description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Nov. 2 (UPI)A fourmonth old boy was attacked and killed by rats in his home near this Washington suburb, the police said today. The infant Joseph Alexander, was taken to a police station early yesterday suffering from numerous bites. He died soon afterward from loss of blood.

title: MARTIN ARUNDEL
description: Martin Arundel, labor reporter for the North American Newspaper Alliance for 25 years, died on Oct. 26 in the Veterans Administration Hospital, First Avenue at 23d Street. He was 63 years old.

title: Alabama, L.S.U. on TV
description: The AlabamaLouisiana State college football game Nov. 11 at Birmingham will be televised nationally starting at 4 P.M., The American Broadcasting Company announced yesterday.

title: Con Ed Chided on System For Billing and Servicing
description: If the Consolidated Edison Company showed a little more imagination in its electricity billing and servicing methods, a member of the New York Public Service Commission said yesterday, it might cut its volume of customer complaints and handle them more swiftly as well.

title: Cheers, Mr. President
description: LONDONWhether he likes it or not (and in many ways he probably doesn't much), the President of the United States is also the President of the United Kingdom. I don't just mean that the British look to the Americans for protection against the westward march , or gradual encroachment of Communism, though they certainly do; more of this later.

title: Borowiak, in 2d Upset, Beats Richey and Reaches Quarterfinals
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Nov. (AP)Jeff Borowiak, who up set secondseeded Arthur Ashe in the first round of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis tournament, upset Cliff Richey today to reach the quarterfinals.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS;Which Natives Return?
description: PARISA curious footnote to the winddown of the Indochina war is revival of hopes among political leaders exiled from that area of finding new opportunities to play roles in its development.

title: Personalities: jets Get Charge Out of Riggins
description: John Higgins of the Jets, who sat out most of last Sunday's victory over the New England Patriots with a toe injury, ran well yesterday at Rikers Island as the Jets prepared for Sunday's game against the Washington Redskins at Shea Stadium. The Jets, who put in some new offensive formations, are expected to activate Hank Bjorklund, a rookie running back from Princeton, to replace Steve Harkey, a reserve running back who pulled a tendon in his right foot against the Patriots. Harkey will not play against the Redskins and may miss the contest against Buffalo the following week.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Oct. 18 editorial entitled The Albany_Three urging the election of two young Democrats from the East Side misses a key point which voters should bear in mind on Nov. 7.

title: Housing Lawyer Is Discharged by City
description: An $18,840ayear lawyer for the city's Human Resources Administration was dismissed yesterday for refusing to tell the Department of Investigation about $100,000 it said he had deposited in seven bank accounts over ah 18month period.

title: No Symbols in His Films, Bunuel Says
description: At an age when most film directors are settled in retirement and are living off memories and retrospectives, Luis Bunuel has become increasingly productive as if the very fact of his longevity had invigorated and inspired him.

title: New School Establishes Center For the Study of TV Politics
description: The New School for Social Research announced yesterday the establishment of a Center for the Study of Television and Politics, which will collect and make available to scholars the televised political advertisements of candidates for major offices.

title: Republic in Agreement To Extend Debt Payment
description: The Republic Corporation, diversified company based in Beverly Hills, Calif., yesterday announced that it had completed an eightyear credit agreement with all of its bank lenders to extend the period of payment of the company's $60million term debt.

title: Rail TonMileage Rose 23.2% From the 71 Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Association of American Railroads estimated that freight traffic on United States railroads last week was 16.7 billion tonmiles, 23.2 per cent above the corresponding 1971 week when traffic was affected by dock and coal strikes.

title: Saigon Gets C130's By CRAIG R. WHITNEY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 2  The United States has so speeded up the delivery of arms, helicopters and planes to South Vietnam in advance of a possible ceasefire that today the South Vietnamese Air Force got planes it was not prepared forfourengine C1 130 transports.

title: Kings Beat Bruins, 52
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 2 (AP)  Los Angeles took advantage of a 5minute fighting (penalty to Boston's Wayne Cashman tonight to score four thirdperiod goals in less than four minutes as the Kings defeated the Bruins, 52.

title: Namath Sees Touchstone In Sunday's Touchdowns
description: The Giants are favorites and the Jets are not in Sunday's games here as they both play at home, for the third straight week, against interconference opponents, Denver and Washington, respectively. Television will show Chicago at Detroit (Channel 2, 1 P.M.), followed

title: Saigon Deaths at 504; 3 Americans Killed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 2 (Reuters)South Vietnamese combat deaths dropped last week, although a 15 per cent increase was reported in fighting.

title: Dave Anderson
description: A. J. Foyt has driven, and won, at Indianapolis, Daytona Sebring and Le Mans, but yesterday he drove in midtown New York much more harrowing in its own way than any autoracing track. And almost as noisy.

title: Associated Transport Requests I. C. C. to Block Eastern Merger
description: Associated Transport, Inc., announced yesterday it had asked the Interstate Commerce Commission to reject and refuse to act upon the recent application of Eastern Freight Ways, Inc., for authority to merge Eastern under the control of D. E. Shevell and M. P. Shevell, Eastern's principal stockholders. Associated said it, had acted after its board of directors concluded that the proposed merger with Eastern, a smaller trucking concern, was not in the best interest of Associated shareholders.

title: MORRIS J. KASPER, CHESS PATRON, 72
description: Morris J. Kasper, treasurer and a founder of the American Chess Foundation and retired president of the Central Knitwear Company, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 530 Park Avenue.

title: Mt. Garbage Scaled To Focus on a Need
description: Slogging and slipping over precarious footholds ranging from potato peels and coffee grounds. to computer punchcards and bits of broken bicycles, state and city officialsclimbed to the top of a 55foothigh mountain of garbage on Staten Island yesterday to dramatize the city's Most immediateand still unsolvedenvironmental problem.

title: NIXON BARS TRUCE FOR VIETNAM WAR TILL PACT IS RIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2President Nixon asserted tonight that the draft agreement for an Indochina settlement would not be signed until all remaining issues were resolved.

title: Asian Exiles From Uganda Arrive
description: Wearing warm clothing supplied in Rome by a Catholic relief agency, Vargala Kundan, his wife and their two teenage dchildren, weary but smiling, arrived at Kennedy International Airport last night, the first of 1,000 stateless Asians expelled from Uganda to be resettled throughout the United States.

title: Allende Names 3 Military Men To Cabinet in a Move for Order
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 2 (AP)President Salvador Allende Gossens named two generals and an admiral to the Cabinet tonight in an effort to restore order to the country after nearly a month of strikes and demonstrations against the Government.

title: F.P.C. TO RESTUDY BLUE RIDGE PLANT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Federal Power Commission announced today that it would reopen the sevenyearold question of permitting the Appalachian Power Company to build the $350million Blue Ridge hydroelectric plant on the New River separating North Carolina and Virginia.

title: President's Aides Identify 283 Donors of 5.8Million
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2President Nixon's campaign finance aides disclosed tonight the names of 283 contributors who gave him more than $5.8million in gifts of up to $1million.

title: F.C.C. IS REDUCING GOVERNMENT ROLE IN BROADCASTING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Federal Communications Commission today took the first in what is promised to be a long series of steps reducing the amount of Government regulation of the broadcasting industry.

title: DOUGLASHOME ENDS 4DAY VISIT TO CHINA
description: PEKING, Nov. 2The British Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, left China today after a fourday visit that demonstrated once again how sharply Chinese foreign policy toward the West has changed in the last IS months.

title: Goodman Ruled Off Ballot As Tenant's Party Candidate
HUSBAND AND WIFE PLAY GUITAR MUSIC
description: Music composed and arranged for two guitars was played at Carnegie Recital Hall Wednesday night by use and Nicholas Alfonso, a husbandandwife team from Belgium now touring America for the first time.

title: Others Claim Responsibility
description: SARAGOSSA, Spain, Nov. 2 (AgenceFrance Presse)  Two different groups today claimed responsibility for a bomb blast that seriously injured the French Consul here.

title: SPIEGEL IS SEVERED IN BREWSTER TRIAL
French Consulate Bombed In Spain
description: MADRID, Nov. 2  Basque separatists were blamed for the bombing of the French Consulate at Saragossa in northeast Spain today, in which the consul and two other persons were injured.

title: Protest Fades at Junior High 211, but Boycott Goes On
description: For the first time this week, black and Puerto Rican children from Brownsville's Tilden Houses entered John Wilson Junior High School 211 yesterday without a demonstration by angry white parents.

title: British Unions Rebuff Heath on His AntiInflation Plan
description: LONDON, Nov. 2  Prime Minister Heath's efforts to win approval for a voluntary antiinflation program collapsed tonight, foreshadowing a. major confrontation with the nation's labor unions.

title: Program to Aid Veterans
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 2 (AP)  A $200,000 program to help get training to blinded veterans was announced today by Veterans Administrator Donald Johnson.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a former press secretary to President Truman, aide to Adlai Stevenson in 56, Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs under President Kenriedy and as Ambassador to the United Nations and other international organizations in Geneva for sevenandahalf years under Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, I have long supported Democratic programs.

title: Flyers Down Penguins
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 2 (AP) Bill Clement broke a 22 tie with a secondperiod goal and later assisted on Bobby Clarke's insurance goal as the Philadelphia Flyers beat the Pittsburgh Penguines, 42, tonight in the N.H.L.

title: WOMAN IS SLAIN HELPING HUSBAND
description: A 52yearold woman was apparently shot to death yesterday afternoon when she rushed of the aid of her 82yearold husband as he was being mugged in a hallway in the East Village.

title: Outline for Ulster Peace
description: Britain has taken a significant new step toward shaping the political future of Northern Ireland. Its socalled Green Paper is not a precise blueprint; but, as British Minister William Whitelaw says, it sets out some fundamental conditions which any settlement must meet. Because it does so bluntly, the document has drawn heavy fire from extremists in both Protestant and Catholic camps; but moderate leaders on both sides have greeted it with measured approval and even optimism.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A state Civil Service examination specifying that preference in hiring would be given to minoritygroup applicants was ruled unconstitutional yesterday by the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Albany.

title: Relief Is Sometimes a Swallow Away
description: WASHINGTONOn Oct. 3 in New York Senator McGovern offered to exercise the kind of national leadership which is essential to steer this country away from Its obsession with pills and drugs of all kinds.

title: Big Producer to Cut Vitamin C Price
description: The price of ascorbic acid, better known to consumers as Vitamin C, will be lowered by the world's largest maker of the product.

title: Randolph Boy, 15, Held In $1,128 Bank Robbery
U. S. Giving Saigon New Aircraft in Attempt to Win Over Thieu
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Administration officials disclosed today that the United States had decided to provide the South Vietnamese Air Force with hundreds of additional jet fighters, transports and helicopters above previously programed levels.

title: POLISH DENY DRAFT OF STUDENT PRIESTS
description: WARSAW, Nov. 2The Polish Government tonight rejected a charge by the Roman Catholic Church that student priests were called up for military service in violation of a 1950 agreement providing for their exemption.

title: Bensorthurst, an Area Similar to Canarsie, Takes Busing in Stride
description: Each morning, 91 black and Puerto Rican children from Tilden Houses in the Browsville section of Brooklyn spill out of buses in front of Seth Low Junior High School 96 in the predominantly white, middleclass community of Bensonhurst.

title: WHOLESALE INDEX OF PRICES POINTS TO LESS INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Wholesale prices, a key indicator of inflation, showed virtually no change in October, the Labor Department reported today.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES RISE, THEN FALL
description: Brokers said yesterday was a dull session on the Chicago Board of Trade, despite the fact that most soybean futures contracts set new lifeofcontract highs.

title: NIXON HAS BIG LEAD IN PAPERS SUPPORT
Bar Association Rejects 17 for Courts
description: The Association of the Bar of the City of New York announced yesterday that it had disapproved 17 of the 59 candidates running for the State Supreme Court and the Civil Court.

title: Dr. Josephine B. von Miklos, 72, Photographer and Author, Dies
description: Dr. Josephine Bogdan von Miklos, photographer, designer and author, died yesterday in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. She was 72 years old and lived in Pound Ridge, N.Y.

title: Credibility and a Political Career
description: LONDON  Americans must grow very tired of Europeans who feel entitled to adVise them on their choice of a President. Plainly, we have no business whatever to advise on your problems of pollution, urban poverty, drugs, color or any of the other wonderful and exciting things which make up the substance of American politics.

title: Jersey TransitBond Issue Is Given Slight Edge in Poll
description: TRENTON, Nov. 2Though the $650million transportation bond issue to be voted on Tuesday has been carefully engineered to offer something for almost everyone, politicians and at least one independent poll give the referendum not much better than an even chance of squeaking through.

title: CourtMartial Defense Rests
description: FORT ORD, Calif., Nov 2 (UPI)The defense rested its case today in the courtmartial of a young black soldier accused of killing two lieutenants at an Army base in Vietnam. The prosecution immediately called the first of several rebuttal witnesses to bolster its case against Private Billy Smith, 24yearold, charged with setting a boobytrap that killed two officers at Bien Hoa Army Base on March 15, 1971.

title: The Sinking Pound
description: The British pound is the sick currency of. Europe and of the world monetary system. As part of the Smithsonian Agreement of last December, when the dollar was devalued and the currencies of Europe and Japan were upvalued the pound was pegged at a price of $2.60 an exchange rate many observers thought too high.

title: Disabled Tie Up Traffic Here To Protest Nixon AidBill Vote
description: In wheel chairs and on crutches, activists for the country's disabled citizens twice blocked traffic in Manhattan yesterday to protest President Nixon's veto last week of the Rehabilitation Act of 1972.

title: Record U.S. Exports Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (UPI) Massive grain sales to the Soviet Union wilt help push United States farm exports to a record $10billion in the fiscal year that ends June 30, Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz predicted today.

title: Bridge: Playoff Match to Determine Team From North America
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 2  The composition of the team to represent North America in the 1973 world team championship will be determined this weekend. A playoff match of 160 deals between two sixman squads will begin here tomorrow evening and end on Sunday.

title: Bartender Slain in Dispute
description: COMPTON, Calif., Nov. 2 (AP)Four youths, ordered out of a bar because they were under age, kicked out the tavem's plate glass window. Then one of them hurled a jagged piece of glass at the bartender, Manuel Morad, spearing him in the chest and killing him Instantly, the police say. Two juveniles were arrested after the incident last night and boked for investigation of murder. Two other teenagers were being sought.

title: Case Is Waging Typical Quiet Campaign
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Canarsie school controversy raises an important question which The Times and city government have overlooked: To what extent does community have a voice in decisions affecting it?

title: Stage: Carlin and Rankin at the Palace
description: George Carlin is a funny guy. Likable, too. He certainly had a Palace Theater audience where he wanted it last nighthanging on to his every word.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The Metropolitan Intercollegiate indoor track and field championships, which traditionally have been held entirely or mostly in New York City, were moved yesterday to Princeton University's Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: RAIDERS WIN, 42, FROM SAINTS SIX
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Nov 2 (AP)Peter Donnelly supported a balanced scoring attack with strong goaltending as the New York Raiders beat the Minnesota Fighting Saints, 42, tonight in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Kissinger Negotiates a Washington Social Reception
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2I'm not even here, Henry A. Kissinger said as he eased his way out of the South Vietnamese Embassy reception last night. That was my double.

title: G. M., in Second Request, Seeks $54 Price Rise on 1973 Models
description: DETROIT, Nov. 2  The Gencval Motors Corporation asked the Price Commission today to approve an average increase of $54  1.2 per cent  per car on the 1973 models. The commission turned down the G.M. request once before, but told the auto maker that it could ask again after its JulySeptember pfofits were calculated.

title: G. O. P. Opens a VoterTurnout Drive
description: Despite polls showing President Nixon far ahead, Governor Rockefeller and other topranking Republicans will campaign across this state today to get out the vote.

title: Two Broadway Shows Sign Key Female Roles
description: Two incoming Broadway stage productions have signed major performers for starring female roles.

title: NIXON BARS TRUCE FOR VIETNAM WAR TILL PACT IS RIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2President Nixon asserted tonight that the draft agreement for an Indochina settlement would not be signed until all remaining issues were resolved.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We are all aware of the monumental issues facing us today. As the campaign proceeds, however, I feel there is something at least as important as issues. That is the character of the man who will head this Government for the next four yearspossibly the most crucial years in our history.

title: Police Estimate 20,000 At McGovern's Rally
description: Although estimates varied widely as to the size of the crowd at Senator George McGovern's garment center rally Wednesday, Police De: partment engineering estimates yesterday supported The New York Times estimate of 20,000.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Those who appreciate whimsey should be interested in six objects d'art that will go on display and sale at The Brownstone Gallery at 76 Seventh Avenue, Brooklyn, through Nov. 10.

title: BURGLARY ARRESTS FOLLOW SHOOTOUT
description: The police yesterday arrested three youths in connection with the attempted burglary of a Bronx apartment that resulted in the double mistake shooting Wednesday in which a policeman was shot and critically wounded and another man killed.

title: Smith Gains in Paris
description: PARIS, Nov. 2 (AP)Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., defeated France's Georges Goven, 36, 63, 61, today and joined two countrymen in the quarterfinals of the $50,000 French international open indoor tennis championships.

title: DR. LEWIS MERIAM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Dr. Lewis Meriam, a former vice president of the Brookings Insti tution and onetime Mayor of Kensington, Md., died Monday in Bethesda, Md. He was 89 years old and lived in Kensington.

title: McGovern Presses Effort In 3 Midwestern States
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 2Senator George McGovern, his voice hoarse and cracking, campaigned doggedly through three states today in an effort to close the apparent gap between himself and President Nixon in the final days of the Presidential race.

title: Citizens'
description: Law enforcement officials who carried out the police raid that resulted in the death of two Black Panther party leaders in Chicago nearly three years ago were broadly atJacked yesterday by a special citizens commission.

title: Canada Offers Services
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2External Affairs Minister Mitchell Sharp today offered the services of Canada's 19member delegation now in Vietnam to any international supervisory body set up after a truce is in affect.

title: Private Group Seeks to Protect Political Prisoners in Vietnam
description: PARIS, Nov. 2An effort to protect political prisoners in Vietnam, whose fate under future ceasefire has become matter of increasing concern, was begun today by Amnesty International.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $915million, up 15 per cent from the yearearlier $794million. Total retail store sales Were an estimated $8.855billion, up 7 per cent from the yearago $8.739billion.

title: People and Business
description: As expected, Paul Kolton was elected yesterday as the first fulltime, salaried chairman of the American Stock Exchange. The election, at the first meeting of the reorganized board of governors of the Amex, of the chief executive was unanimous.

title: Hunam Still Ranks At Top of the List
description: ****  Hunam, 845 Second Avenue, MU 77471.

title: DR. WILLY E. BAENSCH, RADIOLOGIST, DEAD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Dr. Willy E. Baensch, chairman of the department of radiology at Georgetown University Medical Center for 20 years, died in Sibley Hospital yesterday of aII cerebral hemorrhage He was 79 years old.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.2 From YearAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 124.9 from 124.7 last week.

title: Saigon Aide Looks Forward to CeaseFire With Hope and Fear
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 2  The Social Welfare Minister, Tran Nguon Phieu, looks forward to a ceasefire by Christmas with hope and fear.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A few days ago in a corridor leading to my office desk I found a small, yellowing maple leaf, and was strangely moved.

title: JUDGE RALPH KOHNEN
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 2Judge Ralph B. Kohnen of the Common Pleas Court died here Tuesday at Christ Hospital.

title: Soviet ABlast Reported
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Nov. 2The Soviet Union today exploded underground a nuclear device in the megaton. class, the Uppsala Seismological Institute reported.

title: Smith Gains in Paris
description: PARIS, Nov. 2 (AP)Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., defeated France's Georges Goven, 36, 63, 61, today and joined two countrymen in the quarterfinals of the $50,000 French international open indoor tennis championships.

title: Loy's 7UnderPar 65 Sets Texas Open Pace by Stroke
U.S. MAY CONTINUE CULEBRA SHOOTING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The White House has quietly raised the possibility that the United States Navy may indefinitely continue to use Culebra, a tiny island off Puerto Rico, as a gunnery range despite a public) commitment by Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird for the end of all such operations there by June, 1975.

title: Concern Over the Legal Rights of a Silent MinorityChildren
description: The question of whether children have rightsand, if they do. the extent of themis becoming of increasing concern to the lawyers, doctors, public officials, administrators and educators who tangle constantly with a morass of legal inconsistencies, loopholes and uncharted areas.

title: TV: Homosexuality Is Subject of Two Programs
description: Wednesday evening, the American Broadcasting Company presented its widely publicized production of That Certain Summer, the story of a father forced to explain his homosexuality to his 14yearson.

title: Nurses Strike Hospital
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 2 (AP)Nurses at Cook County Hospital went on strike today. The nurses, members of the Illinois Nurses Association, rejected a contract offer from county officials this morning and immediately went on strike.

title: U.N. Environmental plans Near Assembly Approval
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 2The technical machinery for carrying out the broad recommendations of the United Nations environmental conference, held in Stockholm last June. was approved today by the General Assembly's Economic and Financial Committee. Formal endorsement by the General Assembly is virtually assured next month.

title: BOARD DENOUNCES SCRIBNER LETTER
description: A draft of a letter written by Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, the city's School Chancellor, has been criticized by members of the Board of Education, who said it would hurt efforts to resolve the Carnarsie school controversy.

title: Canadian Socialist With Bargaining Power
description: MONTREAL, Nov, 2Forty years ago in Montreal, a young McGill University graduate named David Lewis was applying for a Rhodes scholarship. The application procedure included an interview with Sir Edward Beatty, who was the president of Canadian Pacific railways.

title: LANDLORD TELLS P.G.A. TO VACATE ITS HEADQUARTERS
description: John D. MacArthur, the wealthy Florida real estate developer, told the Professional Golfers Association yesterday to leave its headquarters at Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., which he owns, or face eviction.

title: Agnew Says Thieu's Opposition May Just Be Political Rhetoric
KAISER COMPANIES CONSENT TO ORDER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 2 (AP) The Kaiser Steel Corporation and a Canadian subsidiary today consented to a Federal Court order barring further offers or sales of stock in the Canadian company unr less such shares are registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: TRUDEAU TO STAY AND PUT DECISION UP TO PARLIAMENT
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau announced tonight that despite setbacks in Monday's election his Government would carry on and face the next Parliament as a minority.

title: It's Unanimous: Canton Voted Cy Young Award
BIG BOARD'S VOTE FOR INSTITUTIONS
description: The New York Stock Exchange seized the initiative yesterday on the issue of institutional membership, or who should be able to buy seats on the exchange.

title: Underwater Photos Show Loch Monster
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2 (AP)The much photographed and yet unexplained Loch Ness monster has had its picture taken again and its identity still remains a mystery.

title: COALITION ON RACE TO BE SET UP HERE
description: A citywide coalition of ethnic And neighborhood groups will be set up before Christmas in an effort to reduce racial polarization and avert such confrontations as the Canarsie school dispute.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Eight of the 50 athletes selected by the Associated Press sports staff for its new book, The Sports Immortals, were honored at a luncheon yesterday at Jimmy's Restaurant, 33 West 52d Street.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Nov. 2Everybody had expected that Vinnie Carlesimo, the St. Peter's football coach, would be the first one to arrive at the New Jersey college football writers luncheon today, but they were wrong.

title: LaborStudent Political Coalition Thrives in. Hudson
WHOLESALE INDEX OF PRICES POINTS TO LESS INFLATION October Steadiness Reflects Smallest Rate of Climb Since End of Freeze
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Wholesale prices, a key indicator of inflation, showed virtually no change in October, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Bond Prices Rise In Heavy Trading; City's Issues Gain
description: Bond prices raced ahead for the second straight session yesterday as Wall Street professionals, seeking inventory, were joined by some institutional investors who have decided that now is the time to commit their hoards of cash.

title: McGovern Disappointed
description: JACKSON, Mich., Nov. 2 Senator McGovern expressed disappointment here tonight at Mr. Nixon's speech, and said, It does not appear to me that peace is near.

title: Concerts: A Milestone for Bach Group.
description: It isn't often that an ensemble as specialized as the Bach Aria Group survives as long as it has. On Wednesday night in Tully Hall, it began its 25th season, under the direction of its founder, William H. Scheide. It is an extraordinary record for an outfit that has limited itself to the performance of Bach cantatas and excerpts thereof. Of course, the cantatas represent a miraculous well that never seems to run dry, and within the musical form, the composer managed to evoke almost every conceivable emotion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: So at long lastfour years and hundreds of thousands of deaths laterPresident Nixon's secret plan to end the war is revealed. If we look beneath the predictable rhetoric and facesaving machinations.of both parties, the terms seem to be those which any American Government could have negotiated at any time in the past decadeand which presented themselves to Mr. Nixon with particular clarity in 1968.

title: Anniversary of Diem's Death Marked
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 2  As both hope and fear about an end to the war were stirring new political currents in Saigon, thousands of Vietnamese Catholics gathered to mourn today in Mac Dinh Chi Cemetery on the ninth anniversary of the death of Presi, dent Ngo Dinh Diem.

title: Maverick Democrat and TaxRaising Republican Battle in Illinois
ALFRED PARENT JR.
description: SANFORD, Me., Nov. 2Alfred (Freddy) Parent Jr., the lone survivor of the first World Series in 1903, in which the Boston Red Sox defeated the Pittsburgh Pirates, died in nursing home here today. He would have been 97 years old Nov. 25.

title: Candidates'Personalities Are Issue In AbzugRyan Race in 20th District
description: Flashing angry glances but avoiding eyetoeye contact, their voices often quivering, the two main candidates in the 20th Congressional District described each other as unqualified for the job each seeks.

title: ROBERT ADAMS DIES; PATENT LAWYER, 72
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 2  Robert Morton Adams, former president of the New York Patent Law Association and brother of Francis W. H. Adams, former New York City Police Commissioner, died at his home here early today after a long illness, He was 72 years old.

title: Agnew's Press Secretary a Touchy Zealot
500 Indians Seize U.S. Building After Scuffle With Capital Police
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2About 500 American Indians protesting injustices, took control tonight of the Bureau of Indian Affairs building after scuffles with the police outside and inside the building.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The lesson that the school situation in Canarsie seems to show is that integration cannot work. What is crucially important and quickly passed over is how well the John Wilson Junior High School 211 had integrated to the satisfaction of both whites and blacks in that community.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In endorsing Margaret Chase Smith because independent Republicans are needed in Congress, The Times confuses independence with personal capriciousness. Your acknowledgment that Mrs. Smith's unusually attractive opponent, Representative William Hathaway... would also make an excellent Senator, places the endorsement in the category of protecting quaintness. Since her 1950 declaration of conscience indictment of Senator Joseph McCarthy, Mrs. Smith has done next to nothing for Maine or for the nation.

title: 2D TRIAL FREES MAN IN ICE FLOE SLAYING
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Nov. 2 (AP)Mario Jaime Escamilla of Santa Barbara, Calif?& was acquitted today in his second trial on a charge of involuntary manslaughter in the 1970 death of a fellow weather researcher on an Artic ice floe.

title: Protest Fades at Junior High 211, but Boycott Goes On
description: For the first time this week, black and Puerto Rican children from Brownsville's Tilden Houses entered John Wilson Junior High School 211 yesterday without a demonstration by angry white parents.

title: Business Briefs
description: PARIS, Nov. 2 (UPI)A judge hearing the case involving Kennecott Copper and a nationalized Chilean company, summoned the parties to his chambers today ask for additional information. He said he would make ruling on Nov. 13.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The value of United States corporate and other direct investment abroad rose strongly again last year to a book value at year end of $86billion, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Notes on People
description: On his 100th birthday yesterday, John Netherland Heiskell, who has been editor of The Arkansas Gazette since 1902, spent most of the day sitting by his home telephone in Little Rock receiving the congratulations of friends, other editors and politicians from all over the country.

title: Dartmouth, Harvard Setbacks Could Put Yale, Cornell on Top
description: By the time eventide casts its shadows, over the Ivy League gridirons tomorrow night, the league championship race may present just as darkening a scene.

title: Viren, Olympic Hero, Is Coy on Pro Track
description: With a coy smile that suggested he knew something you didn't, Lasse Viren dodged any direct response yesterday on whether he would join a proposed professional track and field tour next year.

title: 36 Officers Dismissed by Franklin Bank
description: The Franklin National Bank, which has suffered a sharp decline in earnings this year, confirmed yesterday that it had dismissed 36 officers as part of an effort at streamlining its operations.

title: Permit for New Power Line In Rockland County Urged
The Dance: Arpino's Sacred Grove
description: Ritual is as ritual does, and in Sacred Grove on Mount Tamalpais, it does a little uncertainly. Gerald Arpino's new ballet, Sacred Grove on Mount Tamalpais which itself is not the most ,engaging of titlesis, according to a program note, about the fact that: From antiquity men and women have gone yearly to sacred groves to celebrate the earth's renewal. The note further vouchsafes the information that Mount Tama1pais is in Marin County, California, overlooking San Francisco Bay and the Pacific.

title: Knicks'
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 2The Boston Celtics are leading all teams with their 90 wonlost record, but no one can deny, that the Knicks have been impressive in their own way. They arrived here for a game with the SuperSonics tomorrow night with seven straight victories and a functioning defense that had held those seven opponents under 100 points.

title: Graebner Wins in Wales
description: PORT TALBOT, Wales, Nov. 2 (AP)Clark Graebner, who missed the first five tournaments op the Dewar circuit and was eliminated in the opening match of another, moved into the semifinals of the indoor event today with a 63, 6.4 umph over John Lloyd di Britain.

title: Graebner Wins In Wales
description: PORT TALBOT, Wales, Nov. 2 (AP)Clark Graebner, who missed the first five tournaments on the Dewar circuit and was eliminated in the opening match of another, moved into the semifinals of the indoor event today with a 63, 6.4 triumph over John Lloyd of Britain.

title: LOUIS X. GARFUNKEL
description: Louis X. Garfunkel, a former New York restaurateur and writer, died Wednesday in Hollywood, Fla. His age was 75.

title: $75Million, 2,000Room Hotel Is Being Planned for Times Sq.
description: Plans are under way for a $75million, 2,000room luxury hotel to rise on Times Square in twin, linked towers of more than 50 stories, city officials confirmed last night.

title: Rise in Inventories Slows; Installment Credit Surges
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Manufacturers inventories rose by the unusually small amount of $145million in September, while new orders continued to expand, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: EXSTATE SENATOR CONVICTED IN TEXAS
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 2 (UPI) Former State Senator David Ratliff was convicted yesterday of embezzling state funds while in office and was given a 10year probated sentence.

title: AQUEDUCT EXACTA RETURNS $886.40
description: Sandino Hernandez was glad he had only one mount on yesterday's Aqueduct race card.

title: British Reserves Decline
description: LONDON, Nov. 2Britain's, official reserves fell by $230million in October, with all of it thought to have been paid out in one day to support the value of the pound in the foreignexchange markets.

title: Rhode Island College Pact
description: PROVIDENCE, Nov. 2 (AP)Rhode Island College faculty members have voted overwhelmingly to ratify a twoyear contract negotiated by the school's chapter of the American Federation of Teachers and the Board of Regents. The pact provides an average salary increase of 8 per cent for the current academic year and 10 per cent for the 197374 academic year.

title: Lincoln Mask
description: Five hundred free tickets will be distributed to Harlem and BedfordStuyvesant teenagers for the last three performances of The Lincoln Mask, the V: J. Longhi play, which closes tomorrow night at the Plymouth. The city's Neighborhood Youth Corps with the assistance of the United States Department of Labor will arrange for the transportation of the youngsters to tonight's performance and to tomorrow's matinee and evening showing.

title: The Johnsons Vote; Friend Says They Backed Democrats
Borowiak, in 2d Upset, Beats Richey to Advance in Tennis
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Nov. 2 (AP)Jeff Borowiak, who upset secondseeded Arthur Ashe, in the first round of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis tournament, upset Cliff Richey today to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Advertising: Borden's Mixture
description: Despite Elsie's strong image, Borden, Inc., especially since the midnineteensixties, has moved far afield from dairy products. One directory shows that it makes foods in some 37 product categories, chemicals in 20 and consumer products in 14.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 2 (AP)The Hickok Award to the professional athlete of the year for the first time in years will be awarded at a new site.

title: President's Aides Identify 283 Donors of 5.8Million
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2President Nixon's campaign finance aides disclosed tonight the names of 283 contributors who gave him more than $5.8million in gifts of up to $1million.

title: Books of The Times
description: The word had gotten around that in his memoirs, 5000 Nights at the Opera, the recently retired general manager of the Metropolitan Opera House was going to reveal everything, to take off the wraps, to even the score, to tell what really happened in his confrontations, meetings and battles with the Metropolitan Board, the unions, the critics, and artists such as Callas, Teb a I di and von Karajan. But the book is nothing like that. It is, on the con trary, a serious and, to my mind, valuable defense of his administration at. the Met and an always absorbing account of how a great house is run. It offers a view of the Metropolitan Opera that opera buffs simply will not easily find elsewhere. This does not mean that the author's versions of events will be the ultimate ones or that there is nothing to he said on the other side, sometimes on many other sides. What the book does do is establish the dimensions of theproblems involved in running the houseand in maintaining the machinery thatkeeps it going. I can't imagine any amateur who enjoys opera at all who will comeaway from reading it without enlightenment.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay announced that a pilot program that takes addicts out of city prisons before their trials and places them in treatment programs would be expanded from Brooklyn into Manhattan. The program, operated by the city Addiction Services Agency, has placed 550 addicts charged with misdemeanors and nonviolent felonies in various programs. Of these addicts, 73 per cent have remained in the prograins, a retention rate officials consider highly impressive.

title: BANK RATE RAISED IN PARIS AND BONN
description: PARIS, Nov. 2France and West Germany raised their bank rates today in moves to curb inflation.

title: Equity Financing
description: THE INTERNATIONAL CHEMICAL & NUCLEAR CORPORATION yesterday said it planned to purchase, primarily through private negotiations, number of its common shares not to exceed 500,000. The repurchase program, which it expects to complete by the end of the year, would be applied to outstanding convertible debt and employe stock options. The company's stock closed at 23, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Books of The Times
description: From the very first page of The Cameronswhen Maggie Drum awakes in the dark, cold, still world from which she is so determined to escapeyou can see that Robert Crichton, the author of The Secret of Santa Vittoria, knows exactly what he is doing. Sure, it's been done a thousand times beforethe story of the poor girl trying to rise in the world by dint of hard work and a shrewd marriage. Sure, it all sounds familiarfrom the hoard of money buried beneath the cottage floor to the climactic confrontation between the downtrodden coal miners and their cruel masters. Sure, How Green Was My Valley comes to mind, Emile Zola's Germinal, and even Ernest Hemingway's The Old Man and the Sea (when Maggie's husband, Gillon Cameron, steals off to posted waters to catch a 50pound salmon for his starving family's Christmas dinner, only to lose most of the fish on the dangerous journey homeward). Sure, Mr. Crichton pulls out all the conventional stopsthere is the uneducated hero painfully learning to read Shakespeare, there is the long Dickensian deathbed scene and there is the trial in which the oppressed miners finally get their day in court.

title: Stanfield Sharply Critical
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2 (AP)Robert L. Stanfield, the Opposition Conservative leader, sharply criticized the Prime Minister's decision tonight.

title: NIXON'S AIDES GET DATA ON M'GOVERN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2White House aides involved in President Nixon's campaign have received reports of the Secret Service, whose agents are assigned to protect Senator George McGovern, about confidential meetings of the Democratic Presidential nominee, according to a source in the Secret Service.

title: Manila Dooms Some Papers and Stations
description: MANILA, Nov. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)The Philippine Government today permanently closed down a number of Manila newspapers and radioTV networks, but lifted the 41dayold censorship of foreign news dispatches.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP)The Securities and Exchange Commission filed suit today against a company that puts out a weekly stock market publication, seeking an injunction to prevent violation of registration provisions of a 1940 investment advisors law.

title: Civic Groups Are Investigating Canarsie Blockbusting Reports
description: Some civic groups in Canarsie, concerned about stability and property values in their neighborhood, are looking into advertising and solicitations by realestate brokers to see if there has been an increase in activity since the crisis at J.H.S. 211.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The spring fashion showings have finally come up with a good solid smash hit. it isn't derivative of anything, except maybe Marlene Dietrich a long time ago.

title: Philippines President Held Friendly to U.S. Business
description: MANILA, Oct. 23  The American business community in the Philippines has greeted with relief the results of the Sept. 23 declaration of martial. law by President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: New Magazine Due For Supermarkets?
description: Triangle Publications confirmed yesterday that it would bring out a new women's magazine next year. But it would say no more.

title: Most Signs in OnceDemocratic Sheepshead Bay Show McGovern in Trouble
Texas Rangers Name Herzog Manager
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., Nov. 2 (UPI)  Whitey Herzog, saying he would junk some of the bythebook rules of his predecessor, Ted Williams, quit a highpaying job as farm director for the New York Mets today to become manager of the Texas Rangers, the only team in major league baseball to lose 100 games last season.

title: CHURCH COUNCIL CITES THREE HERE
description: The Council of Churches of the City of New York presented its Family of Man gold medallion last night to Raymond P. Shafer, former Governor of Pennsylvania and chairman of the National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse. The council's annual awards dinner was held in the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: SAMUEL KESSLER,
description: NEWARK, Nov. 2Samuel J. Kessler, assistant Essex County prosecutor in the 1920's and 1930's and later a leading criminal lawyer, died today in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 320 South Harrison Street, East Orange.

title: Amendments: Yes, No, No
description: Amendment No. 1 on next Tuesday's ballot is of more interest to potential district attorneys upstate than to the average New York voter, but it is important all the same. This amendment would give the Legislature power to change the term of these officials from a mandatory three yearsoutside New York Cityto three years, four years or a local choice of either. The flexibility, which could allow the influence of both Federal and gubernatorial elections to be taken into account, would be a gain. We urge an affirmative vote, with the hope that if the amendment is passed the Legislature will act to make the choice of three or four years a matter local option.

title: A Cauliflower Soup For Weekend Chef
description: In the menus below the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe. Cream of cauliflower soup*

title: Bankers Trust Suspends Its Floating Prime Rate
description: The Bankers Trust Company, apparently in response to pressure from Washington, yesterday temporarily suspended its floating prime rate system, which has geared the minimum commercial loan rate of the big New York Cif}, bank directly to interest rates in the open market.

title: Klein Predicts Nixon Will Carry 45 States
SURINAM DELAYING HER INDEPENDENCE
description: PARAMARIBO, Surinam, Oct. 28In an age and an area of the world where the very men tion of colonialism can make tempers flare, the government of Surinam is planning to re sistat least for nowefforts that would separate it corn pletely from the Netherlands.

title: C.B.S. Gets a Writ In Effort to Keep Ubell From WNBC
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System obtained an order yesterday directing the National Broadcasting Company and Earl Ubell to show cause why Mr. Ubell should not be prevented from working for N.B.C. until next August.

title: Student Holiday Barred
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 21 (AP)A student proposal tot give University of Massachusetts students, a political holiday on Election Day was vetoed by the Chancellor, Randolph W. Broomery. He said the faculty generally felt classes should not be canceled. However, faculty members have been urged to allow those students with legitimate election reasons to be absent from class on Election Day with full opportunity to make up examinations and work.

title: U.S. Court Upholds Guideline to States On Air Cleanliness
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  A Federal Court of Appeals upheld today a lower court ruling that the Environmental Protection Agency must not allow any significant deterioration of air quality in areas where the air is now cleaner than required by Federal standards.

title: Queens Soldier Killed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) The Defense Department announced today that First Lieut. Carlos A. Pedrosa of the Army, whose home was in Elmhurst. Queens, was killed in action in Vietnam.

title: FLAMES BEATEN BY GANADIENS, 61
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 2 (AP)The Montreal Canadiens scored three secondperiod goals within five minutes and beat the Atlanta Flames, 61, tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: ADDICT REFERRAL EXPANDED BY CITY
description: A novel pilot program that has been referring heroin addicts out of the criminaljustice system and into treatment is being expanded from Brooklyn to Manhattan. and possibly to Ithe rest of the city, Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday.

title: Cast of Reflections Adds Life to Piece In Joffrey Program
description: Reflections is a plotless, ballet than can be made vialble through performance qualities. The cast led by Nancy Robinson did much to bring it to life at Wednesday evening's performance by the City Center Joffrey Ballet.

title: POUND TO BE BURIED ON VENETIAN ISLAND
description: ROME, Nov. 2Ezra Pound, the American expatriate poet, will be buried tomorrow on the island of San Michele in the Venetian Lagoon.

title: Top Serbian Politician Resigns From the Yugoslav Government
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 2 (Agence FrancePresse) Koca Popovic, the most prominent Serbian politician, resigned today from the federal Presidency in what appeared to be a personal protest, reliable sources here said.

title: Dance: Brilliant Images
description: The Lar Lubov itch Dance Company performs with unusual dedication. Much of this impression comes from the striving and driving communal tone of Mr. Lubovitch's group pieces. Yet even in the lowerkeyed works in his repertory, his dancers never show the civilservice mentality sometimes spotted in larger companies. These are not dancers who take their money (assuming there is any) and just go home.

title: Mills to Seek Investigation Into Tactics of Republicans
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Nov. 2 (AP)Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, said yesterday that he would seek a Congressional investigation of Republican campaign tactics that he said added up to the dirtiest kind of politics in his experience.

title: Second Korean Talks Held In North on Mutual Issues
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 2 Highlevel officials of North and South Korea met in the North Korean capital of Pyongyang today for the second Ito governmental talks to discuss Korean unification problems.

title: Steelworkers Get Raise
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 2 (UPI)The United Steelworkers announced today that 500,000 of its members had been granted wage increases of 2 cents an hour under the costofliving provisions of the wage contract negotiated with the basic steel industry last year. An earlier adjustment of 1 cent an hour was made in August.

title: PRICES ON AMEX POST SLIGHT GAIN
description: A rally in the last hour of trading permitted the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market to post slight gains yesterday in heavier trading.

title: Five Sought in Bridgeport In Fatal Stabbing of Youth
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov 2 (UPI)  The police here searched today for five youths involved in the Idling late yesterday of a 17yearold Milford youth in the city's Bull Head section.

title: WARRIORS CONQUER BLAZERS, 118 TO 104
description: OAKLAND. Nov. 2 (UPI)Cazzie Russell and Jeff Mullins sparked a thirdquarter rally that carried the Golden State Warriors to a victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight, 118104. The victory lifted the Warriors wonlost record to 7.2 and gave them a halfgame lead in the National Basketball Association's Pacific Division. Last place Portland dropped to 19.

title: Equity Financing
description: The NCNB Corporation, a bank holding company that owns the North Carolina National Bank, registered 1 million shares of common stock yesterday with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Salomon Brothers will manage the sale, expected later this month.

title: Joint Space Training Set for Summer
description: Soviet and American astronauts are scheduled to begin training together next summer for their planned joint space mission in 1975, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration announced yesterday.

title: CHARLES B. KEENAN
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 3 Charles B. Keenan, who had been in the New York City school system as a teacher and executive for more than 40 years, died yesterday at his home, 87 Anderson Avenue. He was 70 years old.

title: B52's Seek Out the Enemy's Stockpiles
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Nov. 4 (AP)Communist war stockpiles were reportedly bombed in South Vietnam, North Vietnam and Laos yesterday by a total of more than 100 United States B.52's.

title: Art: Ingenuity of Louise Nevelson
description: The debate as to whether Louise Nevelson is really a person or, as so much of the evidence seems to indicate, a force of nature, is not re solved by her current exhibition at the Pace Gallery, 32 East 57th Street.

title: REV. JOSEPH CONROY
description: The Rev. Joseph Conroy, a Roman Catholic chaplain at the Veterans Administration Hospital in Manhattan for the last five years, died Thursday in Union Hospital, the Bronx. He was 62 years old.

title: Spain Arrests 5 Students In French Consulate Attack
description: MADRID, Nov. 3An extreme leftwing group of university students, members of the Hammer and Sickle Cooperative, was responsible for the firebombing on the French Consulate in Saragossa yesterday, the Civil Governor of the province said today.

title: Woman in the News
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 3The turn of the calendar has made Mrs. Jeanne Martin Cisse of Guinea the first woman President of the Security Council in the 27year history of the United Nations.

title: AGENCY CRITICIZES SOVIET GRAIN DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI) The United States may have sold wheat to the Soviet Union too cheaply this summer the General Accounting Office said today.

title: C.B.S. IS STRUCK BY ELECTRICIANS
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System was struck by its cameramen, technicians and electrical engineers yesterday, and although the network maintained that it would continue operations using supervisory personnel, its coverage of Election Day, said to represent an investment of $3million, could be affected.

title: Jobless Rate Dips To 7.2 From 7.5% As Indicators Gain
THOUSANDS FREED IN EAST GERMANY
description: BERLIN, Nov. 3East German sources said today that a total of 30,000 prisoners, the largest number ever released in the 23year history of East Germany, would benefit from the amnesty declared on Oct. 6 by the Communist Government.

title: Swallowing
description: The American people have swallowed a lot in the last four years. A lot of swallowing has been done. We have, swallowed electric bugs, laundered money, quite a handsome amount of grain moving about in mysterious ways, a war more shameful than can be imagined, much else. There are even some people who believe that the President does not invariably tell us the truth about ourselveshe tells us something, we swallow that.

title: Business Briefs
description: GENEVA, Nov. 3  The head of the international agency that is seeking to widen the channels of world commerce urged its 80 member nations today to begin the final preparatory phase for the next big round of tradeliberalization negotiations.

title: GORMAN UPSETS NASTASE IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Nov. 3 (AP)Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., and Tom Gorman of Seattle gained the semifinals of the $50,000 French open indoor tennis championships tonight.

title: Vessel in Lakes Pollution Suit To Be Linked to Sewage Plant
description: CHEBOYGAN, Mich, Nov. 3 Construction has begun on a 2,030foot pipeline to connect the Coast Guard cutter Mackinaw, the principal icebreaker on the Great Lakes, with this city's sewage disposal plant.

title: Stock Trade Involved
description: Cincinnati Financial Corporation and the InterOcean Corporation announced yesterday that they planned a merger that would involve an exchange of stock valued at more than $50million.

title: JUSTIN HAYNES, 70, INVESTMENT AIDE
description: Justin O'Brien Haynes, retired investment banker and former vice president of Abacus Fund, Inc., died yesterday of heart attack at Mount Sinai Hospital. His age was 70 and he lived at River House, 435 East 52d Street.

title: Red Cross Plans for Truce
description: GENEVA, Nov. 3Twenty experts in Red Cross relief work met here today to discuss plans for an increase in International Red Cross aid in Indochina in the event of ceasefire there.

title: Notes on People
description: The Atomic Energy Commission's $25,000 Fermi Award for 1972 is going to Dr. Manson Benedict of the Massachussetts Institute of Technology. The commission, noting that the award decision had been approved by President Nixon, said that Dr. Benedict was selected in recognition of his leadership in the development of the nation's first gaseous diffusion plant that still produces fissionable uranium for weapons and power plant fuel at Oak Ridge, Tenn. The late Enrico Fermi was a pioneer in nuclear science.

title: The Death Penalty and a Free Society
description: STANFORD, Calif.On Nov. 7, California's voters will decide whether to amend their state constitution to restore the death penalty. The proposed amendment, Proposition 17, has implications reaching beyond California and beyond even the question of capital punishment.

title: TAIWAN APPROVES BIG FORD PROJECT
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan. Nov. 3The Government approved today the Ford Motor Company's application to make a sizable investment in Taiwan.

title: MISS AHERN LEADS IN FLORIDA WITH A 69
description: APOPKA, Fla., Nov. 3 (UPI) Kathy Ahern of Denton, Tex., who says she usually has to play catchup golf, shot a threeunderpar 69 today to take the firstround lead in the $30,000 Lady Errol classic on the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour.

title: THOUSANDS FREED IN EAST GERMANY
description: BERLIN, Nov. 3East German sources said today that a total of 30,000 prisoners, the largest number ever released in the 23year history of East Germany, would benefit from the amnesty declared on Oct. 6 by the Communist Govern ment.

title: New Charges Filed by Airman Against Lavelle and 22 Others
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Lonnie D. Franks, the Air Force sergeant who first reported the unauthorized bombing of North Vietnam, filed courtmartial charges today at the Pentagon against Maj. Gen. John D. Lavelle and 22 Air Force officers.

title: Faces From the Impressionists'
description: Portraits are not the genre one usually associates with t he impressionist painters. When one thinks of Monet, say, or Pissarro, one tends to think of those marvelously sunny landscapes fields of flowers, sailboats flashing on a glistening stretch of water a world, almost, of perpetual summer.

title: 25 States Passed Laws in 72 Dealing With Wide Range of Environment Problems
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 3 Legislatures In more than half of the 50 states approved measures in 1972 to deal with environmental problems on a dozen fronts, from pollution to population limitation.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The death of Mrs. Stella Twardowski, who was shot and killed Thursday as she ran to the aid of her 82yearold husband, who was being mugged, was mourned yesterday by the old people who have held on in St. Marks Place through changing life styles and tougher streets.

title: A Treasury Account
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The Treasury said today its special nonmarketable obligations account, made up mostly of United States securities issued to foreigners, declined by $509.9million in October. This brought the total of the other nonmarketables account to $21.9billion as of Oct. 31.

title: NORMAN SCHUELE SR.
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 3Norman A; Schuele Sr., who retired as advertising manager of Revere Copper and Brass, Inc., in 1960, died today at his home, at Garth Woods Apartments. He was 73 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SION, Switzerland, Nov. 3 (UPI)There is little chance that Sion will be able to stage the 1976 Winter Olympics if the voters of Colorado turn down the Olympic proposition next Tuesday, a municipal spokesman said today.

title: PhilcoFord Plant Reopens
description: MANILA, Nov. 3PhilcoFord's Taiwan electronics plant, closed Oct. 28 on order of the Interior Ministry following disclosure of the deaths and illnesses of a number of young women fact pry workers in recent months, was provisionally allowed to resume operations yesterday.

title: RESERVE WITHDRAWS CREDIT AMENDMENTS,
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (Reuters)  The Federal Reserve Board said today it had withdrawn proposed amendments to its regulations governing when credit may be obtained.

title: Nigerians and Chinese Sign Trade and Assistance Pacts
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 3Nigeria and China signed two agreements here today aimed at doubling trade between the two countries and beginning an era of economic and technical cooperation.

title: Indians in Capital Defy a Court Order
description: WASHINGTON, Saturday Nov. 4American Indian militants defied a Federal court order last night and barricaded themselves in the Bureau of Indian Affairs building for the second successive night.

title: PIANO SKILL MARKS RECITAL BY BASQUIN
description: Hunter College's new Faculty. Series got under way Thursday night in the Playhouse with a recital by Peter Basquin. An assistant professor in the school's music department, Mr. Basquin made his New York recital debut at the keyboard in Tully Hall last season.

title: WENDELL DAVIS, 74, A LAWYER, IS DEAD
description: Wendell Davis, a partner in New York and Danbury, Conn., law firms, died yesterday of heart attack in New York Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived in Princeton, N. J.

title: Dynamic Rabbi Is Leading a Renascence of Orthodox Judaism in Elizabeth
A Bellwether County in Wyoming Is Leaning Heavily Toward the President
RAPE SUSPECT, FREE ON BAIL, HELD AGAIN
description: A 17yearold Baruch College freshman who is accused of menacing with a knife a pregnant Queens housewife while he was free on $15,000 bail on three rape charges, had another bail of $60,000 set in Queens Criminal Court yesterday.

title: Bronx Rate Of Poverty Is Highest
description: The Bronx has the smallest slice of prosperity and the largest proportion of poor families among the 19 counties of the tristate metropolitan region and among all 62 counties of New York State.

title: A WOMAN GADFLY IN ASSEMBLY RACE
description: Esther Rand, a grandmotherly looking woman with a wide smile and a Boston accent, knocked on apartment doors in a Lower East Side housing project the other day. She was asking tenants to send her to Albany as asambleista". for the 63d Assembly District.

title: 2 GUNMEN SHOOT GIRL, 12, AT HOME
description: Two middleaged men entered a Lower East Side apartment late yesterday and shot a 12yearold girl in the face while her parents watched in horror, the police said.

title: New Interior Minister of. Chile Vows to End Strikes by Monday
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 3 (UPI)Chile's new Minister of the Interior, Gen. Carlos Prats, told leaders of a crippling 24day strike by truck owners, shopkeepers, professional and middleclass workers today that he was determined to return the country to normal by Monday.

title: Bridgeport Police Are Urged to Hire Minorities
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 3 Lawyers representing black members of the Bridgeport Police Department asserted today that unless preferential treatment was given to minoritygroup members seeking to become policemen, minorities would not be represented on the police force in proportion to their numbers in the city as a whole until the next century.

title: Missionaries Believed Killed
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 3The United States Embassy reported today that two burned bodies found in a town recaptured from the Communists yesterday were believed to be those of American women missionaries.

title: Display of Indian Bones Is Ended After Protest
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Nov. 3 (UPI)Gov. Robert D. Ray has ordered the remains of five Indian graves taken off public display after Indian protestors suggested  that whites dig up the skeletons of Washington or Lincoln if they wanted bones to put in their museums.

title: NIXON TAKES PLEA TO THREE STATES
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Nov. 3President Nixon campaigned today before airport crowds in Chicago, Tulsa and Providence in pursuit of an overwhelming vote for himself and possible victory for several embattled Republican candidates.

title: Dried Opium Poppies Are Sought in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Nov. 3New Jersey narcotics officials are canvassing florists in search of dried opium poppies imported into the United States from Spain for floral display purposes although they are on a list of controlled dangerous drugs.

title: Sobin to Buy Gum Rosin
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3 (AP)Sobin Chemicals, Inc. announced Friday completion of a contract with the People's Republic of China to buy more than $2million worth of gum rosin. The company said it believes the purchases to be the largest of a single product in the history of United States trade relations with mainland China.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Having endorsed Robert Ross Johnson's opponent for the Ninth Senatorial District of New York, it is quite obvious that you never even bothered to meet the man rated preferred above all others by the Citizens Union.

title: A Girl,12 and Man Critically Wounded On Lower E. Side
description: A 12yearold girl and her 60yearold neighbor were critically shot late yesterday in the girl's Lower East Side apartment in what the police said was a dispute between her father and the injured man.

title: Turner Trial Is Delayed
description: CLEARWATER, Fla.. Nov. 3 (UPI)The retrial of Glenn W. Turner on charges of violation of state securities laws was set back today from Nov. 13 to Jan. 15 because of heavy court dockets. Mr. Turner and a codefendant, David Baumann, of St. Petersburg, Fla., are charged with selling unregistered securities and with being unregistered dealers in the sale of Turner's Dare to be Great franchises.

title: Canarsie Board Pledges To Devise Rezoning Plan
description: The community school board of District 18 in Brooklyn promised School.Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner yesterday to comply with his recent order to formulate a plan within 90 days to rezone John Wilson Junior High School 211 in Canarsie and two other district schools.

title: Canarsie Board Pledges To Devise Rezoning Plan
description: The community school board of District 18 in Brooklyn promised School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner yesterday to comply with his recent order to formulate a plan within 90 days to rezone John Wilson Junior High School 211 in Canarsie and two other district schools.

title: Strict Flammability Rules Urged in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3 (AP)A special legislative committee proposed yesterday measures to impose tougher standards on the manufacture of children's clothing to make it less I flammable. After nearly a year's study, the committee recommended six pieces of legislation for the 1973 session.

title: WINE SUBSIDIARY SOLD BY PEPSICO
description: The chief executive of Pepsico, Inc., disclosed yesterday that the company sold a wine subsidiary this week, in an apparent effort to consummate its acquisition of the Rheingold Corporation. The disclosure was made by Donald M. Kendall, chairman of Pepsico, in testimony in United States District Court here.

title: Harry Richman Is Dead at 77; Broadway Singer of the 1930's
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 3 (AP)Harry Richman, the Broadway songanddance man whose offstage adventures matched the excitement of his performances on the stage, in films and in nightclubs, died today. He was 77 years old.

title: Thomas Again Rejoins Chargers in Practice
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 3 (AP)  Duane Thomas. running hack, rejoined the San Diego Chargers in a twohour practice today for Sunday's National Football League game against the Dallas Cowboys.Thomas has been on San Diego's inactive list after failing to join the team since being traded from Dallas July 31.

title: Mrs. Tappan Is. Married to Parry Jones
description: Mrs. Judith Lockton Tappan and Parry von Steinwehr Jones were married here yesterday afternoon in All Souls Unitarian Church by the Rev. Dr. Walter Donald Kring.

title: Graebner Reaches Final
description: PORT TALBOT, Wales, Nov. 3 (AP)Clark Graebner of New York gained the final of the Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament with a 63, 63 triumph over Ian Fletcher of Australia, today.

title: People and Business
description: A month ago, a Russian television crew came to Dearborn, Mich., for an interview with Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company, on the subject of SovietAmerican trade.

title: Dave Anderson
description: I'm in the swimming pool business now, Johnny Weissmuller was saying.

title: Edith Gilliss Bride of Chester Fisher 3d
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Miss Edith Carter Gilliss and Chester Garfield Fisher 3d were married here this evening in the Little Sanctuary of St. Albans School, where the chaplain, the Rev. Craig E. Eder, an Episcopal priest and stepfather of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: Hanoi and Peking Critical Of Nixon's Stand on Truce
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3North Vietnam responded today with a mixture of perplexity and irritation to President Nixon's insistence last night that an Indochina peace settlement could not be signed until all remaining issues were resolved.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 3 (AP)The United States took a 17stroke lead in the second AmericaJapan professional golf match today.

title: GORMAN UPSETS NASTASE IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Nov. 3 (AP)Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., and Tom Goitman of Seattle gained the semifinals of the $50,000 French open indoor tennis championships tonight.

title: A Negative Nixon Drive Urged by Hispanic Aide
New Car Sales Set a Record
description: DETROIT, Nov. 3Sales of new cars in October totaled 1,066,632, the highest for any month.

title: 9.2 Million New Yorkers Registered for Election
India to Release P.O.W.'s
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 3 (AP)The Indian Government announced today that it would release immediately more than 300 Pakistani prisoners, including many women and children, detained since the war last December.

title: Thursday Night Fight
description: Los AngelesJos Luis Martin del Campn, 128 pounds, Los Angeles, outpointed Salvador Medina, 126, Mexico, 10 rounds,

title: Transport Problems Seen
description: The United States grain industry expects major problems in transporting and storing the $1billion in wheat and feed grains bought by the Soviet Union last summer.

title: Harvard and Navy Tie in Heptagonals
description: Bob Childs of the University of Pennsylvania won the individual title but Harvard and Navy surprised the Quakers and wound up cochampions of the 34th annual Heptagonal crosscountry meet yesterday.

title: Brown Gets 40; Pacers Triumph On His Late Shot
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 3 (AP) Roger Brown scored a gamehigh 40 points and tipped in the winning basket with 16 seconds left tonight as the Indiana Pacers beat the Kentucky Colonels, 118116, in the American Basketball Association. The Colonels had two chances to score atfer that but one shot bounced off the rim and a rookie Don Buse stole the ball from Artis Gilmore.

title: Church Protest Continues
description: A group of demonstrators continued yesterday to occupy the offices of the Council of Churches of the City of New York to protest what they described as the organization's inaction on social issues, specifically racism. The sitin began on Tuesday at the Interchurch Center, Riverside Drive and 120th Street

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Oct. 27 editorial describing Roger Hilsman, Democratic candidate for Representative from the Second Congressional District of Connecticut, as a distinguished man is a real puzzler. In all honesty, can this description be applied to a man who as an Assistant Secretary of State under the late President Kennedy played major role in the overthrow of the duly elected President of South Vietnam, Ngo Dinh Diem?

title: Brooklyn's Chelsea Troupe Moving Across River
description: The Chelsea Theater Center, the resident theater company of the Brooklyn Academy of Music, is expanding its operations to include a theater in Manhattan.

title: Lehigh Tuition Up
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Nov. 3 (AP)  Lehigh University announced today it would increase annual tuition for the 197374 term.

title: CELTICS CONQUER BULLETS 10996
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3 (AP)The unbeaten Boston Celtics wasted a 24point lead but rallied in the final minutes behind Dave Cowens to defeat the Baltimore Bullets 10996 tonight for their 10th National Basketball Association victory.

title: Wankel Changeover Weighed
description: DETROIT, Nov. 3 (UPI)Engineers at General Motors are considering acrosstheboard changeover to the Wankel rotary engine in all its production cars, Ward's Wankel report said today.

title: Race Calendar: Dates to Spare
description: New Jersey's decision to open its 1973 horseracing season five weeks earlier than usual has led to speculation that the state's fledgling Sports Authority may conduct a race meeting next year even before it builds a track.

title: Sharp Profit Rises Posted At Travelers Corporation
Older East Village Residents Mourn Mugger's Victim
description: The old people who have held on in St. Mark's Place through changing life styles and tougher streets mourned yesterday for Mrs. Stella Twardowski.

title: Antitrust Official Insists On an End to Fixed Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3  A top official of the Justice Department's antitrust division served notice today that the department would not retreat from its insistence that stock exchanges stop pricefixing in terms of the commissions charged by stockbrokers.

title: State Offtrack Unit Backs OTB Superfecta Special
FUND MISUSE LAID TO POVERTY AIDE
description: Simon T. Levine, executive director of the Crown Heights Community Corporation, was accused by Controller Abraham D. Beanie's office yesterday of having improperly borrowed $3,000 from the corporation's funds.

title: M'GOVERN ASSERTS NIXON PRETENDED TO BE NEAR PEACE
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3Senator George McGovern charged tonight that President Nixon had only pretended to be near a negotiated settlement of the Vietnam war. He said the President's actions were part of reelection strategy based on cruel political deception.

title: Politics as Theater
description: Masquerading as a journalist last August I attended the Democratic Convention. Like most writers I am always looking for America.

title: Museum of American Indian Displays Skull Masks
description: The current exhibition of 61 skull masks by Indian artists of the Americas at the Museum of the American Indian, Broadway at 155th Street, is a powerhouse of a display.

title: Graebner Reaches Final
description: PORT TALBOT Wales Nov 3 (AP)Clark Graebner of New York gained the final of the Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament with a 63, 63 triumph over Ian Fletcher of Australia today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MIAMI, Nov. 3 (UPI)Calder Race Track reported a $31,133.29 payoff on a perfecta (exacta) today. The winning 126 combination in the sixth race was Bold Illusion, who paid $280.80 for $2 to win, and Autumn's End, who paid $25 to place. The win payoff was a track record. The track said there was only one ticket sold. The identity of the winner hasn't been determined.

title: Member Firms in Accord
description: Halle & Stieglitz, Inc., and Filor, Bullard & Smyth, two well known member firms of the New York Stock Exchange, have reached a tentative agreement for the merger of Filor into Halle.

title: RATE OF JOBLESS FIRM IN OCTOBER; EMPLOYMENT UP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 The nation's unemployment rate remained unchanged at 5.5 per cent of the labor force in October despite another strong growth in the number of persons employed, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Cambodia Asks Revival of 54 Truce Unit
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 3Cambodia is asking for a different type of supervisory machinery to oversee the withdrawal of Communist forces from her territory than that called for in the draft agreement for an Indochina settlement.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A voter registration card, in itself, does not constitute eligibility to vote, nor does the lack of a card disqualify anyone from voting.

title: A Black Panther on Trial Here In Attempt to Slay 2 Policemen
description: Richard Moore, a 27yearold member of the Black Panthers, went on trial yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan on charges of attempted murder in connection with the machinegun shooting of two patrolmen in May, 1971.

title: AMEX SHARES UP 4TH DAY IN A ROW
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market yesterday registered their fourth consecutive advance as both lists made good gains in active trading.

title: Appeals Court Bars Absentee Ballots To Jail Prisoners
description: The State Court of Appeals ruled yesterday that 72 inmates of the Monroe County jail in Rochester did not automatically have the right to vote.

title: Danny Ozark's Father Dies
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 3 (AP)Leonard Ozark, whose son Danny was named manager of the Philadelphia Phillies baseball team Wednesday, died today in Emergency Hospital after a brief illness. He was 76 years old and lived in Cheektowaga. Mr. Ozark once owned a window and doorinstallation business and later operated a service station. Also surviving are his widow, Margaret, and another son, Norwood M. Ozark.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BRICK TOWNSHIP, N. J., Nov. 3The mayor is the biggest football booster at Brick Town High. The assistant superintendent of schools will back every idea proposed for football.
