And the football coach will agree with every decision the mayor and the assistant superintendent make. Mainly, of course, because Warren Wolf is the mayor, the assistant superintendent and the football coach.

title: Belle Geste Starts Work For International at Laurel
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 3Mrs Beatrice Latimer's Belle Geste who will represent Canada in the Nov. 11 running of the $150,000 Washington D.C. international got in her first serious workout at Laurel Race Course today. Carl Chapman sent the 4yearold filly seven furlongs in 1 minute 29 seconds.

title: Personalities: Burbrink Chosen
description: Nelson Burbrink, who has been a member of the New York Mets scouting staff since 1965, was named yesterday director of player development, replacing Whitey Herzog, who signed a twoyear contract on Thursday to manage the Texas Rangers Burbrink, 50 years old, joined the Met organization as a scout in the Southern California area in 1965 and one year later recommended that the Mets make a bid for Tom Seaver whose contract with Atlanta had been ruled invalid. Joe McDonald the director of minor league operations for New York will fill Burbank's duties as director of scouting until a permanent replacement is named.

title: Cargo Sling Is Devised to Eliminate Hooks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 Two young brothers who run Marino Systems, Inc., at Bay Shore, L. I., were awarded patent this week for a cargo sling that is being successfully used on docks and in ships and warehouses.

title: COUGARS VICTORS OVER NETS 10597
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Nov. 3 Billy Cunningham scored 41 points to pace the Carolina Cougars to a 10597 victory over the New York Nets tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: RATE OF JOBLESSFIRM IN OCTOBER; EMPLOYMENT UP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The nation's unemployment rate remained unchanged at 5.5 per cent of the labor force in October despite another strong growth in the number of persons employed, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Decline Posted in London On Rate for Treasury Bills
description: LONDON, Nov. 3 (Reuters) The average rate at today's tender of Treasury bills fell to 6.8838 per cent from 6.89301 last week.

title: Leasco and S.E.C. Sign Deal
description: The Leasco Corporation said yesterday that it had signed a twoyear contract with the Securities and Exchange Commission that would result in the development of a new index system for information filed by corporations with the Government agency. The index would be developed at. no cost to the S.E.C., Leasco said.

title: WINE TALK
description: BRISTOL, England, Nov. 3 There is a wall plaque along New York's East River Drive at about 23d Street, commemorating the fact that parts of the roadway were built on fill made from the ruins of bombedout, wartime Bristol, England.

title: Independent Quits House Race To Insure Defeat of War Foe
Books of The Times
description: This new life of Einstein concentrates on that aspect of Einstein that made him renowned: the theoretical physicist. Unlike so many other authors who neglect the scientist for Einstein the quaint character or the involved pacifist or the victim of Nazism, Banesh Hoffmann and his collaborator, Helen Dukas, Einstein's former secretary, write about the originality of his thought, his contribution to our conception of the universe, his place in world science. The larger outlines of his life are not missing and through judicious quotation from letters and detailed incidents, we are given a pretty good idea of what sort of man Einstein was: modest, unassuming, simple in everyday life.

title: Trenton and Washington
description: The conviction of New Jersey's Secretary of State on charges that he conspired to influence the award of a highway contract invites comparison with incidents at the national level involving the Nixon Administration. At the very least, the case of Paul J. Sherwin raises harsh questions about standards of public behavior in Washington as well as in Trenton.

title: Special Grand Jury To Be Called Here On LoanSharking
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office will start presenting evidence this month to a special grand fury on the activities of an alleged nationwide loansharking ring run by organized crime.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your recommendation in the, Sixteenth District (editorial Oct. 30) has me completely baffled. You say: The young woman who defeated Emanuel Celler for the Democratic nomination after his halfcentury of service will face him again in his role as the inactive nominee of the Liberal party. In spite Of our regard for Mr. Celler's contribution as a legislator, we again endorse the very able Miss Holtzman.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have expressed my concern that McGovern's plan for total withdrawal from Vietnam would end those refugee and other humanitarian programs which are administered in South Vietnam by a number of this country's voluntary agencies.

title: MIKE HILL LEADS GOLFERS WITH 135
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 3 (AP)Mike Hill scored a fourunderpar 68 and moved into a onestroke lead today after the second round of the $125,000 Texas open golf tournament.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City Is Sued for Diverting River A group of 27 owners of property adjacent to the Delaware River charged yesterday in a suit for $1million in Manhattan Supreme Court that the impounding and diversion of the river by New York City to its water supply had decreased the value of their property.

title: The Malevolent Genius of Total War
description: BRISTOL, EnglandIn all the furor over alleged callousness by the American military in the Indochinese war theater the possible civilian massacres by lowechelon commanders, or the unauthorized air attacks by highlevel commandsit may be instructive to look at American military history.

title: Newcombe Gains in Sweden
description: GOTEBERG, Sweden, Nov. 3 (UPI)  John Newcombe of Australia, seeded No. 1 easily reached the semifinals of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis tournament tonight by beating a compatriot, Alan Stone, 6.3, 76.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial of Oct. 19 encouraging the strong support of candidates particularly of Constance E. Cook, Assemblywoman from Seneca, Yates and Tompkins Countieson the issue of abortion is as irresponsible as encouraging voters to appeal to President Nixon to continue the war in Vietnam.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 3 (UPI)The Bank of Greece signed today a new $70million, 10year loan agreement with a consortium of 10 international banks headed by the Crocker National Bank of San Francisco.

title: Gold Recovery Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Poland is seeking the recovery of] $4.25million worth of gold held by the Allies since 1945, United, States officials said today.

title: Fort Waikato Wins Pace
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 3 (AP)Fort Waikato, driven by Charles Smith Jr., won the $4,000 Palisade Pace today at Freehold Raceway. Fort Waikato paced the mile in 2:04 35 and returned $3.60, $2.80 and $3 for $2 across the board. Second was Wonder Colt, pay. ing $5 and $4, while the show horse was Irishman Pick, returning $6.40.

title: First Long Hair, Then Earrings For Some Men
description: Earrings on men? What was until recently a custom confined mainly to some blacks, frankly homosexual males or members of motorcycle gangs is starting to show up more widely.

title: M'GOVERN ASSERTS NIXON PRETENDED TO BE NEAR PEACE
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3Senator George McGovern charged tonight that President Nixon had only pretended to be near a negotiated settlement of the Vietnam war. He said the President's actions were part of reelection strategy based on cruel political deception.

title: Hanoi Is Reported Moving 100 Tanks Into the South
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 3Senior United States military analysts said today that additional North Vietnamese reinforcements were moving into South Vietnam. Among them, they said, is an armored regiment with about 100 tanks and about 100 armored personnel carriers. It was reported crossing the demilitarized zone into South Vietnam's northernmost province, Quangtri.

title: Regreening of 5th Ave. Planned
description: Nearly 100 elmlike Zelkova, willow oaks and ash trees and more than 110 bushy yew shrubs will be planted along Fifth Avenue between 39th and 59th Streets in the spring if the Fifth Avenue Association agrees to pay for a refoliation program proposed by the city.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: WASHINGTONThe Supreme Court held a memorial session last week for John Marshall Harlan, a member of the Court from 1955 until his retirement and death a year ago. It was an intimate occasion, for judges and lawyers and others who admired him. But listening to the tributes, one realized that there was a larger meaning in the life of this man, of significance to Americans generally.

title: Sofia Sentences Hijackers
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Nov. 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  Four young Turks who hijacked a Turkish airline plane to Sofia on May 3 today received threeyear prison terms from Sofia court.

title: One of Men Slain in Jamaica Was a Cantor in Brooklyn
description: One of the two men who were stabbed to death Thursday night in Rufus King Park, Jamaica, Queens, was identified by the police yesterday as a Hebrew teacher and cantor in an unnamed Brooklyn synagogue.

title: U. N. Statistical Office a Growing Success
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 3When Nikita S. Khrushchev wanted to demonstrate that Communist countries were going to overtake capitalist societies, he brandished figures from the United Nations Statistical Office. When the Security Council wanted to measure the success of its sanctions against Rhodesian chrome, it called on the Statistical Office. When Nigeria wanted an expert on census cartography, it got one from the Statistical Office.

title: DowJones Average Up 11.06 PointsGain Is 37.70 Over 4 Days
description: Wall Street investors, showing a classic turnabout in market psychology, sent prices soaring yesterday to the highest level in nearly four years, as measured by the DowJones industrials. Auto, bank, insurance and retailing stocks led the advance.

title: Mafioso Sentenced to 30 Years on Heroin Charge
description: Joseph Manfredi, a reputed Mafia captain, was sentenced in Federal Court yesterday to 30 years in prison and fined $25,000 for conspiring to distribute millions of dollars worth of heroin here and iii other Eastern cities.

title: 3 Robbers Killed in Holdup In Supermarket in Florida
description: LAKE WALES, Fla., Nov. 3  Three robbers were shot to death and two others captured tonight when the police foiled a supermarket robbery here, the police said.

title: Voters Can Be For and Against A Proposition One in Yonkers
description: YONKERS, No. 3  Offidais and civic leaders are predicting widespread confusion at the polls Tuesday because two questions on the ballot in Yonkers are labeled Proposition One.

title: 5 IN TAMPA GUILTY IN EXTORTION CASE
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 3 (UPI)Three New Yorkers and two brothers from Tampa were convicted by a Federal court jury last night of extortion and interstate gambling involving betting on baseball.

title: Thieu Offers a Plan
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Nov.4(UPI)President Nguyen Van Thieu has proposed an alternative to the American North Vietnamese draft agreement that would enable the United States to withdraw from the war but leave him free to negotiate a ceasefire and political settlement with North Vietnam and the Vietcong, Saigon Government sources said today.

title: Talks in Shipping Strike Under Way Again Here
description: Negotiations aimed at settling a 10dayold strike of deck officers against West Coast shipowners were resumed here yesterday afternoon after a twoday lapse.

title: Nixon Family to Open Polls In 3 Sections of Country
Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP)Sales of United States Savings Bonds exceeded redemptions for the 25th straight month in October, the Treasury Department said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with interest and increasing irritation your Oct. 24 editorial on The Senate Races.

title: NIXON TO ALLOW LOANS TO POLAND
description: WARSAW, Nov. 3  President Nixon has decided to make ExportImport Bank credits available to Poland. The decision, to be announced over the weekend, will play major role in facilitating development of a fiveyear program of reforms.

title: Steinkraus Triumphs on Main Spring
description: William C. Steinkraus, who has won more than 100 international classes, scored one of the most dramatic victories in his long career last night at the National Horse Show. He guided Main Spring to victory in the Voice Challenge Trophy event in a ninehorse jumpoff.

title: 54 Stolen Pistols Sought
description: MALDEN, Mass., Nov. 3 (AP)The police sought today 54 stolen pistols, hoping to find them before they might be put to criminal uses. Four men stole the weapons from a gun shop just before closing time on Wednesday, the police said.

title: Rockefeller on Stump in Hudson Valley
Hanoi and Peking Critical Of Nixon's Stand on Truce
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3North Vietnam responded today with a mixture of perplexity and irritation to President Nixon's insistence last night that an Indochina peace settlement could not be signed until all remaining issues were resolved.

title: Daugherty of Mich. State To Resign After Season
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Nov. 3 (AP)Michigan State's football coach, Duffy Daugherty announced his resignation today  effective at the end of the season  resigning gracefully rather than forcing fight over his recent losing ways.

title: Ezra Pound Is Buried With Simple Rites at Island Cemetery in Venice
description: VENICE, Nov. 3 (Reuters) The body of the expatriate American poet Ezra Pound, who died here Wednesday at the age of 87, was taken by gondola across the Venice lagoon today and buried in the tranquil island cemetery of San Michele. The plain chestnut coffin was rowed out to the island by four gondoliers and was interred in the Protestant section of the cemetery with an Anglican clergyman officiating. The funeral service earlier in the Palladian Basilica on the island of San Giorgio was without the customary black drapes, and there were very few flowers. No tribute came from either the Italian or United States Government for Pound, who broadcast from Italy during World War II on behalf of Italy's Fascist government. The broadcasts led to charges of treason against his native country, and Pound later spent 12 years in St. Elizabeths, a Washington mental hospital.

title: WHEAT PRICE UP ON TIGHT SUPPLY
description: Tight deliverable supplies of wheat to fulfill export commitments resulted in higher futures I prices for the grain yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Heath Confronts Bleak British Economy
description: LONDON, Nov. 3For most of the 55 million citizens of Britain these are hard times and they are getting harder.

title: In the Suburbs
description: Three Congressional candidates from the New York suburban areas who are of high caliber are in such particularly tight races that they merit the strongest possible voter turnout in their behalf.

title: The Screen: 'Valachi Papers' Arrives:Work Covers 30 Years of Criminal History Bronson in Lead Role of Mafia Informant
description: Often ludicrous and often just dull, Terence Young's "The Valachi Papers" has the look of a movie project that ran short of ideas before it was finished, and ran short of class almost before it was begun. It is the only gangster movie of recent memory in which the hoods still say "dese" and "dose," and which simulates an Italian accent by adding "a" to the ends of words: "You live by the knife and the gun-a. You die by the knife and the gun-a!"They are the words of Salvatore Maranzano, founder of the organization known as Cosa Nostra, initiating Joe Valachi into his Family. Maranzano, a devout intellectual, is over-played by Joseph Wiseman, rather as if he were Dante Alighieri trembling outside the gate of Hell. Actually, Maranzano mutters a good deal of classical sounding Italian, and before his untimely dispatch (Sept. 10, 1931; multiple knife and gunshot wounds) I half expected him to intone "Lasciate ogni speranza, voi ch'entrate""Leave all hope, ye who enter." He never does, but that might be a useful motto to put over the doors of theaters showing "The Valachi Papers."The film is of course based on the testimony of the Mafia soldier turned informant, Joe Valachi, and on Peter Maas's popular book. "The Valachi Papers." It covers more than 30 years of American criminal history, and it abounds in simulations of real people and events. It is finicky as to dates and often fanciful as to detail. For example, in a sequence showing crooks murdered in 1929, one will show up slumped over the wheel of a 1960's model car. To brazen this out, as the film attempts to do, seems like laziness raised to the level of willful contempt.The real mystery of "The Valachi Papers" is how anything so bad could have come from the efforts of so many good people. Not only Mr. Wiseman, normally a fine actor, but also Charles Bronson (as Valachi), Lino Ventura (as Vito Genovese), and others  all seem to be working out of their proper idiom. Terence Young ("Dr. No," "Wait Until Dark," etc.) has directed competently before this. And Stephen Geller, the scenarist, has, in "Slaughterhouse Five," previously written a useful screenplay.But in "The Valachi Papers" everyone undoes himself. It is as if they didn't know how to make a movie out of the book, or almost didn't know how to make a movieand didn't much care. Some of the assassinations and violent confrontations are so clumsy that they look like a return to primal innocence, or ignorance. And I couldn't help feeling that if only those bosses had seen a few movies they'd have had the sense to stay out of lonely restaurants and barber chairs, and all the bloodshed might have been spared."The Valachi Papers" opened yesterday at the Loew's Cine Theaters.

title: Goodwill in Canarsie
description: The city's educational authorities might well take their, cue from those black and white community and youth leaders in Canarsie who, during the past two days, have so persuasively talked sense to local demonstrators. Together with the teachers of Junior High School 211, who did their best to make the 32 black children from Brownsville feel welcome inside the school despite the unconscionable behavior of white parents outside, these voices of decency have provided a good example of the right way to go about school integration.

title: DEAL IS HELD NEAR ON SIBERIA'S GAS
description: Three American companies negotiating with the Soviet Union for delivery of huge quantities of natural gas from Siberia to the East Coast announced yesterday that they expected to conclude an agreement within 60 days.

title: Stock Prices Soar
description: Stock prices soared yesterday, sending the DowJones industrials 11.06 points higher to 984.12the best level in nearly four years. Wall Streeters attributed the rally, which started Tuesday, mainly to continuing hopes for peace in Indochina. Page 43.

title: SHOP TALK
description: It was a busy time in town for Emilio Pucci.

title: Bar on Tape Recorder Use By Reporters Struck Down
description: LEONARDTOWN, Md., Nov. 3 (UPI)A circuit court judge has struck down the St. Mary's County Commission policy barring the use of tape recorders by reporters at public meetings.

title: Knicks Rout Super Sonics By 10580 for 8th in Row
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 3 (AP)The New York Knicks won their eighth straight National Basketball Association contest tonight rolling over the Seattle SuperSonics, 10580.

title: Marketplace:Institutions Vex Company Head
description: Here's a Wall Street lament by a corporate executive. Russell Banks, the 53yearold president of the Grow Chemical Corporation, has watched the shares of his company drop from around 12 three months ago to 9 on the American Stock Exchange.

title: 76ers Lose 11th in Row
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 3 (AP) Nate Archibald scored 38 points and added 15 assists tonight as the Kansas CityOmaha Kings handed the nonwinning Philadelphia 76ers their 11th straight defeat, 114101.

title: Business Briefs
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The central bank today raised the Dutch bank rate 4 per cent from 3 per cent, effective Monday. The rate had stood at 3 per cent since Sept. 8.

title: The Aiken Solution?
description: Although Administration officials continue to insist that peace is at hand in Indochina, the agreement reached by Henry A. Kissinger and North Vietnamese diplomats in Paris last month is coming under increasing attack from the Government of South Vietnam, as might have been expected; and doubts are apparently also being raised within the Nixon Administration itself. Dr. KisSinger originally indicated that the United States was seeking only relatively minor changes in the ninepoint pact that had been outlined by Hanoi; yet the chief American negotiator in Paris Thursday referred to problems of substance remaining to be resolved.

title: NEW REPORTS DUE ON LUMBER PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The Price Commission threatened a few hundred lumber companies today with fines of $2,500 a day if they failed to get required reports into the mail by midnight Monday.

title: Recitals:
description: This has been a busy week for guitarists, and on Thursday night while Christopher Parkening was making his local debut as a classical performer in Tully Hall, Paco de Lucia was doing the same as a flamenco artist in Carnegie Hall. A native of Cadiz, he comes from a family skilled in playing Spain's traditional instrument, and he is only 24 years old.

title: U.S. Accused of Reneging
description: PARIS, Nov. 3The North Vietnamese delegation to the peace talks here issued a statement today saying that President Nixon's speech last night showed an American refusal to respect its commitments.

title: THE 2 KOREAS AGREE TOCURBPROP AGANDA
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Saturday, Nov. 4 (UPI)South Korea and North Korea formally agreed today to halt propaganda broadcasts against each other, effective Nov. 11, and also signed an accord on organization and operation of committee created to tackle problems between them.

title: Very Rev. Joseph Pishtey Dies; Chancellor of Orthodox Church
description: YONKERS, Nov. 3The Right Rev. Joseph J. Pishtey, chancellor or administrative head of the Orthodox Church in America and pastor of Holy Trinity Church, 46 Seymour Street, died last night at his home. He was 73 years old.

title: Focus Is on Abzug and Ryan, But There Are 5 in the Race
description: While attention has been focused on two of the five candidates for the House of Representatives in the 20th District, the three others have been campaigning hard, and two of them say they can win.

title: Hanoi Is Reported Moving 100 Tanks Into the South
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Senior United States military analysts said today that additional North Vietnamese reinforcements were moving into South Vietnam. Among them, they said, is an armored regiment with about 100 tanks and about 100 armored personnel carriers. It was reported crossing the demilitarized zone into South Vietnam's northernmost province, QuangLri.

title: Queens. L.I.U. in Soccer Tie
description: Queens College battled undefeated Long Island University to a 00 tie after two 5minute overtime periods yesterday in Metropolitan Conference soccer game at the Flushing campus of Queens College.

title: Morocco Has New Premier
description: RABAT, Morocco. Nov. (AP)King Hassan H has designated his brotherinlaw. Ahmed Osnan. to be the new Premier, replacing Mohammed Karim Lamrani.

title: Antiques: Belter Style
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. IJust how soon the exuberant Victorian style of John Henry Belter will reign again in the parlors of America is a question being raised this week for the fourth time in 12 years with the opening of yet another exhibition of Victorian art.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: This letter is written as an unqualified endorsement of the candidacy of Joe Boyd for Congress from the First Congressional District of New York.

title: Edward W. Costenbader. Editor of Dow Jones News
description: BELLEVILLE, N.J., Nov. 3Edward W. Costenbader, who had been with The Wall Street Journal and the Dow Jones News Service for many years, died of a heart attack today. He was 73 years old and lived at 499. Franklin Avenue.

title: Recitals:
description: Christopher Parkening's New York debut recital on Thursday night proved the lanky 24yearold Californian to be an impeccable classic guitarist, perhaps the finest technician this country has yet produced on his instrument. Mr. Parkening, handsome, lanky blond who connected immediately and strongly with the predominantly young audience that filled Alice Tully Hall, is already a popular artist as a result of his recordings, and could well become one of his generation's concert heroes.

title: RapidAmerican Takes Over Glen Alden and Gets a Loan
description: The RapidAmerican Corporation and the Glen Alden Corporation, two large consumergoods companies, were merged yesterday when shareholders of both concerns approved the consolidation at separate meetings in Wilmington, Del.

title: U.N. Aide Cites Progress In SouthWest Africa Talks
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 3 (AP)  Prime Minister John Vorster and a United Nations special envoy, Alfred Escher, agreed today that some progress had been made on the question of of SouthWest Africa.

title: For Surinam Tribe, City's Allure Is Fatal
description: MAMADAM, Surinam, Oct. 27They refused to give in to British plantation owners in the 17th century and they successfully resisted Dutch troops in the 18th century, but Surinam's socalled Bush Negroes now say their Africanbased tribal life is being lost after 300 years to a new

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Oct. 27 editorial entitled and New Jersey shows either your bias toward the Democratic party or that you have been taken in by the campaign literature of candidate Mrs. Jerry F. English, who is opposing Matthew J. Rinaldo (Republican) for the seat of the Twelfth N. J. District in Congress formerly held by Mrs. Florence P. Dwyer.

title: 13 Are Slated to Start Today in 102d Ladies Handicap
description: The oldest stakes race in the nation exclusively for fillies and mares, the Ladies Handicap will have its 102d running today at Aqueduct. A field of 13 has been named for the 1 mile race, with the Hobeau Farm entry of Wakefield Miss and Blessing Angelica ruling as the overnight favorite.

title: Northeastern. Led by Parisi, Surprises Boston U., 100
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2 (AP)Northeastern, led by Paul Parisi, drove 77 yards for firstperiod touchdown and went on to upset Boston University, 100, tonight for its fifth consecutive victory.

title: RAIDERS WIN, 9 TO 6; WARD, SHEEHAN STAR
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Nov. 31 (AP)The New York Raiders erupted for nine goals on 24 shots tonight and defeated the Winnipeg Jets, 96 in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Tams Edge Stars
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 3 (AP)1 Jimmy Jones of the Utah Stars missed two of three free throws with three seconds left and the Memphis Tams controlled the last rebound to gain a 118117 victory in overtime tonight The Tames broke a six game losing streak.

title: NIXON TAKES PLEA TO THREE STATES
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Nov. 3President Nixon campaigned today before airport crowds in Chicago, Tulsa and Providence in pursuit of an overwhelming vote for himself and a possible victory for several embattled Republican candidates.

title: RAPE SUSPECT, FREE IN BAIL, SEIZED AGAIN
description: A 17yearold Baruch College freshman who is accused of menacing with a knife a pregnant Queens housewife while he was free on $15,000 bail on three rape charges, had another bail of $60,000 set in Queens Criminal Court yesterday.

title: $Z5MILLION SUIT IS LOST BY GILBERT
description: The state's highest court yesterday upheld the dismissal of a $25million suit brought by Edward M. Gilbert, the financier who was convicted oftembezzling funds from a company he once headed, against Lazard Freres & Co., and Andre Meyer, the investment concern's senior partner.

title: Secret Service Studies McGovern's Case
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The Secret Service said today that it had opened an investigation to determine if anyone in the agency had given White House aides information about confidential meetings held by Senator George McGovern, who is being guarded by Secret Service agents during the Presidential campaign.

title: PHOTOS SHOWN AT NAPOLI'S TRIAL
description: Photographs that were said to show James Napoli, a reputed Mafia leader, in a restaurant rendezvous with a prizefight manager and his boxer were the basis of legal arguments yesterday during Napoli trial of on charges of perjury and contempt.

title: Thieu Aide Says Saigon Would Fight On A lone
description: SAIGON, Nov. 3  A wellplaced source in the Presidential Palace said today that President Nguyen Van Thieu would continue the war if the United States and North Vietnam concluded a ceasefire that did not provide for the total withdrawal of North Vietnamese troops.

title: Music: A Ring of Time
description: Dominick Argento is a 45yearold American composer who teaches at the University of Minnesota. Stanislaw Skrowaczewski is the conductor of the Minnesota Orchestra. So things naturally came together, and Thursday evening Mr. Skrowaczewski conducted the local premiere of Mr. Argento's A Ring of Time with the New York Philharmonic.

title: Mayor of Pottstown. Pa., Is Held in Gambling Case
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., Nov. 3 (AP)Mayor Joseph Dougherty of Phoenixville was arrested here today on charges of protecting a gambling operation.

title: Jell Experiments Reported
description: BONN, Nov. 3 (Agence FrancePresse)Two West Ger mans released In the East German amnesty were quoted in an article in the Frankfurter Ailgemeine Zeitung today as saying that about 15 prisoners in the Brandenburg penitentiary had been used as guinea pigs by doctors there.

title: SALA STAW, ACTRESS AND DIRECTOR, DEAD
description: Sala Staw, an actress and director, who was founder and president of the Foundation for Classic Theater and Academy here, died yesterday of cancer in Torrance, Calif. She was 66 years old and lived at 4610 61st Street, Woodside, Queens.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Oct. 31, 1972:

title: Nurses'
description: Final and binding recommendations have been made in the contract dispute between the city and the Licensed Practical Nurses of New York, Inc., Arvid Anderson, chairman of the Office of Collective Bargaining, announced yesterday.

title: C.B.S. IS STRUCK BY ELECTRICIANS
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System was struck by its cameramen, technicians and electrical engineers yesterday, and although the network maintained that it would continue operations using supervisory personnel, its coverage of Election Day, said to represent an investment of $3million, could be affected.

title: Queen,Wed For 25Years, To Note Day
description: LONDON, Nov. 3 Buckingham Palace said today that Queen Elizabeth H and Prince Philip would mark their 25th wedding anniversary on Nov. 20 with a church service, a ride through London in a horsedrawn carriage, an elaborate luncheon and a party for family and friends in the evening.

title: Heath, Facing Bleak Economy, Is Expected to Impose Controls
description: LONDON, Nov. 3For most of the 55 million citizens of Britain these are hard times and they are getting harder.

title: Citibank Cuts Loan Rate
description: The First National City Bank and the Mellon National Bank & Trust Company, as expected, yesterday reduced their prime lending rates on business loans to 5 per cent for the week beginning Monday, down from 5, per cent this week.

title: Giacomin Honing Skills For Return to Ranger Duty
description: Leaping like a Ukrainian dancer and making knee splits that threatened to tear his padded pants, Ed Giacomin put on a postpractice show for the Rangers yesterday.

title: Thruway Revenue Rose 2.79% for First 9 Months
description: ALBANY, Nov. 3 (AP)The 496mile Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway grossed $87.6million in revenue in the first nine months of the year, the Thruway Authority reported yesterday.

title: Englewood to Make $2.6Million Loan For Urban Renewal
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your endorsement (editorial Oct. 27) of the Democratic candidate for Congress in the Third Congressional District, I assume, considered the maturity he demonstrates when in joint appearances with his Republican opponent, Angelo Roncallo, he holds up placards behind Mr. Roncallo bearing the legend He is a liar.

title: Terrorism Is Posing a West German Election Issue
description: BONN, Nov. 3  The issue of law and order is present but elusive in West Germany's current election campaign as a result of recent raids by foreign terrorists here and rising domestic crime.

title: Frederick K. Teipel, 78, Of Manufacturers Trust

description: Stock prices soared yesterday, sending the DowJones industrials 11.06 points higher to 984.12the hest level in nearly four years. Wall Streeters attributed the rally, which started Tuesday, mainly to continuing hopes for peace in Indochina. Page 43.

title: NIXON TO ALLOW LOANS TO POLAND
description: WARSAW, Nov. 3  President Nixon has decided to make ExportImport Bank credits available to Poland. The decision, to be announced over the weekend, will play a major role in facilitating development of a fiveyear program of reforms.

title: Credit Market Traders Say Price Rally Shows No Sign of Ending
description: Interest rates tumbled for the third straight session yesterday in unusually heavy Friday dealings.

title: Bridge :Signals Can Reveal Number Of Cards. One Holds in a Suit
description: Giving partner a count is standard defensive procedure. Your partner may need to know the number of cards you have in a suit, so you give him the information, playing lowhigh with an odd number of cards, and highlow with an even number of cards.

title: TV: All About Elections
description: Let's be grateful for a simple, crystalclear 30 minutes of home viewing on What's an Election All About? This Columbia Broadcasting System special, in a children's series that previously dealt with both Presidential nominating conventions, is scheduled to be aired today at 12:30 P.M. The program is as muchperhaps even morefor adults. That's the beauty of it.

title: Building Geodesic Dome Tests Skills of Students

title: Man's House Vanishes As He Eats Breakfast
description: TALLAHASSEE; Fla., Nov. 4 (AP)  M. A. Harrison, 92 years old, left his home to eat breakfast at a restaurant. When he returned his house was gone, bulldozed to the ground by city work crews. The ramshackle frame house Mr. Harrison rented for $20 a month, near the lumber company where he has been a night watchman for 25 years, was condemned by the city last July.

title: Designs for the modern
description: Willi Smith, Scott Barrie and Stephen Burrows are three successful, under30, black designers. Their philosophy is fresh, their styles strongly individual. All would agree that the woman with a mind and a spirit of her own is their ideal. For them the social. but: terfly is not. Willi's designs are the youngest, Scott's are cooly sophisticated, Stephen's the most innovative. Their designs are modeled here by Judith Jamison, star of the Alvin Ailey City Dance Theatre.

title: OKLAHOMA BEATS IOWA STATE, 206
description: AMES, Iowa, Nov. 4 (AP)Leon Crosswhite and Greg Pruitt combined for 216 yards rushing and a touchdown apiece today to give seventhranked Oklahoma a 206 victory over Iowa State in a Big Eight Conference game.

title: A. A. Bragato to Wed Miss Hoffman

title: The World
description: PNOMPENHWe are the poor people who are waiting for the peace to fall from the heavens, the receptionist at a Western embassy in Pnompenh says wistfully to a visitor. His remark is virtually a national litany. From President Lon Nol to the lowliest Pedicab driver, Cambodians wait  helplessly, wishfully, at the mercy of nations and forces beyond their control  for the accord they hope will bring peace to their lush and beautiful country after two and a half years of a war they never wanted.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The polls tells us that President Nixon is going to win on Tuesday, which is easy to believe, and that the American people are going to give him the greatest popular election victory of this century, which is much harder to believe.

title: News of Dogs
description: The Akita and the Bichon Frise have been accepted for registration in the American Kennel Club. Since last Wednesday the stud book has been opened to the two breeds, the first to gain admittance since the Shih Tzu in April, 1969. The two new breeds will be eligible to compete for points and A.K.C. championships, starting next April 4. It has been a long hard climb for the Akita, which, since 1956, has been competing in the forgotten class, the miscellaneous. In the Akita Club of America's stud book, as of last month, there were 2,355 registered in this country, with the largest number on the Coast.

title: Henson Helps Ohio State Rally To Set Back Minnesota, 2719

title: Preps

title: Crisis of the underemployed
description: What is wrong with the economies of America's big cities is at best poorly measured by the conventional unemployment rate published monthly by the U.S. Department of Labor and dutifully reported in the press and on television. The problem is that even those who workor a very large proportion of them  do not and cannot earn enough money to support their families. They work for a living but not for a living wage. Many have long known this fact; certainly, the poor themselves. Now we have documentary evidence that will help bring the picture into focus for others. This lack of perception, this inability of the nation to understand the nature of the problem itself helps to explain our failure to come to the rescue of the cities.

description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Nov. 4 (AP)Neither rain nor the tough Florida defense could stop Terry Henley and Randy Walls from leading the 11thranked Auburn Tigers to a firsthalf romp today, but the Tigers had to fight off a strong finish by Florida for a 26.20 victory. Henley ripped off a 47yard touchdown run with the game only three minutes old. Later in the first period, Henley hauled

title: Sports of The Times
description: Floyd Little of the Denver Broncos has incorporated his philosophy of life into motto that he constantly uses. It might be regarded as cornball by skeptical moderns, but it would surely gain the approval of an older and more idealistic generation. Here are the wise words he most treasures: I choose not to be an ordinary man/Because it is my right to be uncommonif I can.

Hathaway, Democrat, reported this week. The entire Maine coast was closed to clamming because of a recent outbreak of the red tide, a toxic algae.

title: The Campaign: Final Days

He made the comment in his 12th and final radio speech, then set out on a swing through North Carolina and New Mexico to California, where he will stump today and tomorrow before delivering a nationwide television address. He will vote in California.

title: Letter to the Editor 12  No Title

title: Rootbed of Tomorrow
description: November's simplicities actually are the autumn clutter in the meadow and the woodland. Where the trees stand naked the leaves lie deep, their colors already fading. Where the winds of October have pruned the woods of their dead branches, the tangle lies awaiting the bacteria that will reduce it to litter and humus. The frosted fronds of summer ferns are brown embroidery on the rocky hillside. The ripe grasses are bronzed and stiffened, their seeds are'all flown, their summer's work is done.

title: The Taking On of Manhood
description: When is it that a boy comes to be called a man? In many cultures, the passage from childhood to adulthood is marked by specific ceremonial rites: these may include such practices as circumcision, or a period of social isolation, or even some form of mutilationthere are primitive Australian groups who have a ritual which involves knocking out a front tooth. But whatever form the various rites may take, their underlying purpose is always the same: to mark a momentous change in someone's status. The boy who undergoes the puberty ceremony emerges from it in a new social role. He is no longer a juvenile; he is a full man, with an adult's responsibilities and powers.

description: PRAGUE, Nov. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)A new monthly literary review has appeared in Czechoslovakia, where such publications have been banned for more than two years.

title: Hampton Bays Is Due to Vote Soon on Incorporation as Village
description: HAMPTON BAYS, L. I.To incorporate or not to incorporate? That's the question once more puzzling residents of this sprawling South Fork community, wno, for the second time in a decade, are being asked to choose between political autonomy as an incorporated village and continuation as a unincorporated area within the town of Southampton.

title: Texas Tech Beats Rice
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Joe Barnes, a quarterback, ran 11 yards for a touchdown and Don Grimes kicked a 22yard field goal today that carried Texas Tech to a 106 victory over Rice in a Southwest Conference game.

title: Motorists May Feel Fuel Lag
description: DETROIT  The possibility that the United States may face in the next decade its first peacetime energy crisis should be cause for concern to the average motorist.

title: Montclair State Triumphs Over Trenton State, 416
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Nov. 4Scoring three times in the last three minutes of the first half, Montclair State gained its fifth victory of the season, downing Trenton State, 416, in a New Jersey State College Conference game tonight before a rainsoaked crowd of 3,445 fans at Sprague Field.

title: From fashion to freaks
description: The photograph allows us... to admire in reproduction something that our eyes alone could not have taught us to love. ANDRE BAZIN.

title: New characters: caring, needing, dreaming, abusing
description: Written with the simplicity, the energy, the concrete beauty of a child's speech, Like the Lion's Tooth is a wrenching tale of raped, abandoned children who have been ravaged of everything but the power to need. Marjorie Kellogg achieves the extraordinary feat of writing about atrocities with her eye fixed on love, infusing into the mutilation of innocents the sense that, even if parents use and wreck them, the young can keep each other whole and alive.

title: Preps
description: LAWRENCEVILLE. N. J., Nov. 4Scott Coolidge scored three touchdowns and Gabe Sciolla two today in a dual offensive display of rushing that earned undefeated Lawrenceville a 4728 victory over Choate.

title: Religion
description: All together, now, one big crunch, the Rev. Letty Russell suggested. And the congregation, apples in hand, obliged with decisive, symbolic bites. Seated on the floor and even on kiddie furniture in the basement daycare center of the Washington Square United Methodist Church in New York, the more than 50 participants, most of them women, were celebrating their liberation from the old, oppressive myth about Adam and Eve.

title: ExDrug Addicts Trying to Help Band in Jersey
description: A group of former drug addicts in Jamaica, Queens, some of them still in the process of rehabilitation, are raising funds so that a high school band from New Jersey can play at the Rose Bowl.

title: New &
description: On a steamer heading northward up the Labrador coast, several passengers tell tales of Esau Gillingham, a legendary hunter who took the side of the Eskimos against the civilizing influence of those who would obliterate their culture. Gillingham is part Arctic superman, part visionary leader. Both traits help him to become blood brother to the Aborigine in the pursuit of pelts and their own identity.

title: Detroit Rolls Up the Convertible
description: DETROIT  Anyone who wants a new convertible had better buy one soon because trte 1973 models may mark their end on the American road.

title: Dianne M.Ingle Bride on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 4In the United University Church on the campus of the University of Southern California here this afternoon, Miss Dianne Marie Ingle, a senior at the university, was married to Christopher Bratton Marker.

title: CHANGES ASKED FOR LAW SCHOOLS
description: A study of the way American lawyers are educated, sponsored by the Carnegie Commission on Higher Education, calls for broad diversification to reflect the growing heterogeneity of the legal profession and the increasing demands of a changing society. The study was written by Herbert L. Packer, Jackson Eli Professor of Law at the Stanford Law School, and Thomas Ehrich, dean and professor of law at Stanford, with the assistance of Stephen Pepper, a Stanford graduate currently at the Yale Law School.

title: Thieu Counterplan Described
description: SAIGON, Nov. 4 (UPI)South Vietnamese Government sources said today that President Thieu had proposed a counterplan to end the Indochina war.

title: The Mountains At the Bottom Of the World
description: A species, of giant Stone Age primate, surviving in an Andean volcano? Before you say Poppycock! read this latest venture into unnatural history by the author of The Lost Ones. Mighty convincing. We are dealing here with Paranthropus, 7feet tall, covered with reddishbrown hair, splendidly equipped with tusks and fangs and possessed of a halfmillion years experience at preserving his anonymity. So, when the eccentric anthropologist Fergus McBride leads his small party across the Chilean icecap, the worst that can happen is that their mission will succeed.

title: Trailing by 41, Penguins Rally to Halt Rangers, 64
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 4For the first 20 minutes tonight, it looked as if the Rangers could find a better match at their practice rink. But after the next 40 minutes, they probably wished they had been at Skateland in New Hyde Park, L.I.

title: About Pro Football
description: The renewal of one of pro football's keenest rivalries, between the Raiders of Oakland and the Kansas City Chiefs, will be shown on television here today, Channel 4 at 4 o'clock. As usual the lead in the Western Division of the American Conferenc4 is at stake and possibly the eventual division title. This is the first of two games between the rivals and over the past six seasons the second game has definately decided their division championship.

title: Mothers Get Ecology Lesson
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.While many mothers were still getting their children off to school on a recent chilly and rainy morning, 37 women  a number with children in their arms  met at Flax Pond near here with a group of scientists to discuss their environment.

title: Cable Television Offers Boon for Financially Pressed Candidates
description: CONCORD, Calif., Nov. 1Pete Stark and Lew Warden got a free halfhour of television time last night to continue their running battle for California's Eighth Congressional District seat.

title: World News Briefs
description: NIS, Yugoslavia, Nov. 4Workers at one of Yugoslavia's biggest electrical works, the Elektronska lndustrija plant here, staged a mass walkout today to protest against management methods.

title: North Carolina Wins
description: CLEMSON, S.C., Nov. 4 (AP) North Carolina, powered by the running of two fullbacks, Dick Oliver and Tim Kirkpatrick, and a 69yard touchdown run by Phil Lamm, crushed Clemson, 2610, today in an A.C.C. game. The Tar Heels staged three long drives for touchdowns and moved deep enough two other times for successful field goal attempts.

title: Personal Visions
description: The 10 books represented on these pages were selected from 195 titles (after an initial screening of all children's books published in 1972) by Barbara Bader whose history of American picture books will appear next year; Remy Charlip, whose 20th book, Harlequin, will also appear next year; Alan Fern, Assistant Chief of the Prints and Photographs Division, Library of Congress. In this, the 21st annual award, are two previous winnersEtienne Delessert and Tana Hoban.

title: 18YEAROLDS PUSH ABSENTEE VOTING UP
description: Because 18yearolds will be voting in a Presidential election for the first time, the number of absentee ballots in the city is expected to be more than double ble the number cast in the 1968 national election, according to figures obtained from the Board of Elections.

title: MIKE HILL LEADS TEXAS GOLF BY 3
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 4 (AP)Mike Hill shot a birdie on the last hole for a 69 and stretched his lead to three strokes in the $125,000 Texas open golf tournament today.

title: N.Y.A.C. OARSMEN WIN FOUR EVENTS
description: New York Athletic Club oarsmen, led by Dr. Larry Klecatsky, a 31yearold national champion, won four of the seven events yesterday of the election weekend regatta of the New York Rowing Association. The Orchard Beach Lagoon was rough with whitecaps and a strong crosswind. Klecatsky rode in the bow seat of the club lightweight four with coxswain, which overpowered Coach Norman HildesHeim's Spuyten Duyvil crew by twoandahalf lengths.

title: Excerpts From Interview With North Vietnam's Chief Delegate to the Paris Talks
description: PARIS, Nov. 4Following are excerpts from the text of an interview with Xuan Thuy, head of the North Vietnamese delegation to the peace talks, conducted here today by Flora Lewis of The New York Times. The questions were in English and Mr. Thuy answered in Vietnamese. The translation into English was by an interpreter.

title: INDIANS STAYING IN U.S. BUILDING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Members of the American Indian Movement continued to occupy the Bureau of Indian Affairs building today after an early morning agreement with Government officials that Fed eral marshals would not try to evict them pending further negotiations over their grievances.

title: Movies
description: NOW that Fellini's Roma has arrived triumphantly in Manhattan, can the great man himself be far behind? You bet. The Maestro is currently rushing about Rome preparing his new film, II Borgo, which goes into production within the next three weeks at the Cinecitta Studios and will later move to the outskirts of Rome for location shooting.

title: Three Blacks Running for Public Offices in Suffolk County
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I.I'm not running as a black. That would be foolish here. It's not Harlem. I'm a Democrat who happens to be black, said Andrew Malone Jr., who as a candidate for the East Hampton town board is one of three blacks among some 430 men and women seeking state and local offices in Suffolk County this year.

title: Breaking up and working loose
description: Today, so many books begin with divorces, just as 19thcentury novels used to end with marriages. Perhaps we now regard divorce as inevitable for many: a stage in most ordinary lives, like learning to drive or going to school or jobhunting. There's far more respect for the emotions that lead up to marriage or divorce than for either institution. And for many, it gets harder to believe that two people can live together for a long time without paying a fierce price for it, such as losing several limbs. Yet some are still wistful about continuity.

title: Pop Music
description: It was a special night at the Radio City Music Hall on Friday. First, there was the appearance of James Taylor in one of his rare live performances that fact alone helped create the ambiance of a special event. Then, too, Taylor became the first rock performer to play Rockefeller Center's aging grande dame of the movie houses. Finally, and possibily most important, Taylor announced his wedding, earlier in the evening, to his long time companion,. the pop singer and songwriter Carly Simon.

title: National Cemetery at Gettysburg Halting Burials
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Nov. 4 (UPI)Almost 109 years after Abraham Lincoln dedicated it as a final resting place for the Union dead. the national cemetery here has been closed to burials for lack of available grave sites.

title: Medicine
description: Brakes screech. Impact. Half in, half out of the car window, the driver lies unconscious, his body broken and bleeding.

title: Critical of Admissions at Yale, Alumni Fail Chance to Do Better
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 4Yale alumni would be just as tough and use just about the same criteria as the admissions office in admitting young men and women to Yale, judging from an exercise in admissions completed this weekend by 14 groups of alumni.

title: KEY HOUSE RACES COULD AID G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Republican hopes of winning a majority of New York State's seats in the House of Representatives for the first time in 14 years hinge mainly on the outcome Tuesday of potentially close races in and around New York City.

title: Housing Complex Planned For 42,000 in Manhattan
description: One of the nation's largest urban housing developmentsa vast, virtually selfcontained $300million community of apartment towers and supportive facilities for 42,000 people will be built at the northern tip of Manhattan over the next seven years, under plans announced yesterday by state and city officials.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Forty years ago, long before issues dominated the world of public relations, Paul W. Garrett was telling General Motors what the people who bought automobiles wanted and needed.

title: Preps
description: GROTON, Mass., Nov. 4Oncebeaten St. Paul's scored 14 points in the first period and then hung on to defeat tenacious Lawrence today, 1412. Lawrence has a 4.2 record.

title: Regional Leader Nominated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) Russell Field Merriman of Montpelier, Vt., has been nomhalted by President Nixon to Iv, Federal cochairman of the New Fngland Regional Commission.

title: Dr. Sharon B. Drager Is Affianced
description: Dr. Sharon Beth Drager of New York and Capt. Ernest Ivan Katler, U.S.A., Medical Corps, of Los Angeles plan to be, married next June.

title: Regazzoni, Merzario Win 9Hour Sports Car Race
description: JOHANNESBURG, S o u t h Africa, Nov. 4Clay Regazzoni of Switzerland and Arturo Merzario of Italy gave Ferrari its third international ninehour sports car race in three years at the Kyalami circuit today.

title: Mickey Rooney Loses Plea
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif, Nov. (UPI)4 Mickey Rooney has been denied a request for a new trial to gain custody of four children by his fifth wife, Barbara Thomason Rooney. A Superior Court judge, Mario Clinco, who denied the request yesterday, ruled Sept. 29 that it was in the best interest of the children to remain with their maternal grandmother. Barbara Rooney was shot to death in 1966 while she and Mr. Rooney were separated.

title: Austin St. Center Of Voting Activity
description: If you are looking for some election fever in Forest Hills. Queens, these days you might try Austin Street. We go there for almost everything.

title: Preps
description: HIGHTSTOWN, N.J., Nov. 4 A 70yard punt by Ed Abner placed The Hill in a precarious position on its own 4yard line today from which it never recovered in a 13.0 loss to Peddle.

title: Squash: Plentiful and Tasty
description: PINE BROOKPumpkin is squash and vice versa and lot of squash was grown in the state this year. But nobody was counting, so it's only a guess that it was more than ever before.

title: Nijinsky'Outrageous, Spectacular, Sensual
description: ONE of the most satisfying aspects of Maurice Bejart's fulllength ballet, Nijinsky, Clown of God, currently on view at the Felt Forum, is the rare vision of a choreographer using the legendary stuff of his own art as material for a contemporary and meaningful work. It's an old tradition in literature (Joyce's Ulysses is a first choice among many) and theater (Anouilh's reworking of Antigone), and is currently very much the thing in filmI need only cite Play It Again, Sam with its dependence on the mythology of old movies. But save for things like the camp reference to Giselle in Cakewalk and a recent work about Isadora Duncan, dance has very much ignored its own history and legends.

title: IN THE NATION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 3  Gov. Ronald Reagan of California has asked the television networks to wait until the polls have, closed on the West Coast before they report the projected outcome of the Presidential election that they will derive from early returns in the East. Suspicious McGovern backers here believe Mr. Reagan is fearful that news of a projected Nixon landslide will reduce the turnout among complatent California Republicans and help George McGovern carry the state.

title: Rockets Sink Pistons
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 4 (AP)Otto Moore replaced Don Smith in the third quarter and led the Houston Rockets to a 118108 victory over the Detroit Pistons tonight, despite a 42point effort by Bob Lanier.

title: 1973 Car Forecast: Record Sales For Detroit's Big 4
description: DETROITAny reports about the demise of the automobile appear to be greatly exaggerated. It is not simply that Americans cannot do without their cars. The old love affair that seemed to be cooling off may be heating up again.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 9  No Title
description: ATHENS, Ga., Nov. 4 (AP)A sophomore quarterback, Condredge Holloway, threw two touchdown passes in the second period as Tennessee escaped the Southeastern Conference cellar with a 140 victory over Georgia today.

title: HAWAII GOVERNOR PRESSED IN STRIKE
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 4Pressure is being put on Gov. John A. Burns to take steps to end the third shipping strike to affect Hawaii this year.

title: GENERAL MOTORS
description: DETROITThe allnew cars from Detroit are the middlesized models from General Motors. Gone are the hardtops  even the sleek, twodoor coupes have a pillar to give them more strength in rollovers.

title: The lemale only child
description: To the Editor:

title: Court Voids Law in Texas On Seizing Tenant Property
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 4 (AP) A Texas law allowing landlords to seize their tenants' property for nonpayment of rent has been declared unconstitutional by the Federal Appeals court here.

title: Wendy We iler Jersey Bride
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 4 In St. Elizabeth's Episcopal Church here this evening Miss Wendy Carol Weiler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Weiler Jr., became the bride of James Allen Maffucci, son of Mr. and Mrs. Angelo Maffucci of Upper Montclair.

title: EssexHudson
description: Lincoln, playing without fleet halfback Larry Young who broke an ankle last week, managed enough fire power to defeat Union Hill 206, yesterday at Roosevelt Stadium in Jersey City.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Education
description: The allpurpose lawyer is about to go the way of the general medical practitioner. Specialization is the vogue, and the law school should adjust to the facts of life.

title: Criminals At Large
description: At 277 fairly dense pages, Audrey Erskine Lindop's JOURNEY INTO STONE (Doubleday, $6.95), described as a novel of suspense, is considerably longer than most of its kind. But, then again, it tries to do two jobs. On the one hand it is a straight novel about the marital troubles of a hardworking British cop. He constantly has his work on his mind, lives crime for 24 hours a day, and his wife resents it. On the other hand, Journey Into Stone has a good deal of solid, deductive police work in itbut most of the novel is concerned with an itsybitsy crime and,with eccentric characters. (One such is an amiable criminal who wants to go to jail.) The author takes her time, carefully building plot, characters, locale.

title: The greening of a stable
description: Gardens are blooming indoors as never before; even architecture is being influenced by the desire to live amid a small jungle. Joan and Marvin Goody, a husbandandwife architectural team, used the idea of an indoor greenhouse as the focus in redesigning their carriage house, creating a central well topped by an acrylic skylight, as a haven for plants on two levels. The old building. in Boston's Beacon Hill district, dates from 1875 and was originally a twostory stable and carriage house. Standing at the entrance to a charming mews and across from a small commons (below), it is an oddly shaped, triangular structure that had never been used as a dwelling until its owners took it over four years ago. (Until 1920, carriages were regularly hoisted by a handpowered elevator for storage in the secondfloor loft.) The Goodys had to build a complete house within the existing redbrick shell. In some places, Mrs. Goody says. the new studs and dry wall are holding up the outside walls. To gain a proper residence for themselves, while keeping the ground floor as a rental unit, the architects added a third story to the building, capping it with a mansard roof that maintains the traditional character of the old historic streets. The live plants are the most important feature of the interior design. The glass partitions originally planned around the well of greenery were never installed because the owners found that people and plants both thrive in similar conditions of humidity and light. Thus the garden is open, to be enjoyed from the combined kitchen, dining and living room and from the balcony above.

title: Bates, Yes Butley
description: ALAN BATES is brilliant at every turn in Butley (there aren't many turns, his life is all corners he cannot get out of), but if he per suaded me of one thing more than another it was that he simply could not tolerate, in, his cinderblock teacher's cell chilled by bluegray neon light, one more mention of Leontes. Not because Leontes, the central figure in Shakespeare's The Winter's Tale, is a classic case of paranoid jealousy, as Mr. Bates himself is in his more lucid moments. But because Leontes is nothing more than a man in a play, a paper man, a man about whom student papers can be written, a man to be discussed in terms of pity and terror and all the other neat little literary categories that seem to compartmentalize life when life is actually one big decompartrnentalized, but utterly real, mess.

title: EDWARD GASTON
description: TENAFLY, N.J., Nov. 4Edward Gaston, who had been with the A. D. T. Corporation of New York for 53 years and president for 10 years before his retirement in 1963. died today at his home, 14 Surrey Lane. He was 81 years old.

title: The Telling of the War
description: Somewhere in Europe, on the other side of vast oceans and towering walls, there was, once upon a time, a kingdom of malediction where children were not allowed to live and old men were afraid to be seen. But the children, too, were old. And so, all the inhabitants looked alike. Except that they were divided into two distinct groups: those who shouted and those who trembled; those who struck and those who were struck down. The killers killed, the victims vanished without leaving a trace, almost without regret. For in this sad and morbid land, people lived and died under the sign of the executionerhe was king and sovereign. And human life was worth less than a speck of dust and weighed less than a handful of ashes.

title: Picture books: pretty things
description: The star system (that tarnished relic of Hollywood's palmy years) is just now entering a comparable heyday in the world of children's picture books. A wellestablished illustrator today can not only select his own script; he virtually has carte blanche to write one himself, tailormade to suit his talents.

title: Utah State Crushes Idaho
description: LOGAN, Utah, Nov. 4 (AP) Tony Adams completed 13 consecutive passes in the second quarter today as Utah State trounced Idaho, 517. Adams hit the nation's leading pass receiver, Tom Forzani, for two touchdowns of 3 and 21 yards. He completed 32 of 47 passes for 406 yards and five touchdowns.

title: B. M. Friedman to Wed Miss Cook
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 4 Mr. and Mrs. Allan K. Cook have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Allan Cook of New York, to Benjamin M. Friedman, also of New York. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Norbert Friedman of Louisville.

title: Kathy Kusner, Steinkraus Win in Horse Show Here
description: The United States Equestrian Team took first place in both International jumping events on the fourth day of the National Horse Show at Madison Square Garden yesterday.

title: Young Israeli on Occupied Mt. Hermon Thinks Big
description: NEVE ATIV, IsraeliOccupied Syria,  Sheiks Gendelman thinks big.

title: Three of Seven Places on the Court of Appeals Are at Stake in the Only Statewide Contest
description: Three of the seven seats on the state's highest court are at stake in Tuesday's election, in the only statewide race in New York.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Catastrophe has struck. It always has, always will. You struggle to stop it in one form, and it arrives in another. For years here we fought to stop Communism, fought so hard that we could no longer imagine that any other form of catastrophe could ever strike us.

title: 2 KOREAS SET UNIT FOR COOPERATION
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 4 North Korea and South Korea agreed today to organize joint. machinery to arrange political, economic and other exchanges between them to promote peaceful unification of Korea.

title: AMHERST IS VICTOR OVER TUFTS, 49 TO 0
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 4Rick Murphy, a quarterback, led Amherst College to its sixth straight victory today by beating Tufts, 490.

title: Liner Elizabeth 2 Is Delayed
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England, Nov. 4 (Reuters)The Cunard liner Queen Elizabeth 2 was abruptly delayed on its scheduled departure for New York today, affecting the travel plans of more than 1,500 passengers. Cunard said the delay was caused by faults found in new wiring and equipment in the hotel section, particularly the kitchens, of the recently overhauled liner.

title: Long Beach Election Centers on Race for City Judge
description: LONG BEACH, L. I.A minor, interim post as municipal judge has become the focus of a major local campaign by the newly victorious Republicans to Keep Long Beach Republican and by the traditionally controlling Democrats to Keep Long Beach Democratic.

title: Parley on L.I. Historic Sites Set
description: SETAUKET, L. I.A statewide program to inventory historic sites and buildings will zero in on Long Island next Saturday.

title: POMPIDOU SCORNS PARIS AS MUSEUM
description: PARIS, Nov. 4Paris isn't a dead city or a museum, President Pompidou said recently in discussing the march of highrise buildings into the City of Light.

title: Ezra Pound
description: Ezra Pound was so steeped in controversyespecially in the last decades of his lifethat there is a danger that the snioke of battle will obscure, as it has already darkened, his genuine abilities and his considerable contribution to literature. Certainly his treasonous broadcasts from Italy during the war and such poems as Canto 52 in his famous sequence are indefensible even by his defenders. His condemnation of European society in the Mauberley poems was, however, part of the general feeling of revulsion after the bloodletting of World War I. And even his views on money and banking have been held, in less vituperative form, by respectable predecessors.

title: Who could fall in love with the 7th Avenue local? But in Paris, feelings run as deep as the subway tunnel. And partisans insist a visitor can embrace the system in 10 minutes.; I.R.T., Mes Amis, Is Merely Graffiti on the Walls of the Metro
description: PARISAmong the many things that function or merely exist under the revered pavements of this city, three are of enduring interest to travelers: the sewers, the catacombs and the M6tro. The sewers are best used but not visited, the catacombs best visited butwhy rush?not used. But the Mtrothe vein and artery of Paris, the stem and the flowerthe Metro is to be used, visited, loved.

title: Science
description: The interior of the earth is a rich storehouse of energy, a fact made destructively evident in volcanic eruptions and earthquakes, and more peaceably demonstrated by geysers and hot springs. For generations men have dreamed of tapping that energy to light their cities and drive their industries.

title: A poetry of nouns and adjectives
description: James Schuyler's new book contains the best poems he has ever written. In a time when many poets have designs on the immediate and provisional, when verse has the air of first person notation, journals and improvisation, his is naturally a valued presence. His work has the coveted directness, the openness to experience of his plainest declarations: All things are real/no one a symbol. He is often offhand, but never merely so.

title: Sea Cliff Chamber Group Will Open in New Site
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I.,The Sea Cliff Chamber Players, who have been breaking new musical ground on Long island since the group was organized two years ago, will do it again next Sunday.

Bernieri and Iracane made 20 tackles apiece. Bob Maresca; the quarterback, passed Poly into position for its two scores, which were made by Leon Mcdeste and Joe LaFauci.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: October deliveries of new cars, amounting to 1,065,000, was the highest monthly total on record.... Boeing Company sells four new 747 Jumbo jets to Japan Air Lines for $104million.... Lockheed Aircraft gets contract for six Lockheed Tristars from All Nippon Airways for $133million.... Direct investment abroad by United States corporations and others rose $7.8billion to $86billion in 1971. Earnings on such investments increased $1.7billion to $12.6billion.

title: AMERICANS MOOD CALLED DOWNBEAT
description: The mood of the nation is downbeat, but far from one of helplessness, eight writers, educators and political polltakers agreed during a wideranging seminar called President/Politics/People held recently at the Institute on Man and Science in Rensselaerville, N. Y.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: NORTH BLENHEIM, N. Y., Nov. 4Bleinheim Bridge isn't exactly falling down, but it is sagging at one end.

title: SHOP TALK.
description: CALDWELL  The birthplace of Grover Cleveland, the only president born in New Jersey, is the highlight of this borough. The house, at 207 Bloomrield Avenue, has been restored by the state and contains many of his possessions and memorabilia.

title: Chess: For Korchnoi, the Route From A to B Is Through Z
description: For Viktor Korchnoi, chess is not complicated enough. While a Capablanca, a Fischer or a Smyslov will hunt relentlessly for the single strategic thread that unites the diverse elements of the game into a clear pattern, Korchnoi revels in tactical intermezzos, and the more the merrier.

title: Preps
description: Jonathon Gross ran and passed Riverdale to a 2814 victory over Hackley yesterday at Riverdale. Gross passed for 170 yards and two touchdowns and ran the option play for 100 yards rushing.

title: Home Improvement,
description: UNTIL a comparatively few years ago most homeowners installed their clothes washing machines and dryers In their basementsusually next to the laundry tubs which had already been installed there by the original builders. In addition, those who lived in apartments, small rented houses or mobile homes always felt that they had to forego the convenience of having their own home laundry center (washer and dryer)there just wasn't the room for conventional large machines. However, both of these situations have changed drastically in recent years.

title: The Damage Called Growing Up
description: Someone once said that nobody writes well about childhood because nobody knows what it is. And while I cannot remember the source of this statement (Chesterton? Shaw?) I do concur most heartily. The few people who know what childhood is all about cannot tell us because they are the children. The rest of us have simply forgotten; the entire experience has been too strange, or mystical, or harsh to dredge up again.

title: Picture novels: Daughters &
description: Children's fiction beyond a doubt possesses infinite variety, and in spite of the fact that there are large portions staled by custom which age will most certainly wither, every category contains its Cleos. Here are six books, for 7to11yearolds, representing a group that could be defined as picture novels.

title: Battle for the White House
description: To the Editor:

title: Animal Pests Plague Suburban Yards
description: TRENTONAn opossum is hit by a car on a busy suburban street. A skunk interrupts a Sunday School play rehearsal. Tightly fitted lids are mysteriously lifted away and trashcan contents are strewn over the lawn. Squirrels drop acorns on a passerby's head.

title: Boggs Alone on Ballot
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 4Mr. Boggs will be the lone candidate on the ballot in Louisiana's Second Congressional District next Tuesday.

title: Preps
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I.Field ston completed its season today by defeating St. Paul's, 146. Fieldston squared its record at 44. St. Paul's is 25. Bryari Morse, a halfback, rushed for 88 yards and connected Pete Roberts on 38yard pass play for a touchdown.

title: Alabama 5814 Victor
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Nov 4 (AP)  Undefeated Alabama rolled to its eighth football victory today, crushing Mississippi State by 5814.

title: Orwell's freedoms
description: To the Editor:

title: M'GOVERN FORCES IN OHIO HOPEFUL
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 4In the face of devastating polls, a weary hope is nurtured in the McGovern field organization as Its workers do the thing they do bestgetting out the votes.

title: Battle for the White House
description: To the Editor:

title: An Old Staten Island Ferry, in Elegant New Dress, Goes to Sea for Nicaragua
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua An old Staten Island ferry has become something of an international ocean liner, plowing the waters between Nicaragua and El Salvador across Ceneral America's Gulf of Fonseca.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: F.D.A. Says Cycles And Team Sports Head Accident List
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration says that its first computerized survey of household and recreational accidents revealed that the, most frequent injuries involved team sports and bicycles.

title: HYPERTENSION DRIVE IS PLANNED BY W.H.O.
description: GENEVA, Nov. 4  The World Health Organization announced the setting up of pilot projects in 10 countries for the control of high blood pressure.

title: Boys'
description: PRINCETON  Many private boarding schools for boys in New Jersey are going coeducational and accepting day students to make ends meet in an era in which costs have skyrocketed and their popularity has declined.

title: What Wall Street Watches
description: One indication of Wall Street interest in particular issues is the prevalence of earnings estimates. As of Oct. II, for example, 19 of the several dozen brpkers reporting figures to the Institutional Brokers Estimate System had prepared estimates on International Business Machines and Honeywell.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Television
description: BECKY SHARP and Thackeray's Vanity Fair fade outand then, with a push of the button, we turn on Cousin Bette, Balzac's Vanity Fair. One week we were with the ambitious and scheming little English governess, against the background of the grandeur and glory and defeat of Napoleon; the next, we find ourselves in the aftermath, and in Francethe eagles tattered, the flags drooping, the glory tarnished, with Cousin Bette, a scheming, revengeful poor relation, and her glamorous ally the monstrous Valerie Marneffe  perhaps Balzac's greatest intriguante.

title: G.D.P. GRIP STRONG IN WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 4Republicans are Incumbents in every major contested office in Westchester County except one: the 24th District Congressional seat held by Ogden R. Reid, a rormer Republican running now as a Democrat for his sixth term.

title: SCHOOL FOOTBALL
description: Two pointaminute footteams will be meeting next Saturday afternoon in what is easily the highlights of the Nassau County High School football season thus far.

title: Education
description: Canarsie may be Harvey Scribner's Waterloo. Last week, for the second straight week, New York City School Chancellor Scribner was in hot water with the Board of Education for his handling of the controversy in Brooklyn's Canarsie section over the busing of black students across school district lines.

title: Swaps Is Destroyed; Horse of Year in 1956
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov, 4 (AP)Swaps, the winner of the Kentucky Derby in 1955, has been humanely destroyed at Spendthrift Farm here.

title: Paperbacks: one gulliver step
description: Why discriminate against children? Adults have paperbacks; it's about time that paperbacks for children flourish too. Finally in 1972 publishers are providing books for the young and very young, in quantity and quality as well. Some of the softcover volumes come in glowing color, with excellent reproduction like Dover's facsimiles of the first editions of Beatrix Potter's childsized nursery classics, The Tale of Peter Rabbit ($1) and The Tale of Squirrel Nutkin ($1).

title: Buses in Scranton Operate Again Under New System
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Nov. 4 (AP)  Buses began rolling again this week in Scranton and its suburbs, under the operation of the County Lackawanna Transit System.

title: Mazda Coming to the East
description: Mazda passenger cars, the only rotaryengine vehicles sold in the United States to date, will become available to East Coast customers beginning Dec. 1. The 1973 models are currently being shown at the Greater New York Automobile Show.

title: Francis Kelly Voigt Fiance Of Miss Elizabeth A. Black
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Nov. 4  Mr. and Mrs. Norman H.Hayes of Haverford, the Isles of Capri, Fla., and Ocean City, N. J., have made known the engagement of Mrs. Hayes's daughter, Miss Elizabeth Anschutz Black, to Francis Kelly Voigt. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jacob Joseph Voigt Jr. of Longport, N. J.

title: Auto Show Opens Here As Mayor Cuts Ribbon
description: The first Greater New York Automobile Show was opened yesterday by Mayor Lindsay, who cut a ceremonial ribbon and then toured the three floors of exhibits at the New York Coliseum.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Florence in Winter: An Alien Wind and Alien, Lonely Women
