description: FLORENCEOur idea of Italy is that of a fairyland eternally in bloom, soft with an indulgent sun and caressing breezes. But reality has a way of deflating our most durable illusions: Italy has its winters too, cold and rainy and often afflicted with long sunless spells.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: 76ers Drop 12th in Row
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 4 (AP)Pete Maravich scored a seasonhigh 44 points, including 14 in a decisive third quarter, as the Atlanta Hawks handed the Philadelphia 76ers their 12th straight defeat, 128120, tonight.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: 5 U.S. PHYSICIANS SET TO VISIT HANOI
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4North Vietnam has invited the Senate Judiciary Subcommittee on Refugees to send a medical group to study immediate and longterm relief needs.

title: EARLY W.VA. DRIVE DOWNS PITT, 3820
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 4 (AP)Kerry Marbury ran for three touchdowns and Bernie Galiffa passed to Nate Stephens for two to lead West Virginia to a 3820 victory over Pittsburgh today.

title: Some heirs of the robber barons
description: Almost forty years have passed since the first publication of Matthew Josephson's The Robber Barons, and it remains the standard popular text on the American capitalists of the era after the Civil War. That book's extraordinarily persistent freshness and immediacy derives, I think, chiefly from its author's strong ambivalence toward his subjects  on the one hand, his rational liberal conviction that the Vanderbilts, Fricks, Goulds and Morgans were predatory creatures stealing American resources while destroying the American dream of innocence, and on the other, what appeared to be his sneaking suspicion that they were also grand, portentous figures, beyond moral appraisal, in the first act of a huge historical drama.

title: Battle for the White House
description: To the Editor:

title: A DIRE FORECAST GIVEN ON TRANSIT
description: PARIS, Nov. 4In West Germany they're planning the Hochleistungsschnellbahn, a Cshaped magnetic suspension landtransport system that will run the length of the country from Hamburg to Munich, with passengers swooshing along at speeds of better than 250 miles an hour. It will make oneday round trips possible between most of Germany's major cities.

title: Early Roslyn Harbor History Is Chronicled in a New Book
description: ROSLYH HARBOR, L.I.To people who do not live in around Hempstead Harbor, Roslyn, Roslyn Estates, Roslyn Heights and Roslyn Harbor probably sound like the same places. But now one of these villages has attained a measure of literary distinction, for Roslyn Harbor's historian has just turned out the official chronicle of the village.

title: A Guide to What's New in Utility Vehicles
description: DETROIT  In the middle of the boom in the lighttruck market, versatile, funtodrive, fourwheel utility vehicles are changing buyers' minds about the kind of second or third car they should own.

title: Italian Foods Fill Waldwick Shop
description: WALDWICKThe pungent aroma of imported Provolone is mixed with the spicy fragrance of simmering meatballs and stuffed peppers, This is the Italian Riviera, a haven for anyone who craves authentic Italian products.

title: The warp and the Woof
description: There are a lot of good things in Lynn Hall's books. Her true settings are full of the noise and clatter and color of moving figures. She has a sharp way with the easy (and uneasy) emotional connections among these figures. The anxieties of her adolescent characters become the reader's anxieties, andwhat is rarestshe has an understanding of dumb beasts. In LYNN HALL'S DOG STORIES (Follett. $4.95), the last of course counts most.

title: $2.7Million Spent By Oct. 16 in State In Congress Races
description: New York State Congressional candidates have spent more than $2.7million of $3.1million in reported contributions and loans through Oct. 16, according to new reports tallied by Common Cause, the national citizens' lobby.

title: If You Go See Paris by Metro for $1.50
description: AS any underground boulevardier knows, the best way to get to see Paris is by Metro. Not only do you save money by taking the subway; you save time as well since you avoid traffic jams. Outlined below is an itinerary that lets a tourist do a tremendous amount of sightseeing in a single day at a total transportation cost of about $1.50.

title: Keri Richardson Fiancee
description: FLORAL PARK, Nov. 4Miss Keri. Trina Richardson, a Queens College graduate and New York public school teacher, and Lawrence Bradley Koslow, a student at New York University, plan to be married. Mr. and Mrs. Edward Richardson have announced the engagement of their daughter to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Koslow Of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: G.O.P. in Suffolk Hopes to Give Nixon Biggest Plurality in U.S.
description: YAPHANK, L.I., Nov. 4 The Republican party in Suffolk County is heading into Election Day on Tuesday with one purpose in mindfor the second time giving President Nixon the largest plurality of any county in the United States and sweeping every local political contest in the bargain.

title: ExAddicts Aid Tenafly Band
description: A group of former drug addicts in New York City, many of them still in the process of rehabilitation, have launched a drive to raise funds so that students of a high school band in Tenafly can entertain at the Rose Bowl on New Year's Day in California.

title: AMERICAN MOTORS
description: DETROITRichard A. Teague, vice president for styling at the American Motors Corporation, says we have spent 40 per cent of our time this year working on bumpers for the new cars.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEMAt 7:45 A.M. last Monday, just 24 hours after Arab terrorists hijacked a Lufthansa airliner in Beirut, Israeli jet fighters pounded four guerrilla installations on the outskirts of Damascus.

title: Fire Destroys French Dock
description: MARTIGUES, France, Nov. 4 (AP)Explosions today aboard a vessel., loading fuel in this petroleum port caused a fire that destroyed the loading dock, but firemen prevented the blaze from reaching the rest of the installations, Two men were slightly injured, the police reported.

title: Ballot Poses 3 Questions for the Voters
description: TRENTON  The conviction of Secretary of State Paul J. Sherwin focused attention on a somewhat obscure public question on the Nov. 7 ballot in New Jersey.

title: East Carolina Romps, 337
description: GREENVILLE, N. C. Nov. 4 (AP)The East Carolina Pirates unleased a powerful offense and ripped TennesseeChattanooga, 337, in a homecoming football game today. The Pirates registered their seventh victory against one loss.

title: Man, 35, Shot Sitting in Car
description: A 35yearold man was shot fatally yesterday while sitting in his sixyearold car in the High Bridge section of the Bronx. The victim, Mario Pineda of 114 Elliot Place, the Bronx, a Cuban national, was shot in the head at close range while his car was parked at West 170th Street and Cromwell Avenue. He was found at 4:45 A.M. and had about $8 on his person.

title: Social Announcements
description: Weddings

title: Blacks in Queens Show Sharp Rise in Income
description: Black families in Queens improved their income status so much in the last decade that by 1970 their median income of $9,850 was, for the first time, higher than the citywide median for all of New York's two million families.

title: Brooklyn College Expands
description: After a 35year sabbatical, Brooklyn College officiallyreturned to downtown Brooklyn with the dedication of its downtown campus last Friday.

title: U.S. WIDENS LEAD IN JAPAN TOURNEY
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 4 (UPI) The United States neared its second straight victory over Japan by taking a 33stroke lead after 36 holes in the 54hole professional golf match.

title: Suffolk Is Planning a Comprehensive Study of Water Resources on the South Fork
description: SOUTHAMPTON., L.I.The South Fork, which needs water to keep its agricultural and resort industries alive, will be, the subject of a longterm, comprehensive Study of its water resources.

title: Heston Leads Drake, 199
description: DES MOINES, Nov. 4 (UPI)Jerry Heston of Drake turned two recovered fumbles into touchdowns today to break the school's career scoring record and lead the Bulldogs to a 199 victory over Southern Illinois. Heston tied and then broke the record of Johnny Bright, set in 1951, with his 40th and 41st career touchdowns. Heston is only 639 yards shy of Bright's career rushing mark of 3,134 yards.

title: Underneath the Tire Treads
description: AKRON, OhioHere in the tire capital of the world, it's what's inside that counts.produce it. It's Detroit, not Akron, that sets the tire pace.

title: College Outlives a Dog, Gets Bequest of $5,000
description: NORTON. Mass., Nov. 4 (AP)  Wheaton College has received a bequest of more than $5,000 from the estate of a dog.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Preps
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Nov. 4Jim DiCalagero, a sophomore from Astoria, Queens, accounted for all of McBurney's points today in a 2814 victory over Long Island Lutheran. DiCalagero ran for a touchdown and conversion, passed for a conversion and threw passes that produced touchdowns on 22, 18 and 49yard plays, the victory was the third for McBurney in five games.

title: Preps
description: ANDOVER, Mass., Nov. 4Tim Whelan ran for 119 yards of the 220 that Andover gained on the ground today in leading his team to a 14.6 victory over the Williams freshmen. Whelan scored on a 14yard run as Andover evened its record alter six games.

title: Canarsie School Crisis Expected To Kart Democratic Incumbent
description: A political spillover from the Canarsie school controversy is cutting into the reelection chances of a twoterm Democratic Assemblyman in an area that has normally voted overwhelmingly Democratic.

title: Headliners
description: The Mayor of Jersey City, Paul T. Jordan, was frank to admit he had a problem: Dirty streets. Last week he sought some help in that paragon of pristine pavements, New York Cityfrom that selfproclaimed streetcleanliness freak, John Lindsay. He had come to City Hall, said Mr. Jordan, to tap the expertise New York City has in its scientific approach to cleaning streets. Mayor Lindsay seemed willing to be tapped.

title: William Carson, 87, Dead; A Grandson of Kit Carson
description: ALAMOSA, Colo., Nov. 4 (AP)  William Thomas Carson, grandson of Kit Carson, the famous Indian scout and explorer, died yesterday at a nursing home here. He was 87 years old.

title: Gorky, a Totally Good Man
description: MAXIM GORKY, whose drama, Enemies, written in 1906, will have its first New York performance on Thursday, was something rare among famous authors. He was a totally good man. His goodness cannot be accounted for except by the genius of his character, for he had good reason to adopt the pen name Maxim GorkyMaxim The Bitter. His real name was Alexei Maximovitch Peshkov. Born in 1868, Gorky lost his father when he was four and was then abandoned by his mother. He had the hardest possible upbringing by a despotic grandfather, and was nomadic laborer and tramp from the age of 10 until published his first story at 24.

title: Gaebner Is Upset
description: ABERAVON, Wales, Nov. 4 (AP)Clark Graebner of New York, playing what he called the worst match of my career, was upset by West Germany's. Juergen Fassbender, 60, 62, in the final of the third Dewar1 Cup indoor tennis tournament today.

title: B52's and Fighters Rake North Vietnam Below 20th Parallel
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Nov. 5 The United States command reported today that B52's dropped at least 2,000 tons of explosives on North Vietnam in the 24hour period ending yesterday morning.

title: HighSpeed Boats to Wall St. Planned
description: ATLANTIC HIGHLANDS,The longclosed back door between New Jersey and New Yorkwatermight be reopened soon if a company planning a highspeed boat commutation service between Wall Street and the Jersey shore has its way.

title: BetTime Music
description: If bids are settled in time, New York's offtrack bettors will be able to do their Christmas wagering to the pipedin strains of Jingle Bells.

title: Living With the Law on Women's Jobs
description: When Sharon Kirkman told her mother last summer that she was leaving her job as a personnel manager at American Express to set up a consulting company specializing in affirmative action programs for women, her mother responded dubiously to the ponderous phrase.

title: Waldheim Cites Invitation
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 4  Secretary General Kurt Waldheim has been asked by all the parties to lake, part in whatever Vietnam peace conference will be held.

title: Houston Tops Florida State
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 4 (AP)  Houston's quarterback, D. C. Nobles, passed for one touchdown and set up two others with his running today as the Cougars defeated Florida. State, 3127.

title: Allende Summons Cabinet in Attempt To Check Strikes
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 4 (UPI)  President Salvador Allende Gossens met for the first time today with his new civilianmilitary Cabinet to draft solutions to the antiGovernment strikes that have crippled the nation's economy for almost a month. The talks were described as optimistic.

title: Kathleen Blee, Robert Ashe Jr. Plan Marriage
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 4Dr. and Mrs. Myron Roy Blee have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathleen. Marie Blee, to Robert Lawrence Ashe Jr., a lawyer with the Atlanta firm of Kilpatrick, Cody, Rogers, McClatchey & Regenstein. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lawrence Ashe of Knoxville, Tenn., and Hobe Sound.

title: Wagner Rallies to Defeat Springfield on Pass, 2117
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 4 (AP)Andy Uske hit Greg Lindsey with a 40yard touchdown strike early in the fourth quarter today as Wagner scored a 2117 victory over Springfield.

title: RAIL GRANT STUDY BY U.S. IS SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Two land reform groups and at least 13 members of Congress are asking the Department of the Interior to investigate possible violations in the terms of Federal land grants issued to railroads in the last half of the 19th century.

title: In Suburbia, 3 Cars May Not Be Enough
description: WARREN, Mich.  At a quarter to 7 every workday morning, Walter Bochenek heads his green Dodge Polara onto the highway for the sevenmile, 30minute trip to the General Cold Storage Warehouse Company in Detroit. At 7:30, he starts his job as a produce checker.

title: Lindsay Moves to Assure Peace After School Boycott
description: Mayor Lindsay, convinced that the worst threats of racial violence in the Canarsie school crisis have been contained, initiated a behindthescenes effort yesterday to minimize the chances of clashes anions school children when they finally return to school.

title: Counterplan Is Denied
description: SAIGON, Nov. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)The South Vietnamese foreign ministry today strongly denied a foreign news agency report that President Thieu had presented a counter peace proposal.

title: Lance Dow to Marry Miss Ritchie Davis
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 4 Mr. and Mrs. Charles C. Davis Jr. of Princeton have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ritchie Davis, to Lance Merrill Dow. He Is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip N. Dow of. Winchester, N.H., both of whom are retired educators.

title: Disappearance of Rep. Begich Becomes Issue in Alaska Vote
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 4The disappearance of Representative Nick Begich of Alaska aboard a light plane with Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana, the House majority leader, has developed into an election issue in the last days of the campaign.

title: New York Tech Overcomes State Maritime Team, 34.0
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 4  Steve Szewczuk scored three times and Rick Lapp twice in leading New York Tech to a 340 rout of the New York State Maritime eleven today.

title: JobCreation Is Called Big Challenge in Asia
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4 (AP)Asia's labor force, expected to exceed a billion persons by 1980, will create serious problems for developing countries already plagued by serious unemployment, an Indian economist has warned.

title: 8 Nations to Get Results On TV From Satellites
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  Eight nations interested in the American election results have reserved satellite television coverage time for next week, the Communications Satellite Corporation says.

title: R. M. Scherzer Weds Claudia Neuhauser
description: BALDWIN, L. I., Nov. 4Miss Claudia Beth Neuhauser, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Neuhauser of Merrick, was married tonight to Robert M. Scherzer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph M. Scherzer of Wantagh. Rabbis A. David Arzt and Bernard Cohen officiated at the South Baldwin Jewish Center.

title: New characters: caring, needing, dreaming, abusing
description: Sinning With Annie and Other Stories is a finely written collection about the comeuppance of the mildly ruthless, those nasties who abuse people to get what they want only to find no joy in their prize. Paul Theroux shows them wheeling and dealing through Africa, India and Russia, but wherever they are and whatever they win, they fall into a down. For their nastiness always breeds guilt, and the fight for their great goody always leaves them sickish. Their success is muted by remorse; their remorse is dampened by the impulse to do it again. Theroux's talent is for this middle grayness, for the mellowest anxiety and the thinnest vibrations of evil.

title: TEAMSTER OFFICIAL ACQUITTED IN TEXAS
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)jury found Edward Grady Partin of Baton Rouge, La., an official of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, not guilty today of charges of obstructing justice in an earlier trial in Baton Rouge.

title: MISS BLALOCK GAINS TIE FOR LEAD AT 141
description: APOPKA, Fla., Nov. 4 (AP)Jane Blalock got birdies on four of the final six holes today to gain a tie with Betty Burfeindt for the secondround lead in the $30,000 Lady Errol Golf Classic here.

title: REFORM UNIT FEARS PRISONS MAY ERUPT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  An independent committee concerned with penal reform has called some of the nation's prisons hotbeds ready to erupt into strikes and possible riots.

title: Lawford Has Cyst Surgery
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 4 (UPI) Peter Lawford, former brotherinlaw of President Kennedy, underwent four and onehalf hours of abdominal surgery for a pancreatic cyst today and was placed in an intensive care unit in fair condition, his doctors reported. The 49yearold actor was operated on at U.C.L.A. Medical Center, where tests showed the cyst to be benign.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Movies
description: THEY'RE ornery, they march to their own special beat, they have the look of being made exactly as their creators wanted to make them, they're moody and experimental, if they're sometimes precious they always have real temperament behind them, and if they're sometimes derivative they always indicate flair for (if you'll forgive me) the syntax of films.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Duke Gets 2014 Victory As Ga. Tech Rally Fails
description: DURHAM, N. C., Nov. 4 (AP)  A sophomore quarterback, Mark Johnson, scored two touchdowns as Duke's Blue Devils held on to defeat Georgia Tech's football team, 2014, today before a crowd of 37,300.

title: ...and Mechanics on Wheels
description: DETROIT  An automobile tuneup company, in business to make house calls, has stated a national franchise system.

title: MOROCCAN PARTIES REBUFF THE KING
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 4A new effort by King Hassan II to enlist political support appeared to have collapsed today.

title: 1973 Car Forecast: Record Sales For Detroit's Big 4
description: THE first introduCtory automobile show to be held here in the fall in 32 years opened yesterday for a nineday run at the New York Coliseum.

title: The World
description: The generation of antagonism between the two Germanys has been drawing to a close in recent months, and last week brought a dramatic new sign of the thaw in the heart of Central Europe.

title: The Eskimos of Anaktuvuk Have a Hotel, But They Don't Have a Word for It
description: THERE is no word for hotel in the language of the Inupiat Eskimos of northern Alaska, and so the place to stay in the village of Anaktuvuk Pass, north of the Arctic Circle, is called AimagvikHome. By any name it is not likely to appear in a hotel guide.

title: Suffolk DuckFarms Acting on Pollution
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I. Under pressure from both state and county environmental protection agencies, 21 of Long Island's duck farms have taken steps to meet enforced standards in cleaning up the effluent discharged into streams and creeks.Operating under 90day provisional permits, that expire on Nov. 20, most of the affected farms have shown considerable improvement, according to Sam Bleecker, information officer and community relations officer of the State Commision for Environmental Conservation.

title: Vandals Alarm McGovern Workers
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 4Repeated vandalism against local McGovern headquarters in Westchester and dozens of reports of abusive latenight telephone calls made in the name of McGovern workers have angered and alarmed workers in the campaign for the Democratic candidate here.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISForeign policy, and national security together are the Number One issue in U,S..Presidential elections. This originally became true in 1920 when the paramount question was membership in the League of Nations.

title: LAFAYETTE DOWNS GETTYSBURG, 3925
description: EASTON, Pa., Nov. 4Lafayette exploded for three touchdowns within five minutes midway through the third period today and held on to beat Gettysburg, 3925.

title: Children's Books Fall 1972
description: People who care about book illustrations have known for some time that one of the best illustrators to be found is Nancy Ekholm Burkert. Though she's chiefly known for her work on Hans Christian Andersen's The Fir Tree and The Nightingale and Edward Lear's The Scroobious Pip, she also produced firstrate pictures for Meindert DeJong's The Big Goose and the Little White Duck, Natalie Savage Carlson's JeanClaude's Island, John Updike's A Child's Calendar and Roald Dahl's James and the Giant Peach. But her new book is her masterpiece.

title: If it has to be chicken again
description: Improving on a cliche

title: TORTURE  CASE IN NATO WEIGHED
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 4  After hearing a week of chilling testimony about an incident that took place in November, 1971, during North Atlantic Treaty Organization maneuvers in Belgium, a military tribunal in Liege is now trying to decide when training to resist torture becomes torture itself.

title: Convertin a VW Into a MiniRolls
description: Andres Castillo owns a bright orange 1972 Volkswagen Beetle. But when he drives his car around New York City, people often think he has a RollsRoyce. Mr. Castillo has a MiniRolls, a hybrid made from a standard Volkswagen Beetle and a custom front end that bears a striking resemblance to the impressive RollsRoyce grillc.

title: 2 Youths Who Killed Ponies To Clean Stables for a Year
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4 (AP) Two youths found guilty in the stoning deaths of two ponies were ordered yesterday to clean Fairmont Park Stables on Sundays for a year.

title: CHRYSLER
description: DETROIT  Special attention is being paid to Chrysler's Satellite and Charger models this year to make them fit the changing mood of the intermediate car buyer. Extensive changes in front styling and a new effort in the area of quality improvement are features of all 1973 models of the No. 3 auto maker.

title: New characters: caring, needing, dreaming, abusing
description: What are writers made of? Why theyre put together from the fantasies of butchers and newsboys, the dream of long afternoons in bed with lusty women, and the yearning of businessmen to think about art. Norman Rosten's Over and Out is a light, funny novel about a writer as neighborhood hero, a local banker of fantasy with whom storekeepers deposit their dreams of freedom and demand, fearful their investment might fail, Why arent you smiling?

title: The World
description: Last Friday, Salvador Allende Gossens marked his second anniversary in the Presidency of Chile. But there was no fanfare. Since Oct. 11 the Latin American nation has been buffeted by strikes, street demonstrations and bombings of power installations and railroad tracks. The strike wave was begun by truck owners to protest the creation of a transport authority seen by them as a step toward nationalization of the trucking industry. Shopkeepers, lawyers, teachers, farmers and airline pilots joined the walkouts. The labor unrest has crippled Chile's economy, already suffering from inflation, insufficient production and lack of foreign reserves.

title: FREE THROW BY SUNS TOPS BUCKS, 105104
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 4 (UPI)Connie Hawkins of Phoenix, sank a free throw with nine seconds left tonight to offset a scoring spurt by the Milwaukee guard, Wally Jones, and enable the Suns to beat the Bucks, 105104.

title: For Rent: A Student Chef Who Cooks Chinese Food
description: NEW BRUNSWICKA 24yearold graduate student of Chinese history at Rutgers University moonlights at what he calls his great love Chinese cooking. He rents himself out as a party chef.

title: Admirals and Generals To Study Race Problem
description: PATRICK AIR FORCE BASE, Fla. Nov. 4 (AP)In Sanuary, all United States admirals and generars will begin attending in Defense Department race relations seminars that have sprung up since racial brawls at American military bases at home and abroad.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Many influential members of Congress who are running for reelection this year without significant opposition have nonetheless amassed sizable campaign treasuries.

title: ' Roma' -- The Faces Are Perhaps Too Familiar:Too Familiar 'Roma'?
description: "FELLINI'S ROMA," now at the Ziegfeld Theater, is properly titled: the city that Federico Fellini explores for almost two hours bears little resemblance to the real Rome. When Fellini takes his camera crew into the streets and reality threatens, the exuberant director does everything possible to destroy the illusion, as if such a thing would be impossibly poor form. Instead, the film is Fellini's free-flowing valentine to the Rome of his imagination, of his memory and especially of his movies. It's a testament to the unique properties of films, and a gigantic advertisement for himself."Fellini's Roma" is also incredibly lovely, yet after a while it's depressing. It's like watching a gallant old prince auction off the contents of his palazzoboth too cheaply and much too readily, since his creditors really aren't that desperate. As the extraordinary things are carried out and put on display, you recognize them with love, laughter and a good deal of shock.Item: Childhood (Fellini's, in Rimini), a period when the little Federico was terrorized by almost everything, but especially by his father, his teachers, the priests; when Fellini's Rome was a dream fed by slide lectures of Roman landmarks, and by visits to the Rimini movie theater ("Two adults, three children and one maid," his father tells the ticket seller), to see spectacles about Nero and Poppaea and moon-faced centurions who joined their Christian sweethearts down amongst the lions.Item: Whores (all sizes and shapes, but aging fat ones are the most plentiful) in two different whore houses, one poor, one expensive, both being elaborations on a little boy's guilt-ridden fantasies as recalled by the maestro, who now laughs at his old self, the old whores, the old times, with affection, irony, compassion and unflagging interest.Item: One midget. "See my tiny grandmother," a little girl says to the young Federico (Peter Gonzales) when he arrives at the strange Roman pensione in which he is to stay on his first visit. The girl opens a door and there, indeed, is a teeny-weeny old lady who is apparently used to being put on display.Item: Roman decadence (various forms). Most spectacular is an ecclesiastical fashion show (the high-point of a Roman princess's at-home for a dark-glasses-wearing cardinal), with the models (priests, nuns, bishops, cardinals) on roller skates, displaying habits made of lam, of mirrors and of more conventional cloth, in styles that suggest what might happen if Elizabeth Taylor suddenly became the Vatican's wardrobe mistress. The excesses are positively stunning.Item: Roman food and table manners. An extended sequence that recalls the friendliness, robustness and sheer grossness of Roman appetites. This time they are the appetites of the lower orders.Item: A recollection of the old music halls that Fellini remembers from the early days of World War IIuncertain refuges for third-rate talents on their way up, second-rate talents on their way down, and audiences for whom rudeness is the highest form of self-expression.And so it goes in a movie that is one part travelogue, two parts memoire, and all fantasy.The film includes one of the most vivid and mad sequences Fellini has ever shot, a rush-hour ride into Rome on a rainy evening undertaken by Fellini and his cameramen, one of whom is perched on a camera boom that swoops down into the traffic and then high into the air, observing, always observing as we observe it, dressed in a pink plastic rain shield that looks like a prop from "Juliet of the Spirits," in jams of pushcarts, Fiats, trucks and busses. We catch sight of a dog run over and forgotten, of a political demonstration, of a terrifying too-muchness of everything that must eventually bring Rome, the world and Fellini to a halt."Roma," is as free as any film Fellini has made, including "The Clowns," which, next to this new film, looks like a model of disciplined joy. "Roma" is free, all right, but it's not free in the way of quick sketches and exercises made for some future work, although I have a feeling Fellini has something like that in mind. Perhaps a new form of cinema journalism. Everything in "Roma" too easily recalls things already seen, Fellini films already made. Somewhere or another, they all are there in "Roma"including "Variety Lights," "La Strada," "Cabiria," "La Dolce Vita," "8," "Toby Dammit" and "Satyricon."Fellini, like all good directors, has a limited number of concerns to which he returns repeatedly, with variations. If you admire his earlier films, as I do, and care about the talent that made them, it's a little sad to see him spending so much time and effort in "Roma," not re-exploring those concerns, but simply recycling them, along with camera shots and faces.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Music: Sorting Cage's Earliest Charms
description: The second of this season's Prospective Encounters presented by the New York Philharmonic at New York University's Loeb Student Center, on Friday night, was a 5050 affair. The good half came first. Three pieces by John Cage were played in honor of his 60th bifthday on Sept. 5. They were, fortunately, drawn from the early 1940's, when the composer had not ventured into the wilder reaches of his experimentation and when whimsy and humor were still saving graces of his music.

title: Missouri Triumphs, 31.14
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., Nov. 4 (AP)  Sixteenth ranked Missouri defeated Kansas State, 3114, in a Big Eight conference football game today.

title: Flooded Library Gets Books
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Nov. 4 (AP)Princeton University has donated 250 duplicate books to help replenish the Wilkes College library, whose collection was depleted by the flooding Susquehanna River in June.

title: A New Resource for Europe
description: Discoveries of oil in the North Sea have touched off an exploration race that is creating new jobs and new economic opportunities in the two ports closest to the oil fieldsAberdeen, Scotland, and Stavanger, Norway. New York Times correspondent Michael Stern visited both cities and filed these reports.

title: Miss. Jane S. Kahn To Become Bride
description: WOODMERE, L. I., Nov. 4 Miss Jane Susan Kahn and Harvey N. Cohen, who attended the University of Hartford, have become engaged. Mr. and Mrs. Ade Kahn of Woodmere and Ogunquit, Me., have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Cohen of Scotch Plains, N. J., formerly of Franklin Square.

title: SEVENTH AVE.
description: An upsurge in the sale of women's coats has brought joy to the hearts of retailers and to manufacturers on Seventh Avenue.

title: New characters: caring, needing, dreaming, abusing
description: Robert Kotlowitz's Somewhere Else is a first novel of tense, dry brilliance, remarkable for the immensity of its scope and the individual power of its characters. Against a background of Europe sliding toward the Great War, the rise of Zionist groups and the rumblings of revolution in Russia, Kotlowitz weaves a powerful tale of Jewish life. Through portraits of one family and its friends rabbis, revolutionaries, Zionists and tradesmenhe achieves a passionate album of people who embody what he sees at the center of orthodoxy or revolution. For Kotlowitz goes after essences; his portraits are vivid, pure psychopictures, renderings of souls alive in belief and bitterness.

title: Falling Dominoes
description: It is ironic that at a time when the Administration claims to be bringing to a successful conclusion a war that was supposed to forestall the progressive toppling of free governments in Asia, freedom is in fact falling in two Asian nations closely allied to the United States. The falling dominoes are the Philippines and Korea, where the assault on freedom comes not from any external source nor even from internal. Communist subversion, but rather from two individual leaders who have long received American material and moral supportPresidents Ferdinand E. Marcos in Manila.and Park Chung Hee in Seoul.

title: RECORD VOTE SEEN IN ROCKLAND AREA
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Nov. 4Rockland County political leaders anticipate a record vote Tuesday, with 120,421 registered voters, compared with 99,217, an increase of almost 22 per cent over last year.

title: State Senator Stewart and Two Held in Altercation With Police
description: State Senator Waldaba Stewart, who represents the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, was arrested last night after a dispute with patrolmen over the ticketing of a campaign truck doubleparked outside Mr. Stewart's Better Government Democratic Club at 725 Franklin Avenue.

title: Mets Name Thomson To Board of Directors
description: James K. Thomson has been named to the board of directors of the New York Mets. M. Donald Grant, board chairman, said the 50yearold Thomson would maintain his functions as business manager and a vice president, a post he was elevated to in September of 1964.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: One of the more significant results of the recent meeting of the board of governors of the International Monetary Fund in Washington is the fact that henceforth the developing countries will participate in the negotiations leading to new world monetary system.

title: Briton Back From Peking
description: LONDON, Nov. 4 (Reuters) The British Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, returned today from his first visit to Peking where he had talks with Chinese leaders on major international problems, including Vietnam and BritishChinese relations.

title: Barbara Saslaw Is Fiancee of C. P. Dixon
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Nov. 4The engagement of Miss Barbara Saslaw to Christopher Palmer Dixon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Cook Dixon of Riverside, Conn., has been announced the the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. M. Robert Saslaw of Poughkeepsie. A wedding in January is planned.

title: Brockport Wins, 70
description: MILTON, Mass., Nov. 4 (AP) Bob Tasullo capped an 88yard iourth period scoring drive, today by scoring from the one as Broskport State Curry, 70.

title: Brownsville Pupils Plan Solidarity Day Absence
description: Brownsville children involved in the Canarsie school dispute will stay away from school tomorrow for Black Solidarity Day, the Rev. Wilbert B. Miller, who has been shepherding the group, said yesterday.

title: Depending on Others for Minerals
description: Interdependence among nations is commonly viewed in terms of dependence of poor countries on rich ones. And so it is with capital and technology. But with minerals, dependence of rich countries on poor ones is far greater and increasing year by year.

title: Science Panel Says SST's Could Endanger Earth
description: Fears expressed last year that exhaust from supersonic transports might seriously deplete the ozone that protects life on earth from ultraviolet radiation are a legitimate cause for concern, according to a panel of scientists appointed by the National Research Council.

title: Preps
description: EAST ROCKAWAY, L.I. Nov. 4East Rockaway allowed Fordham Prep a first period touchdown and then bottled up the Little Rams's strong ground game and posted a 30,6 victory in a Metropolitan Football League game.

title: Jo Yerger Is Wed To Barry Stobbs
description: The marriage of Miss Jo Yerger to Barry Stobbs, director of the Brussels office of the J. Walter Thompson Company, took place yesterday in Paris. The Rev. Edwin H. Tuller performed the Protestant ceremony in the American Church.

title: Indian Fact
description: One of the ironies of the present literary vogue of the American Indian is that so few Indians themselves are creative participants. Young militants will say that this is only a continuation of a white man's ripoff that has gone on during the last four centuries. Whether this be true or not, there is no denying that there are hundreds of American Indians who can tell of their past and present with far more originality than most of the nonIndian authors who wrote the bulk of this season's crop of books for young readers. And anyone who has seen examples of American Indian art is aware that 12yearold Indians can produce illustrations as good or better than those found in most current juvenile books about them. This is not to put down the nonfiction books of the season. Several are excellent; a few are superb. Yet it would seem that at least a dozen or so retellings could have been replaced with lively Indian books written and illustrated by Indians themselves.

title: Art
description: ITS single room is so small that there Is always a temptation to leave exhibitions in China House Gallery unreviewed, especially exhibitions like the current one, Wintry Forests, Old Trees, which is best savored in quiet and, if not alone, at least not in a crown. With nobody else around, the gallery's size is a great advantage, bringing the visitor as close as he can get, in a public exhibition of precious objects protected behind glass, to the ideal intimacy of the proper way to see Chinese painting.

title: 2 Slaying Victims Found on a California Ranch Left Georgia for Life With West Coast Motorcycle Cultists
description: FRENCH CAMP, Calif., Nov. 4 (AP)Thomas (Big Tom) Shull and Charley Baker were motorcycle partners.

title: OBSTACLE IMPEDES REILICH, A VIOLIST
description: Joseph Reilich is a violist of extensive orchestral and solo experience. Perhaps the mishap with his instrument that delayed his concert in Carnegie Recital Hall Friday night for a half hour unsettled him, since intonational difficulties were a plaguing factor throughout the evening.

title: Religion
description: At first glance it looks like just another underground newspaper. Called the Hollywood Free Paper, it is freewheeling, garish and full of cartoons. There's even a headline demanding Release the Prisoners.

title: Spirit of Dance Solo Permeates Action On Westbeth Stage
description: Choreographers' solos, like painters' sketches, often have an intimate immediacy that their other works do not. Often their freshness and unadorned simplicity of observation are strongly appealing. At the opening of the Exchange Theater on Friday evening in Westbeth, Rudy Perez and Dan Wagoner offered two wellrealized solos.

title: Jean de Yturbe Fiance Of Alexandra Bemberg
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward P. Bemberg of Paris and Buenos Aires, formerly of New York, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alexandra Bemberg, to Jean de Yturbe, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles de Yturbe of Chateau d'Anet, EureetLoir, France.

title: Queens Symphony Orchestra Starts 20th Season
description: There was a gala banquet, in Flushing Meadow a couple of weeks ago, and there were toasts and speeches, and there was even an official proclamation from the Borough President's office, cornplete with greeting, hereby,. therefore and four whereas's. What it all meant is that there will be fine music in Queens again this yearin the schools, in the hospitals, in the concert auditoriumsas the Queens Symphony Orchestra heads proudly into its 20th anniversary season.

title: Cooking With Children
description: Way back in the days before children's cookbooks (and those were the days of my youth) we turned to Fannie Farmer when we wanted to make Welsh rarebit. My mother always preferred Version II with ale or lager beer, which was daring indeed, and to be spoken of only in whispers in case father might discover what was in that delicious gooey cheesy mess. For fudge, molasses candy, popovers, pancakes, and baking powder biscuits, Fannie again was our guide. It never occurred to us that we should be using a book geared to our age group. And now, anticipating Christmas 1972, I am looking at 10 cookbooks for children, each unique, of course, and ranging in price from seventyfive cents to $6.95.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4The 50th Ward precinct captains greeted the neighborhood people arriving for Candidate's Night with handshakes and pats on the back and smiled and applauded politely as a succession of officeseekers recited the litany of Democratic heroes Republican perfidies and the farnilial bonds of the Cook County Organization.

title: Dance
description: IT is said of Sol Hurok that he can walk into a theater, look at the price of his ticket, the size of the house and instantly estimate the (note this) weekly gross. I cannot. Indeed if I could I would perhaps be in a more profitable if less rewarding undertaking. However, with nothing of Hurok's legendary expertise, it does occur to my virginly commercial mind that the City Center American Dance Marathon at the ANTA Theater is doing better than anyone might have guessed.

title: Jimsonweed's Use Stirs New Mexico
description: ROSWELL, N. M., Nov. 4The sudden rise in use by teenagers in this southeastern New Mexico city of highly toxic jimsonweed seeds as a hallucinationproducing drug has reached such proportions that the State Environmental Improvement Agency has issued an urgent appeal to parents to tell their children of the weed's possible disastrous consequences.

title: Glimmer of Light for Consumers
description: WASHINGTON  Virginia H. Knauer, special assistant to the President for consumer affairs, sees a glimmer of light at the end of the tunnel for motorists frustrated by unreliable automobile service.

title: Mary Oliver Married
description: Miss Mary Catherine Oliver and Dr. William Michael Walsh were married yesterday afternoon in St. Anselm's Roman Catholic Church in Brooklyn by the Rev. James Ferris. The parents of the bride are Dr. and Mrs. William A. Oliver of Brooklyn. Her father is a physician. Dr. Walsh is the son of Mrs. Charles Walsh, also of Brooklyn, and the late Mr. Walsh.

title: Manhattan Triumphs, 207; Smith Passes for 3 Scores
description: Manhattan College defeated Brooklyn College, 207, in a football game played yesterday at Gaelic Park.

title: Preps
description: DEERFIELD, Mass., Nov. 4Paul LaRochelle ran for two touchdowns and Tom Lincoln ran for one today as Deerfield defeated Worcester Academy, 2012 in a heavy rainstorm. Deerfield is 221 while Worcester dropped to 33. PU Agate

title: Sandra Bannister Betrothed to Raymond Dolan Jr.
description: PELHAM, N. Y., Nov. 4Mrs. Vanderbilt Bannister has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Sandra Leigh Bannister, to Raymond Leo Dolan Jr., son of Mrs. Dolan of Scituate, Mass., and the late Mr. Dolan. A February wedding is planned.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: EVANSTON, III., Nov. 4 (AP)In a final preelection fling to dramatize rising food costs, 100 proGeorge McGovern housewives opened a shop on a downtown street today and within a few hours sold 108 cases of a variety of staples at 1969 prices. The food was advertised for sale at McGovern's prices.

title: Paris Hotel Pact Signed
description: PARIS, Nov. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)Japan airlines signed an agreement yesterday with Semea, the Parisian company, for construction of a large hotel on the Left Bank. The hotel, on the Quai de Grenelle, will have 32 floors and 784 rooms. It is due to open in March, 1976. Air France is to have a share in the hotel.

title: ...And Baby Grand Makes 3
description: THE one thing that irritates Jean and Kenneth Wentworth more than anything else is to be told by an impresario that We don't have two pianos. The reason is simple. They have been specializing for a long time in playing duets on one piano. They not only prefer duets to twopiano music; they also know how hard it is at times to get one decent piano, let alone two, for a concert. They think they are making it easier for others. Yet, when they send out correspondence and promotional matter that clearly says they play on one piano, along come replies regretting that two are not available.

title: INDIANA IS BEATEN BY MICHIGAN 217
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Nov. 4 (UPI)Dennis Franklin, Michigan's slick sophomore quarterback, ran for two touchdowns today in piloting the fifthranked and unbeaten Wolverines to a 217 victory over Indiana.

title: Warriors Win, 127104, To End Knick Streak at 8
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 4 (UPI)The Golden State Warriors hit on 15 of 18 shots in the final quarter tonight, scoring 47 points in the period, en route to a 127104 rout of the New York Knicks in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Jersey Central Freight Derailment Wrecks Station
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Nov. 4A section of a Jersey Central freight train derailed in the heart of the city this afternoon, crashing through a passenger station and injuring two persons.

title: Bridgeport Lifts Streak to 18 By Routing Southern Conn.
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 4 (AP)Bridgeport exploded for five secondhalf touchdowns tonight on the passing of Roy Ferreira and the running of Ron Mason to rout Southern Connecticut, 4210.

title: Architecture
description: THE sharp sense of nostalgia, the sense, even, of something a bit rundownattheheels that hovers over two recentlyopened exhibitions  a show of drawings by Niles Spencer, the American Precisionist painter, at the Washburn Gallery, 830 Madison Avenue, and an exhibition of drawings by American artists dating from the twenties and thirties, at the Weyhe Gallery, 794 Madison Avenue is, in its peculiar way, one of the most poignantly effective features of the pair of exhibitions. Neither show is intended to be definitive, which is all the more reason, I suspect, that one has the feeling of catching an authentic glimpse of the perioda period of bright hopes and uneven accomplishments in American art  and a sense of coming across the artists in question on one of their average days.

title: Westchester; Unbeaten Scarsdale Routs Port Chester, Gains Title
description: Undefeated Scarsdale beat Port Chester, 50.0, at Port Chester, winning for the seventh time this season, and taking the Westchester Interscholastic Athletic Conference B Division championship.

title: Cortland State Wins, 149
description: CORTLAND, N. Y.. Nov. 4 (AP)Mark Hinsch threw two scoring passes to Gary Theobold as Cortland State fought to a 149 victory today over Edinboro State on a rain drenched field.

title: Medicine
description: Sickle cell anemia has become the new Cinderella disease. Of little national concern a decade ago, the blood ailment  which primarily affects blacksis the target of a broadranging attack underwritten by Congress with a $115million authorization. Now, however, the program itself is under attack on political, medical and racial grounds. Two examples:

title: RUFUS S. TUCKER
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., Nov. 4Rufus S. Tucker, an economist with the General Motors Corporation for 27 years, died in a nursing home today. He was 81 years old and lived at 1568 Lamberts Mill Road.

title: North Stars Down Hawks On 15Second Spree, 53
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 4 (AP)Dennis Hextall and Bill Goldsworthy scored thirdperiod goalseach their second of the game15 seconds apart to power the Minnesota North Stars to a 53 victory over the Chicago Black Hawks tonight.

title: Clifford Dufton Weds Rosemary Edgar
description: Miss Rosemary Ethel Edgar and Clifford Driver Dufton were married yesterday noon in the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine (Episcopal). The Rev. Howard Stowe performed the ceremony.

title: Randy NewmanOut of Cole Porter, Hoagy Carmichael, Bob Dylan, Groucho Marx, Mark Twain, and Randy Newman
description: I've been around the world Had my pick of any girl You'd think I'd be happy But I'm not

title: Air Bag Testing Starts in 5 Cities
description: The first Government testing under real driving conditions of the controversial automobile safety air cushion system began this fall at five branches of the General Services Administration around the country.

title: IRISH CASE SIFTED BY EUROPE GROUP
description: STRASBOURG, France, Nov. 4  The European Commission on Human. Rights is working hard behind the scenes to bring about a friendly settlement of the case of the Irish Republic versus Britain.

title: Law
description: Twice the case had been appealed. Twice the Federal judge in Lexington, Ky., had refused to heed the suggestion of the appeals courtthat the fiveyear sentence meted out to the draft resister be reduced. Finally, last June, on the third time round, the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit took upon itself a power that no Federal appellate court has exercised in almost a century. It reduced the sentence, an action that seems likely to open an important new ground for appeal.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  Despite the continued talk about peace last week, movement toward that elusive goal was almost imperceptible. Polemics were heavy, with Hanoi accusing President Nixon of vile deception and Mr. Nixon telling his aides he would not be tricked or treated into rushing into Hanoi's Oct. 31 signing deadline  which, as a result, passed without an agreement.

title: Connecticut
description: Greenwich remained on top of the Fairfield County's West Division with a 146 victory over defending champion Stamford yesterday.

title: The Spirit of Christmas
description: PICTURED above and below are scenes that Linda Layman feels reflects the Christmas spirit. They comprise a strip of ten 1972 Christmas Seals that the 24yearold Boston artist designed, and which go on sale this week in support of a matter of life and breath, the good health effort of the Tuberculosis and Respiratory Disease Association. The strip is repeated 10 times in sheets of 100 produced by lithography by Berlin Lithographing Company and Edwards and Deutsch Lithographing Company, both of Chicago; Eureka Specialty Printing Company, Scranton, Pa.; Fleming Potter Company, Peoria, Ill., and Western Lithographing Company, Los Angeles. An initial representing the printer may be found in the 56th seal, the sixth seal from the left in the sixth row. The seals, on sale everywhere in the country, may also be obtained from Tuberculosis and Respiratory Disease Association, 15 East 26th Street, New York, N. Y. 10010, for a contribution (make it more than a dollar) that will help the association's efforts.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) Lieut. (jg.) David Eisenhower has returned to Washington on leave from Navy duty in the Mediterranean Sea so that he can spend the last days of the election campaign with the Nixon family. The White House announced return today, although President Nixon's soninlaw arrived Thursday night by commercial airliner from Greece, where his ship, the Albany, is in port.

title: Nebraska Drubs Colorado, 3310
description: BOULDER, Colo., Nov, 4 Johnny Rodgers and his quarterback, Dave Humm, ran for yard touchdowns and cornbilled on an 11yard pass today! to carry thirdranked Nebraska! to a 3310 Big Eight victory. over Colorado.

title: Discoveries Off Scotland Bring Aberdeen New Jobs
description: ABERDEEN, ScotlandIt takes a lot to put a smile on the granite face of this city, but oil has done it.

title: Family Health Care Unit To Be Built in Brooklyn
description: The city's Municipal Service Administration has awarded contracts for the construction of the neighborhood family care center, in the East New York section of Brooklyn. The center will be built on Pitkin Avenue between Pennsylvania and New Jersey Avenues.

title: SCHOOL FOOTBALL
description: LIVINGSTON, N. J., Nov. 4 Bob Taratko, a I7yearold Morristown high school footbal player, died yesterday after being injured in a game against. Livingston at the Livingston High School field. He was pronounced dead at St. Barnabas Hospital, Livingston.

title: Battle for the White House
description: To the Editor:

title: 4 STATES TO VOTE ON PROPERTY TAX
description: Voters in four states  California, Colorado, Michigan and Oregon  will be asked Tuesday to approve constitutional amendments that would kill or sharply limit the property tax as a source of funds for public education.

title: Bullets Sink Cavaliers
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Nov. 4 (UPI)Elvin Hayes tallied 15 of his 19 points in the second half, pulled down 19 rebounds and blocked six shots as the Baltimore Bullets pulled away from the Cleveland Cavaliers in the fourth quarter for a 10898 victory tonight.

title: Soviet Is Transporting Forage on an Emergency Basis
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4The Soviet Union's Agriculture Minister acknowledged today that we are having certain difficulties in providing forage for livestock in regions that suffered particularly from a disastrous harvest this year.

title: California Snaps Streak
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 4 (UPI)  Vince Ferragamo, a freshman quarterback, threw two touchdown passes and directed California to three other scores today as the Golden Bears snapped a sixgame losing streak with a 3112 victory over Oregon.

title: Handicrafts
description: As matteroffactly as a recipe calls for salt, the instructions in these craft books call for a vise, awl, center punch, coping saw, needlenose pliers, chisel, rasp and/or canvas stretcher. But if he or she has access to a wellequipped workshop any 10yearold with a minimum of parental help can produce toys (jumping jacks, tumbling men, pecking birds whirligigs) and folkcraft objects (colonial lanthorn, a cornhusk doll), that will be worth the outlay of effort, time and equipment.

title: Snowballs Fly at Game, 15 Hurt, 37 Arrested
description: BOULDER. Colo., Nov. 4 (AP) A snowballthrowing incident during the third quarter of the Nebraska Colorado football game today resulted in injuries to 15 persons and 37 arrests.

title: Bergen's Catholics Hold Jesus Week
description: ENGLEWOOD  Several hundred people participated here and in Rutherford in Jesus Week, a parish mission for spiritual renewal at St. Cecilia's Roman Catho lic Church.

title: 1973 Is the Year Of Almost Bumpers
description: DETROIT  The bumpers on the 1973 automobiles led to calling the model year the year of the bumper. It isn't quite.

title: Susan Hadley Fiancee
description: RYE, N.Y., Nov. 4Miss Susan Hadley and John Meade Richey Jr. plan to be married in December. Dr. Richard B. Hadley, an otolaryngologist, and Mrs. Hadley have announced the engagement of their daughter to the son of Mrs. C. Buff Scott of Rye and Mr. Richey of Vero Beach, Fla.

title: COLGATE TRIUMPHS OVER LEHIGH, 4234
description: HAMILTON, N. Y., Nov. 4 (AP)Mark van Eegan scored a pair of firstperiod touchdowns and started Colgate to a 42.34 victory over Lehigh today.

title: A Question of Values
description: On Tuesday, the American voter will have the clearcut choice between two different sets of values to guide the United States during the next four years.

title: Woman Politician Enjoys Both Roles
description: PHILLIPSBURG  When Gloria Decker was elected chairman of the Warren County Democratic party last month, she did not attribute her success to the women's liberation movement. Rather, she said the other day, it was just that if one does a good job, advancement should be expected.

title: Wisconsin 1614 Victor
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 4 (AP) Wisconsin, stopped inches short of a touchdown with 5:08 to play today, was handed a 2point safety three plays later when Dave Harris of Iowa fell down in his own end zone, and the Badgers then hung on for a 1614 Big Ten football victory.

title: Photography
description: IN some few rare cases a body of creative work is not primarily a statement of esthetic sensibility or an intellectual feat of strength or a sermon or anything abstractable and removed, but rather the naked manisfestation of the artist's own moral code in action.

title: CONCERNS IN EAST FIGHT COAST PLAN
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 4 Nearly $1million, some of it from big Eastern corporations, has been contributed to defeat a ballot proposition that would establish new controls on the development of California's 1,072mile coast line.

title: Architecture
description: WHEN officials dynamited PruittIgoe Houses in St. Louis this year, they finally blasted the subject of housing design into the public consciousness. It took the violent and necessary act of destruction of part of a public housing project that had become an obscenity of American life to make it clear that we have been doing something awfully wrong.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  If George McGovern wins the Presidency on Tuesday, there isn't a pollster, reporter or pundit worth asking why. For their evidence and analyses and instincts raise not even the murmur of a doubt that the 1972 campaign will be recorded as a Nixon triumph or a McGovern disaster or some combination of the two. Indeed, it seems safe to predict that if McGovern wins, it will be largely because about 9million Americans, in one great glorious fit of pique at the polls and pUndits, will decide in the hours that remain to vote against the political experts and for the doctrine of the Unfathomable Voter. Not bloody likely that, but bloody embarrassing for sure if it were  ever  to occur.

title: SCHOOL FOOTBALL
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Nov. 4Cary Rosoff, a 190pound end for Bethpage's undefeated team, uontinued today to prove as talented with a football as he is with a pencil.

title: Local
description: Evander Childs, Far Rockaway and Jefferson gained the semifinal round of the Public Schools Athletic League championship playoffs yesterday. Brooklyn Tech had previously clinched a berth.

title: NIXON DENOUNCED 011 AFRICA POLICY
description: Senator George McGovern's study group on Africa policy has accused the Nixon Administration of conducting African American relations in such a way as to bring about a repetition of the Vietnam experience.

title: Beloved Maude Adams
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: $20.80 GrafittiWins Ladies Stake Here
description: Grafitti etched her name on the oldest stakes race for fillies and mares in the country when she won the Ladies Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: BLAZERS DOWNED BY WHALERS, 84
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)The New England Whalers exploded for five goals in the second period, two in the last frantic 90 seconds, and Went on to an 84 victory over the Philadelphia Blazers in a fightfilled World Hockey Association game today.

title: Recordings
description: THE new Tristans, Rigolettos, Normas and Carmens are on the turntable horizon, demanding full attention and a place in the cabinet right up there with their familiar brothers and sisters, each gaudily and jealously equipped with the most dazzling names in the contemporary operatic firmament. Welcome, and yes, there is always room, both in the ear and on the shelf. But what about the more modest and definitely more singular recording proposals? A quartet of recent releases, exploring less traveled eighteenth, nineteenth and twentiethcentury byways reminds that a different breed of enjoyment and curiosity needs servicing too.

title: Son to Mrs. Goldberg
description: MORGANVILLE, N.J., Nov. 4A son was born Oct. 6 to Mr. and Mrs. Terry H. Goldberg in the Freehold Area Hospital

title: To Be Young, Gifted and Ben
description: THE secondnight curtain has come down and Ben Vereen, the black dynamo who steams and swaggers and struts his way to stardom in the pip of a musical called Pippin, stands, flannelrobed and weary, in his dressing room.

title: Core of Vietcong Surviving War
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov., 4Despite years of fighting that have largely shattered the Vietcong guerrillas, the Communists in South Vietnam have managed to preserve the core of their political apparatus with what many wellinformed Vietnamese and American officials believe to be a dedicated cadre of 40,000 to 60,000.

title: The World
description: VIENTIANE  If progress toward peace in Laos were to be measured in terms of the tangible results of the past three weeks of negotiations here, it would seem unreasonable to expect a Laotian ceasefire any time in the next decade.

title: Columbia Defense Spurs 140 Victory Over Cornell Team
description: Columbia's football team, frustrated and disappointed after five games, finally put all its good qualities together in the second half of the sixth and scored a 140 victory over favored Cornell at Baker Field yesterday.

title: McGovern with tears
description: Everyone recognizes him now. The flat tones, the nasal voice, the hesitant smile, the restrained gestures, the earnest airif George McGovern is not quite as familiar as, say, a President or the most famous movie stars, it is not for want of public and television exposure or headline coverage.

title: Wankel Fever Is Now Widespread
description: DETROIT I think if they were available we could sell any number in the Vega. It is a wonderful, smooth engine. There are no two ways about it.

title: Atlanta Jury Links Brother of Mayor To the Underworld
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 4A grand jury exploring the activities of Atlanta's nightclubs has concluded that the Mayor's brother has apparently associated with elements of the underworld.

title: Patriots'
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., A pioneering effort to create linear, or green strip park in this urbanized center of Morris County is beginning to achieve reality after six years.

title: The Guest Word
description: Alfred Nobel never had anything but the best of intentions; what became of them is a different matter, and not entirely his fault. The annual literary championship promoted in his name is a case in point; there ispace Papa Hemingway and all the little Papassomething absurd about ranking writers like heavyweights. Yet now and then, like most absurdities, this one works in spite of itself. Given the odds against it, the Nobel Prize Committee has accomplished a miracle of sorts by honoring twice in recent memory men whose achievements are beyond dispute and whose moral stature is at one with their art.

title: Only Pigs Are Residents In Iowa Voting Precinct
description: AMES, Iowa, Nov. 4 (AP) There is no need for campaigning and voter registration drives in one precinct hereall the residents are pigs.

title: Kings Halt Celtics'
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)Nate Archibald, the National Basketball Association's leading scorer, scored 35 points and contributed 15 assists for the Kansas CityOmaha Kings as they snapped the Boston Celtics winning string at 10 games tonight, 118107. The Celtics had been undefeated since the Season began.

title: Nixon Hopeful on Vietnam But Concedes Pact Is Open
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Nov. 4President Nixon acknowledged today that there were some details still to be negotiated before a peace settlement could be struck in Vietnam. But he said he had full confidence that such a peace would be negotiated on the basis of honor and not surrender.

title: Natty Bumppo, We Need You
description: THE indignities suffered by some of the world's bestknown writers in the indelicate hands of posterity are saddening to contemplate. If James Fenimore Cooper could somehow see what is happening to the house of his young manhood in Westchester County he might reactivate his frontiersmanhero Natty Bumppo to draw a bead on posterity.

title: FORDHAM DOWNS GEORGETOWN, 148
description: The Fordham Rams came from behind with 1 minute 40 seconds left to beat the Hoyas of Georgetown, 148, yesterday before a homecoming crowd of 6,676 at Jack Coffey Field.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 What began as one man's prankish antidote to boredom  an occasional, impulsive toot on a police whistlehas now become one of the hallmarks of Vice President Agnew's reelection campaign.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: President Nixon and Senator George McGovern have declined to reply to a series of questions concerning American foreign policies for the next four years, according to Dr. Harry D. Gideonse, president of Freedom House, a nonpartisan national organization.

title: MAX SHAMAN, ACTIVE RADICAL
description: Max Shactman, who was active in the American radical movement 50 years as well as a writer, lecturer and organizer, died yesterday in Long Island Jewish Hospital. He was 68 yeasr old and lived at 121 Magnolia Street, Floral Park, L.I.

title: JAPANCHINA TIES WORRYING SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4The Soviet Union has been taking an Increasingly dim view of the reconciliation between Japan and China, from an initial reaction that was cautious and bland to a comprehensive analysis this week in the Government newspaper Izvestia suggesting that Japan risks becoming a pawn in Maoist power politics.

title: Patricia L. Alban Will Be Bride
description: Mrs. Billie Telfair Alban of New York and Guillermo Alban of Guayaquil, Ecuador, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Lynn Alban to Robert Abbe Shea, son of Dr. and Mrs. S. Hazen Shea of Washington. The couple plan to be married Nov. 25 in St. Margaret's Episcopal Church in Washington.

title: New &
description: Nor All Thy Tears

title: Giants Are Picked by
description: Never before have the New York Giants played the Denver Broncos, as they will this afternoon at 1 o'clock at Yankee Stadium, so for most followers Denver is something of a mystery team.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Tuberculosis deaths in the city declined last year at a somewhat sharper rate than in previous years, according to a report issued yesterday by the Health Services Administration. But the incidence of the disease and of death from it continued to concentrate in poverty neighborhoods.

title: The Talk of Secaucus
description: SECAUCUSNot long ago, motorists headed for the Lincoln Tunnel and New York had to drive down the main street of Secaucus with their car windows closed tightly to block out the stench from pig farms. Now, motorists use a threelane express highway a quarter of a mile north of the main street and the car windows are closed only to prevent drafts.

title: The Shavian Playground
description: Notwithstanding the London publisher, the Anglicized spelling and a jacket identifying Margery Morgan as a professor at Monash University (Australia), an English reviewer of The Shavian Playground has described the author as a fearless example of the best in American letters, polymathic in her references, armed to the teeth with categories which, although second Nietzsche to her stream of culture, are scarcely even Greek to us.... A very scholarly book, to the point of pedantry, suggests the Englishman. Ergo, it must be American.

title: Dr. Mathers Jr. Weds Anita Hasselstrom
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Nov. 4Miss Anita Sofia Hasselstrom, a staff nurse at the Presbyterian Hospital in New York, was married here this afternoon to Dr. James Alexander Lamond Mathers Jr., a medical interne at Roosevelt Hospital there. The Rev. Henry Powers performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Atonement.

title: Arbiters Aiding Home Buyers
description: RIVER EDGEConsumerism is coming to the homebuying field in Northern New Jersey.

title: Four more years? Learning to live with Nixon
description: Four more years. Of what? Germaine Greer claims Arthur Miller gave her the answer in Miami: If this man wins another term, the Supreme Court will be castrated, and The New York Times will be a single mimeographed page. Almost this Miller makes me a hardhat. He would no doubt have said the same kind of thing before the 1968 election; yet here is the same old Times, still very fat, like the rest of us. The apocalypse has better taste than to associate itself with American elections. Our party processes mash the. candidates in toward the middlea law best proved by those who try to defy it, like Senator McGovern. After denouncing the regulars in primaries and the convention, he was reduced to shameless capitulation by the end of his campaign; and even then he has been ineffectual. He started too far out from the perceived middle of things.

title: OnceFearful Parents Praise Huntington School
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I.  A group of mothers gathered recently to talh in a conference room at the Huntington elementary school, which opened last year in the heart of Huntington's urban renewal area. They talked about the fears and anxieties they had before the school opened, about their dismay over redistricting, their anger over having their children bused to the area. But mostly they talked about our school, a family feeling and the beautiful spirit we have.

title: Robert Beck to Marry Rosalind H. Chananau
description: Assemblyman Alexander Chananau of the Bronx, a Democrat who is ranking minority member of the State Assembly Ways and Means Committee. and Mrs. Chananau have announced the engagament of their daughter, Miss Rosalind H. Chananau, to Robert Beck, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kuba Beck of Poughkeepsie, N.Y. The wedding is planned for June.

title: Sailboat Leasing Business Thrives by Renting for Fractions of the Season
description: BALDWIN L. L Walter Haber, director of the Baldwin Public Library, and his wife, Barbara, a former school librarian, have found it cheaper to lease a sailboat than to own one or rent it on a daily basis.

title: The Nation
description: Frank Kelley, the Democratic candidate for the Senate in Michigan, feels like he's caught between a rock and a hard place. Busing is THE issue in the raceand he must win voters on both sides of the fence.

title: State Department Staff Unit Gets I.R.S. Exemption
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3  A group of State Department employes planning a lawsuit against the State Department has been granted full tax exemption as a charity by the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Fourth Infantry Division Epitomizes Problems of Transition to an AllVolunteer Force
description: FORT CARSON, Colo.In moving to an allvolunteer force next July 1, the Army hopes to transform a hierarchical, authoritarian institution into one that bids for manpower at market rates, works from 8 to 5 and trains on increasingly complicated weapons.

title: Queens Man Found Slain On a Street in St. Albans
description: A 23yearold Queens man was found dead at 194th Street and 111th Avenue, St. Albans, Queens, early yesterday with a bullet wound through the head. The victim, identified by the police as Alvin McSween of 19210 110th Road, St. Albans, was discovered at 4:45 A.M. by a passerby who notified the police.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: RAY BRYANT PLAYING THECOOKERY'S PIANO
description: Ray Bryant has been playing very capable jazz piano around New York since the mid1950's without managing to establish a clearly positive identity of his own. He is now at the Cookery, University Place and 8th Street, following in the footsteps of such pianists as Teddy Wilson, Mary Lou Williams, Eddie Heywood and Marian McPartland. Each of them has basked happily in that setting.

title: Views of Review
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Nixon and McGovern Are L. I. Issues
description: NIINEOLAThe main issues in local elections on Long Islana this year appear to be Senator George McGovern and gresident Nixon. Traditional local concerns, such as unemployment, transbortation and pollution have been overshadowed by the issues and personalities of the Presidential race.

title: Galoomphing along on the wings of Pegasus
description: Disney's Fantasia, the part with cute little horses flying over cute little Greek temples, impressed me so lastingly that to this day the word fantasy brings winged horses to my mind. Take the cuteness away, and the connection works. Fantasy is like Pegagus: You can soar on his back. But you must hold the golden bridle, given by Minerva, and that gift is artistry.

title: Mailbox:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Indian Fiction
description: The Apaches are really going to get a break in this one, announces a Hollywood producer in Elliott Arnold's new novel for young readers, THE SPIRIT OF COCHISE (Scribner's. $5.95). Although he is speaking of a film he hopes to make about the great Indian leader, he might have been commenting on the nature of the current deluge of books about Indian life for children and teenagers. Since Virgil took up his pen on behalf of the Trojans, few defeated peoples have received the kind of sympathetic fictional representation practiced in these volumes.

title: Caryn Seitz Affianced
description: WOODSIDE, L. I., Nov. 4Mr. and Mrs. Christian Seitz of Woodside have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Caryn Ellen Seitz, to Cadet Robert M. Gates, a secondclassman at the United States Military Academy. The prospective bridegroom is a son of Mrs. Marion Gates of Lemoyne, Pa., and Ray Gates of Mechanicsville, Pa. Miss Seitz is a junior at Queens College.

title: Preps
description: KENT. Conn. Nov. 4Hotchkiss extended its undefeated string to six games today when it edged Kent, 7.0, in a Berkshire League contest. Kent, which went undefeated last season, has won four of seven this year.

title: Hospital Volunteers Take on New Task
description: NEWARK  Volunteers put in close to 2.5 million hours of work last year in hospitals across the state, and there is every indication that the figure will be even higher this year.

title: Hofstra Mistakes Help Delaware State Win, 267
description: DOVER, Del., Nov. 4 (AP)Luther Howard, a defensive back, intercepted his 12th and 13th passes of the season today as Delaware State defeated Hofstra, 267.

title: A Major Topic on the Campaign Trail: How to Deal With Environment Problem
description: Our most important question is whether the Third District's voice in Washington will reflect the views of its citizens, and whether that voice will act decisively to protect the environmental and economic wellbeing of the MonmouthOcean area.

title: Crusaders Top Nordiques
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 4 (AP)H The Cleveland Crusaders scored' three goals in the final period to edge the Quebec Nordiques, 53, in a W.H.A. game tonight.

title: LONG RUN DECIDES
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 4  Bob Hines capped the best performance of his Army football career today by sweeping right end on a 49yard touchdown run with five minutes 53 seconds remaining to give the Cadets an exciting 1714 victory over the Air Force.

title: CIVIC GROUPS FEAR HEALTHAID LOSS
description: A Federal policy paper has caused five leading civic groups here to voice fear that the National Administration is about to abandon essential fiInancial support for neighbor. hood health centers and other health programs it has heretofore advocated.

title: Notes: Refund Pledge
description: THE list of things that can go wrong on a vacation is long enough to fill a guidebook. What the traveler has been led to expect and what he sometimes gets may not bear much resemblance. And, according to people in the travel business, he's getting more verbal about his gripes. A reflection of the consumers' gettough policy came in an announcement last week from a wholesale tour company. (Wholesale means that it sells travel arrangements to agents.) The company, Rocket Tours, said it had started a consumerprotection plan that guarantees refunds covering the cost of any tour component that is presented in a company brochure and not delivered. For example, if a package promised sightseeing and for some reason the sightseeing did not materialize, the client would be reimbursed for that missing component.

title: Marks's Late Field Goal Keeps F. and M. Unbeaten
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 4Craig Marks booted a 39yard field goal with six seconds to go to lift Franklin and Marshall to a 2422 victory over Moravian in a Middle Atlantic Conference football game today.

title: HARRIER TITLE WON BY BISHOP LOUGHLIN
description: Bishop Loughlin High upset Archbishop Molloy and captured the crosscountry championship of the Catholic High Schools Athletic League Brooklyn diocese yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: Stefanie M. Getnick Is Married
description: Miss Stefanie M. Getnick, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving M. Getnick of Freeport, L.I., was married here last night to Charles A. Spector, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Spector of Milwaukee, The ceremony was performed at Essex House by Rabbi Judah Nadich of the Park Avenue Synagogue, assisted by Cantor David J. Futterman,

title: Alma North Captures $61,150 Vineland Handicap, Surviving Foul Claim
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. (AP)East Acres Alma North drew away from Hobeau Farms Blessing Angelica at the top of the stretch today and won the $61,150 Vineland Handicap for fillies and mares at Garden State Park.

title: Utica Newspapers Name A New Executive Editor
description: UTICA, N. Y., Nov. 4 (AP)Herman E. Moecker, publisher of the Utica Newspapers, announced today that Gilbert P. Smith, 52 years old, would become executive editor of the two newspapers Jan. 1.

title: Television
description: PUBLIC television is being strangled by a financial crisis. That has been obvious for a good while. Somewhat leSs obvious, at least until recent months, is that public television also is being strangled by politics and politicians. And the two threats are directly related, as was dramatically demonstrated in June as President Nixon vetoed a twoyear authorization of $155million in funding for publicTV.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
