description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 The stricter, new campaign finance disclosure law in force for the last seven months of the 1972 Presidential campaign has demonstrated with more precision than ever before that few citizensperhaps 1 to 2 per cent of the eligible voterscontribute the money necessary to make the electoral process work.

title: Managers of Plants Are Fined by Soviet For Volga Pollution
description: KALININ, U.S.S.R., Oct. 30  The manager of a chemical fiber plant, long the worst air and water polluter in this Russian industrial city, conceded with an embarrassed smile that he was personally being fined from time to time for violating airquality standards.

title: Metro Limited
description: Much has been written about the ideal of metropolitan area government in this overwhelmingly metropolitan nationand almost as much about the suburban resistance that makes it so unattainable. A valuable product of the fading Scott Commission, which has been studying the problems of governing this city, is a task force report that proposes to approach metrolitanism not by a simple geopolitical spread but on a functionbyfunction basis.

title: MIDDIES TOPPLED BY NOIRE DAME
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4In defeat, Navy regained respectability in bigtime college football today.

title: CROSSCOUNTRY RUN. WON BY O'DONOGHUE
description: Tim O'Donoghue, a sophomore at Montclair State by way of County Kerry, Ireland, yesterday captured the individual title in the 20th annual Collegiate Track Conference cross country championships at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Soviet U.N. Aide Is Seized On Drunken Driving Charge
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 4A Soviet United Nations official was arrested here yesterday on charges of drunken driving. He had spent Thursday night in a policedetention cell.

title: Faulkner, Lost and Found
description: The 1933 Publishers' Trade List Annual carried a tentative advance announcement for the fall of 1933, by the then small and comparatively new firm of Random House, Inc., listing A new limited Edition of William Faulkner's The Sound and the Fury. It was to be printed by the Grabhorn Press and published in an edition of only 500 copies, signed by the author, who would also contribute an introduction.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: Will political developments significantly affect the direction or the momentum of the American economy in 1973 and beyond? That's the allencompassing question that businessmen, economists, investors and money managers are pondering in these final days of the Presidential election campaign.They are also wondering whenbut no longer whether a ceasefire agreement will finally be signed to stop the war in Southeast Asia.

title: The World
description: LONDONThe words were blunt. To the Catholics of Northern Ireland the British Government said there would be no unification with the Irish Republic without the consent of the majority population of Ulster. To the Protestants of Ulster the British said that concessions had to be made to meet Catholic demands for an effective voice and real influence.

title: Social Announcements
description: Bella and Charles, Your children loin, your family and friends In wishing you. a most deserving happy 27th wedding anniversary.

title: CITY WARNS OF LEAD IN EVAPORATED MILK
description: Significant amounts of lead have been found in leading brands of evaporated milk, according to the City Health Department.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew charged today that Senator George McGovern broke all existing records of political irresponsibility when he accused President Nixon of falsely raising hopes for peace as part of his reelection strategy.

title: Preps
description: EAST HAMPTON, Mass., Nov. 4Mike Aroney scored on touchdown runs in the first and third periods today and led WilbrahamMonson to victory over Williston, 120. Aroney scored on runs of 1 and 31 yards as Wilbraham won its fourth game against one loss. Williston dropped to 15.##############

title: Musts for the movie addict
description: Film enthusiasts will not want to pass up these two unusual reference works. From its beginnings early in the century, the cinema has been evolving into the most universal medium of entertainment, if not of art. Originating in the simple documentary and slapstick comedy, it has become the most culturepivoted form of selfexpression  hence as changeable as American society itself. Though Mr. R. H. E. Pickard's 1,000 films are listed alphabetically, rather than chronologically, it is not hard to seeflipping through the bookthe many changes that the movies have rung in the period between the starving Gold Rush Chaplin, cooking his shoes, to the dispossessed Midnight Cowboys roaming 42nd Street. The selections are broad, the synopses succinct, the credits thorough.

title: BIG SAIGON RALLY TO SUPPORT THIEU
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 4The South Vietnamese Government plans to sponsor a rally of 20,000 to 30,000 people in front of Saigon's City Hall tomorrow morning as part of Its campaign to demonstrate popular support for President Nguyen Van Thieu's tough stand against the latest proposed peace agreement.

title: the traveler's world
description: THERE are some things that are impossible of statistical proof, like an unequivocal prediction of Tuesday's election or my longheld theory of a causeandeffect relationship between a Presidential election and a moderate autumn slump in the travel business. However, by prodding oldtimers in the business and stirring up the memory convolutions In their brains and mine, we can generate evidence sufficient to support that theory if not establish it beyond a reasonable doubt.

title: Photography
description: AMODERATELY priced darkroom enlarger for 35mm and 126 negatives has just recently been introduced as part of the Paterson line distributed by Braun North America, 55 Cambridge Parkway, Cambridge, Mass. 02142. Called the Paterson 35, and selling for under $100 with lens, this new model is functionally designed with a chrome plated steel column that minimizes vibration, and a 15 by 16 inch white matte finish baseboard that has an overlaid metal surface so that it can be used with the company's magnetic corner pieces to make borderless prints without an easel.

title: Tasaday and privacy
description: To the Editor:

title: Middlebury, Paced by Pope, Overwhelms Norwich, 490
description: MIDDLEBURY, Vt., Nov. 4The Middlebury Panthers rolled to a 490 victory over Norwich today with a 28point third quarter. The nation's fourthleading s c or e r, Phil Pope, scored three touchdowns to bring his season's total to 100 points on runs of 5, 2 and 1 yards.

title: Gardens
description: The Greek word for saffron, krokos, gives these delightful spring flowers their name. Once crocus were wild flowers throughout the Mediterranean region. Now, they are a traditional part of the gardener's spring. Plant many of them in an open, sunny place where their wineglass shaped blooms of white, yellow or purple shades will easily be seen. Mixtures of colors for large plantings are less expensive than the named varieties. Though the spring flowering species are most popular, there are fallflowering forms. Plant bulbs four inches deep.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Among the reactions here to the latest international monetary flurries, this time involving the British pound and the Japanese yen, surprise is hardly in the forefront.

title: South Carolina Wins, 533
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Nov. 4 (AP) Independent South Carolina spotted Wake Forest a field goal, then went on to drub the A.C.C. visitors, 353, tonight.

title: Shooting of Girl, 12, Now Held by Police To Be an Accident
description: A 12yearold girl who was accidentally shot in the face during an argument over the renting of an apartment in a Lower East Side tenement was descrbed yesterday by doctors at Bellevue Hospital as in critical condition but expected to survive.

title: The high priestess of Bloomsbury
description: Generally regarded as a genius by those who knew her, Virginia Woolf has long suffered from both the uncritical adulation and the virulent antipathy that genius frequently inspires. Lost in the conflict between those who worship at the altar of her sensitivity and those who decry her as snobbish, desiccated and irrelevant is any substantial notion of who Virginia Woolf actually was. Quentin Bell brings an impressive set of intellectual and genetic credentials to the task of unraveling the enigma of the high priestess of Bloomsbury. As the son of Clive and Vanessa Bell and the nephew of Virginia, Bell would seem to be the most qualified person to reveal the facts of her life. An art critic of as much substance but certainly less influence than his father, he has previously written a Slim volume evaluating the Bloomsbury circle in which he grew up, and it was no surprise that Leonard Woolf, Virginia's husband, should have encouraged Bell to undertake the authorized biography. The results are in many ways startling.

title: Boston College Trounces Syracuse
description: NEWTON, Mass., Nov. 4 (AP)A sophomore, Mike Esposito, sprinted 52 and 28 yards for touchdowns and added another score with a leaping pass reception today in sparking Boston College to a 37.0 victory over Syracuse.

title: MuchDelayed Student Center Will Open at Queens College
description: After more than two years of delays, the College Union of Queens College will open tomorrow.

title: A Welcome for Ugandans
description: LONDON, Nov. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)The Archbishop of Canterbury, Dr. Michael Ramsel, yesterday took in a young Asian couple expelled from Uganda. The couple was installed in a cottage, repainted and expressly furnished for them, in the grounds of Lambeth Palace. A total of 22,017 British Asians, 11,326 of whom are living in camps, has now arrived in Britain from Uganda.

title: Variable Mortgage Rates
description: GENEVAWhile the American homeowner can expect his taxes to continue to rise, he can at least take solace in the fact that his payments for mortgage interest and principal will at least remain stable.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: MIZUKAIDO, Japan, Nov. 4 (AP)Brian Allin of Santa Barbara, Calif., the leader after the second round of the $48,701 Bridgestone golf tourntnent, shot a 71 today and was locked in a threeway tie for first after three rounds.

title: Kerr Off B'way
description: THE Chelsea Theater Center's Lady Day: A Musical Tragedy, completing its run at the Brooklyn Academy of Music this evening, is an overproduced and underdeveloped attempt to make some sort of sociological, if not dramatic, sense of the downhill career of Billie Holiday. Its first mistake is to sentimentalize the sociology, In the course of a Harlem amateur night which opens the proceedings at great length, we are prombed the story of a black, beautiful, unrecognized queen and what this country did to her.

title: Protest at Coney Island Hospital Only One of Facility's Problems
description: At Coney Island Hospital, the implantation of pacemakersthose electronic devices used to regulate heart beatsare made not in the sterile, protective environment of an operating room but in the Xray department.

title: News of Boating
description: The world championship offshore racing circuit winds up next Saturday with the 10th Hennessy Key West race off Florida with several things settled and several others not yet settled.

title: Brooklyn's Game Warden
description: In Brooklyn, it is uphill work to protect the fish and birds, to obstruct air and water polluters, and to prevent marine brigands from grabbing a dishonest dollar on the high seas off the Brooklyn coast. But this is what Len Lippman, an enforcement officer for the State Environmental Conservation Department, attempts to do.

title: COMMUNIST OFFICE FIREBOMBED HERE
description: A fire bomb was hurled against the Manhattan headquarters of the Communist Party, U.S.A., last night, splashing flaming liquid over its front door.

title: State Is Giving Aid To Hemophiliacs
description: WOODCLIFF LAKENew hope for hemophiliacs has been kindled by pioneer legislation enacted in Trenton that assigns, some of the financial burden for patient care to the state.

title: YOUNG TEAM LEADS IN BRIDGE FINALS
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 4Youth held an advantage against experience in the early stages of the international bridge final playoff match that began here last night.

title: Center in Newark Cares for Children Under 2
description: NEWARK The door of the Newark Day Center Nursery opens at 7 A.M., but mothers leading toddlers by the hand often start gathering outside even earlier.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) The United States population will pass 210 million on Election Day, with 140 million people eligible to vote, the Commerce Department said today. On Tuesday the census population clock, a device that automatically keeps track of changes in the population, will show 210,002,963, the departnent said.

title: MINERS CRITICIZE U.S. MONITORING
description: CLARKSBURG, W. Va., Nov. 3With four weeks remaining before the courtordered election for the presidency of the United Mine Workers, both sides are expressing criticism of the Department of Labor's monitorship.

title: An instant cure for mental illness
description: Two years ago Arthur Janov, a California psychologist, published The Primal Scream, subtitled Primal Therapy: The Cure for Neurosis. The success of this book and its successor The Anatomy of Mental Illness, together with extensive clinical experience, has served to confirm Janov in his belief that he has discovered both the cause of neurosis and psychosis and also the only way of curing them. His theory of mental illness, which must by now be familiar to thousands of people, is attractive in its simplicity.

title: OLYMPIC GROUP: TOWER OF BABEL
description: The United Staten Olympic Committee, which meets here tomorrow to nominate a new slate of officers, faces serious problems in preparing for the 1976 games in Montreal.

title: Leafs Win as Keon Excels
description: TORONTO, Nov. 4 (UPI)Dave Keon continued his splendid play by scoring a pair of goals as the Toronto Maple Leafs downed the St. Louis Blues, 42, tonight.

title: Nassau North
description: Levittown Division eliminated Jericho from the North Shore Division III race yesterday when it turned in a 306 victory on the running of Kurt Watkins.

title: U.S.I.A. Employe Wins 72 Rockefeller Award
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 4 Barbara M. White, a career minister for information do the United States Information Agency, was named today the first recipient of the 1972 Rockefeller Public Service Awards.

title: Big Sur Braces For More Mud Slides in the Wake of Forest Fire
description: BIG SUR, Calif., Nov. 3Up here where Highway 1 leaves the ocean's edge, it is the mountains that dominate. They are huge, powerful mountains, a part of the remote and rugged Santa Lucia range.

title: Housing Stirs Perth Amboy
description: PERTH AMBOY  The plight of a family of nine that has been living in the back room of a church for more than a month has aroused the city's sizable Spanishspeaking population and focused public attention on a critical housing shortage.

title: Preps
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. T., Nov. 4Brain Cressey scored on a 71yard pass play on the first play from scrimmage today and Locust Valley Friends went on to defeat Dalton, 188, completing an undefeated season. Mike O'Brien, who threw the pass to Cressey, later caught a scoring pass from Vince Mazzeo, a quarterback.

title: School Drivers Test Defensive Driving
description: TRENTON  Fifty five schoolbus drivers took part in Freehold last week in the first of this school year's defensivedriving courses. By June, about 1,900 drivers will have completed the fourweek, eighthour program, which has been alloted $7,000 jointly by the state and Federal governments.

title: Blue Hill Avenue
description: Vaudeville, the narrator calls his tale. A variety show sure enough, played along Boston's Blue Hill Avenue, around the rackabones Jewish ghetto of Dorchester. Oddments from the Talmud, from the Psalms and Proverbs, play games with gossip and bad dreams. To shanghai a conceit from Mark Mirsky's first novelThou Worm Jacobjunk, seen just the right way, can be worth a lot when the times are bad. Like Druckman the Dreckman of that earlier Blue Hill Avenue novel, Mirsky will poke at almost anything with his long stick. But Mirsky knows just what he's looking for.

title: Sadness; By Donald Barthelme. 183 pp. New York: Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $5.95.
description: A highly selfconscious writer, Donald Barthelme indicated in the first story of his first collection both his main artistic strategy and the crucial question it raises. In Florence Green Is 81 (in Come Back, Dr. Caligari) the narrator muses, I am free associating, brilliantly, brilliantly, to put you into the problem. Or for fear of boring you: which?

title: UnionMiddlesex
description: Westfield used its alert defense to score two touchdowns in the third quarter yesterday and come from behind for an 1814 victory over Montclair in, Westfield, which tied the New Jersey record for unbeaten streaks.

title: Political Script in Texas Familiar, but Johnson Stays in Wings
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 4In 1968, Texas was supposed to go Republican. President Johnson took the stump in his home state to campaign for Democrats, and Texas stayed Democratic.

title: CARL F. BRANDIS
description: ORANGEBURG, N. Y., Nov. 4Carl F. Brandis, a sports deskman for The Daily News in New York, was killed here last night in an automobile accident on the Palisades Interstate Parkway. He was 62 years old and lived in New City.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: News of the Rialto
description: PETER USTINOV, the protean Englishman who occasionally puts pen to paper and tongue in cheek, is at it again. He's putting together a play he calls Who's Who in Hell and Alexander H. Cohen, who presented Ustinov's last two pieces in New York, is thinking that he'll get the latest on either in New York or London before the season is out.

title: The World
description: PARISThe Eiffel Tower grows rusty. Helas! And now, it seems, France is no longer the world's capital of sex but just one more suburb.

title: CHANGES ASKED FOR LAW SCHOOLS
description: A study of the way American lawyers are educated, sponsored by the Carnegie Commission on Higher Education, calls for broad diversification to reflect the growing heterogeneity of the legal profession and the increasing demands of a changing society.

title: Queens Program for Aged Gets $133,000 State Grant
description: The Community Service Society of New York has been awarded a state grant of $133,000 to help establish a program of comprehensive services for the elderly in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Live bombs and dud people
description: Frederick Forsyth's first novel, The Day of the Jackal, about an attempted assassination of de Gaulle, received and deserved a good deal of praise for being suspenseful. Forsyth was able to make a prospective event that could no longer occur (de Gaulle had died well before the book appeared) seem exciting through purely mechanical means: the compounding of some actual political fact and the intricate, authentic details of the Jackal's patient pursuit. Forsyth achieved this excitement despite the lameness and hokiness that took over the book whenever he forsook his false passports, disguises and concealed rifle parts to dabble in dialogue and intimate behavior.

title: Tulane Beats Kentucky
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 4 (AP) Steve Foley's passing punched some life into Tulane's listless offense tonight and the Green Wave broke a threegame losing streak with an 187 homecoming victory over eKntucky.

title: Dear Voter: Your taxes are going up (no matter who wins on Tuesday)
description: If you were running for President, you wouldn't make a lot of speeches telling the voters that Federal taxes are almost certain to go up during your Administration. It is hardly surprising that neither President Nixon nor Senator McGovern admits any intention of raising the tax burden of the average citizen. But the plain fact is that, no matter who wins the election, an increase in Federal taxes is a virtual certainty. The real question is not whether Federal taxes will go up, but which taxes and how much.

title: Penn Rally Trips Harvard, 38 to 27
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., NON. 4  Penn tumbled Harvard from the Ivy League unbeaten ranks today, 3827, in scoring more points against the Crimson than any previous Quaker aggregation since the rivalry began in 1381.

title: GROUP MAY SIT OUT TAIWAN ELECTIONS
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 4A group of 50 prospective independent candidates for legislative office is considering boycotting the Dec. 23 elections unless the Government of President Chiang Kaishek removes some restrictions on campaigning and permits the group to station pollwatchers at every election precinct.

title: Flyers Down Sabres, 53
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4 (AP)1 Bill Barber scored his first! National Hockey League goal and added three assists as the Philadelphia Flyers defeated the Buffalo Sabres, 53, tonight.

title: 2 Youths Who Killed Ponies To Clean Stables for a Year
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4 (AP) Two youths found guilty in the stoning deaths of two ponies were ordered yesterday to clean Fairmont Park Stables on Sundays for a year.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Big city retailers, who in recent years have been following large numbers of their customers to the suburbs by opening branches in outlying shopping centers, are giving Close attention these days to their downtown flagship Operations.

title: Voter Suit Fails in Ohio
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 4 (UPI)Federal District Judge Frank J. Battisti dismissed yesterday a suit asking for a threehour extension of voting hours throughout Ohio next Tuesday. The suit, filed by supporters of the Democratic Presidential nominee, Senator George McGovern, contended that the additional hours were necessary to handle 750,000 new voters.

title: Sergeant Names Freed P.O.W. as One of Those Involved in Unauthorized Bombing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Sgt. Lonnie D. Franks disclosed today that a former prisoner of war recently released by Hanoi was among the Air Force officers he has named in courtmartial charges stemming from the unauthorized bombing of North Vietnam.

title: The Automobile As Sex Object: Erotica on Wheels
description: DETROIT  In 1909, an Italian named Filippo Tommaso Marinetti wrote an essay called The Futurist Manifesto, in which he described machines as artistic objects and gave automobiles sexual connotations.

title: 3 ARE FOUND GUILTY IN MAJOR DRUG CASE
description: Three members of what authorities described as a major heroin ring were convicted early yesterday after a jury trial in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: Views of Review
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Fight Over Marburger Poses a Threat to Cahill
description: TRENTONThe highly controversial renomination of Dr. Carl L. Marburger as State Commissioner of Education is threatening to become a divisive and politically potent issue in this month's legislative session and in next year's gubernatorial election campaign.

title: With 2 Minutes to Spare, Police Defuse Pipe Bomb
description: A 6inchlong pipe bomb, atCached to a clock and set to go off at 9 o'clock yesterday morning was defused two minutes before by the Police Department bomb section in Brooklyn's gaSt New York section.

title: Community Service Unit Sees A Fight on Abortion Law in '73
description: New York's liberalized abortion law will come under strong attack again in the 1973 State Legislature, according to a study prepared for the Community Service Society of New York, the city's oldest private social agency.

title: D. B. Stewart Fiance of Susan Tremble
description: HAWORTH, N. J., Nov. 4 Mr. and Mrs. Roland S. Tremble have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Clark Tremble, to Donald Bruce Stewart, son of Dr. and Mrs. George Stewart of Norfolk, Neb., and Sarasota, Fla. The wedding is planned for summer.

title: The quaternary marriage
description: Most psychiatrists, therapists and counselors who deal as I do with the devastating effects of contemporary society upon marriage and the family are aware of the limited help they can providesometimes hardly more than first aid. Will the patient survive? We don't know. We don't even know if we ourselves can.

title: CANUCKS WALLOP ISLANDERS BY 72
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 4 (AP)There was a cold wind that blew in on the New York Islanders last night. It almost blew them right off the ice of the Pacific Coliseum.

title: Sharks Beat Cougars
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4 (AP)Jim Neikamp, a defenseman, who tied the game in regulation play late in the third period, fired 30foot slap shot for a goal to give the Los Angeles Sharks 32 W.H.A. victory over the Chicago Cougars today in overtime.

title: The President Nobody Knows
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass.For a while it looked as though President Nixon would follow Franklin Roosevelt's standard campaign tactic. In each of his three reelection campaigns F.D.R. delayed outright electioneering until middle or late October.

title: Yellow River Not Fully Tamed by 20Year Effort
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 4There are a hundred calamities in the Yellow River is an old Chinese saying and, despite 20 years of preventive effort involving millions of workers and a capital investment of nearly $2billion, the Chinese Government has not fully tamed the river.

title: Where the Big Trout Still Rise to the Dry Fly
description: IN New Zealand In 1911 the Honorable Percy Thelluson of Great Britain posed cockily for the camera, as era, as fishermen are wont to do, his day's catch strewn before him on the shores of Lake Taupo. According to meticulous historical accounts, the total weight of his catch that day was nearly 1,000 pounds.

title: Four competitors in the shadow of the Oxford Companion
description: These four volumes, a sort of Who's Who and What's What of letters, had to be spottested rather than properly reviewed. To make the project even less orthodox, I enlisted Philip Miller for the volume on English literature, Richard Goldstone for its twin on American writers, Joseph Wohlberg for the classical material and John D. Yohannan for the Oriental authors and tastetested the European Section myself.

title: Mrs. Dorothy Eyre Is Married To Hickman Price Jr. in Florida
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 4Mrs. Dorothy Hurt Eyre, widow of Edgar Ainsworth Eyre, was married at her home here this afternoon to Hickman Price Jr., a former assistant Secretary of Commerce.

title: Outlook on Pollution
description: DETROITYes, there are cars that can pass the 1975 Federal emission standards. The cars stand in laboratories, are carefully tended by engineers and are run under ideal conditions.

title: Incumbent Republicans in House Races Basing Bids on Total Support of Nixon
description: The effect that the present economic situation is having on the people of the Sixth Congressional District in New Jersey is a prime concern in this year's election. The discomfort and pain is felt by all of the citizens in one way or another.

title: Kings Point Wins, 2120, Cuts Alfred String at 16
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 4Dave Buzanoski scored two touchdowns and passed for a third today as the United States Merchant Marine Academy snapped Alfred University's 16game winning streak, 2120.

title: Miss Susan Andersen Is Affianced
description: CHATHAM, N.J., Nov. 4Mr. and Mrs. Raymond T. Andersen have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Millicent Andersen, to John Ragsdale Hendrie. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Robert F. Hendrie of Mendham. A wedding in August is planned.

title: Delaware Beats Villanova On FourthQuarter Pass
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Nov. 4 (AP)A fourthquarter scoring pass from Scotty Reihm to Vern Roberts gave Delaware, the topranked College Division team, a 147 victory over Villanova today.

title: Gary Zeltzer to Wed Janice Berger Dec. 17
description: LEVITTOWN, L. I., Nov. 4 Miss Janice Berger and Gary Zeltzer will be married Dec. 17 in Wantagh.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: 84Pound Soviet Soldier
description: Sixty years ago, the United States amassed 128 points at the summer games in Stockholm.. The Tsarist Russian Olympic team scored a mere 5.

description: To the Editor:

title: MALCOLM T. McCLURE
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 4 Malcolm T. McClure, supervisor of the research program for the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's information system, died of a heart attack Thursday at his home, 300 Orchard Place. His age was 45.

title: Suffolk
description: Brentwood extended its undefeated streak to 24 games With a 410 victory over Half Hollow Hills. The streaking Indians once again got, some fine Work from their defensive unit, not only in holding back the Thunderbirds but also in setsting up scores.

title: 1,500 Foreigners Arrive In Stavanger, Norway
description: STAVANGER, Norway Oil is giving this old town a new push. You can't see it as you walk the street, but it's there. And it's going to be important for us.

title: Bernstein Joins Harvard, Taking Norton Poetry Chair
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Leonard Bernstein, composer and the former conductor of the New York Pnilharnionic, becomes the Charles Eliot Nor. ton Professor of Poetry at Harvard University tomorrow.

title: BRAZILIAN WOMEN IN MUTED DRIVE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 4 The queen of hearts clearly dominated the king on the poster but the women attending Brazil's first National Women's Congress here had no such pretentions.

title: Ecology Bond Issue Wins L.I. Support
description: Voters will face a state environmental proposition Tuesday that would provide $230million toward programs for clean air, sewer and solid waste management on Long Tsland; plus the purchase of wetlands.

title: Battle for the White House
description: To the Editor:

title: JAPANESE TRANSMIT TELEPAPER TO HOTEL
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)A leading Japanese daily has begun transmission of what is said to be the world's first telenewspaper to a Tokyo hotel.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 4 If George McGovern proves to be the Barry Goldwater of Democratic party, will Sargent Shriver become its William E. Miller?

title: Construction Thefts Thwarted
description: WEST TRENTONA contractor in, Bergen County walked onto a construction site in 1968 and discovered that a 13ton earthmoving machine valued at $20,000 was missing. He searched unsuccessfully for it and finally called the state police.

title: In Goreme, a Turkish Flag Flies Over an Otherworldly Landscape
description: GOREME, reads the caption for a photograph in the enthusiastic Turkish magazine Turizm, is a touristic region which embarrasses the tourist.

title: N. C. State Beats Virginia
description: CHAR LO 1 1 hSVILLE, Va., Nov. 4 (AP)  North Carolina State's wolfpack defeated Virginia today, 3514, before Peach Bowl scouts on hand for the A.C.C. game.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As a longtime resident of a small hotel west of Times Square, may I comment on the apparently publicspirited article, Old Hotels Off Times Square Must Come Down [Oct. 22], by Seymour Durst?

title: New Piscataqua Span
description: PORTSMOUTH, N. H., Nov. 4 (AP)The states of Maine and New Hampshire officially have opened the new Piscataqua River Bridge between Portsmouth and Kittery, Me. The 1,500foot span provides a third link over the Piscataqua between the two cities, and joins Interstate 95 in the two states. The entire project, including approach roads, cost about $55million, officials said.

title: AROUND THE
description: Do the best you can with leavesrake, compost, sweep or ignore them.... Hurry along bulb planting; roots must have some time to develop before the ground freezes.... Clean and oil tools that will not be used until spring... Check greenhouse temperatures often these days.

title: Miss Childers Wed To Ehud Mouchly
description: Miss Camilla Elizabeth Childers was married here last evening to Ehud G. Mouchly, a former member of the Israeli Foreign Service. Rabbi Ronald Sobel performed the ceremony at the AmericaIsrael Cultural Foundation.

title: COAST CITY HALL ROLLED TO PUBLIC
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif., Nov. 4 Linda Fletcher, who moved here recently from the Bronx, N. Y., was on her way to the supermarket the other day when she detided to find out where her husband could learn to flycast.

title: U.S.O.C. Rolls in ChipsBlue Chips
description: The United States Olympic Committee is performing considerably stronger on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange this year than it did on the playing fields at the Munich Olympics.

title: Movies
description: THE voice is still Little Caesar's: harsh, stabbing, authoritative. The eyes still have a fierce intensity, the wide frog mouth as tight with determination as ever behind the grizzled Hemingway beard. The body may be shrunken now, even smaller than one had remembered it on the screen, but the hands, graceful and darting, are constantly expressive. In the snug, richly upholstered den of his Beverly Hills mansion, flanked by part of his great collection of French Impressionists, Edward G. Robinson is still, at 78, very much Edward G. Robinson. And after years of character roles and guest appearances, he is starting work on a genuine starring assignment as tne aged sidekick of Charlton Heston in Richard Fleischer's scifi film about the New York of the future, Soylent Green.

title: Dr. Whipple to Retire As Observatory Head
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Dr. Fred L. Whipple will retire July I, 1973, as director of the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory in Cambridge, Mass., S. Dillon Ripley, secretary of the Smithsonian Institution, said this week.

title: Foe Said to Gain in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 4North Vietnamese troops, backed by tanks and artillery, made powerful attacks against a number of Laotian Government positions, driving defenders out of some of them, military sources reported today.

title: Defeat of McGovern And a Nixon Sweep Indicated in Survey
TRANSPORTATION
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 2 (AP)IFishfarming, especially the mass production of trout and salmon for food, may some day be an integral part of the nation's agricultural industry, delegates to a conference sponsored by Cornell University were told yesterday.

title: MonmouthOcean
description: Brick Township, the toprated team in New Jersey, ran into unexpectedly rough opposition yesterday, but kept its record unblemished with a 1914 victory over Neptune at Neptune.

title: Now Hear This: The Navy Is Taking Over the Old Brooklyn Army Terminal
description: Things are a bit different these days at the old Brooklyn Army Terminal in Bay Ridge. Thom who knew the terminal in the halcyon days of its 53year existencethe period from 1945 to 1947, when it was the center for Magic Carpet, the military operation designed to expedite the return of millions of World War II G.I.'s would hardly recognize the place.

title: Mrs. Morse Has Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Morse of Manhattan Beach, Calif., on Sept. A in the Torrance (Calif.) Memorial Hospital. Mrs. Morse is the former Miss Beverly Simons.

title: Preps
description: WINDSOR. Conn., Nov. 4Taft received the opening kickoff and punted to Loomis when it was unable to gain. Rob Kohl took the kick and ran 90 yards for a touchdown that started Loomis off to a 4016 victory. Frank Caufield, a quarterback, ran for two touchdowns and passed for two more as Loomis improved its record to 5.2. Loomis rolled up 405 yards on total offense.

title: Homer, Billy, Nate and friends
description: Easy readers, or primers as they were once known, must be big business, judging from the volume published. They cover a variety of subject matter science, history, sport, and what I would reluctantly call fiction. The price is right (around $3). So are the ostensible educational motives: anything to help darling Willie along the path to enlightenment and reflection. Besides, they're accessible, economical, durable, personable, and, for all I know, bullet proof.

title: Louise Saurel And Earl Kari Are Wed Here
description: The marriage of Miss Louise Gabrielle Saurel to Earl Nyhus Kari, son of Mr. and Mrs. Earl Kari of Westport, Wash., took place here yesterday at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Saurel, parents of the bride. State Supreme Court Justice Vincent A. Lupiano performed the ceremony.

title: RED WINGS DOWN CANADIENS BY 42
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 4 (UPI)Four former Canadiens  Leon Rochefort, Mickey Redmond, Bill Collins and Red Berensonscored for Detroit tonight as the Red Wings broke Montreal's 13game undefeated string with a 42 victory.

title: At Her Back She Always Heard
description: Young Bridie McShane, stubborn, blazingly outspoken, is her father's special daughter, as good as a boy, he had been known to say. Yet even when William is born (and in spite of her mother's You've lost your place in the sun, Bridie) it is still Bridie her father takes for rambles, talks to about Christ, the revolution, and the wickedness of grinding poverty in the midst of plenty. But Bridie and her family, living on the outskirts of Edinburgh after the First World War on the tiny disability pension of wounded Patrick McShane and the pittance he earns from patrol duty, still know nothing of desperate poverty until after his death, when Bridie is 9.

title: Copper Bedeviled by Politics
description: Last month, at a conference in Cleveland, an industrialist was waxing rhapsodic about the properties of copper, the red metal that helps conduct electricity, carry water and beautify a host of consumer goods.

title: New & Novel
description: As he lay beside his fiftyinch goddess... he knew with the force of discovery that he was happy. And well might he be. Bacombe Fletcher, quondam salesman of fluoridation systems, has the unique privilege of cohabiting with. Venus! She's Venus, Aphrodite, Ishtar, Ashtoreth, Astarte, Freyja, Bacombe dithers to the skeptical press, and call her what you will, she is a celestial experience. There's Just this one bug in the FletcherVenus affair. I'm not going to tell you what it is, except that it is bigger than both of them.

title: Barry Fits In Nicely
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 4Al Attles was intrigued by the cutout puzzles Jerry Lucas was distributing on the plane. The Golden State coach had scouted the Knicks in Seattle and was on the same flight that carried the team here for a game with the Warriors and a first meeting with Rick Barry since his return to the National Basketball Association.

title: Road Grows in Vermont
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Nov. 4 (AP) Two sections of Vermont's Interstate 91 link from Massachusetts to the Canadian border are set to open next week, and bids were opened yesterday on 19 more miles of the highway. As of next week, the road will be open from the Canadian border to Barton in the north and from the Massachusetts line to Fairlee on the southern section.

title: BergenPassaic
description: Glen Pecoraro's sparkling play on both offense and defense led Queen of Peace to its sixth victory in as many games, 240, over Weehawken yesterday at Weehawken.

title: Pheasant Season Is Opening
description: LACEY TOWNSHIP  The Forked River State Game Farm will release the first of 5,000 ringneck pheasants tomorrow in anticipation of the opening of the upland pheasanthunting season next weekend.

title: Mental Unit Rings With Sound of Music
description: KINGS PARK, L.I.The saxophonist played with the smooth, sure sound of a professional while at the piano a man sat playing with a quiet smile, his fingers flying over the keys as New Orleansstyle improvisations poured forth.

title: Letter to the Editor 11  No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: A Girl, 3, Is Found Hanged In Her Harlem Apartment
description: A threeyearold girl was found hanged yesterday with an electrical ironing cord that had been tied to an overhead pipe in a oneroom apartment at 56 East 123d Street.

title: Newcombe, Emerson Win
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Nov. 4 (AP)  John Newcombe and Roy Emerson, both Australians, scored straightset victories today in the semifinals of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis tour tournament.

title: Thiel Beats Allegheny
description: GREENVILLE, Pa, Nov. 4 (AP) Bernie Kanski and Bob Withcrop combined for nearly 200 Words rushing, to power Thiel to a 2818 triumph over Allegheny today.

title: Jets 3Point Underdogs;
description: Pro football's most productive offense goes against one of the game's stingiest defenses in Shea Stadium today when the New York Jets meet the Washington Redskins for the first time ever.

title: DOYLE PACES ELIS
description: NEW HAVEN, NOV. 4Before the game, Take Grouthamel, Dartmouth's young football coach, improbably called Yale the best team in the Ivy League. The Elis gave him credibility today by routing the Big Green, 4514, before the largest Ivy crowd of the season, 41,507.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 4  British paratroopers today recaptured Augustus Spence, a convicted murderer and suspected leader of a Protestant guerrilla group.

title: VOTER NEWS HOOKUP STARTING 10TH YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) The machinery to be used in gathering and tabulating the 80 million or more votes to be cast in the general election Nov. 7 has been operating since 1963.

title: Illinois Big Winner
description: EVANSTON, III., Nov. 4 (AP) The quarterback, Mike Wells, scampered to two touchdowns and hurled a pair of scoring passes today as Illinois shattered a sevengame losing streak with an explosive 4313 Big Ten football triumph over errorstricken Northwestern.

title: How now, poetry lovers?
description: Wouldn't it be pleasant to suppose, just suppose, we were anxious to raise up a generation of poetry lovers? How should we go about it?

title: Nassau South
description: Massapequa football fans found themselves in the unusual position of rooting for neighborhood rival Berner yesterday as the South Shore Division football race continued to tighten.

title: AX Jets May Spell Long Island Jobs
description: SYOSSET, L.I., Nov. 4  A senior Republic Aviation official said this week that the contract to build 600 AX Air Force attack jets, for which Republic is competing, could mean 14,000 Jobs and more than $150million for the Long Island economy over the next eight years.

title: Joan K. Studdiford To Marry Nov. 24
description: MORRISVILLE, Pa., Nov. 4 Mr. and Mrs. James Stryker Studdiford have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Kerney Studdiford of New York, to Alan D. Breward, an account supervisor there with the DancerFitzgeraldSample advertising agency. The wedding is planned for Nov. 24 in the Princeton University Chapel.

title: Spassky Loses Again
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4 (Reuters) Valeri Chekhov, a 17yearold Moscow schoolboy, has taken a leaf out of Bobby Fischer's book by beating the former world chess champion, Boris Spassky, the newspaper Komsomolskaya Pravda reported yesterday. He was playing the Soviet grandmaster at the same time as five other young players, representing the Moscow Pioneers, the Soviet equvalent of Boy Scouts.

title: LOUISIANA BLACKS DISRUPT COLLEGES
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 4 (UPI) With a battle cry of More black awareness, students have immobilized two universities in Louisiana with boycotts and protests and disrupted another with property destruction.

title: BrooklynIs Seeking Band Shell in Park
description: Brooklyn Borough President Sebastian Leone has asked the City Planning Comrnision to appropriate $150,000 of 197374 capital budget funds for construction of a band shell on the open meadow of the 12.3acre Seaside Park, in the Brighton BeachConey Island section.

title: About Motor Sports
description: When you're barreling along at high speed in a turn, your instinct is to back off the throttle. But following that instinct can cost you the race if your engine is turbocharged. In fact, early in the turn you are supposed to pour on more power so that you come off the corner in shape to start running the straightaway with maximum power. This is the effect of throttle lag, that lapse of miniseconds between the time you hit the accelerator and the time the boost from the turbocharger comes in. Throttle lag is characteristic of turbocharged enginei. In winning five races and the 1972 Canadian American Challenge Cup, George Foilmer had to unlearn old habits before driving the turbocharged L & M Porsche successfully.

title: DoItYourself Repairs...
description: CHICAGOPatrick O'Donnell, a 27yearold suburban teacher, got together $300 not long ago to buy a 1952 Cadillac from a woman in Wisconsin.

title: Braves Halt Bulls, 10199
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 4 (UPI)Dick Garrett's layup with 36 seconds left to play gave the Buffalo Braves a 10199 victory tonight over the Chicago Bulls, snapping the Bulls' sixgame winning streak and ending Buffalo's sixgame losing string.

title: L'Humanite Found Guilty Of Slandering Journalist
description: PARIS, Nov. 4  A Parisian court has found the Communist party paper L'Humanit guilty, of slandering Michel Gordey, the Soviet affairs specialist of the masscirculation paper FranceSoir.

title: ShowandSell Art Galleries Are Increasing in Jersey
description: While New Jersey has never been a place either its residents or New Yorkers think of as an art market, smattering of galleries giving oneman shows is springing into being.

title: LEONARD MOHILL
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 4Leonard Mohill, vice president and general manager of the Pittsfield (Mass.) News Company, newspaper distributors, and a former circulation roadman for The New York Times, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived in Farmington.

title: Tokyo's Mad Passion
description: TOKYOIn a conversation about the Tokyo stock market the other day, an American businessman here sipped his lunchtime beer and said: There's an opportunity for some pretty swinging action here. All markets are emotional, and this one is no exception. It runs on mad passion.

title: Some Ranger Tickets Go on Sale Tomorrow
description: The first boxoffice sale of a limited number of tickets for 13 Ranger games from Wednesday thorugh Dec. 27 will be held tomorrow at the Felt Forum box office at Madison Square Garden and more than 150 Ticketron locations.

title: Betsy G. Gambrill Will Be Bride of Robert. B Clark
description: WESTON, Mass., Nov. 4Mr. and Mrs. Howard Gambrill Jr. of Weston, and Ogunquit, Me., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Betsy Greenwood Gambrill, to Robert Brewster Clark of Washington, and Brewster, Mass.

title: Jazz Stars Find Park Ridge Haven
description: PARK RIDGEDottie and Jerry Dodgion are basking in obscurity here, living in a house that is snuggled into the hilly woods along Bear Brook.

title: Advertising:
description: Young & Rubicam management is consolidating three of its special service units and is considering spinning them off as a separate subsidiary.

title: Dolphins Take 8th in Row By Defeating Bills, 3016
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 5 (UPI)Mercury Morris ran for two touchdowns and Garo Yepremian kicked three field goals in the first half as the unbeaten Miami Dolphins scored a 3016 victory over the Buffalo Bills today and extended their winning streak to eight games.

title: LILI KRAUS, PIANIST, EXCELS IN SONATAS
description: The piano music of Mozart and Schubert have long been the house specialties of Lili Kraus, and not surprisingly their sonatas were the principal offerings at her Hunter College Assembly Hall concert yesterday afternoon.

title: SOCCER FAN IS SHOT IN POSTGAME BRAWL
description: A spectator at a soccer game in Van Cortlandt Park was shot and wounded yesterday, and another man was slashed when a brawl erupted after the New York Albanians, a Bronx team had defeated the Awrac Molters of Brooklyn a team made up of ArmenianAmericans.

title: Queens Fire Destroys Office Of Regular Democratic Club
description: A twoalarm fire of undetermined origin destroyed a twostory building at 9814 Queens Boulevard at 65th Road, Forest Hills, Queens, early yesterday, demolishing the headquarters of the MidQueens Regular Democratic Clubthe campaign headquarters of Assemblyman Herbert J. Miller semblyman Herbert J. Miller.

title: Bridge: Stern's Team Gains Edge In World Team Qualifying
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 5The final of the match here to determine the 1973 North American international team turned out to be an unexpectedly onesided contest.

title: How a School Tips From. White to Black
description: There is an almost classic quality to the ethnic switch that has taken place during the last decade at Brooklyn's Winthrop Junior High School 232 and in the East Flatbush neighborhood that surrounds the school:

title: Democrats in Connecticut Fear The Length of Nixon's Coattails
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 5Democrats in Connecticut campaigned hard in the last weekend of the Presidential election campaign, worried that the grip they have had on the State Legislature for six years may be loosened by a defeat for Senator George McGovern.Associated Press

title: U.S. Sets Up Panel On Energy Policies; Economist Is Head
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  Interior Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton announced today the creation of an Energy Board to develop and coordinate energy policy.

title: Grenade Hurts 11 in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 5 (UPI)Police sources said that 11 persons were wounded, one seriously, when an unidentified person hurled a grenade into bus station early Saturday in the town of Tyre, 56 miles south of Beirut.

title: Blumberg to Aid Commission
description: Richard J. Blumberg has been appointed general counsel of the New York Study Commission for New York City. The 39yearold lawyer has bee associate counsel of the commission, which i headed by Stuart N. Scott.

title: Loren Eiseley The Hope of Man
description: PHILADELPHIA  Tomorrow the American people will make a decision; tomorrow a longsought peace will be in process and a leader chosen. So deeply has our society been riven by conflict, however, so deep has grown the worry over the innumerable problems presented by our dinosaur cities and frenetic technology that we find ourselves still torn by dissension, cynicism and fear. With one foot poised at the threshold of the stars and with almost limitless power at our command we tremble over that which we have created.

title: U.S. Opens Polish Trade Office
description: WARSAW, Nov. 5  The United States opened a trade information offfice yesterday in Warsaw, the first such facility in a Communist country. It will serve as a home away from home for American businessmen as well as filling a variety of Polish needs.

title: Harlem Gets ChurchinaChurch
description: Four years ago fire ravaged St. Charles Borromeo Roman Catholic Church in Harlem, reducing the 85yearold structure to a shell.

title: Nixon Puts Peace at Top Of 10 Goals for Winner
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 5President Nixon said today that whichever candidate is elected President should dedicate himself to 10 goals in the next four years.

title: Needham to Moscow
description: James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, has accepted an invitation to visit Moscow later this week as a guest of the Bank of Foreign Trade of the Soviet Union. Page 65.

title: Bonn's Explanation On Arabs Release Assailed by Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 5  Israel said today she was not satisfied with West Germany's explanation of the circumstances surrounding the release of three Arab guerrillas held in the slaying of 11 members of the Israeli Olympic team in Munich in September.

title: Flood Aid Set for Students
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) More college workstudy funds to help students whose families were victims of floods were announced today by the Office of Education. They include $2.3million for 104 colleges and universities in seven Eastern and Southern states, and the District of Columbia, where the rains of the tropical storm Agnes struck, and $155,500 for 14 schools in South Dakota.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 5 (AP)Frank Froehling, Jim McManus and Tom Leonard of the United States scored firstround victories today in the $63,500 Stockholm Grand Prix open tennis tournament.

title: Advertising:
description: The Magnavox Corporation, one of the pioneers using a la carte advertising services, just may be headed back to the fullservice fold.

title: Republicans Name 1,290 Donors In Final Part of Suit Settlement
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5President Nixon's campaign finance committee disclosed today the names of 1,290 more previously unidentified contributors to Mr. Nixon's reelection effort. The donors gave total of $490,000.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Steelers Rout Bengals, 4017, Reach Top of Division
C.I.A. Cleared in Plot By French Red Paper
description: PARIS, Nov. 5  The United States Central Intelligence Agency had an unexpected defender today, the French Communist party's organ L'Humanite, in its Sunday magazine.

title: CHARLES SARGENT JR., LED FACTOR CONCERN
description: Charles S. Sargent Jr., president of William Iselin & Co. and of MeinhardCommercial Corporation, factors and subsidiaries of C.I.T. Financial Corporation, of which he was director, died Friday at Pine Valley, N.J. He was 59 years old and lived at 1155 Park Avenue.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. to discuss draft resolution on nonuse of force in international relations and prohibition of use of nuclear weapons.

title: Each Party Plans a Final Effort To Get Out the Vote Tomorrow
Blues, Sabres in Deadlock
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 5 (UPI)Frank St. Marseille deflected a shot by Chris Evans into the Buffalo net in the second period tonight to give the St. Louis Blues a 11 tie with the Sabres.

title: Rockets Weather Comeback by Nets And Win,137107
description: DENVER, Nov. 5The New York Nets lost their third American Basketball Association game in a row tonight, a 137107 decision to the Denver Rockets.

title: Frost, Diahann Carroll Plan Wedding at Easter
description: David Frost, the television personality and Diahann Carroll, the actresssinger, havl announced their engagement, a spokesman for Mr. Frost said yesterday.

title: Rangers Top Flyers, 32, With Giacomin Back in Net
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 5Keeping any hard feelings within himself and the puck generally out of the net, Ed Giacomin returned to goal after a 22day absence tonight as the Rangers edged the Philadelphia Flyers, 32.

title: Dave Anderson
description: In his cubicle in the coaches room, GeOrge Allen was fumbling with a cuff link as he talked with Joe Sullivan, one of his assistant coaches, after the Washington Redskins 3517 victory yesterday over the New York Jets.

title: Top Businessmen Report Strong Support of Nixon
description: An overwhelming majority of the nation's top businessmen have indicated that they will vote for President Nixon in tomorrow's election and that domestic economic policy is the key campaign issue for them.

title: Black Theater Alliance Opening A 2Week Festival in Brooklyn
description: The Black Theater Alliance, an association of 13 independent New York black theatrical groups, opens its second annual theater festival tomorrow night in the handsome new Billie Holiday Theater in Brooklyn's BedfordStuyvesant section. The twoweek festival, which runs through Nov. 19, marks another milestone in the city's longrange plans for the cultural and physical rehabilitation of New York's second largest black and Puerto Rican section.

title: BETTER OUTLOOK SHOWN IN SURVEY
description: An improvement in new orders and willingness of companies to order further ahead are factors contributing to better outlook in business, it was reported over the weekend, by the National Association of Purchasing Management, Inc.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Nov. 5Tickets for a special football game are on sale in the Newark community. What makes the game special is that the proceeds will go back into the community.

title: Heavy B52 Raids Go On As Foe Keeps Up Attacks
description: SAIGON South Vietnam, Nov. 5  Waves of B52 bombers dropped nearly 2.5 million pounds of bombs over South Vietnam and the southern part of North Vietnam in the last 24 hours, while Communist forces were reported to be continuing to strike at Government troops with fierce intensity.

title: HALLAM M. RICHARDSON
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 5Hallam M. Richardson, a lawyer, died yesterday at Grasslands Hospital in Valhalla. He was 74 years old and lived at Normandy Road.

title: Stewart Calls His Arrest Harassment
description: State Senator Waldaba Stewart, who was arrested Saturday night after a dispute with the police over the ticketing of doubleparked vehicles in front of his campaign headquarters, charged yesterday that the incident was a conspiracy by police who are out to get him because of his criticism of them.

title: Jerusalem:A Call to the MovieMakers
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 3Atop the Nabotean ruin of Avdat, deep in the Negev Desert, Jesus was being crucified to a throbbing rock score. Eighty miles to the north, in an ersatz western town on the outskirts of Tel Aviv, Gregory Peck and Desi Arnaz Jr. were staging a classic chase scene. In Jerusalem, Paddy Chayefsky was making notes for a film he plans to shoot here next spring about Palestine under the British mandate, and at Lod Airport, Melvyn Douglas was arriving to star in a film written by Ephraim Kishon, the Israeli Art Buchwald.

title: DORIS JUNG RETURNS IN ROSENKAVALIER
description: Doris Jung returned to the New York City Opera Saturday afternoon, her homecoming role the same one in which she made her company debut back in 1960: the Marschallin, in Strauss Der Rosenkavalier. Although her husband, Felix Popper, is music administrator of the City Opera, the soprano spent only a few seasons there, leaving to build an important and almost exclusively European career. She came back a year ago, however, to make an impressive solo appearance here with Leopold Stokowski and the American Symphony Orchestra and last summer she was the Fidelio at the Aspen Festival. It is hoped that she will be taking on other assignments at the State Theater next year.

title: Javits Is Given 2 Tickets While Driving in the Bronx
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits was issued two traffic summonses yesterday afternoon by a Bronx highway patrolman who cited the 68yearold Republican lawmaker for driving an unregistered and uninspected vehicle.

title: 100 Mayors in State Give Support and Praise to Nixon
description: More than 100 Mayors of New. York cities and villages are supporting President Nixon for reelection, a campaign spokesman for the President said yesterday.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Nov. 5 (AP)John Newcombe scored his sixth victory on the 1971 World Championship Tennis circuit today, trouncing a fellowAustralian, Roy Emerson, 60, 63, 61, in the final of $50,000 tournament.

title: WARRIORS TAKE MORE THAN GAME
description: OAKLAND, Nov. 5  The frustrating lack of interest around these parts in the Golden State Warriors, finally may be over. To the hard core of players who finished with the best wonlost record in team history last season, 5131, was added Rick Barry. The Warriors are not only good, now they're exciting.

title: Saigon Aides Suspended in Rice Scandal
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5A major scandal in the procurement of rice for the 264,000 war refugees living in and around Danang, South Vietnam's second city, has led to the suspension of a number of high officials and a demand by the Cabinet that they and the Mayor of Danang be dismissed.

title: Low Bidder Chosen For Safety Project On L. I. Crossings
description: The state's program to eliminate grade crossings on the Long Island Rail Road has moved a step closer to reality with an announcement by the New York State Department of Transportation of the name of the low bidder on a project involving eight crossings in Nas sau County.

title: Australia in Rugby Final
description: TOULOUSE, France, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Australia, the reigning champion, reached the final of the World Rugby League cup competition today with a 319 victory over France. The victory gave Australia a place in the final against Britain next Saturday.

title: McGovern Presses His Final Bid Here
Plane Crash Kills One
description: HONESDALE, Pa., Nov. 5 (AP)A private plane crashed shortly after taking off today from nearby Cherry Ridge Airport, the State Police said, killing Harold F. O'Brien, 47 years old, of Lakeville. Gerald Slick, 28, of Simpson, was injured.

title: Navy Acts to Halt Racial Violence and Alleged Sabotage on Ships
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5.The Navy, working on accelerated roundtheclock schedules in Southeast Asia, has been staggered by a series of racial brawls and alleged acts of sabotage.

title: Smith, Avenging Two Defeats, Trounces Gimeno in Paris Final
description: PARIS, Nov. 5 (AP)  Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., avenged two losses to Andres Gimeno this year with an easy 62, 62, 75 victory over the Spaniard today in the final of the $50,000 French indoor open tennis championship.

title: Strike Leaders in Chile Call End to the Stoppage
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Leaders of a transport and business strike against Chile's leftist Government ordered their supporters to return to work tomorrow, ending a 26day stoppage.

title: Needham to Visit Soviet After Journey to London
description: James J. Needham, the new chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, has accepted an invitation by the Soviet Union's Bank of Foreign Trade to visit Moscow later this week.

title: Blasts in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 5 (UPI)A Government ammunition dump blew up today on the outskirts of Pnompenh and a grenade hit the capital's military headquarters, killing one soldier and wounding eight.

title: Young Voters Push Absentee Balloting To a Peak in State
Heath Shifts Cabinet, Naming Consumer Official
description: LONDON, Nov. 5  A Cabinet Minister assigned to safeguard the interests of the consumer was named tonight by Prime Minister Heath.

title: Svare Signed by Chargers To New 5Year Contract
description: San Diego, Nov. 5 (UPI)Coach Harland Svare was signed to a new fiveyear contract by the San Diego Chargers today following their 3428 defeat by the Dallas Cowboys.

title: DEBT UNREPORTED BY A NIXON DONOR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) A major donor to President Nixon's campaign distributed personal financial statements omitting millions of dollars in debts before he gave his campaign contribution in the form of a $305,000 i.o.u.

title: 22 Hours in Jail Produces Charge of Police Brutality
description: Having been cleared of all charges against him, a 43yearold Brooklyn commodities broker is pressing his own charges of police brutality and campaigning for better treatment for prisoners.

title: Bomb Scare at U.S. Court
description: A Brooklyn youth who approached the United States Customs Courthouse carrying a wooden box with a fuse dangling from it and threatened to blow the place up was jailed last night on menacing and other charges. The youth, Paul Zeukas. 17 years old, of the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn, was questioned at length by the police and Federal Bureau of Investigation agents before being booked. The box was opened by police bomb experts and was found to contain spent mortar shell, The fuse wasn't attached to anything.

title: ROGERS EXPECTS HANOI WILL ENTER FINAL TALKS SOON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that he had every reason to think that North Vietnam would agree to resume negotiations in the near future for the conclusion of an agreement to end the Indochina conflict.

title: ExNun's Lay Religious Group Grows in Glen Ridge
Mrs. Lefcort Married Here to Charles Segal
description: Mrs. Eleanor Schall Lefcort, widow of Martin Lefcort, was married here yesterday noon to Charles Segal, a lawyer. Both are of New York. Rabbi Balfour Brickner performed the ceremony in the chapel of the House of Living Judaism. The bride retired recently as president of the Eastern Wine Corporation, producer of Chateau Martin Wines. She succeeded her first husband as head of that organization after his death.

title: Safer City
description: Mayor Lindsay's decision to hire 3,150 more policemen as first priority in use of Federal revenuesharing funds reflects a realistic recognition of the urgent need make New York a safer city.

title: To European Union
description: If the enlarged European Economic Community can keep to targets and timetables fixed by heads of the nine member Governments, it may well achieve its aim of transforming itself into a European Union by the end of 1980. Even if some targets are missed, the myriad projects launched by the recent summit conference will make it extrrmely difficult for any member to stop the clock on European integration.

title: At Least 28 Are Killed as Fire Stalls Train in Tunnel in Japan
description: FUKUI, Japan, Monday, Nov. (Reuters)Fire swept an express train crowded with sleeping passengers in a tunnel near here today, causing at least 28 deaths. The police said that 179 other people were still missing 10 hours later.

title: Pursuing a Profit in Great Salt Lake
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Ever since John C. Fremont first explored the Great Salt Lake in 1843, there has been a fascination with this natural wonder and a nagging belief in its great economic potential.

title: 2 Macy Divisions to Honor American Express Cards
description: The American Express credit card will be accepted for the first time by two major store divisions, New York and California, of R. H. Macy & Co., Inc., starting Wednesday.

title: Jets Lose
description: The Washington Redskins defeated the New York Jets, 3517, yesterday before a record 63,962 at Shea Stadium. A crowd of 62,689 saw the Giants down the Denver Broncos, 2917, at Yankee Stadium. Page 57.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Jules Cooper, chairman of Community Planning Board 12, in the Inwood section of Manhattan, expresed surprise at the announcement of plans by state and city officials to build a skyscraper city of 42,000 people in the neighborhood. He said the plan, which. calls for constructing 30 towers and supportive facilities over a subway yard, would not work and would cause congestion and uglify the area.

title: U.S. Attorney Prepares For Voting Complaints
Philippine Police Report Attack by a Force of 500
description: MANILA, Nov. 5 (UPI)The police said today that a band of about 500 men attacked a 15man national police detachment in troubled Cotabato Province on Oct. 29 but were repelled after a fourhour fight with Government troops aided by a helicopter gunship.

title: ROGERS EXPECTS HANOI WILL ENTER FINAL TALKS SOON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that he had every reason to think that North Vietnam would agree to resume negotiations in the near future for the conclusion of an agreement to end the Indochina conflict.

title: HOUSING PROJECT NEWS TO INWOOD
description: The chairman of Community Board 12 in the Inwood section of Manhattan expressed surprise yesterday at the announcement of plans by state and city officials to build community of 42,000 people in the neighborhood.

title: Wings Tie Penguins, 11
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (AP) Mickey Redmond scored his sixth goal of the season at 15 minutes 3 seconds of the third period tonight to give the Red Wings a 11 tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins. The deadlock was the first for both clubs.

title: The Work Ethic
description: President Nixon has sought to make a campaign issue out of his defense of the work ethic that he says built this nation's character, while implying that Senator McGovern upholds something called the new welfare ethic that would destroy the national character.

title: Burdge, of Amex, Elected President, Kolton Announces
description: Richard M. Burdge, 45, has been elected president and chief operating officer of the American Stock Exchange. His appointment was announced by Paul Kolton, who was named chairman and chief executive officer of the Amex last Thursday.

title: Postal Head Links Continuing Deficit To Labor Problem
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  The Postmaster General, Elmer T. Klassen, says the United States Postal Service may lose money for anotherdecade because, among other things, half its employes couldn't care less about improving service.

title: Mike Hill Victor in Texas
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 5 (UPI)Mike Hill held off a midround charge by Lee Trevino today by getting three birdies in a row and posted a twostroke victory in the Texas open. It was his second victory in five years on the Professional Golfers Association tour.

title: Sick of Separates? Two Piece Dress May Be an Answer
description: Remember the dress? It's that body covering with hole for the head, two holes for the arms and a skirt. It almost became obsolete with the advent of pants. Indeed, it is rumored that there exists a certain number of young women, the usual wearers of dresses, who have never had one on their backs since their christening day.

title: Dull Campaign in Jersey Resists Shriver Efforts
JAMES A. M'CLOSKEY; EXADVERTISING AIDE
description: James A. McCloskey a former public relations official of the National Association of Manufacturers, died here yesterday He was 67 years old.

title: FIRSTPLACE KINGS TOP ISLANDERS, 92
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 (AP) Butch Goring scored three goals last night for the second time in three nights to power the Los Angeles Kings to a 92 victory over the New York Islanders in National Hockey League action.

title: Eskimos Beat Stampeders
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 5 (Canadian Press)The Edmonton Eskimos, aided by six interceptions, defeated the Calgary Stampeders, 2814, today to finish the regular Canadian Football League season tied for first place in the Western Conference with the Winnipeg Blue Bombers. The Bombers drew a bye into the playoffs because they won the season series with Edmonton.

title: New McGovern TV Ads Sharpen Attack on Nixon
Lenox Hill Hospital Plans A New 12Story Building
description: Lenox Hill Hospital will erect a new 12story medical building on Park Avenue and 76th Street to replace its 65yearold Ottendorfer Dispensary.

title: Dance: Good to the Last
description: The City Center Joffrey Ballet is just coming up to the final week of its customary sixweek fall season at the New York City Center. This has been one of its best Seasons yet, with the company dancing, in exceptional fashion. There is such vigor and style to the Joffrey dancers that they are easy to love.

title: Levitt Says City Failed to Claim $2Million Available for Relief
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt, who in the past has cited millions of dollars in overclaims by the city on the state, yesterday made public a report that the city had failed to claim $2,062,972 state and Federal reimbursement for welfare grants issued two and a half years ago.

title: Achievers Often Sick As Youths
description: The aquanauts of Tektite 2 went down into the sea two years ago to learn about coral reefs, fish communities and seafloor sediment. But an unexpected discovery was something the psychologists are calling the Teddy Roosevelt effect.

title: Boycott Talks Stalemated
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 5 (UPI) Weekend talks with boycotting students in control of the Southern University Administration Building reached a stalemate but officials said classes, would resume tomorrow.

title: Runners Aid Jimmy Fund
description: HENNIKER. N. H., Nov. 5 (UPI)The New England College crosscountry team ran more than 225 miles this weekend for the benefit of the Jimmy Fund, which helps children with cancer. They raised more than $1,000.

title: Cambodian General Killed
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 5 (AP)Brig. Gen. Un Savuth, who often led his troops into battles against Communist forces, was killed in an auto accident yesterday four miles north of Pnornpenh.

title: F. T. M'CLINTOCK, 68; LED SECURITIES FIRM
description: Franklin T. McClintock, a former vice president and director of Harriman, Ripley & Co., now part of Drexel Firestone, Inc., investment securities died yesterday of a heart attack in Arrowhead Highlands Calif. He was 68 years old and lived in Solebury Bucks County, Pa.

title: Jane Blalock Takes Playoff
description: AOPKA, Fla., Nov. 5 (UPI)Jane Blalock sank a 30foot birdie putt on the third hole of a suddendeath playoff today to beat Kathy Whitworth and Sandra Palmer and win the $30,000 Lady Errol Golf Classic.

title: The Szamek Case: Honor After Rebuffs
Article 3  No Title
description: MITSUKAIDO, Japan, Nov. 5 (AP)Hsieh MinNan of Taiwan broke out of a threeway tie for the lead with a finalround, fiveunderpar67 today and won the Bridgestone golf tournament today by three strokes from Brian Allin of Santa Barbara, Calif., and Kuo ChiHsiung of Taiwan. Hsieh, in earning the $12,987 first prize, completed the 72 holes with a 12underpar 276 over the 6,900yard Mitsukaido Golf Course, northwest of Tokyo.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5A central argument for President Nixon in this election, and a most effective one, has been that he is the more practical candidate. Even some who would define themselves as liberal intellectuals support Nixon as the hardnosed politician, able to deal with the notsopleasant realities of American life and the American character.

title: A Nebraska Star Rises to Replace Fallen Giant Hero
description: Charlie Evans is out for the season, having suffered a broken leg in the Giants 2917 victory over Denver yesterday, but Coach Alex Webster believes no major changes will be needed. Joe Orduna stepped right in when Evans was injured in the first quarter, and he'll remain as the regular until further notice.

title: Books of The Times
description: An allegory is a novel that you're not supposed to try to believe in. Instead of empathizing into the characters, you're expected to go along with an idea poorly disguised as a situation. To me, this seems like an awkward thing to be asked to do. I feel as if the author has me up on the handlebars of a bicycle while he or sculptures of pedals doggedly away over difficult and barren ground. Reading an allegory is like going to a banquet where there are only speeches and no food. The Roman Emperor Elagabalus used to do something like this. According to one of his biographers, he often amused himself by inviting people to dinner and serving them paintings food, feasts em broidered on the napkins. The curious thing about David Ely is that he knows very well how to serve up a feast. His novel The Tour was one of the most enjoyableif not one of the most importantbooks I ever read. I've lent it to 40 discriminating people, of whom 39 felt as I did.

title: Final Polls Signal Landslide Victory For the President
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5With 36 hours remaining until the voting booths open, the national public opinion surveys reported tonight that President Nixon stood on the brink of a sweep of landslide proportions.

title: New Marine Science Lab
description: BUZZARDS BAY, Mass., Nov. 5 (UPI)  A marine. science program and laboratory will he established by the Massachusetts Maritime Academy. Lee F. Harrington, the academy president, said yesterday that the pro Irani would serve Bay State Colleges.

title: Cable Cut in Strike Halts C.B.S. TV Jets Broadcast
description: Severed cables prevented the scheduled televising yesterday of the New York JetsWashington Redskins pro football game from Shea Stadium, and three men were arrested in a scuffle outside the field. These were the first instances of alleged sabotage or violence in the threedayold strike by 1,200 cameramen, engineers and other technicians against the Columbia Broadcasting System.

title: Boy at Play Hangs Himself
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Nov. 5 (AP)  A 10yearold boy playing a game of cowboys and Indians accidentally hanged himself with a rope while his younger playmate looked on helplessly, the police said today. The 7yearola playmate told the police that Aaron Roerig had tied a rope to a platform about 10 feet above ground, slipped a noose at the other end of the rope around his neck and apparently jumped or fell to his death.

title: Jets Lose
description: The Washington Redskins defeated the New York Jets, 3517, yesterday before a record 63,962 at Shea Stadium. A crowd of 62,689 saw the Giants down the Denver Broncos, 2917, at Yankee Stadium. Page 57.

title: Pearson Wins Bristol Race
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., Nov. 5 (AP) David Pearson of Spartanburg, S.C., took the lead on the 164th lap today and breezed to a onelap victory in the Permatex 300 race for latemodel sportsman cars at Bristol International Speedway. Pearson averaged 73.203 miles an hour in a 1966 Chevelle.

title: Records Scattered in BreakIn At Kentucky Democratic Offices
Dr. Harry Samberg, Authority On Rehabilitation Medicine, Dies
description: Dr. Harry 14. Samberg, chief of rehabilitation medicine at BrooklynCurnberland Medical Center, died there yesterday of a heart attack. He was 68 years old and lived at 9201 Shore Road, Brooklyn.

title: CATHOLICS ASSAIL ACCORD IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5  Ten thousand to 15,000 Roman Catholics of North Vietnamese origin demonstrated today against the draft peace agreement between Henry A. Kissinger and the North Vietnamese.

title: FIRSTPLACE KINGS TOP ISLANDERS, 9.2
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 (AP) Butch Goring scored three goals last night for the second time in three nights to power the Los Angeles Kings to a 92 victory over the New York Islanders in National Hockey League action.

title: Aid and Comfort for Owners of Sickly Lawns and Ailing Aspidistras
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., During morning clinic hours at the Nassau County Cooperative Extension, phones ring continually and people wait at the reception counter with samples of wilting greenery or wriggling insects inside pill bottles. Tension occasionally rises to the level of a hospital emergency room rather than a horticultural advisory service.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Presargery Visitor Can Help Recovery, A Doctor Declares
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (AP)A visit from the doctor, a member of the family or a religious counselor before an operation can help a surgical patient recover afterward, according to a Northwestern University anesthesiologist. can help a surgical patient recover afterward, according to a Northwestern University anesthesiologist.
