title: Bulgarian Airliner Hits Mountainside, Killing 34 Aboard
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Nov. 5 (UPI)  A domestic airliner crashed into a fogshrouded mountainside in the rugged Rila Range, killing all 34 persons on board, Bulgaria's official press agency said today.

title: Dublin Prepares Stronger Legislation Against the I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 5The Government is preparing legislation to strengthen the law against Illegal organizations such as the Irish Republican Army, the Minister for Justice said here today.

title: CAVALIERS BEATEN BY SUNS, 107106
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 5 (AP)Neal Walk of the Phoenix Suns hit two free throws with only two seconds left to beat the Cleveland Cavaliers, 107106, in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Bond Market Is Poised To Extend Vigorous Rally
description: The bond market is poised to extend its most vigorous rally since President Nixon announced the first phase of his economic controls program more than 14 mpnths ago.

title: Stock Analyst Is Bullish On Laggard Steel Issues
description: Steel stocks repeatedly have disappointed investors in recent years. Whether the laggard steels will find favor remains, of course, to be seen. But some analysts are taking a kindlier Look at the group and projecting profit improvement over the next 12 to 15 months in gear with the economic recovery. One man who has become more positive about steels is Robert A. Hageman, senior metals and mining analyst for the Argus Research Corporation which provides economic and research services for the securities industry. He expressed his views last week in an interview with Vartanig G. Vartan of The New York Times. Portions of their conversation follow:

title: Big 4 Powers Reaffirm Their Authority in Germanys
description: BERLIN, Nov. 5The United States, Britain, France and the Soviet Union agreed today on a formula reaffirming fourpower rights and responsibilities for divided Germany.

title: How a School Tips From White to Black
description: There is an almost classic quality to the ethnic switch that has taken place during the last decade at Brooklyn's Winthrop Junior High School 232 and in the East Flatbush neighborhood that surrounds the school.

title: Dull Campaign in Jersey Resists Shriver Efforts
description: NEWARK, Nov. 5Sargent Shriver, the Democratic VicePresidential nominee, appeared in this rainy city today in a final effort to deny President Nixon the landslide victory in New Jersey that political leaders from both parties were predicting for him on Tuesday.

title: Nixon Puts Peace at Top Of 10 Goals for Winner
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 5President Nixon said today that whichever candidate is elected President should dedicate himself to 10 goals in the next four years.

title: Classes Set Despite Protest At a University in Louisiana
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 5 (AP) Officials at Southern University in New Orleans say classes will resume tomorrow morning, but a spokesman for the 150 militants who hold the school's administrative building said tonight that the boycott was still on.

title: L.S.U. Thriller Sets Stage for Alabama
Kilmer Throws for 3 Scores Biggs Tallies
description: Joe Namath is supposed to be the ace bombardier of pro football, but Billy Kilmer, filling in for the injured Sonny Jurgensen, unloaded three touchdown bombs and his defense scored twice as the Washington Redskins defeated the New York Jets, 3517, yesterday before a record crowd of 63,962 in Shea Stadium.

title: A Robust and Resonant Tone Marks Beroff's Concert Debut at the Piano
description: Several weeks ago, Michel Beroff, the 22yearold French pianist, made his first appearance in New York playing in Bartok's Second Piano Concerto with the New York Philharmonic under Pierre Boulez. The youngster played the Bartok with zip, rhythm and technique to throw away, and everybody was talking about it. Thus a goodly number of the curious went to Hunter College on Saturday night, to partake of Mr. Beroff's local concert debut.

title: Crash Dead Found
description: MANILA, Monday, Nov. 6 (UPI)The United States Navy announced today that it had recovered the bodies of the pilot and the crewman of an A6 jet bomber that crashed into Subic Bay last Tuesday. The Navy identified the two as Lieut. Charles Clayton Heil Jr. and Lieut. Scott Parker Thomas, from a squadron on the carrier Enterprise.

title: Kashmir Talks to Resume
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 5, (Reuters)  A twoweek deadlock between India and Pakistan over Kashmir ended tonight with the announcement here that Pakistan has accepted an Indian proposal for another meeting between senior military commanders. Their task will be to draw a line through Kashmir that will act as a controlled frontier.

title: A.M.C. IS PLANNING TO REOPEN PLANT
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5  The American Motors Corporation plans to reopen a longclosed plant in Kenosha, Wis., this spring, hiring at least 500 new workers to increase automobile production, it was learned here today.

title: Personal Finance: Advising Investors
description: Small investors often complain that it is not always easy to find a professional willing to give them advice.

title: Flames, Leafs Play 22 Tie
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 5 (AP) Ron Harris's first goal of the season midway in the final period tonight earned the Atlanta Flames a 22 tie with the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: INDIANS ASK NIXON TO SOLVE IMPASSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) Indians occupying the Bureau of Indians Affairs building urged President Nixon tonight to help find a solution in the impasse between the demonstrators and Federal officials, who have given the Indians an ultimatum to evacuate by tomorrow morning.

title: BOND ISSUE SHORT, BOTH SIDES AGREE
Elly Ameling Brings Lyricism To Song Program at Museum
description: Elly Ameling cares deeply! about the meanings of the songs. she sings, and Saturday night when she discovered that the Metropolitan Museum program contained not one word of the texts Or any program notes, she herself explained that each song was about before she sang, it.

title: The Secret Key Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Like the dog that, as Sherlock Holmes observed, did not bark, what may be the underlying issue of the Presidential campaign of 1972 never really came out into the open. The surface talk has been about bombing or bugging or inflation. But close analysis of the endless rows of computer tabu

title: 6 Young Men Arrested Upstate In DrugRelated Slaying of Coed
description: DRYDEN, N.Y., Nov. 5A state police investigation into the drugrelated murder of college coed here has resulted in the arrest of six young Tompkins County residents.

title: Evans Finished for Year With Broken Leg
description: With their task made easier after two touchdowns in the last 35 seconds of the first half provided a 190 lead, the New York Giants disposed of an erratic but troublesome Denver team, 2917, at Yankee Stadium yesterday and kept their contender status viable for at least one more week.

title: City Gives $250,000 Grant To JewishPoverty Council
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that a $250,000 city grant had been given to the Metropolitan New York Coordinating Council on Jewish Poverty to assist people living beloW the poverty line who are not receiving assistance from other antipoverty programs.

title: U.S. Voting Doesn't Grip Central Asia
description: BUKHARA, U.S.S.R., Nov. 2In the hinterlands of Soviet Central Asia, the American election is regarded as a nonevent, President Nixon's trip to Moscow is less warmly remembered than the subsequent triumphal tour of Angela Davis, and the largescale American grain sale to Moscow is almost entirely unknown.

title: Campaign Workers Killed
description: ASHLAND, Kan., Nov. 3 (UPI) Two campaign worker for Morriskay the Republican candidate for Governor, died last night in the crash of a private plane northwest of here. They were Wayne R. Starr, 50 years old of Hiawatha, and Mrs. Sharon Fitzpatrick, 28, of Topeka.

title: Heavy B52 Raids Go On As Foe Keeps Up Attacks
description: SAIGON South Vietnam, Nov. 5  Waves of B52 bombers dropped nearly 2.5 million pounds of bombs over South Vietnam and the southern part of North Vietnam in the last 24 hours, while Communist forces were reported to be continuing to strike at Government troops with fierce intensity.

title: Mr. Nixon, We Agree
description: It is now eleven days since Henry A. Kissinger confidently proclaimed that peace is at hand in Indochina, but the war drags on, exacting its ever mounting toll American and Vietnamese lives.

title: Bruins Defeat Canucks On 3 Early Goals by 42
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 5 (UPI)The Boston Bruins notched three quick goals in the first period and then held off the Vancouver Canucks to take a 42 National Hockey League victory today at the Pacific Coliseum.

title: Top Businessmen Report Strong Support of Nixon
description: An overwhelming majority of the nation's top businessmen have indicated that they will vote for President Nixon in tomorrow's election and that domestic economic policy is the key campaign issue for them.

title: Final Polls Signal Landslide Victory For the President
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5With 36 hours remaining until the voting booths open, the national public opinion surveys reported tonight that President Nixon stood on the brink of a sweep of landslide proportions.

title: Lakers Top Sonics, 124115
description: SEATTLE, Nov.5 (AP)Jerry West's clutch scoring and Wilt Chamberlain's key inside baskets led the Los Angeles Lakers to a 124115 victory tonight over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: Inonu, 88. Quits Party After It Leaves Coalition
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 5 (Reuters)  Ismet Inonu resigned from the Republican People's party today after it decided to withdraw from the national coalition Government.

title: Final Daily News Poll Gives State to Nixon by Landslide
Olympian Needs
description: Now, rather than the eve of the 1976 Montreal Olympics, is the time to start reforming the outmoded and inept management of American participation in this world sporting event. The United States Olympic Committee, meeting here today, has the opportunity to make a new beginning for the benefit of the next generation of competitors and spectators alike.

title: Police Dept. Memorandum Is Aimed at Christmas Gifts
description: The chief of Manhattan's 1,500 detectives has posted the first of the annual Police Department memorandums concerning conduct during the Christmas season.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City Council leaders announced invitations yesterday to top school, police and union leaders to confer at City Hall on Wednesday at 2 P.M. on means to end the current wave of muggings, rapes, other assaults and the general atmosphere of anarchy that prevails in some city schools today.

title: Man Kills His Nephew In Shooting at Bandits
description: The 15yearold nephew of the manager of a Bronx bodega was shot and killed accidentally yesterday when his uncle fired four shots at two armed men attempting to hold them up after they had closed the grocery and were about to enter their home.

title: F. SLADE DALE DEAD; A BOAT BUILDER, 70
description: BAY HEAD, N. J., Nov. 5F. Slade Dale, a boat builder and yachtsman who pioneered in the offshore use of outboard motors, died Friday at Point Pleasant Hospital here. His age was 70.

title: Winnipeg Avenges Defeat to Raiders With a 31 Victory
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Nov. 5 (UPI)  Larry Hornung, Dan Johnson and Ab McDonald scored firstperiod goals tonight to enable the Winnipeg Jets to break a threegame losing streak with a 31 World Hockey Association victory over the New York Raiders.

title: DORATI CONDUCTS WORK BY STRAUSS
description: Washington's National Symphony Orchestra, well along the road toward success in sloughing off its former reputation for mediocrity, tested itself) yesterday afternoon at Philharmonic Hall against one of the repertory's most demanding showpieces, Strauss'. Thus Spake Zarathustra. Under Antal Dorati's direction, the orchestra rose remarkably well to most of the score's demands, particularly in the solo departments.

title: BRUINS TRIUMPH OVER CANUCKS, 42
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 5 (UPI)The Boston Bruins notched three quick goals in the first period and then held off the Vancouver Canucks to take a 42 National Hockey League victory today at the Pacific Coliseum.

title: Chiefs Beat Raiders, 2714, to Take Western Lead by HalfGame
Democrats in Connecticut Fear The Length of Nixon's Coattails
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 5Democrats in Connecticut campaigned, hard in the last weekend of the Presidential election campaign, worried that the grip they have had on the State Legislature for six years may be loosened by a defeat for Senator George McGovern.

title: U.S. Says Plans for Refugee Relief Must Await a Truce
description: The breakthrough toward a Vietnam peace settlement finds the United States with no comprehensive plan to help the survivors in Indochina.

title: DR. MILTON WEINTRAUB
description: Dr. Milton Weintraub a dentist practicing at his home 2374 University Avenue in the Bronx died Friday, apparently of a heart attack, while fishing at Greenport L.I. He was 67 years old.

title: Tokyo Still Says That Status Of Taiwan Is Not Determined
description: TOKYO, Nov. 5Japanese officials here said last week that, contrary to a widespread impression, Tokyo had not recognized Peking's claim to Taiwan.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Board 18 Members Urge School Rezoning Equity
description: Four East Flatbush members of the local school board involved in the Canarsie school controversy declared yesterday that Board of Education monitoring of rezoning plans to be developed for the area remains an absolute necessity in order to insure equity and impartiality.

title: Five Die in Iran Flooding
description: TEHERAN, Nov. 5 (AP)Floods in western Iran this weekend devastated villages, drowning five people and making about 1,000 homeless, officials reported today.

title: Waldheim Warns Of Crime Crisis, Asks U.N. Action
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 5 (AP)  Secretary General Waldheim called today for United Nations action to cope with a world crime crisis of growing proportions.

title: TV Review
description: Last night, Balzac's Cousin Bette settled in for five weekly episodes on public television's Masterpiece Theater, the Bostonbased series that continues to import dramatizations from the British Broadcasting Corporation and that continues to be made possible by a grant from Mobil Oil.

title: Flames, Leafs Play 22 Tie
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 5 (AP)Ron Harris's first goal of the season midway in the final period tonight earned the Atlanta Flames a 22 tie with the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: Boggs Search Goes On
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska. Nov. 5 (UPI)Twentyfive military planes searched again today for Representatives Hale Boggs and Nick Begich, whose plane disappeared Oct. 16.

title: Taipei Officials Describe Theirs Main Concern Now as Survival
description: TAIPEI, TaiwanThe senior Chinese Nationalist official leaned forward in his chair, clasped his hands in front of him, and said intently: You asked how we feel about things today?, Of course; we are preoccupied with our survival. We have our backs to the wall.

title: M'GOVERN ASSERTS NIXON MISLEADS NATION ON PEACE
description: Senator George McGovern declared here last night that the war in Vietnam was intensifying rather than coming to an end, and that President Nixon had deliberately misled the nation into believing peace was near.

title: POLICE KILL GUNMAN AT QUEENS THEATER
description: A young gunman was shot to death by two policemen yesterday afternoon when he tried to hold up Keith's Flushing Theater on Northern Boulevard at Main Street in Queens, the police reported.

title: Stock Exchanges ,Banks, Schools Shut Tomorrow
description: The stock exchanges, banks and public schools in the city will be closed tomorrow for Election Day. Many stores are to remain open and liquor sales will be permitted under a new state law.

title: Wings Tie Penguins, 11
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (AP) Mickey Redmond scored his sixth goal of the season at 15 minutes 3 seconds of the third period tonight to give the Red Wings a 11 tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins. The deadlock was the first for born clubs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GROUP TO COUNTER ANTIISRAEL TALK
description: LONG BEACH, L.I., Nov. 5The establishment of a commission of educators, scholars and rabbis to combat indifference and hostility toward Israel and Judaism among leftist Jewish students was announced here today.

title: Notes on People
description: Mayor Carmen Orechio of Nutley is promising to reassume control of the busing program in his city and hardly anyone is complaining.

title: Pact May Face Delay
description: BONN, Nov. 5Lastminute wishes voiced by members of Chancellor Willy Brandt's coalition Cabinet may delay conclusion of negotiations between the two German states on basic treaty, officials reported this evening.

title: 3 SCHOOLS SHARE LEAD IN FOOTBALL
description: St. Francis, Holy Family and St. John The Baptist all won yesterday and remained tied in the Catholic Schools Football League. Each has won all six of the league games.

title: Bulgarian Capital: A Soviet Air
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Nov. 3One of the striking aspects of this Bulgarian capital is the profusion of monuments to Russia, past and present, streets named for Russians, and stores, cinemas and restaurants with names like Moskva, Lenin and Russian Club.

title: 4 SEIZED IN MURDER OF BROOKLYN WOMAN
description: Three men and a woman were arrested yesterday morning in the death of a Brooklyn woman whose nude body was found in a stolen panel truck in the Bushwick section.

title: F.B.I. Aide Linked to Circulation of White House Political Request
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5An investigation of how a controversial White House request for electionyear political advice was circulated to F.B.I. offices has placed key responsibility on a top assistant to the acting bureau director, L. Patrick Gray 3d, a reliable informant said today.

title: A BlueCollar Voter Discusses His Switch to Nixon
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 4John E. Hazuda Sr. a 42yearold boilermaker has always voted for the Democratic Presidential candidate. This Election Day he is going to vote for President Nixon.

title: State LowIncome Housing Plan Is at a Standstill in Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 5Six months after the State Urban Development Corporation announced plans to build 900 units of low and moderateincome housing in Westchester County, the socalled Nine Towns Program is at a virtual standstill.

title: COVERN ASSERTS NIXON MISLEADS NATION ON PEACE
description: Senator George McGovern declared here last night that the war in Vietnam was intensifying rather than coming to an end, and that President Nixon had deliberately misled the nation into believing peace was near.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Train Crash Recreated
description: CHICAGO. Nov. 5 (AP)The crash of two Illinois Central commuter trains was recreated today, but investigators refused to disclose what conclusions were reached. Fortyfour persons were killed in the accident Oct. 30.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: AARON'S 209 WINS IN JAPANESE GOLF
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 5 (AP) Tommy Aaron of Gainesville, Ga., won the individual title and led the United States to an 18stroke victory over Japan today in the second team golf match between the countries.

title: Blues, Sabres in Deadlock
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 5 (UPI)Frank St. Marseille deflected shot by Chris Evans into the Buffalo net in the second period tonight to give the St. Louis Blues a 11 tie with the Sabres.

title: Factory is Bombed
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 5, (Reuters)  A bomb squad from the militant Protestant Ulster Defense Association attacked a small factory in the Irish Republic today in stated retaliation for republican guerrilla bombings in Northern Ireland.

title: HOTA REGISTERS SOCCER SURPRISE
description: For InterGiuliana, the defending champion of the GermanAmerican Soccer League, New York Hota has been a nuisance most of the time the teams have met in the last six years, but yesterday's loss stung more than usual because it meant elimination from the United States Challenge Cup.

title: Marksmanship Tested in Turkey Shoot; Frozen Birds Are West Windsor Prizes
Two Queens Men Arrested After a Drug Investigation
description: Queens detectives arrested two Long Island City men yesterday on charges of the sale and possession of dangerous drugs and possession of deadly weapons after a fourmonth investigation.

title: Adriana Maliponte Makes Solid Debut As Juliette at Met
description: Romeo had a new Juliette Saturday night, as Adriana Maliponte portrayed Gounod's heroine for the first time at the Metropolitan Opera. The soprano has done consistently fine work here since her debut (as Mimi) in the spring of 1971, and she did not disappoint this time either.

title: SkiTown Split on Winter Olympics
description: STEAMBOAT SPRINGS, Colo., Nov. 2  This is the mountain resort that refers to itself as SkiTown, U. S. A. and boasts that it has sent more of its sons and daughters to winter Olympic games than any other city, suburb or hamlet in America.

title: Needham to Moscow
description: James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, has accepted an invitation to visit Moscow later this week as a guest of the Bank of Foreign Trade of the Soviet Union. Page 65.

title: Hawks Tie on Late Goal
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (UPI) Pit Martin scored with 3:40 to play, less than a halfminute after an apparent Chicago goal was disallowed, to give the Black Hawks a 33 tie tonight with the California Golden Seals.

title: Elsewhere On The Ballot
description: I didn't know I was a candidate, protested Florence Quigley of Brooklyn. You mean my name's on the ballot?

title: Cambodia Offers Khmer Rouge Amnesty
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 5President Lon Nol has offered complete amnesty to all members of the Khmer Rouge the Cambodian rebel forces who have been fighting as allies with the North Vietnamese and Vietcong against the Cambodian Government.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Chapot Is Victor Twice In Horse Show Jumping
76ers Lose 13th in Row
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 5 (AP)Gary Gregor, a reserve forward, got 21 points and 15 rebounds tonight as Milwaukee handed Philadelphia its 13th defeat without victory, 131113.

title: Work Starts Today on Repairs To the Queens Midtown Tunnel
description: The first phase of construetion in the $3.2million rehabilitation of the Queens Midtown Tunnel between the toll plaza and Gale Avenue in Long Island City, Queens, is to begin today.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Nostalgia is but one of the reasons modern furniture designers, manufacturers and importers are receiving ideas from the turnofthecentury through the nineteen twenties. Another is that the proliferation of innovative furnishings which characterized the nineteen sixties, particularly in Italy, has slowed.

title: HIJACKER SEIZED Al TOKIO AIRPORT Demanded $2Million and a Flight to Cuba While He Held 126 as Hostages;
description: TOKYO, Monday, Nov. 6A Japanese was captured at 4 o'clock this afternoon after he had hijacked a Japan Air Lines Boeing 727 airliner, held 120 passengers and six crew members hostage for over seven hours, and demanded $2million and a flight to Cuba.

title: Mrs. Abzug and Mrs. Ryan, On TV Exchange Charges
description: Leaders in the labor movement who are opposing Senator McGovern form the primary backing for Priscilla Ryan in her campaign to succeed her late husband in the 20th Congressional District Representative Bella S. Abzug charged yesterday as the two candidates clashed over which one now has the Reform Democrat support that repeatedly elected Representative William F. Ryan.

title: CHICANOS REPORT FACTIONAL STRIFE
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5The leader of the Brown Berets, once called the shock troops of the Chicano movement, says he expects the organization to dissolve within three months because of a threat of factional violence.

title: Baba, ExInsurance Salesman, Is Now a Yogi Here
description: A former insurance salesman who is now a guru named Baba has been sitting from dawn to midnight for the last five months on a bench at the corner of 86th Street and Central Park West. He meditates and preaches to New Yorkers who have heard of him and to passersby attracted by his gentle mien.

title: Houston Hijacking Suspect Depicted as Extreme in Word and Deed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Charles Andrew Tuner, accused hijacker. killer and wouldbe bank robber, was a handsome, aggressive. $26,000 ayear Washington bureaucrat who apparently believed the American dream could belong to everyone and worked to make it so.

title: KAMMER DUO MAKES DEBUT AT CARNEGIE
description: The Kammer Duo of David Snively, clarinet, and Byron Franklin, piano, made its New York debut Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hall. Both musicians live in Florida (where, in.addition to their team efforts, Mr. Franklin is an organ recitalist, Mr. Snively a member of the Fort Lauderdale Symphony) and both play with secure technical control and confident ensemble giveandtake.

title: JETLINER WITH 127 HIJACKED IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Monday, Nov. 6A Japan Air Lines Boeing 727 jet liner was hijacked this morning by two men who demanded $2million and bigger plane to fly them to Cuba.

title: Street Venders Being Carted Away by Police Trucks
description: Big Jimmy and Bucky and several others had escaped this time around, but The Brain Surgeon had not, so he was atop the police's peddler detail truck along with his pretzel, chestnut and peanut pushcartbeing transported, for perhaps the 100th time, to the 14th Precinct.

title: Oil Companies Announce
description: The Union Oil Company of California and the Charter Company have announced jointly a successful new pool wildcat discovery in Lake Maracaibo, Venezuela. The new well, Centro44X, produced 2,400 barrels a day during a recent test, the joint announcement said.

title: Advertising.
description: Never has so much been spent to say so little to so many, a leading agency executive said yesterday in commenting on the advertising campaigns for the two major Presidential candidates.

title: Orr Out Until After Jan.1
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)The Boston Bruins hockey star, Bobby Orr, is expected to remain out of the lineup until after Jan. 1, his Toronto attorney, R. Alan Eagleseon, said today. Orr is undergoing therapy to rebuild his left knee, which has had three operations.

title: Vietnamese Yearn for the Peace Not Quite at Hand
description: THUTHUA, South Vietnam, Nov. 3  Trinh Van Tuong, a mahoganycolored man whose world is his rice field, is living with a new kind of excitement that makes him almost bounce when he talks. After all these years, peace seems finally to be within grasp.

title: Beauty Treatment Has Earthy Charm
description: Anybody want to buy some mud? Nice, clean Arizona mud? That's what George F. Dembow Jr., former New Yorker with a master's degree in business administration, former construction executive and, more recently, an airlines president is selling. When a friend first tried to sell him the mud, he thought it was crazy, too. The mud is a pleasant reddish brown color, smells like nothing at all and sells for $5 in a 6ounce jar labeled DowntoEarth. Mr. Dembow, a tall, lean, trimlytailored man, says quite a lot of people are slathering it on their faces and coming out cleaner and smoother when they wash it off.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Doctor Held as Bail Jumper
description: A Washington physician convicted last month on a narcotics distribution charge and given a week to post $25,999 bond was arraigned here on bailjumping charge, officials reported yesterday. The physician, Dr. Thomas William Moore Jr., 39 years old, surrendered to federal agents last week at Kennedy International Airport after allegedly returning from Europe. Federal officials said that the doctor had been director of a methadone clinic in Washington.

title: Our Quadrennial Orgy of Politics
description: For far too many of us the Presidential election is a quadrennial orgy of absorption in political matters, all centering around the single issue of the identity of the man who will serve as President for the next four years.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6  About 30,000 party workers, mostly volunteers, but some paid, and including lawyers, telephone operators, babysitters and even hired elevator repairmen, were being mobilized today by the New Jersey Nixon and McGovern forces to get out the vote tomorrow.

title: Two Children Die in Fire In Newburgh Apartment
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Nov. 6 (UPI)Two children died when fire swept their firstfloor apartment here today. They were identified as Hyram Cline, 21 months old, and his sister, Christine, 6.

title: People and Business
description: Andrew Allen, the 61yearold dissident director on the board of the Penn Central Company, has lost his fight to have the proxy material for the company's 1972 annual meeting declared in violation of Federal securities laws.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 6Job prospects for New Jersey college students, especially those majoring in engineering and accounting, appear brighter this year than at any time since 1969, according to college placement officials.

title: Reginald Owen Is Dead at 85; Star of the Stage and Screen
description: BOISE, Idaho, Nov. 6Reginald Owen, whose international film and stage career spanned some 70 years, died here yesterday of a heart attack. He was 85 years old.

title: FORD AGAIN SEEKING $92ACAR PRICE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Ford Motor Company reapplied to the Price Commission today, for permission to increase prices on 1973model passenger, cars by an average of $92.

title: About Pro Football
description: The major confrontation this Sunday will be the Detroit Lions against the Vikings in Minnesota and the loser of this nationally televised contest will suffer a blow to its playoff possibilities. Both teams played well in winning last Sunday and the fact that the Lions have lost nine straight games to Minnesota bothers them tremendously. I've never had a good game against the Vikings, says Greg Landry, the Detroit quarterback who has had many good ones against others.

title: Income Increases 16%
description: The City Investing Company, a conglomerate in the fields of financial services, housing and land development and manufacturing, had a 16 per cent higher operating income in the third quarter of $15.9million, or 43 cents a share, compared to $13.8million, or 38 cents, in the period last year.

title: Syracuse Tire Executive Reported Missing on Flight
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Nov. 6 (AP)  The state police said today that the family of a Syracuse businessman had reported him missing on a flight in his private plane from Albany to Syracuse.

title: DEMOCRAT GAINS
description: Amid predictions of a Nixon landslide, more than 80 million Americans will go to the polls today to confirm or confound the forecasters in their choice of a President.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Off at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Port Notes
description: The Navy's Military Sealift Command, the shipping agency for the armed forces, usually develops its own special ships.

title: Screen: Indian's Tentative 'U-Turn':A Secretive Irishman Is Played by Ellis First Vadehra Movie at Whitney Museum
description: Sean, the hero of Dave Vadehra's "U-Turn," is a young Irishman living in Dublin who drives north to his home in troubled Belfast to visit his dying mother. Along the way he nurses his ancient car, keeps calling home (no answer), picks up a girl hitchhiker, gives her the car and sees her taken into custody at a checkpoint by British soldiers.He continues into Belfast by foot and borrowed rides. He arrives too late for his mother's death but just in time to be arrested under the Special Powers Act, by which suspects may be detained incommunicado and without recourse to judicial proceeding.About the arrest, imprisonment and torture we have known from the beginning, by way of a series of flashes forward that keep interrupting the drive to Belfast. But the reason for the arrest, and whether Sean actually is an exiled revolutionary, we do not knowor at least we are never told. Sean says very little and very little is said about him. "U-Turn" is full of overheard talkin pubs, on Dublin streetsbut about its central action it is almost silent and very secretive.The characterization of Sean, by Brendon Ellis, enforces a sense of secretiveness, as with shy, slightly sullen persistence he avoids saying what he is about and what, besides his mother's sickness, motivates him. Sean might almost inhabit the private spaces typical of the later films of Robert Bresson, and if "U-Turn" were a better movie, Bresson's cinema would be a logical comparison.Bresson's cinema is made up not merely of ideas, but also of a marvelously precise judgment for feeling and gesture and of a passion  spiritual or romantic that there is a point in being secretive about. None of this, neither the precision nor the passion is evident in "U-Turn," which ultimately fails to rise above its intentional ordinariness, its concern with a trivial objectivity.Despite the great public issues at stake, the film doesn't seem to have found a way of annexing a subject; though it has a Subject at hand. This is not uninteresting film making; but it is too tentative, and in a sense too modest, for its own ambitions."U-Turn," the first venture of Dave Vadehra, an Indian film maker now living in America, opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum.

title: Bridge: 3 New York Experts to Make Debuts in International Play
description: The North American zonal representation in the 1973 world championship in. South America will have a strong New York emphasis.

title: 2 GERMAN STATES AGREE ON TREATY FOR FORMAL TIES
description: BERLIN, Nov. 6West Germany and East Germany completed negotiations this evening on a treaty to establish formal relations between their two states, founded in bitter hostility 23 years ago.

title: Edwin Simpson, ExAide To Rockefeller, Dies at 65
description: LACONIA, N.H., Nov. 6 (AP) Edwin Simpson, a former administrative assistant to Governor Rockefeller, died Friday after a brief illness. He was 65 years old.

title: 5 Landing Sites on Mars Picked for Missions in 76
description: Five broad plains on Mars have been identified by space agency scientists as the potential landing sites of two unmanned Viking spacecraft in the summer of 1976.

title: KENNETH SHAND SR.
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Nov. 6Kenneth R. Shand Sr., chairman and former president of the First Federal Savings and Loan Association of Montclair, died today at his home, 206 Midland Avenue. His age was 90.

title: SHOP TALK
description: As any Gucci lover will tell you, Gucci clothes are handsome, timeless and carry a generous price tag. The store continued the tradition in its recent fall and winter collection with several striking suede coats and costumes. A princessstyled coat in a rich green suede has bell sleeves and contrasting white leather piping. The price is $695. Sude skirts in shades of beige, brown or gray begin at $150 and pants at $185.

title: Steel Production Declined for Week To 2,626,000 Tons
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 4 fell for the second consecutive week, dipping to 2,626,000 net tons, or 0.8 per cent below the 2,646,000 tons :reported in the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel In salute said yesterday. The in dustry's production index slipped to 107.6 from 108.5 a week ago and 110.7 in the week ended Oct. 21 when the decline began.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. to discuss a draft resolution on prohibition of force in international relations and permanent prohibition of the use of nuclear weapons.

title: Vietnam River Life: A Family's Struggle Along Sampan Alley
description: HUE, South Vietnam  A dead rat floats down the sluggish water of Sampan Alley where children brush their teeth, and women scrub babies, clothes, and dishes. Men dump garbage in the canal and everyone uses it as a toilet. It is also the home of the Tran family who live on a sampan there.

title: Suit Settlement Delay On Agronomics Is Asked
description: The American Agronomics Corporation disclosed in Miami yesterday that it had encountered a new problem in resolving a suit filed against it by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: COLTS URN BACK PATRIOTS BY 2447
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Nov. (AP)Bruce Laird set up a pair of thirdperiod touchdowns with a fumble recovery and a long kickoff return and the Baltimore Colts snapped a fourgame losing streak tonight with a 2417 victory oven the New England Patriots.

title: Cancer Drive Leader To Head 3d Campaign
description: The appointment of the publisher John L. McGraw for the third consecutive year as chairman of the American Cancer Society's New York division drive for funds was announced yesterday by Paul W. Williams, the division's chairman of the board.

title: U.S. Troop Cut of 1,500 Is Largest in 9 Weeks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 6 (Reuters)The United States command announced today that 1,500 American troops left South Vietnam last week, the largest withdrawal in nine weeks. This left 32,200 United States servicemen in the country.

description: To the Editor:

description: Representatives of 30 national and neighborhood Jewish groups, ranging from the Hassidic to the secular, gathered at City Hall yesterday in what they called a historic occasion, brought together by concern for poor Jews in the city who are not cared for under the antipoverty programs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WALDHEIM SEES MAYOR ON OFFICES
description: UNITED NATIONS N. Y., Nov, 6  Secretary General Waldheim met with Mayor Lindsay, and officials of the United Nations Development Corporation in an effort to find a solution to the problem posed by the shortage office space for the United Nations and its related agencies.

description: TRENTON, Nov. 6 (AP)The State Transportation Department announced today that the Route 7 bridge between Kearny and Jersey City would be closed Wednesday during daylight hours for repairs.

title: Market Place: Broker he Naivete Naivete al Estate
description: Wall Street has always been fascinated by real estate. After all, practically everybody down there owns his own homepart of it, anyway. And real estate values have soared over the years.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)The Securities and Exchange Commission ordered an investigation today to determine whether the Geier Letter Inc., a registered investment adviser, and its president, Michael S. Geier, had violated Federal securities laws.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether New York can constitutionally reimburse churchrelated schools for costs of pupiltesting and recordkeeping that are required by state law.

description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Tuesday, Nov. 7 (Agence France Presse)Piping Lane scored a narrow victory over the top New Zealand mare, Magnifique, today in the $103,000 Melbourne Cup at Flemington. Favored Gunsynd finished third. Double Irish, a stablemate of Piping Lane, was fourth.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: The following table lists the number of electoral votes assigned to each state and the District of Columbia in today's Presidential election and the pollclosing time for each. A total of 270 electoral votes is needed to elect a President. All times given are Eastern standard.

description: MONTREAL, Nov. 6 (AP)Lord Killanin, president of the International Olympic Committee, said today he was very impressed and very happy with the progress made so far by the organizing committee for the 1976 Summer Olympics.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Tokyo Policemen Thwart a Hijacking, Seizing Japanese From U.S. in Plane
description: TOKYO, Nov. 6Daring policemen blocked a hijacking today by capturing a Japanese of many aliases on a plane he had wanted to carry him to Cuba.

title: IN THE NATION
description: On Oct. 26, while he was announcing that peace is at hand in Vietnam, Dr. Henry Kissinger said with what appeared to be an unimpeachable dignity and pride, that while it is possible to disagree with provisions of an agreement, the implication that this is all a gigantic maneuver which we will revoke as soon as this period is over is unworthy of what we have gone through.

description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 6 Senator George McGovern, still urging Americans to come home to their ideals by supporting his Presidential candidacy, mingled confidence with hope as he headed home himself tonight to South Dakota.

title: Business Briefs
description: Two leading retail, chains yesterday reported higher sales in October compared to the same 1971 month. The reports follow similar gains disclosed last week by other large retailers.

description: Penn State again was a unanimous choice yesterday in the sixth weekly voting for the Lambert Trophy, given annually to the East's top major college football team. Yale jumped to the No. 2 spot.

description: The three television networks, one of them hampered by a strike of its cameramen and other technicians, plan to spend an estimated total of about $9million bringing election returns to some 150 million Viewers tonight.

description: There are men and women working at 110 Livingston Street, in downtown Brooklyn, who think they know how the people in the British Colonial Office felt when the colonies asserted their independence and the empire started crumbling.

description: The New York City Taxi Drivers Union has agreed to submit to binding arbitration its longstanding contract dispute with the fleet owners, Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, said yesterday.

title: Agnew Aide Named
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 6 (UPI)Details of Senator Eagleton's hospitalizations were made known to someone in the office of Vice President Agnew before they were made public, The St. Louis PostDispatch said today.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Nov. 6 (AP)  Former President Harry Truman and his wife have requested absentee ballots for the election tomorrow, the Jackson County Board of Election Commissioners said today. Mr. Truman is 88 years old and Mrs. Truman is 87. Until this year, the former President and his wife voted in person.

title: Vietnamese Yearn for the Peace Not Quite at Hand
description: THUTHUA, South Vietnam, Nov. 3  Trinh Van Tuong, a mahoganycolored man whose world is his rice field, is living with a new kind of excitement that makes him almost bounce when he talks. After all these years, peace seems finally to be within grasp.

title: U.S. REPORTS LOSS OF 3 HELICOPTERS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 7 (AP)Enemy gunners shot down three United States helicopters within 14 miles of Danang Sunday, killing two Americans and wounding three, the United States command announced yesterday.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: HELENA, Mont.. Nov. 6 (AP)  The Helena Independent Record has pulled back from an endorsement of President Nixon with an editorial entitled: Weep America, and Then Vote.

title: Personalities: Majors Preview?
description: Frank Robinson, often mentioned as likely to be the major league's first black manager, got some onthejob training in the Puerto Rico Baseball League. The Los Angeles Dodgers outfielder, who manages Santurce in the winter league, was thrown out of a game in an argument with Ron Hanson, the umpire... Roberto Clemente, the Pittsburgh outfielder, said yesterday in Ponce, P. R., that he understood the Pirates were actively working on a trade to get Steve Carlton, the Philadelphia Phillies Cy Young Award winner. In Philadelphia, Paul Owens, the general manager, said, The last time I talked with Joe Brown [the Pirates general manager] was at the World Series and it was social talk,

title: Records of Donors To Nixon Campaign Are Given to Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Seven filing cabinet drawers of records containing the list of stillundisclosed contributors of an estimated $10million to President Nixon's reelection campaign were delivered to the United States Courthouse here today and placed under tight security.

title: U.S. SEES TALKS WITH HANOI SOON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  A high Nixon Administration official said without qualification today that efforts to resume negotiations with North Vietnam on ending the Indochina conflict were on track and that somemovement would become apparent in a few, days.

title: Theft of Beams Investigated
description: PARKERSBURG, W. Va., Nov. 6 (AP)The police are investigating the theft of twelve 1,000pound steel beams last week from the construction site of an office building. The authorities said the beams were 35 feet long.

title: Sports of The Times
description: At least we'll find out in this game how good a team we really are, said Joe Namath one day last week. He spoke of the upcoming Redskin game with a lot more confidence than he actually felt before the JetColt collision in the Super Bowl a few years ago, a lucky popoff that forever cemented his reputation as a peerless prophet. That's when he not only predicted the Jets would score a titanic upset, but also helped produce it later.

title: BLACKS HERE MARK DAY OF SOLIDARITY
description: Black students in many city schools stayed away from classes yesterday in accordance with a call for a black day of absence, the fourth annual observance of Black Solidarity Day.

title: 17 Restaurants Among 30 Places With 2d Health Code Violations
description: Thirty food establishments, including 17 restaurants, were accused by the Health Services Administration yesterday of having failed to correct, violations of the city's Health Code on a second inspection.

title: Ramsey Clark Asserts He Saw F.B.I. Report on Eagleton Health
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) Ramsey Clark, former Attorney General, says that while he was in the Justice Department he read a Federal Bureau of Investigation file on Senator Thomas F. Eagleton that included details of the Missouri Senator's treatment for exhaustion and depression.

title: Eviction of Indians by U.S. Delayed by Appeals Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A Federal judge gave the Government permission today to retake the Bureau of Indian Affairs building from militant Indians, but a Federal appeals court stayed the order until Wednesday.

title: BROTHER OF JAVITS LOSES HIS APPEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  A long legal struggle by Benjamin, A. Javits, brother and former law partner of Senator Jacob K. Javits, to overturn his threeyear suspension from law practice failed today in the Supreme Court.

title: A CHAIR IN MUSIC ENDOWED AT YALE
description: The Samuel Simons Sanford Professorship of Music has been created and endowed by an anonymous gift honoring the first professor of applied music in the Yale School of Music, it was announced recently by Philip F. Nelson, dean of the school.

title: E. M. Kresky Weds Mary McAniff
description: Miss Mary J. McAniff, assistant secretary to Governor Rockefeller for intergovernmental relations, was married here yesterday afternoon to Edward M. Kresky, a vice president with Wertheim & Co., Inc.

title: Mundine Stops Lee in 2d
description: NOUMEA, New Caledonia, Nov. 6 (UPI)Tony Mundine of Australia knocked out Roy Lee of Jamaica today in the second round of their middleweight bout before 3,000 spectators.

title: Citizens or Sheep
description: Politicians and political scientists will continue to disagree over the impact of polls on elections. Pollsters naturally deny that their activities have any distorting effect. Be that as it may, these samplings are a legitimate part of the free election process, whether used as instruments of public enlightenment or of campaign propatanda.

title: British Step Similar to Nixon's in '71
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The 90day wage and price freeze imposed today by Prime Minister Heath in Britain is similar on its face to a measure by President Nixon 15 months ago, but there are differences that may make the freeze harder to carry out in Britain.

title: Tristate Area Candidates Mount Final Vote Drives
description: Candidates from the national to the town level wound up their campaigns in New York, NeW Jersey and Connecticut last night with handshaking stints at subway stations, speeches before community groups or pep talks to party workers hours before the polls would open.

title: 2 GERMAN STATES AGREE ON TREATY FOR FORMAL TIES
description: BERLIN, Nov. 6West Germany and East Germany completed negotiations this evening on a treaty to establish formal relations between their two states, founded in bitter hostility 23 years ago.

title: Salute to Hammerstein Will Be Held Sunday
description: A salute to the late Oscar Hammerstein 2d will be held Sunday at Philharmonic Hall for the benefit of the American Academy of Dramatic Arts and the George Junior Republic, a selfgoverning high school in Freeville, N.Y.

title: Election Day Closings Set
description: The nation's major securities and commodities markets will he closed today. Election Day. In major financial centersNew York, Chicago, Detroit and Philadelphiabanks will also be closed today. Banks in most other areas will remain open.

title: Shopping Spree Is Awaited in Chile as Strikes End
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. (AP)  Chileans overflowed buses, jammed stores and bumped into each other on Santiago's yellowtiled sidewalks today as the country marked the end of the worst strike in its history.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay signed into law yesterday an amendment to the city's administrative code insuring that elderly tenants in rentcontrolled housing would not have to pay retroactively increases in rent allowed since Aug. 1, 1970.

title: Message Given by Dobrynin To U.S. Called Encouraging
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  United States officials said today that the Soviet Union had given an encouraging reply to United States proposals on the timing of preparatory talks on a European security conference and a conference on troop reductions in Europe.

title: Ladies Room Is Delayed
description: The Off Broadway opening of A Quarter for the Ladies Room, scheduled for tonight at the Village Gate, has been postponed until Sunday because of throat viruses suffered by two cast members, Norma Donaldson and Judy MacMurdo. The musical has book and lyrics by Ruth Batchelor and score by John Clifton and Arthur Siegel.

title: The Talk of Greenville, Miss.
description: GREENVILLE, Miss., Nov. 4In New Orleans, the best parties are given during hurricanes. Greenville operates on the same rule, that there is no better time for a party than a period of trial or trouble.

title: HARRY E. MACDONALD OF ENGINEERCONCERN
description: Harry E. MacDonald, a retired consulting management engineer, died Saturday in the Veterans Administration Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 77 years old and lived in Vero Beach, Fla.

title: Bay State Jobless Rate Dips
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)Unemployment in Massachusetts declined from 7.5 per cent of the work force in August to 6.7 per cent in September, the state Division of Employment Security reported today, but it called the decline largely seasonal. Adjusted to remove seasonal factors, the state said, the jobless rate moved insignificantly frm 7.5 per cent to 7.4 per cent. Richard C. Gilliland, director of the division, said that little improvement occurred in the Massachusetts economy in September.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CAPITOL PROTESTS UPHELD BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) The Supreme Court affirmed today an order invalidating a Federal law that prohibited largescale demonstrations on the grounds of the Capitol.In a brief order the Court upheld a threejudge Federal panel that on June 22 ruled the law unconstitutional.

title: Mailman Is Accused Of Slaying Partner In Staged Robbery
description: A 21yearold mailman was charged last night with murdering a man with whom he had allegedly staged a phony $30,000 mail theft in June and who was preparing to testify against him in their upcoming Federal trial.

title: French Academy of Sciences Honors 2 U.S. Biologists
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (AP)The French Academy of Sciences announced today that it had awarded its most important prize for biological sciences, valued at about $24,000, to Prof. Robert W. Briggs of Indiana University and to Prof. Thomas J. King of Georgetown University.

title: BRITAIN FREEZES WAGES ANDPRICES ININFLATIONFIGHT
description: LONDON, Nov. 6Prime Minister Heath today announced a 90day freeze on wages, prices, rents and dividends in a dramatic bid to curb inflation.

title: 2,000 Parents Shout Down An Agreement in Canarsie
description: At a tumultuous meeting in a Canarsie school last night, white parents and other community residents shouted down leaders of their parentteacher associations who had sought approval of an agreement to end the sevenday boycott over the admission of black children from Brownsville to John Wilson Junior High School 211 in Canarsie.

title: DEMOCRAT GAINS
description: Amid predictions of a Nixon landslide, more than 80 million Americans will go to the polls today to confirm or confound the forecasters in their choice of a President.

title: Japan and Taiwan Plan Group to Keep Liaison
description: TOKYO, Nov. 6 (AP) Japan and the Chinese Nationalists on Taiwan have agreed to set up a liaison office here to maintain trade and other nondiplomatic relations, Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ohira said today.

title: AMEX PRICES UP; 0TC MARKET OFF
description: The American Stock Exchange outperformed the overthecounter market yesterday and turned in its fifth consecutive advance in moderate trading.

title: Senior Citizen's Group Charges Lie in Nixon Election Pamphlet
description: Stung by President Nixon's Oct. 30 veto of a bill to extend the Older Americans Act, the National Council of Senior Citizens accused the Administration yesterday of a cynical campaign of trickery and outright propaganda directed at older voters.

title: Seattle Office Invaded
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 6 (UPI)Fifty Indians invaded the Bureau of Indian Affairs office here today and began a sitin to support the protest in Washington.

title: Father, 2 Sons and Third Youth Indicted in Texas Jet Hijacking
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 6The Department of Justice announced here today the indictment of Charles A. Tuller, his two teenaged sons and another youth on charges of air piracy and kidnapping in the hijacking Oct. 29 of a jetliner to Cuba.

title: I.T.T. Gets Hotline Contract
description: RAMSEY, N. J., Nov. 6 (UPI) The Soviet Union awarded I.T.T. Space Communications a $Imillion contract for earthstation equipment to improve the White HouseKremlin hotline, the International Telephone & Telegraph Corporation announced today. The new communication network will link Washington and Moscow via satellite. The existing hotline is a landline cable teleprinter, passing through London, Copenhagen, Stockholm and Helsinki.

title: Marburger Renomination Vote Appears Near in Jersey Senate
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6In a dramatic reversal of earlier predictions, the State Senate's Republican leadership said today that the controversial renomination of Dr. Carl L. Marburger as State Commissioner ofl Education now stood a good chance of being released from the Senate Judiciary Committee next week.

title: ROCKET FOUL GAME AWARDED TO SQUIRES
description: The controversial foul game between the Virginia Squires and Denver Rockets on Oct. 26 has been forfeited to the Squires. Robert Carlson, commissioner of the American Basketball Association, made the ruling yesterday.

title: Reluctant Witness In Brewster Trial Is Ordered Jailed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) A witness was ordered jailed today by a Federal District judge at the bribery trial of Daniel B. BrewSter, former Senatory of Maryland, after the witness refused to answer some of the prosecutor's questions.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: TORQUAY, England, Nov. 6 (AP)Clark Graebner of New York routed George Szakacs of Australia, 60, 60, in the fourth tournament of the Dewar Cup indoor tennis series today. Graebner was the losing finalist in the third tournament on Saturday.

title: Talks Suspended in Strike Against Shipping on Coast
description: Suspension of negotiations In the West Coast maritime strike.was announced here late last night by J. Curtis Counts, director of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service.

title: P.B.A. and City Detective Unit Score Rule on Christmas Gifts
description: The presidents of the Detectives Endowment Association and the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association threatened lawsuits yesterday against proposed new rules to combat the problem of Christmas gratuities among the 1,500 detectives and 400 patrolmen in Manhattan's detective division.

title: Opponent Heads Home
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 6  Senator George McGovern, still urging Americans to come home to their ideals by supporting his Presidential candidacy, mingled confidence with hope as he headed home himself tonight to South Dakota.

title: Veterans Against the War Deny Plot to Disrupt G.O.P. Parley
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Nov. 6 Seven members of the Vietnam Veterans Against the War and a nonveteran supporter pleaded not guilty today to charges stemming from an alleged conspiracy to disrupt the Republican National Convention.

title: PARIS MUSEUM GETS 15 MORE MONET OILS
description: PARIS, Nov. 6The Marmottan Museum has added 15 more paintings by. Claude Monet to the 75 it already houses, in the world's most comprehensive collection of works by the impressionist master.

title: COL. TUVIA ARYEH, PARATROOPER, 58
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 6  Lieut. Col. Tuvia Aryeh, one of Israel's most famous soldiers, was killed yesterday at the age of 58 in a parachute accident in the Republic of Zaire, formerly the Congo.

title: Chess: Book Recounts Games and Wit in U.S. Championship
description: The most recent addition to tournament literature is Burt Hochberg's Title ChessThe 1972 United States Chess Championship, available in hardcover for $6.00 from the U. S. Chess Federation, 479 Broadway, Newburgh, N.Y. 12550.

title: BANKERS FORESEE STABILIZED POUND
description: PARIS, Nov. 6Prime Minister Heath's wageprice freeze was seen by bankers on the Continent today as a measure that should help stabilize the pound for at least the next few weeks.

title: Chicago &
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 6 (AP)The Chicago & North Western Railway said today it had placed an $8.5million order for 500 covered hopper carsthe carier's first major equipment acquisition since it became employe owned this year.

title: Eviction of Indians Delayed on Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A Federal judge gave the Government permission today to retake the Bureau of Indian Affairs building from militant Indians, but a Federal appeals court stayed the order until Wednesday.

title: Krumm Named to Top Post By U.S. Olympic Committee
description: Despite cries for wholesale revisions, the United States Olympic Committee followed traditional practices yesterday and rewarded its first vice president, Philip 0. Krumm of Kenosha, Wis., with the nomination for president of the quadrennial leading to the 1976 Olympics.

title: Pound Value Up 1.1 Cents Following British. Freeze
description: LONDON, Nov. 6The pound rose 1.1 cents to $2.3575 today on Prime Minister Health's announcement of a 90day freeze on wages and prices.

title: College Sports Notes
description: Villanova University is studying the possibility of dropping varsity football while Fordham University, which reinstituted the sport at the varsity level two years ago, plans to give five scholarships to football players each year starting next fall

title: Mistrial Declared in Trial of Reputed Mafia Figure
description: State Supreme Court Justice Frank J. Blangiardo declared a mistrial yesterday in the weekold case involving perjury and contempt charges against James Napoli, a reputed Mafia leader. The move came as a surprise and both sides objected to the ruling.

title: FiatCitroen Association Runs Into Trouble
description: PARIS, Nov. 6The fouryearold association of France's Citroen Company and Italy's Fiat Company is running into trouble. It is the familiar story of a refusal to cede sovereignty in order to create a union.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: BEAUMONT, Tex., Nov. 6Sargent Shriver plunged through five states today, involving Kennedy memories and sounding more than ever like Hubert H. Humphrey with his hoarse exuberance in the face of ominous public opinion polls.

title: Election Day
description: Data on Election Day in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, including the effect it will have on services, will be found on Page 24.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: The last day before today's voting brought reports yesterday of intensifying interest, reflected by a tide of absentee ballots throughout the metropolitan area and election boards switchboards flooded with telephoned inquiries.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 6  Vice President Agnew's campaign ended today the way it began confidently and lowkey.

title: Net Assets Decline in Year At Alleghany Corporation
description: The Allegheny Corporation reported yesterday that its net assets as of Sept. 30 stood at $139.4million, or $16.19 a on its common stock, compared with $161.1million, or $18.231 a share, on the same date last year.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NIXON, Nov. 6 (UPI)Is Nixon for McGovern?

title: G. M. ANNOUNCES SPECIAL DIVIDEND
description: The General Motors Corporation announced yesterday a dividend of $1.65 cents a share, including a special payment of 80 cents a share.

title: Giants Still Able to Dream of Playoff Spot
description: The most important, and totally irrefutable, fact about the New York Giants is that they are able to spend Election Day today calculating pennant race possibilities.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif. Nov. 6 (AP) The American patty's Presidential candidate John G. Schmitz, today continued to forecast that he would score an upset victory in tomorrow's election.

title: CANARSIE BOYCOTT GOES TO 7TH DAY
description: A neartotal boycott of Canarsie schools went into its seventh day yesterday as new efforts were under way at 1Board of Education headquarters to end the bitter controversy in Brooklyn.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Mrs. Edward F. Cox, President Nixon's eldest daughter, declared yesterday that, although the preelection polls were encouraging, the only poll that really counts is the vote on election day.

title: High U.S. Aide Foresees Early Meeting With Hanoi
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A high Nixon Administration official said without qualification today that efforts to resume negotiations with North Vietnam on ending the Indochina conflict were on track and that some movement would become apparent in a few days.

title: French Reserves Are Steady
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (Reuters)France's gold and currency reserves stood at 45.5billion francs (about $11.9billion) at the end of October, unchanged from the September figure, the Finance Ministry said today. The ministry said the country's overall reserve figure includes 2.2million francs on account in the exchange stabilization fund.

title: STUYVESANT RACE DRAWS 15 ENTRIES

Owned by Frank McMahon, a West Coast breeder the industrialist, Triple Bend, the probable favorite, will carry 122 pounds and will be ridden by Laffit Pincay; a field of 15 horses is expected to run.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (UPI)The lowcost woolen industry in Britain faces a contracting market over the next six years, the wool intellgence publication of the Commonwealth secetariat said today. Its designs are not as bright and cheerful as those from Italy and its marketing methods need streamlining, using managers from outside the industry, the publication said.

title: Purge in Belgrade
description: The growing Western concern about recent trends in Yugoslavia will be deepened further by the news of the resignation of Serbian Communist leaders Marko Nikezic and Mrs. Latinka Perovic. Favorably known in the West for his earlier service as Yugoslavia's foreign minister and ambassador to this country, Mr. Nikezic as Serbian party chief had won wide repute as a partisan democratic decisionmaking and a market economy. The extent of political resentment in Serbia has been further underlined by the decision of Koca Popovic, formerly Yugoslavia's foreign minister and chief of its general staff, to resign from Yugoslavia's collective presidency.

title: Allende Plans to Visit U.N.
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Tuesday, Nov. 7 (Agence FrancePresse) President Salvador Allende Rossens of Chile will leave here at the end of the month to visit the United Nations, Mexico and Cuba, it was disclosed last night. A source close to the President said that Dr. Allende would address the General Assembly. He is expected to leave for New York on Nov. 27.

title: Nixon Defends Peace Bid
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 6President Nixon spent the last few moments of his reelection campaign tonight defending himself against Senator George McGovern's charge that he had deceived the American people about the prospects for a settlement in Vietnam.

title: Metal Concerns Report
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., reported yesterday gains in thirdquarter sales and earnings along with higher sales for the first nine months of this year. Net income, up in the quarter, slipped below the yearago level in the first nine months of 1972.

title: Spanish End Prison Mutiny And Free Four Hostages
description: MADRID, Nov. 6 (UPI)The Spanish police ended a 15hour mutiny today in the Tarragona prison and freed four persons, including a Catholic priest, who had been taken hostage at knife point.

title: PATROLMAN TELLS OF 1971 SHOOTING
description: He picked up what appeared to be a machine gun and fired at us through the window.

title: LOCKHEED PROFIT ROSE IN QUARTER
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation reported yesterday slightly higher earnings for the third quarter, but somewhat lower results for the ninemonth period compared with a year earlier.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: The Conservative party expects to poll 4400,000 to 500,000 votes in New York State, Kieran O'Doherty, state vice chairman of the party, said yesterday.

title: High School Class Is Told Secret of Writing Pop Hits
description: Estelle Levitt, a pop lyricist who finds flavor in Shakespeare, Heine, Mahler and the Rolling Stones, was telling the popularsongwriting class at Grover Cleveland High School yesterday that it was a good idea to get the hook in early.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Representatives of 30 national and neighborhood Jewish groups, ranging from Hassidic to secular, gathered at City Hall in Manhattan for what they called a historic occasion. Brought together by mutual concern for poor Jews in the city who are not cared for by antipoverty units, the organizations received the first fruits of unity a grant of $250,000 from the city for poor Jews.

title: Rev. Dr. James Robinson Dies; Founded Youth Group for Africa
description: The Rev. Dr. James H. Robinson, founder and executive director of Operation CrossroadsAfrica, which since 1957 has been giving black and white American and Canadian young people an experience of practical work in the independent countries of Africa, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 549 West 123d Street.

title: 2 PIANISTS CONTRAST IN CHOPIN TRIBUTE
description: One of the more intriguing aspects of the Tribute to Chopin in Carnegie Hall Sunday night was the contrasting approaches to the music taken by the two soloists, Adam Harasiewicz and Tadeusz Kerner.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  The Federal Reserve Board announced today that it had adopted amendments truthinlending regulations making clear that a $50 ceiling on unauthorized creditcard purchases applied to business as well as consumer use.

title: Italy's First Playboy Edition Is Seized by a Magistrate
description: ROME, Nov. 6A magistrate in Lodi, in northern Italy, today ordered the seizure of the first issue of the new Italian edition of Playboy magazine, which has been attacked by the left and right since its arrival on newsstands this month.

title: STOCKS EDGE UP IN ACTIVE SESSION
description: The stock market's preelection rallyin full swing last weeksimmered down yesterday as prices edged generally higher in another active session.

title: Handicapped Stage A Times Sq. Protest On Health Measures
description: A group of 15 handicapped men and women disrupted traffic in midtown for an hour during the evening rush hour yesterday to protest the Nixon Administration's health policies.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: ST. CHARLES COUNTY, Mo.  Dawn's light, which crept onstage as the sun rose behind heavy, dark clouds, revealed a wide expanse of brown marsh broken by clumps of willows and a row of hardwoods on the high ground at our backs.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) Dr. Benjamin Spock ended today his campaign as the Presidential candidate of the people's party, saying he was encouraged by the party's prospects in the election.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: PATTT POOl You+Moslle. Forever Happy Ann'yLove, Husband JAMESadvt.

title: Louisiana Students Still Hold Building; Police Action Hinted
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 6 (UPI) A black liberation flag fluttered over the studentheld administration building at Southern University today while school officials warned that the campus would be secured by the police.

title: Credit Markets
description: Bond prices continued their steep climb early yesterday before enthusiasm began to fade during the afternoon.

title: The Dance: Between Cute and Bland
description: For this final week of the City Center Dance Marathon at the ANTA Theater, the Dance Theater of Harlem is holding court, backed at some performances by the Gloria Newman Theater and at others, starting tonight, by the Sanasardo Dance Company.

title: F.T.C. Accuses Phillips And Sohio of Unfair Acts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Federal Trade Commission accused the Phillips Petroleum Company and the Standard Oil Company of Ohio today of anticompetitive and unfair practices.

title: ANDRES FERRARI, 56, OF EQUIPMENT FIRM
description: NEEDHAM HEIGHTS, Mass., Nov. 6Andres Ferrari, vice president for research since 1969 of the Damon Corporation, makers of electronic equipment for medical and educational purposes, died yesterday, apIlparently of a heart attack, at Ihis home in Weston. He was 56 years old.

title: WENTWORTHS TEAM FOR PIANO PROGRAM
description: Jean and Kenneth Wentworth have icing championed music for piano, four hands (as opposed to twopiano music), and Sunday night at Town Hall they presented a twointermissioned minimarathon devoted to the complete works in that form by the composer who more or less invented it in the first place, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.

title: Man in the News
description: An observer at yesterday's United States Olympic Committee meeting asked one official to cite Philip Otmar Krumm's qualifications to lead the committee at such a critical period. He doesn't have to be good, the official said of the man who was nominateed to suoceed Clifford H. Buck as president. He's got the votes and that's all that counts. From the standpoint of practical politics, Krumm was a logical candidate for the post. He had served as first vice president for four years; he was affiliated with the independents among the sports organizations that help make up the committee, and it was their turn to name a president; he was semiretired, wealthy and eager to devote the time and energies necessary to handle the job between now and the 1976 Games in Montreal.

title: Election Day
description: For government to be truly representative, it is Important that every eligible voter cast a ballot today. We recapitulate below the recommendations this newspaper has made to the voters in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut. Asterisks denote incumbents, although as a result of the redistricting of many Congressional and state legislative districts incumbents may be running in districts with numbers different from their present ones.

title: Patrolman, at Trial of Panther, Describes MachineGun Attack
description: He picked up what appeared to be a machine gun and fired at us through the window.

title: Mundine Stops Lee in 2d
description: NOUMEA, New Caledonia, Nov. 6 (UPI)Tony Mundine of Australia knocked out Roy Lee of Jamaica today in the second round of their middleweight bout before 3,000 spectators.

title: Business Briefs
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 6 (UPI)  Representatives of the Andean Group met with members of the Common Market today in hopes of getting preferential treatment in Europe for products of the fivenation group.

title: Stockton, Gorman Beaten In $63,500 Swedish Tennis
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 6 (UPI)Tom Gorman and Dick Stockton of the United States were beaten in the first round of the $63,500 Swedish open tennis tournament today.

title: Knicks Conquer Blazers On 2dHall Surge, 11195
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 6 (AP)Walt Frazier and Willis Reed sparked the New York Knickerbockers in the second half for an 11195 National Basketball Association victory tonight.

title: Police Begain Program To Cut Bicycle Thefts
description: The Police Department, in an effort to curtail bicycle thefts, has announced that it is supplying all station houses with metal die stamps for use in a bicycleidentifica tion program.

title: Justice White's Mother Dies.
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Nov. 6 (AP)Mrs. MaudeBurger White, mother of United States Supreme Court Justice Byron White, died Saturday night at Poudre Valley Memorial Hospital here after a short illness. She was 87 years old. Mrs. White moved here in 1904 with her husband, Alpha Albert White, who died in 1966. Besides Justice White, she is survived by another son, Clayton; three brothers; a sister, and five grandchildren.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Tampa Electric Company yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission registration statement for a proposed offering of 750,000 shares of common stock to be marketed through underwriters managed by Stone & Webster Securities Corporation, and Kidder Peabody & Co. The issue is expected early next month. The company's stock was up  at 23 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Fosse Discusses Creation of Pippin
description: Who gave Pippin a bed to romp on and Irene Ryan a bouncing ball to singalong with, and changed War Is a Science from a Gilbert and Sullivanstyle song into a minstrel show and invented outright a role with a Pirandello aspect for Ben Vereen?

title: New Jersey Sports
description: TENAFLY, N.J., Nov. 6  When Jerry Lucas lived Greenwich, Conn., last season, the Knick center occupied himself on the long rides into New York by counting the number of steps at the train station and making sure he reached the top of each staircase with his left foot. was a long trip to Madison Square Garden for the 6foot9inch commuter.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Federal Communications Commission, by a 5to1 vote, refused today to order the three television networks to give half an hour's coverage tonight to the Presidential candidacy of Dr. Benjamin Spock.

title: EARNINGS CLIMB AT COLUMBIA GAS
description: The Columbia Gas System, Inc., reported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net income for the first nine months of this year.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WHEELING, W. Va., Nov. (AP) The Senate Democratic Whip, Robert C. Byrd, has, without mentioning any names, criticized the campaign, positions of the Democratic Presidential nominee, George McGovern.

title: Merger News
description: Pepsico, Inc., and the Rheingold Corporation announced yesterday that the litigation by Rheingold seeking to block Pepsico's tender offer for 1,6 million Rheingold shares at $22 a share had been settled by stipulation.

title: BRITAIN FREEZES WAGES ANDPRICES IN INFLATION FIGHT
description: LONDON, Nov. 6Prime Minister Heath today announced a 90day freeze on wages, prices, rents and dividends in a dramatic bid to curb inflation.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 6 For some 200 Jewish business and professional men in Essex County, the makeup of the list of candidates in tomorrow's election was an affront and a call to organize.

title: NOFAULT DRIVE GETS FAST START
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6The hot line into Commissioner Richard C. McDonough's offices here averaged about 20 calls an hour today as the State Insurance Department opened a public information campagn on nofault automobile coverage.

title: OUTLOOK WEAKENS SOYBEAN FUTURES
description: Soybean futures were depressed yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade by an estimate that betterthanaverage moisture and higherthanaverage temperatures in October have helped Increase the nation's soybean crop this year to a record of 1,358,000,000 bushels.

title: Described as Promoter
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 6 (AP)Mr. Nakaoka was said here to have been involved in a variety of business areas and was known as a promoter. He had connections in the sportinggoods field and once served as a technical adviser for a John Wayne movie filmed in Japan, associates said.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGH
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6It is only a few hours until Election Day, and Dewey Burton still does not know whom he will vote for as. President.

title: Books of The Times
description: BLACK MOUNTAIN. An Exploration in Cominanity. By Martin Duberman. 527 pages. Illustrated. Dutton. $12.95.

title: Stockton, Gorman Beaten In $63,500 Swedish Tennis
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 6 (UPI)Tom Gorman and Dick Stockton of the United States were beaten in the first round of the $63,500 Swedish open tennis tournament today.
