description: To the Editor:

title: Emu Disappears Upstate En Route to a Game Farm
description: WEST LOWVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 6 (UPI)For a bird that stands 5 feet, weighs 130 to 140 pounds and can't even fly, an emu who flew  or walked  the coop, is proving surprisingly hard to find.

title: Britain Names 3 to Try Terror Suspects in Ulster
description: LONDON, Nov. 6The British Government today an nounced the details of a new legal effort to replace the controversial policy of interning suspected terrorists in Northern Ireland without trial.

title: FIREMEN ASSAIL CITY HAWS PLAN
description: The Lindsay administration's productivity plan for disbanding some fire companies and relocating others was attacked yesterday by Michael J. Maye, president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association, as a lunatic plan that was absolutely uncalled for.

title: Brain Exhibit Recalls Early Approach
description: ITHACA, N. Y.  Cornell University has decided to display the best of its unusual collection of human brains, recalling a longgone era of scientific exploration.

title: For the Election Analyst: A DoItYourself Guide
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Herewith some hints for doityourself election analysts who plan to follow the returns tomorrow night. All times given are Eastern standard.

description: To the Editor:

title: 2 POLICEMEN ADMIT NEWBURGH LARCENY
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 6 (AP) Two suspended Newburgh city policemen pleaded guilty today in State Supreme Court in Westchester County on charges resulting from a sevenmonth investigation of Newburgh police corruption.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The moving vans had been drawn up at the warehouse all night long and the men, most of them wearing gas masks, were still unloading the 1972 Presidential campaign.

title: Miss Mimi Walters Married In West to Spelman Prentice
description: PARADISE VALLEY, Ariz., Nov. 6 Miss Mimi Walters was married here this afternoon to Spelman Prentice of San Francisco and Southampton, L. I., an independent oil producer and a grandson of the late John D. Rockefeller. The Rev. Dan J. Gerrard performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church of the Ascension. A reception followed at the Biltmore Hotel in Phoenix.

title: 4 Wounded in Violence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 6 (AP)Four people, including a 68yearold woman, were wounded in sporadic violence across Northern Ireland today.

title: KOSYGIN DEMANDS CURBS ON WASTE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin, in an unusually frank appraisal of the Soviet economy, has called for stringent savings and reduction or waste in 1973 in view of the costly crop failure this year.

title: Shirley Temple Undergoes Surgery
description: STANFORD, Calif., Nov. 6 (UPI)Shirley Temple Black, the former child movie star, disclosed today that she had undergone surgery for removal of a breast because of cancer.

title: Price Changes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) The Price Commission today approved an average 11.2 per cent price increase by the Pillsbury Company for its flour products.

title: JILL COREY RETURNS WITH VOICE INTACT
description: It was 19 years ago this fall that 18yearold Norma Jean Speranza of Avonmore, Pa., went through a Hollywood fairy tale experiencebut for real. A radio station manager sent a tape of her voice to Mitch Miller, then a prominent figure at Columbia Records. Mr. Miller auditioned her, signed her, changed her name to Jill Corey and started her on a career that included regular stints on such programs as The Hit Parade and recordings that sold in the millions.

title: JohnsManville to Expand
description: The johnsManville Corporad Lion yesterday announced ai $12million expansion program; to increase polyvinyl chlorides pipe production capacity at Wilton, Iowa: McNary, Ore., and Jacsoon, Tenn.

title: U.S. RIDERS REGAIN AND KEEP TROPHY
description: The United States Equestrian Team regained and retired the Nations Cup at the National Horse Show in Madison Square Garden last night.

title: Nixon Defends Peace Bid
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 6President Nixon spent the last few moments of his reelection campaign tonight defending himself against Senator George McGovern's charge that he had deceived the American people about the prospects for a settlement in Vietnam.

title: Rutgers Holds Off Princeton to WinIn Frisbee
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 6On the same site where, 103 years ago to the day, Rutgers and Princeton squared off in college football's first game, the same two colleges clashed today in what was billed as the first intercollegiate game of Ultimate Frisbee.

title: Some Words of Advice On Corporate Identity
description: After years with major design firms, William M. Ennis Jr.now with his own firm and dedicated to, bringing corporateidentity programs to companies that feel they're necessary but unaffordablegave some words of advice to members of the New York Chapter of the Association of Industrial Advertisers yesterday.

description: PATTY POO: You+Me=Us. Forever; Happy Ann'yLove. Husband JAMESadvt.

title: For the Election Analyst: A DoItYourself Guide
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Herewith some hints for doityourself election analysts who plan to follow the returns tomorrow night. All times given are Eastern standard.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: TORQUAY, England, Nov. 6 (AP)Clark Graebner of New York routed George Szakacs of Australia, 60, 60, in the fourth tournament of the Dewar Cup indoor tennis series today. Graebner was the losing finalist in the third tournament on Saturday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The Appellate Division of Superior Court reserved decision on an appeal to merge two suits seeking to overturn lowdensity zoning ordinances in Bedminster Township. The appeal was brought by the Suburban Action Institute and the American Civil Liberties Union, which contend the Somerset County community's zoning laws exclude poor people, particularly blacks.

title: MRS. CLAUDE ALEXANDER
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Nov. 6Mrs. Dorothy J. Kioske Alexander, wife of Claude L. Alexander, former executive secretary of the Esso Foundation who retired 10 years ago died here this morning at a nursing home. Her age was 72 and she lived here.

title: AMERICANLED RAIDS INTO LAOS REPORTED
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 6The St. Louis PostDispatch said today that United States Army Special Forces led bands of foreign commandos on raids into Laos this year at a time the Pentagon was insisting that no Special Forces personnel were in the, area.

title: TWO MORE FUGITIVES CAPTURED AT ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Nov.6 (UPI)Two more fugitives from the Albany County jail were captured by the police early today as a grand jur prepared to open an investigation into the escape of 12 prisoners on Oct. 27.

title: 4 CHILDREN BURNED IN BROOKLYN BLAZE
description: A twoalarm fire in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn raged out of control last night for more than an hour, sending four children in one family to the hospital with burns and injuring six firemen. More than 40 people were made homeless by the blaze.

title: Tristate Area Candidates Mount Final Vote Drives
description: Candidates from the national to the town level wound up their campaigns in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut last night with handshaking stints at subway stations, speeches before community groups or pep talks to, party workers hours before the polls would open.

title: Notes on People
description: Among the millions of eligible Americans who will not vote for President today is the man who has spent the last 37 years trying to explain why Americans feel the way they do about things. Dr. George Gallup, the pollster, said he would not vote because if he did, and revealed his preference, it might be interpreted as trying to influence the election outcome. On the other hand, Dr. Gallup said, If I answer I can't tell you, then how could I ask anyone else such a question? Dr. Gallup did say in an interview in New York, however, that the last time he voted for President it was for Alfred E. Smith, in 1928.

title: Winnebago Loses Lawsuit; Ordered to Pay $4Million
description: FORD DODGE. Iowa, Nov. 6, (AP)A jury in the Federal District Court here today awarded a total of $4.8million to LifeTime Industries, Inc., California corporation, in a lbreachofcontract suit against Winnebago Industries, Inc.. of Forest City, Iowa, and two of its officers.

title: SOVIET BIDS NIXON SIGN TRUCE PACT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6The Soviet leadership called upon the Nixon Administration today to sign a Vietnam ceasefire agreement as soon as possible.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DIXVILLE NOTCH, N.H., Tuesday, Nov. 7 (UPI)Residents of this tiny mountain hamlet near the Canadian border cast 16 votes today for President Nixon and three for Senator George McGovern. One blank vote was cast.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HOBOKEN, N.J., Nov. 6 (UPI)A man burst into a topfloor apartment today, killed his estranged wife and her father with a shotgun, critically I wounded two other family members, and committed suilcide.

title: Max Rudolf to Conduct Philharmonic Concerts
description: Max Rudolf will conduct the New York Philharmonic in the concerts on Thursday, Friday, Saturday and next Tuesday. He replaces Lorin. Maazel, the scheduled conductor, who is ill. Mr. Rudolf, who last led the Philharmonic in 1957, was conductor of the Cincinnati Symphony from 1958 to 1970 and is currently head of the opera department at the Curtis Institute in Philadelphia.

title: Kenneth Crittenden,83 Dies; Chrysler of Canada Official
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich. Nov. 6 (AP)Kenneth Crittenden, an automobile industry pioneer and retired Chrysler Corporation of Canada vice president died Saturday. He was 83 years old.

title: Cyrillic Is Vanishing, And Serbs Are Worried
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 6Along the downtown streets of Belgrade, capital of both the Serbian Republic and the Yugoslav Federation, old handpainted signs reading PECTOPAHrestaurant in the Slavic Cyrillic alphabethave begun to disappear. In their place hand moderndesign, Romanlettered signs saying RESTORAN.

title: Met Catcher Has Flowery Touch
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 6The strong hands of Duffy Dyer, which caught fast balls and curves in 94 games behind the plate last season for the Mets, were put to more genteel uses today  making delicate floral arrangements.

title: Stars Turn Back Cougars, 124112, as Combs Nets 24
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 6 (AP) Six players, led by Glenn Combs with 24 points, scored in double figures tonight as the Utah Stars defeated the Carolina Cougars, 124112, in a battle of the American Basketball Association's West and East Division leaders.

title: Music: A Young Pianist
description: Eugene Indjic has been climbing the international contest ladder in recent years, so one was not surprised to find the 25yearold pianist capable of prodigious technical feats in his recital on Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall. More worth noting at this stage of his career, perhaps, was the way Mr. Indjic's fingers served the musical needs of the three major scores that made up his program.

title: Cornell Students Barred
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Nov. 6 Three of four Cornell students who had attempted to register to vote in Tompkins County were turned down in a decision handed down today in State Supreme Court.

title: 3,000Mile Walk for Office
description: ALVISO, Calif., Nov. 6 (UPI) Dan McCorquodale, a candidate for Santa Clara county supervisor, claimed today a record 3,000 miles of campaigning on foot. Mr. McCorquodale, 37 years old, said he had visited 70,000 homes in the district and had worn oute 12 pairs of shoes. His opponent is the incumbent, Charles Quinn, 67, a real estate developer.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: BRIDGE: 3 New York Experts to Make  Debuts in International Play
description: The North American zonal representation in the 1973 world championship in South America will have a strong New York emphasis.

title: Head of Trade Group Joins Elevator Mediation Effort
description: A new attempt to settle the I29dayold strike of elevator donstructors began yesterday Vvith Peter J. Brennan, president of the Building and ConStruction Trades Council of Greater New York, joining in mediation efforts.

title: Crane of Jets Out, Probably for Season
description: On practice days at Shea Stadium, Paul Crane usually reported early, dressed, ate a light lunch at his equipment stall and sat quietly on his stool doing a crossword puzzle until team meetings began. Hardly anyone missed the quiet Jet linebacker in the locker room after his knee injury in Sunday's loss to Washington.

title: ALEXANDRA HAWLEY EXCELS AS FLUTIST
description: Alexandra Hawley's New York debut in Carnegie Recital Hall late. Sunday afternoon was a remarkable one from every standpointnot only is she a flutist of complete technical proficiency, but also she brings the spontaneous perceptive musical sensitivity of a finished artist to her work.

title: All Fires Verbal Punches at Frazier
description: Muhammad Ali made two predictions yesterdaythat Joe Frazier soon would be stripped of the world heavyweight title because of inactivity, and that he would register an eighthround knockout of Bob Foster in their 12round bout Nov. 21 at Stateline, Nev.

title: STATE GETS FUNDS TO TREAT ADDICTS
description: Federal officials announced a $522,000 grant to the state yesterday for a project to divert addictcriminals from the Federal courts into state rehabilitation programs.

title: Ches: Book Recounts Games and Wit in U.S. Championship
description: The most recent addition to tournament literature is Burt Hochberg's Title ChessThe 1972 United States Chess Championship, available in hardcover for $6.00 from the U. S. Chess Federation, 479 Broadway, Newburgh, N.Y. 12550.

title: The Theater: What If It Had Turned Up Heads
description: What If It Had Turned Up Heads, now running at the New Lafayette Theater through Nov. 19, confirms the fact that J. E. Gaines (also known as Sonny Jim and Sonny Gaines) is not only an excellent actor but also a playwright with a steadily unfolding talent.

title: MARBURGER ISSUE HEADS FOR A VOTE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6In a dramatic reversal of earlier predictions, the State Senate's Republican leadership said today that the controversial renomination of Dr. Carl L. Marburger as State Commissioner of Education now stood a good chance of being released from the Senate Judiciary Committee next week.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: PEKING, Nov. 6  Chinese perspectives on the Presidential election in the United States tomorrow can be judged from the fact that there has been no coverage of the election in the mass circulation newspapers and only the most incidental mention of President Nixon's challenger, Senator George McGovern.

title: News Analysis
description: PARIS, Nov. 6The North Vietnamese have professed not to believe that the United States is seriously concerned about Saigon's objections to the ceasefire agreement negotiated by Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho, Hanoi's representative.

title: HIGH COURT RULING DUE ON SCHOOL AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether New York can constitutionally reimburse churdhrelated schools for costs of pupiltesting and recordkeeping that are required by state law.

title: Foundations Aim to End Isolation From Public
description: Three years after the 1969 Tax Reform Act stunned private foundations by imposing strict regulations on them and by raising questions about their very purpose, the foundations are still trying to assess the effects of the act and struggling with the criticisms it raised.

title: EASED RULE ASKED ON AUTO POLLUTION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency proposed today regulations to permit maintenance or replacement of major antipollution devices on automobiles being tested for cornIpliance with 1975 standards.

title: Orr Out Until After Jan.
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)The Boston Bruins hockey star, Bobby Orr, is expected to remain out of the lineup until after Jan. 1, his Toronto attorney, R. Alan Eagleseon, said today. Orr is undergoing therapy to rebuild his left knee, which has had three operations.

title: Huge Peking Arts Show Revives Themes of Past
description: PEKINGCelestial fairies, peacocks and Pandas are prominent among the themes of an enormous new exhibition of modern Chinese arts and crafts that has opened here.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ALBANY, Nov. 6Governor Rockefeller and four other leading state Republican officials, campaigned around the state, together today in a getoutthevote effort that stressed giving President Nixon the greatest possible mandate in tomorrow's election.

title: Special Courts to Hear Complaints of Voters
description: Following are special locations where State Supreme Court justices are to be sitting from 6 A.M. to 9 P.M. today, to hear complaints from people about being unable to vote within the city:

title: Bonanza Put Out to Pasture; N.. C. Also Axes Bold Ones
description: Bonanza, the National, Broadcasting Company's longrunning hourlong series concerning the exploits of the Cartwright clan in the Old. West, has been canceled and the program will go off the air in late January.

title: Cancer Drive Leader To Head 3d Campaign
description: The appointment of the publisher John L. McGraw for the third consecutive year as chairman of the American Cancer Society's. New York division drive for funds was announced yesterday by Paul W. Williams, the division's chairman of the board.

title: Whalers Down Jets, 62, As Webster Gets 3 Goals
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)Tom Webster scored three goals and Larry Pleau, a linemate, chipped in a fourth as the New England Whalers defeated the Winnipeg Jets, 62, tonight. The victory moved the Whalers into second place In the World Hockey Association's East Division.

title: Bronx Lawyer Sentenced For Using False Affidavits
description: A Bronx lawyer was sentenced to six months in prison yesterday for assertedly using a false affidavit in eviction proceedings against numerous Bronx tenants.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 A young salesman stood on a corner in. Cheyenne, Wyo., a few days ago and expounded at length on the need for tax reform, especially in the dosing of loopholes that benefit the rich. It was almost precisely the argument advanced by Senator George. McGovern all this year in the Presidential race, and to the salesman it was the most burning national issue of the day. Yet he expected to vote for President Nixon, he said, because he did not quite trust Senator McGovern and he thought that real tax reform would have to await the arrival of a more convincing candidate on the national scene.

title: The Candidate
description: BALTIMOREThere is little about the hon. gentleman [Roosevelt] to make the heart go pitterpat. He is an honest man but that is about it. Of the six or seven aspirants who opposed him ror the nomination at Chicago, at least four were better. But he beat them by playing the game a great deal more boldly and skillfully than they did, and so we must take him now, giving humble thanks that he is not worse.

title: Louisiana Students Still Hold Building; Police Action Hinted
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 6 (UPI) A black liberation flag fluttered over the studentheld administration building at Southern University today while school officials warned that the campus would be secured by the police.

title: Trudeau Rival Sets Terms for Backing
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 6  The leader of the New Democratic party, which holds the balance of power as a result of the recent Parliamentary election, has made it clear that the price for supporting the minority Government of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau will be high.

title: Expos Trade McCarver To Cards, Acquire Roque
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 6 (AP)The St. Louis Cardinals announced today they had reacquired Tim McCarver from the Montreal Expos in exchange for Jorge Roque, an outfielder.

title: Hawks Win in Overtime
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 7 (AP)George Trapp's basket with 2 minutes, 14 seconds left in overtime gave the Atlanta Hawks a 109107 triumph over the Baltimore Bullets tonight.

title: Baker Reelected in Tennessee; McGovern Is Far Behind Nixon
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 7 (AP)Howard H. Baker Jr., the first Republican ever elected to the United States Senate by popular vote in Tennessee, won his bid for reelection today, defeating Representative Ray Blanton, his Democratic opponent.

title: GOV FERE IS UPSET BY HERN ANDEZCOLON
description: SANJUAN P. R Nov. 7(UPI)Rafael Hernandez Colon,36 years old President of the Puerto Rican Senate became the youngest elected Governor of Puerto Rico today upsetting the incumbent, Luis A Peril in the general election.

title: WYSZYNSKI IN ROME, STEP TO ACCORD SEEN
description: ROME, Nov. 7The Roman Catholic Primate of Poland. Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, arrived today for a month's visit that will include talks with ecclesiastical officials that some churchmen feel could lead to the reestablishment of relations between Poland and the Vatican.

title: U.S. Pianists Give China Taste of Rock (and Bach)
description: It wasn't the Rolling Stones, exactly, but China has had its first taste of rock music played by Western musicians. Richard and Frances Hadden, duopianists from Mackinac Island, Mich., closed that cultural gap last month. They also played Bach, Handel, folksong arrangements and a wide variety of other Western music during a sevenweek, fivecity visit to China.

title: New Mexico Elects Republican to Senate for First Time in 38 Years
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Nov. 7  For the first time in 381 years, a Republican has been elected to the United States Senate from New Mexico.

title: Belgian Mine Blast Kills 6
description: CHARLEROI, Belgium, Nov. 7 (AP)  Six men were killed in a gas explosion 2,700 feet underground in a coal mine near here today, officials said. Three others were injured and a seventh escaped unhurt.

title: Prisoners Back McGovern
description: JACKSON. Mich., Nov. 7 (UPI)George McGovern won by 1,001 to 273 over Richard M. Nixon in a mock election at. Southern Michigan Prison today.

title: Transcript of Nixon's Victory Speech
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's victory speech from the Oval Office in the White House last night as recorded by The New York Times:

title: BARTLETT AHEAD IN OKLAHOMA BID
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 7Dewey F. Bartlett, a Tulsa oilman and tanner Republican Governor, built a strong lead tonight over Representative Ed Edmondson, a 10term Democratic congressman, in their race to fill the United States seat vacated by Democrat Fred Harris. An estimated one million Oklahomans, a record, went to the polls.

title: Summary of Other News
description: Following is a summary of major nonelection news. A full report begins on the first page, second part.

title: Food Prices Steady Since July; Average for Quarter Is Up 2.4%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) Retail food prices leveled off in the third quarter of 1972 after a sharp jump in July, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Auto Worker and Wife Decide on McGovern
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7I really don't think McGovern will win, but maybe if we vote for him we can show Nixon what we want, what the working man wants. said Dewey Burton, a Detroit area automobile worker.

title: MANY VOTES SPLIT
description: The Democratic party retained control of the Senate and the House of Representatives yesterday in the face of President Nixon's smashing victory as voters in all parts of the nation split tickets in vast numbers.

title: New Harvard Hall: Drama and Questions
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. Gund Hall, the striking new, home of the Graduate School of Design at Harvard University, is not just a building, it is a problem. This longawaited work of a stellar young firm, John Andrews, Anderson, Baldwin of Toronto, commissioned in 1965,

title: Kansas Officials Reelected
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Nov. 7 (AP)Gov. Robert Docking, a Democrat, and Senator James B. Pearson, a Republican, were reelected tonight. The vote meant a record fouryear term for Mr. Docking.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARIS  It is inevitable that the United States must now give priority in its foreign policy over the next four years to relationships with allied countriesabove all Western Europe and Japan. The period 19681972 was perforce devoted to finding a solution to the Vietnam war and this could not be done without the tacit assistance of Russia and China.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. (UPI)Fireman Patrick D. Chenoweth, 21 years old, of Puyallup, Wash., was arranged yesterday on a charge that he had delayed the sailing of the aircraft carrier Ranger to southeast Asia for 3 months.

title: Cuts in Defense vs. National Security
description: WASHINGTONWith annual increases in defense spending virtually certain and a $100billion defense budget on the horizon, a search is beginning in and out of Government for ways to cut defense spending while maintaining national security.

title: Reds'
description: Johnny Bench of the Cincinnati Reds was elected the most valuable player in the National League yesterday for the second time in three years.

title: M'GOVERN VICTOR IN CAPITAL VOTING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 Senator George McGovern won the District of Columbia's three electoral votes today.

title: NIXON ISSUES CALL TO GREAT TASKS
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Nov. 8  President Nixon summoned the nation last night to get on with the great tasks that lie before us and, in a later statement to a crowd of cheering supporters, pledged to make himself worthy of this victory.

title: Eastland Is Reelected
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 7 (AP)President Nixon easily won Mississippi's seven electoral votes and James 0. Eastland, a Democrat who had Administration backing, won another Senate term tonight.

title: Business Briefs
description: Seaboard Coast Line Industries, Inc, announced yesterday that a favorable Federal tax ruling would permit the completion of a stock swap with minority holders of Louisville & Nashville Railroad securities. It would also thus complete the merger of the L. & N. into Seaboard.

title: Smith Scores Easy Victory In Community College Run
description: Alex Smith of Kingsborough Community College won his second crosscountry title, in four days when he ran the fivemile course in 22 minutes 4.5 seconds in the Metropolitan Community College championships yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Crash Kills One, Hurts 45
description: LAS CRUCES, N. M., Nov. 7 (UPI)A bus chartered out of Cincinnati collided headon with a tractortruck east of this southern New Mexico community today, killing the bus driver and injuring at least 45 persons, the police reported. Names of the dead man and the injured were withheld pending notification of next of kin.

title: MINNESOTA VOTES IN POOR WEATHER
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 7 (UPI) Minnesotans lined up outside polling places despite cloudy skies and some snow and rain today to vote for President, United States Senator, Representatives and a number of other officials.

title: REPUBLICANS GAIN IN MICHIGAN VOTE
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7President Nixon carried the industrial state of Michigan, and Senator Robert P. Griffin, the Senate's secondranking Republican, appeared on the way to reelection this evening.

title: Shriver Urges Supporters to Look to the Future
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 7Sargent Shriver told disappointed young supporters of the Democratic ticket here tonight that they were the vanguard of the future and said he would he working with you in the years ahead.

title: Shelling in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 7 (UPI)Cambodian Communist gunners launched a series of artillery assaults today against Government positions along a 35mile stretch of embattled Route 2, the high command reported.

title: Nixon Sweeps Maryland
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 7 (AP)Republicans picked up one Congressional seat to gain an even split in the Maryland House delegation today while President Nixon was sweeping every area of the state except the city of Baltimore.

title: Oregon Man Jogs Five Miles To Office Every Other Day
description: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) , Grorge Brown jogs five miles to his office and another five, miles home every other day on the average.

title: FURTHER DROP SEEN FOR U.S. BIRTH RATE
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  In report coinciding with a twoyear drop in the birth rate in the United States, the Census Bui:e'au provided new evidence that young wives are expecting to have still fewer children.

title: fudge Extends Polling Hour in Bronx As Thousands Seek Writs to Vote
description: With unprecedented thousands of voters in New York City swarming to get court orders attesting their right to vote, a State Supreme Court justice extended the closing time one hour to 10 o'clock in the Bronx last night to let such voters use their ballots.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The Jeep Wagoneers looked like crates in which the opposition cars had been shipped. But those Ugly Americans were strong enough to place first and third in the Press On Regardless rally, which ended Sunday after an ordeal of three nights in snow, fog, sleet, rain and mud over 2,000 miles of roads and nonroads in the Upper and Lower Peninsulas of Michigan. It was the first time an Americanmade car had ever won an event on the International Rally Championship calendar of the Federation Internationale de ('Automobile (F.I.A.)

title: An Emergency District Lets 20 Vote in Newark
description: NEWARK, Nov. 7 (AP)Es sex County officials created an emergency voting district tonight to permit about 20 people to cast ballots moments before the polls closed.

title: JUDSON THEATER PLANS STEIN WORK
description: The Judson Poets Theater will celebrate its 10th anniversary this season by presenting a new work, The Making of Americans, an adaptation by Leon Katz of Gertrude Stein's 900page novel, at the Judson Memorial Church, 55 Washington Square South, on Nov. 17.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  On the morning after an American Presidential election, the winner has almost more problems than he can handle, and the loser more regrets than he can bear. Maybe, then, we should pause about now to consider the human efforts, accidents, triumphs and tragedies of this campaign.

title: Navy Seeks 8 Women To Volunteer as Pilots
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7 (UPI)The Navy announced today that it was seeking eight woman volunteers to become pilots.

title: Books of The Times
description: Quite unintentionally, I find myself reviewing today a novel which is like correction of the one I wrote about Monday. The first book I described as an allegory, the kind of novel in which the characters are puppets on the strings of an idea. In it, a man was made to walk around the world in order to point a moral, and the moral so dominated him that he was like a person in a posthypnotic trance. He was incapable of the sort of spontaneous or autonomous gestures that make the reader feel that a character has broken free from the author and acquired independent life. When a character can do this, he is as much ours as the author's, behe belongs to himself. He unfolds, or simply becomes, and we don't feel that he, and in turn we, are, being manipulated. We sense that he is capable even of defying his creator, much as man is imagined by some to have defied his. Or as a child must, if he is to become an adult.

title: Case Big Winner
description: President Nixon won the overwhelming victory predicted for him in New Jersey in yesterday's Presidential election, defeating Senator George Mc Govern by a 2to1 margin.

title: Business Briefs
description: GENEVA, Nov. 7 (AP)The United States today proposed dutyfree trade of industrial goods among industrialized countries as a subject of future talks on liberalizing trade.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The Metropolitan Squash Racquet Association, comprising 43 member clubs, will begin an extensive league Schedule tomorrow that will run through Feb. 7 and will include competition in Classes A through D. There will be 36 local invitation tournaments,, plus 12 championship tournaments. The tournament season runs from Nov. 18 through April 18. The national singles are scheduled to be played in February in Princeton's Jadwin gymnasium; the national doubles and senior doubles in Baltimore, and the veterans in Rochester in March.

title: Student Wins Right to Vote But Ballot Remains Afar
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 7 (UPI)A Prairie View A. & M. College student from McKeesport, Pa., who contended that he should be allowed to vote today in Houston, won the theoretical portion of his argument but lost the practical side of it.

title: SENATOR TOWER WINNER IN TEXAS
description: HOUSTON, Wednesday, Nov. 8Texas Republicans won a major victory yesterday. President Nixon was taking the state 2 to 1. Senator John G. Tower of Wichita Falls, who campaigned as a favorite of the President, won a third term easily.

title: Season Canceled By the Symphony Stokowski Guided
description: The American Symphony Orchestra, which was founded 10 years ago by Leopold Stokowski, has suspended operation because of a lack of financial support. Mr. Stokowski, the 90yearold conductor, resigned as the orchestra's music director at the close of last season. The resignation was not disclosed until now, apparently in hopes that a way could be found to keep the orchestra alive without hisprestigious name attached.

title: Connally Hopes for Sense To Repel Any Nixon Post
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 7 (UPI)John B. Connally, who headed Democrats for Nixon, said today that if President Nixon offered him a job in the new Administration, I hope I have the good sense not to take it.

title: French Consul in Spain Dies Of BombingAttack Injuries
description: SARAGOSSA, Spain, Nov. 7 (Reuters)The French consul, Roger Tur, died here today after being badly burned in a bomb attack on his consulate last Thursday, hospital officials reported.

title: Vignettes on Election Day: Secret Ballot Proves a Transparent Fiction in Connecticut Polling Place
description: It was not exactly like voting in a Macy's window, but it was not exactly like voting in secret either. People who went to the polls in some places found the voting booth was not the fine and private place it ought to be, but a kind of device for displaying one's political allegiance.

title: MARGIN ABOUT 60%
description: Richard Milhotts Nixon won reelection by a huge majority yesterday, perhaps the largest ever given a President.

title: 56 Uganda Asians Arrive, Bringing Total in U.S. to 197
description: An additional 56 Uganda Asians arrived here last night, bringing the figure in this country to a total of 197.

title: G.O.P. FAILS TO GAIN CONTROL IN FLORIDA
description: MIAMI, Nov. 7 (AP)President Nixon carried Florida, with its 17 electoral votes by wide margin today, but the Republicans failed to gain control of the state Legislature.

title: BOY'S FRIENDS SEEK TO BAR HIS ARREST
description: Two Housing Authority detectives had to call for help yesterday when several youths and adults tried to keep them from arresting a 15yearold boy suspected of stabbing another youth on Halloween, according to the police.

title: TV Review
description: A 90minute exercise called The Crooked Hearts, in which Rosalind Russell and Douglas Fairbanks Jr. try to charm each other out of money, is pleasant but wears exceedingly thin. The American Broadcasting Company's Wednesday Movie of the Week goes on tonight at 8:30.

title: CHINA SAID TO ADD MISSILE STRENGTH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7Administration officials said today that there was now evidence that China had deployed a handful of strategic missiles capable of reaching Moscow.

title: Market Place:Fund Managing:A Closer Look
description: When the Securities and Exchange Commission published its widely read study of the institutions effect on the stock market in early 1970, it concluded that the activities of professional money managers did not distort market prices unduly.

title: Olympic Fund Barred
description: Voters in Colorado cut off public funds for the 1976 Winter Olympics yesterday. Without the tax money, the International Olympic Committee was all but forced to move the games to another site. Page 31.

title: OUTLOOK IS BLEAK IN ROOSEVELT, L.I.
description: ROOSEVELT, LI., Nov. 7This community could go either waystraight up or straight down. It's really poised on the edge.

title: Farmer's Imported Horses Provide Language Barrier
description: ARMADA, Mich. (UPI) Either Albert: Stankewitz, farmer, is going to have to learn! a few key words of French or three new Belgium draft; horses are going to have ,to learn some English.

title: Island Off Russia Votes But a Delay Is Expected
description: LITTLE DIOMEDE ISLAND, Alaska, Nov. 7 (UPI)It took a special airplane drop to get the ballots to remote Little Diomede Island and the results may not be officially reported until after the President is inaugurated.

title: Landmark Church Burns
description: UNION CITY, Pa., Nov. 7 (AP)A 100yearold landmark, the United Presbyterian Church, was destroyed by fire early this morning, with the loss estimated in excess of $300,000. Although an investigation into the cause of the blaze was continuing, officials said indications were that decorative lights used to illuminate the stained glass windows at night mipht have set fire to some rugs.

title: Coxes Are First in Line To Vote at L.I. Village
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, L. I., Nov. 7Mrs. Edward F. Cox, President Nixon's older daughter, and her husband were the first voters to cast their ballots this morning in this East End Long Island village where the two maintain legal residence.

title: Food Prices Steady Since July; Average for Quarter Is Up 2.4%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) Retail food prices leveled off in the third quarter of 1972 after a sharp jump in July, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: 7 Die in Thai Hotel Collapse
description: BANGKOK Thailand Nov 7 (Reuters)A newly built threestory hotel collapsed in the provincial capital of Nakhon Sanwan north of here today killing at least seven people. Others were feared buried under the brick and concrete debris.

title: Gov. Bumpers Is Victor
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Nov. 7 (AP)Gov. Dale L. Bumpers, a Democrat won reelection tonight, while President Nixon defeated Senator George McGovern, becoming the first Republican Presidential candidate since Reconstruction to take the state's six electoral votes.

title: CourtMartial Recesses
description: FORT ORD, Calif., Nov. 7 (UPI)The courtmartial of a black private was recessed today to give his counsel time to find three rebuttal witnesses. The trial of Pfc. Billy D. Smith, will resume tomorrow morning, either with the rebuttal testimony or with closing arguments and instructions to the courtmartial panel of seven officersfive white and two black.

title: Motel to Become a Prison
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 7 (AP)Florida's prison system is so overcrowded that a Fort Lauderdale motel, the Sunway, is being converted into a temporary prison facility to help ease the load, the State Corrections Director, Louie Wainwright, said today.

title: ROGER L. SOLOMON
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 7Roger L. Solomon, vice president for tobacco administration of the Consolidated Cigar Corporation, died on Saturday. He was 61 years old and hadbeen on leave of absence for health reasons.

title: Mayor Backed President
description: Mr. McGovern was trailing in the normally Democratic strongholds of Luzerne and Lackawanna counties.

title: Scranton? Who's He? Let Him Vote, Anyway
description: SCRANTON, Pa.William W. Scranton, former Pennsylvania Governor and a member of the Price Commission had trouble casting his vote for President Nixon today.

title: Lansky Is Arrested on Landing in Miami
description: MIAMI, Nov. 7  Meyer Lansky, reputed underworld financial figure, was arrested at Miami International Airport today by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The arrest marked the end of a flight that began on Sunday in Israel and that touched at seven countries before arriving in Florida.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
description: Political and Security Committee  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Western Returns Show Bradley a FrontRunner
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 7Bill Bradley's contributions to the Presidential cause of Senator McGovern are behind him. He can now concentrate on the campaign of the Knicks to overtake the Boston Celtics, still running out in front on the basis of a fine early showing in the National Basketball Association polls.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 7 (UPI)Topseeded Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., had to fight all the way in his first appearance in the $63,500 Stockholm open tennis tourna10,mt today before beating Ove Bengtsson of Sweden 67, 75, 64.

title: CREW IS DISSIDENT, SO CARRIER RETURNS
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 7 (UPI)The aircraft carrier Constellation was back in port today after her skipper, Capt. J. D. Ward, cancelled training exercises and met personally with 130 dissident crew members.

title: Strict Rules Will Govern School Reopening in Troy
description: TROY, N. Y., Nov. 7 (UPI)Strict security rules will be in force tomorrow when officials reopen Troy High School after several days of racial unrest.

title: Upstate Hunter Found Safe As Second Is Still Sought
description: OLD FORGE, N. Y., Nov. 7 (AP)The state police and forest rangers today found one of two hunters missing from separate hunting parties in the Herkimer County town of Webb.

title: A Meissen Pot Is Sold For $94,000, a Record
description: LONDON, Nov. 7A Meissen coffeepot was sold today for $94,000, the most expensive piece of European porcelain ever sold at auction. The buyer was the Antique Porcelain Company of New York.

title: Icecapade, $10.60, Takes Stuyvesant
description: A frontrunning colt named Icecapade won the $60,950 Stuyvesant Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday as 36,540 Election Day customers turned out to vote for the horses of their choice.

title: Man Dies in Plane Crash
description: CONCORD, N.H., Nov. 7 (AP) An unidentified man was killed today when his light plane crashed and burned in a farm field off Route 129, the police said.

title: Reason in Canarsie
description: The mob at Junior High School 68 in Canarsie which shouted down an agreement between the central Board of Education and leaders of the local parentteacher associations provided one more repulsive chapter in shameful episode of vigilantism. Be it noted, however, that the public meeting and its noisy vote on the agreement was without any standing under the school law, either of the, city or the local community.

title: Transcript of the Speech by McGovern
description: Thank you. Thank you very much.

title: About Pro Football
description: Howard James Twilley Jr., an all but anonymous dwarf who plays for the Miami Dolphins, symbolizes pro football's only undefeated team. The 40man Dolphin squad is hardly head and shoulders above the others, but it reflects such qualities as dedication, confidence, unity and giving. These are Twilley qualities.

title: Brandt Urges Opposition to Back Treaty
description: BONN, Nov. 7The Government of Chancellor Willy Brandt appealed today to the opposition conservatives to support the treaty it has just negotiated with the East Germans to establish formal relations between the two Germanys.

title: Coast Guard Rescues 3 Off Florida
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 7 (UPI)The Coast Guard found three bodies and three survivors today from an oceangoing tugboat that sank in rough water while towing barge.

title: Confidence Limited
description: It is still impossible to tell with certainty the partisan complexion of the 93rd Congress, but it is evident that despite President Nixon's landslide victory, it will remain in the hands of the Democrats. Interpreted broadly, the overall results suggest strongly that it was Senator George McGovern personally who went down to defeat, not the Democratic party.

title: VOTERS OPPOSING BONDS IN JERSEY
description: A $650million transportation bond issue seemed to be headed for defeat in New Jersey last night against the counterpoint of a heavy vote in favor of referendum that will permit the elderly to run their own bingo games.

title: KINGS TOP BLUES, 32, FOR EIGHTH IN ROW
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 7 (UPI)Ralph Backstrom scored in the third period tonight to give the Los Angeles Kings their eighth straight triumph, a 32 National Hockey League decision over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Kansan Votes in 20th Race
description: NEWTON, Kan., Nov. 7 (AP) H. Guy Hawk, a retired banker who is 100 years old, voted today in his 20th Presidential election. He declined to identify his choice.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Jake McCandless is at it again.

title: PIKE HOLDS FAST IN SUFFOLK RACE
description: BLUE POINT, L.I, Nov. 7An overwhelmingly Republican landslide in Suffolk County, nearly twice as strong as four years ago when the county gave President Nixon his largest plurality in the nation, swept all but two Republican candidates into office tonight. Only Otis G. Pike of the First Congressional District, Long Island's senior Representative, and I. William Bianchi Jr., running in the Third Assembly District, who last year lost overwhelmingly in his bid for Suffolk County Executive, managed to stem the Republican tide and were apparent winners in their races.

title: Program in Hackensack Aids Impaired Children
LAOS PEACE TALKS STILL DEADLOCKED
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 7 The fourth weekly meeting of opposing sides in the Laos peace talks ended today in the usual deadlock over procedural matters and an agreement by both the Government and the Communists that there had been no progress.

title: Vote in North Dakota
description: FARGO, N. D., Nov. 7 (AP)President Nixon swpet to a substantial early lead over Senator George McGovern in North Dakota today and appeared to be pulling almost a full slate of state candidates with him.

title: Vasectomies Increase
description: ROCHESTER, Minn., Oct. 28 (AP)  One million American men underwent voluntary sterilization, or vasectomies, last year, compared with 40,000 men in 1960, a Mayo Clinic specialist, Dr. William Furlow, told 500 physicians at a symposium that ended Wednesday.

title: $1Million Prize to Permit All the Children I Want
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7 (AP)For Helene Sullivan, a $1million Massachusetts lottery prize means a trip to Europe, chalet in New Hampshire, new car and as many children as I want.

title: Brown Co. Settles Suit for $1.6Million
description: The Brown Company of Pasadena, Calif. announced yesterday that it had settled a class action brought by former preferred stockholders for $1.6million.

title: Dorothy Day, Comforter;
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.Dorothy Day was born in Brooklyn just seventyfive years ago today. The daughter of an agnostic newspaperman, she was destined to become the most influential lay person in the history of American Catholicism, and it is just possible that she will be numbered among the outstanding Christians of the twentieth century, an era that for all its vaunted secularism has not lacked for saints. Whether she will finally be found in that small company the church formally recognizes as models for others, no one can yet say. But it is already clear that the Devil's Advocate has his work cut out for him.

title: British Doctor Makes Study Devoted Just to Hangovers
description: LONDON (AP)  A British doctor reports after experiments with 20 men that the worst hangovers resulted from whisky, brandy, rum and red wine.

title: Bank FeeRise Bid Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Price Commission turned down today a request by the Franklin New York Corporation for a 7.5 per cent increase in the corporate trust fees of its subsidiary, the Franklin National Bank. The commission said the bank had failed to provide required information, but it did not explain what information was lacking.

title: The President Richard Milhous Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 During a campaign stop in Greensboro, N. C., last week, Richard Milhous Nixon, bothered by heckling from small group of antiwar demonstrators, paused in his speech and asked the television cameramen to train their equipment on theThen with an imperial wave and a triumphant smile he directed the cameras to the vast sea of white, middleclass faces who made up the rest of the crowd so the country could see the kind of people who are supporting us. Suitably aroused, both by the presence of the protesters and the injunction of their President, the audience erupted with a loud, almost visceral roar of approval.

title: TRUDEAU CRITICIZED AFTER JOB REPORT
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 7A Government report on unemployment raised new demands today on Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau to convene the newly elected Parliament soon.

title: POLICEMEN CLEARED IN CAMBRIDGE CASE
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7 (AP)The Metropolitan District Commission says an investigation has cleared policemen charged in the beating of a young cerebral, palsy victim during a disturbance Oct. 26 at a Cambridge housing project.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: DENVER, Nov. 7 (UN)Colorado voters cut off public funds, for the 1976 Winter, Olympics today. The International Olympic Committee without the tax money, was all but forced to move the event to another location.

title: $751,566 in Pennsylvania
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 7 (AP) As of Oct. 26, the Pennsylvania Finance Committee to Reelect the President had spent $751,566 in an effort to win the state's 27 electoral votes, according to a report filed with the General Accounting Office.

title: Case of Youth Held in 4 Rapes Shows How Law Handles Bail
description: The patternthe modus operandi, as the police put itwas the same in all three cases.

title: COLORADO DENIES OLYMPICS TAXES
description: DENVER, Nov. 7 (AP)President Nixon carried Colorado by a 2 to 1 margin over Senator George McGovern tonight, but Senator Gordon L. Allott, a threeterm Republican, was locked in a tight race with his Democratic challenger, Floyd K. Haskell.

title: Finger Lakes Ends Racing With Increase in Fans, Bets
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., Nov. 7 (AP) Finger Lakes Race Track closed out what it called its most successful season in history today, recording a 9.68 per cent increase in handle and a 3.9 per cent increase in attendance over last year.

title: 11 Airmen in Morocco Doomed By Court for Attempt on Hassan
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 7Eleven Moroccan Air Force men were sentenced to death by a military tribunal tonight for their role in an unsuccessful attempt last August to shoot down a plane carrying King Hassan II.

title: Sparkman Overwhelms Blount In Alabama Voting for Senate
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 7 Senator John J. Sparkman swept to victory today over his Republican challenger, Winton M. Blount, a former member of President Nixon's Cabinet, despite a strong popular surge for the President.

title: U.N. Sets Up Centers In Uganda to Aid Stateless Expellees
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Nov. 7 (Reuters)United Nations officials today set up special departure centers for about 1,300 stateless Asians expelled from Uganda but still awaiting places in European refugee camps.

title: G.O.P. CAPTURES POSTS IN MISSOURI
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. The Republican party reached a political highwater mark today in traditionally Democratic Missouri by capturing the governorship and giving President Nixon a sweeping majority.

title: India Returns 100 Pakistanis
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 7 (Reuters)One hundred Pakistani women and children were flown here today by the International Committee of the Red Cross after 11 months in prisonerofwar camps in India. They are among a group of 300 Pakistanis released by India on the eve of the Moslem festival of EidulFitr. The others are due here Friday.

title: Madison Harriers Capture First Public Schools Title
description: Madison placed all of its five scorers among the first 25 finishers yesterday to win its first Public Schools Athletic League crosscountry championship at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Hepatitis Cases Near 30 At a School in Alabama
description: TUSCUMBIA, Ala., Nov, 7 (AP)Health officials in this north Alabama town fear that the number of cases of children with infectious hepatitis will continue to climb. Nearly 30 have been reported so far.

title: Mother of a Youth Slain In Detroit Gets $62,500
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7 (AP)Detroit has agreed to pay $62,500 to the mother of Aubrey Pollard, one of three youths killed at the Algiers Motel during the 1967 Detroit riot.

title: McGovernsto See Caribbean
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, Nov. 7 (AP)Win or lose, Senator George McGovern and his wife will travel to St. Thomas on Thursday for a postelection rest, a spokesman said today. The McGoverns plan to stay at the home here of Henry Kitn6 melman, the nominee's finance chairman,

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Wallace Is Hoping to Reshape His Party
description: MONTOMERY, Ala., Nov. Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama served notice tonight that he intended to play major role in reshaping the Democratic party as it recovers from the massive electoral rejection of Senator George McGovern and the views he represented.

title: Hartford Senate G.O.P.
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 7President Nixon carried Connecticut today in a landslide victory.

title: M'COVERN TO BACK MOVES FOR PEACE
description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D., Nov. 7  Senator George McGovern conceded defeat of his Presidential candidacy here tonight but said that he would shed no tears because of the effort his campaign had made to draw the nation close to peace.

title: 3Alarm Fire in Brooklyn
description: Firemen battled a threealarm blaze that raged out of control through a block of 10 stores at 86th Street and 19th Avenue in Brooklyn. The cause of the fire was not determined. The department said 25 pieces of equipment and more than 150 men from throughout the area were called to battle the blazed. No injuries were reported.

title: High Court Upsets Ouster of Workers For Heeding Pickets
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP) The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that workers dismissed solely for refusing to cross the picket lines of fellow strikers have an absolute right to get their jobs back.

title: HIGH SCHOOL PLANS RANGE FOR DRIVERS
description: KANSAS CITY (AP)  Suburban Shawnee Mission School District plans to build a driving range that will enable one instructor to supervise 10 cars and student drivers at once.

title: Jazz: A Full Bandstand
description: Now that the Half Note has moved uptown to West 54th Street, it is piling jazz musicians onto its bandstand in glittering profusion. This week the headliners are Earl Hines and Bobby Hackett but, in addition to these two leaders, Mr. Hine's group also includes Tiny Grimes, the guitarist, and Bert Dahlander, an excellent Swedish drummer whci is rarely seen in the parts, while Mr. Hackett's pianist is John Bunch, who is getting his jazz fingers back after a sixyear stretch as pianist and conductor for the Singer Tony, Bennett.

title: Woman Dies in Fire
description: SOMMERVILLE, Mass., Nov. 7 (AP)One woman perished and two others were rescued. by firemen early today from a. threestory wooden tenement that was destroyed by fire. The police identified the victim as Alice MacLean, GO years old.

title: Case an Easy Winner
description: President Nixon won the overwhelming victory predicted for him in New Jersey in yesterday's Presidential election, defeating Senator George Mc Govern by a 2to1 margin.

title: 2 KILLED AS PLANE CRASHES IN ALLEY
description: DALLAS, Nov. 7 (UPI)An Aero Commander 600 aircraft that ran into trouble right after takeoff yesterday dodged and twisted in the air to keep from hitting a row of homesthen crashed and exploded in an alley between a cluster of other residences.

title: Massachusetts Is Carried by McGovern
description: BOSTON, Wednesday, Nov. Massachusetts gave a clearcut victory to Senator McGovern yesterday, but four of the most hotly contested Congressional races in the country remained too close to call here early this morning.

title: Reid Wins as Democrat; Bella Abzug Easy Victor
description: Representative Ogden R. Reid, a former Republican, was reelected yesterday as a Democrat in Westchester County, and Representative Bella S. Abzug, a oneterm Democrat, won a decisive reelection in, Manhattan.

title: Mrs. Hart Returns to U.S.
description: Mrs. Philip Hart, wife of Michigan's Democratic senator, returned here last night from a visit to Hanoi saying that further delays in signing the settlement with Hanoi would mean delays in the return of American prisoners of war. Mrs. Hart, a member of the National Organization for Women, was accompanied on the trip by two other women.

title: 25 Suspected MailBombs Reported Found in Bombay
description: BOMBAY, India, Nov. 7 (Reuters)  Twentyfive pieces of mail suspected of being letterbombs were detected here today, a senior postal official said.

title: Advertising:
description: Ben B. Bliss, who for three months has run the Ben B. Bliss division of Albert FrankGuenther Law, has left and set up the Ben B. Bliss Company at 770 Lexington Avenue.

title: CHINATOWN YOUTH SHOT DEAD AT MOVIE
description: A youth was shot dead and another was wounded last night by three members of a gang in a Chinatown theater, the police said.

title: Nixon Wins in His Native State; Margin Appears to Be Smaller
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 7Voters of his native state gave Richard M. Nixon their 45 electoral votes by a wide margin in his third campaign for the Presidency, incomplete returns showed tonight.

title: Manhattan Keeps Crown In Title CrossCountry
description: With the memory of an Olympic experience still fresh in their minds, Mike Keogh and Tony Colon led Manhattan to a third consecutive Metropolitan Intercollegiate crosscountry championship yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: 2 I.R.A. Leaders Arrested
description: BELFAST. Northern, Ireland, Nov. 7 (UPI)British troops, arrested two more leaders of the militant provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army. the army said today. An army spokesman said a member of the provisionals command staff for Belfast and the commander of a provisional company were captured when troops stopped their car at an army checkpoint.

title: PENNSYLVANIANS BACK PRESIDENT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 7President Nixon won Pennsylvania's 27 electoral votes by apparently landslide dimensions tonight.

title: Conservative Republican Victor In North Carolina Senate Race
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Wednesday,1 Nov. 8Jesse A. Helms, a conservative Republican, became the first member of his party in this century to be elected to the Senate from North Carolina yesterday, but it was still not clear whether President Nixon's triumph would also carry in the state's first Republican Governor in 71 years.

title: Lakers Down Rockets
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif. Nov 7 (UPI)Although he scored only 10 points, Jerry West contributed 20 assists and stole the ball from Houston seven times tonight in leading the Los Angeles Lakers to a 122109 victory over the Rockets.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Connecticut judge ruled today that policemen were not entitled to decide for themselves what constitutes pornography. In dismissing an obscenity charge against magazine salesman, Circuit Judge David J. Jacobs said that if policemen were allowed to make such decisions there would be as as many different standards of what constitutes obscenity as there are policemen.

title: Bulgaria Is Testing Computerized Farming
description: NOVI KRICHIM, Bulgaria, Nov. 2  At the foot of the snowcapped Rhodope Mountains, on the ancient Thracian Plain, 9,500 workers of the Lenin AgroIndustrial Complex are taking part in a venture in largescale, computerized agriculture that seems intended to be an example for farming reorganization in other East European Communist countries.

title: Widow of Astronaut Sues Spacecraft Manufacturer
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 7 (AP)The widow of an astronaut who died in a spacecraft fire in 1967 filed a $150,000 damage suit today.

title: Hilary Marquand Is Dead at 70 British Professor and Politician
description: LONDON, Nov. 7  Hilary Marquand, a university professor who became a minister in the first postwar Labor Government, died last night. His age was 70.

title: Chapot Captures TWO Riding Titles
description: Frank Chapot, a member of the United States Equestrian Team since 1955, has won many honors over the years. But last night, as the National Horse Show ended an eightday run, he left with two titles that had eluded him.

title: Needham Asks a Longer Trading Day To Aid Investors in Other Time Zones
description: LONDON, Nov. 7James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, proposed today that the exchange lengthen its trading day to help investors in other time zones who want to do business through the New York stock market.

title: FirstTime Yale Voters Show Little Exuberance
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 7 There is no sense of this being a historical occasion, said 18yearold Fred Krupp, a Yale freshman. Everybody just takes it for granted.

title: Humphrey Votes
description: WAVERLY, Minn., Nov. (AP)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, who cast a ballot for himself for President in Marysville Township Hall four years ago, voted with his wife, Muriel, quickly and without fanfare Tuesday.

title: SUBWAY DISPLAYS ART BY CHILDREN; Paintings Vie With ?? at W. 86th St Station
description: Twelve tempera paintings are on view on the 86th Street subway station of the West Side IRT, competing for the traveler's eyes with the spontaneous expressionism of MARK 142, Rick II and the cigarette and movie advertisements.

title: Conquistador Rally Sinks Nets, 116108
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 7 The New York Nets continued to have their troubles on the road tonight and dropped their fourth straight, bowing to the San Diego Conquistadors by 116108.

title: Securities Markets Closed
description: Major securities and commodities markets were closed yesterday. In the major financial centersNew York, Chicago, Detroit, Philadelphiabanks also were closed. In most other areas, however, banks remained open.

title: S.I. COUNCIL RACE IS WON BY GAETA
description: Anthony Gaeta, a 45yearold Democrat, won in the contest for City Councilman at Large from Staten Island, the only Council race that was part of yesterday's balloting.

title: Professor at Stanford Uses Movies to Teach History
description: STANFORD, Calif. (UPI)History courses are better than ever at Stanford University because of the movies, says a professor.

title: Notes on People
description: Natalya Mtkarova, the ballerina who defected to the West from the Soviet Union two years ago, flew from New York to London for guest appearances with the Royal Ballet at Covent Garden and said, I would really prefer to live on this side of the Atlantic. Back in New York. the American Ballet Theater said Miss Makerova would continue to dance in its company, but that the ballerina bad, indeed, given up her apartment at the Apthrop on the Upper West Side, and rented one in London.

title: Louisiana Governor Plans To Evict Southern Students
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. (UPI)  Gov. Edwin Edwards said today that he would order about 150 students who seized the Southern University administration building evicted within 24 hours.

title: Mrs. Smith Defeated For Senate in Maine
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Wednesday, Nov. 8The 34year Congressional career of Senator Margaret Chase Smith, the Senate's only woman member, ended last night in a major upset as Democrats showed unexpected strength in New England Senate and Gubernatorial races.

title: Democrats Lead in Races For 28 Judgeships Here
description: President Nixon's coattails failed to extend to Republican judicial candidates in New York City last night, as Democrats running for 28 judgeships jumped to early leads in the balloting.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Connecticut judge ruled yesterday that policemen were not entitled to decide for themselves what constitutes pornography. In dismissing an obscenity charge against a magazine salesman, Circuit Judge David J. Jacobs said that if they were allowed to do so, there would be as many different standards of what constitutes obscenity as there are policemen.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Friends of Korea cannot remain silent in the face of the devastation of democratic process of Oct. 17 in Korea.

title: Bridge:Leaders in Long Match Find Sound Play Offsets Swings
description: The appropriate strategy in a long match between two expert teams depends to a great extent on the score. A team trailing by a big margin is forced to play for swings. Normal results will not help, so it must attempt games or slams that are slightly inferior, and perhaps even make plays that are slightly inferior on a percentage basis.

title: Westchester C.O.P. Leads In Contests for Legislature
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 7 Communities throughout Westchester County gave early 2to1 leads to President Nixon, and those Democratic legislative candidates who had been given the best chance of upsetting Republicans appeared to be running far behind.

title: China Childhood Was Inspiration For Needlework
description: Until she started to copy the 18thcentury design needlepoint, Maggie Lane had never noticed that the face on her Japanese snuff bottle resembled E. G. Marshall, the actor. He really looks just like E. G. Marshall, doesn't he? Mrs. Lane remarked the other day as she stood front of an outsized tour de force in stitchery hung above her dining table. The resemblance inspired the 47yearold wife of State Supreme Court Justice Myles J. Lane to seek out other similarities.

title: M'GOVERN OFFERS SUPPORT TO NIXON
description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D., Nov. 7 Senator George McGovern conceded the election to President Nixon tonight and offered him his support for the next four years.

title: Mrs. Abzug in the 20th
description: Representative Bella Abzug has succeeded in her second attempt to carry the 20th Congressional District. Defeated by the late. William Fitts Ryan in the Democratic primary in June, she received her party's designation after his deathand yesterday that proved enough.

title: Young Resigns as Pilot Of Finley's N.H.L Seals
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 7 (AP)Charles 0. Finley announced tonight that his California Golden Seals of the National Hockey League have accepted the resignation of Coach Garry Young. Finley, in a news conference said Fred Glover, a Seals executive droped by Finley as coach, would take Young's job on an interim basis.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The board of directors of the 3M Company, which has about 113million shares outstanding, has authorized the purchase of up to 300,000 shares of its common stock over a twoyear period. The purchased shares will be used in connection with the company's stock option plan.

title: First Leisure Elects
description: The First Leisure Corporation, a Beverly Hills, Calif., holding company, announced yesterday that Arthur H. Maslansky, special counsel to the company, had been named president. chief executive officer and a director. Harold Goldstein. acting President, was elected chairman.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The state's righttoknow laws covering conflict of interest, campaign finance and open governmental meetings are among the worst in the nation, according to a report by Common Cause, the national citizens lobby.

title: Robins Traded Illegally
description: VICENZA. Italy (AP)The police are investigating an itlegal trade of robins, used Pori polenta, a pudding delicacy in the Venetian region.

title: PHILIP J. KELLY DIES; SALES EXECUTIVE, 76
description: HENDERSONVILLE, N. C., Nov. 7Philip J. Kelly, a retired advertising man and a former president of the Sales Executives Club of New York, died on Saturday at his home here. He was 76 years old.

title: G.O.P. Retains Control Of Both Houses in Albany
description: The Republicans retained their control of both houses of the New York State Legislature in yesterday's election, but unofficial returns indicated that President Nixon's victory in the state was not significantly influencing how voters picked their Assemblymen and State Senators.

title: Heath to Visit Ulster
description: LONDON, Nov. 7 (Renters)Prime Minister Heath will visit Northern Ireland Nov. 16 and 17 for the first time since Britain took over direct rule in the province, it was announced today.

title: WILLIAM JOHNSTON, GEOLOGIST, WAS 73
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7Dr. William D. Johnston Jr., the retired chief of the United States Geological Survey's branch of international geology, died at his home here last Saturday after a short illness. He was 73 years old.

title: Cambodian Army, Despite U.S. Aid, Is Still No Match for Its Foe
description: ON ROUTE 5, in Cambodia, Nov. 2The sun burns the road soft, but the shade and the countryside are lush and actively cool like a gently running airconditioner. There are mango and lime trees, clumps of bamboo, waving rice and languid streams with languid, sweettasting fish.

title: Pell Reelected in Rhode Island as New Englanders Split Tickets
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I. Nov.  New England voters appeared to practice the art of ticketsplitting as early returns indicated a strong showing by Democrats in states swept by the Republican Presidential ticket.

title: 3 Republicans Lead Race For Appeals Court Seats
description: After the most lotly contested campaign in the history of the New York State Court of Appeals, the three Republican contenders were leading early today in the race for three seats.

title: DAVID M. DAVIES
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Nov. 7David M. Davies, who retired in 1958 as foreign advertising manager of the Standard 0il Company (New Jersey), died today at Clara Maass Memorial Hospital, Belleville. His age was 77.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his Oct. 20 letter Nathan Leventhal, Commissioner of Housing and. Development, talks of harassment by landlords eager to secure vacancies in their buildings and gives percentage increases purporting to show rentals have skyrocketed under vacancy decontrol.

title: Leaders of School Boycott in Canarsie Again Call on Parents There to End It
description: The Canarsie parents who headed a boycott that has kept white elementary and junior high school students out of classes for two weeks declared yesterday that the boycott is over and urged the return of the children to school today.

title: Nunn, a Conservative Democrat, Def eats Rep. Thompson in Georgia Contest for Senate Seat
description: ATLANTA, Wednesday, Nov. 8Sam Nunn, a young, conservative Democratic state legislator, won the Senate race here yesterday even as Georgians split their voting tickets to give the state's 12 electoral votes to President Nixon.

title: Jersey Democrats Win Local Contests
description: President Nixon's victory in New Jersey had little effect on local contests as Democrats won mayoral races in Paterson Elizabeth and East Brunswick and retained control of the Essex County Board of Freeholders.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, Nov. 7The first of three public hearings will open here tomorrow on regulations to preserve 36,000 acres of valuable marshlands adjoining seashore resorts in Ocean County and coastal areas in Monmouth and Middlesex Counties.

title: DEFENSE IS BEGUN IN BREWSTER CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The defense opened its case today in the trial of Daniel B, Brewster, former Senator of Maryland, depicting him as a millionaire who had a long history of interest in postal rates for advertising mail and, who therefore could not have accepted a bribe to influence them.

title: Boggs Is 1st Missing Person To Be Elected to Congress
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 7 (UPI) The House majority leader, Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana, who has been missing since Oct. 16 in Alaska, was reelected unopposed in today's general election. Thus, he became the first missing person in history to be elected to Congress. Mr. Boggs, a veteran New Orleans Congressman who coasted to victory over two political unknowns in the Democratic primary last August, was set to begin his 15th term in the House when he disappeared during a flight from Anchorage to Juneau, Alaska.

title: Advertising:
description: Manufacturers of prescription drugs can assault the eye of the physician with ads in any or all of scores of professional journals or specially tailored magazines. Now there's a couple of fellows over on Third Avenue offering a way to assault their ears as well.

title: British Pound Shows Drop In Day of Erratic Trading
description: LONDON, Nov. 7The pound lost ground in erratic trading today, disappointing Government hopes that the wageprice freeze announced yesterday by Prime Minister Heath would start the pound on steadily upward course.

title: NIXON WINS OHIO; STATE TAX KEPT
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 7President Nixon defeated Senator George McGovern here tonight in the contest for Ohio's 25 electoral votes, while the state's voters, by an overwhelming margin, voted to keep a key tax program of their Democratic Governor.

title: BREWERY CONCERN FILES COURT SUIT
description: A suit has been filed by Grain Belt Breweries, Inc., St. Paul, in the United States Federal Court, district of Nebraska, against the Joseph Schlitz Brewing Company, Milwaukee, and AnheuserBush, Inc., St. Louis. The St. Paul company charges that the two other companies violated Federal antitrust laws in the Nebraska and Iowa markets by market practices that were in restraint of trade.

title: COAST CONTRACTORS LOSE PLEA IN COURT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. (UPI)  The. California Supreme Court has refused to reconsider an environmental ruling that contractors contend could halt $500million worth of building projects in the state.

title: Hitchhiker Gains Vote
description: ROCHESTER, Minn., Nov. 7 (AP)Scott Dreblow, 19 years old, who said he put off getting an absentee ballot until it was too late, hithchhiked 1,105 miles from Jackson, Wyo., to Rochester to vote for Senator George McGovern for President. Mr. Dreblow has been working on a cattle ranch near Jackson. He said he left Jackson early Sunday, arrived in Rochester about 5 A.M. Monday, and voted for McGovern on Tuesday. He has to be back at the ranch by Friday.

title: DEMOCRATS KEEP GOVERNORS'
description: Despite Richard Nixon's sweep of the country in the Presidential race, the Democratic party managed to retain or possibly improve its margin of control over the majority of the nation's 50 governorships.

title: GOVERNOR IN IOWA WINS REELECTION
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Nov. 7 (UPI)  President Nixon won Iowa's eight electoral votes tonight, in a farm state that Senator George McGovern had considered vital in his Presidential race. But is appeared that Senator Jack R. Miller, a Republican, might be upset by Dick Clark

title: FUND FEE CEILING OF 85% IS SOUGHT
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers, acting under a mandate from Congress, proposed yesterday that a ceiling of 8.5 per cent be placed on the sales charges for mutualfund shares.

title: Mr. Nixon's Victory
description: Richard M. Nixon and Spiro T. Agnew have now been overwhelmingly elected to a second term as President and Vice President of the United States. In accordance with the essential genius of this democracy, all Americansincluding especially those who, like ourselves, vigorously opposed their reelectionrecognize that the President yesterday received an unchallengeable popular mandate and that the destiny of this country for the next four years is now, for better or worse, to a large and important extent in his hands.

title: 125 Photos By Arbus On Display
description: Few photographers of the past decade have had as powerful an impact on the practice of their own medium as that of Diane Arbus, who died last year at the age of 48. In a remarkably short timeher serious work was all done in a period of 10 years she drastically altered our sense of what was permissible in photography and extended the range of what could be considered a sympathetic subject. She altered, too, some of the established notions of photographic style, substituting for the familiar compositional niceties a radical candor and an extraordinary empathy.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WEEHAWKEN, Nov. 7  To the Rev. John A. Kelly, a walk along Boulevard East is like a stroll on the French Riviera, but with a better viewthat of the New York skyline.

title: Lieut. Gartley Shoots Deer
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 7 (AP) Among successful hunters as the deer season opened in southern Maine was a man who had waited four years to shoot a whitetail, Navy Lieut. Mark Gartley, one of three American prisoners of war released by Hanoi more than a month ago. He was the first hunter to record killing a deer at Greenville, his home town.

title: ROCKLAND MARGIN IS OVERWHELMING
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Nov. 7Rockland County voted overwhelmingly for President Nixon today, 63,457 to 34,446 for Senator George McGovern.

title: Bad Weather Thwarts A Candidate in Kansas
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan., Nov. 7 (AP)Dave Owen, Republican candidate for Lieutenant Governor of Kansas, planned an intensive last day's campaigning. He wound up spending 13 hours in airplanes ranging as far as Dallas and Chicago.

title: Blue CrossBlue Shield Sued
description: KANSAS CITY. Mo., Nov. 7 (AP)The United States Attorney's office announced here today that it was filing suit against Blue CrossBlue Shield of Kansas City for allegedly violating Phase II price control regulations by increasing premium rates on group health insurance.

title: MANY VOTES SPLIT
description: The Democratic party withstood President Nixon's landslide yesterday to retain control of both houses of Congress.

title: Pepsico and Rheingold: A Soft Drink or a Beer?
description: For nostalgic New Yorkers the 119yearold name Rheingold evokes memories of Miss Rheingold and, later the Metsomania of the nineteen sixties.

title: Remote Pickups Cut By C.B.S. in Strike
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System was forced last night to drop from its election coverage most pickups from points outside its studios because of the continuing strike of its cameramen, audio engineers and other technicians.

title: Lieut. Gartley Shoots Deer
