description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 7 (AP) Among successful hunters as the deer season opened in southern Maine was a man who had waited four years to shoot a whitetail, Navy Lieut. Mark Gartley, one of three American prisoners of war released by Hanoi more than a month ago. He was the first hunter to record killing a deer at Greenville, his home town.

title: M'TGOVERN LAGS IN NATIVE STATE
description: SIOUX FALLS, S. D., Nov. 7 As vote counting lagged badly in South Dakota tonight, President Nixon held a slight lead over Senator George McGovern, a native son.

title: Sports of The Times
description: His face in a smile or a sneer, Muhammad All changes quickly, from huckster to comedian to prophet to poet bargainer with foreign nations to American nonvoter. Once the heavyweight champion, he remains the heavyweight chameleon.

title: President's Margin Seen As a Million in the State
description: President Nixon swept New York State yesterday and was running ahead of Senator McGovern in New York City with a third of the vote counted.

title: Idaho Elects McClure, a Conservative Republican, to Fill Senate Seat Vacated by Jordan
description: BOISE, Idaho, Nov. 7Representative James A. McClure, conservative Republican, was elected today to the United States Senate, defeating his Democratic opponent, William E. Davis.

title: UPSTATE MAN FOUND DEAD IN AIR CRASH
description: DUANESBURG, N.Y., Nov. 7 (AP)Searchers found the body of Joseph Grady Syracuse businessman in the cockpit of his small private airplane to day. He had been missing since last Saturday.

title: No Free Samples at Bank
description: TROCHTELFINGEN, Germany (UPI)A masked man walked into a bank and demanded its money. No, we don't have any, an employe standing behind a bulletproof window told him The man shruggedand left.

title: ILLINOIS GOVERNOR IN CLOSE CONTEST
description: CHICAGO, Wednesday, Nov. 8Bucking a Nixonled Republican trend throughout Illinois, Daniel Walker, the independent Democrat, was holding a steady lead early today over the Republican incumbent Governor, Richard B. Ogilvie, as returns, slowed by widespread ticketsplitting, trickled in.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 7 (Reuters)The European Common Market's foreign ministers have agreed in principle to extend the freedom of establishment in Common Market countries to the banking sector, informed sources said today.

title: 5 Men Seized in Brooklyn Face Marijuana Charges
description: Five men, including one who holds two graduate degrees, were under arrest yesterday on charges of criminally selling and possessing marijuana.

title: LATE OILER GOALS BEAT RAIDERS, 42
description: EDMONTON; Alberta, Nov. 7 (UPI)Third period goals by Steve Carlyle and Al Hamilton sparked the Alberta Oilers to j4 2 victory over the New York Raiders tonight in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Virginia's Spong Loses to Conservative
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 7Republicans won. a Senate seat from Virginia tonight for the first time in this century.

title: Indiana Gives Nixon Big Vote and Picks A G.O.P. Governor
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 7 (UPI) President Nixon carried Indiana today by a plurality estimated at more than half al million votes. This helped Otis R. Bowen, a Republican and smalltown physician, win the Governor's office by a probable 3to2 margin.

title: Hartford Assembly G.O.P.
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 7President Nixon carried Connecticut today in a landslide victory.

title: A Relaxed Agnew Votes In Home State,Maryland
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 Vice President Agnew, looking every bit as fresh as when he began his pursuit of reelection seven weeks ago, voted in his home state of Maryland today and then returned to this city to await the country's decision.

title: Ears. Called Clue to Kidney
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 7 (AP)The size and shape of a child's ears may be a clue to the state of his kidney, according to a University of Texas urologist. Dr. Paul C. Peters told a meeting of urologists here that ears and kidneys reach key stages of development at about the same time in an embryo.

title: Dance: Marathon Finale
description: Arthur Mitchell's Dance Theater of Harlem was joined at the ANTA Theater last night by the Sanasardo Dance Company providing the final program of the City Center American Dance Marathon. The Marathon promised 20 companies in six weeksthe Sanasardo was the 20th. It was the end of a useful and memorable journeyalthough, of course, the marathon continues with the Harlem dancers, and Sanasardo alternating with the Gloria Newman Dance Theater from the West Coast, until the end of this week.

title: Voting for Conservative Party Running Far Ahead of Liberals'
description: The Conservative party's vote for President Nixon was running far ahead of the Liberal party's vote for Senator George McGovern with returns in from more than the state's 12,948 election districts in yesterday's election.

title: TALK BOARD AIDS VICTIM OF PALSY
description: MINNEAPOLIS (AP)F. Hall Roe can't carry on a speaking conversation with you. But he gets along capably by flipping a hand around his talk board.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 7 (AP) Thirdperiod goals by Ed Hoekstra and Jack Stanfield gave the Houston Aeros a 32 victory tonight over the Chicago Cougars in a World Hockey Association contest.

title: Delaware Democrats Defeat Governor Peterson and Senator Boggs
description: WILMINGTON Del., Nov. 7Democrats upset today the reelection bids by Gov. Russell W. Peterson and Senator J. Caleb. Boggs.

title: Charles Stafford, Served In New Hampshire Posts
description: LACONIA, N. H., Nov. 7 (AP)Charles F. Stafford, prominent New Hampshire Republican, died in a hospital here today after a brief illness. He was 59 years old.

title: The Soviet Revolution Is Celebrated in Peking
description: PEKING, Nov. 7 (Reuters)  A ceremony marking the 55th anniversary of the Russian Revolution took place today quietly here today despite fresh attacks on the Soviet Union by Chinese leaders.

title: Great Southwest in Accord
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 7 (AP) The Great Southwest Corporation said today agreement had been reached on settlement of a suit brought against it by four of its former officers.

title: State Environmental Bond Issue Approved Handily
description: New York State voters yesterday overwhelmingly approved a $1.15billion environmental bond issue.

title: The Talk of Luxembourg
description: LUXEMBOURG  In the squat City Hall of Luxembourg, Alfred Geib and Adrienne Bartholme wait with their parents for the arrival of Mayor Colette Flesch, who will perform their civil marriage ceremony. Mr. Geib is one of 4,000 Luxembourgers who work in a bank. Rene Bartholme, Adrienne's father, talks a little about the way things used to be in Luxembourg before all the banks and holding companies settled in, before Luxembourg exploded into a Eurobond capital and a kind of Wall Street on the Moselle.

title: Brandt Urges Opposition to Back Treaty
description: BONN, Nov. 7The Government of Chancellor Willy Brandt appealed today to the opposition conservatives to support the treaty it has just negotiated with the East Germans to establish formal relations between the two Germanys.

title: Bella Abzug Wins Easily; Reid Leads as Democrat
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug, a oneterm Manhattan Democrat, won a decisive reelection victory yesterday, while Representative Ogden R. Reid, a former Republican, led in his bid to win reelection as a Democrat in Westchester County.

title: Mrs. Truman Votes Alone
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Nov. 7 (UPI)  Mrs. Harry S. Truman, 87 years old, voted alone here today, accompanied to the polls only by Secret Service men and her husband's companion and chauffeur, Mike Westwood. Her husband, the former President, remained at the couple's home, having cast an absentee ballot for the first time in a general election.

title: Nixon Takes a 2to1 Lead in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Wednesday Nov. 8President Nixon appears to have carried local Republican candidates with him as he took a commanding lead over Senator George McGovern in Nassau County last night.

title: ABITIBI TO RAISE NEWSPRINT PRICES
description: The Abitibi Paper Company, Ltd., said in Toronto yesterday that it would increase its newsprint prices in Ontario and Quebec beginning Feb. 1.

title: Confidential U.S. Records On Meat Opened to Public
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP) The Department of Agriculture bowed to a court order and oponed for public scrutiny today thousands of confidential inspection records on meat plants in six states.

title: Retirement Gift Is Burnt
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) Milton Buch's career at a local company came to a flaming end recently when a fire broke out at the company and destroyed, among other things Mr. Buch's retirement gift. I'm not sure what I'll do with it, Mr. Buch said holding a charred desk set. I'll probably have it engraved and hang it on the wall.

title: Man Sets Up His Children With Ice Cream Business
description: TOLEDO, Ohio (AP)  A newly opened ice cream parlor here is operated by a 21yearold president and general manager and 12 vice presidents ranging in age from 20 years to 8 months.

title: People and Business
description: Louis Rasminsky, one of the world's mostrespected central bankers, turns 65 in February and will step down then after almost 12 years as governor of the Bank of Canada. He has been with the bank for 32 years.

title: President Loses in City By 81,920Vote Margin
description: President Nixon swept New York State yesterday, but lost to Senator McGovern in New York City by a total of 81,920 votes.

title: Price Panel Studies Data on Car Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Price Commission's staff believes it can use new, highly confidential breakeven data just received from the auto industry to reduce or disapprove price increases sought by General Motors and Ford.

title: Man Slain in Chicago Voting
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 7 (UPI)A man was shot and killed by a policeman in a polling place today. The man had knocked down an election judge during a quarrel and made a motion as if reaching for a gun as he fled. He was identified as Fred Emanuel, about 40 years old.

title: 8 Democratic Incumbents Are Reelected in Jersey
description: Eight Democratic incumbents won reelection to the House of Representatives from New Jersey yesterday but the reapportionment of the state's 15 districts earlier this year allowed the Republicans to gain a seat and nearly win a majority of the state delegation.

title: WARRIORS CRUSH BRAVES, 405 TO 91
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 7 (UPI)The Golden State Warriors rallied from a 2point halftime deficit to an 18point thirdquarter lead and downed the Buffalo Braves, 10591, tonight for their sixth straight National Basketball Association victory.

title: The Screen: A Chinese 'Fist of Fury':Stark Tale of Revenge Opens at Pagoda Shanghai Is Setting for Kung-Fu Combats
description: "Fist of Fury" landed with a bang and quite a few whimpers yesterday at Chinatown's Pagoda Theater to illustrate that some Orientals aren't particularly inscrutable. Despite a concentration on the rough Kung-Fu form of hand-to-hand combat and other vaguely exotic matters, this import from Hong Kong subtitled in English (and Chinese for the Cantonese who can't follow its Mandarin dialogue) proves as in, say, "Batman", that the bad guys don't stand a chance against the good guys.Lo Wei, the writer-director, offers some lip service to national pride as the young members of the Chinese Kung-Fu school battle villainous Japanese trying to destroy their organization, although it's difficult to discern from the studio sets that it's all happening in 1908 Shanghai. In a simplistic story that is performed in similarly stark, obvious style, the hero, a master of Kung-Fu with a low boiling point, avenges the murder of his revered teacher with an clat that would charm Superman.Reportedly a box-office smash in the Orient, "Fist of Fury" is, in effect, Bruce Lee's personal dish of tea. And the handsome, 32-year-old actor, a reputed Kung-Fu expert with the muscular build of a welterweight champ, doesn't let the Kung-Fu lovers down. He is decidedly an eye-catching figure as he takes on all comers, singly or in whimpering groups, in stylized, Karate-like bouts with swift, balletic moves, baleful stares, deadly flying fists and legs and, of course, all the necessary eerie shouts.He also has some moments of subdued, romantic dalliance with Miao Ker Hsiu, a Kung-Fu colleague who's a real doll by any standards. But Mr. Lee's heart is obviously elsewhere. The main thrust here is action, while he and the rest of the cast are fairly casual about love and national pride. And, while Chinese films are plentiful in Chinatown, the action here is as black-and-white and as pleasantly, if naively, diverting as that in any western even though it was all shot in vivid colors.

title: NIXON ISUEES CALL TO WORK TOGETHER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7President Nixon summoned his supporters and political opponents tonight to work together in the four years ahead to achieve our common great goals.

title: Pacers Beat Tams
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Nov. 7 (AP) The Indiana Pacers broke ripen a close game late in the third quarter and went on to a 124116 American Basketball Association victory over the Memphis Tams tonight.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BRIELLE, N.Y., Nov. 7Mrs. Lillian Bogan has just returned from her annual sixweek Florida vacation and she's glad to be home. One of the reasons is that she can go out on her fishing safaris from Bogan's Basin.

title: 200 Evacuated in BMT Fire
description: A smoky twoalarm fire in the BMT DekalbFlatbush Avenue station in Brooklyn caused the evacuation yesterday of about 200 of morning passengers.

title: Summary of Other News
description: Leaders of Canarsie parents who have kept their children out of school for two weeks declared yesterday that the boycott is over and called on parents to return their children to school. But the prospect of full classes today remained in doubt since more than 1,000 parents shouted down the same call Monday night.

title: Harold O'Brien, CoOwner Of Resort, Killed in Crash
description: MILFORD, Pa., Nov. 7A private funeral service was held here today for Harold O'Brien of Lakeville, who died in a crash of his small airplane at nearby Honesdale on Sunday. He was 46 years old.

title: Airman. 19. on Leave Here Is Fatally Shot by Brother
description: A 19yearold Brooklyn airman, home on leave from Blytheville Air Force Base in Arkansas was shot to death yesterday afternoon by his 14yearold brother in an apparent accident, according to the police.

title: U.S. Agency Upholds Complaint by Blacks At Washington Post
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7A complaint that The Washington Post discriminates against blacks in its hiring, promotion and jobassignment practices has been supported by the Federal Equal Employment Opportunity Commission.

title: Key Decision Near on Adirondack Development
description: TUPPER LAKE, N.Y., Nov. 7  New York State will soon be forced to make a decision that will set a precedent for largescale development of the vast Adirondack wilderness.

title: Music: A Young Violinist
description: Marylou Speaker, a young Boston Symphony violinist who appeared Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, made it clear in the course of her program that she is the kind of musician any orchestra would be lucky to have in its ranks. Miss Speaker, an Oregonian by birth, joined the B.S.O. two years ago, and has been a soloist with the Boston Pops. She plays in tune, with great facility and in unimpeachable taste.

title: Level of Fighting in Vietnam Falls Off
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 8The war continued yesterday at a level of intensity that was relatively routine but slightly below its level during the last 10 days, the Saigon and American commands reported. Ground infantry engagements, indirectfire attacks, naval gunfire missions and tactical and strategic air operations were 10 to 15 per cent below weekend levels.

title: Voter Is Told She Died
description: SAEGERTOWN, Pa. Nov. 7 (APA Crawford County woman was rather surprised when she went to the polls today in a rural township near here. Authorities told her she was dead. It developed that another woman with the same name and the same rural delivery address had died during the last year, and the wrong person had been taken off the rolls.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I deplore the recent acts of violence against schoolchildren, with particular reference to the Queens incident in which ten city children were injured when their school bus was attacked by adults. Violence does not resolve conflict of ideas or goals; does not lessen fear; it does not provide the problemsolving climate in which people can understand each other enough to want to create mutually beneficial kind of life. [Editorial Oct. 26.]

title: Federal Observers Sent To Eight Counties in South
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) Federal observers were assigned to eight counties in four Southern states for the general election, Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MARGIN ABOUT 60%
description: Richard Milhous Nixon won reelection by a huge majority yesterday, perhaps the largest ever given a President.

title: A Profit Society
description: DORTMUND, West GermanyMuch has been said in recent years in this country about violence in connection with problems of domestic security. A lot of violence has also become visible, and there has been a tacit agreement that violence means only the one kind, the visible: bombs, pistols, clubs, stones, water cannons and teargas grenades.

title: Personalities: Bruin Goalie Out
description: The Boston Bruins, only last season the most funfilled team in hockey with a collection of players who knew they were best, suffered still another blow yesterday to continue their hard luck this National League season. Ross Brooks, a 35yearold rookie who became the squad's No. 1 goalie, broke his left collarbone.

title: GROWING GAP SEEN It WORLD OUTPUT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7A State Department study of the probable world economic performance during this decade predicted that by 1980 the industrial nations will retain roughly their present share of the gross planetary product while the underdeveloped countries slide further behind the rich ones.

title: A Rockefeller Loses West Virginia Race
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va., Nov. 7  Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. was reelected to a second term tonight, defeating Secretary of State John D. Rockefeller 4th, in a race that was nationally watched for indications of a Rockefeller future in national politics.

title: Republicans in Connecticut To Control Both Houses
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 7Connecticut Republicans tonight won control of both houses of the General Assembly for the first time since 1956.

title: Maritime Strike's Impact On Hawaii Eased by Union
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 7 (UPI)Gov. John A. Burns announced yesterday that the Masters, Mates and Pilots Union had granted Hawaii a reprieve. The union, he said, has agreed to grant the state partial exemption from its strike against the Pacific Maritime Association.

title: Michigan Fighting Efforts to Prohibit Its Hot Dog Rules
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7 (UPI)The Michiganmade hot dog is undergoing the most serious challenge to its integrity.

title: Victory, 10 Years Later
description: It was a spectacular personal victory for Richard Nixon, 10 years to the day, and almost to the hour, after his most humiliating defeat by Pat Brown in the 1962 election for the governorship of California.

title: Dorothy Day, at 75, Is Still the Gentle Radical
description: TIVOLI, N. Y., Nov. 7  A cool breeze ruffled the surface of the Hudson River outside her window, and Dorothy Day smiled and said, It was bitter cold that winter  and Gene O'Neill was there.

title: NEW JERSEY; Dining Out in New Jersey; Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).
description: ** Stegeman's Cock n Bull, Tappan Road and Blanch Avenue, Norwood, N. J. (201) 7670332.

title: Senator Case Again
description: In the only contest for a United States Senate seat in the tristate area, Republican incumbent Clifford Case won an overwhelming victory in New Jersey. A conscientious and independentlyminded legislator, Mr. Case has been sent to the Senate, for the fourth time now, with justifiably increasing majorities.

title: DEMOCRAT VICTOR IN LOUISIANA RACE
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 7 In the face of a Republican Presidential sweep of the state, former State Senator J. Bennett Johnston, the Democratic nominee, apparently defeated three opponents in the race to fill Louisiana's vacant United States Senate seat today.

title: Whigs Concede Defeat For Millard Fillmore
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 7 (AP) The Resurrected Whig party, which nominated the late Millard Fillmore as its candidate for President last July 6before the major party conventionsacted before the more widelyknown political groups again today.

title: RANGERS RETURN TO PLAY CANUCKS
description: The invisible Islanders, a hockey team that last was seen in the metropolitan area late last month, turn up tonight in Chicago. The highly visible Rangers, meanwhile, appear in Madison Square Garden tonight following a road trip.

title: Soviet Displays Military Might; Brezhnev Seems to Be Unwell
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 7The Soviet Union paraded its military might in relatively lowkey fashion today, and Western diplomats were more interested in the appearance of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the party leader, than in the weaponry, which was all familiar.

title: Barker Is Denied Request For a New Trial in Florida
description: MIAMI, Nov. 7 (UPI)Bernard Barker, one of the men charged in connection with the Watergate case, has been denied a request for a new trial on charges of misusing his notary public seal on a $25,000 Republican campaign fund check.

title: News Analysis
description: It was a spectacular personal victory for Richard Nixon, 10 years to the day, and almost to the hour, after his most humiliating defeat by Pat Brown in the 1962 election for the governorship of California.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 7 (AP)The Erie County legislature decided today to accept the offer of the Rich Products Corporation of Buffalo to pay $1.5million for the right to name the county's new football facility Rich Stadium. The legislature voted, 164, to accept the foodprocessing firm's bid over three other official proposals and an offer by the Buffalo Bills owner, Ralph C. Wilson Jr., to name the park Buffalo Bills Stadium.

title: Strike Forces C.B. S. to Curtail Remote Pickups
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System was forced last night to drop from its election coverage most pickups from points outside its studios because of the continuing strike of its cameramen, audio engineers and other technicians.

title: DEFENSE IS BEGUN IN BREWSTER CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The defense opened its case today in the trial of Daniel B. Brewster, former Senator of Maryland, depicting him as a millionaire who had a long history of interest in postal rates for advertising mail and, who therefore could not have accepted a bribe to influence them.

title: EXPANTHER FIGURE SEIZED AS FUGITIVE
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 7 (UPI)Lawrence E. Townsend, 34 years old, a former Black Panther party organizer who lives in Bridgeport, was arrested in Boston today on a charge of unlawful flight to avoid prosecution.

title: Lon Nol Discloses U.S. Doesn't Inform Him Fully
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 6The President, Marshal Lon No], said today that Henry A. Kissinger had informed him only of the broad terms, not the details, of the proposed peace accord for Indochina, and that even now he was being neither consulted nor promptly or fully informed by the United States on the negotiations with North Vietnam.

title: HENRY M. GROSMAN
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 7 Henry Marc Grosman, a trial attorney in Newark for 43 years, died yesterday at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston. He was 76 years old and lived at 32 South Munn Avenue.

title: A Rockefeller Loses West Virginia Race
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Wednesday, Nov. 8Secretary of State John D. Rockefeller 4th suffered a sharp defeat yesterday in a bid for the West Virginia governorship. The loss appeared, at least, to have postponed a possible role for him in national Democratic politics in 1976.

title: Bella Abzug Reelected by Wide Margin
description: Representaive Bella S.Abzug won reelection by a margin of almost 2 to 1 yesterday after a campaign carefully designed to mute her often controversial personality, and she promptly returned to the fiery ways that had won her national attention.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TORQUAY, England, Nov. 7 (AP)Australia's Alvin Gardiner and Robin Forst of Britain won their opening matches after allnight play in the Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament. With the schedule running late, the matches continued for 24 hours without interruption and went into another probable allday, allnight session.

title: Burger Panel Will Propose a National Court of Appeals to Screen Cases
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  A new national court of appeals to help the United States Supreme Court screen out appeals of lesser importance will be proposed in the next few weeks by a panel appointed by Chief Justice Warren E. Burger.

title: Election Noted in Hanoi
description: HANOI, Nov. 7 (Agence FrancePresse)The North Vietnamese Communist party daily Nhan Dan disclosed today to its readers that this is Election Day in the United States. This morning it carried a halfpage commentary on the subject under the headline, The U.S. at the Crossroads. The real problem is not who will be elected but the policy that the new President will adopt on the Indochinese problem, it was observed.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Continental Oil Company took a step forward in Britain and a step backward in Canada yesterday.

title: UTILITY REPORTS NINEMONTH GAIN
description: The South Carolina Electric & Gas Company reported yesterday gains in total operating revenues and net income for the first nine months of this year.

title: C.R. MAXWELL JR., 58, CORPORATE LAWYER
description: Charles R. Maxwell Jr., corporate and financial lawyer with offices at 230 Park Avenue, died on Friday in Funchal, Madeira. He was 58 years old and lived at 113 East 61st Street.

title: Halo Wins Voters Handicap At Laurel on Strong Finish
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 7 (UPI)Cragwood Stable's Halo triumphed over 11 other 3yearolds at a mile today in the $23,850 Voters Handicap at Laurel Race Course.

title: Thurmond Wins Election Easily in South Carolina
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Nov. (AP)South Carolina gave its eight electoral votes to President Nixon and reelected Republican Senator Strom Thurmond to another sixyear term today.

title: Harry H. Rifkin. Lawyer And Wartime O.P.A. Aide
description: Harry H. Rifkin, a New York lawyer for 40 years and an official of the Office of Price Administration in World War II, died yesterday of cancer in Memorial Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived at 75 Bank Street in Greenwich Village.

title: FirstTime Yale Voters Show Little Exuberance
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 7 There is no sense of this being a historical occasion, said 18yearold Fred Krupp, a Yale freshman. Everybody just takes it for granted.

title: Not One to Live in Husband's Shadow
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Mrs. Peter Jankowitsch, the wife of Austria's United Nations Ambassador, was browsing in the bookshop here when an acquaintance making small talk posed a question: Did Mrs. Jankowitsch know how to make a sacher torte?

title: BRITONS CONFUSED BY PRICE FREEZE VOICE COMPLAINTS
description: LONDON, Nov. 7Government offices were swamped today with complaints of price increases on the first full day of Prime Minister Heath's threemonth freeze designed to control inflation.

title: Huddleston, Democrat, Defeats Nunn for Kentucky Senate Seat
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 7 State Senator Walter (Dee) Huddleston, a Democrat, was elected to the United States Senate tonight despite an overwhelming victory by President Nixon in the state's Presidential balloting.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The Jeep Wagoneers looked like crates in which the opposition cars had been shipped. But those Ugly Americans were strong enough to place first and third in the Press On Regardless rally, which ended Sunday after an ordeal of three nights in snow, fog, sleet, rain and mud over 2,000 miles of roads and nonroads in the Upper and Lower Peninsulas of Michigan. It was the first time an Americanmade car had ever won an event on the International Rally Championship calendar of the Federation Internationale de ('Automobile (F.I.A.).

title: HATFIELD DEFEATS MORSE IN OREGON
description: PORTLAND. Ore., Nov. 7Republican Mark 0. Hatfield won reelection tonight, defeating Wayne Morse in a closely contested United States Senate race that attracted national attention.

title: HEMOPHILIAC WINS PENNSYLVANIA HELP
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 7 (UPI)Kevin Marshall, a hemophiliac whose family had been faced with going on welfare to provide treatment for him, finally is assured of free treatments.

title: Data on Latest Wheat Sale To China Are Announced
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) The Department of Agriculture said today that the latest sale of wheat to China had totaled 3,684,983 bushels so far.

title: Economic Analysis
description: With inflation threatening to get out of hand, the pound sinking and the British social and political fabric in danger of being ripped apart, Prime Minister Heath has frozen wages, prices, rents and dividends for 90 days and has said that some form of controls would follow thereafter. The Tory leader's action was as much of an ideological somersault for him as was President Nixon's wageprice freeze of Aug. 15, 1971. Conservatives in this country were stunned by Mr. Nixon's adoption of a policy theyand hehad often denounced as not only ineffective but statist and even immoral.

title: A New Rule Allows Policemen To Serve as Security Guards
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy has changed departmental regulations to permit policemen to work during offduty hours as security guards in the city's public schools.

title: THIEU'S OPPOSITION REPORTS CONTACTS BY VIETCONG AIDES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 7Agents of the National Liberation Front have initiated several contacts in recent weeks with members of Saigon's antiGovernment, nonCommunist opposition, apparently in preparation for a ceasefire and the coming political struggle, according to opposition sources here.

title: The Vice President Spiro Theodore Agnew
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 The question was a constant companion to his campaign, and in Los Angeles last week it was raised once again. The reporter wanted to know which of the muchdiscussed public imagesthe old one or the new onemore closely resembled the real Vice Presi

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lawrence N. Canjar, 49, Educator in Engineering
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7Lawrence N. Canjar, an educator in the field of engineering, died last, night of a heart attack. He was 49 years old.

title: 2 Killed in Island Holdup
description: CHRISTIANSTED, V. L., Nov. 8 (UPI)Bandits killed two persons yesterday in the holdup of a restaurant. The slayings occurred two months after an armed robbery at the Fountain Valley Golf Course, in which eight persons were slain.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Frances C. Huntington, Author And Geographer, Is Dead at 82
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 Mrs: Frances Carpenter Huntington, an author and geographer, died last Thursday atl Washington Hospital Center after a brief illness. She was 82 years old.

title: One Governorship Is Gained by Democrats
description: The appeal to populism that failed to work for Senator George McGovern in the Presidential election emerged as an important factor in the out come of several governorship races across the country, as the Democrats gained one governorship in Tuesday's election.

title: Hull Plays First W. H. A. Game But Nordiques Beat Jets, 32
description: QUEBEC CITY, Nov. 8 (UPI) Bobby Hull played his first game for the Winnipeg Jets tonight, but it was to. little avail as the club lost, 32; to the Quebec Nordiques.

title: Accord Ends Church SitIn
description: The city's Council of Churches agreed yesterday to set up a task force on racism, ending a sevenday sitin at the council's offices by a group led by the Rev. A. Kendall Smith of Harlem. The Rev. Daniel Potter, executive director of the council, said the task force had been agreed to at a meeting of Mr. Smith's group and representatives of the council's 60member board of directors.

title: Alex Rose Concedes That Liberals Took a Beating in Election
description: Alex Rose, the Liberal party's chief strategist, conceded yesterday that the Liberals took a beating in the Presidential election.

title: Bergen Votes the Classic Split Ticket; Democrats Survive Nixon Tidal Wave
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Nov. 8The voters, said Anthony Statile, Republican chairman of Bergen County, are getting more choosy.

title: Market Place: A Time Bomb In New Issues
description: There have always been plenty of risks in the newissue marketthat pool of capital that companies dip into when they first sell shares to the public.

title: PeyserOttinger Result Still in Doubt
description: A number of uncounted absentee ballots left an element of uncertainty yesterday in the apparent victory of Representative Peter A. Peyser, a freshman RepublicanConservative, over former Representative Richard L. Ottinger, who was attempting a political comeback in a merged WestchesterBronx County district.

title: CANARSIE REPORTS ATTENDANCE GAINS
description: Rejecting the appeals of parents association leaders and local school officials, Canarsie parents kept thousands of children out of schools in the area yesterday in a continuing dispute over the admission of a group of black and Puerto Rican children from Brownsville to John Wilson Junior High School 211.

title: Dow Off by 1.06 Turnover Is Heavy
description: The stock market yesterday gave President Nixon's victory, something less than three rousing cheers.

title: U. S. Investigator Will Replace Ruskin, Who Is Quitting Dec. 1
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday rimed Nicholas Scopetta, a Federal prosecutor in charge of investigating corruption in the criminaljustice system, as his new Commissioner of Investigation.

title: ASIANS IN UGANDA: TIME HAS RUN OUT; Straggers ?? in Makeshift Quarters to Await Exit
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Nov.8 About 800 stateless Asians were placed in two Sikh temples and a Hindu community center here tonight as President Idi Amin's 90day limit for the expulsion of Asians expired.

title: BLACK HAWKS TOP ISLANDERS, 6 TO 1
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 8 (AP)The Chicago Black Hawks scored ,six goals in the final period, three of them by a seldomused left wing, Dan Maloney, to rout the New York Islanders, 61, in a wild National Hockey League game tonight.

title: Kitten Hunt Leads Upstate Man Into World of Dog Training
description: Twenty years ago Fred Henry was looking for a kitten to give his daughter. He wound up with a German shepherd instead. I paid $50 for a bitch and thought the price so high, I was afraid to admit it to anyone, he laughingly recalled. Since I had paid so much, I was

title: FASHION TALK
description: We bring you now from Seventh Avenue for spring the elasticized waistline. Radical departure? Of course not. Simply a sensible manifestation of the casual mood of dressing that is definitely main stream.

title: Hanoi Asserts Accord Includes Release of All Held by Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. Nov. 8The North Vietnamese Cormmunist party newspaper said today that the draft agreement that was to have been signed Oct. 31 provided for the release of all military and civilian political prisoners in South Vietnamese jails  a provision whose existence was specifically denied by American officials.

title: DEMOCRATS FACE FIGHT FOR CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Senator George McGovern's defeat for the Presidency has opened the way today for a fierce struggle for control of the Democratic party, its structure and its rules.

title: Japanese Industry Is Expanding in Brazil
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Nov. 8 Japan's new push into Brazil is strongly felt here, where the Bank of Tokyo is going up next to the Hilton, the Japan Trade Center is organizing a milliondollar Japanese industrial fair and Japanese companies of every kind are rushing in to do business.

title: Already, a Hot Race For Mayor Looms
description: While some votes were still being counted, New York State Democrats and Republicans began preparing yesterday for the next election and the next fight, hours after President Nixon's stunning 1.2 millionvote margin of victory in the state.

title: Former Head Start Director Seized Here in $1,000 Theft
description: Mildred Douglass, former director of the Head Start preschool program for the Union Settlement Association, was arrested yesterday by the City Commissioner of Investigation's Office for the alleged theft of $1,015.14 through forged checks.

title: Korean Troops End Vietnam Combat Role
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 8  The 38,500 South Korean troops in Vietnam at the behest of the United States and South Vietnamese Governments have effectively retired to their rear bases and have stopped combat operations, according to their headquarters here.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Republic Steel Corporation decided yesterday to bid goodby to the production of nuts and bolts and virtually all forms of fasteners. The company said the bolt and nut division had been operating at a loss despite extreme costreduction measures. Accordingly, Republic said it planned to phase out production at facilities in Cleveland and in Gadsden, Ala.

title: Desertion Rate Doubles
description: As indicated by the major political polls, more than twice the usual proportion of Democrats abandoned their party's nominee Tuesday and voted for President Nixon.

title: Truckers Linked to Mafia Sue Police for $1 Million
description: Three garmentdistrict trucking concerns that have been linked by the Police Department to the Mafia and their executives sued Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy and the Deputy Commissioner William P. McCarthy yesterday for $1,005,000 in damages.

title: Japanese Concern Plans Issue of Brazilian Bonds
description: TOKYO, Nov. 8 (UPI)The president of Japan's largest securities company said today that his company was preparing for the issuance of bonds in Tokyo worth $32.4million on behalf of the Brazilian Government.

title: Truckers Linked to Mafia Sue Police for $1 Million
description: Three garmentdistrict trucking concerns that have been linked by the Police Department to the Mafia and their executives sued Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy and the Deputy Commissioner William P. McCarthy yesterday for $1,005,000 in damages.

title: Colorado Drops Winter Games Bid
description: DENVER, Nov. 8 (AP)Denver. denied funds, by a state referendum, was forced today to withdraw its bid to stage the 1976 Winter Olympic Games.
