description: To the Editor:

title: Stock Prices Down
description: The stock market rallied strongly yesterday morning in response to President Nixon's victory, but profit taking moved in later and the market closed generally lower. Wall Street leaders said the President's victory had been discounted in advance to some extent. Page 67.

title: DECIMATOR TAKES GREAT AMERICAN
description: Evan the racetrack fan, notoriously diehard insofar as weather is concerned, decided that the best form yesterday was to stay away. As a consequence, the smallest attendance since Aqueduct was opened in 1959 came out for the daily program.

title: Four Killed in Plane Crash
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Nov 8 (AP)A Beechcraft Bonanza fourseat plane crashed on a landing approach to the Greensboro airport after hitting a highvoltage power line during rain last night, killing the four persons on board. The victims were identified as Forrest Adair Paschal, 43 years old, of Siler City, N.C., his son, Forest Adair Paschal 2d, 18; Jake Burgess, 46, the pilot, of Siler City; and Joseph Norwood of Coraopolis, Pa.

title: Proposed Wetlands Rules Draw Strong Opposition in Monmouth
Japanese Concern Plans Issue of Brazilian Bonds
description: TOKYO, Nov. 8 (UPI)The president of Japan's largest securities company said today that his company was preparing for the issuance of bends in Tokyo worth $32.4million on behalf of the Brazilian Government.

title: Navajos in Utah Reject Indians, Elect Whites
description: MONTICELLO, Utah., Nov. 8 (UPI)Two Navajo Indians lost their bid yesterday to wrest control of the San Juan County government from whites.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: It's Muhlenberg Again In the Path of F. and M.
description: Franklin and Marshall trailed Moravian, 2221, with 50 seconds remaining last Saturday and had the ball on its 20. It had a long distance to go to keep its undefeated record intact.

title: PACERS BEAT STARS AND TAKE TOP SPOT
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 8 (AP) The Indiana Pacers took the Western Division lead in the kmerican Basketball Association tonight, beating the Utah Stars, 135124, behind George McGinnis's 35 points.

title: 2 Germanys Initial Pact To Normalize Relations
description: BONN, Nov. 8  West and East Germany initialed here today a comprehensive treaty designed to begin normalizing relations between them after more than two decades of nonrecognition.

title: Directors of C.B.S. Vote An End to Stock Dividend
description: Directors of the Columbia Broadcasting System, Inc., voted to discontinue the stock dividend that the company has distributed since 1954 and instead raised the quarterly cash dividend by 1.5 cents a share to 36.5 cents. It is payable Dec. 8 to holders of record Nov. 22.

title: Three New Curtain Dates
description: Three incoming stage attractions have set new opening dates. Ambassador, the new musical, will arrive at the LuntFontanne Theater Nov. 19. F.O.B., the Jeff Weiss play, makes its debut at the Mercer Brecht Theater on Nov. 24. Dr. Selavy's Magic Theater, a musical, will be presented at the Mercer O'Casey on Nov. 23.

title: Uneasy Truce in Chile: Rival Groups Await Elections
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 8The Chilean Government and the Opposition accused each other of bad faith today and the leader of President Salvador Allende Gossens party publicly disagreed with the President's policy. Thus Chile, a highly political and highly polarized country, seemed back to normal. Since Monday, when the country slowly returned to work after 26 days of strikes, a monthlong showdown between the Government and the antiMarxist Opposition has ended in a muddy truce, without clear winners or losers.

title: DEMOCRATS FACE FIGHT FOR CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Senator George McGovern's defeat for the Presidency has opened the way today for a fierce struggle for control of the Democratic party, its structure and its rules.

title: 1,250 Buyers of Cigarettes From South Get Tax Notice
TV Review
description: Following a tour Tuesday evening of the 'electron centers set up by the news departments of the three commercial networks, a visitor would have to be impressed, perhaps overwhelmed, by the scope of the projects, from the talent involved on every level to the dazzling manipulation of complex computer systems. The entire production was reported to cost the networks a total of about $9million, and it looked it.

title: PAKISTAN LEAVES SEATO ALLIANCE
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 8 (Reuters)  Pakistan announced today that she was withdrawing from the Southeast Asia Treaty Organization in line with a promise to the people made by President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto.

title: Meany Says Voters Rejected Neoisolationism of McGovern
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, said today that American voters, in soundly rejecting Senator George McGovern for President, had overwhelmingly repudiated neoisolationism as a basis for foreign policy.

title: Canarsie Reports a Gain in Attendance
description: Rejecting the appeals of parents association leaders and local school officials, Canarsie parents kept thousands of children out of schools in the, area yesterday in a continuing dispute over the admission of a group of black and Puerto Rican children from Brownsville to John Wilson Junior High School 211.

title: 73 ECONOMIC GAINS FORECAST IN SURVEY
description: The New York Stock Exchange's annual survey of 32 prominent United Stales economists finds a sustained high level of economic growth is in prospect for 1973, but inflationary clouds are likely to continue to hover over the landscape.

title: Misinformed Nevadan Calls Albany in Vain About Vote
description: ALBANY, Nov. 8 (AP)  A man who said he was from Nevada called The Associated Press office here repeatedly last night and this morning, asking for the results on Amendment No. 2 on the New York State ballot.

title: Chinese Youth Is Seized In Murder in Chinatown
description: A 16yearold youth said to be a member of Chinatown's Black Eagles youth gang was arrested yesterday and charged with attempted murder in the ambushslaying of another Chinese youth Tuesday at a Chineselanguage movie.

title: The Rezoning of Canarsie
description: The parents and the Community School Board of District 18 in Brooklyn will face a number of difficult and potentially volatile alternatives in complying with Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner's order to increase integration at these junior high schools. The order, delivered to the local board by Deputy Chancellor Irving Anker on Oct. 11, directs it to redraw the zone boundaries at the Meyer Levin 285 in East Flatbush and John Wilson 211 and Isaac Bildersee 68 in Canarsie, so as more nearly to equalize integration in these schools.

title: McGovern Defeat: A Look at Some Factors
description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D., Nov. 8 The black limousine that bore the defeated Democratic candidate from his hotel to the airport here today was a backup Presidential vehicle, flown here in case its occupant should be a Presidentelect. But the short ride in a President's car was as close as Senator George McGovern was destined to get to the White House.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CHAMPAIGN, III., Nov. 8 (AP)President Nixon was requested by the National Association of College Directors of Athletics today to set up a White House Congress on Amateur Athletics to resolve a growing controversy over the United States role in international competition.

title: Hewlett Wins Tennis Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Nov. 8  Hewlett High School defeated Great Neck North yesterday, 50, to win the Nassau County high school tennis championship at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: AID TO DEMOCRATS VOWED BY LINDSAY
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that he would play a very vigorous role in rebuilding the Democratic party, after the crushing defeat of the Democratic Presidential candidate, Senator George McGovern.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery made public yesterday the six engine companies that will be discontinued and the seven that will be relocated in a program designed to meet changing conditions in the city. The program has been assailed by the Uniformed Firefighters Association, which has charged that it would strip neighborhoods of adequate fire protection. Completion of the program is expected by Dec. 1.

title: Democrats Gain 2 Seats And Have 5743 Majority
description: In the face of an overwhelming Nixon landslide, Democrat ic senatorial candidates held control of their chamber, creased their majority by two and promised to provide much resistance to the Presin his second term as they in his first.

title: RentLeveling Bill Seems to Be Locked In Committee, Posing Possible 73 Issue
Virgin Island G.O.P. Lags
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I., Nov. 8 (AP)The Republican party appeared likely to be. reduced  today to only one seat in the 15member Virgin Islands Legislature, with the Democrats and the Independent Citizens Movement winning seven each. Another Democrat, Ron De Luge, handily defeated the Republican candidate, Vicfor Schneider, for the new post of delegate to the United States Congress.

title: CHILE COPPER CARGO ARRIVES IN SWEDEN
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 8 (AP)Part of a controversial copper cargo from Chile arrived today in Stockholm harbor in a Russian ship.

title: Proxmire Asks Grounding Of F111's, Citing Losses
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP)Senator William Proxmire to day asked the Air Force to provide proof that the recent loss of three F111 aircraft over North Vietnam had resulted from enemy fire and not mechanical failure.

title: E.D.I, IS PLANNING TOY SAFETY DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Food and Drug Administration is paying a New York advertising and public relations agency $137,632 to help it publicize the desirability of buying safe toys in the Christmas shopping season.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 8 (AP)  The owner of the proposed National Hockey League expansion franchise in Kansas City, Edwin G. Thompson, said today the next two or three days would likely determine whether the franchise remains in Kansas City.

title: 3 Jersey Democrats Who Won House Races Emerging as Rivals for Governor
description: TRENTON, Nov. 8The ability of Democratic. Congressional incumbents to survive the Republican landslide in yesterday's elections in New Jersey set up the prospect or a bitter primary battle for the Democratic nomination for Governor next year.

title: SISTER HELEN O'CONNOR
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Nov. 8Sister Helen Marie O'Connor, a member of the Benedictine Sisters of Elizabeth, died yesterday at St. Elizabeth's Hospital after a brief illness. She was 76 years old.

title: Thomas Now Ineligible Rest of N.F.L. Season
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 8 (UPI) Duane Thomas, the controversial running back, did not appear for practice with the San Diego Chargers today and was placed on the reserve list.

title: Already, a Hot Race For Mayor Looms
description: While some votes were still being counted, New York State Democrats and Republicans began preparing yesterday for the next election and the next fight, hours after President Nixon's stunning 1.2 millionvote margin of victory in the state.

title: A Plan for Police to Guard Schools Reported Failing
description: A proposal to hire offduty policemen to moonlight as security guards at public schools was reported by its sponsors yesterday to be foundering as the Mayor's office outlined a long list of legal and administrative problems that raised.

title: REGIONAL BANKS JOIN SOVIET TALKS
description: A group of regional banks in the United States, under the leadership of the French American Banking Corporation in New York, are negotiating with the Soviet Bank for Foreign Trade in Moscow to extend a line of credit of $100million that would be used to finance United States exports to the Soviet Union.

title: President Won 49 States And 521 Electoral Votes
description: By decisively reelecting President Nixon and a Democratic Congress, the American voter delivered a mixed mandate Tuesday along with fresh evidence that he remains planted in the middle of the political spectrum.

title: Tapes Reported To Link Jockeys To Fix Inquiry
The Tuskegee Mayor and His Wife: A Very Visible Interracial Marriage
description: TUSKEGEE, Ala.Ordinarily, being the first lady in a mediumsized Alabama town is no demanding task. The job requires little more than keeping a gracious smile, being the hostess at a few teas, and occasionally snipping the ribbon at a grand opening.

title: Rhode Island Elects Youth
description: WOONSOCKET, R. I., Nov. 8 (Reuters)A 19yearold college student became yesterday, the first teenager ever elected to the Rhode Island Legislature. Roger N. Begin, a student at Rhode Island Junior college, was elected as a Democrat to the State Assembly by a better than 2 to 1 margin over his 50yearold Republican opponent, George Koury.

title: F.P.C. APPROVES GAS SUPPLY DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8In the first application of a new policy intended to increase naturalgas supplies, the Federal Power Commission approved today deliveries of natural gas from a Texas field at a price nearly onefourth, higher than the present area ceiling.

title: The Stage: New Faces in Nanette and Prisoner
description: There are not so many long runs on Broadway right nowcome to think of it, there aren't so many short runs eitherbut at least five shows are at 400 performances or above. Two of these, No, No, Nanette at the 46th Street Theater and The Prisoner of Second Avenue at the Eugene O'Neill Theater, have recently had the blood transfusion of major new casting.

title: Temporary Injunction Against N.H.L. Frees Hull and Others to Play in W.H.A.
description: The National Hockey League was restrained temporarily yesterday from using its reserve clause to prohibit players from jumping to the World Association.

title: MERGER EXPLORED BY NORTON SIMON
description: Norton Simon, Inc., announced yesterday that it was conducting exploratory discussions to acquire Max Factor & Co.

title: Jamieson, Weiskopf Say They'll Keep World Golf Cup
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Nov. 8 (Reuter)Jim Jamieson and Torn Weiskopf are confident they can retain the World Golf Cup for the United States in the fourday tournament that opens here tomorrow.

title: French Ballet Arrives Monday
description: Someone somewhere in the corridors of Andre Malraux's French Ministry of Culture once cared enough about the state of dance in France to urge the Government to create a ballet company.

title: Personalities: Mathias, Metcalfe Run Well
description: Bob Mathias and Ralph Metcalfe, two former United States Olympians, easily outdistanced opponents in Congressional races yesterday in California and Illinois and were returned to the House of Representatives. Mathias, the decathlon gold medalist in 1948 and 1952, was reelected to a fourth term by a 21 margin over his Democratic rival, Vincent J. Lavery, in California's 18th Congressional District. Metcalfe, a silver medalist in the 100meter dash and a member of the gold medalwinning 400meter relay team in 1936 at Berlin, was reelected to a second term in Illinois's First Congressional District, winning 85 per cent of the

title: For 5 Hours Tenants Battle Niagara Falls in Town House
description: Only a fraction of the rain that inundated the city yesterday poured through a sixstory apartment building across the street from the Metropolitan Museum of Art, but it was enough to turn the elevator shaft into what one tenant called a Niagara Falls.

title: Jersey to Reassess Its Transport Budget
description: TRENTON, Nov. 8The New Jersey Department of Transportation said today it would have to reassess its capitalspending program because of the defeat of the $650million transportation bond issue at the polls yesterday.

title: Jersey Bingo Vote Brings Calls for Part of the Action
description: NEWARK, Nov. 8While President Nixon and Senator Clifford P. Case had landslide victories in the New Jersey election yesterday, the state's elderly hit their own bonanza at the polls.

title: CANADIENS SCORE OVER LEAFS, 52
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 8 (UPI)Pete Mahovlich scored twice, including the winning goal midway through the third period tonight, as the Montreal Canadiens edged the TorOnto Maple Leafs, 52.

title: Essex and Hudson Say State Suit Will Force Bridges to Stay Open
G.O.P. TAKES OVER IN CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 8Connecticut Democrats emerged from their defeat at the polls yesterday bitter, divided and doubtful that the party could avoid slipping into an abyss of bickering.

title: Never a MinorLeaguer
description: The New York Met thirdbase coach, Eddie Yost, played 2,109 games in the major leagues. He never played minorleague ball.

title: New England
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Nov. 8Democrats at the state level fought back the Nixon tide.that swept over most of the New England states yesterday and further weakened the traditional Republican grip on the Northeastern states.

title: A NearSweep for Westchester G.O.P.
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 8 Republican headquarters early this morning had a touch of grimness about it because the Westchester County race that concerned the party most intimately a congressional contest had been lost.

title: Kiwi Bird Dies in Zoo
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 8 (AP)A rare kiwi bird, one of only four believed in captivity outside New Zealand, was found dead today in the San Diego zoo. The death was attributed to massive infection of internal organs.

title: South
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 8The Republicans, spurred by President Nixon's unprecedented sweep of the old Confederacy, gained two United States Senators, seven Representatives and a Governor in yesterday's elections in the South.

title: N.B.A. Board Will Meet
description: Officials of The National Basketball Association said yesterday its board of governors would meet here next Thursday to discuss a number of issues, including a report from Abe Polin of Baltimore on the status of the proposed merger with the American Basketball Association. The N.B.A., in the third and final year of a television contract, also will consider TV plans for the 197374 season.

title: WHY THE BAY STATE COUNTERED TREND
description: BOSTON, Nov. 8The unusual depth of antiwar feeling and a heavy student vote in this highly liberal state appeared to have helped make Massachusetts the only state to support George McGovern.

title: Penguins Topple Flyers, 52
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Pittsburgh Penguins broke out for four goals in the first 10 minutes tonight and breezed to a 52 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: The Victory...
description: The astonishing feature of President Nixon's reelection victory is its uniformity. Not since President Roosevelt's sweep of all but two states in 1936 has a national candidate attracted support so clearly in every region and from virtually every segment of the voting population.

title: London Stock Exchange Dedicates a Skyscraper
description: LONDON, Nov. 8The London Stock Exchange dedicated tonight its new skyscraper home six years in the building and still not completewith a visit by Queen Elizabeth, a formal dress supper for 2,000 guests and a lot of handwringing over the uncertainties of the future.

title: Minnesota Elects the Sons Of Humphrey and Lombardi
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 8 (UPI) Hubert H. Humphrey 3d and Vince Lombardi were elected to, the Minnesota Legislature yesterday.

title: GEORGE FRANCIS, BELMONT OFFICIAL
description: TEANECK, N.J., Nov. 8 George M. Francis, who was prominent in racing circles and had been an associate of. Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney for 47 years, died yesterday after a long illness at his home here. He was 81 years old.

title: 8 Series of Cumulative Preferred Stock Are Being Redeemed
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation reported yesterday new highs in sales and earnings for the third quarter and first nine months of 1972.

title: CHILE COPPER CARGO ARRIVES IN SWEDEN
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 8 (AP)Part of a controversial copper cargo from Chile arrived today in Stockholm harbor in a Russian ship.

title: U.S. Investigator Will Replace Ruskin, Who Is Quitting Dec. 1
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday named Nicholas Scopetta, a Federal prosecutor in charge of investigating corruption in the criminaljustice system, as his new Commissioner of Investigation.

title: FOES OF MARBURGER SEE TAXES MISUSED
description: TRENTON, Nov. 8 (UPI)The New Jersey Education As sociation charged today that tax money was being used improperly in the fight over the reappointment of State Education Commissioner Carl L. G. Marburger.

title: BOLD STEPS HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 President Nixon announced to day that his first order of business, after his overwhelming reelection victory at the polls yesterday, would be a significant realignment of his staff and the executive departments.

title: Paris for Women's Equal Pay
description: PARIS, Nov. 8 (Reuters) The French Government announced today that it is to present a bill to parliament providing that women be given equal pya with men for the same work.

title: Uganda and Racism
description: NAIROBI, KenyaThere are no simple moral answers to the question of the plight of Asians currently being evicted from Uganda. Certainly, President Idi Amin and his military government are exhibiting a racism toward Asians which makes nonsense of much of Africa's righteous stand against the racist white minority governments of southern Africa. There are grounds for genuine concern for the safety of any Asians left in Uganda.

title: SMITH LEADS WAY AT STOCKHOLM NET
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 8 (AP)Stan Smith, the Wimbledon champion, led a strong American advance today in the $63,500 Stockholm tennis tournament, while Bjorn Borg, Sweden's 16yearold star, scored a smashing upset.

title: SOVIET TEAK PLANS N.H.L. CITIES TOUR
description: DETROIT, Nov. 8 (AP)  A: top Soviet hockey team will make a fourgame exhibition tour of selected National Hockey League cities in late January, officials said yesterday.

title: Hijackers Gain Release of Six In Mexico and Fly On to Cuba
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 8 (Reuters)Five gunmen hijacked a Mexican airliner today, obtained the release of six poltical prisoners and a ransom of four million pesos, about $333,000, and flew to Havana with 75 passengers.

title: Peak British Leyland Sales
description: LONDON, Nov. 8 (UPI) Britain's biggest auto concern British Leyland, today announced record October sales of Triumph sports cars in the United States last month. The total of almost 2,000 cars was an increase of more than 33 per cent from the similar month last year.

title: Transit Patrolmen's Group Files Suit to Curb Overtime
description: The New York City Transit Authority Patrolmen's Benevolent Association brought suit in State Supreme Court yesterday to bar the Metropolitan Transportation Authority from requiring overtime work except in the event of emergencies.

title: To Check Diabetes
description: Diabetics under proper control (through diet, insulin or other medication) look and act like anybody else. Consequently most people do tes is. Yet it is the fifth largest cause of death in the United States and the second leading cause of new cases of blindness. To combat this major health problem, the American Diabetes Association, in partnership with its 48 affiliate assocations throughout the country, sponsors programs of education, detection and research.

title: Nixon's Victory Brings Cheer to Wall St.
description: President Nixon's landslide victory over Senator George McGovern was greeted with optimism and enthusiasm yesterday in the financial community.

title: Open Questioning Voted For Analysts Luncheons
description: Directors of the New York Society of Security Analysts voted yesterday to permit open questioning of speakers at the society's daily luncheon forums.

title: INCENSE AND WAILS IN DANCE BY MURPHY
description: Poor lambs that we were, being led to the esthetic slaughter one by one! We had sand poured on us, were smeared with fingernail polish a.nd had our clothes impregnated with strawberryscented incense, and our ears were assaulted by wails and pseudoorgiastic rock at Seamus Murphy's unnamed dance ritual at the Exchange Theater in Westbeth Tuesday evening.

title: EUROPE'S CAPITALS PLEASED BY VOTE
description: LONDON, Nov. 8President Nixon's victory was generally welcomed in European capitals today with words of congratulations and expressions of hope that he would now take positive steps to improve relations with the continent.

title: Kings, Flames Play Tie
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 8 (AP)Mike Corrigan scored with 35 seconds left to give the Western Divisionleading Los Angeles Kings a 33 tie with the Atlanta Flames tonight.

title: Giants Orduna Is Grateful to Leave Bench
description: The rain that pelted Yankee Stadium yesterday hampered the Giants on their first day of preparations for the important game in Washington Sunday, but to Joe Orduna even the raindrops look like roses these days.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Ewbank Adept at Juggling Linebackers
description: It has been a very uncertain season for Ralph Baker and Mike Taylor, and Paul Crane's knee operation that will keep him out for the rest of the season hasn't helped resolve the situation for the New York Jets at the left linebacker spot.

title: FITZ LEWIS SARGEANT
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 8Fitz Lewis Sargeant, an executive) of the Reynolds Metals Compang for more than 30 years, died at his home on Hunt Club( Lane last evening after a brief: illness. He was 53 years old.

title: Rattenni Convicted in Jury Case Here
description: Nicholas A. Rattenni, said by Federal officials to be the Mafia leader of Westchester County, was found guilty in Federal court here last night of conspiring to tamper with the jury in a previous trial.

title: Peking Kept Watch
description: PEKING, Nov. 8The reelection of President Nixon came as no surprise to senior offficials of the Chinese foreign ministry, who appear to have kept a close watch on the state by state returns as they came in.

title: Pipe Bomb Found at Office Of Nixon Campaign Group
description: A pipe bomb was found early yesterday in front of a storefront office of the Committee to ReElect the President, at 4321 Avenue D in the East Flatbush district of Brooklyn. Members of the Police Bomb Division went to the area following an anonymous phone call to United Press International by a caller who said he was a member of the John Brown Brigade and that the group wanted to show its solidarity with the Vietnamese people.

title: Four States Vote Down Curbs On Property Taxes for Schools
description: Voters in four states resoundingly defeated on Tuesday proposed constitutional amendments that would have killed or sharply limited the property tax as a source of funds for public education.

title: RAIDERS LOSE, 21, TO SHARKS ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 8 (AP) Jarda Trwpicka, in his first World Hockey Association game, scored with 34 seconds to go tonight, giving the Los Angeles Sharks a 21 triumph over the New York Raiders. The Sharks gained first place alone in the Western Division.

title: Results on Ballot Questions a Curious LiberalConservative Mixture
description: Death and taxes, and an array of other public concerns from women's rights to pornography, were variously approved and disapproved by voters across the nation in Tuesday's balloting.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  Every election produces a large number of public officials who interpret victory as a mandate to break the promises they made while campaigning. To find out more about the littleknown subject of campaignpromisebreaking, we have sent a questionnaire to everyone who was elected Tuesday night, and the results are now in.

title: VOTERS ACT TO END STREETNAME MIXUP
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 8 (AP)Voters in Syracuse and 19 townships in Onondaga County approved yesterday a ballot proposition that called for elimination of 2,000 duplications in street names.

title: Manila Curbs Associated Press; Will Censor Its Outgoing News
description: MANILA, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Government suspended distribution of news by The Associated Press to its clients in the Philippines today and imposed censorship on all outgoing news dispatches by the agency.

title: Army Ending Experiment Of 3Day Trial Enlistment
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) The Army is closing down an experimental program under which young men tried Army life for three clays before deciding whether they wanted to enlist.

title: Meadows Plan Adds Open Space
description: LYNDHURST, N.J., Nov. 8The revised master plan for the development of the 20,000acre Hackensack Meadowlands was announced here today by the Meadovilands Development Commission, and it reflectsin the words of William D. McDowell, its executive directorthe fact that the commission was listening to the proponents of open space.

title: Japanese Armor in Auction
description: An auction of ancient Japanese swords, fittings and armor brought a total of $138,395 at Sotheby Parke Bernet yesterday, commanding prices a gallery spokesman described as just crazy. Some of the 122 items were confiscated from the Japanese, along with other weapons, after World War II, and some were brought back as souvenirs by G.I.s.

title: Text of Germanys Treaty on Ties and Cooperatiori
description: BONN, Nov, 8 (Reuters)Following, in unofficial translation, is the text of the treaty initialed here today by West Germany (the Federal Republic of Germany) and East Germany (the German Democratic Republic):

title: Gospel Fund Ended by Votel
description: SENECA FALLS, N.Y., Nov. 8 (AP)A gospel fund created in the early eighteenhundreds to finance visits of touring evangelists was eliminated yesterday by voters in the Town of Seneca. They approved the transfer of a $2,000 balance, long unused, to the town's general fund. The money is on deposit in a bank.

title: Brooke Contemplating 76 Presidential Run
description: BOSTON, Nov. 8 (AP)Senator Edward W. Brooke, who won a landslide reelection victory yesterday, said today that he was contemplating a run for the Presidency in 1976.

title: FRANK HALL, HEADED CATHOLIC NEWS UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Frank A, Hall, for 31 years director of the Catholic News Service, died today at his horne in northwest Washington. He was 78 years old.

title: Raised Level of Lead Is Linked to Hyperactivity
description: Lead poisoningvery high levels of lead in the blood and body tissuescan cause convulsions, brain damage, mental retardation and sometimes death. Now, researchers at Downstate Medical Center have found evidence that lead levels just slightly above normal may also have some damaging effects.

title: Jazz: Hayward at Piano
description: Lance Hayward, the blind jazz pianist who played at West Boondock for four years, has recently moved to JacquesintheVillage at Bleecker and Sullivan Streets, where he is giving an interesting demonstration of the thesis that less can be more.

title: WHITE HOUSE RIVALS ALL BACK IN HOUSE
description: Only four of 17 candidates for their parties' 1972 Presidential nomination were up for election Tuesday, and all of them made it, according to the Associated Press.

title: Thomas Now Ineligible Rest of N.F.L. Season
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 8 (UPI) Duane Thomas, the controversial running back, did not appear for practice with the San Diego Chargers today and was placed on the reserve list.

title: Police Reports to Prod Courts on Major Crimes
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yesterday that his department had begun a new crimereporting system to assure that import1 ant cases receive priority attention from prosecutors and the courts.

title: Badillo Asserts Registration MixUps Hurt McGovern
description: Representative Herman Badillo, who won a court order extending voting in the Bronx an extra hour Tuesday night asserted yesterday that) George McGovern's lead for President in New York City might have been doubled if not for voters eligibility troubles. Mr. McGovern's unofficial city margin was 81,920 votes.

title: Pete Mahovlich Sparks Canadiens 52 Triumph
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 8 (UPI)Pete Mahovlich scored twice, including the winning goal midway through the third period tonight, as the Montreal Canadiens edged the Toronto Maple Leafs, 52.

title: 5.1 Inch Rain Whips Metropolitan Area, Disrupting Traffic and Cutting Power
description: A foultempered storm with bullying winds of up to 60 miles an hour raged up the coastline yesterday and brought record rains, flooded roads, disrupted air and subway traffic, power and telephone failures and sodden basements in the metropolitan area.

title: Suffolk Sextet in 44 Tie
description: The Suffolk Ducks and Oyster Bay played to a 44 tie yesterday in a Metropolitan Junior Hockey League game before 1,272 fans at Madison Square Garden.

title: YOUTH COURT JUDGE VOTED OUT IN OMAHA
description: OMAHA, Nov. 8A juvenile court judge who had been ac cused of being inconsistent and arbitrary was voted out of office yesterday.

title: Penguins Topple Flyers, 52
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Pittsburgh Penguins broke out for four goals in the first 10 minutes tonight and breezed to a 52 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: POLICE OPEN INQUIRY ON BOY SHOT IN CHASE
description: The Police Department's Civilian Complaint Review Board is investigating charges that a Brooklyn policeman shot and critically wounded an autotheft suspect Sunday afternoon out of personal dislike.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mrs. Horace J. McAfee, 65, Was Active in Charities Here
description: Mrs. Horace J. McAfee, who had been active in many charities in New York and Westchester and was honorary chairman of the Mistletoe Debutante Ball, died yesterday at HarkI ness Pavilion, ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 65 years old and lived at IrvingtononHudson, N. Y.

title: Baseball Writers Elect 3
description: The New York Chapter of the Baseball Writers Association held its fall meeting at Shea Stadium yesterday and elected Joseph Durso of The New York Times chairman, Phil Pepe of The Daily News was named vice chairman and Jack Lang of the Long Island Press was reelected. secretarytreasurer. The writers annual dinner and show will be held next Jan. 28 at the Americana.

title: Stock Prices Down
description: The stock market rallied strongly yesterday morning in response to President Nixon's victory, but profit taking moved in later and the market closed generally lower. Wall Street leaders said the President's victory had been discounted in advance to some extent. Page 67.

title: Books of The Times
description: I must now confess to a persisting anxiety in the presence of Hortense Calisher's writinga feeling that has kept growing on me during the last few years. It first began when I read her middle novelS, Extreme Magic and Journal From Ellipsia. It began to overwhelm me during her later novel, The New Yorkers, as out of the woodwork of her realistic brownstone setting prose billowed like lather from a shavingcream dispenser gone haywire. And now, with the simultaneous publication of Herself and Standard Dreaming"the first a journal of Miss Calisher's thoughts and sensibilities; the second her latest novelmy anxiety seems to border the neurotic.

title: ... and Empty Landslide
description: The results of Congressional contests across the country reveal little or nothing of ideological significance. The expectation of top Republicans was that if President Nixon could win only 55 per cent of the popular vote, the Senate would fall to the G.O.P. While capture of the House was not really expected, it was thought that with a few additional percentage points the President might look forward to a working margin.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PARIS, Nov. 8 (Reuters)A pla to enable leading French amateur skiers to receive payments from manufacturers at the end of their careers has been drawn up by French team officials, it was reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sweep by the G.O.P. in Nassau Fails to Upset Legislative LineUp
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 8Although President Nixon carried Nassau County yesterday by al plurality of more than 187,000; votes, there will be little impact On the local level in the years ahead because the voting failed, to change materially the composition of Nassau's legislative bloc in Albany.

title: People and Business
description: Harry Heltzer, chairman of the 3M Company, is a man who knows a thing or two about multinational corporations, since his $1.8billion company has facilities in 38 countries and customers in more than 140. He expressed his views about such corporations the other day in a speech about the logic of trade.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WAYNE, N. J., Nov. 8Tom Fleming was about begin his senior year at Bloomfield High School as a betterthanaverage soccer and basketball player when some friends told him about the annual Fourth of July Bloomfield Mile. I decided it might be a good way to get shape, the William Paterson College senior said four years later, and I found a new sport.

title: Louisiana Governor Orders Eviction of Students
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. 8 (UPI)Reacting to reports of guns smuggled into the New Orleans campus of Southern University and of what was described as moblike actions by roving bands of students in East Baton Rouge, Gov. Edwin W. Edwards today ordered the eviction of students occupying the Southern University administration building in New Orleans.

title: Coroner's Office Dropped
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 8 (AP)Cook County voters overwhelmingly discarded the office of coroner yesterday, and the county will replace it with a medicalexaminer system in 1976. The vote favored eliminating the post by 879,181 to 153,765.

title: Kissinger's View Upheld
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Nixon Administration had no formal comment today on the Nhan Dan editorial, but officials noted that the prisoner issue was a sensitive one for North Vietnam.

title: KISSINGER'S AIDE FLYING TO SAIGON TO TALK TO THIEU
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The White House announced today that Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., chief aide to Henry A. Kissinger, was flying to Saigon to confer with President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam on the efforts to conclude an Indochina settlement.

title: TERRORISTS BLAMED IN DEATH IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 8 (AP)A parttime soldier was found dead in a wrecked car tonight and authorities said he may have been shot by gunman while he drove through Lurgan, 20 miles from Belfast.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: DENVER, Nov. 8 (AP)  Juius Erving, who spent the extibition season trying to jump to the National Basketball Association, pumped in 38 points tonight and paced the Virginia Squires to a 116111 victory over the Denver Rockets.

title: Ivory Coast Lures a Film Maker
description: KOUMASSI, Ivory CoastThe sweating, teenaged soccer players were surprised when the bearded man with the movie camera rushed into their game, shouting orders.

title: South's First Black Since 1870 Is Elected to House by Georgia
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 8  For the last month the Rev. Andrew J. Young rose early to greet urban Atlantans waiting at bus stops and ask for their votes.

title: BOLD STEPS HINTED
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 8President Nixon announced today that his first order of business, after his overwhelming reelection victory at the polls yesterday, would be a significant realignment of his staff and the executive departments.

title: (Reprinted from yesterday's late editions.); Nets Drop 4th in Row, 116108, As Q's Win on Rally in 2d Hall
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 7 The New York Nets continued to have their troubles on the road tonight and dropped their fourth straight, bowing to the San Diego Conquistadors by 116108.

title: Secretariat Study Supports Action on Terrorism by U.N. General Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 8In an unusually forthright document on a controversial subject, the United Nations Secretariat reported today in special study that there was a present need for international cooperation aimed at curbing terrorism.

title: Representatives Likely To Contest Status Quo
description: The new House of Representatives convening Jan. 3 will reflect a sharp shift in both looks and ideology, with many of the aging and powerful leaders of recent years gone.

title: Kiwanis Club in Vermont May Defy Ban on Women
OPEN SPACE ADDED TO MEADOWS PLAN
description: LYNDHURST, N. J., Nov. 8The revised master plan for the development of the 20,000acre Hackensack Meadowlands was announced here today by the Meadowlands Development Commission, and it reflectsin the words of William D. McDowell, its executive directorthe fact that the commission was listening to the proponents of open space.

title: Black Political Power Strengthened by 3 New House Victories
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Black political power in Congress was strengthened yesterday with the election of three more blacks to the House of Representatives.

title: Support Grew Across State
description: President Nixon's reelection victory in New York State was marked by an increase in support from 1968 that cut across all geographic regions and major ethnic groups.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  Retail sales in September were higher than originally estimated but still a little below the August record, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Truck Driver Found Slain In Upstate Road Rest Area
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 8 (AP)A truck driver hauling a load of bakery goods from New Jersey to Watertown was shot to death early today ,in the cab of his tractortrailer at a rest area along Interstate 81. The State Police said he apparently was the victim of a robbery.

title: U.S. Aides Studying Deaths of Patients on TB Drug
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Federal and local health officials met in Baltimore today in and investigation of seven deaths ini the past 10 months among; users of the antituberculosisl drug isoniazid.

title: Bargain Day in Tashkent: Imports Pull In Shoppers
description: TASHKENT, U.S.S.R., Nov. 1 For ordinary people, the biggest event of the year was the opening this fall of modern State Department Store not far from the intersection of the ancient silk, gold and spice caravan routes to China, India and Persia.

title: Rep Ashbrook Blames Nixon For G.O.P. Lag on Congress
description: JOHNSTOWN, Ohio, Nov. 8 (UPI)Representative John M. Ashbrook, Republican of Ohio, blamed President Nixon today for the failure of the Republicans to gain control of Congress.

title: EUROPE'S CAPITALS PLEASED BY VOTE
description: LONDON, Nov. 8 President Nixon's victory was generally welcomed in European capitals today with words of congratulations and expressions of hope that he would now take positive steps to improve relations with the continent.

title: Rangers Top Canucks, 52, To Stay Unbeaten at Home
description: In a game of such scant excitement that the fans cheered the penalty killers as loudly as they applauded the goal scorers, the Rangers last night remained unbeaten at Madison Square, Garden with a 52 decision over the Vancouver Canucks,

title: Lake Placid Is Hopeful
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y. Nov. 8 (AP)Officials here were hopeful today that Colorado voters rejection of state subsidies for the 1976 Winter Olympics would mean this resort community would get another opportunity to play host to he Games.

title: Middle West
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 8In the the wake of President Nixon's landslide victory, the Midwest remained about as it was: divided fairly evenly between Democrats and Republicans and demonstrating an even wider streak of independence.

title: Middle States
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 8President Nixon's huge majorities in six industrial and I coal mining states between the Delaware Bay and Lake Erie I failed notably yesterday to help local Republican candidates.

title: For 800, Free Concert Dispels the Gloom
description: Some 800 people braved the driving rain yesterday afternoon to attend a lunchhour concert by Andre Watts, the pianist, and the Orchestra of the City of New York at St. Thomas Church, Fifth Avenue and 53d Street.

title: Directors of C.B.S. Vote An End to Stock Dividend
description: Directors of the Columbia Broadcasting System, Inc., voted to discontinue the stock dividend that the company has distributed since 1954 and instead raised the quarterly cash dividend by 1.5 cents a share to 36.5 cents. It is payable Dec. 8 to holders of record Nov. 22.

title: HERBERT MELCHER OF MERRILL LYNCH
description: Herbert H. Melcher, a retired vice president of Merrill Lynch, !Pierce, Fenner Sr Smith, Inc., died on Monday. He was 77 years old and lived at 7 Gracie Square.

title: AMEX DEFICIT PARED IN LATEST QUARTER
description: Continued low volume had its effect on the earnings of the American Stock Exchange, which announced yesterday that it lost $47,000 in the third quarter, compared with a deficit of $48,000 in the same period in 1971.

title: MESSENGER FIELD IS CUT DOWN TO II
description: WESTBURY, Nov. 8Harness racing's richest event, the Messenger Stakes for 3yearold pacers (it offered a gross purse of $189,018.54 last year when Rum Customer won it) will be worth $154,733.96. when it is presented at Roosevelt Raceway Saturday night,

title: Personal Finance: PostMerger Tax
description: With mergers continuing at a vigorous pace, some employes of acquired companies may be in for a shockmuch heavier taxes than they ever expected. Ironically, they can put the blame on recent judicial decisions and not on the Internal Revenue Service. In fact, the I.R.S. has tightened its rules several weeks ago to get in step.

title: City Planners Vote To Bar Apartments In 2 Midtown Parks
description: A proposal that would block construction of apartment towers in two private parks at Tudor City was approved last evening by the City Planning Commission.

title: Number of Women Elected Rises Slightly In Nation, But Senate Is All Male
description: Although the United States Senate will be without a woman member next year for the first time since 1949, as result of the elections Tuesday, the number of women holding elective office in the nation as a whole appears to have increased modestly.

title: MRS. CASTLE LOSES A LABOR PARTY POST
description: LONDON, Nov. 8Barbara Castle, one of the most important ministers in the Cabinet when Harold Wilson was Prime Minister, was voted out today as the Labor party's spokesman on subjects relating to social security.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 8 (AP)Dallas built a 6550 halftime lead and coasted to a 126.118 victory over Memphis tonight before 3,200 fans at the first game in the new $23million Myriad Convention Center.

title: Mrs. Begich May Run
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Nov. 8  Mrs. Pegge, Begich, the wife of Representative Nick Begich, missing in a planeaccident, said she might be candidate for Alaska's only seat in the House of Representatives.

title: RESULT SURPRISE IN PUERTO RICO
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov 8The Popular Democratic party, behind its 36yearold candidate for Governor, Rafael Hernandez Colon, swept to an overwhelming and unexpected victory in yesterday's election.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LOUISVILLE, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Eastern Division leading Carolina Cougars routed the Kentucky Colonels, 126111, tolight behind an 84point prodaction from their 3C offense of Mack Calvin, Billy Cunninglam ,and Joe Caldwell.

title: Saints Drop Durkee
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 8 (AP) The New Orleans Saints waived Charlie Durkee, a placekicker, today and signed three free agents  Happy Feller, kicker; Dick Palmer and Billy Hobbs, linebackers.

title: YURI GALANSKOV A SOVIET WRITER
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 8  Yuri Galanskov, one of the most prominent Soviet dissident iwriters and protesters of the early and mid1960's, has died at a labor camp in Mordovia,1 about 300 miles southeast of Moscow, dissident sources reported tonight.

title: Buck Decries Vote
description: Clifford H. Buck, president of the United States Olympic Committee, said yesterday he was deeply disappointed with the people of Colorado for the way they expressed themselves over the Olympic issue.

title: Indian Theater Group: Strong Beginning
description: When the history of the American Indian theater is written in, say, the year 2054, it will probably record that it all began back in 1972 in a narrow loft at 74A East Fourth Street on New York's Lower East Side.

title: Hanoi Asserts Accord Includes Release of All Held by Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 8The North Vietnamese Communist party newspaper said today that the draft agreement that was to have been signed Oct. 31 provided for the release of all military and civilian political prisoners in South Vietnamese jails  a provision whose existence was specifically denied by American officials.

title: Advertising:
description: Well, what do you think, doctorif after a year the corporate body hasn't rejected the transplant, is all well?

title: File CompositeForm Plan By Dec. 26, Brokers Told
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Securities and Exchange Commission directed the nation's stock exchanges and overthecounter dealers today to file by Dec. 26 plans for the first phase of the socalled Composite Transaction Reporting System.

title: Fletcher Jones Killed in Crash; Founder of Computer Sciences
description: SOLVANG, Calif., Nov. 8 (UPI)Fleteher Jones, a founder and board chairman of Computer Sciences Corporation and a wellknown horse breeder, was killed last evening in the crash of his plane in Santa Barbara County. He was 41 years old.

title: Cashman's Back Injured
description: BOSTON, Nov. 8 (UPI)Wayne Cashman's back problem was diagnosed as a hairline fracture, the Boston Bruins announced today. A spokesman said Cashman would be permitted to play for the National Hockey League club, but could not take part in practice sessions and must rest between games.

title: Death Toll Rises to 5 in Georgia River Crash
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga., Nov. 8 (UPI)  A steering gear malfunction or a ship pilot's error were cited today as possible causes of a freighter's collision with a drawbridge in which a half dozen cars and their occupants were spilled into the Brunswick River,

title: Seattle Protest Goes On
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 8 (UPI) Indians continued their sitin at the local Bureau of Indian Affairs offices today after it. I had been reported that they were ending the occupation.

title: Taste of Dog Foods Appraised By a Dog and His Best Friend
description: Every night in this country, 32,600,000 dogs eat dinner. So do about 20,000,000 Cats. And more and more of them every year are eating commercial pet food. Americans will spend $1.5billion for billion pounds of pellets and kibble and dog biscuitsmuch more than the $390million spent on baby foodwithout having the slightest idea of what is in that miserablelooking slop or how tastes.

title: It's Muhlenberg Again In the Path of F. and M.
description: Franklin and Marshall trailed Moravian, 2221, with 50, seconds remaining last Saturday and had the ball on its20. It had a long distance to.go to keep its undefeated recprd intact.

title: Jockey Link To Race Fix Is Reported
description: While Aqueduct's proposed weekly offtrack superfecta remained stalled, a Rochester grand jury began hearing testimony yesterday involving an alleged superfecta fix at Finger Lakes.

title: BOND PRICES FALL IN PROFIT TAKING
description: Bond prices retreated on a broad front yesterday, in some cases by substantial amounts, as professional traders decided to nail down profits and as several taxexempt issuers took advantage of recent strength to announce major new financings.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The North American Rockwell Corporation has received a $64million contract from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration for design, development and tests of hardware to be used in the planning of the United States Soviet space project, it was announced yesterday. Involved is, work on the docking system and modification of an Apollo command and service module to be used in the joint rendezvous and docking mission panned for the summer bf 1975, NASA said.

title: Lake Placid Is Hopeful
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y. Nov. 8 (AP)Officials here were hopeful today that Colorado voters rejection of state subsidies for the 1976 Winter Olympics would mean this resort community would get another opportunity to play host to he Games.

title: Meminger Buzzes to Nickname
description: Dean Meminger had scored only 33 points in eight games when the Knicks left nine days ago for a fourgame road trip. New York, which plays the Atlanta Hawks tonight at Madison Square Gar den, returned Tuesday with three victories in the four games and Meminger with 84 points and a new nameSuper Fly.

title: NATO Backs Nov. 22 Talks
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 8 (Reuters)  The North Atlantic Treaty Organization announced its formal acceptance tonight of Nov. 22 as the beginning date for EastWest preparatory talks for a European security conference. The acceptance follows Monday's Soviet note to the United States that apparently indicated the Kremlin's formal approval of that date.

title: B52's Set SaturationBombing Mark for One Day in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 9  The United States military command reports that American 952 bombers set a record Tuesday for concentrated bombing in a !single South Vietnamese province in a single day.

title: Advertising:
description: Foote, Cone & Belding, New York, which has been without an airline account since the muchpublicized loss of Trans World Airlines business in 1968, has just gotten its foot in the hangar at Braniff.

title: IN THE NATION
description: During the 1964 Presidential campaign, Richard M. Nixon, then a New York lawyer, had lunch with some of the editors and executives of The New York Times. He was asked why he was working so hard for the Republican nominee, Barry Goldwater, when it was clear that Mr. Goldwater would not be able to defeat President Johnson.

title: The Proceedings in the U. N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. to discuss reports of Budgetary Committee, international cooperation in the peaceful uses of space; preparation of a treaty concerning the moon, preparation of a convention on artificial earth satellites for television broadcasting, and nonuse of force in international relations and permanent prohibition of use of nuclear weapons.

title: U.S. Calls SEATO Useful
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) The State Department discounted Pakistan's withdrawal from SEATO today and said the alliance still retains a very useful function. The department spokesman, Charles W. Bray 3d, said Pakistan's withdrawal was formalizing what has been reality for some time.

title: 88 Seized in Japan Clashes Over Transfer of U.S. Tanks
description: TOKYO, Nov. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)  Eightyeight demonstrators were arrested today as they attempted to prevent 13 trailers carrying M48 United States tanks for Vietnam from reaching a pier in Yokohama from the United States Army Sagami supply and maintenance depot.

title: Unitas Kicks a Point In Dispute With Press
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 8 (AP) Johnny Unitas walked into the locker room following practice today and, spotting several reporters, tossed a stool toward the dirty clothes hamper. Then he took off his jersey, and kicked it as several Baltimore Colt teammates cheered.

title: N.B.A. Board Will Meet
description: Officials of The National Basketball Association said yesterday its board of governors would meet here next Thursday to discuss a number of issues, including a report from Abe Polin of Baltimore on the status of the proposed merger with the American Basketball Association. The N.B.A., in the third and final year of a television contract, also will consider TV plans for the 197374 season.

title: Indians Take Documents as They Leave U.S. Building
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 Loaded with what they called incriminating documents purloined from Federal files, Indian militants began leaving the Bureau of Indian Affairs Building today. They took over the building a week ago.

title: Ballots Impounded in a Suffolk Assembly Race
description: YAPHANK, L. I., Nov. 8All ballots were ordered impounded in the Third Assembly District in Suffolk County today as Republicans requested la complete canvass in what appeared to be a Democratic victory and a mayor upset.

title: Desertion Rate Doubles
description: As indicated by the major political polls, more than twice the usual proportion of Democrats abandoned their party's nominee Tuesday and voted for President Nixon.

title: Pacers Beat Tams
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Nov. 7 (AP) The Indiana Pacers broke open a close game late in the third quarter and went on to a 124116 American Basketball Association victory over the Memphis Tams tonight.

title: Defeated Mrs. Smith Is Secluded in Maine
description: SKOWHEGAN, Me., Nov. 8 (AP)  Senator Margaret Chase Smith secluded herself from the public today after a crushing defeat in yesterday's election that ended her 32year political career.

title: Blues Drop Arboux, Name Talbot Coach
description: ST. LOUIS. Nov. 8 (AP)The St. Louis Blues of the National Hockey League dismissed Coach Al Arbour today and replaced him with JeanGuy Talbot. former coach of the team's Denver. Spurs farm club in the Western League.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Hospitals to Hire More Technicians The city's Health and Hospitals Corporation will use the largest part of its recently acquired $42.1million in new money to hire personnel lost during the city's job attrition policy, Dr. Joseph T. English, the corporation's president, announced.

title: Approval of Bingo Sets Off Calls for Part of the Action
Arthur Daley
description: It was more than coincidence that the fortunes of Johnny Bench and the Cincinnati Reds rose together, fell together and then rose together once again. Cause and effect were very much involved. The powerful young catcher had so smashing a year in 1970 that he won the most valuable player trophy and the Redlegs won the pennant. He faded the next season and so did the Redlegs. But the rebound was complete for both in 1972. Once more Bench took most valuable player honors and once more the Reds took the pennant.

title: High Post for Briton
description: LONDON, Nov. 8 (AP)Julian Amery, formerly, Minister of Housing, was named today as the top deputy to the Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome. Mr. Amery was appointed Minister of State at the Foreign Office by Prime Minister Heath in a Cabinet shuffle last Sunday.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Interstate Commerce Commission delayed today until June 10, 1973, a proposed increase in railroad rates for hauling salvageable goods such as paper, scrap iron and steel. The I.C.C. instead served notice of a full investigation of the rises, which railroads wanted to put into effect next Sunday.

title: Letter to a Daughter in India
description: Dear Barbie: If there is anything as temporal as a wall calendar in an ashram, you may note in some pause between asanas and meditation that your birthday is at hand, which makes it nearly two years since you left this country and about one year since you found your spot in India (a spot too small for our home atlas) where you can concentrate on intensive soulsearching. Happy Birthday, Dear One. We miss you.

title: Rep. Schmitz Says Nation Has Enthroned an Emperor
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov 8 (UPI)  Representative John G. Schmitz, American party candidate for President, gave an untypical concession speech last night, asserting that his party's future was just beginning and that voters have now enthroned an emperor.

title: Changing City
description: A vote switch of less than 2 pier cent would have put New York. City in the Nixon column this week, thus breaking a record of Democratic dominance in Presidential elections here that has prevailed for almost a halfcentury. That nearvictory in the face of a Democratic registration, edge of nearly four to one is as astonishing a personal achievement for the President as was his landslide nearly everywhere else.

title: South African Reserves Up
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 8 (Agence FrancePresse) South Africa's gold reserves rose this week by $5.2million over the preceding week, it was announced today. The country's total gold reserves now stand at $635million.

title: KISSINGER'S AIDE FLYING TO SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The White House announced today that Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., chief aide to Henry A. Kissinger, was flying to Saigon to confer with President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam on the efforts to conclude an Indochina settlement.

title: ASIAN RESPONSE UNENTHUSIASTIC
description: TOKYO, Nov. 8Japan and, other United States allies in east Asia greeted President Nixon's reelection today cordially but without enthusiasm.

title: McGovern HomeState Loss Is First Since Stevenson's
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (Reuters)Senator George MeGovern's loss of the State oft South Dakota marks the first time in 16 years that a Presidential candidate has lost home state.

title: Russell Thorndike, Author, Dies; Actor Wrote the Dr. Syn Novels
description: LONDON, Nov. 8, (Reuters) Russell Thorndike, an actor and author of the Dr. Syn novels, died last night at the age of S7. He was the younger brother of Dame Sybil Thorndike, the British actress who recently celebrated her 90th birthday.

title: Western Senate Races Bring a Standoff
The South Asians: City's Mysterious Immigrants
description: Seated crosslegged on the floor of a new condominium apartment on West 56th Street, an assembly brilliant, in Indian silks and cottons gathered around a fire of purification in a skillet, then joined in the ancient Sanskrit chant:

title: Banker Has a Session With President Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 9 (Reuters).  Ambassador Ellsworth Bunker called on President Nguyen Van Thieu this morning, possibly to prepare for the visit of Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., the chief aide of Henry A. Kissinger.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE SHARPLY
description: Commodity futures prices went their own way yesterday, almost unaffected by President Nixon's reelection.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: G.O.P. Controls North Carolina For the First Time Since 1901,
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 8Nearly threequarters of a century of Democratic domination in North Carolina ended yesterday as the state elected its first Republican Governor and Senator in this century.The makeup of the state's 11man Congressional delegation  four Republicans and seven Democrats  remained unchanged.

title: U.S. and Poland in Pacts Expected to Triple Trade
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The United States and Poland signed today a series of agreements that are expected triple trade between the two countries over the next several years. Among today's actions was a decision by President Nixon to authorize credits from the ExportImport Bank for Poland.

title: Voters in Warren Say No to the Tocksl. Dam
description: BELVIDERE, Nov. 8Warren County voted against the proposed Tocks Island dam project yesterday in nonbinding referendum.

title: Parties Cloudy Future
description: For the two great American political parties, which have played a constitutionally undefined but crucial role in the evolution of the American democracy, it was a disquieting election, full of confusing portents for tomorrow.

title: Graebner, Miss Hogan Advance
description: TORQUAY, England, Nov. 8 (AP)Clark Graebner of New York beat Britain's Mike Collins, 61, 75, today in the Dewar's Cup indoor tennis series. The victory put Graebner into the last eight in the men's singles.

title: ANDREW S. LOCKIE
description: Andrew S. Lockie, a retired member of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 128 Green Street, Woodbridge, N. J.

title: KNOX BOURNE DEAD M'GRAWHILL AIDE, 57
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 8Knox Bourne, regional vice president of McGrawHill Publications Company, died yesterday in Valley Presbyterian Hospital in Van Nuys after neural surgery. He was 57 years old.

title: President Won 49 States And 521 Electoral Votes
description: By decisively reelecting President Nixon and a Democratic Congress, the American voter delivered a mixed mandate Tuesday along with fresh evidence that he remains planted in the middle of the political spectrum.

title: South, M'GREGOR, LANIGAN GET COMPANY POSTS
description: Two leading Republican party officials, Clark MacGregor and Charles T. Lanigan, were appointed to corporate jobs yesterday, the day after President Nixon's sweeping reelection victory.

title: Chess: A Strength or a Weakness? You May Find Out Too Late
description: An old but debatable bit of advice is to use a man's favorite weapon against him, the assumption being that an opponent would not adopt one opening variation habitually if he knew a good answer to It. Sometimes it works  and sometimes it falls flat on its face, because a player will also make a given system his favorite because he knows more about both its pros and its cons than anyone else.

title: BritishDutch Company Had 16.7% Sales Gain in Third Quarter
description: Unilever, the foods, fats, detergents and chemicals group made up of Unilever, Ltd., and Unilever, N.V., had record sales and sharply higher profits in the third quarter and first nine months of this year, according to its report yesterday.

title: CITY'S HOSPITALS WILL START HIRING
description: The city's Health and Hospitals Corporation will use the largest part of its recently acquired $42.1million in new money to hire personnel lost while the city's job attrition policy was in effect, Dr. Joseph T. English, president of the corporation, announced yesterday.

title: Envy and Levity by Trudeau
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 8 (UPI)Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, who lost his party majority in last week's Canadian election, cast an envious glance today at President Nixon's landslide victory. Asked to comment, Mr. Trudeau quipped: He won with a majority to which I am not accustomed.

title: Kitten Hunt Leads Upstate Man Into World of Dog Training
description: Twenty years ago Fred Henry was looking for a kitten to give his daughter. He wound up with a German shepherd instead. I paid $50 for a bitch and thought the price so high, I was afraid to admit it to anyone, he laughingly recalled. Since had paid so much, I was determined my shepherd would have the best. I called the humane society in Rochester and was told of an obedience training program.

title: Republicans'Appeals Court Victories Not Likely to Signal a Veering to Right
description: All three Republican candidates for the New York Court of Appeals appeared yesterday to have won, beating out four other contenders for the three vacancies on the state's highest court.

title: The Rezoning of Canarsie
description: The parents and the Community School Board of District 18 in Brooklyn will face a number of difficult and potentially volatile alternatives in complying with Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner's order to increase integration at these junior high schools. The order, delivered to

title: 2,000 PROTEST WAR AND NIXON ELECTION
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 9 Nearly 2,000 University of Wisconsin demonstrators marched to the state capital from the library mall in Madison today to protest the continuation of the Vietnam war and the reelection of President Nixon.

title: ... the Defeat...
description: In defeat, Senator George McGovern remains an admirable and respected figure. He waged a gallant and often lonely campaign, never losing confidence in his own prospects or, more important, in the rightness of his vision of America. Scorned by his opponent who refused to debate him or even to respond to most of the issues he had raised, Mr. McGovern nevertheless continued hammer away on his major themes, of which he spoke so movingly as he acknowledged defeat late Tuesday night.

title: Business Briefs
description: The taxpayer revolt against bond issues lost its drive this week as voters decided they were much more willing to go into debt for the facilities they want. An estimated 75 per cent of nearly $5billion of bond proposals passed, ending the downward trend that ran from the midnineteensixties through last year.

title: MSGR. JOHN G. DELANEY

description: A prop drawbridge collapsed during a rehearsal at the Radio City Music Hall yesterday, plunging 16 of the precisiondancing Rockettes to the stage. None were seriously injured.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A WriteIn Runoff in Texas

The only name on the ballot, however, was that of the late constable torn Myer who died shortly after winning the Democratic nomination. Election officials said today that special election would be held to determine the winner.

description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 8 (AP)Two pictureplay goals by Buster Harvey led the Minnesota North Stars to a 52 victory over the California Golden Seals tonight.

description: HOUSTON, Nov. 8 (AP)Four persons have been indicted by a Harris County grand jury on charges of murder and assault to murder in the Oct. 29 skyjacking of an Eastern Airlines plane from Houston to Cuba.

description: HARTFORD, Nov. 8Both Republican and. Democratic leaders in Connecticut predicted that the G.O.P. sweep of the General Assembly would lead to close cooperation between the legislature and Gov. Thomas J. Meskill, as well as a continuation of the tightfisted spending program that has marked the first two years of the Republican Governor's administration.

description: NIXON, Tex., Nov. 8 (AP)Nixon, Tex., went Republican for the first time in its history yesterday and voted for Richard M. Nixon. The town, 50 miles east of San Antonio, has a population of around 2,000. The vote went, roughly, 2 to for the President.

The company's stock was up  at 10 on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday.

description: A foultempered storm with bullying winds of up to 60 miles an hour raged up the coastline yesterday and brought record rains, flooded roads, disrupted air and subway traffic, power and telephone failures and sodden basements in the metropolitan area.

description: President Nixon's reelection victory in New York State was marked by an increase in support from 1963 that cut across all geographic regions and major ethnic groups.

description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. S There was, last spring, a notable lack of enthusiasm among Delaware Democrats for the nomination to oppose the relection bid of Senator J. Caleb Boggs.

title: Screen: Ken Russell's 'Savage Messiah,' Biography of a Sculptor, Opens
description: "I want to take the 'mystique' away from art and show that success is usually 5 per cent inspiration and 95 per cent perspiration and hard slog"Ken Russell, the director of "Savage Messiah," quoted in studio publicity material.Publicity brochures aren't notable for their accuracy, and I wouldn't bet that Ken Russell actually made that statement, but whoever did had certainly seen "Savage Messiah," Mr. Russell's film biography of Henri Gaudier-Brzeska, the French sculptor who died in the trenches of World War I at the age of 24. "Savage Messiah" is, first and foremost, a hard slog movie."Art is alive!" young Henri shouts at one point. "Love it or hate it, but don't worship it!" "Art is above sex!" screams someone else, apropos of just what I've now forgotten.Yet for all of these definitions of art, or of what art should be above, "Savage Messiah" is much less interested in information, or even in the creative process, than in Gaudier-Brzeska's relationship with Sophie Brzeska, the Polish woman twice his age with whom he carried on what the publicity brochure insists on describing as a strange affair. Time was when a strange affair might have suggested one of those loves that dare not speak its name, say mother-with-son or sister-with-sister.We're now so liberated that "strange" here refers to an affair of such intense platonism that although Henri and Sophie joined their names, they never slept together. The merest suggestion that they might, according to Mr. Russell, would be enough to send Sophie into hysterics, as well as to her purse, for when Henri got too worked up, she'd finance his visits with street-walkers, which were the best that she could afford.As played by Dorothy Tutin, who has the pinched, pointy profile of a hickory nut and a voice that would command attention in a hurricane, Sophie is a riveting figure to watch, even though we seldom have the slightest idea of what's going on in her head. Which is an odd lack in a film by Russell who, in films like "The Music Lovers" and "The Devils," hasn't hesitated to dramatize states of emotion in ways that were sometimes courageous and more often monstrously foolish.A handsome, very young English actor named Scott Antony plays Gaudier-Brzeska as if he were auditioning for "The Prisoner of Zenda," with much leaping about in the conventional fashion of the artist as a young man. Lines that should stick in his throat don't as when he shouts to Sophie as they are being bodily evicted from the Louvre: "Let them keep it pure and air-conditioned for the American tourist!" This, of course, in 1911.Russell takes the mystique away from art, but supplies nothing much in its place. We see Henri chopping away all night on a piece of graveyard marble that apparently becomes one of his best-known pieces, "Torso," but we learn little about London's avant-garde Vorticist movement with which he was identified.In passing, Henri makes a few nasty remarks about Michelangelo, about French impressionists, but except for a couple-of pencil sketches and a brief montage of his sculptures at the end, we haven't a clue as to what Gaudier-Brzeska was up to, or why his reputation has soared since his death.Although the performances are full of hysteria, "Savage Messiah" is so tame that it almost makes one long for the excesses of the earlier Russell films, which so overwhelmed the senses as to become anesthetically soothing, like loud rock. At one point in the film, I had the feeling that perhaps Russell was really taking stock of his career to date.How else to explain the speech he puts into Henri's mouth: "You can always tell a bad artist, like a bad doctor: he surrounds his work with a certain amount of hocus-pocus."

title: Kings, Flames Play Tie
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 8 (AP)Mike Corrigan scored with 35 seconds left to give the Western Divisionleading Los Angeles Kings a 33 tie with The Atlanta Flames, tonight.

description: Laughable errors committed by beginners sometimes turn out to be brilliancies at the expert level. On rare occasions it may be right to leave your partner in a cuebid, to ruff your partner's ace or to underruff when you could overruff. A good example of the third of these rarities occurred last Saturday in the open pairs event in the Weschester Sectional. Tournament.

Phil Pepe of The Daily News was named vice chairman and Jack Lang of the Long Island Press was reelected secretarytreasurer. The writers annual dinner and show will be held next Jan. 28 at the Americana.

description: CHESTERTOWN, Md.No matter how tempting it may be, a waterfowler should never call attention to the good shots he makes, for it is as inevitable as the dawn that he will fall from grace.

description: STANFORD, Calif., Nov. 8Shirley Temple Black, looking chipper after breast surgery last week, repeated her warning today that every woman, who discovers strange lumps in her breasts should go to a doctor immediately and get it diagnosed.

description: To the Editor:

title: Buck Decries Vote

description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6A twoweek visit by Prof. John K. Fairbank of Harvard University to the Soviet Union has provided an unusual opportunity for interchange between one of America's most prominent experts on China and some of the China scholars in this country.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 9Military communiques broad cast by the Damascus radio described the air and ground fighting with the Israelis today as the heaviest of the year along the 1967 ceasefire line. They also pictured a stiffening of Syria's air defense, which have been bolstered recently by Soviet arms and advisers.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The Halston mystique continues. Fashion's man of the hour doesn't try to do anything drastic for spring. He doesn't have to. Practically everything he touches moves into the spotlight witness his Ultra (translation: fake) suede coats and dresses, his wrapskirted suits, his buttonfront dresses and his caftans. The surprise is, Halston goes on making them and women go on clamoring for them.

title: Music: Talking Recital
description: Samuel Lipman was the first of the talking recitalists to be presented by Town Hall this season in a sixevent series that will attempt to break down some of the formality existing in conventional performeraudience relationships.

title: The Theater: Rising to the Occasion of Enemies
U.S. Corn Crop Expected To Approach Record Level
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP)  The nation's corn crop, in large demand because of expanding cattle and hog production, as well as expanding exports, will be 5.4billion bushels, down only 3 per cent from last year's record harvest and 3 per cent more than forecast in October, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Storm Leaves Residue of Traffic Snags and Blackouts
description: The aftermath of Wednesday's destructive northeaster continued to snarl traffic during the morning and evening rush hours yesterday as isolated flooded areas and hundreds of abandoned cars blocked highways.

title: Carmona Favored to Defeat Gonzalez and Retain Crown
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 9 (UPI) Chango Carmona of Mexico makes his first World Boxing Council lightweight title defense tomorrow night, meeting Rodolfo Gonzalez of Long Beach, Calif., in a 15round fight at the Sports Arena.

title: BRUINS WIN,83, AS ESPOSITO STARS
description: BOSTON, Nov. 9 (AP)Phil Esposito scored his ninth and 10th goals of the season and assisted on three others tonight in helping the Boston Bruins to an 83 National Hockey League victory over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: Newsman Acquitted. Of Mayor's Charge. Of Upsetting Debate
DeerHunting Season Cut
description: CONCORD, N.H., Nov. 9 (AP) New Hampshire's regular season for hunting deer with firearms for an abbreviated period, running through Nov. 28. The season usually runs December, but was shortened this year by the state to increase the size of the herd.
