But last week Southern University, a predominantly black institution In Louisiana, was hit by a major studentadministration confrontation that threatened to erupt into violence.

title: Judith Milliken Is Bride Of Michael Hale Holden
description: NEW CANAAN, Con., Nov. 11 St. Mark's Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Judith Eaton Milliken, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter L. Milliken 2d, to Michael Hale Holden, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip D. Holden. The Rev. Grant A. Morrill performed the ceremony.

title: Immunology the Key To a Transplant Era
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11They are as various as humanity itself, but they all have something desperately important in common. They are all living on time borrowed with living tissues from.. someone else..

title: Bridge
description: One of the many ways in which bridge players differ from ordinary mortals is that they take a positive pleasure in being insultedespecially if the insult is recorded on the scoresheet.

title: T. M. Green 3d Weds Mrs. du Pont
description: NEW VERNON, N. J., Nov. 11Mrs. Dulcinea Lee du Pont was married here this noon to Thomas Martin Green 3d, headmaster of the Peck School in Morristown. The Rev. Dr. Thomas Mutch performed the ceremony.in the First Presbyterian Church, where he was assisted by the Rev. Hughes Garvin, an Episcopal priest.

title: AllState: Young Musicians
description: ATLANTIC CITY  The New Jersey AllState High School Orchestra and Chorus performs publicly twice a year. A week ago, the group appeared before the annual New Jersey Education Association in Atlantic City.

title: Voters in the Cincinnati Area Approve Conversions to Publicly Owned Transit
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 11 Voters in Cincinnati and in three areas of northern Kentucky have voted. to convert their respective privately owned bus systems to public ownership.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: As it happens, I had just finished, watching a Public Service TV commercial for the United Nations Children's Fund last Sunday, when picked up The Times and read Patricia Bosworth's piece on Dude.

title: THEORY DISPUTED ON BIRTH DEFECTS
description: The theory of a British scientist linking blighted potatoes to the occurrence of two severe neurological birth defects has become the focus of discussion and controversy on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Major Suffolk Political Parties Facing a Time of Reevaluation
description: HOLBROOK, L.I.In the aftermath of Senator George McGovern's defeat by more than 180,000 votes in Suffolk County, the Democratic chairman of the county, Dominic J. Baronello candidly conceded that his organization was in a shambles. But the Republican party in Suffolk despite its victory, has troubles of its own.

title: Theater: Bentley and the Committee
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 11From the miles of testimony before the House Committee on UnAmerican Activities, Eric Bentley has assembled Are You Now or Have You Ever Been, which received its world premiere last night at the Yale Repertory Theater. The play is specifically concerned with the committee's investigation of show business (from 1947 to 1958).

title: Some Other Place. The Right Place.
description: If that English teacher at East Passaic High School had stuck to Chaucer and dangling modifiers instead of futzing around with experiments in age regression, probably none of the jumbled events of this long novel would have occurred. Day Whittacker, Eagle Scout, an 18yearold Jersey jerk, might never have convinced himself that he was the reincarnation of Daniel Lyam Montross (18801953), rural philosopher, violent swinger and memorable stud. Nor would Diana Stoving 21, wealthy Sarah Lawrence graduate (major: dance), have been lured out of the waiting room of a Porsche dealer in Garfield to take part with Day in that taperecorded, hairy odyssey to Connecticut, Vermont and finally to Arkansas, where the author discovers her waiting for Day's resurrection and apparently halfway through pregnancy. And she certainly would have been spared the experience of a damnednearunique sexual dilemma: Diana is Daniel's granddaughter Day is possessed by Daniel; when Day and Diana finally learn they can zipper their sleepingbags together, it's not only time that get warped.

title: Indians Artistry Makes Way East
description: MILLBURNTen years ago, Bebe Antell stopped off in Phoenix, Ariz., while on a transcontinental trip with her husband and their three children. Since then  and five trips to the Southwest later  she has been hooked on the arts of the American Indian.

title: Water Treatment Grant
description: BOSTON, Nov. 11 (AP)The Federal Environment Protection Agency has awarded Medfield, Mass., a $2,050,000 grant for the construction of facilities to treat waste water. The agency announced Thursday that the funds were for the construction of a pumping station, sewer and a treatment plant. Total cost for the project is estimated at $4,185,000.

title: Academy Elects Danielou
description: PARIS, Nov. 11Jean Cardinal Danilou was elected to the French Academy this week to take the seat of the late Eugene Cardinal Tisserant.

title: Preps
description: SUFFIELD, Conn., Nov. 11Mike Burns plunged 1 yard for la touchdown with 15 seconds remaining as Suffield defeated WilbrahamMonson today, 12.6.

title: Senegal Harsh With Rustlers
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Nov. 11 (AP)  A new law provides for life terms at hard labor for some firstoffense cattle rustlers and the death penalty for repeaters, a broadcast reported.

title: Florida Racing In a Deeper Mess
description: MIAMI, Nov. 11Florida winter racing, which underwent a wrenching change one year ago when a State Supreme Court decision took away the coveted middle dates from Hialeah and handed them to Gulf stream, is under a greater strain today as a result of the court's ruling yesterday reversing its action of 1971.

title: 38 JUDGES TO LOSE SEATS IN BAY STATE
description: BOSTON, Nov. 11 (AP) Judges in Massachusetts are appointed, not elected, but nevertheless 38 of them were turned out of office this week when the electorate overwhelmingly approved one of several amendments to the State Constitution.

title: Misfortune Revisits a Vietnamese Girl
description: TRANGBANG, South Vietnam, Nov. 11 (AP)Misfortune has again visited Phan Tilt Kim Phuc and her family in the town of Trangbang.

title: Black Loses in East Hampton
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I. The.. bid by Andrew Malone Jr. to become the first black elected to office by the East End was buried by the Nixon landslide last Tuesday. Running third in a field of four candidates, Mr. Malone failed to capture one of two newly created seats on the East Hampton Town Board. The Republicans, Richard B. Herrlin and Mary Fallon, finished well ahead of Mr. Malone and his Democratic colleague, John Bistrian.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Consumer complaints about the service provided by electric utilities have broadened recently to include not only environmental concerns but the rising pattern of rate charges,

title: JEHOVAH'S WITNESS IS SLAIN BY KNIFER
description: A Jehovah's Witness was fatally stabbed yesterday afternoon and a second church member was wounded by a young man who attacked the two men in a West Side loft they were preparing for a religious meeting.

title: Nordiques Top Aeros, 3.1
description: UEBEC, Nov. 11 (UPI)Andre Gaudette scored twice tonight as the Quebec Nordiques spotted Houston a onegoal lead. and then rallied for a 31.victory over the Aeros in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Running With Bassets In Jersey's Countryside
description: GLADSTONE, N. J.Running with the hounds on Sunday afternoons is bound to put pink into the cheeks of even the pokiest follower of the Tewksbury Foot Bassets. But now it was time to go home. An autumnal sun was setting in an appropriate russet blaze as Mel Disch, the 17yearold huntsman, sounded the end of day on an English hunting horn. The succession of short mournful notes and the verbal command to the hounds to pack up signaled that the hunt was over for that Sunday.

title: RIZZO BOLSTERED BY NIXON VICTORY
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 11The reelection of President Nixon this week gav a new assist and added new controversy to the unorthodox political career of Democratic Mayor Frank L. Rizzo.

title: Art
description: WHEN Jean Leon Grme died at the age of 80 in 1904, he came to the end of a career full of official honors, popular successes and the exercise of prejudices, that could not have been better calculated to make him despised in the 20th century. Among many other offenses that were to make him in retrospect the; archetYpe and archfiend of 19thcentury French academic artists, he had protested in 1884 against the planned Manet memorial exhibition at the Ecole des: Beaux Arts. This was ungraceful enough as a postmortem continuation of the Academy's persecution of Manet, and even more shortsighted as an historical decision. But Grme made his real booboo in 1893 when he led the opposition to the government's accepting, the Caillebotte bequest  now the heart of the Louvre's impressinist collection  and. described the Cezannes, Redoirs, Monets, and others as filth that only a great moral slackening could

title: Maryland Beats Clemson
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md. Nov. 11 (AP)  Maryland scored three touchdowns in the fourth quarter today as it rolled over Clemson, 316. The victory lifted Maryland's record to a 541 wonlosttied mark and insured the school's first nonlosing season since 1964. Clemson is now 36.

title: Preps
description: SOUTH BYFIELD, Mass., Nov. 11In a battle of nonwinners, Governor Dummer defeated Belmont Hill, 4220, today. An alert Governor Dummer defense picked off three passes and returned all for scores.

title: Armstrong Races Purdue
description: WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind., Nov. 11 (UPI)Otis Armstrong tallied three touchdowns, including an 89yard gallop on the opening kickoff, in a 276 Purdue triumph over Wisconsin today. The victory left Purdue with a 51 record in the Big Ten and its hopes still alive for the conference title.

title: Patricia Clark Is Bride
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Nov. 11Miss Patricia Ann Clark, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clifford M. Clark of Endwell, was married here this evening to Thomas Milton Aser, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles D. Aser of New York. Rabbi Jacob Hurwitz performed the ceremony at the Sheraton Inn. The bride is an employment specialist for Clairol, Inc., New York. Her husband, an assistant district manager with I.B.M. in New York, is vice president of the New York Syracuse Alumni Association.

title: ExAddicts in Newark Are Taught to Cook as Therapy
description: NEWARKDeboning fowl, butchering a side of beef, growing herbs or preparing haute cuisine are all part of the therapy program at Integrity House, drug rehabilitation center here, where 165 adult and juvenile members cook their own meals and are learning the fundamentals of nutrition.

title: British Banknote Design Is Termed Tactless
description: LONDON, Nov. 11 (Reuters) The design on Britain's latest 5pound banknote, a peer warned this week, is somewhat tactless.

title: Program Aimed at Drugs and Smoking
description: NORTHPORT, L.I.A model science and health program, designed to instill student resistance to smoking and drugs through knowledge, has been started at the Larkfield School in Union Free District 4 here. The district has been chosen by the State Education Department as the first training center for other school districts on Long Island.

title: CHILE IS CHECKING ON NEWS AGENCIES
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 11 (UPI)By order of the Government, foreign news agencies operating in Chile are now required, presumably indefinitely, to provide the Presidential Palace with copies of all news dispatches sent abroad.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 11 This city's last trolley car rolled off into the sunset a quartercentury ago, leaving a few pleasant memories, some steel rails faintly showing through asphalted streets, and a 10acre square block of aging carbarns.

title: PAKISTAN'S STAND ASSAILED BY INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 11Prime Minister Indira Gandhi was reported to have blamed some foreign pm/ors today for what she described as a hardening of attitude by Pakistan toward India that has blocked efforts toward peace on the subcontinent.

title: U.S. Lists1,809 Missing Or Captured in the War
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 11 (Reuters)A total of 1,809 United States military men pre missing or have been captured by  Commtinist forces in Indochina, according to a revised breakdown of prisoners of war issued today.

title: Miss Sharon Cramer Bride of John Farago
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 11Miss Sharon Ann Cramer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Cramer of Glencoe, was married here this evening to John Michael Farago, son of Ladislas Farago, author of the recent bestseller The Game of the Foxes, and Mrs. Farago of New York and New Milford, Conn. Rabbi David Grauhert performed the ceremony at Temple Anshe Emet.

title: Gardens
description: MUSHROOMS have been eaten for long time, since the days of the cavemen. For trained and knowing eyes, mushroom hunting for delectable species in the wild is one of the most delightful and rewarding pursuits, for the flavor is fascinating and unique.

title: Local
description: Monsignor Farrell turned back New Rochelle, 148, yesterday at its Staten Island field, for its seventh victory in eight starts. Farrell has a wonlost tied record of 3514 for the past five seasons.

title: Nassau South
description: Two of the four Nassau County South Shore divisional football races will have to wait until next Saturday to be decided, but Freeport (Division II) and East Meadow (Division I) have already made playoff preparations.

title: Thousands of Tenants. in Queens Banding Together to Fight for Improvements
description: Recent changes in city and state housing laws have spurred thousands of Queens tenants to band together against rent increases, leaking roofs, dingy hallways and the apathy of fellow tenants.

title: Queens Party Proves Chilly
description: About three Sundays ago we went to a fundraising, al fresco cocktail party on the windwhipped patio of the Forest Hills Inn. It had to be the chilliest fete ever held this side of the Arctic Circle.

title: STRIKE IMPERILS WAR OBJECTORS
description: BOSTON, Nov. 11Five conscientious objectors who are members of a striking labor union here face possible prosecution if they do not return to work.

title: Photos by Skylab To Assist Planning In Tristate Region
description: The Tristate Regional Planning Commission has reached an agreement with N.A.S.A to have astronauts aboard the spacecraft Skylab photograph the New York metropolitan area after the vehicle's launching from Cape. Kennedy next April.

title: Staff of Price Commission Is Settling Down to a Hectic Routine
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11After a year of administering this country's first peacetime price controls, the Price Commission's staff finds that life is no longer frenzied. It is, merely hectic.

title: BergenPassaic
description: A. J. Borresen Jr., the son of a star lineman for an unbeaten Lyndhurst team in 1949, continued to set the scoring pace for Bergen County yesterday with a fourtouchdown performance.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: WASHINGTONThomas A. Kauper, the new head of the Justice Department's antitrust division, believes that he must accord top priority to two traditional areas of antitrust enforcement: pricefixing cases and mergers between companies in the same field.

title: Boys League Awards To Be Given on Dec. 14
description: The Gustavus Town Kirby Sportsmanship Awards for 1972 will be presented by the, Boys Athletic League at a lunncheon on Dec. 14 at the Plaza Hotel.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: You may not know it yourself yet, but quite a few people already know what gifts you will lavish this Christmas on your wife, husband, son or daughter. Not only do they, the retailers and suppliers, know but also they are laying many millions of dollars on the line to back up their belief.

title: U.S. Home Subsidy Program Is Upheld by Business Study
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)  A yearlong study by a business research group coneluded that the Federal Government's programs of subsidizing home purchases and rental payments for lowerincome families were basically sound.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: IREAD your article about Dude with great humor. Now how about that $100billion international hit musical that is going on in Vietnam every day where young men go to their graves like bedsa musical war that is sold out to standing room only all over the world. So say what you want to say. Call me what you call me. Do to me what you do. You still won't get me to hate myself. You won't get me to be like you. You see, I love myself. And I love you, too.

title: Rain for McGovern
description: ST. THOMAS, V. I., Nov. 11 (UPI)  Rain kept Senator George McGovern inside today on the third day of his rest from the 1972 campaign. Mr. McGovern and his 1.1Life are staying at the estate of Henry A, Kimelman, who was the finance chairman for the Senator's campaign.

title: Missing Emu Is Recaptured
description: ADAMS, N.Y., Nov. 11 (AP)  A fivefoottall, 140pound!, emu, a bird closely related to the ostrich, was a little hungry and weary but otherwise healthy today after a week of freedom in the northern New York countryside. The big bird was found late yesterday, eight days after it had disappeared from the back of a truck that was carting it from the Hillcrest Animal Farm here to the Natural Bridge, Va., Zoo.

title: PARNELL SECOND
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 11 Taking the lead late in the going, after two horses fell, John M. Schiff's Droll Role won the 21th running of the 1mile Washington D.C. International_ on the turf today.

title: Warriors Top Knicks, 103 to 102
description: Bill. Bradley, who had connected on an incredibly difficult jump shot to send the game into overtime, missed from the key as the buzzer ended the extra period with the Golden State Warriors holding a 103102 advantage over the Knicks in the tensionpacked) National Basketball Association game.

title: $200 Lost in Hotel Burglary By General Assembly Head
description: Stanislaw Trepczynski, the president of the United Nations General Assembly, lost $200 in cash and assorted jewelry Friday night when his hotel room was broken into, the police said yesterday.

title: Simpson at Shea Today
description: Although the New York Jets held Larry Brown of the Washington Redskins, the National Football League's leading rusher to 48 yards: on the ground last week, they think they have an even tougher assignment against 0. J. Simpson, who comes into Shea Stadium with the Buffalo Bills today.

title: Sihanouk Aide Adamant
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)Khieu Samphan, defense minister of Prince Norodom Sihanouk's government in exile and commander of antiGovernment forces in Cambodia, has rejected any talks, compromise or ceasefire with the Lon Nol Government in Pnompenh, the Peking radio reported today.

title: Preps
description: SAXTON RIVERS, Vt., Nov. 11Vermont Academy cornpleted an unbeaten season today. by overwhelming Kimball Union, 4212.

title: Maine Paper Fills Post
description: PORTLAND, Maine, Nov. 11 (AP)Richard R. J. Morin has been appointed general manager of the Kennebec Journal, succeeding Raul Plummer, who retired. The Journal, a daily newspaper published in Augusta, is owned by the Guy Gannett Publishing Company of Portland.

title: Article 19  No Title
description: DALLAS, Nov. 11 (AP)Texas A and M marched 85 yards in the closing minutes and scored on a. 37yard field goal by Pat McDermott, then added a tounchdownfollowing a fumble recovery to defeat Southern Methodist, 2717, in Southwest Conference football game today.

title: The Nixon Interview
description: In an interview with The Washington StarNews, President Nixon has provided a clear outline of how perceives the nation's needs, his concept of government's role and his politics in the aftermath of his enormous personal triumph in last Tuesday's election. There are no surprises in the interview. In both foreign and domestic affairs, the prevailing theme is continuity.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I am a junior in high school and I love the theater. would like to comment on the injustice done to the now destroyed Dude.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The Billie Holiday Enlivens BedStuy
description: BedfordStuyvesant's new Billie Holiday Theater, which is curently playing host to a threeweek dramatic festival sponsored by the Black Theater Alliance, expects to play an increasingly important role in the cultural rejuvenation of this once elegant section.

title: SEAT IN OHIO WON BY NAVY OFFICER
description: COLUMBUS. Ohio, Nov 11Lieut. C. William O'Neill of the Navy, son of the Chief Justice of the Ohio Supreme Court, has been elected to a seat in the State House of Representatives although he is on active duty in the Philippines.

title: Sharp's Race Team Cleaning Up
description: The $200,000 raceshop addition to Bob Sharp's dealership in Wilton, Conn., is so new that the mechanics have not had time to put equipment, tools and spare parts neatly in place. But in a week or so, Sharp says, we'll have it Roger Penskeclean. Sharp can feel comfortable about waiting for the tidiness because on the track he already has a record that resembles Penske's. This season the Datson racing teamconsisting of Sharp in the northeastern division of the Sports Car Club of America and Jim Fitzgerald of Clemmons, N.C., in the southeastern divisionhas won 19 of 26 races.

title: The Nation
description: DENVER  The most Important thing In the Olympic Games... is not to have conquered but to have fought well

title: MRS. MEIR DOUBTS NEW U.S. PRESSURE
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 11 (UPI) Premier Golda Meir of Israel said today that she assumed President Nixon would not try to apply pressure on her Government in an attempt to reach a Middle East peace. Nor did she think Mr. Nixon would seek to impose his own settlement.

title: Mrs. King Ranked No. 1 For Third Year in Row
description: Mrs. Billie Jean King has been ranked the No. 1 woman player in the country for the third straight year by the United States Lawn Tennis Association.

title: New Ban on Busing in California Challenged in Suit by A.C. L. U.
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 11The American Civil Liberties Union of Southern California has challenged in court a ban on student transfers for racial desegregation purposes that was approved by the voters on Tuesday.

title: College Service Aids ExGI's
description: EDISONWhen he left the Army more than three years ago, Carlos Cardona toyed with the idea of going to college.

title: Local
description: WEST ISLIP, L. I., Nov. 11Holy Family assured itself of at least a tie for the Catholic High Schools Football League championships today by defeating St. John the Baptist, 1412, at St. John the Baptist field. St. Francis can tie Holy Family for the title with a victory tomorrow over Archbishop Stepinac.

title: Fire Trucks in 40 Areas Change Their Colors
description: MAYWOOD  Fire Departments in nearly 40 communities throughout the slate have switched in the last year from the traditional red engines to trucks painted white and in such hues as lime and chrome yellow.

title: Leanne Fosbre Engaged
description: MADISON, N. J., Nov. 11 Mr. and Mrs. Vincent P. Fosbre of Madison have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Leanne Fosbre, to Lieut. Bruce Clayton La Vigne, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Hubert H. La Vigne of San Diego.

title: Saigon Gets Longbinh
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 11The United States Army today turned.over its huge headquarters base at Longbinh, 16.miles north of Saigon, to the South Viet  namese Army. The transfer symbelized the end of direct United States Army participation in the. Vietnam war after more than seven years. About 19,000 Army soldiers remain in South Vietnam, working chiefly as advisers to Saigon Government troops, as helicopter crewmen, and as maintenance, supply and office staff. Under ceasefire proposals being considered, they would have to leave South Vietnam along with about. 10,000 Air Force personnel, 1,300 Marines, 1,800 sailors, and 100 Coast Guardsmen within 60 days after the signing of an agreement.

title: COLORADO TRIUMPHS OVER KANSAS, 33 TO 8
description: BOULDER, Colo., Nov. 11 (AP)Colorado, held to three field goals by Fred Lima in the first half, erupted for two touchdowns only 18 seconds apart in the third period to crush. Kansas, 338, in a Big Eight Conference game today.

title: 100 Psychiatric Attendants End Essex Hospital Walkout
description: CEDAR GROVE, N. J., Nov. 11 (UPI)A walkout by more than 100 psychiatric attendants at the Essex County Hospital Center ended today by court order.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: BRITAIN imposed a 90day freeze of wages, prices, rents and dividends.... This action propped up the pound, which rose from $2.35 on Monday to $2.36 at the weekend. The New York Stock Exchange chairman, James J. Needham, proposed a longer trading day for investors in other time zones, including Europe.... S.E.C. entered into a setlement with Investors Diversified Services, Inc., whereby I.D.S. is barred from future violations of insider trading rules in connection with dealing in stock of Caesar's World, Inc. (formerly Lum's Inc.)

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 1ITwo more letter bombs addressed to Jewishowned companies and mailed In India were found in London and Glasgow today.

title: A Bloomsday Place Near Zurich's Zoo
description: ZURICH, Switzerland  This city, which has all the standard Swiss tourist attractions, also possesses something rather unSwiss memorial to an Irishman. It is a statue of James Joyce, erected six years ago on his grave.

title: 26 Calves Brought From Europe to Texas Ranch
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex, Nov. 11Twentysix purebred Simental calves, which Department of Agriculture officials in Washington say represent the first herd of that breed ever to be imported from Europe, have arrived at a ranch along the Medina River 15 miles west of here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I can't applaud you enough for the sentence of a recent editorial which says that demolishing the Palestinian strike force is not solving the Palestinian problem.

title: Vault Becomes a Jail
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 11 (AP)Many people might relish a few minutes alone in a bank vault, but not in the one in the basement of the former Louisville Trust building. The old vault, believed to be the bank's original, will be used as a holder for prisoners booked by the Jefferson County police. The police have taken over the building as their new headquarters. The vault will not be in use long, however. The county eventually plans to process its prisoners through nearby Louisville Police Department holdover facilities.

title: A hungry Ik is a mean and nasty Ik
description: The Ik (pronounced Eek) treated anthropologist Colin M. Turnbull as one of themselves, which is about as badly as anybody can be treated. They lied to him; they stole from him; they defecated on his doorstep. They played mean pranks for the pleasure of witnessing his distress. Had he fallen sick they would have hastened his end and then robbed the corpse, which then wouldn't have been worth the trouble of burial. (A funeral, it was said, was a nuisance to everyone. Expensive, too.) Sometimes the decrepit are just pushed off hillsides. They won't crawl back up.

title: Pay Increases Off a Third For 7 Groups of Workers
description: Pay increases for seven groups of professional and technical workers in New. York State were about a third lets in the year ended last March than the preceding 1970.71 period, according to Herbert Bienstock, regional director of the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Queens Zoning Eased
description: After hearing from a host of Queens homeowners who made the bus and subway trek to Manhattan to fight City Hail, the City Planning Commission has softened its new zoning proposal that would encourage row houses on the borough's leftover lots.

title: DEFEAT IS ASSAYED BY A ROCKEFELLER
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 11West Virginians just felt like they had to kick me once before they would accept me. They had to see if, rejected, would stay.

title: ENHANCED LIVING PRESSED FOR JEWS
description: TORONTO, Nov. 11Leaders of Jewish philanthropic funds reported today on innovative projects undertaken recently to cope with deficiencies in Jewish education, cultural and religious life.

title: Musical Chairs in Business and Government
description: Hundreds of generals, highlevel civil servants, commissioners and Congressmen each year switch from government jobs to closely related careers in private industry.

title: Cathy Simon Fiancee of Michael Palmer
description: Dr. and Mrs. Bernard E. Simon of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cathy Simon, to Michael Palmer, of New York and the late Mr. Palmer, son of Mrs. 14eorge Palmer of New York and the late Mr. Palmer. The couple have planned their wedding for Nov. 24 in San Francisco.

title: Policies of Police Help to Prevent Violence in Canarsie School Dispute
description: At the height of the school controversy in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn recently, Inspector James Meehan knew he had a bad situation on his hands. Rival groups of black and white youths nad been pulled apart and placed behind barricades, but eggs and a few rocks were beginning to fly, and the angry shouts from both sides were driving tension higher and stretching the nerves of his riot police. Then he noticed the police observation helicopter circling high overhead, and that gave him an

title: Washington State Converts Miscues Into 2713 Victory
description: PULLMAN, Wash., Nov. 11 (AP)  Washington State University converted two major Stanford errors into scores in the final minute of play and scored a 2713 upset victory in a Pacific8 Conference game today.

title: Lansky's Wife Joins Him
description: MIAMI, Nov. 11 (AP)Thelma Lansky, wife of the reputed Mafia financial adviser, Meyer Lansky, has joined her husband in Miami. Lansky; 71 years old, had been a fugitive from the United States. He was expelled from Israel as dangerous to the public welfare last Sunday and was arrested in Miami. He is in a hospital with a heart condition.

title: Family Thanksgiving Urged
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 11 (AP)The Mormon church released today its annual Thanksgiving message, calling for a family home day with religious flavor and the spirit of Thanksgiving. In its message to presiding church leaders, the First Presidency of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints said the day could be one of greatly increasing family love and solidarity and recognition of the blessings of the Lord, which we so richly enjoy.

title: 2 Exhibitions: Benton and. Rockwell
description: NEW BRUNSWICKMajor exhibitions of two wellknown artists of the thirties, one here and on e in Newark, are scheduled this month.

title: Cornell Routs Brown, 4828, on Allen's Passing
WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONAlthough it has not been widely noticed except by experts, in the weeks before the election there began to emerge outside the Government a remarkably optimistic set of forecasts about the United States economy over the next few years.

title: Virginia Edington Wed To Joseph F. Brown 3d
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 11Miss Virginia Louise Edington, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Augustus Edington, was married here this noon to Joseph Freolia Brown 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. Brown of Myersville, Md. The Rev. Boleslaus J. Rarus performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Roman Catholic. Church.

title: Ohio Welfare Chief Named
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 11 (AP)Charles W. Bates, a 44yearold Boston social service worker, was named Ohio welfare director yesterday by Gov. John J. Gilligan.

title: Ski Notes: Thinking Snow at the Show
description: THERE are a few people in New York who will smile perverse smiles at the sight of snow, or even a few flurries, this week. The reason is that they have organized the Ski Show at the Coliseum (it opens Thursday afternoon and runs through Sunday) and they know that even a tentative taste of winter encourages a blizzard of visitors. Once there, they wander among the booths to examine the latest equipment, watch instructors give demonstrations and gaze at ski movies that always seem to show lots of fluffy powder snow under a blue sky. Even crisp fall weather, implying snow ahead, is also good for attendance, but the thing the show people cannot stand is rain. Last year, without snow, the show attracted 75,000 visitors in four days.

title: Theater In Chester Marking 13th Year
description: CHESTER  The Chester Theater Group, one of New Jersey's 79 community theaters, is now ushering in its 13th season.

title: DoubleDeck London Buses To Be Kept on Busy Routes
description: LONDON, Nov. 11 (Reuters)  London's famous rearentrance, doubledecker buses have been given a reprieve in the interest of speedy service.

title: IRISH SONG TAKES OPEN JUMPER TITLE
description: SOMERS, N.Y., Nov. 11George D'Ambrosio, a 5foot 2inch, 100pound high school student from Mount Kisco, N.Y:, rode Irish Song to the open jumper championship today at the Primrose Farms horse show.

title: UnionMiddlesex
description: Powerful Westfield established a New Jersey record of 41 consecutive games without a defeat yesterday, and it was a family affair.

title: NAIVE
description: To THE EDITOR: Patricia Bosworth's article blaming Dude's failure on Gerome Ragni is either sick, truly cruel and ruthless, or just plain naive. If anything, it merely spotlights Ragni's purported intention of showing the plight of an individual caught in a society so lost in its own system and experiencing such an identity crisis that it can no longer survive without destroying the human being.

title: But Shunpikers Are Strictly Low Profile
description: THERE is no feeling quite like that experienced by the lone skier at the summit of a mountain. Absolutely alone. Quiet. So quiet the creaking of ice on the trees dominates the distant squeal of the chairlift cable, so quiet the spill of snow from an overloaded branch obscures even the tissuepapertearing sound of skis scraping the snow. Silence violated only by the rush of air.

title: The tree does not rise nor does it bow
description: James Tate is about the same age as Bobby Fischer. Like the new world chess champion he knows how to play any number of dazzling games with the counters of his art. In chess, one is told the dazzle issues, against a background of severe even monotonous orderliness from the combinational and improvisational skills of the great player. It can't be all that different in poetry, an art which as Coleridge famously noted combines an extreme degree of orderlinessthe regularities and recurrences of meter, assonance, rhyme, etc.with exceptional opportunities for novelty and surprise. Tate's poems are very orderly as well as very surprising and original. Does that make him a player of Fischer's caliber on his own turf? I guess it may, although I despair of being able to justify my opinion in a few hundred words.

title: Gardens
description: IF YOU would like to experiment with growing your own mushrooms at home, there are two ways. With commercially prepared kits, now sold through many mailorder houses, and some department stores, or by buying the spawn, mixing your own growing medium, and carrying on from there.

title: Town of Huntington Preparing to Help Nation Celebrate Bicentennial in 1976
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I.Although the United States will not become 200 years old until 1976, the Town of Huntington has already started to plan its role in commemorating the bicentennial years, 19761983.

title: Egypt Is Reported to Get Advanced Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Soviet Union has recently shipped about 60 advanced surfacetoair missiles to Egypt and turned them over to Egyptian forces, according to United States military and diplomatic sources.

title: LONG BEACH AIMS TO TRIM BUDGET
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., Nov. 11 A tone of austerity was set by some Republican City Councilmen here this week when they recommended that the salaries for their parttime jobs be cut $1,000 a year in a proposed budget for next year.

title: Chess: While the Time Bomb Ticks, The Hypermodernist Tacks
description: Some openings carve out definite and deep channels of play in which urgent threat and counterthreat follow each other in rapid succession. Arising mainly from either 1 PK4 or 1 PQ4, they result in hypertense play and exciting conclusions, win, loss or draw.

title: 4 Boys Die in Fire
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 11 (AP) Four sons of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Weber died in a fire early today while Mr. Weber was away on a 25minute trip to pick up his wife at a restaurant where she worked. The boys, 7 to 16 years old, were asleep when the fire started.

title: MorrisSomerset
description: Randolph Township clinched at least a tie for the Iron Area Conference title yesterday by defeating Morris Knolls, 80, in Rockaway.

title: MRS. RODERICK KERR
description: RED BANK, N.J. Nov. 11Mrs. Ruth Trexler Kerr, former manager of the public affairs department of the American Broadcasting Company, and the wife of Roderick. E. Kerr, a warehouse executive, died toI day in Rievrview Hospital. She was 56 years old and lived in Rumson.

title: SHOP TALK
description: FAIRFIELDThere's not much rural area left, and its population (now 7,000) doubled during the last decade. But Fairfield, Essex County's last frontier, still has a low tax rate, as compared to its neighbors.

title: U.S. Gives Up Secrecy Fight On Tax Auditing Manuals
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 11 (AP)The Federal Government says it has given up efforts to preserve the classified status of manuals and handbooks used by the Internal Revenue Service in auditing income tax returns.

title: CANADIENS HALT KINGS SKEIN, 52
description: MONTREAL,, Nov. 11 (UPI)Frank Malloylick scored two firstperiodpower play goals tonight as the Montreal Canadiens broke Los Angeles's ninegame undefeated string by defeating the Kings, 52.

title: COLUMBIA ROUTED
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 11No longer called the Indians, Dartmouth's football team went on the warpath anyway today and overwhelmed Columbia, 388, before 15,200 fans at Memorial Field. The victory put last year's cochampions into undisputed possession, of first place in the Ivy League.

title: In Harrisburg ( Pa.), an answer to, Vietnam; The Harrisburg 7 and The New Catholic Left; By William O'Rourke. 264 pp. New York: Thomas Y. Crowell. $6.95.; The FBI and The Berrigans; The Making of a ConspiracyBy Jack Nelson and Ronald J. Ostrow. 317 pp. New York: Coward, McCann & Geoghegan. $7.95.
description: In Harrisburg during the trial, novelist William O'Rourke seemed to be everywhere shaggy enough to give security men some qualms despite his press credentials; young enough to be trusted by the Defense Committee (members of which will surely regret some of their indiscreet comments to him, now put in print). He seemed always to be shaking his wispy hair, as if to say What madness!  and I guessed, even then, he would do the best book on the trial. Here is all the madness, distilled:

title: Rate of Growth In Schools Dips
Science
description: Australopithecus, an apelike man that walked relatively erect, lived 2.5 to 3 million years ago. Homo erectus, a beetlebrowed type, lived fgr more recentlyabout a million years ago. These two creatures are widely thought to represent early stages in the evolution of man.

title: What Peace Means to Wall Street
description: Wall Street is convinced that peace will break out shortly in Vietnam and that it should have profound implications for the stock market.

title: GOVERNOR SLATES TEN MEETINGS AS POLICY GUIDES
description: Governor Rockefeller will begin the first of a series of town meetings throughout the state tomorrow to discuss problems and needs that, he says, should appropriately be considered in preparing my legislative program and annual message to the Legislature.

title: Edwina Martin, Robert Stuart Wed in Florida
description: HOBE SOUND, Fla., Nov. 11Mrs. Edwina Atwell Martin of Palm Beach was married here this afternoon to Robert Whiton Stuart ofBenalmadena, Spain, formerly of New York. The Rev. Francis Dickinson performed the Presbyterian ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Agnew.

title: Officials Urge Better Transit Systems for Today, Not the Future
description: A panel of city and Federal officials agreed here this week that advanced transportation concepts such as peoplemovers and personal rapidtransit system can have little or no impact on the city's immediate transportation needs.

title: Preps
description: BLAIRSTOWN, N.J., Nov. 11 Skip Waddell scored two touchdowns and gained 103 yards in 15 carries to help Blair defeat Peddie today, 280, and narrow the series gap in the 69game rivalry.

title: New &
description: The latest of John Masters's Indian novels (a series that began in 1951 with Nightrunners of Bengal) is a glittering Kiplingesque entertainment sorting out some differences between East and West in the last decades of the British Empire. And finding a few commonalities. As Kipling's ballad concludes, There is neither East nor West, nor Border, nor Breed, nor Birth!/ When two strong men stand face to face, though they come from the ends of the Earth!

title: The Nation
description: Pollutantsthose of the ear and those of the nosewere under attack last week in New York City. The results were mixed:

title: Skiing Norway With Guides, Dog Sled, Fear, Hope and Joy
description: THE train takes us north from Oslo. The farmland outside the city is so brilliantly white that the reflections of ravens swooping over the snowy fields seem more black than the birds themselves. We go for about four hours, changing to a bus at the very small valley town of Otta. There we see the sled team, five Eskimo dogs, for the first time. They come tumbling out of the baggage car like playful lions. We take turns holding their leashes on the station platform as the luggage is loaded into the bus. They pull us, unwillingly, behind them. They appear to know where they are going. Do we?

title: Two Men Wearing Disguises Cited in 13 Jersey Holdups
description: PARSIPPANY, N. J., Nov. A drug store in Lake Hia watha was robbed yesterday, apparently by the same two men wearing disguises who have been blamed for at lead 12 other armed robberies in the area, the police said today.

title: Picarooning, bikeriding, modern youth, a Jersey jerk
description: At its best, the picaresque novel adds allspice to a bland literary diet of dull readeridentification with dull protagonists, empathy for whom is too often a conditioned rather than an earned response. At its most bumbling, the picaresque is a contrived copout from the fictional chores of sustaining complex characterizations, of working with the growing intensity of shapely narrative rather than in staccato spurts of episodic deadfalls and pratfalls. The Incredible Brazilian, first volume in a projeced trilogy about Gregorio Peixoto da Silva Xavier, Brazilian adventurer, is lukewarm picaresque with the fillip of a series of reincarnations for its roguehero: I know that I am indestructible, who have, in one form or another, lived through four centuries... I once married a girl... who turned out to be my own greatgranddaughter."

title: W.H.O. Reports Decline Of 80% in Cholera Cases
description: GENEVA, Nov. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)  The World Health Organization said in its bulletin this week tthat there had been an 80 per cent drop in cholera cases reported so far this year from those of the like period of last year.

title: Mir: Poetic Improvisations
description: THE exhibition of paint. ings by Joan Mir which Rosalind Krauss and Margit Rowell have organized at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, Fifth Avenue at 88th Street, is an event of capital importance for anyone with a more than casual interest in the vicissitudes of modern painting. For Mire is a more original and a more seminal figure in the history of that painting than we commonly suppose, and this exhibition addresses itself to the terms of that originality with an unusual intelligence and tenacity.

title: The trials of a juror
description: The notice to appear for jury duty is no less intimidating than a speeding ticket: Willful disobedience of this summons is a criminal contempt of court and is punishable by a fine of $250 or imprisonment not exceeding thirty days, or both...

title: Triangular Scores by a Nose at Aqueduct
description: Canonero II, Triangular, a proposed $200,000 match race and the Florida Supreme Court all generated different kinds of good for racing enthusiasm yesterday at rainsoaked Aqueduct.

title: Deborah C. Ringgold Plans March Bridal
description: Mrs. J. Richard Ringgold of New York, formerly of Locust Valley, L. I., has made known the engagement of her daughter, Miss Deborah Caines Ringgold, to William E. Mulvey Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Mulvey of Wollaston and Marshfield, Mass.

title: Education Levels Of Blacks Surveyed
description: Not far from the black poverty belt across Brooklyn there is a broad sweep of black residential sections stretching eastward from Prospect Park to the edge of Brownsville where educational and income levels are much higher.

title: Article 20  No Title
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Nov. 11 (AP)Virginia Tech assaulted South Carolina with the passing arm of Don Strock and the kicking of his older brother Dave today as the Gobblers routed the Gamecocks, 4520.

title: QE2 Arrives Late; Passengers Angty
description: BOSTON, Nov. 11  The Queen Elizabeth 2 steamed into Boston two and a half days late this morning and disembarked her 1,300 passengers, many of them as angry as hornets.

title: Streaking Steelers Face Chiefs Today
description: Pittsburgh has always been a good pro football town since Art Rooney installed a $2,500 franchise there in 1933, good inasmuch as the Steelers have never even won a division championship. They appear to be on their way at last this year and a club unaccustomed to big games has one on its hands today. The Kansas City Chiefs, twice a Super Bowl team and a play off competitor in two of the last three seasons, are the visitors.

title: Music
description: WE don't hear much about musique concrete these days. was reminded of it the other night, at Bejart's Ballet of the 20th Century. The dance company is doing its fulllength Nijinsky, Clown of God at the Felt Forum, and the ballet is set to music by Pierre Henry.

title: Swedes Debate the Impact of Welfare System on Their Freedom
Picarooning, bikeriding, modern youth, a Jersey jerk
description: Are you ready for another modern youth novel? More acidtrips, highs, bummers, busts, antiVietnam street theater onomatopoeic sexlyrics cookingoil couplings, race riots, communal minds, astrology, Diggers, Black Panthers and White Pigs, the new American Revolution? Will you string along with a lightskinned, prepschooltrained black hero from the Caribbean, with a Harvard philosophy degree, eager to stop doing and just be"? What if he threatens to turn into yet another version of the tragic mulatto stereotypeHe has the worst of both worlds: rich intellectual college beatnik to the blacks, dirty loathsome smelly drugfreak nigger to the whites"? And if he wins turns on, and loses a minister's daughter from midAmerica who then moves beyond him through the stoned range of drugs and sex into transcendental existentailism?

title: Brustein in London
description: FREEDOM of expression and the laws of libel, the public good versus the rights of the individual, English privacy and American surveillancethese were some of the thoughts that ran through my mind when I was almost prevented, recently, from reviewing a play because it was the object of a threatened law suit. The work in question was The Ballygombeen Bequest by John Arden and his wife, Margaretta D'Arcya fusillade of grapeshot aimed at an absentee English landlord who swindled his Irish tenant out of squatter's rights on the Connaught property they shared in West Ireland, and then arranged for the murder of the farmer's Marxist son when he tried land.

title: TAMPA STUNS MIAMI BEHIND DEFENSE, 70
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 11 (AP) The University of Tampa shocked the University of Miami for the second time in three years tonight as the Spartans defense made an 18yard touchdown run by Morris LaGrand stand up for a 70 homecoming victory.

title: Local
description: EAST ROCKAWAY, L. I, Nov. 11East Rockaway clinched at least a tie far the Metropolitan Football League championship by edging Xavier today, 3630, in a wild game that saw both teams score in every period.

title: Education
description: I'm glad this is over, a white boy said as he mounted the steps of John Wilson Junior High School 211 in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn.

title: Lutanist With Money in the Bank
description: WHEN Lucy Cross went to Vassar, she majored in English and drama. Her particular interest was in Elizabethan lyrics. Since the singing of these was accompanied by the lute, Miss Cross turned her attention to that instrument. In fact, she went to Yale, learned to play the lute and got a master's degree in music. Two years ago, she joined the New York Pro Musica.

title: Van Lier Faces Hearing
description: BEAVER FALLS, Pa., Nov. 11 (AP)Norm Van Lier of the Chicago Bulls of the National Basketball Association has been held for the Beaver County Grand Jury on charges of assaulting a police officer and obstructing a policeman. The action came.yesterday after a hearing before District Magistrate Milton Illicit, who conitinued a $2,500 bond under which Van. Lier is free. The charges stem from a July 31 incident in which Van.Lier and six other men engaged in brawl with police.

title: Saigon General Charged
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 11 (Reuters)  Charges carrying a possible death penalty have been filed against Gen. Vu Van Giai, whose division retreated from the northernmost province of. Quang Tri at the start of the North Vietnamese offensive, military sources said today.

title: Body Found on L. I. Beach
description: LLOYD HARBOR, L. I., Nov. 11 (UPI)The body of a 28yearold Manhittan man whose sailboat capsized in Huntington Bay two weeks ago was found today on a beach here. The Suffolk County police identified the man as David Kerr of 150 West 77th Street, who was reported missing Oct. 28 after his boat capsized.

title: Headliners
description: Two political developments of last week, destined to littlenoted and shortremembered:

title: Poly Defeats St. Paul's For 22d Straight Year
Rangers Beat Seals, 72, To Continue Garden String
description: As far as the goalie, Gilles Meloche, was concerned, the rest of the California Golden Seals could have been boating in San Francisco Bay for all of the help he got yesterday afternoon at Madison Square Garden.

title: Article 18  No Title
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Nov. 11 (AP)Texas Christian, with a sophomore 1 at the controls, scuttled Texas Tech's Southwest Conference title bid, 317, today and dealt the Red Raidyers bowl hopes a severe jolt. The underdog Horned Frogs took a quick 18point lead to hand Tech only its second loss of the season. Terry Drennan, a safety. converted to quarterback, engineerer a 15point scoring flurry in the first quarter and later guided T.C.U. into range for field goals of 19, 43 and 49 yards by Berl Simmons.

title: The Last Word
description: We are becoming immune to the dramatics of dissent. Where Fox's Book of Martyrs sustained generations of dissenters, today's martyrs are caption fodder, and it's hard to pay attention: Russian dissent, Greek dissent, Brazilian dissent, Nigerian dissent, South Vietnamese dissent, American dissent  the list is endless. There is, however, a sporting element in the way we react to the latest confrontation by wondering, How will they cope with that one? We are connoisseurs of truly unpredictable dissent as we are connoisseurs of the offbeat techniques of suppression and censorship. A recent example that we commend to your attention was dreamed up by the Czech authorities, who are still trying to erase the last traces of 1968's Prague Spring, a task made easier by this year's chumminess

title: M'NIFF CAPTURES STATE P.S.A.L. RUN
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Nov. 11 Howie McNiff shattered the course record here today in the New York State Public HighSchools Athletic Association intersectional cross country championships. McNiff, a 17yearold Albertus Magnus senior, clocked 12 minutes 41 seconds on the flat Rochester Institute of Technology 2.5mile course, strewn with puddles from overnight rains. He captured the B division, one of the three championship sections seeded equally on the basis of school enrollment.

title: Sal Maglie to Be Honored By Greenwich Old Timers
description: Sal Maglie, Jon Matlack and Bill Jennings will be honored Tuesday at the 12th annual awards dinner of the Old Timers Association of Greenwich, Conn.

title: UNION EN EARN CREDITS FOR WORK
description: An academic program offering apprentices a chance to work for a degree at the same time that they train for journeyman cards is being developed by Louis L. Levine, the State Industrial Commissioner.

title: The Nation
description: Since his election as Governor of Puerto Rico in 1968, Luis Alberto Ferre has pushed for two things: increased industrialization (since 1952, Puerto Rico has added 1,900 factories and 145,000 jobs); transition from the present Commonwealth status to full statehood for the island.

title: Dreams for Children, Nightmares for Teenagers
description: Two of the major night pastimes sleeping and dreamingare such a strange mixture of scientific fact and fantasy that the Encyclopaedia Britannica can inform us in one breath that: we dream more in REM periods, young children dream more frequently of wizards and fairies, the Greek oneiromancers made an ancient art of divination by dreams, and we can trace the AngloSaxon word dream back to the. German, triiger, to deceive. So it was only natural that the night or dream book should become a recognizable category in children's literature. After all, most children of picture book age are read to in bedan appropriate stage, with shadows on the wall, for fantasy in solitude.

title: The Impossible Railway
description: Canada threatened within by French Canadian separatists and without by rampaging American investment is presently in a truculent and soulsearching mood. Its writers their nationalist zeal often outstripping their talent are bent on mythmaking. Turned inward, they are prospecting the past for those heroic tales that helped forge the nation or at least define how it differs from the other, sometimes insufferably overshadowing, America.

title: Cougars Top Squires
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 11 (AP)  Carolina's clutch freethrow shooting after four technical fouls were called on Vir ginia in the final halfminutec enabled the Cougars to strengthen their hold on firstplace in the East Division of the American Basketball Association with a 136128 victory; over the Squires tonight.

title: Miss Snider Is Fiancee of H. J. Singer Jr.
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 11The engagement of Miss Barbara Rose Snider to Herbert Joseph Singer Jr., son of Mrs. Singer and the late Mr. Singer, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Sidney R. Snider, parents of the bridetobe. A December wedding is planned.

title: How Long Does It Take to Peel a Red Onion?
description: WHEN Robert Wilson and four of his Byrd Hoffman School of Byrds arrived for the Debate on Robert Wilson at this year's Festival of the Arts in Iran, they were wearing black blindfolds as though expecting to go before a firing squad. They were not far mistaken. The hostility in the room was palpable, and it came mostly from a large, international group of reporters whose creature comforts had been seriously interfered with in the course of covering the arts beat this past September in the Iranian city of Shiraz.

title: Blues Beat Leafs
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 11 (UPI)Garry Unger scored on a St. Louis power play in the second period tonight to give the Blues a 1.0 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs, and make JeanGuy coaching, debut in the N.H.L. a success.

title: Movies
description: ISPENT my 13th and 14th summers stuffing pictures of Van Johnson, Peter Lawford, June Allyson, and Esther Williams into envelopes at MGM studios. I was required to stuff 340 envelopes an hour, and my fingers were always covered with paper cuts.

title: Miss Fallon Is Wed Here
description: Miss Maureen Carmel Fallon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis M. Fallon of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Robert Nelson Bridger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Garland Bridger of Newport News, Va. The Rev. Sean S. Reid of Kilkenny, Ireland, performed the ceremony in the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: Decay in Jersey City Yielding To Springtime of Renewal
description: JERSEY CITYAfter decades of decay, declining population, rising costs and political corruption, Jersey City's Redevelopment Agency views this as the springtime of the city's urgent efforts to renew itself.

title: Rare Breeds of New England To Have Their Day Next May
description: A new organization, the Assotiated Rare Breeds of New England, has been formed and plans made for a match show.

title: Waiters'
description: The strike by waiters, waitresses and busboys against wellknown Manhattan restaurants was extended yesterday to three more, bringing the total to 16.

title: Army Permits a Wac To Live With Spouse
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., Nov. 11 (AP)The Army has allowed a Wac and her new husband to live together despite Army regulations that would have kept them apart.

title: Rio Police Hunt Terrorists After 2 Deaths in Clashes
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 11The police hunted fugitive terrorists today after clashes in which a woman terrorist and detective were killed.

title: Detroit Lawyer Becomes First Radical Judge in U.S.
description: Detroit, Nov. 11First came the radical students. They graduated and became radical lawyers. And now Detroit has elected one of them to office: a radical judge.

title: EssexHudson
description: Unbeaten Barringer had its shutout streak snapped at six yesterday, but took a 306 victory over Paterson Eastside at Newark's School Stadium. Two other Barringer strings were kept intacteight straight verdicts this year and 21 straight over the past three years.

title: The Glorious Revolution In America
description: How often do you see an American colonial painting from the late 17th century? Not many have survived; and the few that have are mostly dim and indistinct. Our general knowledge of that period has also been incomplete. The generation between 1660 and 1690 has been the most obscure in American history, the most readily passed over and least understood.

title: France's 162YearOld Law Against Abortion Faces Test as. Trial in a Paris Suburb Stirs the Nation
description: PARIS, Nov. 11  Luminaries of France's intellectual galaxy have paraded through dreary suburban courtroom this week to testify on behalf of subway worker in a trial that is Stirring France.

title: the traveler's world
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.The American Association for Automotive Medicine has been alive and working for 16 years but it makes few ripples evident to the general public and there probably is not a handful in our congregation this morning that has ever heard of the organization. Yet many of the safety improvements in design and construction of today's automobiles can be traced to the thinking and subtle pressures of the A.A.A.M. The association was founded by six physicians who were racing fans and had become active in treating drivers injured at major automobile race tracks. It was logical for them to prescribe improvements to prevent injuries they were then treating, simple improvements like rollover bars to keep drivers heads from being crushed during turn overs, fairly common in race crashes. The racer's rollover bar has been translated in today's passenger cars into roof supports and roof crosspieces strong enough to keep passengers heads from crushed in rollovers.

title: Movies
description: WE always thought Jane Fonda was a real live doll. Director Joseph Losey apparently agrees with us, since he has selected her to play Nora in A Doll's House. David Mercer's adaptation of the Ibsen play will go before the cameras for John Heyman's World Film Services next week in Roros, Norway.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: Two years ago, in Commentary, Midge Decter castigated the liberated woman as a jaded, promiscuous bitch. Now, in her book The New Chastity, she castigates the liberated woman as a timid, neurotic nun. Surely the disparityto be validmust point to a massconversion experience unparalled in intensity since the days of St. Augustine.

title: Peter Busch Orthwein To Wed Susan Haas
description: WESTON, Conn., Nov. 11 Miss Susan Marston Haas and Peter Busch Orthwein, a greatgrandson of the late Adolphus Busch, founder of AnheuserBusch, the brewing company, will be married Dec. 30 in Westport.

title: Safety on the Job
description: The appalling cost of industrial accidents in lives, maimed bodies and lost'wagesa toll even greater than that from auto crashesprompted the nation to put into effect last year a landmark Occupational Health and Safety Act. That tough Federal law came about because Congress at last recognized the shameful inadequacy state standards for protecting workers, an inadequacy primarily attributable to the power of employer lobbies.

title: New MaineNova Scotia Ferry
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 11  Ferry service between Portland and Yarmouth, Nova Scotia, will be doubled here starting next summer.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: It is no secret that the unused sensitivity of many of the world's wild creatures to the degradation of their habitat provides an ecological early warning system for man. Rachel Carson's shattering Silent Spring, for example, revealed that certain persistent pesticides had interfered with the reproductive potential of some birds, and the same was later proved true of Maine's landlocked Sebago salmon and the coho salmon of Lake Michigan.

title: Nassau North
description: A crowd of more than 8,000 braved the rain yesterday to watch Farmingdale defeat Syosset, 368, in a muchher aided meeting of undefeated giants that decided the Nassau County North Shore Division championship.

title: And Now the End of the Trek
description: He would be chairman of the board of General Motors if he'd gone into legitimate business, a Federal, agent once said with grudging admiration. But, for Meyer Socks Lansky, the numbers came up scrambled.

title: JAPANESE WRITES ON WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 11No matter whether Peter A. Peyser or Richard L. Ottinger finally wins the stillcontested race in the 23d Congressional District, the election will have accomplished at least one thing: the, political education of Yoshikazu Ikeda.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 11 (UPI) Orland. Kurtenbach's goal at 14:22 of the third period snapped a tie game and gave the Vancouver Canucks a 43 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight.

title: News Is Taped for Disabled
description: TEANECK  Local residents who are blind or disabled will no longer be cut off from local affairs, thanks to a weekly News on Tape being circulated by the Teaneck Public Library.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: What does your income buy for you? Probably much more than popular chart and headline comparisons make you aware of.

title: Flight One
description: Flight One confirms my view that the Wright Brothers made a terrible mistake, second only to that of Karl Benz, the father of the motor car. Mr. Carpentier projects the history of the airplane up to the maiden flight of the first American S.S.T. If we can believe the author, this may be sooner than we think. It is a threat that could do much for the railroads.

title: Jean McIntosh, L. L. Jones Jr. Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Miss Jean Gordon McIntosh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Dempster McIntosh of Darien, Conn., was married here this afternoon to Lyman L. Jones Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Jones of Hammond, La.

title: New Queens Art Museum Offers First Exhibit
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is now in Queensor at least part of it is.

title: Pisa Tower Is Flaking; Its Rate of Lean Grows
description: PISA, Italy, Nov. 11 (Agence France Presse)Marble fragments have fallen off a column on the third floor of the Leaning Tower of Pisa and there is a crack in the door frame on the fourth floor, causing new fears for the ancient structure's stability.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I was a chaperone to the Hackensack (N. J.) High School a capella choir that recently toured Rumania on a Friendship Through Music Tour and the article by Seth S. Goldschlager, There Was a Real Count Dracula and He Was Not a Good Old Boy (Travel section, Aug. 27) and subsequent discussions in the letters to the editor columns, really hit home. I would like to offer some advice to anyone who plans to visit that part of Europe: By all means pursue your curiosity about Dracula. but don't miss the trip of a lifetime by skipping the rest of Rumania. Not only did weall 85 of ussing our way through Transylvania, Dracula's old stamping ground, but also Bucharest, the Paris of the East, and Constanta, the home of thy banished Ovid and Neptune, a wonderful new tourist city which is sometimes called the Riviera of the Black Sea. And we did all of this at a top price of $5 per day for three in modern comfortable accommodations. Add about $3 per day per person for food and you are touring cheaply.

title: When the stage director takes on the opera; Says Frank Corsaro: My productions are supposed to be so sensational and sexual, but what in God's name is the theater all about? Theater is vulgar in the best sense
description: The case against the stagedirectorasdictator in opera was succinctly stated years ago by Ernest Newman, the late Cicero of British critics. Newman contended that acting in the usual stage sense was inimical to the physical act of singing and that operagoers should be trained to accept that as one of the conventions of a strange art: When an opera character raises one arm we are to understand that something or other has moved him deeply; when he raises both arms, that means that his soul has been shaken to its foundations. Only a mutated breed of singers, having grown an extra pair of arms, could be expected to suggest more subtle ideas visually, the critic insisted.

title: Fales Yachting Trophy Goes to Raben's Craft
description: The Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound made its annual awards and elected officers at its yearly meeting last week. La Forza del Destino, owned by Norman Raben of Loudenville, N. Y., and the Sheldrake Yacht Club, was the big winner, picking up the DeCoursey Fales Trophy. The 60foot aluminum yacht, designed by Gary Mull, was tops among yachts over 30 feet in length in a distancerace series that included two overnight and two day events. William J. Walker's Wildcat was second overall, followed by H. Irving Pratt's Zest and Anthony Widmann's Freebooter III.

title: 15 Die in Turkish Crash
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Nov. 11(Agence FrancePresse)  Fifteen people were killed today when a truck carrying cotton workers burst a tire and overturned 75 miles east of Smyrna. Several other passengers were injured.

title: City Agencies Reduce Capital Budget Requests
description: The City Planning Commission reported yesterday that city agencies, while still asking, for much more money than was available, had showed signs of restraint in capital budget requests.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: I read with great interest Nathaniel Samuels thoughtful article (Finding Formulas for Monetary Change, Oct. 1) on the difficult problems underlying the devising of a workable monetary system in an unstable world, but I am afraid that it is not possible to cull from his suggestions a realistic basis for optimism.

title: The Postman Rang, And Rang and Rang
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 11 (UPI)Mrs. Ruth Lowe of suburban Westerville gets a little nervous each time the postman stops at her house.

title: Social Announcements
description: Cella and Hyman Berkowilz of Far Rockaway, N.Y. have brought Joy to their family upon celebrating their Sixtieth Wedding Anniversary. We, their children, Helen and David Aaronson, Edna an Walter Sendach, Gloria and Herold Berkowitz and their adoring grandchildren shower them with love and devotion.

title: State Senate Gets an Antiwar Feminist From L.I.
description: WOODMERE, L.I.  The new State Senator from the Ninth District, covering parts of Nassau and Queens Counties, is an attractively packaged bundle of energy.

title: Views of Review
description: To THE EDITOR: The article on the Transit Authority police by Robert Lindsey in The Week in Review, Oct. 29, contained several illuminating statements. Some of the points, however, require clarification.

title: The American Campaigns Of Rochambeau's Army
description: The help from Francesupplies, money, ships and menenabled us to win our war for independence, and this is an excellent time, as we are preparing to congratulate ourselves for the 200th time, on our forefathers valor, to remember that valor alone would not have caught Cornwallis at Yorktown. Howard C. Rice Jr. and Anne S. K. Brown, editors, translators and compilers (with heroic support by Princeton University Press and Brown University Press) have produced a dazzling documentary reminder of the American Revolution. These two splendid volumes illuminate General Rochambeau's march from Newport, R. I. to Yorktown, Va., in 1781; French participation in the siege of the British position; and the French campaign in the Caribbean in 1783, after the fighting in

title: Westchester
description: Rye upset previously undefeated Harrison, 1814, to win the Central Western League championship in the rain yesterday on Feeley Field in Harrison. Mark Bockeloh threw for all three touchdowns as Rye rallied after trailing by 60 in the first half and 146 in the final period.

title: New Hampshire Victor
description: DURHAM, N. H., Nov. 11 (AP)  Ed Whalen sparked the University of New Hampshire to a 26.12 victory over Springfield today.

title: Big Fun Boom
description: McAFEE, N. J.  Doug Laird, owner of the Appalachian Motel in nearby Vernon Township, pushed aside his coffee cup and laughed.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: One of the recent significant changes in advertising is the increased involvement of advertisers in activities previously handled by their advertising agencies. Some major advertisers have even assumed various ad functions themselves.

title: Stamps
description: NEW YORK'S major annual philatelic emporium will be functioning this weekend with the advent of the 24th National Postage Stamp Show, which opens Friday morning at Madison Square Garden. The opening day program will include firstday sales for new United States and United Nations stamps, a U.N. souvenir card, and a U.S. Bureau of Engraving and Printing., card honoring the show and its sponsor, the American Stamp Dealers Association. Postal officials of the United States, the United Nations and other participating nations will share in the firstday program, which beginS at 10 o'clock.

title: The World
description: OTTAWAI never want to see Canada again! The speaker, Bhajan Singh Gill, a tall, turbaned student from the Punjab in northern India, was sitting dejectedly last weekend in a glasswalled, locked room at Toronto International airport. Along with 26 other Indians, he had just arrived, ostensibly to visit friends and relatives, but he and the others found themselves abruptly refused admission and detained until they could be put on the next flight to New York, the first leg of the long journey home.

title: CITY SEES PINCH IN U.S. HEALTH AID
description: The city has, estimated that a pending Nixon Administration plan would cut off Federal aid for 496,000 visits to neighborhood health centers here each year63 per cent of the 790,000 such visits to nine centers largely serving the poor.

title: Shriver: Bailing with a Dixie Cup
description: Among the more than 500 speeches in Sargent Shriver's evanescent campaign the one that said it all was delivered to Mayor Richard J. Daley's precinct workers in their Sherman House den next to City Hall, Oct. 24.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTONAmong other gular works of the people in week's election was the strong in California, the most populous for Proposition Seventeen, the tion of the death penalty. This raises numerous questions, in addition to the old, familiar argument as to whether capital punishment itself is inffective and immoral.

title: At the Nation's Edges: Instant Gratification in South Carolina...
description: TRAVELING the 60 miles of South Carolina coast from Little River southward to Georgetown is like rummaging through the contents of an addled dowager's mind. Strung together along U.S. 17, almost parallel to the Intracoastal Waterway, are ancient oaks and endless motels, plantations and condominiums, golf courses where 476,954 paid rounds were played last year and vast, silent marshes which once produced 60 per cent of the nation's rice.

title: The Elections
description: WASHINGTONIt ended, in a sense, the day the Democrats nominated Senator George McGovern in Miami Beach; he had already been fatally damaged by the attacks of his Democratic competitors in California, and the Eagleton affair and every thing else just sealed it. As the bulk of the electorate saw him, he was not competent enough, credible enough, Presidential enough to do the job.

title: Silent Majority Captures $154,734 Messenger Pace
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 11Most of the 19,576 harness racing buffs at Roosevelt Raceway figured tonight's 17th edition of the Messenger Stakes logically and correctly.

title: It was never a game for Jackie
description: The score is crucial to any game, and announcing the score is a fundamental routine for sportscaster So before I attempt a review of this autobiography by Jackie Robinson, let me give my score.

title: IOWA STATE HOLDS HUSKERS TO 2323
description: AMES, Iowa, Nov. 11Iowa State just missed an upset today as it scored on a 24yard touchdown pass with 23 seconds left, butmissed on the conversion kick, and had to settle for a 2323 tie with No 2ranked Nebraska.

title: N. CAROLINA TOPS VIRGINIA, 23 TO 3
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Nov. 11 North Carolina clinched the Atlantic Coast Conference championship today as Nick Vidnovic passed for two touchdowns and ran for one in a 233 victory over Virginia.

title: Medicine
description: Chance, said Louis Pasteur, favors the prepared mind, and few scientists had more accidents or were more ready for them than the acerbic little Scot, Alexander Fleming. He discovered penicillin that way. And, in a serendipitous discovery that may yet have even greater consequence, he came upon a substance he called lysozyme.

title: Who really writes those cerealbox lids?; The Big, Fertile, Rumbling, CastIron, Growling, Aching, Unbuttoned Bellybook; By James Trager. Illustrated. 608 pp. New York: Grossman. $12.50 to Dec. 31. $15 thereafter.
description: James Trager's first book had a silly title too: The Enriched Fortified, Concentrated, CountryFresh LipSmacking Fingerlicking International, Unexpurgated Foodbook. It was about what we put into our bellies. The tome at hand is about bellies themselves. It may not tell you everything you always wanted to know about nutrition, digestion and nutritional disease, but it does cram together an immense amount of information never so well organized in one place before.

title: Jack Kaufmann Plans to Marry Dr. Elizabeth Phillips Jan. 27
description: TACOMA, Wash., Nov. 11Dr. Elizabeth Amanda Phillips, a hematology fellow at Montefiore Hospital in the Bronx, New York, plans to be married here on Jan. 27 to Jack Kaufmann, a lawyer with the New York firm of Dewey, Ballantine, Bushby, Palmer & Wood. The ceremony will take place in the Raynor Chapel at the Annie Wright Seminary, of which the future bride is an alumna.

title: Miss Schulman to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Sidney B. Schulman of Bayside, Queens, have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Stacy Schulman, to David Michael Klein. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard I. Klein of North Bellmore, L. I.

title: Pop
description: THE KINKS:

title: 30 Toys Banned by F.D.A. In SafeChristmas Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI) The Food and Drug Adminis tration says it banned 30 toys during September on grounds they were hazardous to children because they had, sharp points and edges and dangerous removable parts.

title: Brighton by the Sea: A Princely Rx for Success
description: BRIGHTON, England  Any resort that sets out in life with the patronage of the Prince of Wales and certification of a healthy birth from a fashionable physician can hardly fail. Brighton was a success almost two centuries ago, and still is.

title: Environment Vote a Factor In 50 Congress Contests
description: A growing environmental vote across the nation made itself felt in Tuesday's elections.

title: Recordings
description: AS far as New Yorkers are concerned, Offenbach's Les Contes d'Hoffmann is very much in the news because of the New York City Opera's new production of the work, with Beverly Sills and Norman Treigle each playing many roles. With wellplanned timing, ABC Records has brought out a recording of the work, with the soprano and bassbaritone (three disks, ABC/ ATS 20014/3).

title: The bedroom as battlefield
description: The title is ingenious and perversely amusing. Given the Sexual Revolution and the current vogue for militaristic metaphors, it telegraphs that this is a book for right now. It's about sex and war the AllAmerican pastimesmother and flag transmogrified for our 20thcentury obsessions. But Combat in the Erogenous Zone cannot be dismissed as faddish or libbish. It must be read and it must be taken seriously if human sexuality is even going to live up to its notices.

title: Youth Registration Is High in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L.I.  According to the Board of Elections here, Nassau County can lay claim, at least unofficially, to having the largest percentage of registered voters between the ages of 18 and 21 years old of any county in the country.

title: Music: Nielsen's Fourth
description: For a while, the makings of a Nielsen revival were ire the air, especially when Leonard Bernstein showed an interested in the Danish composers symphonies.
