But it never took hold, and performances of the Carl Nielsen symphonies are, still rather rare. The Carnegie Hall program of the Detroit Symphony on Friday night thus had special interest, for Sixten Ehrling put Nielsen's Fourth Symphonythe Inextinguishableon his program.

title: New &
description: It was only last month that James McClure's The Steam Pig, a thriller with a South African locale, was published. Now comes Peter Driscoll's THE WILBY CONSPIRACY (Lippincott, $6.95), also set in South Africa, also a thriller and also a frightening picture of a bigoted police state.

title: Both Sides Are Wooing Pensioned Members for Mine
description: FAIRMONT, W. Va., Nov. 10 Retired miners are being ardently wooed by both sides in the battle for control of the United Mine Workers of America.

title: Doctors call it an overloaded
description: I got my first case this way: My son was about 7 and playing football on the field next to the public courts in Great Neck. He noticed me in my whites playing tennis. Watch my daddy serve! he cried to a young fullback next to him. I realized I was in one as they say in showbiz, with the honor and traditions of tennis on my back.

title: Connecticut
description: Greenwich squeaked by Staples of Westport yesterday, 76, to annex the Fairfield County West division crown. The last division championship for the Cardinals came in 1962.

title: Local
description: Tim Casey and Chuck Grevious, Curtis halfback, led the Warriors to a 28.6 victory yesterday at the winner's field,

title: Controversial Chief Is Wearing Two Hats
description: EAST WINDSORA controversial police chief has taken over temporarily the top administrative position in this community of 18,000 persons in southeastern Mercer County.

title: Packs of Stray Dogs Part of the Brooklyn Scene
description: In the early morning hours before and after sunrise they are most easily seen, cruising the streets of Flatbush or Canarsie or any other Brooklyn neighborhood. They move along in packs of six to eight, cadging scraps of food from garbage cans; dodging cars as traffic begins to build up in the wakening streets, then crawling into abandoned factories or garages for shelter.

title: Smithwick Seeks a Triple in Rich Chase
description: CAMDEN, S.C., Nov. 11Steeplechase racing will have no Triple Crown, winner this year, but when the final race of that series, the $100,000 Colonial Cup International, is run here next Saturday D. Michael Smithwick, trainer, may well deserve his own personal triple crown.

title: Judge Wins Personal Victory
description: LONG BEACH, L.I.Long Beach voters, with a 10to1 margin of Democratic registrations, picked their way painstakingly along the levers on Election Day and raised their hands in the final column to take one from Row ACity Judge Jack Mackston, a Republican.

title: Fort Valley Tops Fisk
description: FORT VALLEY, Ga., Nov. 11 (AP)Samuel Coverson scored two touchdowns to lead Fort Valley State to a 13.7 victory over Fisk today in a regionally televised game.

title: St. Moritz Lives So High It Could Buy Natural Snow
description: ST. MORITZ is in the Engadine Valley of Switzerland, 6,000 feet up and open to the weather, but nicely protected by the indigenous philosophy: What might elsewhere be considered sloth, lust, pride and, covetousness enough for a whole nation has instead made the little village the summit of chic.

title: Biracial Politics
description: Politics in America has always been problematic for blacks. How should one be guided: principle or pragmatism self or group, race or class? What is reasonable to expect from political action? Which techniques and strategies will yield the most of any political expectation? Any serious book about AfroAmerican political thought and behavior should bring some sharpness and clarity out of this confusion. Now that the dust has settled from the revolution of the 1960's it is time to learn what new direction black politics is taking.

title: All the postelection acclaim went to the winnerandstillchampion. But there had been others in the ring. Last week, correspondents who had traveled with the three were asked for vignettes of the experience. Their responses follow.
description: His shoes were off. So was his suit coat, and the shirt collar was undone. George McGovern sat, legs dangling, on top of a credenza built into the office portion of his chartered campaign plane. His right arm hung loose, and the silver bracelet commemorating a prisoner of war captured five years earlier, almost to the day, showed below his shirt cuff.

title: Tough and Exciting Season Forecast for College Basketball Teams in City Area
description: Some persons may consider the basketball schedules of Fordham, Hofstra, Manhattan,. Fairfield, Seton Hall, Long Island University and St. Peter's suicide. But many coaches have another word for it"exciting.

title: All But Super Fly Fall Down
description: WATCHING Martin Ritt's Sounder at the Embassy Theater on Times Square the other afternoon turned out to be a much more lively experience than I might have imagined poSsible of a film of such wellordered tepidity. The packed audience was 99 per cent black mostly parents and (I assume) teachers with young children who arrived in wellbehaved blocks and, thereafter moved around the aisles singly or. in pairs. The children talked a good deal, sometimes about what was happening on the screen and a lot of the time about whether or not it was all right to go to the bathroom or to buy popcorn, The audience, I suspect, was responding as much to the complicated, festive business of going out as it was to the contents of the movie itself, which is distant enough in place and time (a black Louisiana sharecropper's farm in the 1930's) to be much less disturbing than downright soothing. Some of the adults might have been bored, but I doubt that many would have admitted it. After all, Sounder has been endorsed by everybody with the exception of God, but God doesn't have an outlet.

title: Three Die in Upstate Crash
description: ALBANY, NOV. 11 (AP)An automobile struck a utility pole on Route 155, near the Albany County Airport, in suburban Colonie and burst into flames early today, kiling two teenaged sisters and a 21yearold man, the police said. The victims were identified as Sharon Conners, 18, and Kathleen Conners, 17, of Colonie, and John Ficcone of Schenectady.

title: Sicily's Dangerous Toy
description: PALERMO, Sicily, Nov. 11 (AP)  Twentysix children in Palermo have been admitted to hospitals for treatment of eye injuries caused by toy guns given as gifts on All Souls Day, Nov. 2. Dr. Giuseppe Colombo, head of the eye department at. Civic Hospital, appealed to the authorities to ban tilt. sale of the guns, which fire rubber or plastic bullets.

title: Luis C. Dominguez Rollins 61 Plans to Wed Virginia Regan
description: Mr. and Mrs, John Nicholas Regan of New York, East,,, Hampton, L. I., and Dublin, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Virginia Regan, to Luis C. Dominguez, son of Mrs. C. Matthews Dick of Newport, R. I., and the late Vincent L. Dominguez of London.

title: HIJACKED PLANE LANDS IN HAVANA A SECOND TIME, 31 HOSTAGES FREE; 3 GUNMEN SEIZED AFTER 29 HOURS
description: A hijacked jet airliner, its tires shot out and its oil supply running low, landed safely in Havana early today about 29 hours after it had been commandeered by three fugitives armed with rifles and grenades.

title: C. W. Post. Led by Powers, Trounces Gettysburg, 55.14
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa.. Nov. 11 C. W. Post, behind a sophomore quarterback, Ed Powers, and a strong defense, overI powered Gettysburg, 5514, today. The victory was the fourth in a row for Post and gave the Pioneers a 53 wonlost record. Gettysburg is now 2.6.

title: Bulls Top Bullets, 111106
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 11.(AP)Norm Van Lier scored'28 points and protected the lead in the final three minutes with fancy ball handling as the Chicago Mills held off the Baltimore Bullets, 111106, tonight.

title: RINGWORM CASES TRACED TO PETS
description: California health officials have traced three recent outbreaks of ringworm to Contact with pet dogs and cats. Ringworm is a curable fungal infection that is common among children and adults throughout the world.

title: Brazil Prelate Spurs Group Discussions on Urban Ills
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Nov. 4The head of one of the largest Roman Catholic dioceses in the world is promoting informal basic committees to discuss bigcity ills.

title: Used Craft Raise Query. In Florida
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Nov. 11A boat show that assembled more fancy tonnage than probably any other ever held entered the weekend today with an unanswered question: Could an event devoted entirely to used yachts of the gold plater variety, all expensive and all offered by brokers working on a cooperative basis, be successful?

title: Ustashi Member Sentenced
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 11 (UPI)A court has sentenced a 28yearold Yugoslav to three years in prison for antiGovernment activities and connections with extremist groups abroad, judicial officials said today. Mato Tadic was member of an Ustashi exile group during a stay in West Germany as a worker from 1969 to 1972.

title: Homosexual Teacher Fights Shift of Assignment
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 11A homosexual has filed a suit in Federal District Court here accusing a Maryland school board of unconstitutionally keeping him from his classroom.

title: Television
description: ESSENE is one of the best religious films ever made. This, despite the fact that it lacks a temple rape, chariot race, trace of brimstone, or even a soundtrack of God shouting through echo chambers. It is also talky, intellectual, and has no stars.

title: A Computerized System Registers State's Dialysis Patients
description: EAST ORANGE The nation's first statewide computerized Central Registry of Dialysis Patients to improve the care of those suffering from chronic kidney disease has been established by the New Jersey Regional Medical Program.

title: Togetherness Is the. Story of Nutley
description: NUTLEY  One of the things that brings a big smile to the face of almost any local resident is a reference to safety in the streets. Nutley, recently named in a national survey as one of the 10 safest communities in the country, is a place where people do things together

title: Frederica Schlaff Wed To G. A. Rentschler Jr.
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., Nov. 11Miss Frederica Price Schlaff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nelson W. Schlaff, was married here this afternoon to George A. Rentschler Jr. of New York. The Rev. Paul Desch performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Convent of the Sacred Heart on what would have been the 36th wedding anniversary of the bridegroom's parents, Mrs. Rentschler of New York and the late Mr. Rentschler, who died in May.

title: Agnew: A Toot on the Whistle
description: The gymnasium of the College of Southern Idaho was jammed one night late last month with 3,000 of the townspeople of Twin Falls, a little community not far from the Nevada border. Most of them had gathered there, shoulder to shoulder on the bleachers, to hear and cheer the Vice President of the United Statesmost of them, but not all.

title: ROMAN COINS SOLD BY METROPOLITAN
description: A Roman gold coin from the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art was auctioned Friday in Zurich, Switzerland, for $55,000, a record for an ancient gold piece at a public sale.

title: A Political Tyro Finds How Each Vote Counts
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 11H. B. McKinney,. a newcomer to local politics has learned firsthand that every vote does count.

title: Seized Suspect Held in 3 Other Cases
description: A suspected bank robber was held in $100,000 bail yesterday after it was revealed that he was wanted in connection with the fatal shooting of two policemen in the East Village last January, the machine. gun wounding of two patrolmen near the home of District Attorney Frank S. Hogan in May, 1971, and an assault on another policeman recently in the Bronx.

title: Man Leaps From Window With Child
description: As his estranged wife and patrolman stood in the doorway of his Bronx apartment last night, a 19yearold man jumped out a rear window and plunged three floors with his yearold son in his arms.

title: Crusaders Down Cougars
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 11 (AP)Gerry Pinder scored three goals to pace the Cleveland Crusaders to a 4.1 victory over the Chicago Cougars tonight.

title: Boys Town Plans to Build Youth Development Center
description: BOYS TOWN, Neb. Nov. 11 (UPI)  The Boys Town board of directors has given preliminary approval to a $40million program for the study of youth development.

title: Local
description: Chris Legree bettered the 100yard mark in the air and Freddie Ginsberg passed that total on the ground to power South Shore to a 1410 Brooklyn Division II P.S.A.L. game victory over John Jay.

title: Photography
description: ASERIES of four lectures titled Photography: Points of View, is being presented by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Museum of Modern Art and its Junior Council, in the Metropolitan Museum's Grace Rainery Rogers Auditorium. The first in the series, Toward a Photographic Tradition, by John Szarkowski, was held last Wednesday evening. The next, this Wednesday at 8 P.M., will be on Photography as Art, by Clement Greenberg; followed by Living in a Snapshot World, by John A. Kouwenhoven, on Nov. 22; and Fifty Years in Photography: A Personal View, by Ansel Adams,

title: The Elections
description: WASHINGTONFollowing President Nixon's triumphant reelection last. Tuesday, the political weathervanes continued to spin wildly. Forecasts about the future of the Democratic party often seemed confusing and contradictory. Senator George McGovern had absorbed a devastating defeat. Yet Democratic candidates on the state level had run very well, picking up a net gain of two Senate seats and one governorship, while losing only 13 House seats.

title: Crew's Racial Grievances To Get Hearing by Navy
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 11 The Navy announced today that individual hearings to deal with the racial grievances of 129 crewmen from the aircraft carrier Coristellation would begin next week at three shore stations to which most of the dissident sailors have been reassigned.

title: French Prize to 2 Americans
description: PARIS, Nov. 11 (Reuters)The French Academy of Science has awarded its biology prize, the Prix CharlesLeopold Mayer, to two embryologists, Robert W. Briggs of Indiana University at Bloomington, Ind., and Thomas J. King of Georgetown University in Washington, for their research on cell transplants.

title: 2 SLAYING SUSPECTS EXTRADITED IN WEST
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. Nov. 11 (UPI)Two members of a nomadic family suspected of a crime spree in which 22 persons may have been murdered were extradited to Texas and Colorado today.

title: Mrs. Court Wins Final
description: TORQUAY, England, Nov. 11 (Reuters)Mrs. Margaret Court of Australia shrugged aside a head cold and beat Virginia Wade of Britain, 26, 63, 61, in the final of the fourth Dewar Cub tennis tournament today.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Sports of The Times;

title: Notre Dame Stops Air Force's Passing And Triumphs,217
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Nov. 11 (AP)Mike Townsend of Notre Dame stopped three drives with interceptions today and his brother, Willie, caught the deciding touchdown pass as the Irish beat the Air Force Academy, 217.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: While many of us wallow in the euphoric ambience of an imminent peace settlement, and while Nixon is awash with pious triumph, it may be a sobering thought to reflect on the fact that, in substance, a HanoiU.S. settlement was available to Nixon four years and 25,000 American lives ago. To all but the families of these dead, the point may seem belabored. But to them, and to those of us who abhor the malignancy of Nixon's ambition, the point bears repetition and remembering.

title: DAY AN TROT VICTOR; SUPER BOWL IS LAST
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 11 (AP)  Dayan captured the $100,000 American Trotting Classic at Hollywood Park last night as Super Bowl, in his final race, finished last after 18 straight victories.

title: Sri Lanka Ration Shifted
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Nov. 11Dr. N. M. Perera, the Finance Minister, said yesterday that the free ration of two pounds a week of rice or other food would be withdrawn, under the new budget, from those who pay income taxes. Income taxes in Sri Lanka, formerly Ceylon, are levied on those who make $85 a month. The move, Dr. Perera said, would shift the burdens that fall on the poorer sections of the community to income taxpayers and those more affluent.

title: What the Law Says
description: Some 200,000 Federal employes depart from Government service each year, but they provoke fewer than two dozen allegations of conflict of interest, according Stephen M. Weglian, an attorney for the United States Department of Justice.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Opponents of a blacksponsored housing complex being built in the 70 per cent white North Ward of Newark are meet today to decide whether to continue the picketing that has delayed work on the project for two days.

title: RISE ASKED IN FEES FOR INSPECTIONS
description: The city's Board of Health has proposed 49 increases in fees for operating businesses undergoing inspections or taking qualifying tests under its control.

title: Lafayette Routs Erasmus; Goldstein, Caserta Star
19 Hurt in Morocco Blast
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)Nineteen people were injured today, six seriously, when a mortar shell a workman was using to break up rocks exploded in his hands.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Some day we may awake from the illusion of a safe deterrent, facing the possible unleashing of the remotecontrol slaughter with which governments of East and West have equipped themselves. Should thus the peace be questioned, how may we hope for mercy for our childhen while we now are considering killing Vietnamese children for another four years.

title: Jill N. Lang Engaged to Charles Jacobs
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 11  Miss Jill Nancy Lang and Charles Phillip Jacobs, graduates of the University of Pennsylvania, class of 72, plan to be married in June. Their engagement has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. Mark L. Lang, parents of the bridetobe, whose fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Phillip R. Jacobs of Buffalo.

title: Villanova Routs Xavier
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Nov. 11 (AP)Paul Selitto returned an interception 57 yards for a touchdown and the defensive backfield set up two other scores today as Villanova romped over Xavier, 4013. The Wildcats snapped a sixgame losing streak.

title: POLICEMAN QUIETS RENTAL DISPUTES
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 11The Oakland police have stopped telling tenants who complain of being locked out of their dwellings by their landlords that they will not become involved because it is a civil matter.

title: MT. SINAI OBTAINS $22MILLION GIFT
description: Mount Sinai Hospital announced yesterday that it had received $22million in gifts from the Murry and Leonie Guggenheim Foundation. It was the largest contribution in the hospital's 120year history.

title: TAG FOR OIL CARGO COULD TRACE SPILLS
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y. Nov. 11 (UPI)A new method of detecting polluters of the world's waterways has been developed by scientists at the General Electric Research and Development Center.

title: Big Shrimp Meal Ticket TO Biologist
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. Nov, 11American dinner menus may soon include a two foot long fresh water shrimp that until now has led a sheltered and unpublicized life in the weeds of Florida canals and rivers.

title: Education
description: All states except Hawaii raise school funds primarily through real estate taxes levied separately by each local school district. These taxes account for 52 per cent of the school money; the rest is divided 41 per cent from state sources and 7 per cent from the Federal Government. (Hawaii has only one district and its schools are entirely staterun and statesupported.)

title: $590,000 Grant by Kellogg
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 11 (AP) The University of Massachusetts has announced the award of a $590,000 grant from 1 the W. K. Kellogg Foundation.

title: DRUGDEATH DATA RELEASED BY CITY
description: New York City, which uses methadone as a major means of combating narcotics abuse, issued a revised version of its regular narcoticsdeath report yesterday with the new data showing a drop in deaths directly due to addiction and disputing the theory that methadonerelated deaths were a major component.

title: Old Clifton Jail Echoing a Downbeat
description: CLIFTON  Things are swinging at the old Clifton City Jail these nights. The onetime jail  it is at 1104 Main Avenue  was transformed last month into a turnofthecentury bar called Kid McCoy's; its predecessor had been a routine neighborhood bar, Murray's Green Room.

title: UGANDA REFUGEE GOES TO SCRANTON
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Nov. 11A total of 197 Asians from Uganda have found refuge in the United States this month, including Praful Bharkhada, 21 years old, now living with Scranton family that makes a habit of taking in displaced persons.

title: Olivia Dezzie LeCroy Bride Of David Andrew Whitfield 3d
description: Miss Olivia Dezzie LeCroy and David Andrew Whitfield 3d were married here yesterday afternoon in St. Thomas Episcopal Church by Canon Henry A. Zinser, formerly dean of the Episcopal Cathedral of St. Philip in Atlanta.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: As a machinetool man, have watched the apparent American slide toward the metric system with great interest and some dismay. This not to argue the respective merits of the new systemour inch and their meter.

title: SMITH OVERCOMES RIESSEN IN 3 SETS
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 11 (AP) Stan Smith, of Pasadena, Calif., and Tom Okker of the Netherlands advanced to the final of the $63,500 Stockholm open tennis tournament today.

title: Wagner's FirstHalf Surge Downs Susquehanna, 240
description: Wagner College scored 24 points in the first half and coasted to a 24.0 Middle Atlantic Conference victory yesterday over Susquehanna University at Fischer Memorial Field.

title: Cambodian Town Reoccupied
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 11 (Reuters)Cambodian forces reoccupied the battered town of Oudong today without fight as the battle shifted to outlying countryside, the military command reported. The town, 20 miles northwest of Pnompenh on the road to the country's main ricegrowing region, was partly occupied during an enemy attack earlier today.

title: MAN HELD IN SLAYING OF INFANT DAUGHTER
description: An argument between a 31yearold Brooklyn autobody repairman and his wife early yesterday resulted, the police said, in the fatal shooting of the couple's 11monthold baby daughter,

title: Nixon Relaxes in Florida
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 11 (AP)President Nixon worked and relaxed in sunny weather today while aides kept him posted on Vietnam peace efforts.

title: Yemen Talks to Go On
description: CAIRO, Nov. 11 (Agence FrancePresse) The Southern Yemen and.Yemen will meet here as planned on Nov. 25, Yemeni sources said here tonight. The sources, denied report from Beirut, Lebanon, that the meeting had been postponed.

title: Alexandra L. Tolstoy
description: Over a century has elapsed since War and Peace, was written by my father; Leo: Tolstoy. The novel is as new and interesting to many people now as it) was before. Why?

title: World News Briefs
description: TAIPEI. Taiwan, Nov. 11 A group of about 80 nonKuomintang candidates for office resolved at a meeting here today to ignore Government regulations restricting campaign activity next month.

title: Show, Talks, Sale
description: THANKSGIVING will be the theme of the flower show to be held at the Horticultural Society of New York, Inc. on Wednesday. Harvest arrangements, prizesize fruits and vegetables will be on exhibit. Hours are from noon to 4 P.M. Admission $1 at the society's headquarters, 128 West 58th Street, New York.

title: Crosse County Parkway Is Undergoing a 20Year, $120Million Reconstruction
description: YONKERS, Nov. 11  The Cross County Parkway, an important but notoriously antiquated eastwest highway in southern Westchester County, is undergoing a total reconstruction that may eventually take 20 years and more than $120million to complete.

title: Australia Reports Cholera
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Nov. 11 (UPI)Health authorities reported 33 confirmed cases of cholera and 21 suspected cases today throughout Australia. All but one case involved persons who arrived in Sydney Nov. 4 from London. One death from the disease was reported. Authorities said the passengers were aboard a jetliner that stopped over in the Persian Gulf state of Bahrein, where food and water suspected of being contaminated were taken aboard.

title: Photography
description: STONE faces, shells and scruffy celebrities are the subjects of three current photography exhitlons in various outlying parts of Manhattan Island.

title: Arthur McBride is Dead at 85; Founder of Cleveland Browns
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 11 (AP)Arthur (Mickey) McBride, who founded the Cleveland Browns professional football team in 1946, died last night in Cleveland Clinic following a heart attack. He was 85 years old.

title: Lebanese Reported Slain
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)  Two striking workers were killed today and 18 wounded when Lebanese police opened fire on a group of strikers in a suburb of Beirut. informed sources reported. The sources said that the police opened fire as they were dismantling barriers that had been set up three days ago when workers struck for higher wages at the Ghandour Confectionery Factory. Sources at the factory said that 'armed elements among the strikers had opened fire first on the police.

title: Celtics Surge to Front With SecondHalf Rally to Defeat Pistons, 121118
description: BOSTON, Nov. 11 (AP)The Boston Celtics rallied behind John Haylicek, Henry Finkel and Don Nelson in the second half tonight and won, 121118, from the Detroit Pistons in a National Basketball Association game. It was the Celtics 13th victory in 14 games.

title: Dunlap Rides Grand Nouvel to Scurry. Stakes Victory in Toronto Show
description: TORONTO, Nov. 11Grand Nouvel, ridden by Moffatt Dunlap of the Canadian Equestrain Team, was fast and accurate today and won the Scurry Stakes for international jumpers at the Royal Winter Fair horse show.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Picarooning bikeriding, modern youth, a Jersey jerk
description: Honest, this is really a book about riders of bicyclesnot about Hell's Angels or Easy Riders or even Ed Potter, but about an honesttoGod Bike Rider with a white Raleigh Grand Prix with 10speed gears, centerpull brakes alloy rims and a narrow leather saddle plus the following accessories: vinyl tool bag, toe clips and straps, air pump cable lock and red rear reflector. And it's also about Los Angeles... and environs. I like title that tells it true.

title: Adirondack Outsider Looks In
description: KEENE VALLEY, N. Y.The town is quiet tonight; the moon lies full upon the valley; on the far hillside a light gleams and is gone. The shiny aluminum campers are all back home now New Jersey, Connecticut, Quebec, and the maple leaves are thick and soft on the ground. The frost has blackened the plants in the garden and the river is too achingly cold to bathe in anymore, even out of sheer bravado.

title: Revolution Ahead For U.S. Savings
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  A $15billion windfall may be looming for the millions of Americans who. have money on deposit in the nation's savings and loan associations and savings banks.

title: PROTEST STAGED BY HOMOSEXUALS
description: Groups of homosexuals demonstrated opposite the entrance to Police Headquarters, at 240 Centre Street, for more than an hour yesterday to protest alleged. police abuses.

title: Richard A. Farland to Marry Miss Mary Frances Gray Dec. 21
description: WAVERLY, Va., Nov., 11Miss Mary Frances Gray and Richard Ashville Farland, son of Joseph Simpson Farland, United States Ambassador to Iran, and Mrs. Farland of Teheran and Morgantown, W. Va., plan to be married Dec. 21 at Bruton Parish Church in WilIhmsburg, Va.

title: Son to the Blechers
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Steven D. Blecher of Scarsdale, N. Y., on Monday in the White Plains Hospital. Mrs. Blecher is the former Miss Amy P. Glick of Leominster, Mass. The child, whose father is a systems analyst with Neuberger & Berman, New York brokerage firm, is named Andrew Mark.

title: After the selfexplanation, a crosscultural death
description: In 1958 I made a trip to Southeast Asia as a cultural export of our Government, which at the time had the idea that persons of my persuasion were significant. In Tokyo spent an unofficial evening with Yukio Mishima who came to my hotel with Tsutomu Shimamura of Chuo Koron, a leading intellectual review. We got on; the memory must affect what I write here. But that alone does not entitle me to brood on his life and works. His death, however, was a public act and the work a public offering; the world is invited, commanded to brood.

title: NORTH BOLSTERS ITS AIR DEFENSES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Nov. 12 (AP)North Vietnam has moved more heavyantiaircraft guns to its southern panhandle in the three weeks that its northern heartland has been off limits to United States air strikes, United States military sources said yesterday.

title: ISLANDERS LOSE, 30; PLAYERS IN BRAWL
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 11 (AP)Gilles Gilbert, the Minnesota goalie who was making his first start of the season, scored his first National Hockey League shutout tonight as the North Stars beat the New York Islanders, 3,0.

title: From Outdoor Nudes to Just Outdoors
description: ACOUPLE of years ago, I might have begun a review of Neil Welliver's new landscape and figure paintings  now on View at the John Bernard Myers GalIdry, 50 West 57th Street through Dec. 7  by pointing out their remoteness from the avantgardist mainstream of contemporary art. But times and sensibilities have been changing lately, and the onceentertainable fiction of a mainstream in American artmaking is an early casualty. The avantgarde itself has become a cauldron of conflicting stylistic currents and eddies, and the art of the movementdominated sixties comes, interestingly enough, to seem more rather than less various and problematical as it recedes in time.

title: Hanrahan Says That Daley Could Have Helped More
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 11 (UPI) Cook County State's Attorney Edward V. Hanrahan, defeated in his reelection bid largely by the defection of traditionally Democratic black voters, believes that Mayor Richard J. Daley could have given him more help.

title: The World
description: KAMPALAThree months ago it was impossible to imagine Uganda without Asians. They were as inevitably present as the banana trees in the lush green vegetation and the elephants in the game parks. Plump women bulging out of saris minded almost every duka (store) in the villages along the main roads. And here in the capital, Asians were everywhere, dominating the professions and controlling 75 per cent of the import trade and almost as much of the retail trade. The division between Africans and Asians was most apparent in their modes of transport. Africans walked, or rode bicycles or buses; almost all the cars were owned and used by Asians.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Nov. 11Williams came from behind with three touchdown's in the second half today and defeated Wesleyan, 3528, in a Little Three game.

title: New Fairleigh Dickinson Program Teaches Senior Citizens
Preps
description: NORTHFIELD, Mass., Nov. 11Lloyd LeBlanc, a senior running back, scored two touchdowns today as Worcester Academy defeated hapless Mount Hermon, 220. Worcesterimproved its record to 43. I ,Mount Hermon lost its fifth game in six decisions.

title: Reapportionment Gave Republicans Half of Their Net Gain of 13 Seats in the House and Cost the Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Reapportionment accounted for more than half of the net gain of 13 seats by the Republicans in the House of Representatives in Tuesday's elections.

title: ...And the ThreatLure of Attachment in Northern California
description: THE most memorable stretches of coastline have a kind of arrogance, a hint of danger lurking below excitement, in the wayit has been thought often enough of the most memorable women.

title: Mary Gordon Wed to R. A. Dubill
description: COLUMBUS. Ohio, Nov. 11 Miss Mary Veronica Gordon was married here this noon to Robert Andrew Dubill, bureau chief in Newark for The Associated Press. The Rev. Robert R. Schmidt performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass at the Immaculate Conception Roman Catholic Church.

title: Alabama Triumphs Over L.S.U., 3521
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 11 As the sign in Legion Field said today, it is the Year of the Elephant in Alabama.

title: Chinese and Algerians Sign A Trade Protocol for 1973
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)China and Algeria have signed a trade protocol for 1973 in Peking, according to Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency.

title: Movies
description: I GREW up in a small Louisiana town surrounded by plantations heavily populated with black sharecroppers, and the story told in Sounder of one such family's adversities during the 1930's is, at its best, fanciful. It bears no resemblance whatsoever to reality as I observed it, and sometimes lived it among black sharecroppers.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Apollo 17 Crew to Seek Questions for Answers Found by Previous Moon Flights
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 11A perplexed lunar scientist recently began a learned report with story from Walt Kelly's Positively Pogo.

title: Court Bars Jail for Indigent Unable to Pay His Fine
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 11 (AP)It is unconstitutional for judges to order an indigent person jailed when he has not been able to pay a fine, the Wisconsin Supreme Court has ruled.

title: U.N. Peace Corps Program Is Making Its Mark in Poor Nations After 2 Years
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 11  With a notebook and a worn copy of A Field Guide to the Larger Mammals of Africa in hand, John Newby has spent more than 700 hours threading his way through the resistant bush of Manda National Park in southern Chad.

title: SUFFOLK SCORES STATE HOSPITALS
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Nov. 11 Suffolk County Executive John V. N. Klein has assailed the State Department of Mental Hygiene for discharging more than 1,000 patients from state mental hospitals into Suffolk at yearly cost to the county welfare department of nearly $700,000.

title: Midwood Harriers Second
description: Midwood High School has been placed second in the Public Schools Athletic League crosscountry championship run last Tuesday at Van Cortland Park. Marty Lewis, the P.S.A.L. track commissioner, said Midwood was originally credited with 261 points and eighth place, but the points had been added incorrectly and Midwood actually had 161 points for second place. Madison won the title.

title: Medicine
description: Every five minutes, 15 women in this country are diagnosed as having breast cancer. At current cure rates, half of them will die of their disease within five years.

title: Art Illumindtions From the Morgan Collection
description: The exhibition of 23 illuminations from a 14thcentury choir book now on view at the Morgan Library, Madison Avenue at 36th Street, offers both a magnificent esthetic creation and a scholarly revelation. Although the illuminations have been in the Morgan collection for several years, it was not known that they belonged to the same choir book until the recent discovery. of that fact by Mirella Levi D'Ancona, a Hunter College art professor and oa specialist in illuminated manuscripts.

title: Sixminute Opera
description: TRENTON  Fifthand sixthgraders are not normally expected to create an opera by themselves or enjoy so sophisticated an art form.

title: Letters; On being mugged (cont.)
description: To the Editor: Mr. Richard R. Lingeman's account (Writer is mugged, denies being victim,  Oct. 22) of the senseless attack on him was of special interest to me. Something similar recently happened to my wife. She, too, was struck without warning or obvious motive. And she was not robbed. But it did not happen during the small hours of the morning, as it did with Mr. Lingeman. It happened on a bright. sunny day, at about 5:10 in the afternoon, in front of a highrise luxury apartment, with a serene display of fountains.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Patricia Bosworth's story Dude... An $800,000 Disaster"engaged the interest for several reasons:

title: Charlotte Macy Becomes Bride
description: WESTON, Mass., Nov. 11 Miss Charlotte Macy was married here this afternoon to Wallace Egerton Savory at the First Parish Unitarian Church, by the Rev. Harry E. Hochler.

title: Notes: To China By Air
description: ALTHOUGH the average American traveler still finds it virtually impossible to gain entry, interest in going to the People's Republic of China has continued to mount ever since President Nixon's visit in February. The number of airlines offering or soon to offer service to Chinese cities is also increasing.

title: Suffolk
description: Brentwood's 24game undefeated string came to an end yesterday as Vic Kelly scored three touchdowns in Lindenhurst's 1813 triumph. The victory gave the Lindys a League A championship. Coach Bernie Wyatt's Lindys oppose West Islip next Saturday for the A.A.A. Conference championship on the neutral North Babylon field.

title: ACUPUNCTURE CLINIC FIGHTS COURT ORDER
description: The treatment of patients at the Acupuncture Center of New York was halted yesterday by the operators of the clinic, who announced that they would seek the dismissal of a court order which had closed the establishment at 133 East 73d Street.

title: Royal Wedding Recalled
description: COLLECTORS of the stamps of Britain, or noncollectors who may have an interest in British affairs, and who may wish a remembrance of the 25th wedding anniversary of Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, are likely to find. Britain in Miniature a mostpleasing commentary on the silver wedding observation.

title: ParishSchool Future Debated,
description: KEARNYThe work of a commission planning for the future of Catholic education in New Jersey aroused heated discussion last week at a meeting of the Newark Archdiocese Senate of Priests.

title: Quiet Tribute Is Paid To the Dead of Verdun
description: FORT DOLTAUMONT, France, Nov. 11 (AP)French Army tanks moved through nearby Verdun today, commemorating the end of World War. I.

title: AROUND THE
description: Last call to clean up perennials; cut to ground old foliage and compost.... Pull out annuals and vegetable plants; compost; put away tomato stakes. Spray roses once more for black spot... Finish all bulb planting.... Cleanup window boxes; put in clippings from evergreens.

title: POWER'S CENTROWITZ TAKES C.H.S.A.A. RUN
description: Matt Centrowitz of Power Memorial won the individual title in yesterday's rainsoaked Catholic High Schools Athletic Association crosscountry championships. Centrowitz covered the slippery and muddy 21/2mile Van Cortlandt Park course in 12 minutes 38.2 seconds.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe Navy, with its tradition of Filipino waiters and Southern WASP leadership, never really was an alternative for America's young city blacks during the early years of the Vietnam war. The ghetto youths instead joined, fought and died with Army or Marine Corps ground infantry units.

title: Coins
description: EROS, the Greek god of love, will be depicted on the obverse of a 25pence coin to be produced for the Bailiwick of Guernsey to commemorate the silver wedding anniversary of Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip this year Bermuda, Gibraltar and the Isle of Man have also announced plans for crownsize piecesdated 1792to mark the occasion.

title: Segura in Senior Final
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Nov. 11 (AP)  Topseeded Pancho Segura of La Costa defeated Hugh Stewart of Balboa, 62, 62, in the semifinals of an international senior Open tennis tournament today. Tom Brown of San Francisco beat Dr. Joe Ignatius of Los Altos, 60, 61, in the other semifinal. First prize is $1,500.

title: Benefit Game Scheduled
description: WinstonSalem (N.C.) State University and Howard University will meet Nov. 25 in a basketball game, to be followed by a dance, at City College's new gymnasium, 138th Street and Convent Avenue. Proceeds will go toward WinstonSalem scholarships. Tickets are available by mail from the WinstonSalem Scholarship Fund, 296 East 162d Street, Bronx, N.Y. 10451.

title: Fellow travelers on the same small planet
description: Somewhere in the dim past man decided he was different from the other animal inhabitants of the globe. Since that time, he has sought to interpret the difference in many and various ways, nearly always in terms of his own Interests. Gerald Carson now calls him to account in a fascinating and factfilled recapitulation of our crueltiesand occasional kindnessto these fellow travelers on the same small planet.

title: Inmate Escapes at Leesburg
description: LEESBURG, N. J., Nov. 11 (AP)An inmate at the Leesburg Prison dairy farm escaped in a stolen car today after striking a civilian employe, prison officials reported. The inmate, Burl Matthews of Atlantic City, was serving a threetofour year term for assault and battery. He was admitted to Leesburg last August. The civilian, Edward Geisler of Millville, was treated at Millville Hospital and released.

title: KENNEDY IS FOUND POPULAR FOR 76
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.11Two new public opinion surveys have found wide latent support for Senator Edward M. Kennedy as a Presidential candidate.

title: Railroads Warned of Need For Standpipes in Tunnels
description: Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery said yesterday that he might seek to close railroad tunnels under the East River if standpipes to facilitate firefighting in the tunnels were not installed.

title: U.S. Is Said to Deliver 20 Bombers to Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 11 (AP)  Ten United States C141 Starlifter transport planes unloaded 20 propellerdriven Skyraider bombers at the Pnompenh airport today, according to reports from the capital of Cambodia.

title: Leonia's Alternative School Breaking Educational Tradition
description: LEONIAConfronted with an overcrowded high school, taxconscious residents and academically restive students, the Board of Education in this Bergen County borough countered this fall with a traditionshattering, educational experiment called the Leonia Alternative High School.

title: Some Upsets...Some Oddities
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon's smashing election victory last week had been widely predicted. But, across the country, stunning upsets occurred in races for the Senate, the House and the governorshipsmany of them in contests expected to be not even close. Some of the highlights:

title: Flag on the Play Is Name of Game
description: TRENTON  Some 225 players rolled out of bed early today to meet a 10:45 A.M. whistle that signaled the start of another Sunday morning of fun with footballs and flags. They are members of the Mercer County Park and Recreation Commission's Flag Flootball League.

title: A Sad Thing on the Way to the Forum
description: IT Is curious that the Forum, the 299seat experimental house in the basement of the Vivian Beaumont, should constantly prove the focal point in all efforts to make or break legitimate theater at Lincoln Center. The Forum is plainly a secondary house, little brother to the Beaumont stage proper. It hasn't been used all that much over the sixyear period of Jules Irving's regime; the public is nowhere near so familiar with it as reviewers are. Its budget must be minimal compared to that of the main repertory operation. Yet when a crisis comes along, it is fought out over the Forum.

title: New generation of lounge chairs
description: Relax! Superstuffed and fabulously comfortable are the features that seating design is beginning to incorporate in a big way. It's all the result of the new sense of assurance with which designers are making use of synthetic materials. Urethane and polyurethane foam, dacron stuffing and cast, rigid urethane can eliminate the need for an inner structural frame. Even that old standby lounging comfort, the recliner, has been scaled down until it deceptively trim and tailored. The search for comfort has produced these humorously robust shapes, which herald a new generation of furniture for sinkinto, settledown relaxation.

title: Rice Upsets Arkansas
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark. Nov. 11 (AP)  Roland Boyce, a freshman playing his first game of the season, blasted 1 yard for a touchdown with one second left in the game to give Rice a surprising 2320 victory over Arkansas today.

title: Preps
description: WATERTOWN, Conn., Nov. 11The passing combination of Brad Vanacore to Greg Thomas led Hotchkiss to a 156 victory over Taft today for its first undefeated season in three years.

title: American exiles, an American family, an American rebellion, an American ally
description: At the beginning of his autobiography, An American Artist's Story, George Biddle describes the family feeling of his grandmother and her kin. She was a granddaughter of Edmund Randolph. They considered themselves something like royalty. George, the family rebel, thought all rather silly; but when his brother Francis became Attorney General under Franklin Roosevelt, he felt strongly that he was just carrying on an appropriate Randolph tradition.

title: L.I. Puerto Rican Community Thriving
description: Thirty years ago an advertisement appeared in a Spanishlanguage daily in New York offering home sites in Suffolk County for $150 each. Today, the area involved  BrentwoodBay ShoreCentral Isliphas the second largest concentration of Puerto Ricans in the state, surpassed only by New York City.

title: Two Banks Seek to End Trust In Denver Post Stock Dispute
description: DENVER, Nov. 11  Two banks are seeking Denver County Probate Court approval of plans to terminate the multimilliondollar trust established by the late Frederick G. Bonfils, cofounder of The Denver Post, and to distribute the assets to the named beneficiary, the Frederick G. Bonfils Foundation.

title: COLONELS DOWN NETS BY 116.99
description: LOUISVILLE, Nov. 11Dan Issel scored 36 points and contributed 20 rebounds to lead the Kentucky Colonels to a 116.99 victory over the New York Nets in an American Basketball Association game,, tonight. It was the Nets sixth straight defeat, all suffered one road trip that ended with tonight's game.

title: Chicago Crash Deepening a Dispute Over U.S. Commuter Safety Rules
description: The collision of two commuter trains that took 44 lives at Chicago on Oct. 30 has deepened a dispute between Government safety experts and operators of the nation's urban rail transit systems over the need for further Federal safety regulation.

title: 12.000 Bakers on Strike At 3 West Coast Concerns
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 11 (UPI)  Nearly 12,000 bakers went on strike against three of the largest bakeries in the nation today over a demand by workers for two consecutive off.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Balzac noted that man's greatest fear is to stand alone: Be he leper ,or hermit the greatest fear man has is not to have a companion of his fatemoral aloneness.

title: Preps
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 11Charlie Marburg scored two touchdowns and a conversion today to lead St. Paul's to 268 victory over Brooks.

title: Sheila Firestone Ford Fiancee of William Brock
description: GROSSE POINTE SHORES, Mich., Nov. 11Miss Sheila Firestone Ford, a greatgranddaughter of the late Henri Ford, and William Justus Brock plan to be married next June.

title: Bayside Edges Canarsie On Gittens's Late Scores
FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: LONDONOne interesting and difficult adjustment in U.S. foreign policy over the next four years will be that which must inevitably take place with Britain, now that the United Kingdom has joined the European Community and, by so doing, severed the apron strings that bound it to. the United States since World War II.

title: DESTRUCTIVE
description: To THE EDITOR: As the New York theater is constituted today, its success relies, solely on the reactions of a very few individuals, some unnecessarily jaundiced., Who are these men (and several women) who are in a position to decide in. two hours that months and months of work, not to speak of fortunes in the case of Broadway musicals, has resulted in something pretentious, vulgar, rude, crude, or any other of a myriad of adjectives which are set forth weekly by the critics? It would seem that they themselves are nothing less than pretentious.

title: 2 Killed in Jersey Crash
description: SADDLE BROOK, N. J., Nov. 11 (UPI)A local patrolman and his Jersey City companion were killed today when the patrolman's car struck a utility pole on North Midland Avenue, the police said. The victims in the 2:50 A.M. accident were Patrolman Dennis Panagia, of 575 Fairlawn Parkway, and William Meyers, 27, of 130 St. Paul Avenue.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Bridgeport Rolls, 52 to 28, For 19th Straight Victory
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 11 (AP)  Roy Ferreira threw three touchdown passes and ran for another score today as Bridgeport amassed 558 yards in total offense to trounce Lock Haven State, Pa., 5228.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: William Stevenson reviewing Mina and Arthur Klein's Israel Land of the Jews, has written the following (and obviously tongueincheek) paragraph:

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I think it extremely unfair and detrimental to the theater that Gerome Ragni was cast as the villain in Patricia Bosworth's article, 'Dude... An $800,000 Disaster.

title: Explosion of a Fuel Truck Shuts Newark Field Briefly
description: NEWARK, Nov. 12 (UPI)A fuel truck exploded outside the Newark International Airport terminal this afternoon, closing the airport. for 45 minutes while emergency equipment fought the blaze.

title: Flames Beat Canucks, 31
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 12 (AP)Keith McCreary touched off a threegoal Atlanta burst in the second period tonight leading the Flames to a 31 victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: LAURENCE TOMPKINS
description: DARK HARBOR, ME., Nov. 12  Laurence Tompkins, a sculptor whose works included busts of Sir Johnston ForbesRobertson, actormanager, and Somerset Maugham, the writer, died yesterday at his home here. He was 75 years old.

title: Licenses Planned for Doctors Urging Methadone
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 121 The Food and Drug Administration is preparing a new restriction on methadone aimed at preventing doctors from abusing their right to prescribe the synthetic narcotic.

title: City to Offer $694Million In Notes, Its Largest Loan
description: In the largest single borrowing in New York City's history Controller Abraham D. Beame will offer $693,925,000 in shortterm notes for sale tomorrow. Mr. Beame said that more than half was in anticipation of Federal and state aid owed to but not yet received by the city.

title: THIEU OPPOSITION TO DRAFT ACCORD REPORTED EASED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 12Informed South Vietnamese and American officials said today that President Nguyen Van Thieu had modified his total opposition to the draft United StatesNorth Vietnamese peace settlement, but was still unwilling to accept it fully.

title: Chinese Acrobat Troupe Will Come to U.S.Dec.16
description: China, in what appears to be another move toward normalizing relations with the United States, is for the first time permitting one of its major cultural attractions to perform in this country.

title: MealsonWheels Volunteers Caterto Elderly Here
description: Robert Randolph, a 68yearold pensioner, stood on the fifthfloor landing of the Harlem rooming house where he boards, listening to the footsteps of a visitor making the long climb up.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: After years and years of fighting for the right to vote, the eighteenyearolds finally scored a victory. Or did they?

title: 520 Crushing of Patriots Gives Shula No.100
description: MIAMI Nov. 12Boasting the only unbeaten record in the National Football League this year, the Miami Dolphins are finding that success., breeds success and a little bit of luck.

title: City Queries State on ReliefRent Plan
description: The city has asked the !state to confirm reports of a state! plan that might slash maximum rents payable for welfare families from a present general limit of $210 a month for a Manhattan family of four to $120.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 12It was a raw, cold Sunday. The football field was soft from rain, but the blocks being dished out were not. The contest, between Northern Valley and Hasbrouck Heights, was described as touch football, but one player put it aptly when said, In this league, you know you've been touched when you end up on the ground.

title: Stage: A Quarter for the Ladies Room
description: A Quarter for the Ladies Room, a musical revue that opened last night at the Village Gate, takes place in an imaginary ladies room. The time is standing stilland so is the show.

title: Taiwan Wins Golf; U.S. Ties for 4th
description: MELBOURNE Australia Nov. 12 (AP)Hsieh Minnan won the individual title and led Taiwan to the team championship, today in the World Cup golf tournament. The defending champion United States finished in a tie for fourth place seven strokes back.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Psychotherapists have long observed that man is that being who surrenders self awareness and then suffers the neurotic consequences. The recent campaign seemed a national case in point.

title: Snoopy and WilsonDroll Specials
description: Both Flip Wilson and Snoopy, the latter involved again with the Ice Follies, can take a bow for triggering some good escapist diversions last night as National Broadcasting Company TV specials.

title: BRYANT F. GILMOUR
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., Nov. 12Bryant F. Gilmour, president of B. F. Gilmour, Inc., of Brooklyn, pipe fittings, died today in South Side Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived here.

title: Militancy Replaces Old Frills At First Latin Music Festival
description: The 1970's version of Latin music  tough, urban, even militant  arrived at Madison Square Garden on Friday evening, proving that it has come a long way from the old Cesar RomeroCarmen Miranda image Those frilly shirts, with concertina sleeves, and maraca rattling are out. The clenched fist and brassy blending of jazz, soul and rock music into a zesty fundamental form are in.

title: ST. FRANCIS TIES FOR C.S.F.L. TITLE
description: St. Francis Prep completed an unbeaten season yesterday and gained a share of the Catholic Schools Football League championship with Holy Family by defeating Archbishop Stepinac 38.14, on the loser's field in White Plains. It was the eighth victory for the Little Terriers, who accumulated 258 season points and held the opposition to 65.

title: OTB CHIEF REDUCES PROFIT PROJECTION
description: Howard J. Samuels, head of the OffTrack Belting Corpora;;;; tion. said yesterday that he thought his agency would add! $35million to the city's coffers this year.

title: Memorial to School Team
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 12 (AP)About 1,000 people gathered at Marshall University's student center today for the dedication of a memorial fountain honoring the 75 victims of the Nov. 14, 1970, plane crash that killed most of the school's football team and coaching staff, along with many prominent Huntington residents.

title: U.S. Planes Pound North As Foe Presses Attacks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 13  The Communists mounted heavy artillery. barrages while United States planes made heavy bombing raids over the weekend as both sides continued to move supplies into South Vietnam in anticipation of a ceasefire, military spokesmen reported yesterday.

title: Canton Trade Fair Prices Found High by U.S.Buyers
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 12American businessmen who have visited the fall trade fair in the southern Chinese city of Canton are reserved in their comments on the outlook for trade between China and the United States.finding out what it means to be in this business. It's not all roses.

title: The Rib Belonged to Eve: I
description: Freud was no male chauvinist; and his 1905 female theory was firmly grounded in accepted biology. Not Freud, but the biologists of recent years are at faultif fault must: be found.

title: Picnic Atop Kennedy Center Precedes 1776 Opening in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12Five days after the Presidential election, goodwill toward all, regardless of political persuasion, flowed like jugs of apple cider tonight at a Colonial benefit picnic for more than 700 Washingtonians and their families. The event was held atop the roof of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I feel that until our streets are safe to walk and our children able to come home from school on their own the police of this city should leave the pretzel peddlers alone.

title: Dayan Stops Here on Way To Washington for Talks
description: Defense Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel, on his way to Washington for talks later in the week with Secretary of State William P. Rogers, landed at John F. Kennedy International Airport yesterday and was whisked away by security men.

title: JAPAN'S SOLDIERS SOUGHT IN BURMA
description: TOKYO, Nov. 12  A mission of 17 former soldiers of the Japanese Imperial Army left here by airliner today bound for Burma to search for World War II comrades who may still be alive in the jungles there.

title: Peking Accuses U.S.
description: HONG KONK, Monday, Nov. 13 (Agence FrancePress)The Peking radio charged today that while rushing arms supplies to South Vietnam, the United States has also been stepping up delivery of war materials to Pnompenh in the last few days.

title: Advertising:
description: Not everyone thinks that Celanese's idea of promoting its Fortrel and Arnel fibers with almost nightly spots on the Johnny Carson Show next year is a super idea.

title: Bakers Studying Hedging To Cut Losses on Flour
description: A dozen unhappy bakers attended an allday seminar at Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith recently.

title: Canadians Down Bruins, 53
description: BOSTON, Nov. 12 (AP)The Montreal Canadiens backed by Ken Dryden's goaltending built a 41 lead and held on for a 53 victory over the Boston Bruins tonight in their first meeting of the season.

title: Soviet Said to Uncover DrugMaking Operation
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 12A group of scientific workers it Moscow's Institute for Natural Compounds has, been discovered making drugs illegally, apparently including LSD, according to reports circulating among Soviet intellectuals.

title: U.S. Medical Student Held On a Drug Charge in Spain
description: MALAGA, Spain, Nov. 12 (Reuters)An American medical student has been detained in this southern Spanish port after customs officers discovered 269 pounds of hashish hidden in his car, the police) said today.

title: Marriages in Academe Reflect the Changing Status of Women
description: Bonnie Wheeler caiis herself a Jet Set academic. On weekends, the longhaired, 27yearold professor lives with het husband in Cleveland. But on Mondays she flies to New York, where she teaches English three days a week at Columbia University.

title: Haig Meets With Cambodian Leader
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 12Gen, Alexander M. Haig, Jr. paid a brief visit to Pnompenh today to meet with President Lon Nol.

title: Parlaying Friday's Into a Bonanza 7 Days of the Week
description: When Alan Stillman opened Friday's restaurant seven years ago, he had no capital at all. He was working as a salesman for an essential oils company and was living in Manhattanacross the street from The Good Tavern, a downattheheels neighborhood bar on First Avenue at 63d Street. He saw lots of young people in the neighborhood airline steward esses and junior executives and he thought it would be nice to have a restaurant and bar where he and others in his age bracket (he was 28 then) could gather for drink.

title: VietnameseIsraeli Talks
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 12 (UPI) Foreign Minister Abba Eban told the Cabinet today that Israel and South Vietnam were discussing the establishment of diplomatic and trade relations diplomatic sources said. He reportedly said that the discussions were at Saigon's initiative.

title: Conservative Party Sees City Ready for Conservative Mayor
description: The chairman of the New York State Conservative party said yesterday that the city was definitely ready for a Conservative administration and that his party would soon begin to assess the records of candidates for endorsement for next year's mayoral contest.

title: Haig Briefs Korean Leader
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Monday, Nov. 13 (UPI)Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. called on Korea's President Park Chung Hee, this morning and briefed him on the latest developments in the Vietnam peace negotiations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Nixon's politically welltimed prospective peace announcements do not alter the fact that even if it all materializes he could and shouldin fulfillment of his 1968 campaign pledgeshave achieved the result four years earlier. Henry Kissinger's response that at that time the other side consistently refused to discuss the separation of the political and military issues scarcely justifies the four years of continuing and escalating warfare, including the bombing and invasion of Laos and Cambodiaactions taken without the consent or knowledge of Congressand is hardly evidence of earlier Administration eagerness for peace.

title: JOHN A. KNOX
description: IRVINGTON on HUDSON, N. Y., Nov. 12John A. Knox, a retired senior manager with Brown Brothers Harriman, investment bankers, died yesterday at his home on Fargo Lane. He was 68 years old.

title: Some Restaurants Sign Pacts; Mediation Pressed in Strike
description: Representatives of restaurant owners and striking diningroom employes met yesterday for a daylong bargaining session under Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, who was asked by. Mayor Lindsay to intervene in the labor dispute.

title: Judge Releases a Homosexual Rather Than Send Him to Attica
description: ROCHESTER. Nov. 12 (AP)A homosexual convicted of firstdegree assault has been placed on probation by a judge who said that he did so reluctantly because of fears that the man would be dehumanized if not killed if sentenced to a term at the State Correctional Facility at Attica.

title: HELLER SEES NEED FOR 1914 TAX RISE
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 12 A Federal tax increase of between $10billion and $15billion will be required in 1974 to avoid a resurgence of inflation at that time, Walter W. Heller said here over the weekend.

title: Nature of Campaigns for State Bench Raises Both. Questions and Eyebrows
description: There they were, six men and one woman, campaigning for three spots on the New York Court of Appeals. One had radio advertisements that said that a vote for him was a vote for law and order; one appeared on television and pledged to get the thieves and muggers and murderers into these cells, and one had the head of the OffTrack Betting Corporation forecasting that her candidacy was the best bet. Almost all of the candidates campaigned on court reform platforms, though court reform has next to nothing to do with the jobs that were at stake. Three of the seven contenders spent less than $50,000 each, but two (including one of the winners) spent well over $150,000 each.

title: SCOUT LEADER SHOT BY CITY PATROLMAN
description: WEEHAWKEN, Nov. 12A minor collision at the New Jersey and of the Lincoln Tunnel this evening led to a shooting incident in the tunnel involving an offduty New York City patrolman and an executive of the Boy Scouts of America.

title: Judith Schein Wed To Dr. Burnstein
description: Miss Judith Meris Schein, a music teacher in the school system, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Kenneth Richard Burnstein, a dentist in Flushing, Queens. Rabbi Samuel Schafler performed the ceremony at Temple Gates of Prayer in Flushing.

title: Catholics Urged to Stress Evangelism, Not Piety
James Tocco Presents an Unconventional Piano Recital Debut
description: There was very little that was conventional about James Tocco's New York debut piano recital at Tully Hall on Saturday, and almost all its differences were welcome.

title: New GlobeUnion Plant
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 12 GlobeUnion, Inc., announced plans today for construction of a new battery manufacturing facility in Canby, Ore. Groundbreaking for the new plant is scheduled tomorrow. GlobeUnion, with headquarters here, said the new plant would enable the company to double present production capacity.

title: A Call for Disraeli?
description: Two days before his reelection, President Nixon set forth the general philosophy that he expected to follow in his second term. Likening himself to a Disraeli conservative in an interview in The Washington StarNews, the President did convey something of the flavor of nineteenthcentury England, but one that rather combined the flamboyance of a Disraeli abroad with the piety and frugal reformism of a Gladstone at home. Mr. Nixon's remarks were understandably filled with references to the popular will as he clearly expected it to be demonstrated the following Tuesday. But since he has yet to show himself the slave of a philosophy, any philosophy, when it appears to conflict with the political facts of life, what he told his interviewer may well be reconsidered in the light of the mandate he received at the polls. That mandate already has been interpreted as variously as tea leaves; but in spite of the lopsided vote for the President, an interpretation would have to be farfetched indeed to read the election as an upsurge of Victorian conservatism.

title: Real Estate Outfit Charged in Scheme To Inflate Its Fees
description: The Urban Relocation Company, Inc., accused earlier this year of haraSsing tenants to force them out of their apartments, has now been charged with scheming to bilk landlords and tenants with inflated relocation fees.

title: HULL GETS 2 GOALS AND FANS REJOICE
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Nov. 12 (UPI)Bobby Hull scored his first two World Hockey Association goals tonight as his Winnipeg Jets vanquished the Los Angeles Sharks, 52.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Gov. Thomas Meskill of Connecticut indicated that he would seek a second term in 1974.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Fred M. Hechinger's column The Scent of Repression [Oct. 30] recalled to me, and made me look up, a passage in G. B. Shaw's preface to Back to Methuselah, which reads:

title: Once Upon a Time, Everybody Walked to Work
description: When Phyllis Steinfeld leaves her Brooklyn home each weekday morning, she has the choice of a trip by subway that takes 25 minutes door to door or a 45minute, mileandonehalf walk to her job at the city's Environmental Protection Administration in lower Manhattan.

title: SINK BREAKS MARK IN A.A.U. TITLE RUN
description: Sid Sink, a graduate student at Bowling Green, competing for the New York Athletic Club, shattered the meet record in the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union senior crosscountry championship yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: The Mails in Chaos, Italy Discourages Christmas Cards
description: ROME, Nov. 12While post office departments throughout the world are urging the public to send Christmas mail early, Italians are being warned not to mail any holiday greetings at all.

title: Advertising:
description: Tucker Wayne & Co., Atlantathe biggest show in townis celebrating its 50th anniversary by proliferating. It is adding two new communications companies under the single name of Quadrant.

title: Pope Paul Beatifies Nun Who Was Slain In Attempted Rape
description: ROME, Nov. 12Pope Paul VI today officiated at a solemn rite for the beatification of 19thcentury Italian nun, Agosina Pietrantoni.

title: Hunter Dies in Vermont
description: CHESTER, Vt., Noy. 12 (AP) Milton 30 years old, was shot and fatally wounded today by another hunter, the police reported. Mr. Stowell, of Chester, had just shot a deer and was cleaning the carcass when the other hunter fired.

title: Ward Denies It Is Planning A Retail Chain in Japan
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 12 (AP)A Montgomery Ward & Co. spokesman said today that report from Japan saying that Ward plans to open a chain of stores in that country is false.

title: City Opera Offers CarmenTwice
description: Carmen twice In one day is an unusual occurrence for a repertory ensemble like the City Opera: either it was sheer fate or the dictates of a subscriiption system that led to the doubleheader on Saturday. The company had no difficulty, though, in mustering different casts for both performances, and, of course, the opera itself has never had trouble in drawing an audience.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A recent Times article describes Con Edison as being opposed to building cooling towers at its Indian Point II generating station because they would be prohibitively expensive.

title: Airliner. Meal Reported Cause Of A ustralian Cholera Outbreak
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 12  Health authorities believe that smorgasbord served in the economy class of a Qantas jet on the way to Australia last weekend was the source of cholera outbreak that has struck at least 63 of the passengers,

title: S.E.C. Suggests Changes In Sales of Mutual Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The staff of the Securities and Exchange Commission has concluded that there would be little, if any, harm to the stock market, the securities industry or to investors, if a fundamental change were made in the way mutual funds are sold.

title: POLICE UPBRAIDED ON THEIR GROOMING
description: Top New York police commanders have been told that they will be stripped of their rank and that departmental charges will be lodged against them if the appearance of the patrolmen, station houses and radio patrol cars under their supervision is not immediately improved.

title: ARGENTINES SPLIT ON PERON RETURN
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 12Juan D. PerOn, the populist leader whose 10 years in power left a deep mark on Argentina, is scheduled to return this week after 17 years in exile. There is a strange blend of apathy, fear, excitement and doubt in the country awaiting him.

title: Lawyers to Be Sought For Free Consumer Aid
description: Local consumer protection agencies will stage a major drive this winter to recruit free lawyers for consumers who find themselves sued in Civil Court for nonpayment of credit debts.

title: Council of Jewish Federations Approves Plan to Raise $630Million Next Year
description: TORONTO, Nov. 12American Jewish leaders were told today that their communities would have to raise a record $630million in 1973 to supped a broad range of philanthropic services in the United States and to maintain and augment various humanitarian projects in Israel.

title: Hard Times for Schools
description: Assistant Secretary of Education Sidney P. Marland Jr. has issued a warning that schools and colleges must expect some difficult times ahead as the Administration implements President Nixon's budgetcutting policy. Since education is already in the midst of difficult times, the phrase sounds like a euphemism for disaster. Even Mr. Marland's assurance that expenditures in this vital area will not necessarily be reduced below the present austerity level is ominous. At a time of continuing inflation, a budgetary standstill spells retreat.

title: Albanians Open a Mosque Here
description: About the only things missing yesterday were the rugged mountains of their native land and a muezzin calling the faithful to prayer from a minaret when Albanian Moslems of New York and New Jersey opened their first mosque here.

title: Miss Walford, J. C. Rassweiler Wed in Jersey
description: NAVESINK, N. J., Nov. 12 Miss Elizabeth Candy Walford, daughter of Lionel Albert Walford of Atlantic Highlands and the late Mrs. Walford, was married here this afternoon to James Clifford Rassweiler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clifford Fred Rassweiler of Short Hills. The Rev. Harry Sorensen performed the ceremony in All Saints Episcopal Church.

title: OFFICIALS WEIGH GRADUAL MOVES TO END CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The officials who operate the Nixon Administration's controls over wages, prices and rents are strongly disposed to narrow the program as a gradual step toward decontrol.

title: C.B.S. STRIKE PARLEY SET FOR TOMORROW
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 (UPI)Federal mediators will meet with both sides Tuesday to try to settle the technicians strike.against Columbia Broadcasting Systemowned stations in seven cities, it was announced today.

title: Cavaliers Down Sonics
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 12 (AP) Austin Carr and Lenny Wilkens each scored 22 points pacing the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 113107 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics tonight before a crowd of 13,174.

title: Guerrillas Stage Raid
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 12 (Reuters)Guerrilla supporters of former President Juan D. Perlin seized a radio station tonight and broadcast a statement about his planned return this Friday.

title: Supreme Court Logjam
description: The Supreme Court has for some time been weighed down by an increasingly unmanageable load of petitions. Even an expansion of the Court's own administrative machinery cannot sufficiently reduce the rush of appeals, which in the end all converge on the fixed number nine Justices. There is every indication that the pressure of these appeals will continue to grow:

title: Tracer Developed for Oil Spills
description: A novel technique to fingerprint tanker petroleum cargoes for positive identification in case of oil spills has been developed by the General Electric Company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It would seem that McGovernites can learn much from the result of the Presidential election. For example, that millions of intelligent, troubled fellow Americans of other political affiliation, too, have high hopes for honorable and lasting peace throughout the world;, that they are also concerned about the war in Vietnam, not only because of the loss of the lives of so many of our youth and those of the aggressors (which the Democrats seemed particularly to stress) but because of the appalling losses suffered by the oppressed South Vietnamese as well.

title: Stability Grows as Laurelton Stems the Flight of Whites
description: Like many another tranquil neighborhood of comfortable middleclass white people, the Laurelton section of Queens in 1964 began to change.

title: Beridg: California Experts Take National Mixed Pairs Title
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 12 Two California experts beat a Florida pair by a whisker in the national mixed pairs championship, which ended last night in the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals. The winners were John Nohan of Los Angeles and Peggy Sutherlin of San Francisco, with 857 match points. Second, with 856, were Leland Ferer of Miami and Gratian Goldstein of Coral Gables.

title: Wicks's Basket Wins
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 12 (AP)A 25foot jump shot by Sidney Wicks with four seconds left gave the Portland Trail Blazers a 102100 victory over the Kansas City Omaha liKings tonight.

title: Smith Turns Back Okker by 64, 63 In Stockholm Final
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 12 (UPI) Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., the Wimbledon champion, won his second straight major tennis tournament today when he beat Tom Okker of the Netherlands, 64, 63, in the final of the $63,500 Stockholm open.

title: HARRY J. POLLOCK
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., Nov. 12 Harry J. Pollock, president, of the Levitz Furniture Corporation, a national chain based here, died today at the Brookside Country Club. He was 63 years old.

title: U.S. RIDERS TAKE TORONTO HONORS
description: TORONTO, Nov. 12  After having been beaten in the first three events, the United States Equestrian Team suddenly reversed its form and won the Nations Cup for international jumpers at the Royal Winter Fair Horse Show today.

title: HIJACKING VICTIMS RETURNED AS CUBA HOLDS 3 SUSPECTS;31 Passengers and Crew Back on Southern Plane CoPilot in Hospital
description: A Southern Airsays jet landed in Miami last night with 31 exhausted passengers and crew members of a sister plane hijacked to Cuba by three heavily armed gunmen in a 29hour melodrama that frequently seemed on the edge of catastrophe.

title: ALBERT HOTKINS, PSYCHIATRIST, 55
description: Dr. Albert S. Hotkins, chief school psychiatrist of the Board of Education's Bureau of Child Guidance, died yesterday at his home in Forest Hills, Queens. He would have been 56 years, old Wednesday.

title: Nationals Top Blazers
description: OTTAWA. Nov. 12 (UPI)The Ottawa Nationals scored with less than four minutes remaining today and posted a 21 victory over the Philadelphia Blazers in a World Hockey Association game.

title: H0DERATES START DEMOCRATIC GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 (AP) Nearly two dozen veteran Democratic officeholders, authors and strategists, upset by what they call Senator George McGovern's new politics, are starting an organization for restoring the party to its rightful place of leadership.

title: ARAB GROUP IN U.S, HAILS GUERRILLAS
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 12 The Association of ArabAmerican University Graduates, the most influential secular group of Arabs in the Unit ed States, praised Middle East ern guerrillas today and ac cured Arab governments of hypocrisy.

title: Manhattan College Unit Votes for Coeducation
description: Manhattan College, believed to be the largest remaining allmale institution of higher learning in the country, has taken a major step toward becoming coeducational.

title: Reconciliation in Chile?
description: President Allende of Chile has clearly rebuffed the extremists in his own Socialist party by appointing three military officers to his Cabinet and bringing an end to the 27day strike that was crippling the country's economy. It is too early, however, to infer that Dr. Allende intends to move beyond this toward a policy of national conciliation, or even a modus vivendi with his aroused opposition.

title: U.F.T. Sues, Charging Breach of Pact
