description: A $21million damage suit for breach of contract has been filed by the United Federation, of Teachers against Schools Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner and the city's Board of EducaH tion.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Jordan Takes Precautions
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)  Jordan today banned imports of fruit, vegetables and dairy products from the Israelioccupied West Bank because of a cholera outbreak there, the Health Ministry announced here.

title: Newcombe, Richey Gain
description: ROTTERDAM, Netherlands, Nov. 12 (AP)John Newcombe of Australia, the No. 1 seeded player, trounced Tom Leonard of Arcadia, Calif., 62, 62, in the opening round of the Rotterdam World Championship Tennis tournament today. In other firstround matches, Cliff Richey of Sarasota, Fla., beat Terry Addison of Australia 6 2, 6.2; Charles Pasarell of Puerto Rico scored a 46, 64, 64 victory over Gerald Battrick of England, and Mark Cox of England defeated a countryman, Graham Stilwell, 26, 63, 62.

title: Motorcyclist Killed in Crash
description: MACON, Ga., Nov. 12 (UPI) Berry Oakley, a member of the Allman brothers rock band, died yesterday after his motorcycle crashed into the side of a city bus.

title: HighRise Plans in Newark Bring Tension Into Focus
HIJACKING VICTIMS RETURNED AS CUBA HOLDS 3 SUSPECTS
description: A Southern Airways jet landed in Miami last night with 31 exhausted passengers and crew members of a sister plane hijacked to Cuba by three heavily armed gunmen in a 29hour melodrama that frequently seemed on the edge of catastrophe.

title: Japanese Cabinet Decides To Call General Elections
description: TOKYO, Monday, Nov. (Reuters)The Cabinet decided; today to dissolve the House of Representatives to open the way for a general election next month, the first since Premier Kakuei Tanaka took office last July.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: After the Democratic convention in Miami last July one politician, and only one, asked party officials for an analysis of how the. new rules just adopted would affect the choice of delegates and the convention in 1976. That was Edward Kennedy.

title: Black Hawks Triumph 51
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 12 (UPI) Chico Maki set up two goals and scored one and Dennis Hull scored twice to lead the Chicago Black Hawks to a 51 victory over the Detroit Red Wings tonight.

title: Rangers Subdue Kings, 51, Here
description: Two 21yearold left wings one of whom has apparently lost his job to the other took turns fighting for the fan's attention last night while the Rangers gained a 51 victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: BEIRUT BIDS TROOPS COPE WITH LEFTISTS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 12The Cabinet, facing the threat of a mass demonstration by leftist organizations here tomorrow, assigned the army tonight to maintain order. The leftists called for the demonstrations to protest the killing of two people yesterday in clash between the police and striking workers at a chocolate factory.

title: Woman's Success in Drive for L.I. Park May Lead to Her Eviction
description: MONTAUK, L.I., Nov. 12For nearly five years Hilda Lindley led the fight for a 900acre county park overlooking Block Island.Sound here. Now that fight has been won and the park created, but for Mrs. Lindley the success of the fight may mean eviction from the home she has occupied for 22 years on two acres of land right in the middle of the park site.

title: Nixon Back From Florida Goes to Camp David Today
description: WASHINGTON Nov 12 (AP) President Nixon returned late today from a fiveday stay at his Florida home with word that he will head on tomorrow to his camp David retreat to spend a week or more working on plans to reorganize the executive branch.

title: Children and Parents Are Reunited in Berlin
description: BERLIN, Nov. 12 (UPI)Emotional reunions took place today between children and parents who had left them behind when they fled East Germany.

title: MSGR. D. J. FIORENTINO
description: Msgr. Dominic J. Fiorentino, for 45 years pastor of St. Dominic's Roman Catholic Church, the Bronx, died Friday in Boynton Beach, Fla. He was 81 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut suggested yesterday that he would seek a second term in office 1974.

title: LONNY STARR DEAD; DISK JOCKEY AT WHN
description: Franklin (Lonny) Starr, director of broadcast standards at station WHN and a veteran announcer and disk jockey, died yesterday at his home, 161 Cornwell Avenue, Valley Stream, L. I. He was 57 years old.

title: First Trident for China
description: LONDON, Nov. 12 (UPI)The first of 12 British Trident2E jetliners ordered by China will be handed over tomorrow, Hawker Siddeley Aviation said today. The order, with spares, is worht about $101million.

title: Fumble by Bills Opens Way to 413 Triumph
description: Since the schedule calls for the New York Jets to play two road games within five days next week, they figure to have very little practice between meeting Miami next Sunday and Detroit Thanksgiving Day But they got in a good workout at Shea Stadium yesterday, defeating the Buffalo Bills, 413.

title: Rev. William H. P. Hatch, 97, Episcopal Teacher, Author
description: LANCASTER, N.H., Nov. 12 (AP)The Rev. Dr. William Henry Paine Hatch of Randolph, father of the Right Rev. Robert M. Hatch of Randolph, retired Episcopal Bishop of Western Massachusetts, died yesterday. His age was 97.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Perhaps the best description of Erno Laszlo, the Hungarian doctor who has been called the Svengali of the skin, came from a woman who said, succinctly, he must be doing something right.

title: EINTRACHT BOWS TO INTERGIULIANA
description: Someone should tell Eintracht, the oldest team in the GermanAmerican Soccer League, that a soccer game lasts 90 minutes, not 87.

title: It's Still Armistice Day in Silver City
description: SILVER CITY, N. M., Nov. 11For the surviving doughboys of World War I, there is no more significant moment to remember than the 11th hour of the 11th day of the H tit month of the yearthe traditional Armistice Day.

title: Deadlock in Florida Golf
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 12 (AP)Wilf Homenuik of Winnipeg, Canada, and Dave Oakley of Vienna, Va., shared top honors in the West Palm Beach open golf tournament after darkness ended their suddendeath playoff today. They had shot pug on the first two holes. Previous commitments kept them from coni tinuing tomorrow.

title: BAKER BEATS FOYT IN TEXAS 500 RACE
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., Nov. 12 (UPI)Buddy Baker of Charlotte, N. C., defeated A. J. Foyt of Houston by the length of his front fender in the Texas 500 today at the Texas World Speedway.

title: OFFICIALS WEIGH GRADUAL MOVES TO END CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The officials who operate the Nixon Administration's controls over wages, prices and rents are strongly disposed to narrow the program as a gradual step toward decontrol.

title: Nine Killed in Sudan Blast
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Nov. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)Nine military, men have been killed while handling a land mine in the southern Sudan, the Defense Ministry announced today. The ministry said that the Men were setting up an explosives depot at a, military camp, found that the firing pin of a mine was not properly closed and tried to fix it. The mine exploded and the blast set off other explosives.

title: The New Austerity
description: Almost two years ago, when he proposed Keynesian deficitspending policies to lift the economy out of the slump, President Nixon laid down his basic principle for fiscal responsibility.

title: Proxmire Forecasts Check on Controls Program
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 Senator William Proxmire, chairman of the Joint Economic Committee, predicted that Congress would refuse to give President Nixon a simple extension of wareprice controls without writing into the legislation some changes in the program.

title: U.S. Planes Pound North As Foe Presses Attacks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 13  The Communists mounted heavy artillery barrages while United States planes made heavy bombing raids over the weekend as both sides continued to move supplies into South Vietnam in anticipation of a ceapefire, military spokesmen reported yesterday.

title: Japanese Begins Long Trip
description: TOKYO, Nov. 12 (UPI)Kenichi Horie, a 34yearold Japanese who made a solo transPacific voyage 10 years ago, left Awaji Harbor near Osaka today for what he hopes will be a 10month roundtheworld trip in a 22foot sloop.

title: REDSKINS DEFEAT GIANTS
description: Larry Brown of Washington cracked open a hardfought National Football League game with two touchdowns in the final 63 seconds to give the Redskins a 2713 victory over the New York Giants yesterday in Washington. Brown, the league's leading rusher, picked up 106 yards in 30 carries.

title: TV Review
description: At a meeting of the Drama Desk in Sardi's restaurant many months ago, Neil Simon explained how he never wasted the raw material of his playwriting craft. For instance, he noted, one skit deleted from Broadway's Plaza Suite was sold to the movies and became The OutofTowners. In fact, he ended with a grin, I have just sold this lunch to Paramount Pictures.

title: Energy With Skill Aids Dance Efforts At the Clark Center
description: The nine choreographers who created Clark Center's New Choreographers Concert Saturday evening have verve, energy and performing skill but rudimentary ideas about dance design.

title: Passengers Thought They'd Die After Plane's Tires Were Shot
description: MIAMI, Nov. 12Everyone believed they would be dead in an hour after the plane's tires were shot out, Gale Buchanan, one of three passengers injured during the Southern Airways hijacking to Cuba, said early today as he was taken to Hialeah Hospital here.

title: Slobodyanik, Gifted Pianist, Is Heckled at Recital
description: Alexander Slobodyanik played his Philharmonic Hall recital yesterday afternoon under disturbing circumstances, but his performance gave one no reason to doubt his standing, immediately established at his first recital here four years ago He is one of the more gifted pianists of his generation.

title: McKellen Victor in Skating
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 12 (AP)Gordon McKellen, 19 years old, of Rockford, Ill., won the men's figure skating international competition today.

title: Midwestern lawyers Back A Modified NoFault Plan
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 12 (AP) Lawyers from 11 Midwestern states endorsed today a nofault automobile insurance plan that would provide immediate reimbursement for outofpocket losses of accident victims but preserve their right to sue for further damages.

title: The Mails in Chaos, Italy Discourages Christmas Cards
description: ROME, Nov. 12While post office departments throughout the world are urging the public to send Christmas mail early, Italians'are being warned not to mail any holiday greetings at all.

title: Discovery of Puerto Rico Being Marked in Schools
description: This is Puerto Rico Discovery Week in the city's 900 public schools, in observance of the discovery of the island by Christopher Columbus on Nov. 19, 1493.

title: RICH BOAT EXHIBIT ENDS FLORIDA RUN
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Nov. 12A display of pleasure craft that for the most part reflected large sums of money (up to $1million) ended its fiveday run today with sufficient success to warrant an encore next year.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Picasso doesn't paint signs. Nureyev doesn't do the fox trot. Sinatra never sang with a barbershop quartet. But one of the National Football League's most gifted virtuosos, O. J. Simpson, must run behind the Buffalo Bills offenSive line.

title: Drive Against Boll Weevil May Trim Use of Pesticides
description: PRENTISS, Miss., Nov. 11Several dozen men went about the Southern Mississippi countryside this summer turning loose boll weevils in all the cotton fields.

title: Lady Churchill Recuperating
description: LONDON, Nov. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)Lady SpencerChurchill, widow of Sir Winston Churchill, was reported in satisfactory condition today in Westminster Hospital, where she underwent surgery yesterday for a thigh fracture suffered in a accident. She is 87 years old.

title: Pied Piper of Tucson Kidnaps 4, Then Frees Them in Prison Break
description: TEMPE, Ariz., Nov. 12 (UPI) Charles H. Schmid Jr., convicted as the Pied Piper of Tucson in a series of stranglings in the nineteensixties, kidnapped four persons after escaping from prison with another murderer, the Arizona Highway Patrol reported today. The hostages were released unharmed.

title: Fire Companies Rule Out Strike Pending Talks on Antibias Plan
3 Gunmen Kill Student and Rob 30 at College
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 12 (UPI) Three armed men entered the Xavier University student union late yesterday, robbed 30 students, and shot one to death with a rifle.

title: LOUIS STERN DIES; STOCKBROKER, 68
description: TORONTO, Nov. 12 Louis D. Stern, a New York stockbroker and Jewish community leader, died of a heart attack last night while attending a meeting of a major American Jewish group at the Royal York Hotel. He lived in South Orange, N. J., arid was 68 years old.

title: Queen Leads Britons In Rites for War Dead
description: LONDON, Nov. 12 (AP)Queen Elizabeth II led Britons today in the annual Remembrance Day ceremonies to commemorate the dead in two world wars.

title: Surrey Riders Win As Judge Overturns Ship Bottom Statute
Sabres Top Penguins
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 12 (UPI)Steve Atkinson's third period goal gave the Buffalo Sabres a 10 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight The shutout was the third of the season for Roger Crozier.

title: THIEU OPPOSITION TO DRAFT ACCORD REPORTED EASED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 12Informed South Vietnamese and American officials said today that President Nguyen Van Thieu had modified his total opposition to the draft United StatesNorth Vietnamese peace settlement, but was still unwilling to accept it fully.

title: Marian Thompson Treats Lieder Tastefully
description: There are some singers who can overwhelm an audience with sheer vocal beauty; others transcend lesser gifts through discerning artistry. Marian Thompson is in the latter category. Returning to Town Hall Sunday afternoon, 11 years after her New York debut, the soprano offered a lieder recital that was artfully chosen, taste fully sung and supremely musical from first note to last.

title: Brown's Jardine to Quit As Head Football Coach
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov 11Brown University's head football coach Leonard C Jardine, asked today to be relieved of his coaching responsibilities at the end of the season.

title: Floods in England and Wales
description: LONDON, Nov. 12 (AP)Heavy rain and high winds caused widespread flooding today in England and Wales. TWO Welsh rivers overflowed their banks, inundating hundreds of houses in Port Talbot and Aberavon.

title: SAMSON HITTNER
description: Samson Hittner, metropolitan area sales supervisor for the Bulova Watch Company at his retirement in 1961, died Saturday in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset, L. I. He was 76 years old and lived in Kings Point, L. I.

title: Chronology of a Hijacking
description: BIRMINGHAM, ALA.Southern Airways. Flight 49 commandeered by three hijackers at about 7:20 P.M. Friday after taking off for Montgomery, Ala., with 27 passengers and crew of four. Plane ordered to Jackson, Miss.

title: Tabor Struggles to Unify Ranks and Regain Influence in Democratic Party
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 Organized labor, a traumatic election campaign behind it, is now struggling to regain its internal unity and to recover its influence within the Democratic party.

title: BOND RATES SEEN ON DIVIDED PATHS
description: Interest rates seem headed for divergent moves this week, with yields rising on taxexempt bonds while tending to decline on corporate fixedincome securities.

title: Imperiale Affirms Stand In Newark Housing Rift
description: NEWARK, Nov. 12Assemblyman Anthony Imperiale, vowing to chain himself to the entrance of a construction site of a blacksponsored housing project in a largely white neighborhood, all but ruled out this evening any compromise over the controversial complex.

title: S.E.C. Suggests Changes In Sales of Mutual Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The staff of the Securities and Exchange Commission has concluded that there would be little, if any, harm to the stock, market, the securities industry or to investors, if a fundamental change were made in the way mutual funds are sold.

title: Crusaders 31 Victors
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 12 (UPI)Cleveland's Crusaders started fast with three goals in the first period to beat the Alberta Oilers tonight, 31.

title: City's Spending in 62 Neighborhoods Varied Widely in 196970, Study Finds
President's Counsel Accuses The Washington Post and C.B.S. of McCarthyism
description: KENNEBUNKPORT, Me., Nov. 12Charles W. Colson, special counsel to President Nixon, accused The Washington Post aria the Columbia Broadcasting System last night of McCarthyism in their reports of the bugging of the Democratic National Committee and allegations of Republican efforts to sabotage the Democratic Presidential primaries.

title: Soviet Annoyed by TruceSigning Delay
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 12  The Soviet Union displayed today its first signs of impatience and concern with delays in the signing of a Vietnam ceasefire agreement while American arms shipments to Saigon are speeded up.

title: Cuban Money for Statue Will Be Kept by the City
description: New York City is more than $10,000 richer, thanks to the preCastro Cuban Government and Jose Marti, the patriot who died in the final Cuban uprising against Spain in 1895.

title: Woman's Success in Drive for L.I. Park May Lead to Her Eviction
description: MONTAUK, L.I., Nov. 12For nearly five years Hilda Lindley led the fight for a 900acre county park overlooking Block Island Sound here. Now that fight has been won and the park created, but for Mrs. Lindley the success of the fight may mean eviction from the home she has occupied for 22 years on two acres of land right in the middle of the park site.

title: Ypres, Belgium, a Ruin In'18, PreservesIts Past
description: YPRES, Belgium, Nov. 9 Softly at first, then solemn and clear, the notes of the Last Post, played on a silver bugle, drift out each night at 8 o'clock over the still Flemish fields near the town of Ypres. The fields contain 130,000 graves  40,000 marked, the rest unknownof Allied soldiers who died there between 1914 and 1918.

title: Personal Finance: Loans for Students
description: Wouldn't it be nice if you could borrow several thousand dollars and get the Government to pay the interest for a few years?

title: Rugby Title to Lords
description: LONDON, Ontario, Nov. 12 (Canadian Press)The London Lords won the Ontario Rugby Football Union championship today by defeating the Buffalo Lancers, 2820, and taking the twogame totalpoint series by 29 points.

title: The Wronged in Israel Are Quick to Complain
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 12 (UPI)Israelis rank as the most prodigious complainers in the world, according to the Government official whose job it is to listen to them. And, he said most of the complaints are justified.

title: Books of The Times
description: Just before the climax of Transparent Things, Vladimir Nabokov's 16th and latest novel and his 7th to be composed in English, one comes across what I construed to be a Nabokovian elbow in the ribs, another helpful reminder from the master to his readers. At the point when it appears, the novel's heroHugh Person, an American book editoris lying in bed, about to fall into a deep sleep in which he will somnambulistically strangle to death his already deeply sleeping wife. As he drifts off, Hugh worries that his wife was again feigning a feminine ailment to keep him away; that she probably cheated in many other ways;... that no manner of... temporary dissatisfaction mattered in the face of his ever growing, ever more tender, love for his wife; that he would have to consult an ophthalmologist sometime next mouth [sic]. He substituted an n for the wrong letter [in mouth].. continued to scan the motley proof into which the blackness of closed vision was now turning, and drifted into his murderous sleep.

title: CHESTER L. KNOWLES, CHEMICAL ENGINEER
description: Chester L. Knowles, a chemical engineer who retired in 1959 as head of Knowles Assoelates, a consulting firm here, died Saturday in Sarasota, Fla., where he had been living. age was 78 and he was a former resident of New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: Equity Library Theater. Revives How to Succeed
description: The very intimacy of the Equity Library Theater, 103d Street at Riverside Drive, fits the revival of the musical How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying like a glove. In substance the show is a lean affair without an ounce of fat. And what's needed to stimulate offices and a lobby? Just a few doors sparse furniture and some sliding elevator panels.

title: Doctors Question Air Units
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 12 (AP)A symposium of physicians at the Cleveland Clinic called today for renewed investigation into the value of cleanair systems and their effect in preventing infection. They said hundreds of hospitals are paying up to $30,000 for the systems without proof that the aircleaning devices actually reduce infection.

title: Killing of Many Nigerians In Equatorial Guinea Alleged
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)A Nigerian newspaper said today that hundreds of Nigerian laborers had recently been shot dead in nearby Equatorial Guinea.

title: Flyers Beat Seals, 83, and Take Division Lead
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 12 (AP)The Philadelphia Flyers, with Bobby Clarke scoring two goals and adding two assists defeated the California Golden Seals, 83 tonight and took over first place in the National Hockey League's Western Division.

title: China Is Looking to Japan For Industrial KnowHow
description: TOKYO, Nov. 12With Japan's diplomatic recognition of China, the Chinese have begun an intensive effort to acquire Japanese industrial technology.

title: 2 Named in Jet Hijacking Termed Highly Disturbed
description: DETROIT, Nov. 12fwo of the three men who have been identified as the hijackers of a Southern Airways jet to Cuba are suspected rapists who once sued the City of Detroit for $4million for alleged police brutality.

title: Alabama Ready to Pick Its Bowl Game
description: Alabama can just about pick its bowl gameOrange, Sugar or Cottonafter beating Louisiana State, 3521 Saturday to remain the only undefeated and untied team eligible for those three postseason games. And the Crimson Tide probably won't have to play Nebraska again because the Cornhuskers were tied by Iowa State, 2323, in one of three major upsets of the day.

title: IMPERIALE VOWS TO BLOCK HOUSING
description: NEWARK, Nov. 12Assemblyman Anthony Imperiale, vowing to chain himself to the entrance of a construction site of a blacksponsored housing project in a largely white neighborhood, all but ruled out this evening any compromise over the controversial complex.

title: This America and Economic Fallacies
description: An unemployment rate of 5 per cent is politically unacceptable to the American voters.

title: For Erte, A Return To Being In Vogue
description: PARIS  Dripping with rhinestone ropes and not much else, a bronzed youth swooped out of the wings of the Alcazar bearing a large chocolate cake.

title: Airlines Threaten Action Against Israeli Travel Tax
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 12  Locale representatives of international airlines and a visiting official of the International Air Transport Association threatened legal sanctions and proceedings today against Israel unless the stiff taxes on Israelis travel abroad were repealed.

title: Antiburglar Window Gate Traps 2 in Burning House
description: A man and his wife were critically burned in an early morning tenement fire in the South Bronx yesterday when they were trapped inside their apartment and firemen were locked outby an antiburglar expansion window gate, fire officials said.

title: Asians'
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Nov. 12 (Agence FrancePresse)  The wash is still flapping on the lineat some of the 10,000 residences in the former Asian, quarters of Kampala, but their occupants have gone. At a few, the servants have moved in from their cramped quarters, at the back.

title: Trial in 10th Week
description: FAIRFIELD, Calif., Nov. 12 (UPI)  The trial of Juan V. Corona in the deaths of 25 farm workers will begin its 10th week tomorrow. The prosecution is in the third portion of its 10phase case.

title: MUMFORD AWARDED LITERATURE MEDAL
description: Lewis Mumford the critic and social philosopher, has been named the 1972 recipient of the National Medal for Literature, conferred annually by the National Book Committee. The award carries a $5,000 prize and a bronze medal.

title: Mrs. Lois L. Lindauer Married To Maj. William Seitz of Army
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 12Mrs. Lois Lyons Lindauer, national director and founder of the Diet Workshop, a weightcontrol program with headquarters in East Meadow, L. I., was married here this afternoon to Maj. William E. Seltz of the Army Corps of Engineers.

title: Rheingold to Tender Shares for Pepsico
description: NEW YORK Nov. 12 (AP)The Rheingold Corporation said today its top officers had decided to tender their shares of the company to Pepsico; Inc., unless another company makes a better offer or unless Pepsico's takeover bid is blocked by the Federal Trade Commission.

title: Adm. Samuel M. Robinson Dies; Headed Bureau of Ships in War
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 12 (AP) Adm. Samuel Murray Robinson, the only engineering officer to rise to fourstar rank in the Navy, died here yesterday of pneumonia. He was 90 years old.

title: Chiefs Top Jolters in Roller Derby
description: With flurries of fights and a predictable outcome, Roller Derby returned to Madison Square Garden yesterday. The Chiefs defeated the Jolters, 4643, as Mike Gammon scored 4 lastminute ;points.

title: SUNSWIN, 119108, AS SCOTT EXCELS
description: PHOENIX, Ariz,, Nov. 12 (AP) Charlie Scott broke a Coliseum record for the most points in a quarter tonight and led the Phoenix Suns to a 119108 National Basketball Association victory over the Philadelphia 76ers. It was the 76ers 16th loss in 17 games.

title: 2 Hurt as Butane Lighters Explode on Pier in Jersey
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Nov. 13 (UPI)Butane cigarette lighters shipped from the Netherlands in a 20footlong container exploded on a pier here today, injuring a Customs inspector and a truck driver.

title: Volvo to Buy U.S. Device
description: The Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation said yesterday that A. B. Volvo, of Goteborg, Sweden, had agreed to purchase Engelhard's catalytic devices of the platinum monolithic type to be installed in Volvo automobiles for the control of emissions of carbon monoxide and hydrocarbon. The devices will be bought from Engelhard KaliChemie Autocat G.m.b.H., a joint venture of Engelhard and KaliChemie, A.G, of Hanover, West Germany.

title: Supreme Court Denies a Return Of Baby Lenore to Her Mother
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP) The Supreme Court today denied a hearing to the natural mother of a child whose adoptive parents moved to Florida rather than accept the loss of the child as ordered by courts in New York.

title: PRICES ON AMEX AND 0TC EASE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market declined yesterday in slower trading.

title: Lehman College Discloses Expansion Plans
description: Plans for a $30million building program on the Bronx campus of the Lehman College of the City University were disclosed last night by Leonard Lief, college president, at campus meeting of Bronx Community Board 7.

title: Carmichael, Back in. U.S., Seeks Black Unity,
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13Stokely Carmichael, who set a new philsophical direction for blacks with his cry of black power six years ago, is back in this country with the aim of setting another course.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York City Board of Education has decided to equip each junior high and high school student with identification cards carrying their photographs, probably beginning next month, in an effort to cut down on school crime.

title: Etonians Shed Top Hat and Tails Outside School
description: WINDSOR, England, Nov. 13 (AP)Boys at Eton, the school that has produced many British leaders, have been excused from wearing their uniforms when away from the school precincts.

title: Lansky Trial Set Jan. 8
description: MIAMI, Nov. 13 (UPI)Federal District Court Judge James Lawrence King today set Jan. 8 for the trial of Meyer Lansky, the reputed financial expert of the underworld, on a criminal contempt charge issued in June, 1971, when Lansky failed to appear before a Federal grand jury that later indicted him on charges of income tax evasion.

title: OLIN BRASS RAISING SHEETSTRIP PRICES
description: Olin Brass announced yesterday that it planned to increase the price of copper and copper alloy sheet and strip products by 2 cents a pound, effective with shipments of Dec. 4.

title: Excerpts From. McGovern Interview on Election Reaction
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Nov. 13Following are excerpts from the transcript of an interview here last night with Senator George McGovern:

title: High Court Will Review a Rail Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP) The Supreme Court today agreed to review a lower court ruling on grain rates that is being challenged by 34 major railroads.

title: TIGHTER CONTROL OF PRICES URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13Two economists told Congress today that the wageprice controls program should be continued and should be made tougher on prices.

title: Chinese Delegate at the U.N. Bitterly Assails Soviet Plan
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13China's Deputy Foreign Minister today assailed Soviet proposal for the abolition of force in international relations in some of the strongest language heard in the General Assembly this year.

title: Business Briefs
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 13 (UPI)Total shipments of electrical products should reach a record $52.2billion in 1972, according to Bernard Falk, president of the National Electrical Manufacturers Association. This represents a 9.9 per cent increase over the 1971 figure of $47.5billion.

title: Santa Fe Line Will Spend $72Million on Equipment
description: The Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway, a unit of Santa Fe Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it would spend about $72million of its 1973 capital expenditures program for locomotives and freight cars.

title: Gold Tells How Detective Infiltrated Mafia's Trailer
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn said yesterday that three men who had made a Canarsie junkyard trailer their office had attempted to purchase both secret information and loyalty from a 25yearold detective assigned to his office.

title: Business Briefs
description: HATFIELD, England, Nov. 13 (AP)Ambassador Sung Chiahkuang announced today that China was buying eight more Trident jetliners at a total cost of $60million from Britain.

title: HIGH COURT DENIES ELLSBERG APPEAL ON WIRETAP DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The Supreme Court cleared the way today for the resumption of the Pentagon papers trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr., who are accused of making public the topsecret study of the origins of the Vietnam war.

title: Arthur Daley
description: When the late Joe E. Lewis was king of the nightclub comics, his routine included the sly refrain: Sam, you made the pants too long. Alex Webster is now entitled to paraphrase this in a mournful ditty to Commissioner Pete Rozelle. It would be: Pete, you made the games too long. If the gripping RedskinGiant battle at Washington on Sunday had been 63 seconds shorter, it would have produced a 1313 tie that the longsuffering Giant followers would have regarded as a moral victory.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Sooner or later an airline hijacking is going to result in a real disasterhundreds dead in a crash, or a bloody shootout in the sky, or even the reality of something as bizarre as last weekend's threat to crash a hijacked Southern Airways plane into the Oak Ridge atomic installation.

title: Miss Edelstein Bride on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov: 13Miss Lynda Edelstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Edelstein, was married here last Friday to Max Palevsky, an industrialist and heavy financial.backer of Senator George McGovern's Presidential campaign. Rabbi Leonard Beerman performed the ceremony at the Leo Bieck Temple.

title: Dentist Wins an Appeal On Anesthetic Mishap
Auto Bumper Discount Set
description: A 10 per cent bumper discount for collision coverage on all 1973 private passenger cars floreign and domesticwas announced yesterday by the RoyalGlobe Insurance Companies.

title: Market Place: Powerlessness Of Little Guy
description: Not too long ago, an irate investor in upstate New York decided to seek redress in Delaware against a corporation of that state.

title: Oneida Party Chief Backs Reid for Governor in 1974
description: UTICA, N. Y., Nov. 13 (AP)In one of the earliest political endorsements for the 1974 gubernatorial race, a Central New York Democratic leader threw his support today behind Representative Ogden R. Reid, Democrat of Westchester, as potential candidate for Governor.

title: Surrogate Approves Relocation 0f Sailors Snug Harbor to South
description: Manhattan Surrogate S. Samuel DiFalco approved yesterday the relocation of Sailors Snug Harbor, a home on Staten Island for aged, decrepit and wornout sailors since 1833, to a waterfront location at Sea Level, N. C.

title: Coach Supports Rodgers For Prize Despite Troubles
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Nov. 13 (UPI) Johnny Rodgers's scrapes with the law should not lessen the star wingback's chances for the Heisman Trophy, Nebraska's football coach, Bob Devaney, said today.

title: Equity Financing
description: MassMutual Income Investors, Inc., a new closedend diversified management investment company organized under the sponsorship of Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company, yesterday filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed offering of 7 million shares of capital stock. The offering will be made by underwriters managed by Lehman Brothers, Walston & Co., Robert W Baird & Co., J. C. Bradford Co., Alex Brown & Sons, Crowd!, Weedon & Co., Dain, Kalman & Quail Inc., McDonald & Co., and the Rauscher Pierce Securities Corporation. The new company's investment objective will be a high level of current income through a diversified portfolio consisting primarily of high quality marketable debt securities.

title: Job Action Stops Buses
description: WAPPINGERS FALLS, N. Y., Nov. 13Forty bus drivers of the Wappingers Falls school district failed to report to work this morning. All called in sick. According to Superintendent of Schools Robert Young, this is the second time this year this type of job action was taken. He could give no reason for it. Mr. Young said that car pools had been formed to get the students to school and that the schools were open as usual.

title: Connecticut Study Of Formula Milk Finds a Lead Taint
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 13Officials from the Connecticut State Department of Health reported here today finding high concentration of lead in prepared infant formula taken from the shelves of stores around the state.

title: Whereabouts of 2 Unknown
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Nov. 14 (AP)Henry A, Kissinger and General Haig flew by helicopter last night to Andrews Air. Force Base about 12 miles from Washington after a meeting at Camp David with President Nixon, a Presidential press aide said.

title: LUCAS IS INJURED, REED TAKES OVER;Knick Captain Gets Starting Spot Against Suns Tonight
description: The week ahead could prove a revealing one for Willis Reed and the Knicks.

title: U.S. Agency Seeks To Brighten Lights On the 1975 Autos
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP) The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said today that it might require much brighter automobile lights, starting with 1975 models.

title: Saigon Gets More Equipment
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, Nov. 14 (AP)The United States delivered 31 amphibious vehicles to South Vietnam yesterday as part of its equipment buildup for South Vietnamese forces.

title: Personalities: A Coach Pays Price of Success
description: For Al Conover, the Rice coach, a 2320 upset football victory over Arkansas has to be worth more than the cost of a damaged chair and a broken stadium window. In a pregame pep talk Saturday, Conover threw a chair through the window of the visiting team's dressing room in an attempt to create enthusiasm. Conover is more than happy to pay for the damage and yesterday Howard Pierce, the manager of War Memorial Stadium in Little Rock, Ark., said, We plan to be sure he has the opportunity to do so. If we failed to bill him, there's no telling how much damage the next visiting coach might do the stadium to get his team charged up.

title: Federated Stores Suits
description: Federated Department Stores has settled two suits against it filed by the ElderBeerman Corporation of Dayton, Ohio, for $1.2million in cash. The legal actions charging Federated with trying to monopolize the Dayton department store market, were started 10 years ago and sought damages of $100million.

title: Mugged Lawyer Asks Founding Of a Civilian Anticrime Corps
description: A prominent criminal lawyer who was mugged and robbed here in September called yesterday for the formation of a civilian anticrime corps.

title: Chicago Guild Backs Pact
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 12 (UPI)A new contract that would raise the top pay for newsmen to $317 a week by Feb. 1, 1974, was approved yesterday by Newspaper Guild members at The Chicago SunTimes and The Chicago Daily News. The contract between the Guild and the Newspaper Division of Field Enterprises, Inc., which is retroactive to March 1, provides an immediate increase for topscale reporters from $272.03 a week to $291, another increase next March 1 and the final jump to $317 four months before the contract expires May 31, 1974.

title: BROWNS SETBACK CHARGERS, 2117 Phipps Passes 38 Yards to Pitts With 41 Seconds Left for Clincher
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 13 (AP)Mike Phipps threw a 38yard touchdown pass to Frank Pitts with 41 seconds left and the Cleveland Browns defeated the San Diego Chargers, 2117, tonight in a National Football League game.

title: Dr. Elliott L. Weitzman, 49, A Psychiatrist Here, Dies
description: Dr. Elliott L. Weitzman, associate attending psychiatrist at New York Hospital and clinical associate professor at Cornell Medical College, died yesterday of cancer at his home, 68 East 86th Street. He 49 old.

title: Pagan Signs With Phils
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 13 (UPI)Jose Pagan, an infielder, who was released by Pittsburgh last month, was signed today by the Philadelphia Phillies. Pagan, 37 years old, has spent 14 years in the major leagues.

title: Patman Says Loan Board Makes Ambitious Grabs'
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 13Wright Patman, chairman of the House Banking and Currency Committee, charged here today that overly ambitious administrative grabs by the Federal Home Loan Bank Board were making controversial issues in the savings and loan industry more volatile.

title: Arabs Life Terms Upheld
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 13 (UPI)The Israeli Minitary Court of Appeals today upheld the life sentences imposed on two Arab women for, participating in the hijacking of a Belgian airliner five months ago. The two belonged to a Palestinian guerrilla unit that threatened to blow up the aircraft and the passengers if Israel did not release 100 convicted Arab guerrillas.

title: 34 Food Outlets Cited for Violating City's Health Code
description: Thirtyfour food establisbments said to have violated the city's Health Code, are on the latest list made public yesterday by the Health Services Administration. Seven places previously cited for violations have corrected them and two others have been ordered closed by the health authorities.

title: Tanaka Calls an Election In Bid to Tighten Control
description: TOKYO, Nov. 13  Premier Kakuei Tanaka dissolved the lower and more powerful house Of Parliament today and called a general election for Dec. 10.

title: TV:
description: Elizabeth Montgomery undergoes a real workout in The Victim, a suspense exercise if ever there was one. The American Broadcasting Company is showing it tonight at 8:30.

title: Letter to the Editor 8  No Title
description: To the Editor: While studying the President's landslide victory and Senator McGovern's devastating defeat, ask yourself this question: Had Alabama's Governor George Wallace run on the American party ticket, which party would today be number two? Can anyone seriously believe that Wallace wouldn't have carried more states than McGovern?

title: GAMES BID PUSHED BY COLORADO GROUP
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, Nov. 13 (AP)  Colorado is down but not out as host for the 1976 Winter Games, and the International Olympic Committee was asked today to give the state another chance.

title: School Bell for Philosophical Society
description: PHILADELPHIA  With the first Drudgery of Settling new Colonies over, Benjamin Franklin wrote in 1743, it was time for men of leisure to turn their attention to matters that let Light into the Nature of Things, tend to increase the Power of Man over Matter, and multiply the Conveniencies or Pleasures of Life.

title: Haig Flies Home and Reports to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. returned to Washington this afternoon and immediately flew by helicopter to Camp David. There he reported to President Nixon on his special mission to Saigon to persuade President Nguyen Van Thieu to join with the United States and North Vietnam in reaching an Indochina settlement.

title: Business Briefs
description: PARIS, Nov. 13 (Reuters)  France's trade balance reached a record surplus of 1.54 billion francs in October, the Finance Minister, Valery Giscard d'Estaing, announced today. This is up from a 74millionfranc surplus in September.

title: Letter to the Editor 10  No Title
description: To the Editor: The Nixon vote has been reported as a landslide. Really?

title: DRIVER IN BELFAST KILLED BY BRITISH
description: BELFAST; Northern Ireland, Nov. 13British soldiers killed the driver of a stolen car and wounded a bank robber in Belfast today.

title: Show Dramatizes Women's Victories
description: A voice speaks the words of Lucretia Mott, the Quaker and Abolitionist who could support 10 demands of the first Convention on Women's Rights, in Seneca Falls, N. Y., in 1848, but wasn't ready for the 11th: the right to vote.

title: Tanaka Pledges Yen Defense
description: TOKYO, Nov. 13 (Reuters)Premier Kakuei Tanaka said today that he would do everything in his power to prevent another upward revaluation of the yen.

title: School Identity Cards Due Next Month
description: A program to issue photo bearing identity cards to all of the city's 200,0,00 junior and senior high school students and the system's 100,000 teachers and staff members will go into effect next month in an effort to cut down on school crime.

title: STOCKS SET MARK FOR SECOND DAY
description: Chewing its way through a heavy resistance zone, the DowJones industrial average set a record closing high for the second straight session yesterday, but it failed to soar above 1,000 during the day, as it had on Friday.

title: Hunter Dies of Gunshot
description: CHESTER, Vt., Nov. 13 (AP) Milton Stowell, 30 years old, of Chester, died yesterday three hours after being shot on Flamstead Mountain near Chester'in what the police said appeared to be a hunting accident.

title: New Delhi Is Called Lax
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 13Members of the Indian Parliament accused the Government today of investigating the mailing of letter bombs in India in a halfhearted manner.

title: Head of Exim Bank Sees Shift for U.S. In Balance of Trade
description: LONDON, Nov. 13  Henry Kearns, president of the United States ExportImport Bank, predicted today that the American balance of trade, which has been running a substantial deficit, would shift into surplus py February or March of next year.

title: Marburger Issue Cleared For Vote in State Senate
City Human Rights Unit Hopes To Help ExConvicts Get Jobs
description: The city Commission on Human Rights plans to issue, probably next week, a guideline aiming to help former convicts get jobs. The draft regulation would bar employers from asking whether a jobseeker had been arrested or convicted unless the employer could show that the question was jobrelated.

title: Steel Production Shows an Increase Of 1.4% in the Week
description: Steel production last week reversed itself after two con secutive weeks of declines and posted a 1.4 per cent gain over the preceding week, according to figures released yesterday by the American Iron and Steel Institute. Actual output totaled 2,663,000 net tons for an index of 109.2. This compared with 2,626,000 and an index of 107.6 a week earlier.

title: Letter to the Editor 6  No Title
description: To the Editor: The way we are disenfranchising ourselves is frightening. At 7 P.M. on Nov. 7, with a fraction of the returns in and hours of polling remaining, a national election is over. Perhaps we should go all the way and leave the voting to the sample districts. The rest of us can stay home and see how we voted on TV.

title: Celtics Top Pistons 119117, In Hall of Fame Exhibition
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 13 (UPI)Henry Finkel, sank a layup with 4 minutes, 28 seconds left in the game tonight to break a 109109 tie and send the Boston Celtics off to a 119117 victory over the Detroit Pistons.

title: Arlan's and Its Lenders Agree on an Extension
description: The subordination agreement between Arlan's Department Stores, Inc., and its lenders has been extended until March, 1974, Edward Spector, chairman and president, reported yesterday. The agreement between the lenders and the selfservice discount house, whose headquarters are at 393 Seventh Avenue, affects a total of $19.8million of obligations that were due next January and March.

title: Advertising:
description: Betsy Ann Plank, executive vice president of Daniel J. Edelman, Inc., Chicago public relations concern, has been elected the first woman to become chairman of the Public Relations Society of America. The society is currently holding its annual Assembly of Delegates meeting in Detroit.

title: OIL GROUP WARNS ON ECOLOGY ISSUE
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 13In its first policy statement on energy, the American Petroleum Institute said today at its annual meeting that environmentalists would have to compromise on issues if difficulties on energy were to be avoided.

title: MARY B. COGGESHALL
description: CROTONONHUDSON, N.Y., Nov. 13Mary B. Coggeshall, a retired interior decorator and a former partner in the firm of Mary Coggeshall & Jeanette Jukes, Inc., of New York, died Saturday in a nursing home here. She was 92 years old and had lived at 10 Mitchell Place, New York.

title: CECILE KUCHUK
description: Cecile Kuchuk, a partner in the Pix, Inc., photographic agency here for 33 years until her retirement in 1969, died in her sleep yesterday at her home, 146 East 49th Street. She was 72 years old.

title: Detective Who Couldn't Be Bought Douglas A. Le Vien Jr.
description: The transformation from street gang warfare ori the wrong side of the fence to gangbusting as an undercover detective with the Brooklyn District Attorney!s rackets bureau was accomplished. by Douglas AlexanderLe Vien Jr., under the kneading of hardboiled Marine drill

title: MOSLEM IS CHARGED IN WITNESS'S KILLING
description: An 18yearold Moslem was arrested last night and charged with the knifeslaying of a member of the Jehovah's Witnesses sect at Kingdom Hall at 154 West 29th Street on Saturday.

title: In Ermine, Pearls and Jeans, They Came to Dance Theatre of Harlem's Gala
description: The invitation to the Dance Theatre of Harlem's gala benefit at the newly refurbished Loew's Victoria Theater on West 125th Street said, Come on back in ermine, pearls and jeans, and that's what rich and elegant blacks and whites by the hundreds did last night. But not without some soul search

title: 91 Nations Agree on Convention To Control Dumping in Oceans
description: LONDON, Nov. 13  Representatives of 91 countries, including all of the world's major maritime nations, agreed today on a global convention to end the dumping of poisonous waste matter at sea.

title: 4 ON PEACE MISSION RETURN FROM HANOI
description: Four peace activists returned from Hanoi yesterday, carrying 150 letters from American prisoners of war. They said that they had spoken with 11 captives during their oneweek stay in North Vietnam.

title: Fiscal Checkerboard
description: The aborted city study of neighborhoodbyneighborhood outlays for municipal services represents a useful start toward determining how fairly New York City's budget is distributed among its various districts. For the first time citizens in every part of the city have at least the beginning of an idea whether their neighborhood is doing well or poorly in terms of the money the city spends for police, fire, sanitation, schools, hospitals and welfare.

title: Papal Audience Reported
description: MADRID, Nov. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)Juan D. Per6n is to fly from Madrid to Rome tomorrow morning aboard jet belonging to the chairman of Fiat, Giovanni Agnelli, an informed source said here today.

title: CourtMartial Is Recessed In Slaying of Army Officers
description: FORT ORD, Calif., Nov. 13 (AP)A military jury deliberated for three hours today but failed to reach a verdict in the courtmartial of Pvt. Billy Dean Smith, who is accused of murdering two Army officers in Vietnam.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SHOW SHARP GAINS
description: Soybeans and soybean meal futures contracts set new lifeofcontract highs in most deliveries yesterday in active trading on the Chicago Board of Trade. Soybean oil futures also showed some sharp gains.

title: Five Killed in. Texas Crash
description: EAGLE PASS, Tex., Nov. 13 (UPI)Two cars collided headon on a curve north of the Rio Grande River in southwest Texas late yesterday; killing five persons. The victims were Herbert E. Ledesma, 27 years old, his twin sons, Adolfo and Rodolfo, less than a year old; and his daughter, Mary, 2, all of San Antonio; and Hazel Carpenter. Brazil of Eagle Pass. Mrs. Ledesma survived but was in critical condition.

title: WILLIAM EVANS SR., EXJERSEY, SPEAKER
description: GLEN ROCK, N. J., Nov. 13 William W. Evans Sr., who was speaker of the New Jersey Assembly in 1923 and president of the New Jersey Bar Association in 1937, died today in a Wayne nursing home. He was 86. years old and lived at 120 Central Avenue.

title: Won't Disclose Sources
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 13 William T. Farr, facing an indefinite jail term for contempt of court, said today he had no intention of disclosing his sources for a 1970 news article, although that would guarantee his freedom.

title: Dayan,in Capital, Expected To Ask for New Weapons
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  Israel's Defense Minister, Moshe Dayan, will hold toplevel policy talks here tomorrow in which he is expected to press for new weapons and seek assurances of continued deliveries of jet fighters, wellplaced Administration officials said today.

title: Hull Is Talk of Hockey, But Campbell Is Silent
description: Clarence Campbell couldn't talk about Bobby Hull yesterday, but virtually everyone else in hockey who was suing or being sued did. Hull, the millionaire, finally did what he had done more often than anyone else playing the gamescore some goals. His pair came on Sunday night in Winnipeg as his Jets scored a 52 victory over the Los Angeles Sharks in a World Association contest.

title: British Restructuring Health Service
description: LONDON, Nov. 13"Arnerican patients hate their doctors. British doctors hate their patients.

title: Seven Slain by Rio Gang
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 13 (AP)Seven persons were slain in gangland fashion by a gang that spread terror during eight hours of holdups in the suburbs of Rio, the state police reported today. The victims were six men and a woman. Most were shot as they tried to resist attacks over the weekend.

title: Letter to the Editor 5  No Title
description: To the Editor: Backlash, maintenance of status quo and mistrust of what is perceived as counterculture contributed heavily to President Nixon's lopsided majoritybut not to a Republican sweep because Senator McGovern, and not the Democrats, was the focal point of the voters fear. In Its preoccupation with domestic concerns the elec torate was indifferent, at best, to the agony of millions of fellow human beings in Indochina, daily slaughtered and savaged by our air power.

title: Leadership
description: PITTSBURGHThere come times when the cost of seeking to attain an objective promises to exceed by far any value which could accrue from its attainment. At that point wisdom dictates abandonment of pursuit of that objective, whether it be a government's political, or an individual's personal, objective.

title: DETECTIVE, FINED IN GETRICH CASE
description: The top detective in the office of Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell has been found guilty of failing to take proper police action in a case involving a man arrested for running a getrichscheme that included among its victims members of the District. Attorney's staff.

title: For Mental Patients, Social Club Eases Return to Outside World
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  It is Tuesday evening, and the weekly meeting of the Social Club in this community of 154,000 residents is in full swing.

title: People and Business
description: William It Hoover has just been handed the chairmanship of the Los Angelesbased Computer Sciences Corporation along with a nagging problem that has bedeviled the company for months. A C.S.C. computer system that has been the key to New York City's OffTrack Betting Corporation has proved almost as unpredictable as the horses.

title: High Court Rejects a Newsman's Petition for Review
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The Supreme Court rejected today a petition for review filed by William T. Farr, a former reporter for The Los Angeles HeraldExaminer, who was cited for contempt for refusing to tell the trial judge in the Charles Manson murder case who had given him a copy of a statement by a witness about the Manson family's murderschemes.

title: Angell Plays Alkan's Strenuous Music
description: Charlos Valentin Alkan's piano music represents a species of esthetic elephantiasis remarkable even in the 19th century, when an obsession with the grandiose seized European musicians. A colleague of both Chopin and Liszt, the French composer left piles of brutally difficult piano works that only in recent years have been dug into very much, principally by Raymond Lewenthal. The jury is still out as to whether the digging has been worthwhile.

title: IDLE DICE CAPTURES JUMPING AT TORONTO
description: TORONTO, Nov. 13  Rod Jenkins, on Idle Dice, a virtually unbeatable, combination all year, won the Blackwood Hodge stake for open and international jumpers tonight at the Royal Winter Fair horse show in the Coliseum.

title: Scratch at Aqueduct Hurts OTB Fans
description: One of the advantages a trackgoing follower of form has over his counterpart frequenting offtrack betting parlors was put into vivid focus at Aqueduct yesterday during the wagering on the featured $15,000 Bonavena Purse.

title: 2 Japanese Trade Bills Passed to Trim Surplus
description: TOKYO, Nov. 13The Japanese Diet passed tonight two trade bills and a large supplementary budget designed reduce Japan's growing annual trade surplus. The action came prior to the dissolving of the lower house of Parliament to open the way for a general election.

title: U.S. Issues Mailing Deadlines for Christmas
FASHION TALK
description: If men and women run around next summer in Roman striped sweaters, shirts and jackets, in colors brighter than the rainbow, thank Valentino. The Roman couturier, known for the elegance of his designs, brought his spring and summer readytowear collection to New York last week for eventual dispersal to American stores.

title: Cost of Diabetes in the U.S. Is Put at $2Billion a Year
description: Diabetes, the fifth leading cause of death by disease in the United States, costs $2billion year in medical services and potential earnings losses, Dr. William H. Grishaw, president of the American Diabetes Association, said here this week.

title: Balky Commuter Is Cleared by a Jury
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 13A jury tonight acquitted a Penn Central commuter whom the railroad had charged with theft of service for refusing to pay his fare on a hot, crowded Harlem Division train.

title: Underwater Lab Will Start Its Work Off Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 13 (UPI)The first four aquanautscientists to take up residence in Puerto Rico's new underwater research laboratory will dive Saturday for a twoweek stay at the bottom of the Caribbean off the island's southwest coast, project spokesmen said this week.

title: TIMES DATA SYSTEM INSTALLED AT PITT
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 13The first computerized hook up with The New York Times Information Bank has been installed at the University of Pittsburgh.

title: President of Hartford U. Duels a Student Leader: Custard Pies at 3 Paces
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 13They stood facetoface, weapons poised at three paces, the president of the University of Hartford and the chairman of the student association, both in shiny top hats and braced for the duel.

title: British Restructuring Health Service
description: LONDON, Nov. 13"American patients hate their doctors. BritiSh doctors hate their patients.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: How can a school that has produced such pro football stars as Willie Lanier, Leroy Kelly and Ray Chester live down the image of a football factory and live up to its own image of a black Ivy League school? Morgan State thinks it has the answer.

title: Giants'
description: Not quite. Those two words are the key to any appraisal of the New York Giants as they face their five remaining games with a 54 wonlost record.

title: VOICEPRINT TESTS ORDERED IN TRIAL; Supreme Court Rules 2 Men Held in Extortion Must Agree to Procedure
Newark's High Rise Is the Focus Of Unrest in Racially Split City
Gulf Oil's Earnings Drop; Superior's Profit Gains
Dacca Tries ExGovernor
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Nov. 13 (AP)A. M. Malik, governor of East Pakistan during the civil war last year that created Bangladesh, went on trial for his life today before a special tribunal. He is accused of waging war against the Bangladesh Government and of collaborating with the Pakistani Army.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New Jersey Supreme Court, reversing a decision that it had made five years ago, yesterday ordered two defendants in a criminal case to submit to voiceprint tests as a means of identification.

title: Election 72: As the Dust Settles
description: To the Editor: As soon as we Democrats finish picking up the teeth we have had knocked out, I trust that we will reflect on the lesson we should extract from this electoral experience: There is a crucial difference in nature between a party primary and an actual election for office.

title: Advertising:
description: None of the tradepress speculation on which agency would be the next to handle Hamm's beer has included DancerFitzgeraldSample. So (surprise! surprise!) that's the winner.

title: Philharmonic, Citing a $449;000 Crisis Deficit, Inserts Plea for Donations in Program Bills
description: The New York ?? in deep and unprecedented financial trouble because of what its chairman terms a desperation gap between inflationary costs and slowly rising income, is taking the unusual step of appealing to the public for donations.

title: Rich Mix Offered By Chamber Society At Lincoln Center
description: Lincoln Centers Chamber Music Society gave one of its typically wellordered concerts late Sunday afternoon in Tully Hall: no premieres or unusual discoveries this time, but four contrasting works rich with musical vitamins.

title: Dayan, in Capital, Expected To Ask for New Weapons
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  Israel's Defense Minister, Moshe Dayan, will hold toplevel policy talks here tomorrow in which he is expected to press for new weapons and seek assurances of continued deliveries of jet fighters, wellplaced Administration officials said today.

title: 14 Restaurants Agree on Pacts But 7 More Are Struck by Union
description: Local 1 of the Dining Room Employes Union reported yesterday that it. had negotiated new agreements with 14 restaurants but had exended its strike to seven more establishments.

title: RUFUS F. SOULE
description: PORTLAND, Me.; Nov. 13Rufus F. Soule, executive vice president and treasurer of the Associated Hospital Service of Maine. died yesterday in the Maine Medical Center here after a brief illness. He was 57 years old.

title: Savings Gain Sets a Record
description: The nation's mutual savings banks experienced a net deposit gain of $475million in October, a record for the month, according to preliminary figures released yesterday by the National Association of Mutual Savings Banks. The Mutual October high, $382million, was established a year ago.

title: Jets'
description: Unless the undefeated Miami Dolphins lose four of their next five games and the Jets go undefeated the rest of the season (prospects that seem very unlikely at this point), New York's chances of making the playoffs hinge on getting the elusive wild card spot.

title: The Theater: Melina Mercouri Stars in Lysistrata
description: There is nothing quite so gloomy as a gloomy comedy it is like a skeleton in the soup, or a fly at a feast. It is unnatural, unhappy and undesirable. It is difficult to believe that Melina Mercouri, tawnyhaired, brandyvoiced, could be associated with anything undesirable. She was at the Brooks Atkinson Theater last night. The strange combination was achieved by play, purporting to be by Atistophanes, and called Lysistrata.

title: PRIGS RETREAT FOR TAXEXEMPTS
description: Interest rates on corporate and taxexempt bonds moved in sharply opposite directions yesterday while other rates remained steady on light activity.

title: COOLINGOFF EDICT ISSUED IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, Nov. 13  Superior Court Judge Irwin I. Kimmelman declared today a sevenday coolingoff period in the racial controversy surrounding the construction of a blacksponsored highrise project in this city's predominantly white North Ward.

title: The Peron Factor
description: Juan Domingo Peron says he will end his 17year exile and return. to Argentina Friday at the age of 77 with the aim e restoring peace and understanding to divided country. On the record, his chance of achieving that goal seems remote, even if he wants it, which doubtful. In nine years of ironfisted rule, Mr. Peron was rarely a unifying force for Argentines and he left behind him a legacy of class strife that still makes effective government almost impossible.

title: Morrissey Gives the Director's View
description: HOLLYWOODWhen Paul Morrissey's film Heat previewed here recently, he arrived in an antique car, smiled through the beam of a welcoming spotlight and marched past a platoon of Hollywood columnists extending microphones. He was accompanied by his producer, Andy Warhol, and his star, Sylvia Miles, who fondled a pooch. For a few minutes, Hollywood pretended to be glamorous again.

title: A Change Is Suggested For Name of Philippines
description: MANILA, Nov. 13 (AP)The convention for drafting a new constitution for the Philippines has included a provision to rename the country Maharlika, a Tagalog word meaning noble, dignified.

title: Letter to the Editor 11  No Title
description: To the Editor: A Nixon landslideor another victory for money? It seems to me that votes won were in direct ratio to dollars spent.

title: Quality Is High, and Prices, Too, At 75th Eastern Antiques Fair
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 13The antiques show that opened here today at the Westchester County Center is one that New York might emulate. Big, diverse annd unusually rich, it comes close to approaching an entrepreneurs dream of something for. everyone.

title: Peron Bids Followers Prepare Peaceful Welcome
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 13Orders went out to the four corners of Argentina's Peronist movement today to prepare for a peaceful celebration for its leader's return from exile on Friday.

title: Flying With Terror
description: How many more airline passengers must fly with terror, how many airline employes face death or serious injury before the United States Government, the international community and the airlines put safety before politics or profit and take decisive action to curb aerial hijackers?

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. to discuss resolution against force in international relations and prohibition of use of nuclear weapons.

title: Keogh Leads Manhattan To I.C.4A Harrier Title
description: Confident he could conquer the course, but admittedly uptight about his competition, Mike Keogh led Manhattan to its first I.C.4A crosscountry championship in 18 years yesterday with a meetrecord performance.

title: F.T.C. CHALLENGES CREDIT MERGERS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission challenged today the acquisition of 45 credit bureaus by the Retail Credit Company, the nation's largest company in the business of gathering and selling information to businesses for insurance, claim, credit, employment and marketing purposes.

title: District 18 Board Sets the Stage For New Challenge of Pupil Shift
description: At an emotioncharged meeting that was marked by frequent outbursts from the audience, the community school hoard for Brooklyn's District 18 paved the way last night for new legal challenge to the Board of Education's action last month assigning 32 black and Puerto Rican children from Brownsville to John Wilson Junior High School 211 in Canarsie.

title: Protesters Return 31 Paintings by Indians
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13Thirtyone paintings by Indian artists, taken when the Bureau of Indians Affairs building was ransacked last week, were recovered today by the Federal Government.

title: 1.1MILLION WORTH OF HASHISH SEIZED
description: The Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs yesterday announced the arrest of seven men from the metropolitan area, including a City College teacher and a psychologist, In connection with the seizure of 1,100 pounds of hashish.

title: ERICH KAYS
description: Erich Kays, an assistant foreman of the advertising section of the composing room of The New York Times, died Sunday in Point Pleasant (N.J.) Hospital after suffering a heart attack. He was 54 years old and lived at 358 Maria Road, Toms River, N.J.

title: LOW BIRTH WEIGHT IS LINKED TO ILLS
description: A longterm British study of more than 17,000 births has shown that babies weighing less it birth than they should are more likely to suffer from a variety of educational and behavioral deficits by the time they reach school age.

title: COMPANIES STUDY URANIUM PROJECT
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation, the Union Carbide Corporation and the Bechtel Corporation said yesterday that they were looking into the feasibility of building and operating a uranium enrichment facility that would cost in excess of $1.5billiou.

title: McGovern Vows to Press Nixon On War and National Priorities
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Nov. 13Senator George McGovern says he is determined to keep the heat on President Nixon to end the Vietnam war, to reduce military spending and to reorder national priorities.

title: Nassau Is Offered A Record Budget And Slight Tax Cut
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 13A record budget for 1973 of $475,144,000, which calls for decrease in the propertytax rate, was proposed today by Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso.

title: More Girdles Than Buyers
description: BOSTON, Nov. 13 (AP)A local underwear manufacturer has confirmed what fashion experts have been aware of for sometimethe girdle has had it.

title: Price Commission Grants 2 Increases for Boeing Co.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP)  The Price Commission ap, proved price increases today for the Boeing Company's commercial airplanes.

title: Leaders of Filipino Reds To Be Tried in Absentia
description: MANILA, Nov. 13The Philippine Government took steps today to try in absentia accused Filipino Communist rebels who have gone underground.

title: HEALTH PROJECTS GET FUNDING PLAN
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 13A study group of the American Public Health Association has concluded that longterm funding rather than yearly appropriations is needed to insure the stability and quality of the federally funded health care centers in poverty areas around the country.

title: New Haven Trustee Bid Lost
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (UPI)The Supreme Court refused today to consider an appeal from the ruling of the Penn Central Reorganization Court in Philadelphia before it has been heard in.the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit.

title: Whalers, Down 40, Rally For 44 Tie With Aeros
description: BOSTON, Nov. 13 (UPI)Tim Sheehy scored his second goal with one minute left in regulation time tonight as the New England Whalers rallied from a 40 deficit to tie the Houston Aeros 44 in a World Hockey Association game.

title: N.Y.U., Cornell, Army in Soccer Playoffs
description: Long Island University, Cornell, Army and New York University were named yesterday to participate in the New York State (District 2) regional playoffs of the National Collegiate Athletic Association soccer championship.

title: Afghans Deliver Wheat to Avert Famine
description: JAWAND, Afghanistan, Nov. 13 (AP) Hundreds of camels are carrying emergency wheat to a score of Afghanistan's remote valleys, promising life to about 160,000 peasants facing starvation for the scond time in a year.

title: Rudolf Friml Dead in Hollywood at 92
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 13Rudolf. Friml, composer. of Rose Marie, The Vagabond King, The Three Musketeers and 30 other operettas, died last night at Presbyterian Hospital here. He was 92 years old.

title: Margaret Webster Dies at 67; Stage Director and ExActress
description: LONDON, Nov. 13Margaret Webster, the actress and stage director, died here tonight at the age of 67.

title: SAIGON AIDE SAYS AWES ARE CLOSER ON TRUCE ACCORD
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 13Foreign Minister Tran Van Lam said today that the visit of Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. had brought the United States and South Vietnam closer together on a draft peace settlement. Mr. Lam added that there were still some problems requiring clarification before Saigon would accept the accord.

title: Gold Tells How Detective Infiltrated Mafia's Trailer
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn said yesterday that three men who had made a Canarsie junkyard trailer their office had attempted to purchase both secret information and loyalty from a 25yearold detective assigned to his office.

title: The Man Who Saved Babar From Oblivion
description: Once upon a time, Laurent de Brunhoff began quite seriously, my mother told us this story of a little elephant. We were so excited, my brother and I, we went and told my father. My father was so excited, he made a book for us.

title: Howard W. Nugent,67, Dies Pinkerton Vice President
description: Howard W. Nugent, who retired in 1968 as vice president of Pinkerton's, Inc., in charge of investigative service, died Sunday in Southside Hospital, Bay Shore, L. I. He was 67 years old and lived at 156 Church Avenue in Islip, L. I.

title: Bus And Cab Are Robbed Brooklyn Youth Seized
description: A 19yearold Brooklyn youth was captured, early yesterday in a subway station in the BedfordStuyvesant section and charged with robbing at gunpoint the drivers of a bus and cab within five minutes.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 13 (AP)British exports rose and imports declined last month, the Department of Trade and Industry announced today, but the nation's foreign commerce was still in deficit by $112.8million. British foreign trade has been in deficit every month this year except in June and July.

title: TV:
description: With his latest documentary, Essene, presented on the Public Broadcasting Service last night at 8 o'clock, Frederick Wiseman takes yet another long stride toward what might be called the purification of his filmmaking form, a form that has already proved itself to be among the most intelligent and most powerful in contemporary film.

title: TROOPS IN LEBANON. ASSUME POLICE ROLE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 13The Lebanese Army, acting on orders from the Government, took over the maintenance of law and order today to cope with strikes and demonstrations in protest against the killing of two persons in a clashon Saturday.

title: American Agronomics Wins Ruling Against Intervention
description: The American Agronomics Corporation announced yesterday that Judge Robert Krupansky of the Federal District Court in Cleveland had denied a plaintiff's motion to intervene in the settlement of a Securities and Exchange Commission suit against the company.

title: REP. FRANK T. BOW OF OHIO DIES AT 71
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP) Representative Frank T. Bow, Republican of Ohio, a member of. Congress since 1950, died today in Bethesda Naval Hospital. His age was 71.

title: Saigon Aide Sees Progress
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 13Foreign Minister Tran Van Lain said today that the visit of Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. had brought the United States and South Vietnam closer together on a draft peace settlement. Mr. Lam added that there were still some problems requiring clarification before Saigon would accept the accord.

title: Murders and Rapes
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 13 (AP)James R. Hoffa said today that during the 58 months he spent in Lewisburg, Pa., Federal prison he saw four murders committed and also witnessed an undesignated number of mass rapes.

title: Letter to the Editor 3  No Title
description: To the Editor: Those who delight in calling McGovern the Goldwater of the left have missed a most important distinction between these two victims of ballot avalanche.

title: Chess:
description: Not so many years ago, disputes over chess strategy gave off much heat, but very little light. Idiosyncrasy and bias were the order of the day.

title: Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Steig, Surviving as He Nears 65, Finds a Peace in Being a Depressed Cartoonist
description: KENT, Conn., Nov. 13At the top of his forms as he scrapes the bottom of the human psyche, William Steig, the cartoonist, tomorrow shrugs off his 65th birthday and the stimulating despair of a lifetime.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A recent issue of the Sport Fishing Institute's news bulletin reveals that in 1970 sport fishermen spent nearly $5billion (including expenditures for goods and services directly related to angling).

title: Treasury Account Falls
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (Reuters)The Treasury said today its special nonmarketable obligations account, made up mostly of United States securities issued to foreigners, declined $24.8million in the week ended Nov. 8. Since Nov. 1, the account has declined $99.4million, making the total outstanding $21,838,600,000billion as of Nov. 8.

title: U.S. Study Chides City on Job Fund
description: A Federal study has asserted that New York City has failed to use an opportunity to ease excessive civil service requirements under the Emergency Employment Act program that has given Federal funds for city jobs for the unemployed.

title: 8 American Tuna Boats Seized by Ecuador's Navy
description: UITO, Ecuador, Nov. 13 (AP) The Ecuadorian Navy has opened the new fishing season with the seizure of eight United States tuna boats within this nation's disputed 200mile sea limit.

title: 5 CrimeBureau Policemen Arrested as S.I. Grafters
description: Five plainclothes patrolmen in the Organized Crime Control Bureau were arrested yesterday on charges of having Shielded mobrun gambling on Staten Island.

title: HIGH COURT DENIES RISEN APPEAL ON WIRETAP DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The Supreme Court cleared the way today for the resumption of the Pentagon papers trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr., who are accused of making public the topsecret study of the origins of the Vietnam war.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
description: To the Editor: There will undoubtedly be many theories and analyses to account for the Nixon landslide over McGovern. Here's mine:

title: Cuba Reported Firm on Jailing Hijackers
description: Cuban authorities at Jose Marti Airport in Havana said the three gunmen who hijacked a Southern Airways jet there over the weekend would spend the rest of their lives in fourbyfourbyfourfoot boxes, the head of the Federal Aviation Administration, John H. Shaffer, said yesterday.

title: ANDREW S. DILLON
description: Andrew S. Dillion, retired president of Kerr Steamship Company, a maritime agency here, died Sunday in the Cranford (N.J.) Health and Extended Care Center. He was 78 years old and lived at 823 Cedar Terrace, Westfield, N.J.

title: 5 GOVERNORS FIGHT DEMOCRATS'
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13Five Democratic Governors joined today the move to replace Jean Westwood at the head of the Democratic National Committee and to give their party what they called a new sense of direction after Senator George McGovern's crushing defeat least week.

title: Books of The Times
description: One can praise David Halberstam's The Best and the Brightesthis seventh book and the sequel, in a way, to his earlier book on Vietnam, The Making of a Quagmirefor any number of excellent qualities: for its thoroughness and liveliness, for its clarity of detail on such hitherto confusing topics as the events leading up to the Tonkin Gulf, Resolution, or for its singular accomplishment of having retold the whole painful story of the Kennedy and Johnson years, which boils down in essence to the story of America in Vietnam, and made it not only bearable to read, but even tragic in the true and exhilarating sense of that much misused word. But such manner of praise, while de served, is superficial. What seems to me most impressive about The Best and the Brightest is Mr. Halberstam's unusual approach to writing contemporary history, and the unusual assets he has forced that approach to yield.

title: Bridge:
