description: LANCASTER. Pa., Nov. 13 A young East Coast partnership led a field of 112 pairs into the final session of the life master men's pair championship at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals here tonight.

title: EUROPE TO DISCUSS SHIFTS OF TRADE
description: GENEVA, Nov. 13  Against strong pressure from the United States, Canada and Australia, the European Economic Community said today that it would open negotiations in March to compensate foreign traders for markets lost. as result of enlargement of the Common Market.

title: COLUMBIA LISTS ITS INVESTMENTS
description: Columbia University has made public a list of all its investments in stocks and bonds and reiterated that it is studying what to do with its investments in companies doing defenseand warrelated work, companies involved in the socalled Third World and companies whose work affects the environment.

title: STOCKTON UPSETS PILIC BY 6:41 76
description: ROTTERDAM, The Netherlands, Nov. 13 (AP)  Dick Stockton and Jeff Borowiak, two rapidly improving Americans, upset seeded players today in the opening round of a World Championship Tennis Tournament.

title: Broad Inquiry Under Way Into the Selling of Paroles
description: A major investigation into the possibility of the widespread sale of parole to convicts was announced yesterday by District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx following the arrest of a correction officer accused of having accepted $5,000 from a prisoner.

title: Connors Ousts Fletcher
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, Nov. 13 (AP)Jimmy Connors of Bellville, Ill., outsted Ian Fletcher of Australia, 6.4, 64, today and entered the second round of a British indoor tennis series.

title: The Rib Belonged to Eve: II
description: Why did the cruel equation, sex=sin (for women only) begin with agriculture and patriarchy and why did it begin at its most sadistic extreme?

title: Mazur Resigns as Coach, Patriots Name Bengtson
description: Following the Patriots worst defeat in their history, 520, to the Miami Dolphins, John Mazur resigned yesterday as head coach of the New England club. A few hours later, Phil Bengtson, the former Green Bay Packer coach, was named to the position on an interim basis.

title: Grant for Study of Seals
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 13 (AP) The Sea and Shore Fisheries Department has received a $7,290 grant from the National Geographic Society, Robert L. Dow, research director, said today. The money will be used in a study of the habits of seals.

title: McGovern Vows to Press Nixon On War and National Priorities
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Nov. 13Senator George McGovern says he is determined to keep the heat on President Nixon to end the Vietnam war, to reduce military spending and to reorder national priorities.

title: LAOTIAN AIRPORT HIT BY 51 ROCKETS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 13  Communist forces fired 51 large rockets into the airport of the royal Laotian capital of Luang Prabang today, damag ing at least five military planes.

title: G.O.P. Bars Efforts to Weaken Measure to Guard Flood Plains
14 Paintings Worth Million Stolen at French Museum
description: BAGNOLSSURCEZE, France, Nov. 13 (Reuters)  Fourteen impressionist paintings valued at over $1million have been stolen from a museum in this southern French town, the police said today.

title: HEAVY U.S. RAIDS ON NORTH GO ON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 14The United States command reported yesterday that American planes bombed North Vietnam heavily in a continued effort to block the rush of supplies to Communist forces in South Vietnam.

title: 2 Brothers DenyTax Evasion
description: Two brothers, partners in a Catskill resort hotel, pleaded not guilty in Federal Court in Manhattan yesterday to charges of evading taxes on nearly $1.4million of undeclared income. Ben J. Slutsky and Julius Slutsky, both of Ellenville, partners in the Nevele Country Club, Ellenville, formally denied charges filed Nov. 2 by a special grand jury. They remained free without bail.

title: Catholic Bishops Urge Experiments In New Schooling
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The American Bishops of the Roman Catholic Church approved today their first pastoral message in four yearsa wideranging document on parochial education.

title: Bon Vivant to Open Under a New Name And Tight Controls
description: NEWARK, Nov. 13 (AP)Bon Vivant, the 109yearold canning company that closed following the death in 1971 from botulism of a man who ate a can of its vichyssoise, has resumed operations under guidance from the Federal Food and Drug Administration and with a new name.

title: Jersey Senate Will Vote On Marburger Thursday
description: TRENTON, Nov. 13The controversial renomination of Dr. Carl L. Marburger as New Jersey's State Commissioner of Education was released today by the Senate Judiciary Committee, where he had been blocked by the state's teacher lobby and conservative opponents of school busing.

title: Kerner Trial Postponed Until After the Holidays
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 13 (AP)A Federal judge today postponed the trial of former Gov. Otto Kerner of Illinois, who is charged with conspiracy and bribery, until Jan. 3.

title: Submersible to Get A Stronger Sphere For Atlantic Study
description: A titanium sphere of extreme strength is being provided by the United States Navy to enable a crew of three, aboard the deep submersible Alvin, to descend into the greatest depths of the midAltantic rift valley.

title: HANOI SENDS THO TO PARIS TO HOLD NEW PEACE TALKS
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, Nov. 14  Le Duc Tho, the North Vietnamese Politburo member who is in charge of private negotiations with the United States, left Hanoi for Paris today to take part in another round of peace talks, the Hanoi radio reported.

title: Notes on People
description: Charles L. Fefferman, who began his college education at the age of 14, has been named a full professor at Princeton University at the age of 23. Mr. Fe!ferman, named to the mathematics department, is the youngest person to become a full professor in the 226year history of the university, In 1966, at the age of 16, he was graduated from the University of Maryland with a Bachelor of Science degree in physics and mathematics. He received his Ph.D. in 1969 from Princeton. For the past two years he has served as a full pfbfessor of mathematicsat the University of Chicago.

title: James Earl Jones Plans Debut As Director of Cherry Orchard
description: James Earl Jones, who began appearing on the New York stage in 1957 and who won top acting honors for his stage and film performances in The Great White Hope, is making his directorial debut this season with Chekhov's The Cherry Orchard.

title: BRITAIN ADAMANT ON LETTER BOMBS
description: LONDON, Nov. 13 The British Government, worried about the influx of letter bombs sent to Jews in London and Glasgow, issued a warning today to any government giving aid or comfort to terrorists.,

title: Garelik Calls OTB Pot of Gold Ads Misleading
description: City Council President Sanford D. Garelik called yesterday for an end to pot of gold advertising by the Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: Yale Reorganizing Plan Is Confirmed by Court
description: Federal Judge Harold R. Tyler Jr. signed an order here yesterday confirming a plan of reorganization of Yale Express System, Inc., and the five of its subsidiaries that are in reorganization.

title: Letter to the Editor 9  No Title
description: To the Editor: Now that four more years is a fact rather than a campaign chant, what better time, from all valid points of view, to discuss, debate and determine the advantages versus the disadvantages of a single sixyear term for the President and Vice President of the United States?

title: Letter to the Editor 2  No Title
description: To the Editor: President Nixon's victory is being touted as a vast mandate for his Administration. Quite to the contrary, a much more temperate view is in order.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13On most days the Presidency of the United States is a job most of us would just as soon not have, thank you. And not because of all that nonsense about the dreadful burden, the awful loneliness and the splendid misery either. Most of us know nonsense when we hear it. If the job is such a dreadful, awful, miserable, lonely burden, why are politicians constantly struggling for it?

title: Rockefeller Forecasts a Tight Budget
description: HORSEHEADS, N.Y., Nov. 13 Warning that we're going to have an extremely tight budget next year, Governor Rockefeller today began a series of town meetings do listen to taxpayers throughout the state as he begins to shape his 1973 legislative program and his proposed state budget for the 1973.74 fiscal year.

title: New Chairman Sees Steady Gain for Sears Outlays
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 13  Sears, Roebuck & Co., the country's largest retailer, plans to maintain and probably to expand its annual capital outlays of about $275million during the next five years.

title: 5 CrimeBureau Policemen Arrested as S.I. Grafters
description: Five plainclothes patrolmen in the Organized Crime Control Bureau were arrested yesterday on charges of having shielded mobrun gambling on Staten Island.

title: House Majority Whip Seeks Post Held by Hale Boggs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP)  Representative Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., Democrat of Massachusetts, formally announced Ids candidacy today for. House majority, leader.

title: CHARLES E. AMES, 77, INVESTMENT BANKER
description: LAUREL HOLLOW, L.I., Nov. 13  Charles Edgar Ames, former investment banker, died last night in Huntington Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived here.

title: Borch Sees Gap in Foreign Policy
description: Fred J. Borch, who is retiring as chief executive of the General Electric Company, charged here yesterday that the United States had subordinated foreign economic policy and, in effect, now has no foreign economic policy.

title: BREZHNEV ASSAILS U.S ON CEASEFIRE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communise party leader called on the United States tonight to remove the obstacles created by the American side literally on the eve of signing of a Vietnamese ceasefire agreement.

title: FRANK M. RUSSELL, OFFICIAL 77
description: Frank M. (Scoop) Russell, a former vice president of the National Broadcasting Company and for 30 years an important figure In broadcasting liaison with the Federal Government, died Saturday at his home in Kenwood, Md. He was 77 years old.

title: Dabney of Boys High Wins 2d CrossCountry Crown
description: Bill Dabney of Boys High successfully defended his Public Schools Athletic League crosscountry title at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx, yesterday.

title: Cuba Reported Firm on Jailing Hijackers
description: Cuban authorities at Jose Marti Airport in Havana said the three gunmen who hijacked a Southern Airways jet there over the weekend would spend the rest of their lives in fourbyfourbyfourfoot boxes, the head of the Federal Aviation Administration, John H. Shaffer, said yesterday.

title: NASA BARS FUNDS TO AID PUBLIC TV
description: A controversial proposal by the Corporation for Public Broadcasting that the nation's public television stations devote massive coverage to the next Apollo, moon walks ran into trouble yesterday.

title: 5 LINKED TO MANSON ARE HELD IN SLAYING
description: STOCKTON, Calif., Nov. 13 (AP)Two former followers of Charles Manson, the hippie cult leader, were among five persons charged today with the slaying of a woman whose body was dug up here four days after her, husband's body was unearthed 100 miles away.

title: Private. Study Supports Nixon On Possibility of No Tax Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13A prominent private research group supported today President Nixon's contention that a tax increase could be avoided in the next few years, but it suggested that Government spending could safely go a little higher than the President seems to want.

title: Letter to the Editor 4  No Title
description: To the Editor: The repeated reference to 521 versus seventeen electoral votes as a measure of strength of the opposing sides in the elections creates a false picture. Thirty million against 45 million is the true reality and is not the same as 521 against seventeen.

title: PROPOSAL TO AID JUSTICES SCORED
description: A proposal to establish a national court of appeals to ease the workload of the Supreme Court evoked skepticism last night from Chief Judge Henry J. Friendly of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: U.S. Force in Vietnam Cut 1,100 Last Week, to 31,100
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. Nov. 13 (AP) American military strength in South Vietnam dropped by 1,100 men last week, to 31,100, the United States command announced today. Nine hundred of those leaving were from the Army.

title: 91 Nations Agree on Convention To Control Dumping in Oceans
description: LONDON, Nov. 13  Representatives of 91 countries, including all of the world's major maritime nations, agreed today on a global convention to end the dumping of poisonous waste matter at sea.

title: Assembly to Vote on News Media Bill
BREZHNEV ASSAILS U.S. ON CEASEFIRE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communist party leader, called on the United States tonight to remove the obstacles created by the American side literally on the eve of signing of a Vietnamese ceasefire agreement.

title: Brandt Leads Barzel in Crowd Appeal
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Nov. 12At the outset of the last week of West Germany's election campaign, Willy Brandt appears to be clearly outpointing his opponent for the Chancellorship, Rainer Barzel, in crowd appeal and presentation of the issues.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (Reuters)Effective interest rates on Federal Housing AdministrationVeterans Administration home mortgage rates closed during the first week of October, rose slightly to 7.67 per cent from 7.64 per cent for September, the Department, of Housing and Urban Development reported today.

title: Passengers on Hijacked Jet Recall Anger, Fear, Humor and a Sense of Doom
description: Alex Halberstadt, a 47yearold construction engineer, recalls thinking fleetingly of how odd he must have looked sitting in an airliner without his trousers on, a fistful of ransom money in his lap, and a man sitting beside him with a Luger in one hand and a hand grenade in the other.

title: U.S. CHALLENGES U.N. ON TERROR
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13  The United States challenged the United Nations today to take meaningful action to combat international terrorism.

title: Reserve. Voted in August For 59% Growth Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.13 (Reuters)  The Federal Reserve Board's Open Market Committee voted for moderate grOwth in monetary aggregates at its meeting on Aug. 15, the board reported today. Minutes of the meetings are made available 90 days later.

title: Letter to the Editor 7  No Title
description: To the Editor: The pollsters predicted a landslide victory for President Nixon and the people made it so. Thus, the vast majority of voting Americans demonstrated their appreciation for the political acumen that Richard Nixon afforded the nation in his first term as President.

title: Hull Is Talk of Hockey, But Campbell Is Silent
description: Clarence Campbell couldn't talk about Bobby Hull yesterday, but virtually everyone else in hockey who was suing or being sued did. Hull, the millionaire, finally did what he had done more often than anyone else playing the gamescore some goals. His pair came on Sunday night in Winnipeg as his Jets scored a 52 victory over the Los Angeles Sharks in a World Association contest.

title: Letter to the Editor 12  No Title
description: To the Editor: Now that the election is over, I must say in retrospect that the Democratic party virtually did everything within its power to assure President Nixon's reelection.

title: Brezhnev Says Voting In U.S. Spurred Peace
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13 (AP)The Soviet Communist party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, said tonight that the United States Presidential election had strengthened the prospects of world peace.

title: COOLINGOFF EDICT ISSUED IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, Nov. 13  Superior Court Judge Irwin I. Kimmelman declared today sevenday coolingoff period in the racial controversy surrounding the construction of a blacksponsored highrise project in this city's predominatly white North Ward.

title: Kick in Teeth Delights a Viking
description: Errol Mann, the Detroit kicker, came on the field with five seconds left to play and his assignment was simple. Kick a 33yard field goal that would give the Lions a 1716 victory over the Vikings. I've never been so sure of anything in my life, said Mann later. I knew when hit it that it was no more than two feet off dead center. But Wally Hilgenberg, the rugged Viking linebacker, took the Detroit back blocking on the corner out of the way and here came swift Bobby Bryant, the combative Minnesota defensive back. No one touched me. I had a clear shot, said Bryant whom Larry Walton of the Lions had beaten for a touchdown pass.

title: 5 GOVERNORS FIGHT DEMOCRATS CHIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13Five Democratic Governors joined today the move to replace Jean Westwood at the head of the Democratic National Committee and to give their party what they called a new sense of direction after Senator George McGovern's crushing defeat least week.

title: Warning From Detroit
description: Not since the nineteenth century, when universal public education in the United States still faced open hostility and covert obstruction, have serious doubts been raised about this nation's commitment to the education of all of its children. Yet, it is now becoming increasingly evident that just such doubts have begun to spread.

title: U.S. SUES TO END A FOOD MERGER
description: The Justice Department filed yesterday an antitrust suit to nullify the acquisition of the Great Western Foods Company of Knoxville, Tenn., by the Federal Company of Memphis.

title: PEGGY LADEN
description: Mrs. Margaret Laden Brigham, who as Peggy Laden was a Powers model in the fashion world of the 1930's, died Sunday of viral pneumonia in New York. She was 57 years old and lived at 30 East 65th Street. Her husband, William T. Brigham, is president of the Juneham Corporation, a sales organization.

title: LastChance Weekend For Two CarHoppers
description: If you think the oldtime carhopping of the United States Auto Club was chaotic, wait till you see the finale of the Camel GT series this weekend at Daytona, Fla. After a few ludicrous fiascos in 1967 and 1968, USAC tightened its rules to prohibit a driver from taking over someone else's car for the purpose of winning points. Unfortunately for the International Motor Sports Association, which sanctions the Camel GT series (Corvettes, Porsches, Camaros, etc.), its regulations permit a kind of carhopping that will surely baffle the spectators on Sunday and leave the track announcer speechless.

title: City Man, 54, a Suicide
description: HAMPTON, N. H., Nov. 14 (UPI)The body of Reed Hobart Ellis Jr., 54 years old, of Manhattan, was found today hanging from a tree off Interstate 95 near Hampton, N. H., the authorities reported. The county medical examiner, Leland Davis, ruled the death Su itide.

title: NEW MOTIVE SEEN IN MUNICH ATTACK
description: PARIS, Nov. 14An authoritative Western diplomatic source reported today that just over a week before  the Palestinian attack at the Munich Olympics in September, Israel and. Egypt had accepted a plan for direct, secret contacts to open negotiations.

title: State Opens Campaign Here to Close Hotels That Are Havens for Crime
description: The State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, has started a drive against hotels here that are sanctuaries for criminals, drug addicts and pushers.

title: Regents Ask Aid Increase For HardPressed Areas
description: ALBANY, Nov. 14The State Board Of Regents pro:. posed a sweeping change today in the system of aid for public schools to provide more funds for districtS that have neared the limits of their taxing ability while limiting spending by wealthier ones.

title: CITY WEIGHS PLAN ON SEX EDUCATION
description: The Board of Education is expected to authorize a new sexeducation program  devised by city high school studentsto counteract the growing rate of pregnancy and venereal disease among teenagers.

title: MuchHeralded B.B.C., at 50, Face's Uncertain Future
description: LONDON, Nov. 14The British Broadcasting Corporation, the wellmodulated voice of London, celebrated its 50th anniversary today with its past.wrapped in glory but with its future clouded by uncertainty,

title: Mongolians Visit Cuba
description: MIAMI, Nov. 14 (AP)Yumzhagiin Tsedenbal, first secretary of the Mongolian Communist party, headed a highlevel delegation arriving in Cuba today for an official visit, the Havana radio reported.

title: Equity Financing
description: In what was believed to be the largest common stock sale ever made by an electric utility. the Southern Company yesterday afternoon raised $172million by selling 8.3 million shares at competitive bidding. A sevenmanager underwriting group headed by First Boston made the winning bid and then offered the stock for sale publicly at $21.25 a share 371/2 cents above the close yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange. The 30 per cent pot"the 2.46 million shares set aside for orders to the syndicate as a whole or to firms not in the underwriting groupwas reported all sold almost immediately. The underwriters had no estimate of overall sales.

title: Wallace's Physician Says Acupuncture Is Considered
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 14 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace's chief physician said today the possibility of using acupuncture on the partly paralyzed Governor is under consideration.

title: North Stars Beat Kings
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 14 (AP)Danny Grant, Murray Oliver, and J. P. Parise scored in a threeminute span of the first period tonight and kept the Minnesota North Stars unbeaten against the Los Angeles Kings over the last four National Hockey League seasons with a 41 victory.

title: Troop Movements Planned
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 14The Argentine Navy's fleet sailed today for Buenos Aires four days before Mr. Peron is due to return here from exile.

title: TRUSTEES CLEARED IN PACIFIC LAND CASE
description: Judge J. Bertram Wegman has handed down a decision in Brooklyn Supreme Court clearin gthe trustees of the Pacific Land Trust in a suit brought by John S. Kroese, a building supply company executive and a shareholder of the trust. The suit was concluded in April, 1970

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 14You can always find a caddie among the students at Rutgers University. With books under his arm instead of a golf.bag over his shoulder, he will be one of the 53 young men now enrolled. at the university through a special golf scholarship.

title: Pesticides and Mercury Peril WhiteFaced Ibis
description: VICORIA, Tex., Nov. 14The whitefaced ibis, a stunningly beautiful marsh bird, has been declining in numbers along much of the Texas coast in recent years, an apparent victim of pesticides and mercury used to treat rice seed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have read with interest the article in The Times of Nov. 4 giving an outline of the proposed housing project for the Inwood section of Manhattan.

title: 5 Centuries of Genuine Forgeries Go on Display
description: A desperate letter written in French on fine handmade paper in 1569 reads: I am to be moved tomorrow from here to Tattbery & soon after to Nottingham, where I shall be placed in the hands of the greatest enemies have in this world.... Speak yourselves to the Queen of England to prevent as much as you can my removal.

title: Denial by Israeli Officials
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 14  Israeli Foreign Ministry sources denied tonight that there had been any agreement between Israel and Egypt for direct negotiation before the Munich shootings in September.

title: Japanese Imports Set A Record Last Month
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14 (UPI)Japan set a new high of $2.1million in its imports in October, the Finance Ministry disclosed today.

title: Regents Ask Aid Increase For HardPressed Areas
description: ALBANY, Nov. 14The State Board of Regents proposed a sweeping change today in the system of aid for public schools to provide more funds for districts that have neared the limits of their taxing ability while limiting spending by wealthier ones.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Raytheon Company said yesterday that it had been awarded a $104million contract for continued engineering development of the SamD air defense system by the Army Missile Command.

title: Advertising:
description: The William Esty Company, which among the larger agencies probably has the greatest concentration of packagegoods accounts, has just won the $5million Magnavox account, which it will handle on a fullservice basis.

title: Marianne Moore Room Set Up at Museum
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 14Right down to the green footstool given her by T. S. Eliot, the Manhattan living room where Marianne Moore wrote most of her poetry toward the end of her life has been faithfully recreated at the Rosenbach Foundation Museum here.

title: Waiters'
description: The Dining Room Employes Union reported yesterday that it had reached agreement with 10 additional restaurants, raising the number of settlements to 17. Terms of the settlements were nat disclosed.

title: Enemy Pullbacks Reported Near Saigon and the DMZ
Average Yield Declines At Fanny May Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (Reuters)Average yield of accepted bids declined at yesterday's auction for fourmonth commitments on F.H.A.V.A. mortgages, the Federal National Mortgage Association announced,

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LISBON, Nov. 14 (Agence FrancePresse)  Premier Marcello Caetano declared today that his country would not negotiate with rebel movements in Portugal's African territories.

title: Strike Called for Friday
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 14 (Reuters)Argentina's powerful peronistdominated General Confederation of Labor tonight called a general strike to mark the return home this Friday of Juan D. Peron.

title: SOVIET WILL SEEK TRADE CREDIT HERE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14  James J. Needham, chairman of the board of the New York Stock Exchange, announced plans today for a Soviet delegation to visit New York next year to discuss means of financing expansion of SovietAmerican trade.

title: Dow Index Has Mystique And Prestige All Its Own
Garelik Calls for Hiring Of 2,000 More Policemen
description: The immediate hiring of 2,000 more policemen, with 1,000 of them to be posted near public schools, was proposed yesterday by City Council President Sanford D. Garelik.

title: STREET'S REACTION
description: The long awaited decisive penetration of the 1,000 level by the DowJones industrial average was greeted in Wall Street yesterday as an event of mainly psychological significance for the stock market.

title: Companies Find Drug Rehabilitation for Workers Pays
description: DETROIT, Nov. 14  Less than a year ago, Marvin Allen lived a daily frantic gamble, stealing enough from stores to buy heroin while keeping his habit secret from his family and fellow workers.

title: Carey's Drivers Walk Out Over Proposal for Leasing
description: Employes of Carey Cadillac, the limousine renting service here, struck yesterday. Carey's regular airline bus service to Manhattan terminals was not interrupted.

title: Letter to the President
description: Dear Mr. Nixon, Martial law has been declared in my country, the Philippines, by President Ferdinand Marcos. In doing so he has broken his sacred covenant with his people when he took his oath of office to uphold and defend the Constitution. Instead he used it to seize power and institute a oneman rule through the military. He has already given notice that he will not abide by any contrary rulings of the Supreme Court, which has yet to rule whether the situation warranted his resort to this drastic measure.

title: India Locks Into Funds Of a 14YearOld Guru
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 14 (AP) The Indian Government is looking into finances of a 14yearold guru, Maharj Ji, whose followers claim five million adherents in this country, 40,000 in the United States and thousands elsewhere.

title: Cerro Sets Special Dividend
description: The board of directors of the Cerro Corporation yesterday declared the regular quarterly dividend of 10 cents a share and a special cash dividend of 20 cents a share, both payable Dec. 29 to holders of record Dec. 11. After a poor earnings performance in 1971, the company declared no dividend in the first quarter but in the second quarter made it up with 20cent dividend.

title: Peterson Assures Oil Industry U.S. Will Act on Energy Needs
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14Secretary of Commerce Peter Peterson promised today the energy strategies and grams that President would present to the in the coming year will fully equal to his initiatives to the ple's Republic of China. Mr. Peterson told more 2,000 oil industry executives the annual meeting of America Petroleum Institute that few problems facing United States were as tant as meeting the future energy needs of the nation. He stated that there is no new

title: Norton Simon Seeks MaoTai Liquor and Ginger From China
description: Norton Simon, Inc., is planning to import ginger from China, for ginger ale, and MaoTai, the Chinese liquor that was used by Premier Chou Enlai and President Nixon in their toasts to each other in Peking last spring.

title: Lysistrata Ends Saturday
description: Lysistrata, a musical version of the Aristophanes antiwar comedy, which opened at the Brooks Atkinson Theater on Monday, ends its Broadway run Saturday after eight performances. It stars Melina Mercouri. David Black and David Seltzer are the producers.

title: LAKERS TRIUMPH OVER BUCKS, 9592
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 14 (AP) Jerry West poured in 15 of his 26 points in the fourth quarter tonight, rallying the Los Angeles Lakers to a 95.92 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: More Democratic Officials Urge Mrs. Westwood to Resign, but She Vows to Fight for Job
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Senator Ernest F. Hollings of South Carolina and Gov. Cecil D. Andrus of Idaho have joined the chorus of elected Democrats urging Jean Westwood, their national party chairman, to resign.

title: Rockets Down Pacers
description: DENVER, Nov. 14 (AP) Warren Jabali hit two straight late baskets tonight and the Denver Rockets held off fourthquarter rally to defeat the Indiana Pacers, 118108.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I refer to a Nov. 10 letter entitled Food for Bangladesh by Professors Dorfman and Revelle of Harvard University. The two professors refer to the 'unaccountable complacency of the United Nations mission that supervises food imports and distribution

title: Economic Forecasts: On Target
description: Either business forecasting has improved or the. private forecasters are getting luckier. Two years ago, when the Nixon Administration's own economists fell on their faces with their official prediction that the gross national product would rise from $976billion in 1970 to $1,065billion in 1971, the private business economists were right on target with a standard fore cast of $1,050billion.

title: Music: Four Premieres
description: A goodgized audience gathered at Alice Tully Hall on Monday night for a concert called A Gala Benefit for the Thorne Music Fund, which should be good news for all mature American composers of recognized accomplishments, the type the fund was set up to aid. Established in 1965, it was given out more than $220,000 to 27 composers in fellowships and commissions, and it donated proceeds from the benefit to the continued encouragement of new music by Ameridans.

title: A 21Story Sports Center For SoHo Wins Approval
description: A plan to build an $11million, 21story public sports center in lower Manhattan, between Canal and Grand Streets, was approved unanimously yesterday the Board of Standards and Appeals.

title: Ghana Sentences 8 to Death On Charges of Subversion
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Nov. 14Eight Ghanaians were convicted on charges of subversion and condemned to death by military tribunal here today.

title: Alfred Farau, Psychologist, Founded Adlerian Society
description: Dr. Alfred Farau, a psychologist and psychotherapist who was a cofounder of the American Society of Adlerian Psychology, died yesterday at his hoine, 50 West 96th Street. He was 67 years old.

title: There's More Than Hot Air to Using a Hand Hair Dryer
description: An unusual sort of night school is going on once week at The Reapers salon at 847 Lexington Avenue. Peter Lamas and Marc Abitbol are teaching women and men how to blowdry their own hair, for a fee of $2 per lesson.

title: Virgin Islands Seeks Slayers
description: CHRISTIANSTED. V.I., Nov. 14 (AP)Government House said today that a reward had been increased to $13,000 in an attempt to capture gunmen who shot and killed two men last Tuesday in St. Croix. Last Friday, the territorial government announced that a $5,000 reward would be offered.

title: Owner of Lion Fined
description: DENVER, Nov. 14 (UPI)Jim Hoehl, owner of a young lion that jumped a fence and.critically mauled a 3yearold boy, was fined $300 yesterday for disregarding a city order to get rid of the animal. The parents of Tim DiGiacomo have filed a $200,000 lawsuit against Hoehl.

title: Connecticut Catches 871 Evaders of Turnpike Tolls
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 14Using only one state trooper and the simplest of traps, Connecticut has ticketed 871 drivers since Sept. 29 for going through the tollcollection points on the Connecticut Turnpike without paying.

title: U.S. Sues Missouri For Giving Judges Big Pay Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP)The Government filed suit today against the State of Missouri, alleging that it had violated wage controls by paying the state's judges salary increases ranging from 19 to 52 per cent.

title: THEFT REPORTED AT PHILHARMONIC 7 Instruments Were Stolen From Backstage Lockers
description: Backstage lockers at Philharmonic Hall were broken into late last month, and four trumpets, trio trozybones, a French horn, a few mouthpieces and metronome, all worth a total of $3,536, were stolen, according to the management of Lincoln Center.

title: Effect of Big. Grain Purchases Worries World Aid Agencies
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14The impact of Soviet and Chinese purchases of American wheat is being eyed anxiously by relief organizations worried about higher prices, bottlenecks in shipping and the possibility of dwindling reserves in 1975.

title: Southern Newspapers Elect
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 14 (AP)Tams Bixby 3d of The Muskogee (Okla.) Phoenix and Times Democrat was named presidentelect yesterday of the Southern Newspaper Publishers Association.

title: Morton Is Still Unable to Win Over Cowboys'
description: The recent appearance of bumper stickers in Dallas that say We want Stauback must make Craig Morton feel grand. What more does a person have to do to be accepted? When Roger Staubach, the Cowboys Super Bowl quarterback, chose to take on Marlin McKeever of the Rams in a collision last Aug. 12 and came out of it with a shoulder separation, Morton took ever.

title: A BEAUTIFUL DANCE BY PHOEBE NEVILLE
description: Phoebe Neville is almost throwback to another, more quietly disciplined age. She works patiently and intensely, bringing forth her jewellike dances in the fullness of their time, without hurry and hoopla. At the Cubiculo Monday evening she presented three premieres.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON AMEX AND OTC
LISBON CONDEMNED BY U.N. ASSEMBLY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14 (AP)The General Assembly voted 98 to 6 today to condemn Portugal for waging colonial wars in her African territories.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14 (Reuters)The Tokyo stock market had its busiest session ever today with volume amounting to a historic high of 1 billion shares. The previous record was the 820 million shares traded yesterday.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: LONDONThere are widespread expectations of a readjustment of United States relations with West Europe and NATO during President Nixon's second term. His first term saw fruition of basic trends already discernible on the world horizon. These now require policy recognition.

title: CITY RELIEF ROLLS WERE UP ONLY 392 THIS SEPTEMBER
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the city's relief rolls had shown a net gain of only 392 persons this September, compared with a rise of 8,845 in September, 1971.

title: NEW MOTIVE SEEN IN MUNICH ATTACK
description: PARIS, Nov. 14An authori, tative Western diplomatic source reported today that just over a week before the Palestinian attack at the Munich Olympics it September, Israel and Egypt had accepted a plan for direct, secret contacts to open negotiations.

title: MULTINATIONALS ARE BACKED HERE
description: Efforts to restrict the activities of United States multinational companies came underi strong attack yesterday by business executives, scholars and government leaders attending the 59th National Foreign Trade Convention.

title: 5 Centuries of Genuine Forgeries Go on Display
description: A desperate letter written in French on fine handmade paper in 1569 reads: I am to be moved tomorrow from here to Tattbery & soon after to Nottingham. where I shall be placed in the hands of the greatest enemies I have in this world.... Speak yourselves to the Queen of England to prevent as much as you can my removal.

title: SOVIET WILL SEEK TRADE CREDIT HERE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14  James J. Needham, chairman of the board of the New York Stock Exchange, announced plans today for a Soviet delegation to visit New York next year to discuss means of financing expansion of SovietAmerican trade.

title: QE2 Stowaways, 16, Caught
description: BOSTON, Nov. 14 (UPI)Edward R. Hunt Jr. and Phillip Duncan, 16yearolds who stowed away aboard the Queen Elizabeth 2 Saturday, have been found by crewmen and will be flown home, the police said today. The Dorchester youths were found while the ship was cruising to the West Indies. They will be flown home from St. Croix.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The reaction of the two political parties to the election results is a little odd if not downright funny. George McGovern is insisting on the status quo, as if he had won, and President Nixon is shaking up his winning team, as If he had lost.

title: F.B.I. Chief Ordered Jet Tires Shot Out
description: The acting director of the 1F.B.I. said yesterday that he and Southern Airways officials had jointly decided to immobilize the hijacked jet in Orlando, Fla, Saturday. But he added that he personally had ordered that it be done by shooting out the tires.

title: Fontainbleu Buys Polygon For $160,000 at Keeneland
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 14 (AP)Fontainbleu Farm paid $160,000 tonight for a 4yearold mare, Polygon, a daughter of Never bend out of Polly Girl, for the highest price of the first two days of the Keeneland breeding stock sale.

title: Suit to Evict Squatters
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) The Justice Department filed suit today to evict 170 squatters it said had moved into houses doomed for destruction on a Pennsylvania site where a Federal dam is to be built. The suit, filed in United States District Court in Scranton, Pa., was filed at the request of the Army Corps of Engineers, which has been ordered to build the Tock's Island darn.

title: 42% IN POLL GIVE APPROVAL TO CAHILL
EDWARD N. ALLEN, 81, EXHARTFORD MAYOR
description: WEST HARTFQRD, Conn., Nov. 14 (AP)Edward N. Allen, a former Hartford Mayor, who served as Connecticut's Lieutenant Governor from 1951 to 1954 under Gov. John Lodge, died early today at his home after a long illness. He was 81 years old.

title: DowJones Closes Above 1,000 Mark For the First Time
description: The DowJones industrial stock average achieved one of Wall Street's longsought goals yesterday by finishing above 11,000 for the first time. The venerable Dow bro;ie through the barrier with a flourish, climbing 6.09 points to 1,003.16.

title: Pacific Quake Reported
description: BOULDER, Colo., Nov. 14 (AP)The National Earthquake Information Center reports that a medhunsized earthquake occurred about 50 miles off the coast of northern California at 11:10 P.M. Eastern Standard Time, last night. The quake, which registered 4.5 on the Richter scale, occurred on the Mendocino Fracture, a continuation of the San Andres fault under the ocean bed.

title: U.S TRIMS RAISES AT 4 PAPERS HERE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 14The Federal Pay Board, as expected, ordered pay reductions today for nearly 24,000 employes of four New York City newspapers and 300 commercial printing companies in the New York metropolitan area.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES HIGHER AT CLOSE
description: Rain in growing areas once again was an impelling reason for a new round of lifeofcontract highs for all soybean deliveries yesterday.

title: City Affairs School Names Cohen, Director, as Dean
description: Prof. Henry Cohen has been appointed to the new position of dean of the Center for New York City Affairs at the New School for Social Research.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In the election of associate judges to the Court of Appeals a serious infringement of the voters rights took place. Voters were called upon to select three of the candidates, but in fact it was not possible to select any three.

title: Spain's October Surplus Off
description: MADRID, Nov. 14 (Reuters) The Spanish balanceofpayments surplus fell to $91.4million in October from $118.8million in October, 1971, the Bank of Spain reported today. Spain's foreign reserves at the end of October amounted to $4.79billion, the bank added.

title: KISSINGER TALKS TO THE PRESIDENT ON TRUCE SESSION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Henry A. Kissinger conferred with President Nixon and other high officials today as he prepared to depart for Paris to begin what the Administration regards as a crucial round of talks with North Vietnam's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho.

title: MuchHeralded B.B.C., at 50, Faces Uncertain Future
description: LONDON, Nov.. 14The British Broadcasting Corporation, the wellmodulated voice of London, celebrated its 50th anniversary today with its past wrapped in glory but with its future clouded by uncertainty.

title: Hughes Says Only Federal Aid Will Rescue the Nation's Cities
Vera Inber, Soviet Poet, Is Dead; Diary Told of Leningrad Siege
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14  Vera Inber, a Soviet poet best known for her verse and a diary about the 900day siege of Leningrad in World War II, died here Saturday. She was 82 years old.

title: 2 NETWORKS PLAN JANUARY SERIES
description: Shirley Booth and Buddy Ebsen, stars of hit television series in the past, will return in new series in January to replace shoWs canceled by two networks because of poor audience ratings.

title: C.M.I. Receiving Credit
description: BOSTON, Nov. 14  Continental Mortgage Investors announced today the signing of a $125million, fiveyear revolving, credit agreement with 15 major banks led by the Bankers Trust Company. The first National Bank of Boston is acting as agent for the agreement, with Bankers Trust as coagent, C.M.I. said.

title: MEXICAN RIDERS FIRST IN RELAY
description: TORONTO, Nov. 14  The Mexican Equestrian Team, which has been watching its rivals pile up victories all through the fall indoor circuit, finally scored a triumph of its own tonight at the Royal Winter Fair horse show.

title: State Pupil Testing Gets Off to Smooth Start
Columbia Vows an Effort to Hire 900 to Fulfill U.S. Antibias Rule
description: Columbia University will make every effort to add almost 900 women and members of minority groups to its academic and nonacademic staffs by 1977 to satisfy Federal rules barring job discrimination, it was learned yesterday.

title: TAX REFORM IN '73 IS VIEWED AS DEAD
Tenants'
description: Whenever it rains, most other New Yorkers merely get wet, but the 12 tenants of a converted town house across from the Metropolitan Museum of Art say they get soaked because their building's roof tends to leak at the slightest provocation.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The Department of Commerce published today without comment a new volume statistics on the operations of multinational companies and their foreign affiliates.

title: ComputerRun Transit On Coast Is Under Fire
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 14The computerized Bay Area Rapid Transit system, criticized as unsafe in a legislative analyst's report, will be fully operative on schedule for its crossbay service next September, the transit district's directors were told at an emergency meeting yesterday.

title: Zumwalt Warns Navy Discipline Will Not Be Eased as Reforms Are Made
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) As the Navy was completing disciplinary action against rebellious crewmen from the carrier U.S.S. Constellation, Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr. warned young enlisted men today that strict discipline would not be sacrificed as a price for liberalized reforms.

title: Head of F.B.I. Says He Ordered Hijacked Plane's Tires Shot Out
description: The acting director of the F.B.I. said yesterday that he and Southern Airways officials had jointly decided to immobilize the hijacked jet in Orlando, Fla., Saturday. But he added that he personally had ordered that it be done by shooting out the tires.

title: JERSEY MAN SLAIN IN $70,000 HOLDUP
description: SOUTH BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 14An. elderly maintenance man was shot to death this morning, and nearly $70,, 000 was taken by two holdup men at the National Bank of New Jersey here.

title: Louisiana Tech BowlBound
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. 14 (AP)Louisiana Tech University, undefeated in 10 football games this season, accepted an invitation today to play in the Dec. 9 Grantland Rice Bowl game in Baton Rouge. The postseason contest decides the winner of the National Collegiate Athletic Association's Mideastern college division..

title: INVENTORIES ROSE IN THIRD QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Total business inventories rose more in the third quarter than in the second despite a dip in inventory growth in September, the Department of Commerce reported today.

title: Russians, Using Czechs Expertise, Put On Swinging Exhibit in Prague
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 12  The Russians are offering Czechoslovaks an opportunity to see the Soviet Union in a new light  as a modern society btirsting with attractive consumer goods and handsomely dressed young people.

title: Indians Criticize Long Neglect As Rights Panel Opens Inquiry
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov. 14  The suggestion at a staff meeting in 1967 that the United States Commission on Civil Rights look into the problem of American Indians was met with derision.

title: Johnston Appointed to Fill Ellender's Seat in Senate
description: BATON ROUGE, La. Nov. 14 (UPI)Gov. Edwin Edwards to, day appointed Senatorelect J. Bennett Johnston to fill the United States Senate seat vacated by the death of Allen J. Ellender this summer.

title: F.C.C. MEMBER URGES CURB ON TV DRUGADS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI)  A Federal Communications Commissioner, Nicholas Johnson, today termed television the principal pusher to a junkie nation and urged a grassroots campaign for legislation to regulate TV drug advertising.

title: Peron Arrives in Rome on Journey Home
description: ROME, Nov. 14.  Former President Juan D. Peron arrived here from Madrid this afternoon on the first leg of a longplanned voyage that is to take him back to Argentina after 17 years in exile.

title: COUGARS DEFEAT SQUIRES BY 127118
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 14 (AP)Billy Cunningham scored 35 points and snared 11. rebounds to power the Carolina Cougars to a 127118 American Basket ball Association victory over the Virginia Squires tonight. Cunningham also stole the ball five times and blocked two shots.

title: Policeman Seized in Raid Convicted on Drug Counts
description: A 34yearold policeman was convicted yesterday on drug charges by a State Supreme Court jury in Brooklyn.

title: 2 More Prison Stabbings
description: WALPOLE, Mass., Nov. 14 (AP)One inmate was stabbed to death today and another wounded in a minimum security section of the state prison here. The stabbingsthe 26th and 27th since last January, 11 of them fataloccurred on the first day on the job of the new superintendent, Raymond E. Porelle.

title: 3 Policemen Accused of Stealing $8,500 From a Narcotics Agent
description: A police sergeant and two detectives have been charged by the Police Department with stealing $8,500 from an undercover agent posing as a narcotics courier and the working out of an arrangement in which he would help them steal money from other couriers.

title: School During Christmas
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 14 (AP)Public school pupils in Philadelphia will get only Christmas Day off this year. The Board of Education has re: fused requests of some pupils and parents to restore the regular fiveday vacation which was eliminated to help make up for time lost in the threeweek teachers strike in September.

title: TORE SAFEGUARDS ON ABOMBS URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Control of nuclear material to prevent the building of homemade atomic bombs by mentally disturbed people, ambitious small nations or gangsters should be made a toppriority item, a University of Virginia professor told the American Ntrcicar Society today.

title: On Some Beats, the Long Arm of the Law Has a Feminine Touch
description: It was 4 P.M., and the blueclad police officers lined up, for inspection in the glittering new 77th Precinct house in Brooklyn. Most of them were big and burlywith two notable excentions and they all carried the paraphernalia of the cop on the beat: A.38caliber Smith & Wesson police special, handcuffs, blackjack, night stick, whistle.

title: Mannes College Initiates $1,500 Opera Competition
description: The Mannes College of Music is establishing an annual opera competition carrying a cash prize of $1,500 and a performance of the winning work, it was announced yesterday by Paul Berl, music director of the Mannes Opera Workshop.

title: A Tree Social Register Lists 7 in State,,Omittihg 2 Aliens
The Theater: Yoshke Musikant by the Folksbiene
description: As the most fabulous invalid around, the Yiddish theater is flourishingthis season, at leastwith Yoshe Kalb and The Rebbittzen From Israel, alive and doing quite well, thank you. And now, the Folksbiene, the sturdiest troupe of them all, has opened its 58th season with Yoshke Musikant, an amalgam of folklore, unrequited love, native humor and music adapted from the late Ossip Dimow's play, presented on weekends at the showcase on East Broadway.

title: Dayan and Rogers Talk in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Defense Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel and Secretary of State William P. Rogers conferred for 80 minutes today, and officials on both sides said afterward that while :there was a need for a new diplomatic effort for a Middle East settlement, there were no immediate plans to set one in motion.

title: Thousands Flee as Storm Sweeps Great Lakes Area
description: Thousands of families were evacuated with the aid of National Guardsmen in two states yesterday after windwhipped waves and heavy rain drenched the shorelines of Lakes Erie and Huron.

title: SNOW IS SURPRISE TO SKI OPERATORS
description: Only two days before the annual ski show is scheduled to open at the New York Coliseum, Orvil Slutzky, general manager of the Hunter Mountain ski center in New York's northern Catskills yesterday found himself standing in eight inches of natural snow in front of his base lodgewith problems.

title: People and Business
description: In an early post election economic forecast, Albert H. Cox Jr., chief economist of Lionel D. Edie & Co., Inc., predicted yesterday that President Nixon's landslide victory makes it likely that there will be more effective control over Federal spending in the coming 18 months. Mr. Cox told a Los Angeles Chamber of Commerce audience that, because of the new Presidential clout, the Administration can expect cooperation from Congress in its efforts to hold down spending, despite the Republican failure to gain new seats.

title: Church of God Elects Bishop
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 14 (AP)Bishop J. O. Patterson was reelected today as presiding bishop of the Church of God in Christ, Bishop Patterson was selected to head the mostly black, three million member church at its 65th annual convocation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Oct. 7 letter from former Ambassador John Cabpt criticizing the rationale of your editorial stand On the war reflects very likely the confusion throughout the Department or State during Mr. Cabot's career.

title: The Leaves for Moscow
description: PEKING, Wednesday Nov. 15 (Agence FrancePresse)North Vietnam's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho, left Peking today for Moscow on the next stage of his trip to Paris to resume talks with Henry A. Kissinger after a onemonth interruption.

title: CANUCKS'
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum. bia, Nov. 14 (AP)  Thomas Scallen and Lyman Walters, officials of the Vancouver Canucks of the National Hockey League, were committed for trial today on charges of issuing a false stock prospectus. Scallen is also charged with theft.

title: Baraka Rejects Offer by Whites To Take Over Kawaida Towers
description: NEWARK, Nov. 14Leaders of the Italian community in the North Ward have asked Imamu Amiri Baraka, the black nationalist leader, to let them take over sponsorship of the proposed Kawaida Towers highrise project. In return, they offered to support the construction of a similar project in a predominantly black neighborhood.

title: Panel Plans Indian Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) A subcommittee of the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs announced today that it would investigate the seizure and vandalism of the Bureau of Indian Affairs building here by a group of militant Indians earlier this month.

title: High Court Bars Mayors From Judging Traffic Cases Vital to Their Treasuries
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Small towns that make a lucrative business of arresting and fining unwary motorists may find that practice curtailed under a decision handed down today by the Supreme Court.

title: Anniversaries
description: HELMERMom and Dad hoping our lives will be as happy as yours. Happy 21st. Love, DEBBIE, DAVID and DONNA.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two youths who forced the pastor of a West Side church to open a safe at gunpoint yesterday afternoon escaped with $35 and some jewelry donated by parishioners. Shortly afterward, two radiocar patrolmen cruising the neighborhood captured two youths and charged them with the robbery.

title: Books of The Times
description: Readers of Robertson Davies's last novel will recallas I had to do, since my copy of Fifth Business is still, after two years, making the rounds of borrowers (a sure index of its appeal)that at the end of the story, the, narrator's old friend, Canadian tycoon Percy Boyd (Boy) Staunton, has just been found dead, clutching with superhuman strength the steering wheel of his car, which he, or someone else, had driven at top speed off the end of a Toronto dock. Most curious of all, in the corpse's mouth is a pink granite stone about the size of a hen's egg, which the narrator, retired schoolteacher Dunstan Ramsay, had presented to Boy earlier on the evening of his death, in the pres ence of another old acquaintance, the famous illusionist Magnus Eisengrim. Now, while this rather bizarre turn of events proved a symbolically satisfying conclusion to Fifth Business (given the previouS history of that pink stone, not to mention the past relationship of the three men), on the more literal level certain details remained to be cleared up. So when, at the beginning of Mr. Davies's new novel, The Manticore, I discovered that Boy's son, Davidnow grown up to become a rich, powerful and superrational criminal lawyeris also still bothered by his father's strange deathindeed that he has recently attended a Toronto performance of Magnus Eisengrim's illusions and found himself shouting angrily Who killed Boy Staunton? at the oracular brazen head that is the piece de resistance of Eisengrim's performance, and that this outburst of David's has prompted him finally to travel to Zurich, Switzerland, to undertake a Jungian psychoanalysisI was immediately and delightedly willing to go along.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Board of Standards and Appeals approved unanimously yesterday a plan to build an $11million, 21story public sports center between Canal and Grand Streets in Lower Manhattan.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his Nobel Prize lecture, Solt zhenitzyn remarked that one of the prime attributes of the new barbarism is to render international agreements illusory, as if they had never existed. The recent letters of Messrs. Crown and Standard and of David Mandel document his point.

title: 5 G. O. P. County Leaders Study Fusion Mayoral Bid
description: The five Republican county leaders in New York City began yesterday to explore the possibility of nominating a Democrat as a fusion candidate for Mayor next year.

title: Warriors Win, 114105
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 14 (UPI)The Golden State Warriors outscored the Atlanta Hawks, 155, in the final five minutes to take a 114105 National Basketball Association victory tonight.

title: Nixon Loses Election In Vote at Art Gallery
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14President Nixon lost the electionat an exhibit of Presidential losers at the National Portrait Gallery.

title: Ryun and Seagren Among Stars Signed for 48Meet Track Circuit
description: An International track and field tour, with Jim Ryun, Bob Seagren, Randy Matson, Lee Evans and Richmond Flowers in the lineup, was announced yesterday.

title: 10,185 BRAVE RAIN TO BET AT BIG A
description: The weekly monsoon had very little effect on the compulsion of horseplayers to visit the windswept, rainswept expanse of Aqueduct racetrack yesterday. A surprising crowd of 10,185 turned out for the program.

title: G. I. Found Not Guilty of Killing Officers
description: Private Smith, a 24yearold black from the Watts section of Los Angeles, was acquitted of six counts of murder, attempted murder and assault. However, he was found guilty of assaulting a military policeman who arrested him soon after the fragmentation grenade exploded on March 16, 1971, at the Bienhoa air base near Saigon. Fragging refers to assaults with fragmentation grenades.

title: U.N. Halls of Ivy
description: At some point this fall in the United Nations General Assembly, the United States will have a chance to vote for a plan by which the world's scholars and scientists can unite their intellectual resources on a world scale to carry out sustained research on some of the most urgent problems facing mankind.

title: Impact Is Being Weighed
description: Leaders of most of the New York City newspaper unions who were available for comment last night did not indicate immediately whether they would terminate their contracts, although the agreements of all 10 unions contain a clause that says they have the right to terminate if wage increases are reduced.

title: Radio Satellite on Station
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Nov. 14 (AP)A short rocket burst has locked a communications satellite into a stationary orbit from where it can beam radio, telephone and television service for the first time to hundreds of communities in Canada's northland. The 600pound satellite is named Anik1. Anik is the Eskimo word for brother. It was launched last Thursday.

title: U.S. TRIMS RAISES Al PAPERS HERE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The Federal Pay Board, as expected, ordered pay reductions today for nearly 24,000 employes of four New York City newspapers and 300 commercial printing companies in the New York metropolitan area.

title: Saigon's Peace Negotiator Off for Paris
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 14South Vietnam's chief delegate to the peace talks, Pham Dang Lam, left Saigon for Paris1 today, as the secret negotia1 tions between North Vietnam and the United States appeared about to resume there.

title: TOMBS CONDITIONS HELD DEPLORABLE
description: A retired senior inspector for the Federal Bureau of Prisons testified in Federal Court here yesterday that conditions in the Tombs were so deplorable that guards looked upon assignment there as punishment duty.

title: Jordan Presses East Bank Development
description: We are not forgetting the West Bank in our plans, but we must get on with what we can do, said Prince Hassan Ibn Talal, King Hussein's 25yearold brother, who is the coordinator of the new threeyear development plan going into effect.

title: Beatrix Hauser Is Bride in France
description: Miss Beatrix Hauser, who is studying for a Ph.D. degree at the New York University Institute of Fine Arts, was married in St.PauldeVence, France, yesterday to Gregor Medinger, representative in the United States for the Banque Worms of Paris. The ceremony in the chapel of St. George's Roman Catholic Church was performed by the Rev. Max Efcazout.

title: Mayor's Education Task Force Troubleshoots in School Crises
description: In a small office at Canarsie High School the other afternoon, Larry Kieves and Diane Nowlin of the Mayor's Education Task Force sat down with teachers who have been trying for six years to unravel the red tape around their proposed football field.

title: Senate Battleground Finance Committee Choices May Signal a Policy Trend
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The Senate's basic legislative course in the coming two years may well be set, long before the new Congress settles down to business, by a decision on the composition of the Finance Committee.

title: JOBLESSNESS TIED TO INFANT DEATHS The Mortality Rate Is Linked to Economic Instability
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 14A public health researcher reported here today that periods of economic instability have been responsible for fluctuations in infant mortality rates.

title: Eagleton Illness Disclosure
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 AP) Senator George McGovern's top aides learned, even before the Missouri Senator was selected as the VicePresidential nominee, that Thomas F. Eagleton had been hospitalized for exhaustion, interviews with The Associated Press disclosed today.

title: Martin Resigns as Chief Of Home Loan Bank Board
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 14Preston Martin, who has played an activist role in reshaping the savings and loan industry as chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board since 1969, announced here today that President Nixon had accepted his resignation, effective in about two weeks.

title: Music: A Vivid Leader From Glasgow
description: The American Bible Society presents an annual benefit concert, and sometimes it takes a chance on a conductor new to these parts. The debuting conductor takes a chance, too, since he has to work with unfamiliar ensembles and make do with limited rehearsal time.

title: Market Place: Weighing Plans For Mergers
description: Many an investor has watched with a mixture of anticipation and concern as the management of a company whose shares he owns acquires one company after another.

title: CITY RELIEF ROLLS WERE UP ONLY 392 THIS SEPTEMBER
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the city's relief rolls had shown a net gain of only 392 persons this September, compared with a rise of 8,845 in September, 1971.

title: SEPARATISM PATH URGED FOR BLACKS
description: Two theologiansa Protestant and a Jewrecommended yesterday that black Americans, to survive, must follow a kind of separatism that would develop black institutions and reliance on one's self and one's community.

title: KISSINGER TALKS 10 THE PRESIDENT ON TIVE SESSION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Henry A. Kissinger conferred with President Nixon and other high officials today as he prepared to depart for Paris to begin what the Administration regards as a crucial round of talks with North Vietnam's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho.

title: SOCIALISTS IN ITALY TAKE MODERATE LINE
description: ROME, Nov. 14The Socialist partyItaly's third largest after the Christian Democrats and the Communists shifted to a relatively moderate position in a fiveday convention that ended in Genoa early today.

title: BRONX YOUTH SUICIDE IN A POLICE STATION
description: An 18yearold Bronx youth hanged himself in a police station detention cell early yesterday with a belt that had been left atop a radiator six feet from the cell, the police said.

title: An Escaped. TripleMurderer Captured in Tucson Rail Yard
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Nov. 14 (UPI) Charles Schmid Jr., the escaped Pied Piper of Tucson killer, was captured today in a railroad yard in his hometown where he murdered three teenaged girls in the nineteensixties.

title: Two Conflicting Housing Studies Presage Major Fight in Congress and the Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Two studies that come to opposite conclusions about Federal housing programs have set the stage for a major struggle In both Congress and the Administration over the drafting of new housing legislation.

title: Kings Sink Brayes, 106100
description: OMAHA, Nov. 14 (AP)The Kansas CityOmaha Kings sank four straight 20foot shots in the final two minutes tonight to defeat the Buffalo Braves, 106100.

title: M'MAHON CHECKS IN AT THE MAISONETTE
description: Ed McMahon, who's helped Johnny Carson keep TV addicts awake past bedtime for more than a decade and who's appeartd in a movie (The Incident), on Broadway (The Impossible Years) and a variety of other turns,.is proving in his local nightclub debut at the St. RegisSheraton Maisonette that a genial second banana also can be a genial top banana in a boite, at least.

title: Policing the Railroads
description: The recent collision between two Chicago commuter trains which took 44 lives raises chilling questions about the state of railroad safety in this country.

title: Morrall: A Perfect Understudy
description: When Earl Morrall was traded to Baltimore in 1968 for Butch Wilson, a forgettable tight end, and a fourthround draft choice, he started out behind Johnny Unitas but wound up leading the Colts to a record number of victories and a Super Bowl appearance.

title: U.S. Exiles in Canada See No Amnesty
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 14  For the thousands of draftage American men who consider themselves political. refugees in Canada, President Nixon's overwhelniing reelection wiped out what one of them called the last small, sneaking hope that they might soon go home again.

title: Dayan and Rogers Talk in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Defense Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel and Secretary of State William P. Rogers conferred for 80 minutes today, and officials on both sides said afterward that while :there was a need for a new diplomatic effort for a Middle East settlement, there were no immediate plans to set one in motion.

title: TV: N.B.C. Gives a Personal View of America
description: The first installment of America was presented last night at 10 on the network of the National Broadcasting Company. Consisting of 13hourlong episodes, the series will run every other Tuesday evening through next May 8.

title: NEW CHURCH STRIFE REPORTED IN EGYPT
description: CAIRO, Nov. 14A Coptic Christian church has been burned in a suburb of Cairo in a new outbreak of communal strife between Moslems and Copts.

title: Sabotage Held Possible
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 14 (UPI)Possible sabotage aboard the Constellation was disclosed today by the ship's commanding officer.

title: A Tree Social Register Lists 7 in State, Omitting 2 Aliens
description: Seven trees in New York State have made their debut in the American Forestry Association's national Social Register of Big Trees, but two of the state's biggeka. London plane and Chinese wing nuthave been barred because they are not native Americans.

title: Ferdinand Castagna Dies at 73; Led Large Construction Concern
description: Ferdinand Castagna, founder and president of Castagna & Son, a major construction company in New York City and on Long Island, died yesterday at his home on Ormond Park Road in Brookville, L. I. He was 73 years old.

title: Civilians and Brass
description: The reelected President Nixon says he will not exempt the Defense Department from his cuts in Government spending. So much to the good. But his interview with The Washington StarNews revealed a strange quirk his thinking, one that at the very least is open to dangerous misinterpretation.

title: 100 More Asians Expelled By Uganda Arrive Here
description: A group of 100 Asians ousted from Uganda arrived here yesterday to make their new home in the United States.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, Nov. 14 (AP)Jim Connors, the 20yearold from Belleville, Ill., lost the first set today then reeled off 12 straight games and beat Ray Moore of South Africa in the Dewar Cup tennis competition.

title: The Case for Charity
description: The belief of the Roman Catholic hierarchy that the United States should be generous in granting amnesty to draft resisters has just been reaffirmed by Cardinal Krol, whose statement stands in admirable contrast to President Nixon's hard line. The Cardinal's plea to blend charity with justice already has emphatic support from leaders of other churches.

title: State Opens Campaign Here to Close Hotels That Are Havens for Criminals
description: The State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, has started a drive against hotels here that are sanctuaries for criminals, drug addicts and pushers.

title: HAROLD J. APELL
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Nov. 14Harold J. Ape11, president of KaskLine Company, manufacturers of childrens accessories and a resident here for 44 years, died today at Mount Vernon Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 531 East Lincoln Avenue.

title: 2 Rob Bank, Seize 5, Are Denied Jet, Lose Fight to Police
description: BURLINGTON, N. C., Nov. 14 (UPI)Two masked bandits, trapped in a bank they were robbing, took a man and four women hostages tonight and drove around on country roads apparently seeking a plane to hijack before policemen captured them after a gun battle on an interstate highway.

title: A Judge in Italy Rules Playboy Is Not Obscene
description: MILAN, Italy, Nov. 14 (UPI)A judge ruled today that the first Italian edition of Playboy magazine was not obscene and cleared it for sale to the public.

title: 2 of 3 Car Makers Off
description: DETROIT, Nov. 14Sales of new cars in the first third of November trailed those for the corresponding period of last year, but automobile manufacturers are still blaming inventtory shortages.

title: Dave Anderson
description: They sat there, the five pioneers of what will be new event in track and field, taking money over the table. Behind them, in the upstairs room at Gallagher's 52 restaurant, a huge reproduction of a check for $609,600 represented the minimum prize money in the International Track Association meets that will begin next year. The meets will be on weekends, which will enable the athletes to retain their primary jobs. One by one, they were telling what they did. Randy Matson, the shotputter, works as a fundraiser for. the Texas A. and M. alumni. Richmond Flowers, the hurdler, is defensive back for the New York Giants. Lee Evans, the quartermiler, operates an antique shop. Bob Seagren, the polevaulter, is an actor. And now it was Jim Ryun's turn. Professional jock, he said.

title: LAOS NEGOTIATORS STUDY TRUCE PLAN
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 14The Laotian Government and the Communistled Pathet Lao held their fifth weekly negotiating session today. Although there was some discussion of a fivepoint settlement plan, the meeting seemed devoted mostly to propaganda.

title: PRICE PANEL BACKS INCREASE FOR BREAD
description: The Price Commission yesterday approved additional bread price increases for the Continental Baking Company, a unit of the International TeleI phone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Enemy Pullbacks Reported Near Saigon and the DMZ
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 15American and South Vietnamese military sources reported yesterday that several North Vietnamese battalionsized units had begun pulling back from the area near the demilitarized zone and from the province around Saigon.

title: PROXMIRE CALLS BUSINESS CODDLED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Senator William Proxmire, quoting a phrase used by President Nixon in a different context, asserted today that the

title: 16 Win Lasker Awards for Cancer Work
description: Sixteen physicians and scientists who have made major contributions to advances in the chemical treatment of cancer were named yesterday as winners of the 1972 Albert Lasker Medical Research Awards.

title: END OF LEAD TINSEL PREDICTED BY F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration says that not a single strand of lead Christmas tree tinsel should be found on store shelves this Yule season.

title: Poor Nations Clash With Rich on Trade
description: GENEVA, Nov. 14  The underdeveloped nations clashed with the richer countries at a conference today that set up a tentative schedule for negotiations to liberalize world trade.

title: Fire Engine to Be Green
description: TIVERTON, R. I., Nov. 14 (AP)The Tiverton Town Council has decided that the town's new fire engine will be painted lime green. The council voted Lmanimously last night to abandon the traditional red color. Fire Chief Melvin E. Sanford said, Red shows up black at night, green better reflects the light.

title: Business Briefs
description: T. Vincent Learson, chairman of the International Business Machines Corporation, says the prevailing estimate by securities analysts of 1972 earnings of $11 a share isn't unreasonable. The company confirmed this yesterday following a DowJones interview.

title: Theater: Zindel's Secret Affairs of Mildred Wild
CRANE ASSAILED BY TOP PARTY AIDE
description: The Democratic party in New York is broke, its state treasurer said yesterdsy, and he put the blame for the situation in part on the lavish spending of the state chairman, Joseph F. Crangle.

title: PhoneSolicited Land Sale Barred Without a License
Bullets Down Rockets
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 14 (AP)Wes Unseld stole the ball from Jimmy Walker and Mike Riordan won the game with a pair of free throws with six seconds left tonight as the Baltimore Bullets edged the Houston Rockets, 104103.

title: Skorich Is Happy Over Trade That Brought Phipps to Browns
DEFENSE RESTS CASE IN BREWSTER TRIAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) The defense rested its case today in the bribery trial of former Senator Daniel B. Brewster. Its final witness labeled, the Government's key witness a liar, a thief, a forger and a con man of extreme capability.

title: SECOND BIG STORM IN WEEK HITS CITY
description: With memories of the Great Rain less than a week old, New Yorkers suffered through another major downpour yesterday.

title: NIXON HOLDS TALKS ON REORGANIZATION
description: THURMONT, Md., Nov. 14 (AP)President Nixon conferred at Camp David today with Roy L. Ash, a California industry executive who compiled Government reorganization proposals for him two years ago.

title: SECOND BIG STORM IN WEEK HITS CITY
description: With memories of the Great Rain less than a week old, New Yorkers suffered through another major downpoui yesterday.

title: Notes on People
description: Arise, Sir Douglas, said Queen Elizabeth II to Douglas Nicholls as she tapped his shoulder with a sword in a ceremony at Buckingham Palace. And as Sir Douglas arose, he was the first Australian aborigine to receive British knighthood. The 64yearold Sir Douglas, one of Australia's 122,000 aborigines, is pastor of the Church of Christ at Northcote, a Melbourne suburb. He said after his investiture that he had given the Queen a copy of his book, Struggle for Dignity, and that she said she would read it.

title: Labor Aide Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) The White House announced today that President Nixon had accepted the resignation of Horace E. Menasco, administrator of the Labor Department's wage and hour division.

title: Nairobi vs. New York
description: After strenuous debate, a committee of the United Nations General Assembly has voted to locate that body's new environmental coordinating agency in Nairobi. The demand of the developing countries that the Kenya capital be chosen was logically indefensible. If any U.N. unit belonged in the New YOrk headquarters or in Geneva, it was one charged with coordinating the environmental activities of other U.N. agencies already located in those cities.

title: Blazers Beat Cavaliers
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 14 (AP)The Portland Trail Blazers spurted in the second quarter behind Dave Wohi and Charlie Davis and went on to defeat the Cleveland Cavaliers, 10091, tonight. Sidney Wicks led the Blazers with 27 points.

title: Westfield Group Seeking To Bar Christmas Pageant
Du Pont to Cut Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP)  E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. has agreed to reduce the chemical waste in its East Chicago, Ind., plant discharge into the Grand Calumet River, the Justice Department announced today. The consent decree resolved a water pollution suit filed by the government Feb. 19, 1971.

title: Police Warning Is Sounded On Stolen Insulin Capsules
description: The police warned yesterday that 30 insulin capsules stolen from a room at the Woodstock Hotel, 127 West 43d Street, could cause a fatal reaction if swallowed by a person in normal health.

title: CUBAN CAUTIONS U.N. ON TERRORISM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14  Cuba spoke up at the United Nations today in opposition to any forceful abtion to curb international terrorism.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Revulsion can only characterize my feeling after having read Robert McFadden's recent article, More Guards Due for City Schools. When we seriously discuss the necessity of having guards in public schools to protect the lives and property of students and teachers, we have, indeed, reached sad state of affairs.

title: Advertising:
description: Measuring sales results from brand advertising, long believed an impossible dream, could be a reality with the cooperation of all concerned, Paul Gerhold, president of the Advertising Research Foundation, told his members yesterday.

title: ROREM'S SONG FORMS LAUREL FOR STEVENS
