description: Ned Rorem has written many fine songsprobably more than any other American composer and his latest addition to the canon, The Last Poems of Wallace Stevens, had its premiere Monday night at the David Ensemble concert in Town Hall.

title: Soviet Approves Office In Moscow, Chase Says
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank announced yesterday that its application to open a representative banking office Moscow has been approved by Soviet authorities. It will mark, when opened, the first representation of an American bank in the Soviet Union since the nineteen twenties.

title: Three From Texas Indicted In Colorado Woman's Death
description: DENVER, Nov. 14 (AP)Three members of an itinerant Texas family were indicted today on murder and kidnapping charges in the abductionslaying of a doughnut shop employe.

title: Drive Aims to Halt Looting of Mayan Art
description: The artifacts of the ancient Mayans, hidden under dense jungle growth in Guatemala and Mexico's Yucatan area, have become the cause celebre of an international rescue mission,

title: Bulls Beat Sonics, 9780
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14 (UPI) Norm Van Lier tallied 26 points tonight to lead the Chicago Bulls to a 9780 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: Look Who's Climbing in the Ivy: Penn
description: The pollsters who predicted the outcome of the recent Presidential election ought to try their hand at picking the outcome of the Ivy League football race. Even the computers are frantic.

title: PASTERNAK BACKER GETS SOVIET HONOR
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14A Soviet scholar who lost a teaching job after defending Boris Pasternak during the furor over his 1958 Nobel Prize, and who has since encountered other difficulties, has been accorded the honor of nomination to the prestigious Academy of Sciences.

title: ALLAN P. SKOLNICK, S.E.C. ATTORNEY, 28
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 14  Allan P. Skolnick, a trial attorney for the Securities and Exchange Commission, who successfully conducted a rent strike in a New York apartment building last year, died Sunday at Santa Monica Hospital from injuries received in an automobile accident. His age was 28.

title: TV Review
description: Three hourlong specials in succession are due tonight, starting at 8, over the American Broadcasting Company network. The first, is besta Jacques Cousteau dootv. mentary on the Arctic Wal rus, which opens his series for the season.

title: Dramatists Taking Center Stage In 4Volume McGrawHill Work
description: A stage buff's delight has made its debut here. It is The McGrawHill Encyclopedia of World Drama, whose four volumes weigh a total of 18 pounds and cost $119.50sales tax extra.

title: Action Group Seeks to Build a Project in Westchester
description: The Suburban Action Institute announced yesterday that it had acquired options on 600 acres of undeveloped land in Lewisboro, N.Y., and planned to build a 4,600unit new community that would triple the population of that northern Westchester County town.

title: Bridge: Jersey Players Triumph In Life Master Pairs Play
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Noy. 14 Young players from the New York metropolitan area captured one major title and shared another at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals here last night.

title: Islanders Downed By Canadiens, 72
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 14The finalperiod collapse so total and pervasive throughout the teamcontinued tonight for the Islanders. They returned to the Nassau Coliseum to find that nothing had changed as they bowed by 72 to the National Hockey League's hottest club, the Montreal Canadiens.

title: JANE WILSON DEAD; HORIZON ART EDITOR
description: Jane Wilson, art editor of Horizon magazine, died Sunday at the home of her mother, Mrs Dorothy Roe Wilson,. on Winding Farm Road in Ardsley, N. Y., where she had been living in recent months. She was in her 50's.

title: OKKER, RIESSEN ADVANCE IN TENNIS
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands, Nov. 14 (AP)  Tom Okker, a native hero, and Marty Riessen, of Evanston, Ill., survived the first round today of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis international, but Roy Emerson was upset.

title: DowJones Closes Above 1,000 For First Time Since Inception
description: The DowJones industrial stock average achieved one of Wall Street's longsought goals yesterday by finishing above 1,000 for the first time. The venerable Dow broke through the barrier with a. flourish, climbing 6.09 points to 1,003.16.

title: ExRep. Martin Dies, 71, Is Dead; Led UnAmerican Activities Unit
description: LUFKIN, Tex., Nov. 14 Former Representative Martin Dies, first chairman of the controversial House Committee on UnAmerican Activities, died tonight, apparently of a heart attack. He was 71 years old.

title: Wallace Seeks Changes
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 14 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama said today the Democratic party needed to be reconstructed to reflect the attitudes of his constituents and said the party's chairmanship would have to have some changes made if the party wants to win in 1976.

title: MANILA LIFTS CURB ON A.P. DISPATCHES
description: MANILA, Nov. 14 (AP)Thel Department of Public Information today lifted censorship of Associated Press dispatches from the Philippines.

title: WILLIAM CELENTANO, A NEW HAVEN MAYOR
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 14WilI Liam C. Celentano, the only Republican to serve this city as Mayor since the early 1930's, died today at St. Raphael's Hospital while undergoing surgery for an undisclosed ailment. He was 68 years old and lived at 121 McKinley Avenue.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Jews Announce $680Million Program
description: A program to establish a precedentsetting $680million program for a vast range of hospitals, medical research facilities and welfare and educational complexes in the metropolitan area was set on its way yesterday by the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies of New York.

title: ESMOND SHAW, 70, ARCHITECT DIES
description: Esmond Shaw, dean emeritus of Cooper Union's School of Art and Architecture, died Monday night at St. Vincent's Hospital after a long illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 77 East 12th Street.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 15 (UPI)  The Alberta Oilers, paced by Don Walters two goals, beat Winnipeg, 31 tonight to move into a first place tie with.. the Jets in the Western Division of the World Hockey Association before a.capacity crowd of 5,200.

title: The War of the Truce in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 15South Vietnam, while still trying to press Hanoi and Washington for more favorable peace terms, is quietly preparing to accept a peace settlement when it is finally worked out.

title: STATE OFFICE NAMED FOR FILM REQUESTS
description: Governor Rockefeller has designated the state's Commerce Department as coorctinator and central office for all requests by film companies to use locations in New York State for making films, according to Local 644 of the International Photographers of the Motion Picture Industries.

title: Regents Will Propose 10% Rise In State's Spending on Schools
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The issue of amnesty will not die. It keeps cropping up, and when even John Connally feels compelled to mention it, we may ne sure it is here to stay.

title: ARMY SEEKING BIDS ON NEW HELICOPTER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI)The Army today asked 10 aerospace companies to submit proposals for development of a new advanced attack helicopter, the replacement for the Cheyenne gunship that was canceled last fall because its cost got too high.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A splendid little 80page cook book has been assembled by staff members and volunteers of New York City's South Street Seaport Museum.

title: Black Sailors and Ship's Captain Accuse Each Other
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 15The racial differences that led the captain of the Navy carrier Constellation to order more than 100 black sailors off the ship nearly two weeks ago remained unsettled today amid signs that the situation may be worsening.

title: Trade Group Is Cautioned On Economic isolationism
description: Bradford Mills, the president of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, warned here yesterday that the country's competitive position would deteriorate quickly if economic isolationism was allowed to rise again.

title: S. J. Perelman a Passenger
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 15  S..J. Perelman, the humorist, was one of the passengers aboard the hijacked airliner today.

title: Market Place: Large Investor Discloses Woes
description: When a wealthy investor, Thomas G. Wyman, bought his first 50,000 shares in General Fireproofing in 1968, he did so, he says, because he regarded the shares as a good investment.

title: Comedie Francaise Closes in Strikes
description: PARIS, Nov. 15  The Comedie Francaise, France's most prestigious theater, was closed today by order of. the Cultural Ministry, due to a technicians strike. And tomorrow, the other statesubsidized theaters in Paris and the suburbs will be closed by a sympathy strike of technicians who support their colleagues at the Comedie.

title: Citizens Task Force Is Being Formed to Press for Police Action on Crime in Black Areas
description: A citizens task force is being established to augment a drive armed at protecting victims of violent crimes in the city's black communities, victims who are said most often to be black.

title: Dance: An Ailey Opening
description: There are two types of theatergoer to whom one Would unhesitatingly recommend an Alvin Ailey company: those who love dance and those who think they don't. The doubters inevitably revise their, opinion. Tuesday evening the company, which is now the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater, gave the first performance of its threeweek season, and it opened with golden oldies.

title: Notes on People
description: Long retired as an entertainer of American troops in the Pacific, Mrs. Iva Ikuko Toguri D'Aquino seemed closer to paying the Federal Government $5,255 she allegedly owes as a result of her World War II efforts as Tokyo Rose. A panel of Federal judges in Chicago denied her request for a hearing in her effort to prevent the government from attaching her wages to collect the money. The case stems from Mrs. D'Aquino's broadcasts of words and music in the interests of wartime Japan.

title: Dissidents Face Sea Duty
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 15 (AP)The Navy said today that the dissident sailors on the Constellation would be returned to sea duty, possibly soon, but on other ships and after the cornpletion of counseling sessions.

title: Two New Plays Plan for '73 Curtains
description: Two new plays, Let Me Hear You Smile and Welcome Home, were announced yesterday for Broadway pre. sentation this season.

title: INTENSIVE ATTACK MADE BY U.S. JETS ON SUPPLY ROUTE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 16The United States command reported yesterday that American bombers had staged one of the heaviest days of raids of the war on the southern panhandle of North Vietnam.

title: Saigon Desertions Reported
description: PARIS, Nov. 15The Vietcong delegation to the peace talks here asserted today that there had been substantial desertions from South Vietnamese forces last month, and Vietcong battlefield victories.

title: Advertising:
description: The National Advertising Review Board at its second annual meeting yesterday voted to make public all of its decisions involving truth and accuracy in national advertising.

title: A Judge Challenges Automatic Custody Of Child to Mother
Westchester's Taxes to Be Cut In Spite of Its Highest Budget
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 15Although Westchester County's budget will be higher than ever for 1973, there will be a decrease in. the total tax levy and the tax rate for the first time in recent years, according to the proposed budget presented today by the county adminis tration.

title: Black Sailors and Ship's Captain Accuse Each Other
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 15The racial differences that led the captain of the Navy carrier Constellation to order more than 100 black sailors off the ship nearly two weeks ago remained unsettled today amid signs that the situation may be worsening.

title: Subs and SALT
description: Gallant destroyer, bow thrust in the air, speeding over the waves in search of menacing submarinethis classic naval portrait has as much value as does the Red Baron's Fokker triplane to the airtoair combat of today, in the words of Capt. Robert H. Smith; USN (ret.), writing in the Proceedings of the United States Naval Institute.

title: City Electoral Crisis
description: Although the tieups at polling places, the challenges and counterchallenges arising out of last week's election have barely been xesolved, an even larger electoral crisis looms immediately ahead for New York City. The Board of Elections is unconstitutional in the eyes of the courts.

title: United Aircraft Charges Pirating in $1Million Suit.
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 15 (AP)United Aircraft Corporation has filed a $1million lawsuit to stop what it calls pirating of its confidential plans for hellcopter parts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Nov. 6 editorial Safer City applauds Mayor Lindsay's decision to hire 3,150 more policemen as first priority in use of Federal revenuesharing funds....

title: SHOP TALK; In the Market for Linens? New Places to Look
description: It was all those people coming in and asking for custommade bedspreads and dust ruffles and so forth, Bloomingdale's reports, that made the store decide to open its new linens boutique.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Oklahoma, Penn State Reported in Sugar Bowl
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 15. (AP)Oklahoma and Penn State will meet here New Year's Eve in the Sugar Bowl football game, The Associated Press learned today.

title: Books of The Times
description: MARINETTI: SELECTED WRITINGS. Edited, with an Introduction, by R. W. Flint. 366 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $12.95.

title: Personalities: Nastase A Screaming Success
description: With the shrill screams of a crowd of teenage girls ringing in his ears, Ilie Nastase of Rumania beat Clark Graebner, the former United States Davis Cup player, 62, 64, yesterday to reach the quarterfinal round of the Dewar Cup tennis tournament in Nottingham, England.

title: Algeria to Transport Gas
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 15 (AP) Algeria has decided to take up her option to transport liquid natural gas being sold to the El Paso Natural Gas Company and Eascogas in the United States, and to Europe, in her own ships.

title: Pennsylvania Senate Votes For a Strict Abortion Bill
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 15 (AP)The Pennsylvania Senate voted 39 to 9 today in favor of a strict abortion bill that outlaws all abortions unless woman might. die from continued pregnancy.

title: South African Whites Hear a Plea and a, Warning
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 15Superficially, the scene would have been a familiar one to American liberalsa gathering in which earnest whites had gathered to hear blacks shout to them across the chasm of race.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The proposed dog litter law currently before the City Council is another example of the Lindsay administration's technique of focusing public attention on side issues while drawing attention away from its ineffectiveness in dealing with the city's major problems.

title: Meo Said to Retreat
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 15 (AP)A United States military spokesman reported today that Gen. Vang Pao's army of Meo tribesmen, which the American Central Intelligence Agency finances, had been pushed off the southern edge of the Plaine des Jarres. He said North Vietnamese forces shelled a force of several battalions for six hours Monday night and then made a ground attack Tuesday. The Meo retreated after suffering moderate casualties and were trying to regroup to the south, the spokesman said.

title: NETS SURGE TOPS COUGARS, 112107
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 15 It took Bill Melchionni a period and a half tonight to work out the kinks in the New York Nets offense, but then, with George Carter pulling the rope taut, the Nets stopped the Eastern Divisionleading Carolina Cougars 112107.

title: Trudeau Party, in Recount, Gets Extra Seat in Commons'
description: WHITBY, Ontario, Thursday, Nov. 16 (Reuters)Judicial recount has reversed the results of the Oct. 30 federal election in the province of Ontario, giving Premier Pierre Elliott Trudeau's Liberal party one more parliamentary seat and a 109107 edge in the House of Commons.

title: Dynamite Blast Hits Home of Dentist in Brooklyn
description: A dynamite charge exploded at 2 A.M. yesterday at the home of a dentist in Dyker Heights, Brooklyn, tearing out the garage door and the front door beside it and badly damaging his MercedesBenz sedan inside and the brickwork of the porch above.

title: Arab Officials, in Kuwait, Take Up Jordan's Relations
description: KUWAIT Nov. 15An Arab League meeting of foreign ministers and defense chiefs opened here today with Jordan's severed relations with Egypt and Syria as the main problem under review.

title: BISHOPS SUPPORT ANNULMENT STEP

title: 'Ulzana's Raid':Aldrich Directs Cast Led by Lancaster
description: Because film reviews in newspapers are essentially news storiesthat is, reports about what happened yesterday, to whom and whereone is required to describe at least something of the plot of Robert Aldrich's "Ulzana's Raid."However, I'll do it briefly because the very ordinary plot does not do justice to the complexity of the film itself. "Ulzana's Raid" is a Western whose conventional outlines have been rather violently and beautifully bent by Mr. Aldrich, an unreconstructed misogynist ("What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?") even when he makes movies (such as "The Dirty Dozen") dealing exclusively with men. On second thought, it may be that Mr. Aldrich doesn't really hate women. It could be that he feels they clutter up and, in effect, deny the dark side of the world where his most interesting films inevitably take place."Ulzana's Raid," which opened yesterday at the Forum and other theaters around town, is the story of an ill-fated flight and almost equally ill-fated pursuit, about a tough old Indian fighter (Burt Lancaster) and a callow young cavalry lieutenant (Bruce Davison) and their mission to track down an Apache named Ulzana who, with nine braves, has fled the reservation to murder, rape and find the Indian equivalent of identity. Why, the lieutenant asks his Apache scout, do Apaches kill so cruelly and wantonly? Says the scout: "Man give up power when he die. Like fire and heat."Like many Aldrich films, including the recent "The Grissom Gang," the new film plays Russian roulette with itself, not with bullets but with ludicrous lines, and with violence that is so excessive that it comes close to self-parody. Aldrich fans tend either to be humorless (like his worst critics) or to admire (as I do) the daring with which he so consistently courts disaster by turning an ordinary story into (in this case) a winner-take-nothing parable.Although "Ulzana's Raid" deals in the kind of narrative suspense and shock that would keep the most unsophisticated 42d Street audience awake, the film is as bleak as its Arizona landscapes. Much of the screenplay, written by Alan Sharp, depends on the pride and moral breakdown of the young lieutenant, an Eastern minister's son who is completely out of his element. Aldrich's West is a timeless place where noble motives lead to disastrous actions. Loyalties are hopelessly confused and the only possible satisfaction in life is behaving well for the immediate moment.This Burt Lancaster does with ease, along with Bruce Davison, Richard Jeackel and the rest of the predominantly male cast. Of the three women I remember in the film, one is shot to death so she can't be raped by Indians, a second is raped and turned into a raving lunatic, and the third, the Indian girl who plays Lancaster's mistress, is seen only from the eyes up. "Ulzana's Raid" has little time for sentiment.

title: 'Moonwalk One' -- A Record and Essay
description: Theo Kamecke's "Moonwalk One," which opened Monday at the Whitney Museum, is in part a record of, in part a speculation about, man's first landing on the moon, in July, 1969. Given the event, and given the nature of the medium, the film does better as record than as speculation. I'm not sure but that a straight documentary on Apollo 11, using some of this material, might not have been more meaningful as well as more informative. But "Moonwalk One" is what we have, and there is a lot to be taken from it.Necessarily, the film covers a lot of familiar territory, though not always from familiar points of view: the countdown, lift-off, flight, moon landing, return, triumphant homecoming  the by now almost ritual drama of space flightrecounted now with additions and changes. The tourist crowds around Cape Kennedy, the VIP's in NASA's official bleachers, the solemn preparation of the astronauts; space flight as public show and private adventureon just this level, "Moonwalk One" handles its contrasts and its ironies with tact and considerable intelligence.But on other levels it flounders. And whenever it attempts to face the meaning rather than the mechanics of its event it tends to descend into ponderous banalities both in narration (e.g., Around the world, another morning . . . not so different from the morning beforeor tomorrow moning . . .") and in accompanying image (Indian farmers, African tribesmen. European office workersall going about their business while the sun rises and Apollo 11 is made ready on the launch pad. . . . At its worst and most pretentious the film seems bent on evoking Stanley Kukrick's "2001," as if to force the insight that life imitates art.In general, one wishes there were less of Stonehenge ("Dawn remembers again the magic circle . . ." etc.) and more about practical hardware. At moments "Moonwalk One" is genuinely awe-inspiring, and those are always moments of precise technical concentration. The ascent of the lunar module seen from the command ship; the manufacture of the space suits (a fascinating and oddly moving sequence), above all, the lift-off of Apollo 11 itself, photographed by automated cameras from the launch tower and looking like a rehearsal for the end of the worldthese are the film's serious pleasures, and I think that on balance they are worth all the trivially profound and prophetic dross.

Beer parties in the Sigma Chi parking lot! Street dances on Fraternity Row! Pep rallies and bonfires! Marching bands, song girls, yell kings! Campus hijinks! Good Clean Fun! description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov 15The General Assembly debate on international terrorism which from the start of this session has given promise of stirring the widest interest here, has now assumedi pitchedbattle lines.

title: FUND DRIVE SAVES AN N.Y.U. SCHOOL;$1Million in Donations Will Spare Social Work Unit
description: A fundraising campaign that has brought in $1million will save New York University's Graduate School of Social Work, the university's president, Dr. James M. Hester, announced, yeesterday.

title: Gold Futures Trading Is Began at Winnipeg
description: Winnipeg, Nov. 15 (Reuters)  Gold futures trading began today on the Winnipeg Commodity Exchange. Business was brisk at the beginning but slackened towards the close. Total trading was estimated at 70 contracts.

title: 800 in Canarsie Hear 2 New Plans
description: The principal of Junia? High School.68 in Canarsie called last night for a trimming of the school's 98 per cent white enrollment as the community school board of District 18 held the first of three public hearings before meeting a mandate to redraw attendance zones for the school and two others.

title: Business Briefs
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 15 (AP)The El Paso Natural Gas Company filed an application today with the Federal Power Commission for approval to construct the world's first commercial complex to convert coal into a synthetic gas.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Franklin and Marshall College, sweeping to an unbeaten season with a 260 victory over Muhlenberg, won the 1972 Lambert Bowl, awarded annually since 1966 to the outstanding smallcollege (Division 111) football team in the East.

title: CORPORATIONS GET NOTAXRISE VOW
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15President Nixon's pledge not to raise taxes extends to corporation taxes, a high Treasury of ficial said today.

title: Memorial Rites Saturday For R. Hobart Ellis, Editor
description: A memorial service for Dr. R. Hobart Ellis, physicist and editor, will be held at 1 P. M. Saturday at the United.Nations Church Center, 777 United Nations Plaza. Dr. Ellis, whose body was found hanging from a tree on Tuesday in Hampton, N. H., was 54 years old. He lived at 25 Sutton Place South.

title: JAMES KOULOUVARIS
description: James Koulouvaris, owner of the Jim & Andy restaurant at 253 West 55th Street, died of coronary attack there on Mon1day evening. He was 57 years old.

title: Stage: Mourning Becomes Electra
description: More and more it seems that the future of the theater, even the future of the Broadway theater, rests with nonprofit institutional theater, and this, I think, is something to be warmly welcorned. Now another institutional theater has moved into the Broadway area. This is Theodore Mann's Circle in the Square, which has the new and handsome Joseph E. Levine Theater. This is backtoback with the new Uris Theater, officially opening next week.

title: Whirling Dervishes Show Ancient Ritual in Brooklyn
U.S. VIETNAM AIDE QUITS IN DISGUST
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Nov. 15 (AP)  Willard E. Chambers, a senior official in the American pacification protram in South Vietnam, has resigned his $42,000ayear job in sheer disgust with the leadership and the philosophy being applied to what he calls much maligned cause.

title: Prague Combating Anger and Apathy
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 11Czechoslovakia's Communist leaders have begun a significant ideological campaign to attract public approval and support in the face of widespread apathy and resentment.

title: Don't Forget the State Department
description: WASHINGTON  The hoped for Vietnam settlement, if it materializes, would be a triumph of personal diplomacy. It could only have been accomplished by Henry Kissinger working with the President alone. But will the President draw the wrong lessons from this experience, as well as from his Moscow and Peking triumphs, about how to make policy?

title: OCTOBER OUTPUT FOR INDUSTRY UP BY 9.3% OVER 1971
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Industrial production rose strongly in October, bringing the output of the nation's factories, mines and utilities to a level 9.3 per cent above the same month a year earlier, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The Plaza isn't her bag, said Betsey Johnson. So the designer of clothes for liberated juniors decided to have her spring and summer fashion show for Alley Cat at the Fashion Institute of Technology.

title: MARION AND ALZA STUDY A MERGER
description: Marion Laboratories, Inc., announced yesterday it had entered into preliminary negotiations to acquire the Alza Corporation of Palo Alto, Calif. Alza is engaged in research and development of pharmaceutical products in which drugs are in new types of dosage forms called therapeutic systems.

title: Necessity of Civil Service Questioned in City Report
description: A confidential report to a city committee studying the Civil Service has concluded that the system is an inadequate, outdated, rigid, largely meritless and possibly superfluous bureauracy that seems to discriminate against the most qualified applicants for public service.

title: Olympic Unit Shops for New Host City After Denver Withdrawal
description: GENEVA, Nov. 15  The International Olympic Committee tossed up for grabs today the role of host to the 1976 Winter Games that Denver has had to renounce.

title: Jury Investigating Mafia Hears an Islip Republican
description: Anthony Pace, Islip Republican leader and deputy Suffolk County attorney, testified yesterday for half an hour before a Brooklyn grand jury and said later that he had been told his name appeared only in the context of not doing business with the Mafia.

title: SCHOOL OUSTER CASE GETS STATE HEARING
description: ALBANY, Nov. 15 (UPI)Attorneys for an Ulster County school board told the state yesterday that they dismissed Superintendent Dexter Q. Arnold for a consistent pattern of frustrating board policy.

title: Dow Officially Crossed 1,000 Landmark Twice
description: The record closing at 1,003.16 on Tuesday by the DowJones industrial average has raised questions as to how many times previously this market indicator.surpassed the 1,000 mark.

title: Chess: In Ceding a Central Pawn Central Pawn Make Sure the Trade's Fair
description: There are times when it is effective to give up the center, to exchange off a pawn that served as a bastion there, for the sake of suddenly unmasking the pieces behind it, for a counterattack on the opposing pawn center.

title: Tokyo Dow Climbs To a Record Level
description: TOKYO, Nov. 15Stock prices rose sharply to a record here today, exceeding 4,600 yen on the local DowJones average for the first time since the stock market opened in May, 1949.

title: Con Ed Shifting Sites From the Hudson
COTTON FUTURES SHOW SHARP GAIN
description: Cotton futures prices moved up sharply yesterday in futures trading on the New York Cotton Exchange. The rise came in reaction to the Government's announcement late Tuesday that it hoped to cut back the crop by about 20 per cent next year.

title: She Has a Way With Plantains
description: Every immigrant wave has brought new foods to New York City. And, like the immigrants who brought them, the foods have become naturalized, have worked their way into the larder of America, or failing that, of this cosmopolitan city.

title: Red Tide North of Miami
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 15 (AP) Pollutioncontrol officials today identified a patch of discolored water floating five miles north of Miami Beach's motel row as the fishkilling red tide. Samples were identified as Gymnodiniuml3revis, fastblooming organism commonly known as red tide,

title: VICKERS SCORES 3 GOALS, RANGERS ROUT FLYERS, 73
description: Helping the crowd at Madison Square Garden forget Brad Park's absence, Steve Vickers got three goals for the second straight game last night and the Rangers soared past the Philadelphia Flyers, 73.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: GOTTINGEN, West Germany, Nov. 15 (Reuters)A young East German was apparently wounded in an unsuccessful attempt to cross into West Germany last night when he touched off an automatic gunfiring mechanism while climbing a metal fence, border officials said here today.

title: A.M.C. EARNINGS SOARED IN YEAR
description: DETROIT, Nov. 15  The American Motors Corporation reported net earnings of $30.2million, or a $1.11 a share, for the 1972 fiscal year ended Sept. 30, its highest profitg since 1964, when the company began to go into a steep decline.

title: F.T.C. Challenges Pepsico on Merger
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The Federal Trade Commission today challenged the proposed acquisition of the Rheingold Corporation by Pepsico, Inc., contending that it might substantially lessen competition in the softdrink industry.

title: STOCK MARGIN DEBT UNCHANGED IN MONTH
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that stock margin debt had not risen in October for the first time in 11 months and had remained at $7.8billion, unchanged from the September level.

title: Student, 18, Protests in Court MarriageLicense Denial
description: Robert Friedrich, an 18yearold college sophomore, went into State Supreme Court here yesterday to protest the refusal by the City Clerk to grant him an application for a marriage license.

title: Peron Is Rebuffed in Attempt to See Pope
description: ROME, Nov. 15  Former President Juan D. Pettit of Argentina was rebuffed today in an attempt to see Pope. Paul VI on the eve of his, return to his country.

title: Preventive Medicine Need Called Great
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 15The chairman of the President's Committee on Health Education, said here today that the nation's hospitals would be flooded with patients in the event that. a national health insurance law was passed unless people learned and practiced preventive medicine.

title: Midwest Exchange to Cut Fees for Some Foreigners
description: CHICAGO Nov. 15 (UPI)The Midwest Stock Exchange board of governors has approved a rule change that would grant a 40 per cent discount of the exchange's public brokerage rate to certain foreign brokerages, an official of the exchange said today.

title: Party Recalls Tallulah Bankhead Era
description: What looked like the whole surviving cast of characters from the life of the late Tallulah Bankhead gathered last night at a black tie party for 425 guests at that occasional literary salon, Abercrombie & Fitch.

title: NEWARK WARNED ON FISCAL CRISIS
description: TRENTON, Nov. 15High administration and legislative leaders reported tonight that Newark's fiscal crisis would not be resolved in the current session of the Legislature, thus presenting the city with the damaging prospect of an enormous increase in its local property tax, which is already regarded as confiscatory.

title: TESTIMONY IS ENDED IN BREWSTER TRIAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI) Testimony in the bribery trial of Daniel B. Brewster, former Democratic Senator from Maryland, ended today with the Government unable to find its final witness.

title: Japanese Begin the Trial of a U.S. Marine in a Controversial Okinawan Murder Case
description: TOKYO, Nov. 15A United States Marine corporal charged with murder was. put on trial in a Japanese court on Okinawa today in a case that has sent Japanese and American tempers flaring here.

title: FUEL CELLS. TRIED AS POWER SOURCE;Test in. Newark Is Aimed at Solving PeakLoad Needs.
Gianelli Shows the Knicks They're 3Deep in Centers
description: Someone made a remark about John Gianelli's new hairstyle after he had played a key role for the New York Knicks in Tuesday night's 10397 victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: The New Wisdom
description: PHILADELPHIAFor a variety of reasons, the Nixon Administration has moved boldly to negotiate an end to U.S. participation in the Vietnam war. The reasons relate only in part to the war's debilitating effect on the American global posture and to its rending impact on the American domestic scene.

title: Westfield's Christmas Pageant To Go on Pending Court Ruling
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Borough President Percy E. Sutton of Manhattan said yesterday the Western Union Telegraph Company's plans to close all of its 102 local offices here would worsen rather than improve service.

title: THREAT OF STRIKE RAISED BY PILOTS
description: The president of the Air Line Pilots Association yesterday raised the threat of a nationwide shutdown of airline service to back up demands fort more effective action against hijacking.

title: Dick Allen, in a Landslide, Is Voted American League's Most Valuable
description: Dick Allen, the powerhitting outcast from the National League, scored a runaway victory yesterday when he was elected the most valuable player in the American League after one season with the Chicago White Sox.

title: People and Business
description: When John W. Simmons, the secondranking officer of Becton, Dickinson & Co., the medicalequipment manufacturer, resigned unexpectedly on Monday, the company made a twosentence announcement of the fact, identifying him as executive vice president and a director but failing to mention that he was also chief operating officer and chairman of the executive committee.

title: They No Longer Laugh as Jacobson Lines Up to Play
description: For a firstround draft choice and an allAmerican football player who also was voted the nation's top college lineman, Larry Jacobson was the target of a barrage of denigrating comments even before his pro football career began.

title: 8 Poverty Programs Get Grants From Archdiocese!
description: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York has allocated more than $65,000 in selfhelp grants to eight antipoverty programs in Manhattan and the Bronx and in Westchester and Rockland Counties.

title: MET'S NICO CAST EL IN DIE ZAUBERFLOTE
description: The season's fourth performance of Die Zauberflte at the Metropolitan Opera brought Nico Castel into the cast for his first portrayal here of Monostatos. Mr. Castel downed enthusiastically as the ineffectually evil black slave and after a rather smallvoiced start was able to project his jingling tunes nicely.

title: Cambodians Report Road Open.
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 15 (AP)The Cambodian high command said today that its troops had recaptured the dis trict capital of Trapeang Kraleng and had reopened a 37 mile stretch of the road connecting Pnompenh with the sea.

title: Lakers Win 8th in a Row
description: DETROIT, Nov. 15 (AP)Wilt Chamberlain and Gail Goodrich led a secondhalf rally that carried the Los Angeles Lakers to their eighth straight victory and the 13th in their last 14 games as they whipped the Detroit Pistons, 110.99, tonight.

title: MARKET DECLINES IN PROFIT TAKING
description: A burst of afternoon profit taking turned the stock market slightly lower yesterday and sent the DowJones industrial average to a closing below 1,000.

title: Feminists Stir Career Parley at Stevens
UNLIMITED HOURS SOUGHT FOR BARS
description: The Lindsay administration yesterday proposed the ending of tilt restrictions on the hoursthat the city's taverns mayremain that thisopen, arguingwould combat the growing problens of illegal, afterhours bottleclubs and would have little effect on society's drinking patte??s.

title: CONGRESSMEN OFF ON FOREIGN TRIPS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.15 (UPI) Members of Congress are traveling to places like the Sudan, Ethiopia, the Phillippines and Greece on official business. Some people would call the trips junkets.

title: State Welfare Chief Hails Federal Ceiling on Aid
description: Admitting that his words sound like heresy, Abe Lavine, State Commissioner of Social Services, said yesterday that the newly enacted ceiling on Federal aid for social services would provide a constructive opportunity to rethink programs.

title: IMPACT OF THE SST ON OZONE STUDIED
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 15  Specialists in atmospheric chemistry made a preliminary attempt here today to come to grips with what some of them consider the crucial though admittedly remote threat of supersonic transport operations.

title: Israeli Memorial Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) A sports facility, with a swimming pool, gymnasium and arena, will be built as a memorial to the 11 Israeli Olympians who were slain in Munich, it was announced today.

title: Ifs, Ands and Buts of Basketball Merger Here Again
description: The club owners of the 17 National Basketball Association teams will meet here today to discuss, and perhaps decide; where they stand now on the question of merging with the American Basketball Association.

title: To Check Diabetes
description: Diabetics under proper control (through diet, insulin or other medication) look and act like anybody else. Consequently most people do not realize what a serious disease diabe tes is. Yet it is the fifth largest cause of death by disease in the United States and the second leading cause of new cases of blindness. To combat this major health problem, the American Diabetes Association, in partnership with its 48 affiliate associations throughout the country, sponsors programs of education, detection and research.

title: Archibald Gets 47 Points
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 15 (AP)  Nate Archibald scored 47 points tonight to lead the Kansas CityOmaha Kings to a 10697 triumph over the Seattle Supersonics.

title: Welfare Rent Rises Urged In Plan to lmprove Housing
description: A proposal prepared jointly by the New York City Rand Institute and the Human Resources Administration aims at radically improving ghetto life by forcing landlords to improve housing and ending the haphazard dispersal of welfare families into other sections of the city.

title: Free TV Time Aids Drive By Foes of Arms Control
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15For 30 minutes Sunday, television stations WLWT in Cincinnati and WOTV in Grand Rapids, Mich., two affiliates of the National Broadcasting Company, switched from their normal evening programing to the Cold War.

title: Tams Rout Conquistadors
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Nov. 15 (AP)Lee Davis and George Thompson. had 32 points each and Johnny Neumann set a club record with 15 assists tonight as the Memphis. Tams beat the San Diego Conquistadors, 126101.

title: 2MILLION RANSOM IMPERS AIRLINE
description: The $2million debt incurred by Southern Airways to pay three Havanabound hijackers Saturday has placed the airline in a very serious financial position, Secor D. Browne, chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, said yesterday.

title: Advertising:
description: McCannErickson found out yesterday how the cookie crumbled as Nabisco, a client for 38 years, announced it was moving its domestic business to Ogilvy & Mather July 1.

title: CELTICS TRIUMPH OVER, SUNS,113 94
description: BOSTON, Nov. 15 (AP)Dave Cowens scored 25 points and hauled down 19 rebounds in pacing the Boston Celtics to a 11394 National Basketball Association victory over the Phoenix Suns tonight. It was the Celtics 14th victory in 15 starts.

title: Gribbins Family Pulls Champions Out of a Hat
description: Dr. and Mrs. James A. Gribbin are known to dog fanciers for their Great Danes, particularly. Ch. Heidere's Kolyer Kimbayh, currently the topwinning representative of the breed in America. However, it wasn't a Dane the Trenton couple had when they started with dogs 22 years ago. We had a cocker spaniel as a pet, said Mrs. Gribbin: When we started to show, however, it was a boxer bitch. She had 6 points toward her championship when she died. That was 10 years ago and we were griefstricken. We wanted another dog immediately, but not a boxer, since we had been so attached to our pet.

title: Coast Reporter Again Told To Disclose Source to Court
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 15 (UPI)  William T. Farr, a reporter, has been advised to appear in court at 2 P.M. tomorrow to be asked again by Judge Charles H. Older to identify the source of an article he wrote in 1970 about the Charles Manson family during the murder trial of Manson and three of his women followers.

title: CHAPARRALS BEAT COLONELS, 10499
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 15 (AP)  The Dallas Chaparrals coupled a productive inside game with a dogging defense tonight to secure a 10499 American Basketball Association victory over the Kentucky Colonels.

title: Umberto Vedovelli, 60, Dies; Assistant Conductor at Met
description: Umberto Vedovelli, an assistant conductor at the Metropolitan Opera, died after a heart attack early yesterday in his home at 170 West End Avenue. He was 60 years old.

title: Activist Who Succeeded Given Tribute in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15When these people told me they wanted to give me a testimonial, I said, Well, hell, just invite the folks over to the hOuse; we'll set up some chairs and get some Cokes. I just couldn't imagine more than 50 people wanting to do something for me.

title: DEMOCRATS CHIEF GIVEN NEW REBUFF
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Representative Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., a liberal Democrat from Massachusetts and heir apparent to the post of House majority leader, has added his weight to the pressure on Jean Westwood to resign as chairman of the Democratic National Committee.

title: CORPORATE RATES CONTINUE TO FALL
description: Interest rates on corporate and Government bonds continued to tumble yesterday, extending the pattern that has prevailed for most of November so far.

title: Nebraska Marks Safety Day
description: OMAHA, Nov. 15 (AP)Nebraska's Super Safety Day today had as its aim a 24hour period without a single traffic accident While the state fell far short of that goalthe state's first traffic accident today was recorded at 12:01 A.M. Gov. J. James Exon said his realistic goal was reached. Only one traffic death had been recorded by tonight.

title: State Abortion Law Critics Take Protest to Governor
description: OLEAN, N. Y., Nov. 15 Life, life, life, life, the 75 placardwaving demonstrators protesting the state's liberalized abortion law chanted today as Governor Rockefeller walked through a path they cleared for him on his way into the Castle Restaurant here.

title: Fasten Your Cigarette
description: The passenger plane revs up, gets airborne, andeven before the pretty young thing takes the drink orderssmoke begins to fill the cabin: cigarette smoke. Is this the way to run an airline? Apparently for some of the carriers it is. Nonsmokers would prefer not to make Federal case of the fact that the man or woman in the next seat is huffing and puffing. They would rather have the Federal Government lay down the law.

title: Federal Guideline On Radiation Level Is Called Too High
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15A report on the biological effects of radiation concludes that the present guidelines for maximum human exposure are far higher than they should be.

title: Peronist Group Calls Strike
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 15 (UPI)The Peronistdominated General Labor Confederation said today that it was declaring a general strike on Friday so workers could welcome Juan D. Peron home after his 17year exile.

title: Westbury Double Pays $609 as 11 Choice Fails
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 15 Abbe O'Brien, driven by Gary Myer, won the first race at Roosevelt Raceway tonight, paying $47.80 for $2 and setting up a $609 daily, double return with Kammy's Dream High, the $16.40 winner of the second race.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Burroughs Corporation and Texas Instrument, Inc., announced yesterday new computerterminal models. The Burroughs terminals, called the TC3500 series, act independently as small computers as well as inputoutput devices for larger computers.

title: Mrs. Rogel, an Editor, Is Married in Jersey
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Nov. 15  Mrs. Therese Rogel, daughter of Mrs. Robert Grosman and the late Judge Grosman of the New Jersey Chancery Court, was married here today to Sidney Greendorfer of Verona, founder and president of the International Bolt and Nut Company in Newark.

title: 2 Rape a Cleaning Woman, 34, at P.S. 186
description: A 34yearold cleaning woman was raped yesterday afternoon by two youths in Public School by at 521 West 145th Street.

title: Restaurant Union Reports A Pact and 2 New Strikes
description: The Dining Room Employes Union reported one new settlement yesterday and two new restaurant strikes.

title: Deerfield Academy Gains $5Million Anonymous Gift
description: DEERFIELD, Mass., Nov. 15 (AP)Deerfield Academy announced today that it had received a $5million anonymous, unrestricted gift, the largest single contribution ever given to the 175yearold private boys school.

title: LAND TRUST HOLDERS BACKED ON MEETINGS
description: Shareholders of the Texas Pacific Land Trust have the right, and not solely at the discretion of the trustees, to call a meeting if it is requested by the registered holders of per cent of the value of the present outstanding shares.

title: Peron Leaves Rome for Buenos Aires
description: ROME, Friday, Nov. 17 Former President Juan D. Pern left here early this morning to return to Argentina for the first time since his regime was over thrown in 1955.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Hunting Explained in a Book by Ortega
description: CROYDEN, N. H.  The day is gray and damp. The wet snow that fell during the night is nearly gone from the ground and the last mess es of it have long since slipped from the dark green spruce branches.

title: Cry of Bingo Stirs Blood Of Even the Most Geriatric
description: It was 3 o'clock in the af ternoon in Maspeth, Queens, and the women were filing out of the bingo hall, con tented. Some would return for the evening session and others would go to similar halls in different neighbor hoods for a change of luck.

title: Malmberg to Pilot Omaha
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 16 (AP) The Kansas City Royals an nounced today that Harry Malmberg would succeed Jack McKeon as manager of their TripleA baseball farm club at Omaha in the American Asso ciation.

title: Gorman in Semifinals
description: LONDON, Nov. 16 (AP)  Tom Gorman of Seattle took five straight games in the final set for a quarterfinal triumph over Australia's Barry Phillips Moore in the Dewar Cup indoor tennis competition today.

title: MINORITY HIRING SAID TO HURT SOME
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov. 16  The United States Civil Rights Commission has found that some programs guaranteeing jobs for members of minority groups have caused conflicts among those groups.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Jack Musick, a longtime asistant at Dartmouth under ?? Blackman, will send an motionally charged Cornell team against the Big Green tomorrow in Ithaca, N. Y. Cornell and Musick have not beaten Dartmouth since 1967, and if Cornell has any hope of retaining its share of the Ivy League football title, that losing streak must come to an end on Schoellkopf Field.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 16A New ark lawyer and his wife filed a suit in Superior Court today against banks and savings in stitutions to demand an ac counting of escrow accounts on G.I. mortgages.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE TO RECORD FINISH
description: The DowJones industrial av erage caught its second wind yesterday and, in a driving finish, went on to a record clos ing at 1,003.69. The market's favorite indicator, reflecting strength by motors and other blue chips, gained 5.27 points in the process.

title: College Student Is Exonerated Of 3 Rape Charges in Queens
description: A Queens grand jury has found no evidence linking a 17yearold Baruch College freshman with the rape of three women and an attempted sexu al assault on another, District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell announced yesterday.

title: Tower of London to Let Women Be Beefeaters
description: LONDON, Nov. 16  The red  tunicked, pike  bearing Beefeater guards at the Tower of London may get women colleagues, thanks to a long campaign by a Labor Member of Parliament for equal job opportunities for women.

title: H.T. AQUILA AIDED BY A LONG LAYOFF
U.N. ?? Press Issue
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 16The General Assem bly's Social Committee today deferred until next year con sideration of a draft convention for the protection of journalists working in areas of armed conflict.

title: Maravich Aims To Play
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 16 (AP) Pete Maravich, who has seen parttime action for nearly two weeks with a partial paralysis of his face, insists he will re join his Atlanta Hawks team mates this weekend even if he doesn't feel like it.

title: Equity Financing
description: The San Diego Gas & Electric Company yesterday filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed public offering of 1.5 million common shares through underwriters managed by Blyth Eastman Dillon and Merrill Lynch. The company's stock was up  at 19 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: JOHNNY NASH HEARD; BILLY PAUL ON BILL
description: Johnny Nash, who was born in the United States, lived in Jamaica, West Indies, and now is based in England (where he is a major artist), arrived at the Bitter End on Wednesday at the best possible time. His record ing of I Can See Clearly

title: FRANKLIN C. HARRIS
description: RIVER EDGE, N. J., Nov. 16 Franklin C. Harris, a sales representative for the Nabisco Company for 34 years, died yes terday of an embolism at his home here. His age was 62.

title: Books of The Times
description: QUEEN VICTORIA. From Her Birth to the Death of the Prince Consort. By Cecil WoodhamSmith. 486 pages. Illustrated. Knopf. $10.

title: Dance: The Stamp of an Exceptional Performer
description: The fact that the best dancers in the Alvin Alley City Center Dance Theater are men seems finally ac knowledged by a new Play bill cover for the current City Center season that shows eight male members of the company and no women.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: There is an inaccuracy in your Oct. 31 editorial Undermining the Court. You state that  it was the Nixon Court's fivetofour decision last June that denied reporters the right to pro tect confidential sources. And it was shortly after this ruling that, for the first time in this nation's history, a reporter went to jail for his refusal to surrender to governmental inquisition.

title: Nixon and Connally Confer On Changes in Government
description: THURNIONT, Md. Nov. 16 (UPI)  President Nixon met with John B. Connally at his Camp David retreat today. The White House said the purpose of the meeting was to discuss Mr. Nixon's planned Govern ment reorganization and a number of other things.

title: Arts Abroad
description: DUSSELDORF, Germany The most widely published German writer here right now is Heinrich Heine. Hav ing survived the thousand years of Hitler's Reich when textbooks containing his fa mous Die Lorelei said its author was unknown, he is now recognized as a master of modern Ger man prose. That prose is intimate and informative at once, opinion ated but humor ous, and melodious. It has a dreamlike quality, too, and it may be no accident that Richard Wagner took his themes of The Flying Dutch man and of Tannhaeuser from Heine. At this point, Heine editions in several vol umes are again available to every student in the Federal Republic, although it would perhaps be more useful if separate editions of his major works, for instance, Lutetia (on France), were available as paperbacks. East Germany has taken considerable inter est in the works of the poet, who was a friend of Karl Marx and Friedridh Engels. A mammoth edition of all of Heine's output, known as the Saekularausgabe, is nearing volume 27 at East Berlin's Academieverlag. To be completed in 1980, it will include all known letters written by, and to, Heine as well ?? those of his works that were written in French.

title: Improvements in Queens Jail Displayed
description: The city's Correction Com missioner, Benjamin J. Mal colm, spoke proudly yesterday of tremendotis change as he led newsmen on a tour of the Long Island City, Queens, jail where a series of prison riots here began in October, 1970.

title: Eight U.S. Units in Vietnam With 585 Men Deactivated
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 16 (AP)The United States command announced today that eight Army, Navy and Air Force units totaling 585 men had been deactivated.

title: Stallion Sold for $11,700
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 16 (AP)Spoon Balt, a stakes winner of $151,604 during his career, brought the top price of $11,700 today during Keene land's breeding stock sale. The 10yearold stallion, consigned by Pennsylvania National Farms Inc., went to the MacLeod As sociation of Lexington.

title: Earnings Records Set
description: Federated Department Stores, Inc., which includes Blooming dale's and Abraham & Straus in its 209unit chain, and Mar cor, Inc., which operates more than 460 Montgomery Ward stores, reported yesterday rec ord sales and earnings in the three and nine months ended Oct. 28.

title: Workers Die in Trench
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 16 (AP) The bodies of three construc tion workers were recovered today from a collapsed sewer trench. Two other workers were presumed dead, rescue officials said.

title: PARAGUAYAN ENVOY HELD UP IN HOTEL
description: A diplomat from Paraguay was robbed of $50 at gunpoint last night in an elevator at the Summit Hotel, 569 Lexington Avenue, at 51st Street. He was uninjured and the two holdup men escaped, the police said.

title: SULZBERGER CITES PROBLEMS OF PRESS
description: The task of the press is more difficult because news becomes more complex, harder to re port and interpret so that sense emerges from tangled facts, Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, pub lisher of The New York Times, said last night.

title: KNICKERBOCKERS DEFEAT ROCKETS, GAIN ON CELTICS
description: Earl Monroe came out of his offensive slumber last night.

title: 3Man Board to Visit Calley On Nov. 27 to Hear Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) A board of three officers will visit First Lieut. William L. Cal ley Jr. on Nov. 27 to hear his appeal for clemency in the 20 year sentence he is serving for the slaying of civilians at Mylai.

title: Conference in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 16 (AP)American offi cials, headed by Ambassador Ellsworth Bunker, conferred again today with South Viet namese officials on the draft Indochina peace accord.

title: Activist Coalition Sues Health Unit On Role for Poor
description: Charging the city with a lack of concern for the health needs of its poor, an activist coalition of community leaders has filed suit in Federal Court against the city's new Comprehensive Health Planning Agency.

title: 50,000 PROTEST APPAREL IMPORTS
description: About 50,000 garment work ers in the metropolitan area left their jobs yesterday after noon to join a nationwide dem onstration to dramatize their opposition to the rising tide of imported women's apparel.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: SADDLE BROOK, Nov. 16 A 31yearold Saddle Brook man charged with rape, threat to kill, assault with a weapon, il legal possession of a gun, pos session of narcotics, posssession of stolen property and having a counterfeit driver's license was freed yesterday after he posted bail of $45,000.

title: Scotch Valley Is Winner In Toronto High Jumping
description: TORONTO, Nov. 16  Liz Ashton rode Scotch Valley to victory in the international puissance (high jump) stake at the Royal Winter Fair horse show tonight and sent the Ca nadian equestrian team into the lead for the championship.

title: Theater
description: Since one of the two characters in Paul Ableman's new British play, Green Julia, is a plant physi ologist and the untidy digs he shares with the other character, an economist, is filled with thriving plants, one has every reason to suspect that Julia refers to greenery.

title: Giant Letdown for Cards No, Says Athas
description: It's time for the Giants to become afflicted with pro football's syndrome of a nat ural letdown after the big game. But Pete Athas thinks the team can escape the malady in its game at St. Louis Sunday.

title: Advertising:
description: What makes airline adver tising so different is that most carriers use the same equipment, so they've got to advertise destinations, sched ules, service, stewardesses, movies, food or lounges.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 16A far reaching bill that would give the state the power to regulate land use in designated flood plains cleared the New Jersey Assembly today, 69 to 2, and was sent to the Senate.

title: State Buying Choice Tract Of Forest in Adirondacks
description: ALBANY, Nov. 16An in dustrialist who fished an Adi rondack mountain stream as a boy agreed today to sell a choice tract of wilderness near the stream to the state.

title: WEST ASKS SOVIET AND BLOC TO TALKS ON CUTTING FORCES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  The United States and several of its European allies have in vited the Soviet Union and some of its bloc partners to begin ex ploratory talks Jan. 31 on re ducing military forces in Cen tral Europe, the State Depart ment announced today.

title: 2 Die in Clash With Police On Baton Rouge Campus
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 16 Two young blacks were killed and one was wounded today in a day of violence that led Gov. Edwin W. Edwards to close the Southern University campus here.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 16 (Reuters)George Best has been suspended from Northern Ireland's next three soccer World Cup qualifying games, it was announced today. The disciplinary committee of the International Football Fed eration suspended Best for being thrown out of Northern Ireland's Group Six European Zone match against Bulgaria in Sofia Oct. 19. The ban means Best will miss both of Northern Ireland's games against Cyprus next year and a home match against Portugal.

title: Fighting Saints Win, 54
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 16 (AP)A shorthanded goal by Terry Ryan early in the third period proved decisive as the Minnesota Fighting Saints edged the Quebec Nordiques, 54, tonight.

title: Sailors' Lawyer in Philippines Says Navy Forced His Ouster
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 16  A civilian lawyer has charged that Navy intelligence officers were responsible for his ouster from Subic Bay in the Philippines, where he had been defending dozens of black sailors in courtsmartial cases.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their at mosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Southern U. Cancels Grambling Contest
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 16 (AP)The GramblingSouth ern University football game scheduled here Saturday has been canceled because of in cidents at the school today in which two blacks were killed, Southern officials said.

title: Man in the News
description: Disappointed. What the hell do you expect me to say?

title: CRONKITE, OTHERS WON'T CROSS LINE
description: Walter Cronkite, John Hart, Roger Mudd, Daniel Schorr and other newsmen at the Columbia Broadcasting System said yes terday that they would obey a performer's union order to hon or picket lines set up by striking C.D.S. technicians.

title: Uncertainties Seen In PricePay Curbs
description: The future of the wageprice control program is an unknown factor in the economy and is not likely to be clarified before the President presents his State of the Union message to Con gress early next year, James W. McLane, deputy director of the Cost of Living Council, said yesterday.

title: ROCKEFELLER URGES ONETERM MAYOR
description: Governor Rockefeller, assert ing that the idea of a biparti san fusion candidate for Mayor of New York City next year was a live one, feels that such a candidate should be commit ted to only one term in office to do a job that would be less than fully popular.

title: BREWSTER TRIAL IS GIVEN TO JURY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  The bribery trial of former Senator Daniel B. Brewster was given to the jury today in Fed eral District Court.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 16 Imamu Amiri Baraka, the black nationalist leader, and the white president of the Newark Patrolmen's Benevolent Asso ciation engaged in an im promptu debate today over the Kawaida Towers housing proj ect, turning a meeting of 300 municipal planners here into A tumultuous crowd yelling at the P.B.A. leader.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In the Nov. 11 issue of The Times you published a letter from Elizabeth M. Thomas of Cambridge, Mass., en titled Quebec's Doomed Wolves.

title: Many Ethnic Germans Being Permitted to Emigrate From Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 16  The continuing exodus of Soviet Jews to Israel has been match ed in the last two weeks by a sudden spurt in the emigra tion of ethnic Germans with close relatives in West Ger many.

title: Winter on Way, City Gets Ready
description: At the Sanitation Depart ment on these almostwinter days, the top men are walk ing around with the meas ured deliberation of generals preparing for war.

title: JOSEPH G. CORN JR.
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 16Joseph G. Corn Jr., a New York lawyer and for the last 10 years a village judge here, died yesterday in Mount Kisco Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived on Green Meadows Road.

title: THO DUE IN PARIS TODAY, AIDES SAY
description: PARIS, Nov. 16The North Vietnamese delegation to the Vietnam peace talks said today that Le Duc Tho would arrive here tomorrow for further pri vate talks with Henry A. Kis singer but would not discuss any modification of the sub stance of their draft agreement on a ceasefire in the war.

title: Canadiens Keep Winning
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 16 (UPI) Jacques Lemaire scored his 16th goal of the season and set up Yvan Cournoyer's 13th tally tonight as the Montreal Cana diens defeated the Philadelphia Flyers, 65, in the N.H.L.

title: Life of Thais Harder, If Anything, Since Junta Seized Power Year Ago, Though Economy Has Gained
description: BANKOK, Thailand, Nov. 16 (AP)Field Marshal Thanom Kittikachorn and the military junta he heads will mark the first anniversary of their sei zure of absolute power with a big display of the army's hard ware tomorrow.

title: Troubled Raiders to Stay In City, W.H.A. Insists
description: Poor attendance and a dis appointing beginning in World Hockey Association competition have forced an impending change in ownership for the New York Raiders, but the team will continue in New York.

title: About Pro Football
description: The undefeated Dolphins, going for their 10th straight victory, will open up Sun day's six hours of televised pro football (Channel 4, 1 P.M.) playing the Jets in Miami. The Dolphins are favored by 8 points. Then come the favored Giants against the Cardinals froth St. Louis (Channel 2, 2 PM.) and as soon as their game ends the same channel will pick up the VikingsRams contest in progress from Los. Angeles. The Monday night game is Atlanta at Washing ton (Channel 7, 9 o'clock). With five games to go, 15 of the 26 teams remain in contention for the eight post season playoff positions. Here is a preview of all con tests with wonlosttied rec ords in parentheses:

title: London Hails Lauren Bacall
description: LONDON, Nov. 16 (Reuters) Lauren Bacall made a trium phant British stage debut to night in the Broadway hit Ap plause. Thunderous clapping and roofraising cheers greeted her at the London opening of the musical in which she starred for over a year in New York and later on tour. The play was adapted from the 1950 film Alt About Eve.

title: NEWCOMBE STAYS ON A HOT STREAK
description: ROTTERDAM, the Nether lands, Nov. 16 (AP)  Top seeded John Newcombe of Aus tralia continued his winning streak by beating Charlie Pasa rell of Puerto Rico, 63, 64, in the quarterfinals of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis tour tournament today.

title: Market Place: Of Accountants And Footnotes
description: Some years ago, an elder ly woman approached a lawyer assigned by a court to look after the interests of shareholders of a bankrupt company.

title: CRUSADERS WIN; BUCHANAN NETS 4
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 16 (AP) Ron Buchanan scored four goals and assisted on another tonight in leading the Cleve land Crusaders to a 6.3 victory over the Ottawa Nationals in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Trial Date to Be Set
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 16 (UPI)  Attorneys will meet Tues day to fix a starting date for the trial of Daniel Ellsberg for the theft of the Pentagon pa pers, United States District Judge Matt Byrne said today.

title: RUSSIANS TO GET PEPSICOLA PLANT
description: PepsiCola next year will be come the first American con sumer product manufactured and sold in the Soviet Union.

title: Winnebago to Appeal Ruling
description: FOREST CITY, Iowa, Nov. 16 (UPI)Winnepago Industries, Inc., said today it would appeal the $4million judgment ob tained against the company re cently by LifeTime Industries, Inc., a former dealer for Win nebago's recreational vehicles. LifeTime had sued for $445 million, charging it was fraud ulently induced to become a Winnebago dealer and that Winnebago had interferred with LifeTime marketing rights and trade secrets.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: This is to supplement your editorial of Oct. 23 on The People's Schools, which commented on Judge Fraiman's decision that all community school board vacancies must now be filled by special elections because the State Constitution does not permit vacancy appointments lasting beyond the end of the calendar year. That editorial makes some good points but overlooks cer tain basic elements of the situation which seem also to have escaped Judge Fraiman.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The department of commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1,006,000,000, up 5 percent from the yearearlier $957million. Total retail store sales were an estimated $8,940, 000,000, up 6 per cent from the year earlier $8,416,600,000.

title: A SOVIET DISSIDENT WILL LECTURE HERE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 16The So viet authorities have granted permission for a leading intel lectual dissident, Valery Chal idze, to visit the United States for a month with his wife to deliver two university lectures.

title: A.T.&T. to Meet in Chicago
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company has de cided to bring its annual meet ing back to Chicago, which was the site of the largest stock holders meeting ever held. A. T. & T. said yesterday it would hold the 1973 stockhold ers meeting in the Arie Crown Theater of McCormick Place on April 18 This will be the 10th meeting held outside of New York.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 16 (UPI)For the 13th, time in 15 years, Brooks Robinson of the Baltimore Orioles has won the Gold Glo've as the best fielding third baseman in the American League, the Sporting News has announced.

title: Metropolitan Life Appoints
description: The Metropolitan Life Insur ance Company, which decided last month to sell insurance on cars and homes, announced the appointment yesterday of J. Al bert Burgoyne, 58 years old, as president and chief execu tive of the Metropolitan Prop erty and Liability Insurance Company.

title: Bush Lashes Out at Soviet In U.N. Debate on Dues
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 16The United States and the Soviet Union clashed angrily today as the United States opened a major effort to reduce its contribution to the United Nations budget.

title: NEWSMAN JAILED OVER SOURCE DATA
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 16 William T. Farr, a reporter for The Los Angeles Times, was sent to jail today for an in definite term because he re fused to disclose his sources for a 1970 news article on the Charles Manson murder case.

title: Killer of Policemen Hunted
description: KENNETT SQUARE, Pa., Nov. 16 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation, 30 state police men and homicide experts from Philadelphia joined in a wide dragnet today for the assassin who killed two Kennett Square policemen early yesterday in a parking lot behind their station. The authorities have interro gated three suspects, giving two of them lie detector tests, but have made no arrests.

title: News Analysis
description: PARIS, Nov. 16  However rapid or arduous renewed nego tiations on a Vietnam cease fire prove to be, both Washing ton and Hanoi have indicated that they have no intention of making more major concessions at this stage.

title: LeMoyne Coach to Quit
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 16 (AP) Thomas J. Niland Jr., basket ball coach at LeMoyne College since its founding in 1947, will step down at the completion of 197273 season, it was an nounced today. Niland will con tinue as athletic director of the school.

title: President Inaugurated By Radcliffe College
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 16 (AP)Matina S. Homer, a 33yearold psychologist, was inaugurated today as the president of Radcliffe Col lege.

title: Story of Melanie R.
description: Melanie R. was buried in a green Long Island cemetery yesterday, 7,500 miles from the primitive, dusty city where she died 12 days ago at the end of an unaccomplished search for nirvana, as she once put it.

title: TV: Coronation Street From Britain
description: Will the ordinary, hum drum denizens of Corona tion Street come to matter as much to American audi ences as the stately For sytes?

title: Airlines Assailed on Children's Differing Fares
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI)  A consumer group backed by. Ralph Nader ac cused the nation's airlines today of fare disdrimination against children.

title: 10 HIGH POLICEMEN DIRECTED TO QUIT OR FACE DEMOTION
description: Ten highranking police of ficialsinspectors and deputy inspectorshave been told they lack the leadership qualities re quired for their rank and should retire from the department or face demotion.

title: 3 Markets in Japan Curtail Trading Hours
description: TOKYO, Nov. 16 (Reuters) Japan's three major stock exchangesin Tokyo, Osaka and Nagoya  suspended af ternoon trading today as an emergency measure to cool off an overheating market.

title: SUGARMAN WEIGHS HOTEL CRIME PLAN
description: Jule M. Sugarman, the city's Human Resources Administra tor, disclosed yesterday that he was considering two short term approaches to solving the problem of crime in hotels ca tering to single welfare recipi ents and in the neighborhoods around them.

title: TRADE CURB CITED BY EAST GERMAN
description: A foreign trade official from East Germany, speaking before a group of 50 United States businessmen, called here yes terday for a lowering of trade obstacles between the United States and his country.

title: ISRAELI BIDS THE U.N. ACT ON TERRORISM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 16  Israel warned today that whether or not the United Nations acted to combat terror ism, responsible governments would do so.

title: WARRIORS TRIUMPH; BARRY LEADS WAY
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 16 (AP)  Rick Barry ignited a thirdquarter rally that gave the Golden State Warriors a 128 106 victory over the Philadel phia 76ers in a National Basket ball Association game tonight.

title: TECHNICAL ITEMS REDUCE SOYBEANS
description: Soybean futures dropped yesterday for technical reasons. They have been setting life ofcontract highs recently and thus might be considered due for a reaction.

title: Rogers Says U.S. Is Ready For Direct Talk With Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16Sec retary of State William P. Rogers asked the Swiss Ambas sador today to inform Cuba that the United States was will ing to take any steps, including direct negotiations, to obtain an agreement to halt the hijacking of airliners to Havana.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTONThe ten weeks be tween the November election of the President of the United States and his inauguration on Jan. 20 are probably more, important than any other ten weeks of his four or eightyear stay in the White House.

title: ISLANDERS LOSE TO FLAMES, 4 TO 0
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 16 (AP) Billy MacMillan and Lou Mor rison scored firstperiod goals tonight and the Atlanta Flames posted their first National Hockey League shutouta 40 decision over the New York Islanders.

title: Music: From Canada
description: The National Arts Center Orchestra of Canada was formed three years ago to give Ottawa's then new perform ingarts center an orchestra. In its brief life, this ensemble of 45 has done more than provide our northern neigh bor's capital with music. It has toured Canada, and it made its debut here last Feb ruary. Next spring it will visit Europe, playing in the Soviet Union and at Eng land's Bath Festival, among other places.

title: Top Dutch Aide to U.N. Denied Apartment Because He Is Diplomat
description: The chief Dutch represent ative at the United Nations has been turned down for a luxury duplex apartment at 1 Sutton Place South ap parently because he is a diplomat.

title: People and Business
description: With the DowJones indus trials hovering in the heady atmosphere above 1,000, it seems like a curious time to be leaving Wall Street.

title: KEY TOWN IN LAOS ENCIRCLED BY FOE
description: LUANG PRABANG, Laos, Nov. 16  Luang Prabang, the royal capital of Laos, was placed under siege by strong Communist forces this week, but the inhabitants are accept ing situation casually.

title: Southern U. Cancels Grumbling Contest
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 16 (AP)The GramblingSouth ern University football game scheduled here Saturday has been cancelled because of in cidents at the school today in which two blacks were killed, Southern officials said.

title: OTB Is Denied Superfecta Races on TV
description: Fearful of collusion, the State Racing commission flashed the objection sign yesterday to a proposal for weekly televised superfecta races at Aqueduct.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: CHRISTIANSTED, St. Croix. V.I., Nov. 16 (AP)A Federal judge has postponed until May 1 the trial of five men charged with killing eight persons at a St. Croix golf course Sept. 6. The defense had asked that the scheduled. Nov. 27 trial be de layed to allow. more prepara tion of its case. Judge Warren H. Young accepted the plea to day but he rejected motions to change the trial site to St. Thomas and to impose silence on persons connected with the case.

title: MINORITY HIRING SAID TO HURT SOME
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov. 16  The United States Civil Rights Commission has found that some programs guaranteeing jobs for members of minority groups have caused conflicts among those groups.

title: T .V . A. Drops Plan for 14 Darns Along River in North Carolina
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16In the face of mounting opposition by conservationists, eroding support by local government and a budget squeeze from Washington, the Tennessee Val ley Authority has abandoned plans to build 14 dams on the upper French Broad River and its tributaries in western North Carolina.

title: The Captain Speaking
description: The effort of Acting F.B.I. Director L. Patrick Gray to justify his agents' abortive gunplay in trying to stop the recent aerial hijacking in Florida has been unconvincing. By shooting out the jet's tires, the F.B.I. endangered the lives of passengers and crew both by leaving the craft even less airworthy and by exposing those inside the plane to the wrath of their demented captors.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI)The World Bank today approved loans for nearly $91million for economic devel opment projects in Korea, Bangladesh, Thailand, Kenya and the Democratic Republic of Yemen. The World Bank is known formally as the International Bank for Recon struction and Development.

title: Dr. Philip B. Gove, 70, Is Dead; Editor of the Webster's Third
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass. Nov. 16 Dr. Philip Babcock Gove, editor of the controversial Web ster's Third New International Dictionary, published in 1961, died last night of a heart at tack at his home in Warren. He was 70 years old.

title: J. H. S. 211 GROUP SCORES REZONING
description: Parents of white children at John Wilson Junior High School 211 in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn presented a united front last night against any change in the ethnic makeup of the student body, which is 70 per cent white.

title: HOUSING STARTS CONTINUE HEAVY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  Housing starts continued at a boom rate in October and the rise in union construction wages continued to slow, Gov ernment reports disclosed to day.

title: 2 Die in Clash With Police On Baton Rouge Campus
