As for its content, suffice it to say that the author's characteriza tions never rise above the level of hysterical adolescent cari cature and usually fall well below, his plotting is nonexist ent, and I didn't believe a word he said.

title: Campaign Spending in '72 Hit Record $400Million
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18Senator John G. Tower, Repub lican of Texas, reported campaign spending of more than $2.5million today in his successful bid for reelection, mak ing his Senate seat apparently the most expensive nonPresi dential office of the 1972 elec tion year.

title: Girl, 7, Is Raped and Thrown to Her Death From the Roof of a Bronx Tenement
description: Lured by the promise of pizza, two sisters, 7 and 9 years old, yesterday went to the roof of a South Bronx tenement, where the younger girl was raped and then thrown to her death, the police said.

title: Westchester
description: Sleepy Hollow defeated John Jay of Cross River, 3112, at Ryan Memorial Stadium in Port Chester yesterday for the New York State Section 1 Class A championship. The loss ended John Jay's 27game winning streak and made Sleepy Hollow the only county team with a 90 record.

title: Colorado State Wins First Game, 35 to 22
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Nov. 18Pat Juliana ran for one touchdown and passed for another today to lead Colorado State to its first victory of the season, 3522, over TexasEl Paso.

title: Premier Andreotti underwhelms the Italians
description: ROME: When Giulio Andreotti, the current Pre mier of Italy, rises to speak in public, it's a pretty safe bet that everybody else is going to remain seated; the best he can hope for is polite applause, never cheers. His performance at a recent trade fair in Barr, for example, was typical. With the detachment and coldness of an AngloSaxon poli tician, Giulio Andreotti said a few words this morning at the opening of the 36th Fiera del Levante, wrote the correspondent on the scene for Milan's prestigious daily, Corriere della Sera. The speech lasted about 20 minutes, or less than that, and its stringency surprised, perhaps embittered, the organizers of the manifestation, who expected something more, or at least more animated.

title: A Great PowerOr a Great People?
description: CONWAY, Mass.The election is over in these hills as elsewhere in the country and it has left the eerie feel ing that nothing has really happened nothing, that is, but the torrential rains which fell the following day. We believe in the rains because the leaves are down and we can see them in the ditches. But there is nothing to show for the election: the same President is back in the White House and the same contradictory Congress on Capitol Hill, and if there's a man date nobody knows what it is.

title: Movies
description: MOVIES reflect social change indirectly, and the disenchantments that have shaken America dur ing the last decade have not produced many thoughtful movies about current problems. That radical disillusionment surfaces in some fine recent films about the American pastfor example, Arthur Penn's Little Big Man, Robert Altman's McCabe and Mrs. Miller, Philip Kaufman's neglected The Great North field, Minnesota Raidwhich challenge patriotic myths and involve us in searching for our origins, the secrets of the other America, a strange country never recreated in Disneyland.

title: Head of Southern U., Leaving Seclusion, Denies a Role in 2 Student Deaths and Vows to Stay On
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 18 Dr. G. Leon Netterville, presi dent of troubled Southern Uni versity, came out of seclusion today to denounce his accusers and assert his intention to stay on the job.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: More in sorrow than in an ger, may I call your proofread ers' attention to outrages com mitted on the text of my review of Swanberg's Luce and His Empire?

title: April Nuptials for Jinny Carson
description: DEVON, Pa., Nov. 18  Mrs. Lewis Welty Forman of Devon, formerly of Darien, Conn., has announced the en gagement of her daughter, Miss Virginia McNeill Carson, to Andrew Lawrence Haynes, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lynn J. Haynes of Oakland, Calif.

title: Last Survivor of the Cranberry Era
description: MANORVILLE, L.I.  The once lush cranberry bogs here that provided the Thanksgiving turkey with a bright red accompaniment, and the pockets of local farm ers with a good bit of green, are for the most part idle now.

title: Medicine
description: Cancer chemotherapy  the treat ment of cancer with drugs and hor monesis coming of age. Not long ago, chemotherapy brought to mind little more than a lastditch, palliative effort: Pump the dying man full of potent drugs and maybe, just maybe, they will prolong his life by weeks, months, even a year.

title: Notice to Readers and Advertisers
description: The Pay Board on Nov. 14 ordered The New York Times to reduce its employes' wage rate increases by 3 per cent from 11 per cent to 8 per cent, effective today, Nov. 19. At the same time, the Price Commission, in a parallel action, directed that The Times change its adver tising rates to conform to a ceiling of 4.89 per cent in crease over the rates in ef fect prior to June 2, 1972.

title: P. L. Donnelly to Wed Joyce Arbon
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I., Nov. 18Mr. and Mrs. Paul Arbon have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Joyce Elizabeth Arbon, to Peter Lane Donnelly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Donnelly of Oyster Bay. The wedding is planned for early February.

title: Adm. Thomas C. Kinkaid Dies; Headed Guadalcanal Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) Adm. Thomas Cassin Kin kaid, who led the United States Seventh Fleet through the ma jor sea and island battles of World War II, died here yes terday of emphysema. He was 84 years old.

title: Susan M. Hodge Is Betrothed to Charles Anderson
description: CRAGSMOOR, N. Y., Nov. 18  Mr. and Mrs. Lenox MalletPrevost Hodge of Cragsmoor and Keene Valley, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Susan Marion Hodge, to Charles Raymond Anderson of Vail, Colo., son of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond T. Anderson of Clarendon Hills, Ill.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: DONNY OSMOND: Por trait of Donny (MGM SE 4820). This is Don ny Osmond's (the youngest of the five Mormon brothers) third album in less than a year. Even Bing Crosby never had a track record to equal that. Fourteen year old Donny specializes in remakes of fifties' love ballads. His best so far have been Puppy Love and Too Young. On Portrait, This Boy's In Love With You, All I Have To Do Is Dream, Big Man and seven other songs are sung in Donny's rangeless voice, which is highly echo chambered.

title: News of Dogs
description: If a person is seeking a dog for protective purposes, hunting, showing or just as a pet, some good advice is offered in a variety of books now available. A reader can study the psychology of the canine and its behavior pat terns. If a sporting breed strikes his fancy, should it be one of the pointers, flush ers, retrievers or hounds? Then for the economy minded, and who isn't these days, there's practical grooming volume that will save trips to the salon.

title: New Jersey
description: Lincoln of Jersey City com pleted its first undefeated sea son yesterday with a 560 vic tory over Wecquahic at New ark's Untermann Field.

title: Swiss Concerns Said to Aid Apartheid in South Africa
description: GENEVA, Nov. 18 (Agence FrancePress)Swiss businesses and organizations actively or passively bolster apartheid in their dealings with South Af rica, says a study published here this week.

title: 6 Sailors Are Discharged In Constellation Dissension
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 18 (UPI) The Navy announced yesterday that six of the 123 sailors who refused to return to duty aboard the attack carrier Con stellation nine days ago had been discharged under honor able conditions.

title: Music
description: OUR wonderful English language is constantly on the move, and something new comes up every day. In recent years for instance, we have been bom barded with gap expressions. Generation gap. Credibility gap. Now we are going to have a new one, in musical circles at any rate: Desperation gap.

title: SHOP TALK
description: WEST ORANGEIt is eas ier, perhaps, to be a delight ful little town than a delight ful big town, but this big town not only has both charm and more than 50,000 people but also a new in shopping section.

title: Acupuncture Gets Support
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 18 (UPI)The California As sembly has approved the an cient Chinese medical technique of acupuncture. The lower house, on a 65to0 vote, sent to the Senate yesterday a bill allowing an unlicensed person to practice acupuncture if su pervised by a licensed physi cian, surgeon or dentist. The bill states that the primary purpose of the use of acupunc ture must be for scientific in vestigation.

title: Missouri Beats Iowa State
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Nov. 18 (UPI)Greg Hill's 22yard field goal with 1 minute 27 seconds to play today gave Missouri a 65 victory over Iowa State and a berth in the Fiesta Bowl game at Phoenix, Ariz., on Dec. 23. The Western Athletic Con ference champion will be its opponent.

title: Pennsylvania Police Study Operation of 2 Homes for Retarded Children Where 13 Died in 54 Months
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Nov. 18 The Pennsylvania state police are investigating the operations of two homes for retarded chil dren formerly operated in this city and in the borough of Haw ley, about 40 miles from here.

title: Building of Boston Complex Is Cleared by State Court
description: BOSTON, Nov. 18 (AP)The $50million Charles River Park project in Boston's West End may go ahead without further approval from the State De partment of Community Affairs or the City Council, according to a unanimous ruling by the State Supreme Court.

title: Anticipated U.S. Aid Eases L.I. Taxes
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I.  The first effects of Federal reve nuesharing are being felt in town and county budgets across Long Island and, apart from a few significant locali ties, the effects should also be felt by every property owner on next year's tax bill.

title: The Nation
description: They just about got us all killed by doing it, said one shaken passenger. Said another: It drove the hijackers into a frenzy  I thought it was a mistake at the time. But it worked.

title: Police Say Suicide Told of Killing Man
description: A 56yearold furrier plunged to his death from the roof of a 26story Coop City apart ment building in the Bronx yes terday after telling policemen that he had killed his business partner in a dispute.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONWith the economy beginning to perk, raising new concern about the prospects of inflation, the nation's program of wage and price controlsjust a year old last Tuesday has come under increasingly close scrutiny.

title: P.T.A. Chief Reflects Tradition
description: OCEANSIDE, L. I.When Mrs. John Vandermosten was elected president of the New York State Congress of Par ents and Teachers last year no one in her family was surprised because involve ment with the ParentTeach er Association seems to run in her family's blood.

title: Tulsa Tops Montana
description: TULSA, Okla. Nov. 18 (AP) Tulsa defensive tackle Mack Lancaster blocked a punk for a touchdown and forced a fumble to set up a fieldgoal today as Tulsa beat Montana, 107.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: The supercilious style and gross humor of Peter Range's article distort the conception and reality of the Stone Mountain memorial, the South's tribute to Davis, Lee and Jackson as folk heroes paralleling those of the ancient Greeks Agamemnon and Oedipus, for ex ample.

title: Judge's Handling of Case Involving an Alleged Mafioso Being Studied by Gold
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn is investigat ing the disposition of a crilni nal case involving an alleged Mafia member by Justice Jo seph R. Corso in State Supreme Court, according to sources close to the case.

title: Horse Show News
description: In this sport, Bill Stein kraus once said, You can trade in your body when you need a new one.

title: Nassau Study Calls Abandoning of Aged a Myth
description: UNIONDALE, L.I.  The newly created Nassau Bureau for the Aged, surveying the needs of the elderly poor, has found thatcontrary to pop ular belief  county resi dents are making oftendes perate efforts to take care of their own aging parents.

title: Swedish Prisoners Earn Normal Wages in a Test
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 18 (AP) Inmates at a Swedish prison are getting wages on a par with the open market and at the same time pay for their board and lodging in an experiment that started this week.

title: Art
description: WE tend to think of the Impressionist period as a great age of landscape painting, and we are not mis taken. It was. But it was also a great age of figure painting, and even of por tralture, which the decline of patronage and the rise of photography might easily have vanquished but some how did not. Notwithstanding the many radical innovations which the painters of both the Impressionist and the PostImpressionist periods brought to their art, many of their fundamental pictorial interests remained remark ably traditional. In the his tory of ideas, Impressionism may represent a break with the past. In the history of painting, no such decisive break occurred. True of painting generally, this was especially the case with por trait painting.

title: Houses Dug Up in France May Be 5,000 Years Old
description: BESANCON, France, Nov. 18 (UPI)Archeologists say they have discovered eight wellpre served wooden houses that may be 5,000 years old.

title: Interests in Energy
description: One of the major initiatives of government in the second Nixon Administration, judging by its advance billing, will be a national energy strategy aimed at main taining a balance between this country's energy needs and supplies in the coming decades. That a crisis is developing in this realm is no longer much in doubt; the agony will come when the Administration shows just how much imagination it can muster and how much muscle it is prepared to exert for the general good.

title: Photography
description: THE Keystone Division of Berkey Photos, Inc., 842 Broadway. New York, N.Y. 10003, has just introduced a new in stantpicture camera which uses conventional Polaroid film in both color and black andwhite. Called the 60 Second Everflash, this new camera is not only the first different brand to use Polar oid film (other than those that accept special adapter backs) it is also the first instantpicture camera with a builtin electronic flashthus eliminating the need for flash cubes.

title: Always obedient
description: Lord Butler's political life has been a model of conservative rectitude. At no time did he feel the slightest twinge of doubt about his ideological faith, or exhibit the smallest dispo sition to rebel against those set in authority over him. He held office under seven Prime Ministers, a unique record in modern times, and spent altogether over 26 years as a Ministera total exceeded, in this century, only by Churchill. Always obedient, able, hardworking and ob sequious, R. A. Butler did as he was told. Hence, whenever the Tories could command a parliamentary ma jority, Rob was sure of a job. What others might term servility, he calls serviceone of his favorite words. He was, he writes, never tempted to rebellion, instead happily serving the establishment with patient if un glamorous tenacity.

title: Sorrow, betrayal, confusion
description: Lazarine literaturethe lit erature of confinementis a genre that is old in Europe but only just beginning to emerge in the United States, largely because Americans have only recently begun to make a practice of throwing writ ers and intellectuals into jail or driving them into hiding. The European vein is, sadly, a re markably rich one, including authors as diverse and other wise incompatible as de Slide, Dickens, Dostoevsky, Koestler, Anne Frank, Solzhenitsyn and Samuel Beckett. To that dis tinguished but hardly joyous list must now be added the name Horst Bienek, pupil of Brecht, poet, fouryear inmate of the Siberian slave labor camp at Vorkuta, whose very fine first novel this is.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTONThe on again, offagain Pentagon Pa pers trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. will soon be on again in Los Angeles, because of a single word last week from the United States Supreme Court.

title: Islanders Bow, 73; Orr of Bruins Stars
Jauron Scores 3 Times As Yale Triumphs, 317
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn., Nov. 18 Yale likes grass. The Elis beat Princeton here today, 317, for their sixth victory of the sea son, each one achieved on the natural turf of Yale Bowl, against two defeats on the arti ficial surfaces at Cornell and Pennsylvania where they had fumbled and bumbled.

title: Blast Suspect Gets Votes
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 18 (AP)  Karleton Armstrong, charged in a fatal 1970 bomb ing at the University of Wis consin, received 874 writein votes for Dane County district attorney in last week's election, the County Clerk's office re ports. Mr. Armstrong is being held in Canada while Dane County pursues extradition.

title: Damaged Coast Guard Ship Patched Up With Concrete
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Nov. 18 (UPI)  Coast Guard repair workers used temporary con crete patches today to cut down the flow of water into the engine room of the damaged Coast Guard cutter Jarvis.

title: HENRY A. VOICE
description: Henry A. Voice, retired vice president and a director of the Consolidated Lithographing Company, died Thursday at his home here. His age was 81.

title: Southeastern Florida May Curb Water Use as Drought Lingers
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 18Southern Florida is in the 29th month of below normal rainfall, and officials said this week that it might be necessary by February or March to ask municipalities on the populous southeastern coast to curtail stringently the use of fresh water.

title: LEHIGH DEFEATS LAFAYETTE, 146
description: EASTON, Pa., Nov. 18Le high backed up the passing of Kim McQuilken with solid de fensive play to beat Lafayette, 146, in the 108th meeting of the schools today.

title: Columbia Business School Appoints Volpp New Dean
description: Dr. Louis D. Volpp of Duke University has been appointed dean of the Columbia Univer sity Graduate School of Busi ness, succeeding Samuel B. Richmond, who has been acting dean of the school since July.

title: Stage: Changing Room
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 18I am continually and engag ingly amazed by the Long Wharf Theater. Like the Arena Stage in Washington although New Haven's is a more modest operationit always seems in control of the ball. Sometimes I wonder why New York theaters can not be so imaginative as the best of the outoftowners, and then I remember that Joseph Papp is. But despite Mr. Papp and the more intel ligent of his colleagues, much of the best in American thea ter today is to be found out side New York.

title: Russian Chosen to Preside At Container Trade Parley
description: GENEVA, Nov. 18Delegates to a United Nations conference here on the use of huge con tainers to facilitate interna tional trade have elected Dmitri Zotov, a Soviet planning offi cial, as president for their threeweek session.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 18 At 4:30 P.M. on Aug. 27, Wayne Rayford was driving in his new Toyota back to Los Angeles from a northern vacation trip with his preg nant wife and their two young children along U.S. 99.

title: Sunny and Mild Captures $59,150 Queens County
description: Sunny and Mild and Char tered Course finished one, two in the $59,150 Queens County Handicap at Aqueduct yester day, a circumstance that proved of much satisfaction to those fans who like to back horses trained by Preston King.

title: Headliners
description: For the Media, a Baby Boon

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article State Scruti nizing Homeowners' Associa tions [Nov. 5] does not real ly tell it like it is. No one can take umbrage at the desire of the attorney general to re quire disclosure by develop ers. However, the article like Mr. Clurman's book, Condominiums and Coopera tivesis a danger to unsus pecting buyers and their lawyers.

title: Patriotism by Rote
description: The unanimous Court of Appeals ruling that a teacher may not be dismissed for refusal to salute the flag and to recite the Pledge of Allegiance represents a victory of personal liberties over governmental coercion. The ruling is not, as may be charged, an effort to downgrade patriotism; it is rather an affirmation of those basic American principles which permit no compromise with a citizen's freedom to remain silent when the require ment to speak would be a violation of conscience.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: LAST Tuesday, it is widely told, the DowJones average of industrial stocks closed above.1,000, which it had never done before. The Wall Street Journal, which compiles the average, alleged that this event set champagne corks popping in brokerage offices across the country. And without so much as caveat emptor, a major brokerage house proclaimed in large advertisements here and elsewhere that it would be holding a Special DJ 1,000 Seminar at all of its many branch offices.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: Judging by your review of Rudolf Bing's 5000 Nights at the Opera, its author is not only a great wit but a bit of a plagiarist.

title: The Summer People
description: John Rowe Townsend's new novel is a love story. The nar rator is Philip Martin, 50, an English gentleman in trade who tells of his youthful pas sion for a girl named Ann. That it was in fact passion which the young Philip felt for her comes clear only after the story  a confession, really  has reached its end.

title: Son to the Hoffmans
description: A son was born Nov. 2 at Lenox Hill Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Richard Hoffman of Ridgewood, N.J. Mrs. Hoff man is the former Miss Helene Kahan of New York. Her husband is a vice president and associate actuary with the Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States. The child liar been named Daniel Lawrence.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: Why publish an article of such super cilious condescension as Peter Range's on Stone Mountain? I regard that state park memorial as one of the finest in the country. Why is his evaluation more valid than that of millions of tourists who go there every year? True, the souvenir shop offers appalling junk, but what one doesn'tso why single out this one?

title: TEST HALT IS WON BY MICRONESIANS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 18  Embattled islanders of Eni wetok, in the Americanad ministered Marshall Islands, re cently obtained a court injunc tion halting a United States Air Force program to test the ef fect of highexplosive detona tions on the atoll, already rav aged by more than 30 nuclear blasts.

title: Fees for HealthCare Here Under Audit by the I.R.S.
description: The Internal Revenue Serv ice's economic  stabilization program has begun an indus trywide audit of the New York area's healthcare services to determine if the industry has beer complying with the pro gram's guidelines on fees and prices.

title: Art: A Montclair Discovery
description: MONTCLAIR  The Mont clair Art Museum is show ing through Dec. 10 an exhi bition entitled Discovery, a sampling of 40 works selected by the State Council on the Arts.

title: Why the Leading Economic Indicators Lead
description: A recent headline said that 43 per cent of the public be lieved that the country was no longer in a recession. It was the first time in two years that more people be lieved the country was not in recession than believed it was.

title: Acupuncture Gets Support
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 18 (UPI)The California As sembly has approved the an cient Chinese medical technique of acupuncture. The lower house, on a 65to0 vote, sent to the Senate yesterday a bill allowing an unlicensed person to practice acupuncture if su pervised by a licensed physi cian, surgeon or dentist. The bill states that the primary purpose of the use of acupunc ture must be for scientific in vestigation.

title: Architecture
description: FORTY years can be for ever. Today, it is the span between innova tion and obsolescence; between dernier cri and last rites. Forty years is turning out to be a kind of magic number for buildingsthe life span of a surprising number of them. They reflect, in their passing, traumatic social change.

title: Is Albany A Capital Offense?
description: AS anyone in New York knows, a visitor to Albany is there either on business or by mistake, and the less time spent, the better. Even the state's legislators, who are there on business and, in the opinion of some, often by mistake as well, can rarely bring themselves to spend an entire week in the place. The TuesdayThurs day Club is not a standing committee of the Legislature, but the name could he used to describe when most legisla tors get to and leave Albany.

title: NASTASE DOWNS GORMAN IN FINAL
description: LONDON, Nov. 18 (Reuters) ?? Nastase added $4,700 to his tennis earnings today by defeating Tom Gorman in the final of the Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament at Royal Al bert Hall tonight.

title: Flamenco: For the Purist It's a Ritual, Not a Spectacle
description: FIERY, footstomping dancers, fierydarkeyed senoritas, phe phenomenal artistry on the guitar, ?? to mention clacking casta nets. ?? costumes, splits, leaps and backbendsall these have made flamenco the resounding international success it is. Every day, in virtually every country in the world, audiences are enraptured by brilliant profession al flamenco routines burnished by years of meticulous rehearsal.

title: The Little Peepers
description: APRIL was the time to hear the spring peep ers, but if you want to see them, look for them nowto late Novem ber. There may be more to see than hear, because the peepers did not do much sing ing this year.

title: One for life, one for death
description: READ together, these two excel lent books cause us to ask ourselves one of the riddles of life: Why is the experience of one human being so vastly different from that of another? Why, in two sensitive, intelligent, gifted women poets should the ener gies of art be so differently em ployed? Where one discovers in na ture a presence of something else that went before (Kumin in The Presence), the other discovers a help less blue dissolve and shadows chanting, but easing nothing (Plath in Winter Trees'). Where one does not shy away from populating symp toms or from the stunning horrors of a physical world gone into error, the other acquiesces to the symp toms, the horrors, the shriek in the bath,/The cloak of holes (Plath, Purdah)and seems perversely to honor them, to insist upon them, to refuse to make any judgment that might transpose the mysteries of na ture into an adult, human art.

title: Study Finds Bias Among Teenagers
description: A study of teenagers in three integrated East Coast public school districts has in dicated a high incidence of antiJewish and antiblack prej udice, with blacks less anti Semitic than whites and Jews less antiblack than other whites.

title: BELGRADE SHUNS NEW STALINISM Party Aide Says This Is Coal of Tighter Discipline
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 18A drive throughout Yugo slavia in recent weeks to tight en Communist party discipline and authority was undertaken to counteract an emerging dan ger of modern Stalinism, ac cording to Stane Dolanc, one of the country's more influen tial younger leaders.

title: Buddhism is Given a Presbyterian Touch in Seabrook
description: SEABROOK  On Sunday mornings in the Cumberland County village of Seabrook, four miles north of Bridgeton, a group of JapaneseAmeri cans meet to pray at a Budd hist service that has unmis takable American overtones.

title: CLEAN AIR DEVICE MAY BRING BATTLE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  New questions have been raised by the Environmental Protec tion Agency's preliminary rul ing that the principal antipol lution device in 1975model cars need not last without re placement for the normal 50, 000mile life of an automobile.

title: Aileen Robbins, David Friedman To Wed Feb. 25
description: Mrs. Louis J. Robbins, vice president of the International Council of Women and a New York State Commission er for the Powers of Local Government, has announced the engagement of her daugh ter, Miss Aileen H. Robbins, to David J. Friedman. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Mau rice M. Friedman of New York.

title: Home Improvement
description: FOR homeowners who live in areas where be lowfreezing tempera tures are common place during the winter months, electric heating tapes or cables can be an invalu able aid in preventing freeze ups of water lines, drain pipes, gutters, roofs and downspouts.

title: Tax Judge to Head Board Of Hebrew Union College
description: Judge Theodore Tannewald Jr. of the Tax Court in Wash ington has been elected chair man of the board ?? governors of Hebrew Union College Jewish Institute of Religion.

title: Inquiry on Slain Inventor Shows $2.25Million in Life Insurance
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 18Inves tigation into the murder Nov. 8 of the inventor of a rotary en gine has produced disclosures that more than $2million in life insurance on the dead man, Victor C. Null, was taken out by his partners last summer.

title: Canadian Car Crash Kills 5
description: COWANSVILLE, Quebec, Nov. 18 (UPI)  Five persons were killed and two injured yesterday in a twocar collision on an access road near Brome.

title: Photography
description: I NDIANS in Washing ton, D.C., Photographs 18581890, is the first exhibit of photographs ever held at the Museum of Primitive Art, 15 West 54th Street, and a good one to boot. This show, which will be on view through Dec. 31, consists of almost 100 images of Indian delegates to the Capitol during the second half of the 19th century; all but four of these are from the National Anthropological Archives of the Smithsonian Institution.

title: 3 Black Coastguardsmen Detained in Assault Case
description: BOSTON, Nov. 18 (Reuters)  Three black seamen were placed in detention when they arrived here today aboard the Coast Guard vessel Sherman for an alleged assault on two whites during an Atlantic cruise.

title: Bookstore Hears a Familiar Story
description: TRENTONIt's moving time again for what is said to be the largest secondhand bookstore in the East, and the reason is the same: to make way for an urbanre newal project.

title: DR. HANNAH FRENCH, A PSYCHIATRIST, 45
description: Dr. Hannah A. French, a psychiatrist, died Wednesday after a long illness at her home, 111 Roosevelt Avenue in Free port, L.I. She was 45 years old.

title: Maine Elects a Captain
description: ORONO, Me., Nov. 16 (AP) Steve Whalen of Danvers, Mass., was elected captain of next year's varsity cross country team at the University of Maine.

title: Hiroshima to Conduct Study Of Children of Bomb Victims
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan, Nov. 18 (Agence FrancePresse)Hiro shima authorities said this week they will conduct studies for the first time on the children of the surviving victims of the atomic bomb dropped on the city on August 6, 1945.

title: Panorama house
description: A spectacular site helped to shape this spectacular house (facing page) perched above a rocky beach on Long Island's North Shore. Its crisp angularity is softened by the sweep of curved decks which, indoors, frame a 180degree view of the water, visible, like a linear painting, from every major room of the 2story house. The softening curves are not confined to the exterior. Archi tect Myron Goldfinger, who designed this home for a semiretired couple, brought the curves inside with the undulating sofasthe only furnishings in the 30by30 foot living room. The owners stinted on no area of their houseof alifetime. In the spacious kitchen, a fivefoot preparation island is rimmed by counters at every turn; in the master bathroom, the 12by15foot dressing area and lavatory is topped by a skylight so that this windowless room offers a sybaritic sense of privacy under the open sky.

title: Campbell Museum Houses Tureens
description: CAMDEN  When Ralph Collier, the director of the Campbell Museum, flew to San Francisco a few weeks ago his seatmate was a hand some rabbit, eight inches high and 14 inches long, made in England around 1755.

title: Ski Areas in State Braced For Another Busy Winter
description: Yes, Virginia, there is a snowman busily preparing the slopes for Jerseyans to schuss, slalom and fall down on. With a little luck and barring a warm spell, the skiing season at some of the dozen areas in the state should be ushered in this week.

title: New & Novel
description: Werewolf has been a cachetladen word since the days of Count Dracula. In 1945, between the deaths of Roose velt and Hitler, it was an un derground guerrilla group, planned as a lastditch Nazi counteroffensive. Mr. Melchior unreels its scenario as Hitler intended that it be played. As sassination of Eisenhower. Demoralization of Allied forces by sabotage and infiltration. Consolidation in the Alpen festung, a 20,000squaremile redoubt in the thick of for bidding mountain terrain.

title: The Dance
description: On first viewing of Jerome Robbins's The Goldberg Var iations, one is strongly aware of its onehourand 20minute length; a fact that almost escapes notice on sub sequent visits. It is a work of enormous intricacy and craftsmanship, and the New York City Ballet presented it for the first time this season Friday evening.

title: They're Big and Beautiful
description: THE season is now the richer for two attractive and intelligent re vivals, and chances are you'll come away from both of them with the big effects in mind. In A. J. Antoon's picturepostcard mounting of Shakespeare's Much Ado About Noth ing, which Joseph Papp has brought from its summertime outing in Central Park to the even more expansive stage of the Winter Garden, the big effects are certainly there: brass bands bring ing blackbooted soldiers home from the SpanishAmerican war while girls in mauve sway in swings clutching bou quets of red, white and blue carnations, interlopers from the high heavens scat tering silver rain on the cluster of um brellas at a graveside, quivering vintage Fords spouting geysers of steam and discharging Keystone Kops like tumble bugs, carrousel horses bringing masked girls to their marriages.

title: ENTRYMATE NEXT
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. 18 If horses could read, Secre tariat's five rivals in today's $298,665 Garden State Stakes would have known he already had been conceded the season's 2yearold championship.

title: Brigham Young Tops Utah
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 18 (AP)Brigham Young knocked Utah out of the Fiesta Bowl today, dominating the first half and holding on for a 167 Western Athletic Conference victory. A Utah touchdown on a 57yard punt return by Steve Odom was nullified by a clip ping penalty with seven min utes remaining.

title: Gail D. Minich Will Be Bride
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 18Miss Gail Deborah Min ich and Jeffrey I. Stoll will be married Dec. 10 at the United Nations Chapel in New York.

title: Panny Mitchell Married Here to Walter Thomas
description: Miss Leeanne Mitchell, daughter, of Leeds Mitchell Jr. of Barrington, R. I., and Mrs. Guy B. Mercer of Win netka, Ill., was married here yesterday to Walter Thomas, son of Mrs. Walter Tomaszew ski of Brooklyn and the late Mr. Tomaszewski.

title: State Keeps Talents Of Women in Bank
description: TRENTON  New Jersey has a Talent Bank for Women here, where more than 100 resumes are on deposit with the State Office for Women. The office is the temporary home of this new central resource for employ ers seeking professional women and women seeking jobs.

title: Movies
description: WHAT do you want to do an inter view with me for? asked the curt staccato voice of Tony Perkins over the phone a few days before his 40th birthday.

title: Rockland
description: North Rockland clinched its third straight Public Schools Athletic League championship and Coach Ralph Cordisco posted his 100th career vic tory yesterday, but neither came too easily. The Red Raid ers scored on the last play of the first quarter, then played most of the second half in their own territory before beating Nyack, 60.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Haven't we reachedif we haven't long passedthe time when we should resume normal diplomatic and trade relations with Cuba?, Won't we bene fit from both the increased freedom from fear and the trade resulting from such a move?

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: MIAMI, Nov. 18Greater Miami (Dade County) is mov ing to construct a highspeed electric transit system with funds that were overwhelm ingly approved in the Nov. 7 election.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  With wage controls firmly estab lished, nonwage employe benefits, are expected to play an important role in next year's heavy schedule of col lective bargaining.

title: LETTERS
description: Waldemar A. Nielsen has a right to express his opinions in a book and in the article which appeared Oct. 29. However, I believe he and your headline writer ought to be held accountable for some facts and figures to prove their allegations.

title: Law Urged To Require VictimAid By Criminal
description: NEWARKGiles K. Riley, one of the two members of the New Jersey Violent Crimes Compensation Board, is calling for new legislation that would requre convicted criminals to help compensate their victims.

title: Peron Is Cheered by Street Crowd
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 18 Juan D. Peron, the former dictator of Argentina, moved into a new home today and got the popular welcome he had wanted.

title: Art as cure, pomegranate as grenade
description: WITH unrelenting psychic exposure and selfdiagnosis the evident motive power behind the work, Anne Sexton has pub lished six books of poems in only 12 years. This one has a section of prose parables and a sonnet se quence along with her new batch of expert free forms, the content often mordant, visceral, recklessly reveal ing, the technique very deft and exhilarating. Begun as a cure, her art turned into a spur, became addictive. The first poem here says, I would like a simple life/yet all night I am laying/poems away in a long box. But the second announces egohealth: I am at the ship's prow./I am no longer the suicide/with her raft and paddle.  Not that old ghosthates and goblinfears are gone; in fact new devils join the entourage, proliferat ing with the dividends of fame, and they are made fun of, exorcised in full view, like her Sweeney, whose fan letter she quotes: Your words, Sexton, are the only/red queens, the only ministers, the only beasts./You are the altar cup/ Sexton, I am your priest

title: African Goddess from Philly
description: THERE are no distortions in the fulllength mirrors that span the drab practice hall of the American Dance Theater on East 59th Street. And as Judith Jamison rehearses for next Saturday's premiere of Nubian Lady, a new dance solo choreographed for her by John Parks, a fellow dancer in the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater, she is obviously pleased with what she seesa Nubian Lady  la America.

title: Blues Call Up Hamel
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 18 (UPI) The St. Louis Blues called up a defenseman, Jean Hamel, their second draft choice this year, from their Denver farm club in the Western Hockey League. Hamel had six assists in 13 games with the Spurs.

title: As Close to Silence as a Man Can Get
description: WHEN Waiting for Godot was first pro duced in Paris in 1953, Samuel Beckett was approaching 50 and virtually un known. Although he had been publish ing for nearly a quarter of a century, he had few books to his credit. In 1929 he had contributed to a coterie collection of homages to James Joyce, Our Exagmination Round His Factification For Incamination Of Work In Progress, one of those books which seem, even at the planning stage, to have been destined to be a collector's item.

title: 4 Make Gaelic Hall of Fame
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 18The Gaelic Hall of Fame installed four new members to dayDr. Eoin McKiernan, Paul O'Dwyer, Patrick (Paddy) Do herty and Representative Peter Rodinoin ceremonies at the Manor Restaurant here. Spon sored by the Friendly Sons of the Shillelagh in New Jersey, the purpose of the Gaelic Hall of Fame is to strengthen the common bond between Ameri cans of various ethnic heri tages, according to Neil Sulli van, chairman of the hall and president of Sullivan Sept.

title: No. 1 Retailer Broadens Appeal
description: CHICAGO  About five years ago Sears, Roebuck & Co., the country's fourth larg est corporation and by far its biggest retailer, began telling the public: You've changed lately. So has Sears.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Right now, a Houston real estate developer said last week, interest rates are not discouraging anybody. They are all asking what the inter est rate is, but when you tell them it's not scaring them.

title: New York Tech Defeats St. John's, 70, in Finale
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 18Steve Szewczuk ran 28 yards for a thirdperiod touch down to give New York Tech a 70 victory over St. John's University today.

title: Notes: In Cincinnati, Whisper All Aboard
description: IF Cincinnati's new railroad terminal turns out to be the wave of the future, the wave will not be big enough to knock over a piece of balsa wood on a windless day.

title: Georgia Tech Routs Navy
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 18 (AP) Eddie McAshan shattered three Georgia Tech records and tied another today in Tech's 307 triumph over Navy. The vic tory earned an invitation to the Liberty Bowl for the Yellow Jackets.

title: FORTAS IS RANKED AS A TEAR GREAT Justices Rated From Great to Failure by Scholars
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Abe Fortes, the only Supreme Court Justice to resign from the Court under fire for his ethical conduct, has been listed among the nation's near great Justices by leading legal schol ars.

title: A Political Drama Unfolds in Bergen
description: HACKENSACK  There was a meeting here Tues day night that had been billed privately as the oc casion for the political de struction of Anthony J. Statile, Bergen County's con troversial Republican chair man. But Mr. Statile emerged unscathed, and those who planned to press for his ouster were gaveled into adjournment before they could even suggest what they had in mind.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: AMERICA'S gross national product in the third quarter rose to $1,164billion, seasonally adjusted annual rate.  Aftertax corporate profits increased to $53.7billion. annual rate Olin is leaving the aluminum business and certain chemical and defenseoriented ordnance facilities. This will result in an aftertax writeoff of approximately $80million, or $3.33 a share.

title: New & Novel
description: These 11 short stories are existential fantasies by a mas ter of the non sequitur. Effect rarely follows cause. Charac ters detour into random situ ations. Hardly anything co heres to anything else.

title: A Pet Store For the Boy Who Has Everything
description: We were driving through Bay Shore last Sunday when the copilot suddenly ?? There's a pet store, let's see if they've got a land turtle.

title: The World
description: BONN  By German standards, the sixweek Federal election campaign for Parliament that wind's up with the voting today has been unusual, exhilarating and full of contrasts.

title: T.C. & G.B. Spells Anachronism
description: While While the nation's big gest passenger railways have for years been ac cused of hostility toward their customers, the Tuc son, Cornelia & Gila Bend Rail Road Company, a freight line headquar tered in Ajo, Ariz., continues to wel come into its caboose anyone who wants to ride across the dusty, arid plains.

title: Composer Of Baroque Honored In Westfield
description: WESTFIELD  Heinrich Schtz is not a name that crops up often in everyday conversation. But many more Jerseyans are aware of him now, thanks to the effort of an energetic Westfield choir master.

title: LETTERS
description: Arthur Goldberg is correct in noting that, contrary to legal theory, most of the boards of directors of our large business corporations do not in fact control and manage their companies, but I believe his prescription for bringing reality more in line with theory raises some im portant issues, left unex plored in his article.

title: Kim Smith Fiancee of John Niles
description: SHARON, Conn., Nov. 18 Mrs. J. Buckley Smith of Sharon and William Francis Smith 2d of Duxbury, Mass., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Maureen Kimberley Smith, to John McCrea Niles. He is the son of Mrs. Christopher Charles Coyne of Pittsburgh and the late Capt. Richard Martin Niles, U.S.N.

title: Trenton State Victor
description: TRENTON, Nov. 18 (AP) Trenton State nearly doubled its scoring output for the sea son here today as it finished its football season with a 3314 win over Newark Sate. Tren ton State had scored only 37 points in its first eight games.

title: FundRaising Lagging in Affluent Fairfield County
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 18  A community drug program in affluent Westport reached only half of its fundraising goal this year.

title: Houston Wins, 3314
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 18 (UPI) Puddin Jones scored three touchdowns and rushed for 184 yards tonight to lead Houston to a 3314 victory over New Mexico.

title: ASSEMBLY TO GET A BLACK WOMAN
description: Estella R. Diggs, a regular Democrat elected Nov. 7 to the Assembly from the Morrisania section of the Bronx, will be the state's first black woman legislator since Mrs. Shirley Chisholm, now a Representative, left the Assembly in 1968.

title: A Testimonial Concert
description: Until the New Nostalgia set in a few years ago, it seemed that, as with old athletes, no body but fanatics would re member old jazz performers and wonder how they were getting on in a modern world. Just as sure as chorus follows chorus, these men who are at some time the hippest things on two legs find their play ing techniques extended by a new generation and their names pushed out of news papers and into books.

title: Archibald Scores 51
description: OMAHA, Nov. 18 (AP) Nate Archibald scored 51 points, the highest single game production of the year in the N.B.A., as Kansas CityOmaha defeated Houston, 127117, to night.

title: Horsey Set for Montclair
description: MONTCLAIR  This built up suburb of 44,000 people has 97 miles of paved roads, but not one bridle path or even an open field.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Aide Takes Seat on World Labor Body
description: GENEVA, Nov, 18  Bert Seidman of the American Fed eration of Labor and Congress of Industrial organizations took over this week the seat tradi tionally held by a United States trade unionist on the governing body of the International Labor Organization, a United Nations specialized agency.

title: Richmond Wins, 203
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 18 (AP) Richmond, rolling relentlessly on the ground in the final quar ter behind Billy Meyers, routed William and Mary, 203, today. Meyers carried 25 times for 139 yards and scored twice.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The American Road Race of Champions may sound like the name of a breakfast food, but actually it is a fitting de scription of one of the most important racing events of the season. It is the annual runoff that includes approxi mately 450 of the leading drivers in 21 classes of sports cars, sedans and formula cars from the seven geo graphic divisions of the Sports Car Club of America.

title: A Camden Mission to London
description: LONDONArnold Weber, director of the Camden County Economic Develop ment Committee, toured the Covent Garden Market area here last week in anticipa tion of opening a similar cen ter in Camden in the future.

title: The World
description: PARIS  Vietnam was still at war and the Paris peace talks were still marking time. But preparations were completed last week for another  and final, the United States says  round of ceasefire negotiations, and the sense of an impending end to the bloody, interminable conflict was pervasive.

title: Gas Kills Three on Ship
description: PENUELAS, P. R., Nov. 18 (UPI)Three men were as phyxiated by benzene gas in the hold of a 572foot tanker today. The men, who had gone into an empty tank in the Wil liam P. Steele to try to stop a leak from another tank, were identified as John J. Lovehlin, Wallace Crenshaw and Arthur Gunsholsherg. Their home ad dresses were not known.

title: Adrienne Tchertkoff Is Fiancee
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Nov. 18 Dr. and Mrs. Victor Tchert koff of Tenafly have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Adrienne Bonnie Tchertkoff, to Harold J. Glatzer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mark L. Glatzer of New York.

title: TALKS ON EUROPE TO GET SWISS PLAN
description: GENEVA, Nov. 18Switzer land will submit farreaching proposals for resolving inter national disputes by peaceful means at the European talks opening in Helsinki, Finland, Wednesday.

title: Bronx Political Leader Charged With Trying to Bribe Policemen
description: A Bronx political leader was arrested yesterday and charged with trying to bribe two police men to avoid being booked on a charge of drunken driving.

title: BIG GREEN VICTOR
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Nov. 18The Big Green and the Big Red played a big Ivy League game today. The Big Green made more big plays and gained a big victory, 3122.

title: Coins
description: ONE of the most inter esting medals in the United States Mint's official series is the one issued recently as a com memorative for the main Treasury Building on Penn sylvania Avenue at 15th Street in Washington.

title: 7th Victory for Wagner
description: GETCYSBURG, Pa., Nov. 18 (AP)Tony Parisi returned a punt 66 yards and intercepted three passestoday to inspire Wagner to an 187 triumph over Gettysburg in the final football game for both schools. Wagner finished with a 73 wonlost record and Gettysburg lost its seventh game in nine decisions.

title: Bridge Signs to Come Down
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 18 (AP)Bowing to public outcry and a lawsuit, a construction company has agreed to remove its signs from a traveling con struction platform above the Golden Gate Bridge. The Allied Structural Steel Company of Gary, Ind., retained to re place some of the bridge's sus pension cables, had placed Allied signs on both sides of two platforms spanning the main bridge cables.

title: DC3 Down in Atlantic
description: ST. JOHN'S, Newfoundland, Nov. 18 (AP)A DC3 with three Toronto men aboard is missing in the northwestern Atlantic between Iceland and St. John's, authorities reported today. Identities of the passen gers have not been disclosed.

title: Historians Will List Sites to Help Save Them
description: SETAUKET, L. I.More than 100 representatives of historical societies met here to discuss the planned inven tory of historic sites and buildings in Brooklyn, Queens and Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

title: No Teton Jetport
description: In January 1970, President Nixon announced that a proposed jetport adjacent to Everglades National Park was not to be built. The Chief Executive rightly hailed this decision as an outstanding victory for conserva tion.

title: Alabama Educator Chosen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) Dr. Harry M. Philpott, pres ident of Auburn University in Alabama, has been named chairman of the Council of Presidents of the National Asso ciation of State Universities and Land Grant Colleges.

title: Poland Says Mass Graves With Prisoners Are Found
description: WARSAW, Nov. 18 (UPI)  Three mass graves containing the bodies of Soviet war pris oners have been discovered in a forest near Zielona Gora in western Poland, according to the official Polish press agency.

title: British Charge American, 26, With Slaying of His Mother
description: LONDON, Nov. 18 (AP)A 26yearold American was charged today with having stabbed his wealthy mother to death in the luxurious pent house they share in London's Chelsea district.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: For the American adver tising agency executive, Ja pan is everything you ever wanted from the business but were afraid to pray for.

title: Different Lottery Days Set for Holiday Week
description: This week's lottery num bers in New York State and Connecticut will be drawn on Friday instead of Thursday because of the Thanksgiving holiday, according to an nouncements by the State De partment of Taxation and Finance in Albany and John S. Winchester, assistant di rector of the lottery division of Connecticut's Commission on Special Revenue.

title: Letter to the Editor 2  No Title
description: Merle Miller's article in praise of That Certain Sum mer is only the latest in a bombardment of pre and post  performance reviews which have tried to insist that this TV play was a distin guished piece of work. I say it's spinach and I say to hell with it.

title: 4th Slaying Victim Is Found in a Hotel
description: A 44yearold woman was stabbed to death yesterday at the Endicott Hotel, on Colum bus Avenue at 81st Street the fourth homicide victim found at the hotel in six weeks.

title: DIGGETT IS FIRST IN DAYTONA RACE
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 18  Whit Diggett, a liquor wholesaler from Raleigh, N.C., whose racing emblem is a gi raffe in a highball glass, easily won the season's finale today for Baby Grand sedans in the B. F. Goodrich Radial Trophy Series.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It seems incredible that the city, in approving the Washington Street urban re newal development [Big Downtown Project Starts, Oct. 29], should make it a MitchellLama project.

title: Andrew C. Evans to Marry Mary Lange
description: FAIRFIELD, N. J., Nov. 18 Miss Mary Jean Lange and Andrew Chester Evans plan to be married Dec. 2. Mr. and Mrs. Lester Failer Lange of Fairfield and Sand Lake, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Chester Evans of Ossining, N. Y.

title: Beverly Janes Wed to Rev. Carl Leazer
description: Miss Beverly Janes, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Janes of Kew Gardens, Queens, was married yester day afternoon to the Rev. Carl Wayne Leazer, minister of the Calvary Lutheran Church in the Bronx. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Leazer of Salisbury, N. C.

title: Packard Stores Reflect the Tastes of Bustling Founder
description: HACKENSACK  Quite a few years ago, when Frank William Packard was only beginning to make his way in the world, an overly enthusi astic account of his exploits said: At 34, Mr. Packard owns and operates the world's largest supermarket, which he bought several years back for a song.

title: The Tenant Survival Book
description: The crushing personal im pact of landlordtenant con flict is an unhappy footnote to any description of the Ameri can housing crisis. A West Side tenant had a heart attack and died last fall while participat ing in a heated public argu ment with his landlord. This summer a client of mine died, one day after a judge had thrown out harassment charges he had filed against his land lord. Another elderly client died soon after receiving notice that his landlord intended to evict him and his wife from the apartment where they had lived for more than 15 years.

title: WILLIAMS WINS,2112, FOR LITTLE 3 TITLE
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 18 Williams thwarted a fourth quarter Amherst rally today to score a 2112 victory that com pleted a second straight 71 season and gave the Ephmen the Little Three football cham lpionship.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The East New York Sav ings Bank and William Zeckendorf Jr. announced last week that they had pur chased the Mayfair House, a residential hotel at 610 Park Avenue, in a joint ven ture.

title: Linda O'Carroll Bride Of Kent E. Liebman
description: MILLBROOK, N.Y., Nov. 18 Miss Linda O'Carroll and Kent Erling Liebman were married here this afternoon in Grace Episcopal Church by the Rev. Peter Jacobson.

title: Ohio State Is 2714 Victor As Henson Gets 4 Scores
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Nov. 18 (AP)Harold Henson smashed for Ohio State's four touch downs to enable the Buckeyes to stave off lastplace North western, 2714, today and carry their bid for a Big Ten title tie down to the wire.

title: Small Groups of Antiwar Protesters March in Midtown and in 19 Other Cities
description: Antiwar protesters marched through the streets of midtown Manhattan and 19 other cities across the country yesterday, calling for an immediate end to the war in Indochina.

title: The Stalking Horse
description: Abraham Rothberg's novel of espionage, friendship and star crossed love takes place in a deserted and uninteresting part of New Jersey, where a pe dantic exdiplomat named Chapman is biding a childish Russian defector named Fedo rov at the behest of a C.I.A. man named Wheelwright, who bears an astonishing and to tally unexplained resemblance to Franklin Delano Roosevelt. The plot is one of your usual tangled webs, but once every body has been put neatly into his assigned place, it really isn't too difficult to figure out.

title: A New Specialty: Container Repair
description: NEWARK  Welding torches hiss and sputter in the heart of bustling Port Newark at the only com plete container repair and reconditioning plant in the Port of New York.

title: Leading his flock of longlegged, flatchested flappers
description: Say Jazz Age, say sheik, say sheba, and quick as a wink some body answers John Held Jr. His namewith no comma or period fore and aft of the Jr  has become attached to an age as a mussel is attached to a boulder. For days on end the waves come pounding in and the boulder, or the age, is lost to sight, but it reappears on calm after noons when the tide is low. There again we see the Jazz Age in all its durable quaintness, and there too is John Held Jr, arm in arm with Joe College and Betty Coed, leading his flock of longlegged, flatchested flappers.

title: U.S. Keeps an Eye on Product Safety
description: In the short time that the housewife's back was turned her 2yearold daughter in serted the socket of a live extension cord into her mouth. A few moments later the mother found the little girl unconscious and rushed her to the emergency room of a hospital.

title: The Israeli Bonds Mystiqui
description: Last Thursday night, Moshe Dayan, Israel's De fense Minister, had a kosher dinner of brisket of beef with some 3,000, Chicagoans. Each had bought at least $2,500 of State of Israel bonds this year.

title: Mrs. John C. Gibbs, was Valerie Viereck.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 18  Miss Valerie Edwina Viereck, daughter of Prof. Peter Viereck, winner of the 1949 Pulitzer Prize for poet ry, was married here this afternoon to John Clark Gibbs, while her brother, Alexis Viereck, took Miss Deborah Wheelock Howard as his bride.

title: Hopes Rise for Plan On Surplus Homes
description: WESTHAMPTON, L. I. Three years after the United States Air Force pulled out of Westhampton, turning its field over to Suffolk for a county airport and declaring the 172 apartments of base housing excess Federal property, the fate of that housing, caught up in con troversy and litigation, may finally be crawling to a set tlement.

title: They went down like gentlemen
description: It's easy enough to figure why major books on major sub jects come out at the same timethey are timely. But it sure is odd that so often ma jor books on untimely and high ly specialized subjects also come out at the same time. Ei ther authors or the publishers talk too much, or perhaps a rejected book gave the idea to a publisher to assign the same subject to someone else.

title: Washington & Lee Bows
description: LEXINGTON, Va. Nov. 18 (AP)  Ron Peil threw touch down passes of 47 and 64 yards today to lead Washington (Mo.) to a 277 victory over Wash ington and Lee University.

title: BergenPassaic
description: Clifton and DePaul, two un beaten Passaic County powers, kept their records unblemished yesterday with convincing vic tories. Clifton, 80 with a game remaining, trounced Garfield, 550, at Garfield, and DePaul concluded a 90 season by rout ing St. Mary's of Rutherford, 350, in Wayne.

title: Food: Taste of Middle East
description: RIVER EDGEThe haunt ing strains of Middle Eastern music blend with the scent of levani, the incense used in religious services in the Greek Orthodox Church. Even a dumbeg, the brass, vase shaped oriental drum, is on a shelf next to imported Turk ish coffee pots.

title: GreenEyed Legend Returns to Hollywood
description: LOS ANGELES  It is hard for anyone with a face as memorable and beautiful as Merle Oberon's to go to any city in the world and not be lion ized.

title: COLGATE DOWNS BOSTON U., 260
description: BOSTON, Nov. 18 (AP)  Tom Parr ran for 112 yards, passed for 100, scored two touchdowns and rushed for 2 extra points today in leading Colgate to a 260 victory over Boston University.

title: MANHATTAN DOWNS STONY BROOK, 2610
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Nov. 18 Manhattan College closed out its regular clubfootball season today with a 2610 victory over Stony Brook.

title: 51 in Soviet Ask Amnesty for Political Prisoners
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 18Fiftyone civil rights advocates, led by Andrei D. Sakharov, the physi cist, have appealed to the Su preme Soviet to grant amnesty to political prisoners for this year's 50th anniversary of the formation of the Soviet Union.

title: Shopping with the avantgarde
description: SoHofrom Houston Street to Canal, from West Broadway to Lafayettehas a new identity. The area, once known as Hell's Hun dred Acres, more recently as the Cast Iron District, is a haven for artists and avantgarde galleries. Now boutiques are springing up in the neighborhood. These shops (some so new the paint in them is scarcely dried) are scattered among the galleries within a fiveminute walk of one another. They offer a wide range of mer chandise, all of it bearing the stamp of good design.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 18  British troops ar rested five suspected officers of the outlawed Irish Republi can Army today. The army said that the five men, one of them armed, were picked up by military patrols in Roman Cath olic areas of Belfast.

title: TOPRANKED SIDES BEATEN IN BRIDGE
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 18 Almost all the topranked teams were eliminated here last night from the Reisinger board amatch team championship, the concluding major event in the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals.

title: Aime Michaud Is the Fiance Of Joy Powers
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 18 Miss Joy Powers and Aim Michaud, former president of the Del Monte Properties Corporation in Pebble Beach, plan to be married next Sat urday at the home of Col. and Mrs. Allen Griffin in Pebble Beach. The garden ceremony will be performed by the Rev. David Hill, an Episcopal priest.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Though many people will undoubt edly invoke President Nixon's land slide as prima facie evidence of the justness of his policies, it is interest ing to note that history offers us sev eral examples where huge popular mandates were accorded to candidates of severely constricted moral vision who, like the President, appealed to the electorate by ignoring the high ideals upon which this nation was founded.

title: Slaying Suspect Said to Be Withdrawn
description: BRIDGEPORT, Nov. 18 Richard Warren Deveny, the 17yearold arrested this morn ing in the hatchetmurder of a University of Bridgeport pro fessor last Monday, was de scribed by his parents today as sensitive and withdrawn, a high school dropout given to failure and aimlessness.

title: The Nation
description: BATON ROUGE, La.Because of a peculiarity of Southern politics, the eruption of violence that killed two young black men at predominantly black Southern University here Thurs day was fairly predictable. It seems likely that more such eruptions could occur.

title: The overdose explanation
description: The number of deaths throughout the United States attributed to heroin overdose from 1943 to date must total many thousands. In New York City it was reported that nar cotics, chiefly heroin, were the leading cause of death in 1969 and 1970 in all males aged 15 to 35, including non addicts. This can properly be characterized as an epidemic; the general alarm over these deaths is thoroughly war ranted.

title: The four possible life positions:
description: On a recent weekend, I sat in a circle of two dozen people in a room belonging to a hillside estate whose windows look out on Monterey Bay and Carmel and watched a pretty, dark  haired young woman beat a large red cushion to death. Her long hair streamed down over her flushed, tearwet cheeks and her slender fists went thump, thump, thump, thump, thump as she pounded the cushion and sobbed. Then she hurled the cushion to the floor, picked it up and threw it violently down again. After some final thumps, she leaned back in her chair, mouth open and panting, her whole body transmitting the message that she had been through an absolutely consuming experience.

title: Potential Dropouts Get Help to Stay In
description: NEWARKThe building is the former Lev Israel Rab binical School at 276 Chan cellor Avenue, across the street from a bar. Furnished with donated office furniture, it looks like another commu nity help project; in fact, it is, but with a twist.

title: Old Oily Ollie
description: A recent review in The Times Lit erary Supplement endeared itself to me by describing a book as titbiti cal. (Over here, the word would be tidbitical, which loses something.) The three books in front of me now are titbitical, even (as the English might say) hotchpotchical.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Much ado has been made of Senator McGovern's claim that the present peace negotiated by Henry Kissinger and Le Duc Tho could have come about four years ago. Looking at the essence of that peace, it becomes clear that what it proposes is total U. S. withdrawal while Hanoi's invad ing force becomes established as a legal resident of South Vietnam.

title: Rear Admiral Named
description: BUZZARDS BAY, Mass., Nov. 18 (AP)  Lee F. Harrington, president of the Massachusetts Maritime Academy, was named a rear admiral in the United States Merchant Service yester day.

title: Soothsayer Takes $100,000 'Chase
description: CAMDEN, S. C., Nov. 18 Soothsayer, the 21 favorite, won America's richest steeple chase, the $100,000 Colonial Cup, turning back 16 rivals from the United States and Europe today.

title: NIGERIA DEBATING CIVILARMY RULE
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 18 Nigeria's military government is scheduled to relinquish power to a civilian administra tion in 1976 and a national de bate is growing here over the form and structure of the pro posed new Government.

title: Bridge
description: There are two popular misconcep tions about a 4333 distributional pattern, which in the strange colloquial geometry of the game can be called flat, square or round at choice. One is that such hands are common, when in fact a player will receive about one such deal in ten; actually there are four commoner distributions: 4432, 5332, 5431 and 5422. The other is that such hands are dull, when often they present most difficult playing problems.

title: Thieu Meets Top Aides
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 18 (Reuters)South Viet nam's National Security Coun cil met with President Thieu to day and semiofficial reports later said it had agreed not to change Saigon's opposition to several sections of the draft ceasefire agreement.

title: India and Pakistan Agree To Prevent Truce Violations
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 18 (Agence FrancePresse)  Military authorities of India and Pakistan have agreed to take effective steps to prevent future ceasefire violations, an official announcement said here today.

title: Movies
description: IT seems only yesterday that Peggy Lee was singing Marianamafiana is good enough for me. Well, mafiana has come and gone, and nowWomen's Lib will be happy to hearMiss Lee has decided that today is a good enough time to become a movie producer.

title: A writer's home is his language
description: There is no such thing as a Swiss culture. This was the answer that CharlesFerdinand Ramuz, the greatest Swiss nov elist of the French language once gave to the French re view, Esprit. Ramuz felt that the notion of a Swiss culture was at once too broad and too narrow. Since a writer's home is his language, all French literature belongs to the heritage of a French Swiss writer who will often ignore his German or Italian writing compatriots. On the other hand, a Swiss is not just a Swiss, he belongs to a can ton, a township or village, a strictly local tradition. In one of Ramuz's novels two villages wage war against each other. They are, we may assume, two Swiss villages of different lan guage on opposite sides of a mountain. Of course there is an aura of Swissness about Swiss writers as there is a negritude of black African writersbut it is just as elu sive.

title: Beaver Moon
description: Tomorrow night brings the Beaver Moon, the full moon of November. The naming goes back to Indians and frontiersmen, and it has a double meaning. One was that by now the beaver pelts were prime for the trapper. The other was that the beaver now sets an example for the provident man to follow.

title: Looking beyond doomsday for a cure
description: It is less than three years since the environment move ment graduated from the cam pus to the consciousness of the masses, and in that brief time publishers have churned out hundreds of ecologyrelated books. Many of them, parti cularly the earliest, were end oftheworld hooks with such titles as EcoCatastrophe, Eleventh Hour and The Last Days of Mankind. One was actually called The Doomsday Book. And almost everyone who could put pen to paper was an expert. Ballantine published The Arthur Godfrey Environ mental Reader, which the en tertainer managed to bat out between commercials for high phosphate detergents and high powered cars.

title: A Nyack Man Is Acquitted In Murder of Woman, 84
description: Kenneth Hansen, 20 years old, of Nyack, N. Y., was ac quitted yesterday of murder charges in the slaying of an 84yearold woman who ran a boarding house in South Nyack.

title: New Ways Sought For Leaf Disposal
description: MAPLEWOOD  The New Jersey Department of Envi onmental Protection has be gun a statewide survey to determine the economic and ecological impact of the col lection and disposal of leaves by municipalities.

title: Sigma Delta Chi, a Society Of Journalists. Elects Head
description: DALLAS, Nov. 18 (AP)Sig ma Delta Chi, the professional journalism society, today elect ed William Payette as president of the 25,000member organiza tion.

title: the traveler's world
description: WHERE is Pearl White just when we need her most? We being the great American tourist and that part of the travel industry that makes a living supposedly looking out for the tourist. For the ben efit of late arrivals, Pearl White was a dazzling heroine of the silent screen, queen of the thriller serials. Every Sat urday of our youth she met evil in the DeLuxe Theater and tested it, escaping death only to wind up at the end of each weekly episode once again in mor tal peril (The Perils of Pauline), hang ing off a cliff or being fed into the teeth of a whining sawmill.

title: Pullout at Angkor Rumored
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 18 (Agence France  Presse)  North Vietnamese and Viet cong soldiers and Cambodian guerrillas have pulled out of the area of the Angkor temples and Government forces have occu pied the area, according to re ports circulating here today.

title: Social Announcements
description: Anniversaries

title: Tennis Bubbles Here Hit by Deflation
description: Seven indoor tennis bub bles in the city and suburbs and a total of about 15 in New Jersey and Connecticut collapsed as a result of the recent storms.

title: Retraining Coal Miners
description: NEWCASTLEUPONTYNE, EnglandFor John W. Ruth erford, 38 years old, a hard muscled former coal miner, the British Government's pol icy of regional aid is offering a new grip on life. He is in the 13th week of a 26week course in welding at a gov ernment training center run by the Department of Em ployment.

title: COAL DAM DISASTER BRINGS NO CHARGES
description: LOGAN, W. Va., Nov. 18 (AP)A special Logan County grand jury has concluded that there were no criminal law vio lations in the collapse of a coalwaste dam last Feb. 26 that resulted in the deaths of 118 persons in the Buffalo Creek flood disaster.

title: The Nation
description: Is what nearly everyone regarded as a rather plodding business recovery suddenly turning into a boom? Last week there was a burst of speculation in Wall Street, corporate board rooms and suburban living rooms that it might be so.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: AUDIENCE: Lunch (Elektra ELS 75026). Audience is al ways a step and a half away from reality. This is the British group's fourth album, and though it's lyrically a bit more tame than their previous work (they used to specialize in morbid narrative songs about murder and the super natural) the music still comes off sounding like the sound track to a caricature.

title: COLORADO ROUTS AIR FORCE, 38 TO 7
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo., Nov. 18 (AP)Opportunistic Colorado, awakening from a lethargic first half, rediscovered its ground game in the third quarter today and routed Air Force, 387, in the regular sea son finale for both teams.

title: Drexel Tops Coast Guard
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 18 (AP) Drexel spurted in the second half on a touchdown by quarter back Al Checcio and two by Glen Galleone today to rout Coast Guard, 3512. The loss gave Coast Guard a 37 won lost record.

title: Art
description: ALARGE show of new paintings by James Brooks opened recent ly at the Martha Jackson Gallery. Later this week it will be partly re placed with a selection of older pictures by Brooks, a surviving veteran, now 66 years old, of the great first generation of Abstract Ex pressionism. In its two installments, the exhibition gives us our fullest look at the achievement of this paint er since a retrospective at the Whitney Museum in 1963. As handsome as most of it is, the visual evidence confirms me in the opinion that Brooks is one of the most skillful and one of the least exciting prominent artists of his gen eration.

title: Tennis Development Program Puts Accent on Youth
description: CALDWELLProject Jer sey, a tennisdevelopment pro gram now in its 10th year, is drawing youngsters from all over the state to indoor courts here and in Wayne.

title: World News Briefs
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 18 (AP)King Hussein of Jordan entered the Armed Forces Hos pital today for a general check up, the Royal Palace announced.

title: A New Tack for Coast Guard
description: CAPE MAY  The United States Coast Guard Training Center here, the largest in the country, is changing with the times as it continues to teach more than 5,000 re cruits a year how to handle a small boat, swim, navigate, fire a rifle and drill.

title: Miss Simson Engaged
description: WESTON, Conn., Nov. 18 Mr. and Mrs. Humphrey B. Simson have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Deborah Gale Sim son to James E. Nicholson, son of Mr. and Mrs. James M. Nicholson of Bethesda, Md. The wedding is planned for Dec. 28.

title: North Carolina Wins
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Nov. 18 (AP)Nick Vidnovic threw two fourthperiod touchdown pas ses to Ken Tavior as North Carolina's Tar Heels defeated Duke, 140, today.

title: 11 Presumed Dead In Kentucky Crash Of Chartered Plane
description: MADISONVILLE, Ky., Nov. 18 (AP)A chartered plane be lieved to be carrying the pilot and 10 Richmond, Ky., resi dents returning from a high school football game crashed on a farm near here early today.

title: 218 Persons Involved in 159 U.S. Hijackings Since 1961, F.A.A. Says
description: On Thanksgiving eve a year ago, a man boarded Northwest Airlines Flight 305 at Portland, Ore., and gave his name as D. B. Cooper. Brandishing what he said was a bomb, the man demanded  and a few hours later received$200,000 and four parachutes.

title: Water Council Urging LandUse Curbs
description: TRENTON  New Jersey's Clean Water Council has is sued a report calling for legislation to create a state wide landuse policy aimed at preserving, protecting and developing the state's water resources.

title: Daley's Son Weds Barbara Paterson
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18Miss Barbara Lynn Paterson, a fi nancial analyst with Pull man, Inc., here, was married this morning to Michael Daley, son of Mayor Richard J. Daley of Chicago and Mrs. Daley. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George L. Paterson of St. Petersburg, Fla.

title: Scientists Get Help In Search for Jobs
description: NEWARKSince its intro duction in New Jersey three months ago, the VEST (Vol unteer Engineers, Scientists and Technicians) program has found jobs for about 150 men and women in those pro fessional categories.

title: Tennessee Downs Mississippi
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Nov. 18 (AP)Haskell Stanback scored two touchdowns today as Ten nessee beat Mississippi, 170, in a Southeastern Conference foot ball game before a homecoming crowd of 70,527.

title: Blacks Keep Pace In Queens Schooling
description: Black residents in Queens generally kept pace with the population of the borough as a whole in educational gains at the high school level in the last decade, according to the Census Bureau.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  Wrapped in the shroud of mystery he loves, President Nixon was deposited by helicopter last week behind the high, protective fence at Camp David to deliberate on the changes he hopes to make in his own official family and the bureaucracy.

title: WelfareHotel Crime Is a Local Problem
description: Most large cities in the United States apparently do not have the problem of crime that New York City has with single roomoccupancy hotels cater ing in part to welfare recipients.

title: The Nemesis on the Premises
description: They don't go away, do they? Those autumn leaves. For those who have not yet solved the problem (burning is out), the best solution is the good old compost pile. It's not difficult. Here is what you do: If there is easy access to a shredder or grinder, this is the first step to quick com post. Or the power mower can be run back and forth over thick leaf coverage to grind up leaves to chunkier bits. Then select site that is out of the way, but easily ac cessible with wheelbarrows or garden carts for hauling raw and finished material. A fence or cinder blocks to confine the com post area helps to keep things tidy and to keep out playful pets and wild animals. The Indore process is the most practical for foliage. For a foundation, lay a layer of brush such as hedge or tree trimmings. Next pile on about a foot layer of the chopped leaves and any other rakings or trimmings (even leftover naiad greens.) On this sprinkle a layer of bonemeal, dried blood, cottonseed meal or the like. Add a layer of soil. Repeat the sandwich until the layers are a manageable height4 to 5 feet. Keep well moistened.
