description: PARIS, Nov. 19Henry A. Kissinger and a team of aides arrived here tonight to start another round of negotiations on a ceasefire in Vietnam The talks start tomorrow.

title: New Unit Expected To Advise Schools On the Handicapped
description: The Board of Education is expected to approve this week the formation of an advisory committee on special education for handicapped children to recommend new school pro grams for them.

title: HERBERT JACOBY, 73, RAN THE BLUE ANGEL
description: Herbert Jacoby, proprietor With Max Gordon from 1943 to 1963 of the Blue Angel, the former nightclub on 55th Street between Third and Lexington Avenues, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 400 East 59th Street.

title: Browns' Late Field Goal Upsets Steelers, 2624
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 19Don Cockroft, one of the most in tense worriers in professional football, won a game for the Cleveland Browns today with a 26yard field goal in the last eight seconds. He had missed from almost the same spot two minutes before and walked off the field dejected and agonizing.

title: Mental Hospital Report Shows A Shift to Outpatient Treatment
description: A change in psychiatric treatment aimed at getting more patients out of mental institutions and back into com munity life is reflected in a study of the city's municipal hospitals released today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I write to correct a misimpression conveyed by Peter G. Mikelson in his letter published on Nov. 15.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Nov. 19The British Broadcasting Corporation is celebrat nig its fiftieth birthday, amid a good deal of praise and also contentious comment. Politicians on both left and right call the B.B.C. biased. Other critics are just as sure that it is either too daring or too stodgy.

title: NORMAN DAVID
description: Norman David, a staff artist with The Daily News for 19 years, died last night at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 67 years old and lived in Riverdale, the Bronx.

title: Royalty Invades Britain For ?? Queen's 25th
description: LONDON, Nov. 19 (Reuters) European royalty streamed into Britain today to cele brate the 25th wedding anni versary of Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip tomorrow.

title: FIGHTING SAINTS LOSE TO COUGARS
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Nov., 19 (AP)Jan Popiel flipped in a fivefoot goal with a little more than two minutes remaining to give the Chicago Cougars a 43 victory over the Minnesota Fighting Saints tonight in the World Hockey Association.

title: Carpentry Classes Geared To Girls
description: The wooden flower and saw above the doorway hints that this is no ordinary car pentry shop. It isn't.

title: Persian Gulf Producer Rejects Prices Offered by B.P. and Gulf
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 19  The first major negotiations on oil prices to be paid under the new participation agreements with Persian Gulf producers have hit a major snag in Kuwait.

title: Esther D. Levenberg Married To Kenneth Schoen, a Teacher
description: Miss Esther Diane Leven berg and Kenneth Nathan Schoen, both of New York, were married yesterday aft ernoon at the home of the bridegroom's uncle and aunt, Mr. and Mrs. Alfred E. Schoen of Riverdale, the Bronx. Rabbi Samuel Leven berg, the bride's father, and Rabbi Ben Zion Bokser of the Forest Hills Jewish Cen er officiated.

title: Nets' Rally in 3d Quarter Downs Colonels, 1184115
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 19 The Nets could have easily dedicated Pennant Night to Billy Melchionni and Brian Tay lor tonight. The two backcourt players combined for 52 points and 15 assists in a 118115 vic tory over the slipping Ken tucky Colonels at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: Susan Tannenbaum Married to a Dentist
description: Miss Susan Tannenbaum, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Tannenbaum of For est Hills, Queens, was mar ried yesterday afternoon to Dr. Lawrence Rothenberg, a dentist and son of Mrs. Ru bin Rothenberg of Brooklyn and the late Mr. Rothenberg.

title: St. Louis Bows, 137, as a Kick Backfires
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 19One monstrous messup of a field goal attempt by the St. Louis Cardinals gave the New York Giants their chance today, and after the offense produced the necessary touchdown with 4 minutes, 42 seconds to play, the defense held for downs on the Giant 25 with one minute left to preserve a 137 victory.

title: Advertising: Army Picks Ayer
description: Much to the relief of everyone at N. W. Ayer & Son, the Army has once more selected it as the agency for its massive recruiting pro gram for the next fiscal year with options for the two fol lowing years.

title: Soviet Emigration Law Change May Affect the Exodus to Israel
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 19 (AP) The Soviet Government has made a change in its emigration law that could affect the flow of Soviet Jews to Israel. Just what the change is is not known, but some Moscow Jews said today that they were told the policy shift would directly concern their efforts to leave the country.

title: U.S. JOB TRAINING TERMED SUCCESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19At least some of the Government financed manpower training programs appear to be paying for themselves in terms of bet ter jobs for their graduates, ac rcording to a Congressional staff study made public today.

title: RALPH J. MENCONI, COIN DESIGNER, 57
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 19Ralph J. Menconi, who was internationally known for his designs for medals and coins, died here yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 57 years old and lived at Old School Lane.

title: '72 WETTEST YEAR IN CITY'S HISTORY
description: Rain, sleet and a smattering of snow joined yesterday and early today to boost the city's total rainfall for this year to its greatest annual total since 1869, when the National Weather Service began taking recordings in Central Park.

title: Excerpts From Unofficial Reviews of August 1914
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 17Fol lowing are excerpts from a collection of unofficial re views and commentaries on Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's novel August 1914 that has been circulating among So viet dissidents. Reprinted here are selections front an un signed introduction and from a letter last June from Zhores A. Medvedev, a biologist and a dissident, to Ivan P. Melezh, an author prominent among those who criticized the book unfavorably in Litura turnaya Gazeta in an article entitled In Harness With the Enemies.

title: Miss Bernstein Bride of Norman L. Hull
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Nov. 19Miss Miriam Linda Bern stein and Norman Linder Hull, both of Gainesville, Fla., were married here this afternoon by Rabbi Fred Ackerman at Leonard's.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: While I agree with your Nov. 10 editorial condemning the low voter turnout, it is absolutely unfair and misleading to compare U.S. voter turn outs with those of Australia.

title: Psychiatrist Who Died After a Mugging as He Aided Bridgeport's Poor Is Memorialized in Westport
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 19 We told them to stay away, the black man said. We told them not to try to do it that way.

title: Governor, Viewing '73 Fiscal Outlook, Expects Few Funds for New Projects
description: Governor Rockefeller esti mates the state will have $8.5 billion to $8.6billion in rev enues during the new fiscal year, but says that mandated increases in state spending are such that there will be very, very little for anything impor tant moneywise that's new.

title: Bridge:Communication Is Problem In Both the Bidding and Play
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 19 Youth dominated the scene here today in the final ses sions of the Reisinger board amatch team championship, the concluding event on the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals.

title: Rangers' Garden Streak Halted by Penguins, 53
description: With Jim Rutherford's scintil lating saves sparking them, the Pittsburgh Penguins defeated the Rangers, 53, at Madison Square Garden last night and raised the question of what they had on Coach Emile Francis's forces.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I am writing this letter because of the appearance of an article by Henry Kamm on martial law in the Philip pines, in the Nov. 3 issue of The Times. This article is headlined Amer icans in the Philippines See Marcos as a Friend. A major reason for this feeling is that the businessmen believe their investments will be protected against the effects of various court ?? by the President acting un der martial law.

title: TV Review
description: Public television's South Carolina Educational TV Net work had a good idea. Take Mabel Mercer and Bobby Short, long the reigning mon archs of supperclub singing, and give them an hour on primetime television. Aside from a recent appearance on The Dick Cavett Show for Miss Mercer and a filmed segment on public TV's de parted Vibrations for Mr. Short, the two singers had been virtually ignored by the medium which, with its close up penchant for intimacy, would seem especially well suited for their exquisite musical miniatures.

title: Barenboim Surprises With Chopin
description: Daniel Barenboim has not been known as a Chopin pian ist, so it came as a surprise to find him taking on a complete program of that composer's works Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Hall. It shouldn't have, really; every pianist who can handle him plays Chopin, even though some major artists such as Rudolf Serkin have dipped into this repertory only rarely, finding it temperamentally alien to them.

title: Roughriders Win, 2724
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Nov. 19 (Canadian Press)  Jack Abendschan's 32yard field goal with the clock running out gave the Saskatchewan Rough riders an uphill 2724 victory over the Winnipeg Blue Bomb ers in the Canadian Football League's Western Conference final today, and a berth in the Grey Cup game Dec. 3.

title: Canucks Rout Sabres
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia Nov. 19 (UPI)  Bobby Schmautz scored four goals to lead the Vancouver Canucks to a 95 victory today over the Buffalo Sabres before a crowd of 15,570.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 19  The first reliable estimate to be developed for outdoor and greenhouse crop losses in New Jersey showed that air pollu tion in the state had cost growers more than $1million in direct crop losses last year.

title: Oklahoma City Airport Open
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 19 (UPI)Will Rogers World Air port was reopened to traffic today after workmen had re moved a jetliner that slid off the main runway yesterday and a snowstorm had moved out of the area.

title: Mayor to Open Parley
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 19 (AP) Mayor Richard G. Lugar will deliver the opening speech for the National League of Cities' fiveday Congress of Cities here Nov. 27.

title: Broadway Adds a New Face  the Uris
description: Broadway, the fabulous hy pochondriac always hanging on reports of its decline, de crepitude or death, sat up and took a shot of Uris elixir last night.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 19  The chairman of the Senate Institu tions, Health and Welfare Com mittee said tonight that a bill liberalizing the state parole sys tem for prison inmates stands a very good chance of being passed in the Senate tomorrow.

title: 500 in the U.S. Change Sex In Six Years With Surgery
description: Six years ago, it was dis closed that American doctors had been performing one of the most radical forms of surgery  the operations that change one's sex. Since then, an estimated 500 persons have undergone surgical sex change in this country, and hundreds more have applied for such surgery.

title: Wilkes Football Player Dies From Head Injury
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Nov. 19Bobby McBride, a 20 yearold defensive back on the Wilkes College football team, died early today from injuries received in yester day's game here against Kings Point.

title: Disputed Drug Test Reported Pressed In Pentagon Plan
description: WASHINGTON, (Nov. 19) (UPI)The Pentagon plans to go ahead with its proposal to make drugabuse tests on United States military depend ents abroad despite widespread opposition to the idea, a report said today.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 19A group of black residents in Newark's North Ward met here tonight to show their support for the construction of the controver sial Kawaida Towers Housing Project and to give other mi nority residents of the area which is 70 per cent white, a chance to find out about the apartment.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: While the term landslide is being waved for President Nixon in big head lines and through the airwaves, I wish to submit a different analysis that supports a more restrained view of the election. Yes, the Electoral College vote was 521 to 17, a blockbusting victory on the basis of states. On the other hand, few people seem to re flect on the fact that four of every ten voters cast their ballots for George McGovern. More soberly, if one addi tional vote in each ten was switched, the popular count would have been even.

title: Stage: A Henry James Novel to Music
description: The vulgarity of trying to make a Broadway musical out of what is defensibly Henry James's finest novel would almost be appealing had it succeeded. Unfortu nately, Ambassador, which arrived at the LuntFontanne Theater last night, is effete and pallid, and not even the considerable efforts of its lively stars, Danielle Dar rieux and Howard Keel, can make its anemia seem any thing other than pernicious.

title: MAN WITH DYNAMITE IS SEIZED AT AIRPORT
description: DENVER, Nov. 19 (AP)A man from American Falls, Idaho, was taken into custody at Stapleton International Air port here today after custom agents discovered 10 sticks of dynamite in a bag he was carry ing.

title: Miss Henry Bride Of Gary G. Cavallo
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 19  Miss Marianne Clare Henry, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Edward J. Henry, was married here this after noon to Gary George Cavallo, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Cavallo of Floral Park, L.I.

title: Laretei, Pianist, Presents Brahms, Chopin and Bach
description: Kbi Laretei, the Estonian Swedish pianist, may well be a good kind of musician to have as a friend. She seems more than ordinarily intelli gent and catholic in her musical knowledge and tastes; she is a pianist of skill and sensitivity and she appar ently enjoys sharing her en thusiasms through perform ance.

title: Raiders Beat Blazers, 50, for Donnelly's 2d Shutout
description: The New York Raiders may be disorganized and confused lin the front office, but there's nothing wrong with the way they are playing hockey. Yes terday afternoon in Madison Square Garden before a small, but highly appreciative group of fans, the Raiders bombed the hapless Philadelphia Blazers, 5 0. It was the second successive victory for the skaters coached by Camille Henry. The triumph brought the World Hockey As sociation club to within one game of .500.

title: Alternative to Terror
description: In Tel Aviv as in Washington the season is building for a new start on ArabIsraeli peacemaking.

title: STUDY FINDS RISE IN ANTISEMITISM
description: A marked increase in anti Semitic propaganda and activi ties in the last two years accompanied by diminishing public concern about anti Semitism  bears disturbing implications for the security of American Jewry, the Anti Defamation League of B'nai B'rith reported yesterday.

title: Boy, 16, Burned by Paraffin While He Is Making Candles
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Nov. 19  A 16yearold boy was severely burned last night when paraffin he was melting to make candles caught fire.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the third quarter of the game that the New York Knicks and the Milwaukee Bucks will note and long re member, all the noise seemed to be coming from the Bucks' bench. Jumping to their feet, clapping and yelling, the Bucks' bench warmers and their coach, Larry Costello, were enjoying a 7050 ?? Around them, virtually all the 19,694 spectators at Madison Square Garden Saturday night were suffering in silence. Halfway through the final quarter, the Bucks were coasting, 8668, but then the Knicks scored 5 quick points. Suddenly, the hills of the Gar den were alive with the sound of music that turns on the Knicks, the music of people roaring, cheering, stamping their feet, sens ing that somehow a victory was possible, the music that Willis Reed helped to com pose. As if flowing through stereo amplifiers turned high, the music was drumming into the ears of the Bucks and they couldn't turn it off.

title: Solzhenitsyn's New Book Is Reviewed by the Russian Underground
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 17The first collection of underground reviews of Alksandr I. Sol zhenitsyn's August 1914 is circuliting in the Soviet Union, and they find the novel to be a truthful word on a vital part of Russian history.

title: WITNESS ACCUSED IN ANTIWAR CASE
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., Nov. 19A Vietnam veteran who is charged with sending a bomb threat here has said that Wil liam L. Lemmer, who has been identified as a key witness in a grand jury investigation of the Vietnam Veterans Against the War, wrote the bomb threat and told him to mail it.

title: Satterthwaite Victor
description: Frank Satterthwaite won the seventh annual Joseph J. Lordi invitation squash racquets sin gles final yesterday at the New York Athletic Club. He beat Vic Niederhoffer, 1617, 1511, 154, 1514.

title: Fannell Leads Loughlin To CrossCountry Victory
description: Irv Fannell led Bishop Lough lin High School to victory yes terday with a 60yard triumph in the Christian Brothers cross country championships at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: Computer Games Giving Insights Into City Affairs
description: The Real Estate Speculator leaned over the table, fixing the Politicians with his alert gaze.

title: King Hussein Improves
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 19 (AP)  King Hussein, who en tered a military hospital yes terday for a general checkup, is in good health and will leave the hospital within two days, the Jordanian royal palace announced today. The palace said that he had been suffering from physical debility.

title: Wilkens, Carr Excel As Cavaliers Defeat Hawks Five, 10998
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 19 (AP) The Cleveland Cavaliers downed the Atlanta Hawks, 10998, to night with a combination of strong backcourt play and ag gressive rebounding.

title: Spring Mills in Agreement To Acquire Seabrook Foods
description: Springs Mills, Inc., a textile concern with $325million in sales last year, plans to acquire the business of Seabrook Foods, a company that produces and sells frozen vegetables, fruits, specialty foods and sea foods. Seabrook's volume in fiscal 1972 was a little below $73 million.

title: After 4 Hotel Slayings, Fear Stalks All Rooms
description: The drab recreation room of the Endicott Hotel is still decorated in a Halloween mo tif, with orange and black crepe paper and cutouts of witches riding broomsticks. Balloons that have long since shriveled line the walls like limp, rubber fingers.

title: Business Label Required In Classified Ads in City
description: Bess Myerson, the city's Consumer Affairs Commis sioner, has announced a new regulation requiring dealers, brokers and other businessmen to identify themselves as such in classified advertisements.

title: Fannell Leads Loughlin To CrossCountry Victory
description: Irv Fannell led Bishop Lough lin High School to victory yes terday with a 60yard triumph in the Christian Brothers cross country championships at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: PANEL WOULD EASE GOLDSALE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19A unanimous subcommittee of the Congressional Joint Eco nomic Committee rebommended today that the leading finan cial nations alter their 1968 twotier agreement on gold to permit nations to sell mone tary gold on the free market if they want to, though not to buy it.

title: Nixon Goes to Camp David To Work on Reorganization
description: THURMONT, Md., Nov. 19 (UPI)President Nixon went to his Camp David retreat today to work on Government reor ganization plans, which could touch off an angry dispute over how far he can go without seeking the approval of Con gress.

title: SPURRIER PASSES HELP 49ERS WIN
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 19 (UPI)  Steve Spurrier passed for five touchdowns the best perform ance of a spotty, sixyear ca reer, in leading the San Fran cisco 49ers to a 3421 victory over the Chicago Bears today. The victory kept San Fran cisco's title chances alive in the Western Division of the Nation al Conference.

title: Salute Given Puerto Rico On Columbus Anniversary
description: The city's sixday celebration of Columbus's discovery of Puerto Rico in 1493 reached a climax in New York yesterday with a salute to the island's history and a concert at Phil harmonic Hall featuring aspir ing Hispanic musicians, folk lyricists, a soprano and a tenor.

title: Blind Organist Hires Symphony for Concert
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 19 (AP)  Carlo Anaibale, a blind or ganist, said he had always wanted to play with a sym phony orchestra, and he will at a cost of $4,000.

title: Sonics Win in Rout
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 19 (AP)  Spencer Haywood and John Brisker scored 26 and 24 points, respectively, tonight and paced the Seattle SuperSonics to a 10784 rout of the staggering Buffalo Braves. It was the Sonics' third straight victory after nine consecutive losses.

title: A Really Long March
description: In all its long imperial history the study of China's complex written language was the special preserve of the lite who aspired to hold office and become part of the ruling hierarchy. Knowing how to read and write was both a source and mark of power. China's confron tation with the West brought the realization that popular literacy was a basic necessity for a country that would become a modern industrial nation. Thus was initiated a literary revolution that sought to simplify the language and make it a tool of mass education.

title: WILLIAM H. BRONSON
description: SHREVEPORT, La., Nov. 19 (UPI)  William H. Bronson, who began his career as a law yer and went on to become a newspaper editor and pub lisher, died yesterday of a heart attack. He was 60 years old.

title: Nixon Is Undecided On PayPrice Curb, Two Advisers Say
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) Two members of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers said today that the President still had not decided what kind of wage and price controls would be recommend ed this year.

title: Brooklyn Man Charged With Bribery of Policeman
description: A Brooklyn man was charged with bribery yesterday after he allegedly wrote a $2,000 check payable to one of two police men who had arrested him earlier in the day for stealing a car.

title: Australian Authorities Say Hijacker Committed Suicide
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Nov. 19 (Agence FrancePresse)The man who died in an abortive hijacking at Alice Springs air port last Wednesday committed suicide by shooting himself in the head, an autopsy, revealed today.

title: Stamford Renewal Is Finally Taking Shape
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 19 for eight yearswhich is almost as long as she has lived in the decaying wooden frame house beside the Con necticut TurnpikeMrs. Flor ence Goins has tried to move elsewhere.

title: News Analysis
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 19 Three days after his return, Ar gentina is so far absorbing Juan D. Pern without riot, military revolt or revolution.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Eric Lane Weds Karen Burstein
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Nov. 19 State Senatorelect Karen S. Burstein was married here this morning to Eric Lane, a lawyer who was her cam paign manager. Rabbi Harold Saperstein performed the ceremony at the Burstein home.

title: South Bronx Area Stunned by RapeSlaying of Girl, 7
description: The men who gathered yes terday afternoon at the little Latin grocery store at 821 East 161st Street, between Prospect and Union Avenues, were talk ing about what had happened the day before. About how just after 3 in the afternoon, they had heard noise and screaming and how they had run into the alley behind the store and found the naked body of a 7yearold girl who had been thrown from the roof.

title: Closing the School Gap
description: The Board of Regents is pointing in the right direction with its proposal to increase state aid for school districts that have neared the limit of their capacity to meet educational needs through local taxation. The situa tion in New York is different only in degree from that of a number of states that have been ordered by the courts to close the gap in school expenditures between affluent and financially strapped communities.

title: Mrs. Lefkowitz Married to S. L. Pinkus
description: KENT, N.Y., Nov. 19The marriage of Mrs. Rona Carol Lefkowitz to Stephen Leon ard Pinkus took place here this afternoon at the bride groom's home. Rabbi Charles Roth performed the cere mony.

title: MRS. RICHARD C. DOANE
description: Mrs. Mary Goodfellow Doane, widow of Richard C. Doane, re tired chairman of the Inter national Paper Company, died yesterday in the Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 62 years old and had been living at her home in Waitsfield, Vt.

title: Dorati Conducts World Premiere Of Lees' Concerto for Orchestra
description: Anybody who writes a con certo for orchestra these days might expect to find Bartk staring over his shoulder. In Benjamin Lees's case, there is not only Bartk but Prokofiev, Stravinsky and a whole host of earnest American symphon ists, as well.

title: Investments in Mexico Strain Ties With U.S.
description: MEXICO, CITY, Nov. 19 (UPI) MexicanUnited States rela tions appeared nearing their lowest point in recent years last week as Mexico continued to balk at foreign investments and American investors contin ued to worry about it.

title: $108MILLION RISE IS ASKED BY CITY U.
description: Chancellor Robert J. Kibbee has submitted to the Board of Higher Education a $550.7mil lion operating budget request for the City University in 1973 74, an increase of $108million over the current year.

title: MICHEL ROSENBERG; MONOLOGIST, DEAD
description: Michel Rosenberg, a member of the Yiddish Art Theater here under Maurice Schwartz and later a comedian and monol ogist, died Saturday in Miami Beach, where he had been liv ing since 1967. He was 71 years old and a former resident of the Sunnyside section of Queens.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond market will pose in the most striking fashion today the dilemma that faces underwriters every time they compete for new securities: whether to bid cautiously and thus reduce their chances for winning or whether to bid ag gressively and thereby risk getting stuck with a lot of unattractive mer chandise. The de cision will be par ticularly difficult in bidding for $75 million of Michi gan Bell Telephone Company debentures this morning be cause last week's principal bond offering was bid extreme ly aggressively and sales were so poor as to make it of very little use in trying to gauge where the market is.

title: Panel Agrees That Life Beyond Earth Exists but Differs on Establishing Contact
description: BOSTON, Nov. 19A panel of four leading scientists and a theologian agreed this weekend that highly advanced civiliza tions certainly flourish else where in the universe, but they clashed sharply over whether it was prurient ever to try to establish contact with them.

title: New H.D.A. Chief Orders Audit Of All Agency's Fiscal Controls
description: The city's new Housing and Development Administrator, who assumed office earlier this month, has brought in a dozen analysts from the Budget Bu reau to conduct a thorough audit of the agency, a housing spokesman said yesterday.

title: Strong Expansion Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (Reuters)  President Nixon's $250billion Federal spending ceiling is not expected to pre vent a strong expansion of the United States economy in 1973, Mr. Stein also said. He added that we expect the economy to rise as much next year as this year.

title: Oakland to Close Schools
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 19 (UPI)Oakland's public schools will be closed tomorrow so that 2,000 teachers, parents and students can go to Sacramento to lobby at the State Legis lature for more funds. Oak land's legislators said today, however, that the mass journey will be a complete waste of ef fort as far as influencing the Legislature was concerned.

title: Hyatt Heads Conference
description: David Hyatt, the executive vice president of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, has been named to suc ceed Sterling W. Brown as president of the nonprofit human relations organization. Mr. Hyatt, who joined the group in 1954, will take over in April, when Mr. Brown re tires.

title: Death on the Campus
description: The shooting to death of two young black men in a campus confrontation with state police and sheriff's deputies in Louisiana provides unneeded new evidence of the dangers involved when gettough sloganeering replaces administrative skill and judgment in the main tenance of public order.

title: Editors' Parley Focuses on Concern for the Reporter's Freedom to Protect Sources
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 19 The applause was particular ly loud and enthusiastic when The Associated Press Managing Editors Association met here and presented its annual Free dom of Information awards this week.

title: Railroad Police Miss Work In Apparent Labor Dispute
description: Penn Central Railroad police men failed to report to work for the midnightto8 A.M. shift early today in an act of appar ent local opposition to a con tract settlement reached Satur day in Washington by the car rier and the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Life Saver
description: Shirley Temple Black, who is now 44 years old, made an important contribution to all her fans and to many other women a few days ago. A victim of breast cancer, the leading cause of death among women of her age, Mrs. Black announced from her hospital bed at the Stanford University Medical Center that she had undergone a sim ple mastectomy.

title: A.B.A. EYES TEAM IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 19 (AP) An American Basketball As sociation official, Earl Foreman, has opened negotiations with the city to bring an A.B.A. fran chise here in 1973.

title: Miss Miller Bride Of Cornelius Marx
description: Miss Andrea Martha Miller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ru dolph Theodore Miller of New York, was married here last evening to Cornelius Harris Marx, son of Mrs. Richard L. Blum Jr. of New York and Albert L. Marx of Palm Springs, Calif. Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman performed the ceremony at the Regency.

title: Worldwide Amnesty Group Asks Waldheim's Help in Freeing 12
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 19Secretary General Waldheim's help was asked to day for the release of 12 pris oners in 12 countries.

title: Elk Quits Raider Post As League Takes Over
description: Herb Elk, the interim gen eral manager of the New York Raiders, resigned yes terday following the Raiders Philadelphia game at the Garden.

title: Truck Cats Water Line To the Florida Keys
description: ISLAMORADA, Fla., Nov. 19 (AP)Residents and tour ists along a 100mile stretch of the Florida keys were left without fresh water today after a 19inch pipeline that supplies water to the islands and Key West was cut in a truck accident.

title: TopRanking Black In School System To Retire Feb. 1
description: Frederick H. Williams, who has difected the city school system's personnel office for two years, will retire on Feb. 1.

title: MISS ROTH VISITS PAST SONGFULLY
description: For students of generation gaps, it was a bizarre moment: Lillian Roth, who made her first film in 1916 (as a child actress) and is now a 61yearold grand mother, singing You Must Have Been a Beautiful Baby to a young, towelclad member of the audience at the Conti nental Baths Club on Saturday at midnight.

title: Jewish Congress Honors 4 For Distinguished Service
description: The American Jewish Con gress presented its annual Stephen S. Wise awards at a dinner last night at the New York Hilton to four persons who had achieved prominence for their contributions in vari areas.

title: Michael Barker Weds Eileen Rosenfeld
description: CEDARHURST, L.I., Nov. 19Miss Eileen Rosenfeld and Michael Barker, a spe cial agent of the Treasury Department, son of Col. Irv ing O. Barker, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Barker of Washing ton, were married here this evening in the Sephardic Temple by Rabbi Saul Tep litz. The bride is the daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. George Rosenfeld of Woodmere.

title: N.A.I.A. Pairings Made
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 19 (AP) Central State University of Oklahoma, the topranged Di vision I team in the final Na tional Association of Intercol legiate Athletics ratings will meet East Texas State Univer Sity in an N.A.I.A. semifinal football game next Saturday at East Texas State. The other semifinal that day will match Livingston University of Ala bama at CarsonNewman Col lege of Tennessee. The two winners meet Dec. 9 for the N.A.I.A. Champion Bowl title.

title: CONVOY IS AMBUSHED BY FOE IN CAMBODIA
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Mon day, Nov. 20 (UPI)Enemy troops ambushed a convoy of 50 trucks filled with soldiers and their families yesterday, 35 miles northwest of here, destroying nearly all of the vehicles, the Cambodian com mand said today.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 19There was Earl Hoagland, an outstanding New Jersey schoolboy coach for 35 years, walking away from the post office in Popham Beach, Me., last August. He was talking to his wife, Kathryn, about painting his beachfront cottage when he opened a letter.

title: NATO Assembly Opens
description: BONN, Nov. 19 (UPI)More than 200 legislators from 14 nations gathered today for the opening of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's annual assembly, which makes policy recommendations to NATO and its member governments, with no binding force.

title: Jets Lose, Giants Win
description: The undefeated Dolphins clinched their division title yesterday with their 10th football victory, a 2824 de cision over the Jets in Miami. The Giants beat the Cards, 137, in St. Louis. (Page 51.)

title: Felton, on Protest, Captures Auto Race
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 19Gene Felton of Atlanta, driving a Camaro, won the Presidential 250 today in a finish that was drenched by rain and confusion.

title: Navy Seeks to Control Rentals Though Army Favors Concerns
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Nov. 19 The foreign petroleum industry received two stunning blows last week, and the promise of more soon.

title: Southern U. Chief Ousts 2 Who Advised Dissidents
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 19Dr. G. Leon Netterville Jr., presi dent of Southern University, has quietly dismissed at least two professors, including a de partment head, for advising students who had been demon strating in the last three weeks.

title: Bride Wore Blue, Cake Wore Handcuffs
description: The wedding cake was topped with toy handcuffs and a police whistle, and the red carpet down the aisle was the official one from City Hall when Joyce Leverton and Ja cob Goldstein were married yesterday in the muster room of the 20th Precinct station house on West 82d Street.

title: ALEXANDER DILORENZO
description: Alexander DiLorenzo Sr., a retired Brooklyn realestate, gasstation and movietheater chain operator, died Saturday at his home, 1909 80th Street in Brooklyn. He was 82 years old.

title: Dispute Over Legalizing Gambling Stirs a Tiny California Town
description: IRWINDALE, Calif., Nov. 19The latest chapter in the turbulent political history of this tiny Los Angeles suburb has been called the spiked enchilada case by the local media.

title: Field Hockey to No. Jersey
description: COS COB, Conn., Nov. 19  North Jersey won the Field Hockey Association of America national championship today, beating New York, 32.

title: White House Bar On G.A.O. Inquiry Charged by Aspin
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP)The White House has hired at least 60 unauthorized staff members and refuses to allow the General Accounting Office to investigate its pay roll records, Representative Les Aspin charged today.

title: U.S. JOB TRAINING TERMED SUCCESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19At least some of the Government financed manpower training programs appear to be paying for themselves in terms of bet ter jobs for their graduates, ac cording to a Congressional staff study made public today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It is indeed a sad state of affairs when one cannot receive correct vot ing information.

title: Planned Raises for Officials Rile Italians
description: ROME, Nov. 19A Govern ment decree that would give lush pay increases to 7,000 high officials in the topheavy state bureaucracy and raise the Premier's salary from $15,000 to $40,000 a year is irking tax payers and agitating politicians.

title: Hard Drugs Fade on Campuses, But Use of Soft Drugs Is Wide
description: Heroin has virtually disap peared and the popularity of most other hard drugs is fading rapidly this year on college campuses in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: NEW CABINET SWORN BY MOROCCAN KING
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 19 A New Moroccan Cabinet com posed entirely of political neu trals was sworn in by King Hassan II tonight after he had failed to persuade the major political parties to join a co alition.

title: Troops Withdrawn in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 19 (AP)  Tanks and troops that had been guarding major office buildings since President Park Chung Hee proclaimed martial law Oct. 17 were quiet ly withdrawn last night. While the Government said nothing about the withdrawal, it ap peared to be connected with two events Tuesday  a na tional referendum on constitu tional amendments and the ar rival of a North Korean dele gation for a Red Cross meeting on reunion of Korean famiiles.

title: Inquiry Hints at Corruption Among Immigration Aides
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 19  The United States Attorney's office here is conducting a nationwide investigation into alleged cor ruption in all echelons of the Immigration and Naturalization Service.

title: Young Canoeist Drowns
description: MONCURE, N. C., Nov. 19 (UPI)Three boys who clung to logs and a rock in the Upper Cape Fear River through the night were rescued today, but a fourth boy on the canoe trip drowned. He was Lce Strick land, 13 years old.

title: DAVIS, JONES PACE TRIUMPH BY TAMS
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 19 (UPI) Lee Davis and Wilbert Jones accounted for 70 points tonight to lead the Memphis Tams to a 130118 victory over the Vir ginia Squires in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Cappella Coloniensis Plays With Rare Charm
description: One of the larger groups specializing in authentic baro que and early classicera music on original truments, the Cappella Coloniensis (Baroque Orchestra of the West German Radio, Coloque) returned to New York yesterday afternoon for a concert in Hunter College's Assembly Hall.

title: How to Thaw and Roast a Thanksgiving Turkey
description: To thaw a frozen turkey, place the bird on a tray in the refrigerator in the orig inal wrap, which has been punctured, for two to four days or about 24 hours for each five pounds of tur key.

title: Coast Indians Try to Save Ancient Site
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Nov. 19Descendants of the ancient Chumash Indian tribe here are fighting to preserve the site of a great Indian vil lage known as Shalwaj from the bulldozers of a land de veloper.

title: Finland Plans German Ties
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 19 (AP)The Finnish Government has decided to recognize both East and West Germany, For eign Minister Ahti K. Karjalai nen announced today. He said at a news conference that both German Governments would be notified soon.

title: Daughter's Book Calls Truman Loath to Run in 1944
description: Harry S. Truman wrote his family in July, 1944, that he would rather not become Vice President or President, ac cording to a new biography written by his daughter, but he accepted the VicePresidential nomination later that month after President Roosevelt said that to refuse it would be to break up the Democratic party in the middle of a war.

title: ACCOMPLICE IS SLAIN BY STARTLED ROBBER
description: One of a pair of armed robbers shot and accidently killed his accomplice Saturday night in a Bronx tenement, after they had been surprised as they were robbing an 18 yearold girl who was later ar rested on drug charges.

title: Report on City Is Product of Research Dating to 1939
description: I'm the leader of the hardcore optimists, said Eli Ginzberg, director of the Conservation of Human Re sources staff at Columbia University, the other day, after he and members of his staff had put the finishing touches on a massive report on the economic health of the city, entitled New York City Is Very Much Alive.

title: Historic Brandt Victory
description: West German voters have delivered an unexpectedly emphatic endorsement of Chancellor Willy Brandt's strenuous efforts to build reconciliation with Eastern Europe. In returning his coalition of Social and Free Democrats with a comfortable majority in the Bundestag, the Germans have also demonstrated that the 23yearold Federal Republic has come of age and that its democratic system can function effectively to pull the country out of political stalemate and crisis.

title: She Began Preparing Dinner Weeks Ago
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Nov. 19for Mrs. Stephen A. Gettingerstudent, mother of three teenage boys and wife of a doctorThanksgiving dinner has been under way for several weeks.

title: Chavez Seeks Investigation Of Florida's Sugar Industry
description: BELLE GLADE, Fla., Nov. 19 (AP)The leader of the United Farm Workers, Cesar Chavez, said today that he would ask for an immediate Congressional investigation of hiring prac tices in the Florida sugar indus try, which he called exploitive, discriminatory and arbitrary.

title: 30 Years of Service
description: Ever since the outset of World War II, the U.S.O. has been taking warmth and comfort to our fighting men all over the world. The dreary monotony of distant out posts, the everpresent threat of death, the temptations to try drugs and local pleasure palacesthese can present a far more formidable enemy than a foreigner carrying a rifle.

title: DIRTY POLITICS SEEN AS WAY OF U.S. LIFE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (UPI) More dirty politics was used in this election year than in any year in recent history and the voters seem to have ac cepted it as a way of life, the head of the Fair Campaign Practices Committee said today.

title: Aeros 42 Victors
description: HOUSTON. Nov. 19 (AP)  Houston's winger, Keke Mort son, scored his first three goals of the season tonight as the Aeros defeated the Cleveland Crusaders, 42, in the W.H.A.

title: CURATORS' WAGES SCORED IN SURVEY
description: Museum curators in New York State are paid, as a group, less than school teach ers or sanitation workers, ac cording to a salary survey prepared for the New York State Association of Museums.

title: U.S, ASKS 8 STATES FOR $10.2MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The Office of Education dis closed today that it had asked eight more states to repay a total of $10.2million in al legedly misspent funds that had been intended for the compen satory education of, poor chil dren.

title: Insurance Unit Planned
description: Plans for the formation of the St. Paul Life Insurance Com pany were announced yesterday by the St. Paul Companies, Inc., an insurance holding company. It will operate as a subsidiary of the St. Paul Fire and the Marine Insurance Company.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20 (AP)  New Jersey's recently amended obscenity law, which made it easier for the state to prose cute exhibitors of sex films, was ruled unconstitutional today by a threejudge Federal court.

title: Transit Commitment
description: In a letter published on this page today, Governor Rockefeller gives assurance that Port Authority funds will be applied to the masstransit improvements which he and Governor Cahill outlined several days ago. We are delighted to stand corrected on this score.

title: RapidAmerican Chooses New President
description: The RapidAmerican Corpo ration yesterday elected Isidore A. Becker, the 46yearold chairman of Schenley Indus tries, a subsidary, as its presi dent and said it was resum ing payment of a cash divi dend after 2.5year hiatus.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Railroad Police Walk, So Trains Don't Run
description: A walkout of railroad police and the resulting sympathetic absenteeism of train crews severely disrupted yester day morning's schedules on the Harlem and Hudson divisions of the Penn Central.

title: BLUE CROSS RATE UP 5% IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20  The State Insurance Department today awarded the New Jersey Blue Cross an average rate in crease of 5 per cent for 1.2 million subscribers who hold individual policies or who are covered in group contracts of fewer than 100 members.

title: HIGH COURT DENIES COMPUTER PATENT FOR PROGRAMING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Supreme Court ruled today that computer programing con sisted basically of ideas and could not be patented.

title: Queen Is Hailed on 25th Anniversary
description: LONDON, Nov. 20  The ceremony was understated and glowing. The sentiments were often overstated, and ranged from affection to mawkishness, from respect to irreverence.

title: News Analysis
description: Has a corner been turned in America's heroin epidemic?

title: B.E.A. CRASHWITH 118 LAID TO PILOT ERROR
description: LONDON, Nov. 20Pilot er rors caused the crash last June of a British European Airways Trident jet that killed all 118 persons aboard just after it took off from Heathrow Airport, Sir Peter Rawlinson, the Attor ney General, said today as a public inquiry, into the disaster opened.

title: Floating Train System Using Magnets Tested
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP)The Transportation De partment announced today the first successful test in the United States of a magnetic system aimed at producing a floating highspeed train.

title: CONGRESS TO GET A FASTTRAIN BILL
description: Legislation providing for a federally financed superspeed railroad passenger line connect ing Boston, New York and Washington will be introduced in Congress in January.

title: Brandt Is Expected to Visit East Berlin
description: BONN, Nov. 20  Chancellor Willy Brandt, whose coalition Government won an overwhelming victory in general elections yesterday, is expected to go to East Ber lin before Christmas to sign the recently concluded treaty to establish formal relations be tween the two Germanys.

title: ALFRED J. SEIDENBERG
description: Alfred J. Seidenberg, chair man of the executive committee of the Lincoln Savings Bank in Brooklyn, died Sunday at his home, 43 South Panataquit Ave nue in Bay Shore, L. I. He was 67 years old.

title: Bratwurst at C.I.A. Cafeteria Sample of New Capital Fare
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20If you could get security clear ance, you could treat yourself to a Germanstyle lunch of bratwurst with sauerkraut, or knackwurst with red kohl, at a little outoftheway spot called Die Wunder Deli Bar.

title: A STATE PROPOSES TRANSIT STAMPS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  West Virginia, the state that pioneered the revival of food stamps in 1961, is planning to apply to the Federal Govern ment for a $4million grant for for a transportation stamp pro gram.

title: Young of Giants Released On Bail After Auto Chase
description: CRANFORD, N. J., Nov. 20 (AP)Willie Young, offensive tackle for the New York Giants, was released on $150 bail to day after being charged with resisting arrest following a highspeed automobile chase.

title: Price Changes
description: The Engelhard Minerals & Chemicals Corporation said yes terday that it had raised the price of palladium, a rare me tallic chemical used in cata lysts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Nov. 11 editorial, Portent in Puerto Rico, on the results of the 1972 elections reflected only partial understanding of the dynamics which brought about the Popular Democratic party victory. Your claim that Gov. Louis A. Ferr has long espoused but never really pushed the cause of statehood is mistaken and misleading.

title: 29 MORE FOOD SPOTS CITED AS VIOLATORS
description: The Health Services Admin istration cited 29 more food processing establishments yes terday for failing to correct violations of the Health Code. The office also revealed the dispositions of 13 cases previ ously cited.

title: Javits Seeks Job Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) Senator Jacob K. Javits, Re publican of New York, called today for a doubling of funds for a continued public employ ment program. He said in a statement that he would intro duce legislation to provide $2 billion annually for the program designed to help the unem ployed find jobs. It now re ceives $1billion a year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It is indeed a cruel irony that at a time when America is gravely beset by forces of moral erosion the Bible should be so forcefully ejected from the nation's schools.

title: 12 Will Study Unrest at Southern U.
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 20 Louisiana's Attorney General, William J. Guste Jr., announced the formation today of a com mission of six blacks (includ ing two students) and six whites to investigate the unrest that resulted in the deaths of two students at Southern Uni versity last Thursday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Professor Ivan Morris has done a great service in bringing to our atten tion (OpEd Nov. 11) the gross viola tions of human rights being practiced by the signatories to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. Unfor tunately, the United States also falls into this category.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: For the fourth time, India has fired on and killed unarmed Pakistani pris oners of war in the Indian camps. This is shameful; it must be con demned by the civilized world and pressure must be put on India to stop violating the Geneva Convention and release the prisoners of a war that ended about a year ago.

title: MARGARET HAGGERTY
description: Margaret Haggerty, a retired waitress and friend to many patrons of Gough's Chop House, 212 West 43d Street, died Satur day in Westchester Square Hos pital, the Bronx. She was 74 years old and lived at 1562 Unionport Road, the Bronx.

title: Price Panel Opens Study Of Rising Lumber Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  The Price Commission, in an other round of psychological warfare aimed at rising lumber costs, said today that it had begun or scheduled investiga tions of more than 350 lumber and woodproducts companies.

title: C.B.S. Sues to Keep Newsmen on Jobs
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System went into State Su preme Court yesterday to pre vent its news commentators from honoring picket lines set up Nov. 3 by the network's striking technicians union.

title: The Talk of Monroeville Ohio
description: MONROEVILLE, Ohio, Nov. 18The policemen of Mon roevilleall three of them were not giving out speeding tickets this week.

title: In Queens, Best Reading Grade Is Attributed to Diligent Study
description: At Public School 184 in Queens there was satisfac tion but little surprise yes terday over having achieved first place among the city's 632 elementary schools in the annual reading tests under the direction of the Board of Education.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Governor Cahill said yester day he would recommend legislation to put up $40million in state funds to start work on a $240million Newarkto Plainfield railroad line to be operated by the Port Author ity of New York and New Jer sey.

title: PERSONAL INCOME SURGED IN MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) National personal income rose by a sharp $15.2billion in Octo ber, largely because of a 20 per cent rise in Social Security benefits, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: NEIL J. SCHRECKINGER
description: Neil J. Schreckinger, a vice president of the Doyle Dane Bernbach advertising agency, died Sunday of a cardiac ar rest at his home, 544 East 86th Street. He was 46 years old.

title: Bridge: Young Team Wins Reisinger and Qualifies for Title Playoff
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 20 A young foursome that is sure to become known as the Steves won the Rei singer boardamatch team championship here in the early hours of this morning, winding up the biggest ever Fall National Championships of the American Contract Bridge League.

title: 2 Reported Hurt by Shots
description: BUENOS AIRES, Tuesday, (UPI)  Two persons were wounded by gunfire last night when a military patrol opened fire on a group of people demonstrating in support of Juan D. Peron, police sources said.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20Legis lation that would establish an environmental sanctuary along New Jersey's coastal waters re ceived unanimous approval in the State Assembly this eve ning.

title: One Man Killed as Police Foil Holdup of Gypsy Cab
description: Two members of the Police Department's citywide anti crime section foiled a holdup of a gypsy cab driver in West Harlem last night, killing one of the suspects and probably wounding the other, the police said.

title: Despite Loud and Persistent Soviet Propaganda, Ivan Ivanov Smokes More These Days
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 17The film opened with a candid sequence of 14yearold boys smoking on a park bench. Next it zoomed in on long  haired, guitar playing youths singing a jingle about how cool and grownup it was to smoke. Then it picked up some white aproned women working in a cigarette factory telling an in terviewer that they did not consider smoking harmful.

title: Rumania to Let Woman Visit Dying Fattier in U. S.
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20 (UPI) A dying, exiled Rumanian poet was promised today that his wish to see his daughter one last time before he died would be fulfilled.

title: CONSUMERS SPARED DEFAULT JUDGMENTS
description: About 15,000 New York City consumers may escape e fault judgments, or at leest contest them, under a civil con sent decree announced yester day by the Government, in volving Brand Jewelers, Inc., retailers of jewelry and other merchandise.

title: 320 Are Evacuated in Blaze in Jersey City Slum
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 20  A raging blaze, described by one (fireman as a hurricane of flames, destroyed much of a block of frame houses and a vacant factory in the deterio rating Lafayette section of the city tonight.

title: Cuba Will Try 3 Hijackers; Accepts Proposal on Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Cuba has informed the United States that she will put on trial the three hijackers who de manded and received $2million in ransom and forced a South ern Airways jet to land in Havana eight days ago, the State Department announced today.

title: Limit Proposed on Singles in Any Welfare Hotel
description: The head of the city's task force on welfare hotels sug gested yesterday that crime and other problems associated with singleroom occupancy could be cut by restricting hotels to no more than 100 rooms for nontransient single people.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Atomic Energy Commission's assurance that the worst possible accident resulting from damage to an active nuclear reactor caused by bombs or an airplane crashing into the reactor would be a limited re lease of radioactivity in the immedi ate plant area was a display of sheer bravado in the face of a com pletely uncontrollable situation posed by the Southern Airways DC9 hi jackers' threat to crash the plane into the Oak Ridge atomic plant if their demands were not met.

title: Merger News
description: Hamilton Bancshares, Inc., a multibank holding company, announced yesterday it had reached an agreement to ac quire the Hamilton National Bank of Knoxville, Tenn.

title: MORE COOKS OUT AT RESTAURANTS
description: Bargaining talks between the Restaurant League and Local 89 of the Chefs, Cooks and Pastry Cooks Union failed to bring agreement yesterday as the strike was expanded to some of the city's fashionable restaurants.

title: About Football Pro
description: The Miami Dolphins are more interested in the play offs leading to the Super Bowl than in completing the National Football League's first undefeated season in 30 years. We've got to try to polish, to get our act ready for the playoffs, said Mercury Morris, the spiffy running back, after the team beat the Jets for its 10th victory. Our first objec tive was to make the playoffs, said Don Shula, the coach. Our next is to get the team ready for the playoffs. Anything else is just peripheral.

title: JOSEPH O. MAY DIES; DESIGNER OF BRIDGES
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 20 Joseph O. May, an engineer and designer of bridges, died yesterday at the Allendale Nursing Home. He was 83 years old and a resident of Ridgewood.

title: HONESTOUS, $6.60, AQUEDUCT VICTOR
description: Honestous won the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday by a clear enough margin over the runnerup, Jill the Queen. The achievement prompted Eddie Yowell, who trains Honestous for the Wilrun Farm, to say: I just can't win a stakes with this filly. Wait a minute, I haven't won this one yet.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LAS CRUCES, N. M., Nov. 20 (UPI)Jim Wood, who did not have a winning season in five years at New Mexico State University, was dismissed as head football coach today.

title: 6,000 Pakistanis to Be Freed
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 20India and Bangladesh announced to day that as a humanitarian gesture they would repatriate about 6,000 members of the families of interned Pakistani civilians and prisoners of war held in India.

title: Kleindienst, in Paris, Notes Help on Heroin
description: PARIS, Nov. 20 (AP)At torney General Richard G. Kleindienst thanked two French Cabinet ministers to day for their antinarcotics drive and told them that it had resulted in a heroin shortage on the East Coast of the United States.

title: Hull Is Again Blocked From Play in W.H.A.
description: The World Hockey Associa tion, in trouble with its New York and Philadelphia fran chises, suffered a further set back yesterday when Bobby Hull again was restrained from playing with the Winnipeg Jets by a Circuit Court judge.

title: Peron Takes Party Reins And Meets Top Politicians
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 20 The human tide that had flooded for two days along the street where Juan D. Pern lives re ceded today.

title: Reading Failure
description: The latest report on the reading ability of the city's public school pupils can only be described as dismal a further decline from an already alarmingly low posi tion. The tests showed that in only 163 of the system's 632 elementary schools and in only 24 of the 158 junior high schools are at least half of the pupils reading at or above the norm for their grade.

title: Cuba Will Try 3 Hijackers; Accepts Proposal on Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Cuba has informed the United States that she will put on trial the three hijackers who de manded and received $2million in ransom and forced a South ern Airways jet to land in Havana eight days ago, the State Department announced today.

title: Fireman's Ball: At First It Was Considered Just a Little Party
description: Everybody was asked to wear red, black or white to the Fireman's Ball, a quiet little fundraising party at the Museum of the City of New York. So guess what happened? Most everybody seemed to have a quiet little fireman red dress hanging in her closet, or managed to ac quire one.

title: About Football Pro
description: The Miami Dolphins are more interested in the play offs leading to the Super Bowl than in completing the National Football League's first undefeated season in 30 years. We've got to try to polish, to get our act ready for the playoffs, said Mercury Morris, the spiffy running back, after the team beat the Jets for its 10th victory. Our first objec tive was to make the playoffs, said Don Shula, the coach. Our next is to get the team ready for the playoffs. Anything else is just peripheral.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20The Assembly gave final legislative approval today to a bill re instating a program of 13 weeks of extra unemployment benefits to longterm unem ployed who recently exhausted their 26 weeks of standard job less benefits or who did not receive the full 13 weeks of emergency benefits under a temporary compensation pro gram that lapsed earlier this month.

title: HEAVY SALES HIT SOYBEAN PRICES
description: There was a rush to sell November soybean contracts on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday because the contract was expiring. Speculators ap parently were selling out their profitable positions, along with commercial interests who had long positions to settle.

title: U.S. INQUIRY ASKED IN CAMPUS DEATHS
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith called on Presi dent Nixon yesterday for the immediate appointment of a commission to inquire into the deaths by gunshot of the two young black students on the Southern University cam pus.

title: Bengalis Sentence ExGovernor to Life
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Nov. 20 (AP)  A Dacca court today convicted Dr. A. M. Malik, the last governor of East Pakistan, of having waged war against Bangladesh and sentenced him to life in prison. He could have been given the death sentence.

title: R. N. M'CRAY
description: LAKE WACCAMAW, N.C., Nov. 20 (AP)R. N. (Rube) McCray, former football coach at Tennessee Wesleyan, Ken tucky Wesleyan and William and Mary, died yesterday at the age of 68.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WENTWORTH LOCATION, N. H.  Crawling from my bunk at 4:30 A.M., tugging feebly at my long johns with one hand and scratching my stomach with the other, I was confronted by a man of demonic energy, a man old enough to be my father, who thrust a glass at me and said, Here's your Frugal Brugal!

title: J. WERNER BRAUN, GENETICIST, DIES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  Dr. J. Werner Braun, an inter nationally known microbial geneticist, died yesterday in Bethesda, Md., where he was attending scientific meetings at the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious diseases. It is believed that he suffered a heart attack.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Mixed at Weekly Sale
NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20Federal Judge Frederick B. Lacey re fused today to block the pre sentation of Westfield High School's annual Christmas pageant.

title: Minor Party Curbs Urged On Backing of Candidates
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that he favored a law banning Conservative and Liberal party endorsements of majorparty candidates but that there was doubt about the con stitutionality of such a law.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: The Newark Board of Education and the Teachers Union start substantive contract talks today across a payandpolicy gap as forbidding as the one of the 11week strike of 1971. The agreement then concluded does not run out until the end of January.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SACRAMENTO, Nov. 20 (UPI)Cal Poly of San Luis Obispo and North Dakota accepted invitations today to the Camellia Bowl on Dec. 9.

title: Queen Is Hailed on 25th Anniversary
description: LONDON, Nov. 20  The ceremony was understated and glowing. The sentiments were often overstated, and ranged from affection to mawkishness, from respect to irreverence.

title: Carriere Wins Goncourt; Franck Given the Renaudot
description: PARIS, Nov. 20 (AP)  France's top literary award, the Goncourt Prize, was given to day to Jean Carrire, for his novel L'Epervier de Maheu (The Hawk of Maheu).

title: New Doctors at Peak
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 20  While record numbers of doctors were graduated from American medical schools this year and new law to create nine Federal medical colleges will further in crease enrollments, the national shortage of physicians is ex pected to worsen.

title: Jets Lose Thompson
description: Steve Thompson, the New York Jets' defensive tackle originally believed to have suf fered a sprained ankle in Sun day's 2824 loss to the un defeated Miami Dolphins, was found to have a broken leg yesterday.

title: Foe Stages Predawn Shelling Attack on Danang Base
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 21 (AP)Com munistled forces shelled the Danang area before dawn to day, launched a series of hit andrun attacks in the Saigon region and engaged Government troops for the fifth day just south of the demilitarized zone.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 675,000 common shares of Revco D. S., Inc., at 46.125 a share was made yesterday by Merrill Lynch and McDonald & Co. Of the total 200,000 shares are being sold for the account of the company and 475,000 for the account of certain shareholders. The company's stock closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 46, up .

title: WIDER USE URGED FOR HISTORIC SITES
description: The Council on the Environ ment of New York City yester day urged the National Park Service to reach out to com munity and other organizations to obtain wider use of five fed erally run historic sites here.

title: Business Briefs
description: James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, said yesterday that his proposal to increase the number of hours during which the exchange is open for trading each day was merely being studied and was not close to being implemented.

title: CITY FINDS RELIEF TOO BIG A BURDEN
description: Noting that 16 per cent of the people in New York City were on welfare, Human Re sources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman asserted yesterday that no major city could eco nomically keep supporting more than a tenth of its population on relief rolls.

title: Sports of The Times
description: STATELINE, Nev., Nov. 20As skinny as a swaying cobra and almost as dangerous, Bob Foster, poundfor pound, is the best puncher in boxing today, one of the best ever.

title: Full Employment Deficit Of $7Billion Is Predicted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  Builtin increases in spending, with no new programs, will increase Federal spending enough in the next fiscal year to produce a $7billion full employment deficit, a Brook ings Institution analysis esti mated today.

title: Justice Meyer Offered Nassau Ombudsman Job
description: MINEOLA. L. I., Nov. 20 Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso announced to day that he had offered State Supreme Court Justice Bernard Meyer of Cedarhurst the position of ombudsman in his administration and that Justice Meyer had promised him a decision within 10 days.

title: A Ghostly Cavalryman Reports for Duty at West Point
description: The shimmering, opalescent figure of a United States cav alry soldier of the eighteen thirtieswith full uniform, boots, a handlebar mustache and a musket in his ecto plasmic handis causing an uproar at the United States Military Academy at West Point.

title: Apollo 17 Rocket Passes Its Final Test for Countdown
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Nov. 20 (UPI)The fully fueled Apollo 17 rocket passed an important countdown test to night for America's last plan ned mission to the moon Dec. 6.

title: KISSINGER RENEWS CEASEFIRE TALKS WITH THO IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Nov. 20Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho of North Vietnam opened another round of negotiations for a Vietnam ceasefire today.

title: New Croup in Capital: Women's Lobby, Inc.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP)There's a new lobby in the nation's capital: Women's Lobby, Inc., with plans to lobby solely on women's legislation.

title: Special Envoy From Thieu
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, Nov. 21 (AP)President Thieu has ask ed President Nixon to receive a special envoy who would out line South Vietnam's objections to the draft proposal for a ceasefire, a Government offi cial said today.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Mr. Nixon is at Camp David laying plans for the reorganization of the Government, of which Father Theo dore M. Hesburgh appears to be the first victim. This is unfortunate since, as chairman of the Civil Rights Com mission, Father Hesburgh had been outspoken, independent and nonpoliti cal, so much so that Lyndon Johnson wasn't happy with him either. Still, if Mr. Nixon were merely going to fire those he considered less than enthusi astic while retaining his 110percen ters, that would be nothing unusual or threatening.

title: Fred Graham Joins C.B.S.
description: Fred P. Graham, Supreme Court reporter for The New York Times since 1965, has re signed to become a Columbia Broadcasting System corres pondent. Mr. Graham, who is 41 years old, will be assigned to the C.B.S. Washington bureau and will cover the Supreme Court, the Department of Justice, and other areas in volving legal matters. He is a graduate of the Vanderbilt University School of law, and while a Fulbright scholar re ceived a diploma in law from Oxford University.

title: BLUE CROSS RATE UP 5% IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20  The State Insurance Department today awarded the New Jersey Blue Cross an average rate in crease of 5 per cent for 1.2 million subscribers who hold individual policies or who are covered in group contracts of fewer than 100 members.

title: Horses for Sale All It Takes Is Money
description: Let's move on into the tent, ladies and gentlemen, John M. S. Finney urged his customers before yesterday's Claiborne Farm dispersal sale at Belmont Park, and take your seats.

title: Choosing a Man Who: II
description: What needs to be done to eliminate the flaws in the system by which we elect our President?

title: Anderson and 3 Other Officers Resign at Clinton Oil Subsidiary
description: Robert B. Anderson, who was Secretary of the Treasury under President Eisenhower, and three other officers of the interna tional subsidiary of the Clinton Oil Company resigned yester day and called for a manage ment reorganization of the parent company.

title: Leedham's Car Kills a Man In Rain on East River Drive
description: A 70yearold man was struck and killed on the Frank lin D. Roosevelt Drive Sunday night by a city car driven by Charles G. Leedham, the Com missioner of Marine and Avia tion. The police said the acci dent had occurred at 7:45 P.M. during a rainstrom in the south bound lane of the highway.

title: Four Food Chains Sued
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20 (UPI)Four retail food chains were accused of fraudulent ad vertising in civil suits filed to day by the District Attorney's office. The chains are A.&P. Stores, Acme Markets, Inc., Food Fair Stores, Inc. and Penn Fruit Co.

title: Cronkite Is Recovering After Surgery on Throat
description: Walter Cronkite, the Colum bia Broadcasting System news man, was recuperating at home yesterday from surgery in Lenox Hill Hospital to remove a benign tumor of the throat, according to a network spokes man.

title: Ennio Flaiano, Filmwriter; Collaborated With Fellini
description: ROME, Nov. 20Ennio Fla iano, author, playwright, critic and screenwriter, died here to day of a heart attack. He was 62 years old.

title: DETECTIVE GUILTY IN A BRIBERY CASE
description: A suspended police detective pleaded guilty yesterday short ly before his scheduled trial on bribery charges resulting from a Federal investigation of cor ruption in the city's criminal justice system.

title: FRANKLIN CONFIRMS HEADQUARTERS SALE
description: The Franklin National Bank confirmed yesterday that it had sold its administrative head quarters building at 410 Madi son Avenue to the Greater New York Savings Bank for an un disclosed amount of cash. Franklin is moving to a new building at 450 Park Avenue.

title: Mrs. Lynne Field Married to Richard L. Brickley
description: Mrs. Lynne Templeton Field of New York, widow of Marshall Field 4th, editor and publisher of The Chicago Daily News and The Chicago SunTimes, was married in London yesterday to Richard L. Brickley, a widower and a partner in the Boston law firm of Brickley, Sears & Cole. The ceremony in the Farm Street Church was per formed by an Anglican priest and a Roman Catholic priest.

title: The Pointmakers
description: BANGKOK, ThailandIt is hardly surprising that the anomalies, the bitter ironies and the Catch22 lunacy that have marked America's Indochina in volvement from the beginning should characterize also its final phase. A conflict that has cost the United States more than $150 billion, 47,000 dead or missing, 300,000 wounded and at least a decade of moral agony without achieving a single decisive victory or even becoming legally a war could hardly be expected to be resolved in a clearcut, rational fashion. And the evidence of the Nine Points Agree ment indicates that it will not be.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Nov. 17 editorial on the joint announcement by Governor Cahill of New Jersey and myself on the mass transportation program for the Port Authority contains a serious misstate ment of fact.

title: Marshall Islander's Death Tied to Fallout
description: The first known death from a disorder typical of radiation exposure has occurred among those subjected to heavy fall out from nuclear weapons tests.

title: HIGH COURT DENIES COMPUTER PATENT FOR PROGRAMING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Supreme Court ruled today that computer programing con sisted basically of ideas and could not be patented.

title: Wallace Office Opened
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 20 (AP)Gov. George C. Wal lace's national campaign head quarters announced today that it had opened a temporary of fice in Washington, D.C., in an effort to influence the makeup of the Democratic National Committee scheduled to meet there Dec. 9.

title: Vorster Will Press Plan For SouthWest Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Nov. 20Prime Minister John Vorster indicated today that he would press ahead with a plan to grant selfgovernment to 10 nonwhite homelands in the disputed territory of South West Africa but would also create a council of black and mixedrace leaders to provide some unifying authority for the area.

title: Deep Satisfaction in Cuba
description: HAVANA, Nov. 20 (Agence FrancePresse) The United States decision to negotiate with the Cuban Government on air piracy and similar acts announced in Washington to day has been greeted with deep satisfaction in circles close to the Cuban Government, observers said here today.

title: Alleged Confession in Murder Called Psychologically Coerced
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 20 If it happened as Barry Glen Lipsky told it to the police, Patricia Parks thought she was going to get getaway money to flee to South America and per haps find the child her former husband had spirited away. In stead, according to the state ment he gave to the police last March, she was taken for a ride by Lipsky and Vincent Pacelli Jr., her heroindealer boyfriend.

title: RENT AID STARTED FOR ELDERLY HERE
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday signed the first two contracts to provide partial rent subsi dies for the elderly in city and stateaided middleincome hous ing developments.

title: 4 Try to Attack Chief Rabbi In Israel on Marriage Ruling
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 20 (UPI) Four ultraOrthodox youths tried to attack Chief Rabbi Shlomo Goren today to protest a rabbinical court's ruling that a brother and sister were not bastards under Jewish law, a decision that enabled them to marry their fiances yesterday. Rabbi Goren was not injured.

title: Arts Abroad
description: LONDON  The Christmas lights are flickering in Knightsbridge and on Oxford Street, Each evening the crowds surge into the West End and Covent Garden and the Royal Festival Hall over looking the Thames. London's cultural scene throbs now with noisy opening nights.

title: Amex Prices Gain as Volume Retreats
Man in the News
description: When Richard Merrill Ro senbaum was asked the other day which of his many po litical and organizational qualities prompted his selec tion as Republican state chairman, his reply was, You ought to ask Governor Rockefeller, he would know better than I do.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CAMDEN, S. C., Nov. 20 (AP)Ray Wolfe, director of the Colonial Cup steeplechase, has denied reports the race may be dropped. However, he does admit the difficulty underwriting the $100,000 purse, the largest for a steeple chase in the United States.

title: Bonn's Record Turnout
description: The surprising margin of victory for Willy Brandt's coalition should not obscure other significant aspects of the Bundestag election that shed light on the health of West German democracy. For one thing, 91.2 per cent of the electorate went to the pollsthe largest turnout in the Federal Republic's 23year history and one of the biggest ever recorded for democratic countries where voting is not compulsory. In contrast, only about 55 per cent of the potential American electorate voted Nov. 7, the lightest turnout since 1948.

title: Sugarman Says State Proposes A Drastic Cutback in Day Care
description: The state is considering new rules that would force 25 per cent of the children now in New York City daycare cen ters to be removed from the program and would raise the costs for some of those re maining from $1.25 a week to more than $40 a week, the city's Human Resources Ad ministrator said last night.

title: Jennie Grossinger Dies at Resort Home
description: Jennie Grossinger, the gentle Jewish mother who transformed a modest Catskills family hotel into a luxurious resort, died early yesterday morning in a ranch cottage on the vast property the world calls Gros singer's but she called home. Her age was 80.

title: BIG DEBT DEFAULT ENSNARES BANKS
description: The Tidal Marine Internation al Corporation, which at one time was a major shipowner, has gotten into deep financial watersleaving major banks and pension funds scrambling to collect millions of dollars of overdue debts.

title: REDSKINS DEFEAT FALCONS, 24 TO 13
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) Stung by Atlanta's quick 10 0 lead, the Washington Red skins, with Larry Brown's run ning and Bill Kilmer's passing, roared back to a 2413 victory over the Falcons tonight in a National Football League game.

title: U. S. Is Criticized and Supported In U.N. Bid to Cut Assessment
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20The United States received some strong support and some strong criticism to day in its initiative to cut its financial contribution to the United Nations.

title: MSGR. JAMES M'PEAK
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Nov. 20 (AP)Msgr. James P. McPeak, rector of the Roman Catholic Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception here for 49 of his 69 years in the priesthood, died yesterday at the age of 95.

title: 21 Flown to San Diego
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 20 (AP)  Twentyone black sailors arrived here from the Philippines today to face charges of assault and rioting aboard the carrier Kitty Hawk, the Navy said.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Train service on the Hud son and Harlem divisions of the Penn Central Railroad was severely delayed yester day morning by a walkout of railroad police and by the re sulting sympathetic absentee ism of some train crews. However, by early afternoon, the teamster local represent ing the railroad police was served with an injunction, and its leadership announced its men would immediately report for duty.

title: News Analysis
