description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The new era of federalism that President Nixon promised in his first term stands a good chance of becoming a reality in his sec ond.

title: KISSINGER RENEWS CEASEFIRE TALKS WITH THO IN PARIS
description: PARIS, Nov. 20Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho of North Vietnam opened another round of negotiations for a Vietnam ceasefire today.

title: S.E.C. Seeks Formula On Insider Profit Data
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The Securities and Exchange Commission began a public Search today for a formula that would make everyone an in sider on information about earnings of companies whose stock is publicly traded.

title: Advertising:
description: Gilbert Advertising, which in 20 years has built a reputa tion far greater than its billings would indicate, will become Gilbert Grace & Stark on Dec. 1.

title: Notes on People
description: If Poland agrees, the next United States Ambassador to Poland is likely to be Rich ard T. Davies, who is now Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for European Af fairs. Sources in Washington said the United States had proposed Mr. Davies, a career Foreign Service officer, to the Government in Warsaw. Mr. Davies would replace Walter J. Stoessel Jr., who left the post in July to become an Assistant Secretary of State in Washington.

title: NAVY CHIEF DENIES PERMISSIVENESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI) Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., the Chief of Naval Operations, denied today that there was permissiveness in the Navy as a Congressional committee began to investigate the possi bility that a breakdown in disci pline helped spark racial clashes aboard Navy ships.

title: Credit Markets
description: The Michigan Bell Telephone Company auctioned $75million of longterm debentures yes terday. They were priced to yield investors 7.075 per cent, the lowest level on securities of a Bell System unit in 22 months.

title: Jennie Grossinger Dies at Resort Home
description: Jennie Grossinger, the gentle Jewish mother who transformed a modest Catskills family hotel into a luxurious resort, died early yesterday morning in a ranch cottage on the vast property the world calls Gros singer's but she called home. Her age was 80.

title: In Harlem, Poor Reading Score Is Viewed as a Sign of Change
description: From the upperfloor class room windows of Com munity School 31, on the eastern bend of Harlem, near the Manhattan approaches to the Triborough and Willis Avenue Bridges, the pupils and teachers can see work men putting the finishing touches on the area's new est housing complex, the East Harlem Triangle Project.

title: Personalities: Vickers Is Injured
description: The Rangers have won two of their last three games but lost five players with injuries. The latest casualty is Steve Vickers, the National Hockey League's leading rookie scor er (14 points). The 21year old wing, the first player in the league to score three goals in two successive games, will be sidelined for two weeks with strained lig aments in his left knee. The injury occurred Sunday night when he was checked heavi ly by Darryl Edestrand of the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: $1.5Million Raised to Date In United Hospital Campaign
description: The United Hospital Fund of New York announced yesterday that it had collected $1,559,099 to date in its current campaign for the 54 voluntary, nonprofit hospitals in the city that belong to the group.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE SAY WHEN ?? (??)

title: Nassau Redistricting Plan Is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 20 The State Supreme Court here today ruled unconstitutional a reapportionment plan adopted Sept. 25 by the Nassau County Board of Supervisors.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Cahill of New Jersey said yesterday that he would recommend that New Jersey be prepared to put up $40million to start a $240million NewarktoPlainfield railroad line to be operated by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Grove Press Sues to Cut Link With Random House
description: Grove Press filed suit yes terday seeking to dissolve its fiveyear joint venture agree ment with Random House and asking $1million in damages from the giant publishing house for various alleged misdeeds, including the immoral de struction of thousands of Grove Press books that had remained unsold.

title: MOBIL TO REALIGN MARKETING UNITS
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation announced yesterday it was re aligning its marketing organiza tion in the United States, con solidating its present seven marketing divisions into four new units with headquarters in New York, Philadelphia, Chi cago and Los Angeles.

title: Chess: A Danish Pasting Awaits The Timid at San Antonio
description: Bent Larsen wades in swinging, unmindful of oppo nents' blows as long as he comes out on top. Unhamp ered by the fear of the un predictable that affects most of his colleagues up there at the summit, he is forever launching himself into ob scure chessboard situations, optimistically relying on his ability to master them. The title of his book reveals his approach to competitive chess: I Play to Win.

title: WHALERS TRIUMPH OVER NATIONALS, 75
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20 (AP)Tom Webster, John French and Red Green scored two goals apiece tonight, leading the New Eng land Whalers to a 75 World Hockey Association victory over the Ottawa Nationals.

title: Coliseum Offers Tickets For College Basketball
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 20 Tickets for the Nassau Coliseum's five major college basketball programs go on sale tomorrow at the Coli seum and all Ticketron out lets. Tickets are priced at $6.50, $5.50 and $4.50. Prices for students are $4.50, $3.50 and $2.50.

title: Enemies Chat Across Suez About Girls and Home
description: ALONG THE SUEZ CANAL, IsraeliOccupied Sinai, Nov. 9 In the dark, moonless night, the voices carried easily over the still waters of the canal.

title: New Hampshire Taxes Low
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 20 (AP)Per capita taxes in New Hampshire were the lowest in New England in 1971 and the 11th lowest in the nation, re ports the Commerce Clearing House, a Chicago company specializing in tax and business law reports.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Nov. 14:

title: Okinawan Mayor ReElected
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Nov. 20 (UPI)Yoshimatsu Taira, the leftwing mayor of Naha, Oki nawa's largest city, was re elected today on a platform de manding the withdrawal of the 40,000 American servicemen stationed at more than 80 bases on Okinawa and the Ryukyu Islands. He won against a conservative candidate hacked by Japan's ruling LiberalDemo cratic party.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE CLOCKS OF COLUMBUS. The Liter ary Career of James Thurber. By Charles S. Holmes. 360 pages. Illustrated. Athe neum. $10.

title: Fire Routs Hotel Residents
description: About 100 residents of a midtown hotel were evacuated last night when a fire broke out in a restaurant on the main floor. The fire started shortly before 6:30 P.M. in the grease ducts of the Cafe Gregorie at 42 West 35th Street, near Fifth Avenue, causing smoke to rise through the ducts into the 13 story Hotel Murray Hill. Two firemen were treated for smoke inhalation.

title: Watergate Case Defendant Drops 2Million Florida Suit
description: MIAMI, Nov. 20 (AP)Ber nard L. Barker, a defendant in the bugging and burglary of Democratic party headquarters at the Watergate complex in Washington, today dropped a $2million suit against the Dade County State Attorney, Richard Gerstein, who successfully pros ecuted Mr. Barker on a misde meanor charge last month.

title: CITY FINDS RELIEF TOO BIG A BURDEN
description: Noting that 16 per cent of the people in New York City were on welfare, Human Re sources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman asserted yesterday that no major city could eco nomically keep supporting more than a tenth of its population on relief rolls.

title: Plan for Reorganization Of Pennsy Set for April 1
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20 (AP)The longawaited plan for reorganization of the bankrupt Penn Central railroad will be filed next April 1, trustees of the troubled line said today. The trustees said the plan would be based on the end of the current year as a termination date for testing the outcome of the reorganiza tion.

title: Former Aide of Lewis Backs Insurgent Miners' Slate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  Josephine A. Roche, a longtime associate of the late John L. Lewis and the first director of the United Mine Workers Wel fare and Retirement Fund, has endorsed the insurgent Miners For Democracy in the upcom ing U.M.W. election.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20 (AP)  Serendipity Farm's Rastaferian scored by a nose and Nelson B. Hunt's Great Bear Lake won by four lengths in the two $20,000 added divisions of the Flintlock Stakes on opening day at Liberty Bell race track today.

title: Youth Arraigned in Killing of Bridgeport Professor
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 20 A 17yearold high school dropout was arraigned here to day in the hatchet killing of a University of Bridgeport pro fessor.

title: The Bus That Roars
description: As New York's antinoise campaign shiftswe hope into high gear, the search for the most audible violations could well begin with the city's sanitation trucks and its buses.

title: Republican Apparently Wins Seattle Race for Congress
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 20Wash ington State apparently has seated a lone Republican mem ber in its Congressional dele gation.

title: U.S. Court, Citing Bias, Bars Tax Aid To Elks in Oregon
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 20 A threejudge Federal court ruled today that Oregon may no longer grant tax exemptions to Elks lodges because the fraternal organization restricted its membership to whites.

title: Fiji's Boom Transforms the Easy Life
description: SUVA, Fiji  Meli Loki, a Fijian and a former tour guide, has become a successful city merchant, the first of his easy going, unbusinesslike people poorly equipped for mercantile pursuits by their communal a village backgroundto own a dutyfree shop in Fiji.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  I see where the President is planning to stamp out permissiveness, Senator Moldrin remarked as he cautiously lowered his ancient bones into a chair across the table from Senator Merle Survine.

title: FEED GRAIN DEMAND TO BE BIG, U.S. SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Agriculture Depart ment said today that the de mand for feed grains should be heavy in the coining months, keeping prices high to the farmers and reducing carryover stocks.

title: MacStiofain Is Charged
description: DUBLIN, Tuesday, Nov, 21 (UPI)The police today charged Sean MacStiofain, leader of the militant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army, with vi olation of the State Act, which outlaws membership in illegal organizations. The 44yearold Mr. MacStiofain was arrested on the outskirts of Dublin yes terday.

title: Enemies Chat Across Suez About Girls and Home
description: ALONG THE SUEZ CANAL, IsraeliOccupied Sinai, Nov. 9 In the dark, moonless night, the voices carried easily over the still waters of the canal.

title: After Cold War
description: This is the week of new, beginnings in EastWest diplomacy. If SALT II, CESC and MBFR are unlikely candidates for addition to the lexicon of household phrases, they are regarded among governments of the world as symbolic inauguration of a postcold war era.

title: Giants Weigh Probable Improbabilities of Their Playoff Status
description: Regrouping at Yankee Stadi um yesterday to begin working towards Sunday's game against Philadelphia, the New York Giants were buzzing with play off possibilities.

title: Ampex Corporation Is in the Black With Profit for the Quarter
description: The Ampex Corporation, a major producer of magnetic tape recording equipment and computer peripheral equipment, last night reported a net profit of $271,000, or 2 cents a share, on sales of $78million for the second fiscal quarter ended Oct. 28. It was the first time the company operated in the black since the third fiscal quarter ended Jan. 31, 1970. The company had a $90million deficit in the fiscal year ended last April 29.

title: Pentagon Says Vietnam Arms BuildUp Is Mainly Over
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI) The Pentagon said today that it had essentially com pleted an urgent program to arm South Vietnam with 10,000 tons of new military equipment before the withdrawal of Amer ican forces.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The immediate prospects for the Democratic party would be consid erably enhanced if both sides to the developing brouhaha over control of the National Committee would climb down from their respective ideolog ical high horses and join forces in de veloping the opportunities opened by the recent election.

title: B. B. C. at Fifty
description: A halfcentury ago, when radio in the United States was left to the scramble of commercial interests, the British with little planning or debate created a monopoly in the radio field. The British Broadcasting Company its name changed years later to Corporationevolved during its first sixteen years under the leadership of an extraordinary Scotsman, John Reith.

title: Mrs. Herman Wed to Robert E. Thibault
description: Mrs. Selma Herman and Robert E. Thibault were mar ried yesterday afternoon. Judge John Carro of the Criminal Court performed the ceremony in his chambers in the Bronx.

title: 4 BAKERS FACE FINES FOR FIXING OF PRICES
description: Officers of four major baking concerns pleaded no contest yesterday in Federal District Court to charges of conspiring from 1966 to 1969 to fix, raise, maintain and stabilize bread prices in the metropolitan area.

title: Massachusetts Is Invited To Dec. 9 Boardwalk Bowl
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 20 (UPI)  Twicebeaten Mas sachusetts received an invita tion today to participate in the Boardwalk Bowl at Atlantic City on Dec. 9. The Minutemen, champions of the Yankee Con ference, have until noon to morrow to accept.

title: Former Convict Is Seized In Killing of 2 Policemen
description: KENNETT SQUARE, Pa., Nov. 20 (UPI)A former convict was charged with murder today in the alleged revenge slaying of two policemen who had stopped him for a traffic violation two months ago.

title: Price Panel Opens Study Of Rising Lumber Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  The Price Commission, in an other round of psychological warfare aimed at rising lumber costs, said today that it had begun or scheduled investiga tions of more than 350 lumber and woodproducts companies.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20Joseph Rocco Mascari of Phillipsburg provided his own accompani ment today as the State Assem bly gave final legislative pas sage to a bill naming Mr. Mas cari's tune, I'm From New Jersey, the official state song.

title: FRANCIS X. REAGAN
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20 (AP) Francis X. Reagan, a former professional football player and college coach, died today at the age of 53.

title: College Sports Notes
description: Now that the 11 major col lege football bowls have named their teams, Coach Lee Corso of the University of Louisville and his players wonder just what it takes to get into one of those games. The Cardinals, whose only loss was a 2point decision to Tulsa, have one of the most exciting runners in the land Howard Stevens. When Tampa was selected yester day to meet Kent State in the Tangerine Bowl, the last bowl door was shut to Louisville. Corso's team defeated both Kent and Tampa.

title: That Campaign Rhetoric? Greeks Had Words for It
description: Just in time for the 1976 campaign comes That Pesti lent Cosmetic, Rhetoric, a book cataloguing tricks of the verbal trade that will be pub lished Friday by Grossman.

title: HARRY OSBORN LEETE
description: GUILFORD, Conn., Nov. 20 Harry Osborn Leete, a retired certified public accountant and former assistant treasurer of the Democratic National Com mittee, died yesterday at his home here. He was 83 years old.

title: 2 SENATORS VIE FOR ALBANY POST
description: Republicans in the State Sen ate will gather in Albany on Dec. 4 to pick a new majority leader from two contenders for the postSenator Warren M. Anderson of Binghamton, who is the favorite, and Senator H. Douglas Barclay of Pulaski, who says younger senators are pretty much ignored in the senatorial decision  making process.

title: Manila Paper Reopening
description: MANILA, Nov. 20 (AP)  President Ferdinand E. Marcos has authorized The Manila Daily Bulletin to resume publication under a new name, a Govern ment spokesman announced to day. The Englishlanguage news paper, to be called Bulletin To day, is also authorized to pub lish a weekly feature magazine, Panorama, the Government in formation secretary, Francisco S. Tatad, said.

title: SYSTEMS CANCELED BY BALTIMORE GAS
description: The Baltimore Gas and Elec tric Company announced yes terday the cancellation of an order with Combustion Engi neering, Inc., for two nuclear, steam supply systems. The utility said also that it had postponed plans for building a $700million nuclear plant on the site in Harford County, Md. The two nuclear systems were scheduled for operation in 1979 and 1980.

title: Closing at GeorgiaPacific
description: NEW LONDON, Wis., Nov. 20 (UPI)The GeorgiaPacific Corporation announced today that it would close its Curtis Door division plant here, which it purchased just four years ago. The plant, which employs 175 workers, manufactures in stitutional flush doors.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20Bernie Adams coaches football at Weequahic High School in the heart of the ghetto section here. His team plays on an unkempt field, full of holes and jagged rocks. And the wooden beams of its scoreboard are rotting, falling crisscross.

title: GREECE'S STUDENTS VOTE FOR LEADERS
description: ATHENS, Nov. 20  Greek university students voted for student organization leaders today for the first time since the 1967 military coup. The vote was held amid demon strations, boycotts and allega tions of election rigging.

title: Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Saigon Senate Backs Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 20The South Vietnam ese Senate voted overwhelm ingly today to support Presi dent Nguyen Van Thieu's pub lic opposition to the draft peace accord unless all North Viet namese troops are withdrawn from the country.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION DOWN 1% FOR WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 18 slipped 1 per cent to 2,636,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The production index dipped to 108 from 1092 in the preceding week when the production level was 2,663,000 tons.

title: A BOMB IN ULSTER KILLS 2 SOLDIERS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 20A British Army offi cer and a sergeant were killed today by a boobytrap bomb that exploded in a disused farmhouse about a mile from the border with the Irish Re public.

title: 3,000 Picket City Hall to Protest Closing and Shifting of Firehouses
description: Three thousand offduty firemen and sympathizers ringed City Hall yesterday to protest the recent closing by the Fire Department of six firehouses and the relocation of seven others.

title: HARRY E. BRONSTON
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Nov. 20 Harry E. Bronston, a former hat manufacturer and father of New York State Senator Jack E. Bronston of Queens, died at his home here today. His age was 80.

title: Disputed Newark Housing Wins. Court's GoAhead
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20Superior Court Judge Irwin I. Kimmel man today lifted a temporary restraining order in a move that will permit construction to be resumed on the contro versial Kawaida Towers apart ment building here.

title: Disputed Newark Housing Wins Court's GoAhead
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20Superior Court Judge Irwin I. Kimmel man today lifted a temporary restraining order in a move that will permit construction to be resumed on the contro versial Kawaida Towers apart ment building here.

title: Cerro Elects a Director
description: William L. Henry, executive vice president of the Gulf Oil Corporation, has been elected a director of the Cerro Corpora tion. He has been executive vice president of Gulf, since 1970. His election raises the board of Cerro to 11 members.

title: P.T.A. HEAD OFFERS PLAN FOR CANARSIE
description: The president of the Parent Teacher Association at Meyer Levin Junior High School 285 in East Flatbush proposed a zoning plan last night that she said would increase the black and Puerto Rican enrollment at Isaac Bildersee Junior High School 68 in Canarsie from a to 11 per cent by next fall.

title: ExEnvoy Receives Award
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 20 Dr. Samuel C. Adams Jr., a black career diplomat and for mer United States Ambassador to Niger, today was named the recipient of the 1972 Rockefel ler Public Service Award for Human Resource Development and Protection. The 52yearold Federal official now directs pro grams of the agency for Inter national Development for the developing countries of Africa.

title: Waterfront Commission Opens Inquiry on Stevedore Concern
description: The Waterfront Commission opened a formal hearing yester day to determine whether a New Jersey piercleaning com pany possesses the good char acter and integrity necessary to qualify for a license as a steve dore.

title: Market Place: Banking Shares May Face Woes
description: Morris A. Schapiro is one of Wall Street's great success stories. He began modestly as a trader in bank shares, doing business in cramped of fices that belied his success.

title: Rogers Meets With Canadian
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The State Department an nounced that Secretary of State William P. Rogers met in New York today with Mitchell W. Sharp, the Canadian Minister of External Affairs, to discuss the operations of an interna tional supervisory commission once a ceasefire takes effect in Vietnam.

title: MARTIN NORR
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20  Martin Norr, a lawyer and editor of the world tax series of the inter national program in taxation at the Harvard Law School, died today at his home in Newton, Mass. He was 62 years old.

title: People and Business
description: In 1955, when the Dow Jones industrial index was fighting to reach the 500 level, Benton D. Davis, a broker, wrote a paperback book called Dow 1,000? By propounding his theory that this widely watched indicator would zoom ahead and crack the psychological barrier, Mr. Davisthen associated with Mitchell Hutchins & Co. was laughted at by many of the professionals in Wall Street. He couldn't ever get the book published until he put the question mark in the title.

title: McGovern Opposes Dismissing Chairman, but Not Resignation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Senator George McGovern said today that he would not permit Jean Westwood, the chairman of the Democratic National Committee, to be thrown out as a scapegoat for his defeat.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Strict AntiAbortion Bill Voted By Pennsylvania's Legislature
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 20 (UPI)The Pennsylvania Legis lature completed action today on a strict antiabortion bill de scribed by Gov. Milton J. Shapp as unacceptable.

title: Scribner Demands That City Protect Schools Against Invading Terrorists
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner called upon the city yesterday to take steps to deal with criminally bent intru ders who invade schools to rob and terrorize teachers and students.

title: The Theater: Beckett Festival Opens
description: Happy Days is here again. At the doomed prem ises of the Forum Theater in Lincoln Center, the Lincoln Center Repertory Company last night opened its Samuel Beckett Festival with Beck ett's play Happy Days and his Act Without Words 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: We would like to reply to your Oct. 28 editorial Warning on the I.R.A., which commented on the speech made by Republic of Ireland's Justice Minister O'Malley on the question of funds collected in the United States for the relief of distress in Ireland. Mr. O'Malley claimed that much of this money found its way into the bombing campaign of the Provisional I.R.A. and urged his audience to con tribute to relief through the Irish Red Cross or the churches.

title: Arthur MacKenzie, In Recital, Proves A Puzzling Pianist
description: Arthur MacKenzie is a puz zling pianist. He can buzz through thickets of difficulty, reeling off scales and arpeggios with great fluency, and yet even at its best his playing stays on the surface. In his re cital at Alice Tully Hall on Sun day night, Mr. MacKenzie functioned at considerably less than his best much of the time, which made his glibness espec ially annoying.

title: More G.I.'s Leave Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 20 (AP)  The United States Command reported to day that American troop strength in South Vietnam dropped by 1,500 men last week to a total of 29,300. This is just 2,300 short of the ceiling of 27,000 men set by President Nixon for Dec. 1.

title: F. A. O. Says Food Output of Developing Lands Lags
description: ROME, Nov. 20The devel oping countries are not pro ducing enough food to keep pace with their expanding pop ulations, Dr. Addeke H. Boerma, Director General of the Food and Agriculture Or ganization, said today.

title: Advertising:
description: According to reliable sources, Young & Rubicam has got some new business.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The Bride, billowing out of her place on the wall, regards an unseen bride groom with demure rapture. On the wall across from her, the Miracle Woman, talis mans dangling from the hem of her garment, looks in scrutable. The Red Woman tarries on a window seat, Icharus poises triumphantly in the air, and the Old Man, deep in meditation, ignores them all.

title: Boston's Fisk Top Rookie In the American League
description: Carlton Fisk of the Boston Red Sox was elected rookie of the year in the American League yesterday, and also be came the first rookie in the 23year history of the award to sweep all the votes in the league.

title: Very Rev. James Thomson, ExDivinity Dean at McGill
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 21 (Can adian Press)The Very Rev. James Sutherland Thomson, former moderator of the United Church of Canada from 1956 to 1958, and former dean of divinity at McGill University, died Saturday. He was 80 years old.

title: SUIT SEEKS REFORMS AT MILITARY PRISON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  The National Prison Project ac cused the Pentagon today of violating the constitutional rights of prisoners at Fort Leavenworth, Kan.

title: Annapolis Ousts 7 Freshmen For Smoking of Marijuana
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 20 (UPI)The United States Naval Academy said today that seven freshmen had been dismissed for smoking marijuana.

title: Next, Their Oriental Sundae
description: IRVINGTON, N. J.  The tipoff that it isn't all ba nana splits and hot fudge sundaes comes when the cus tomer spots the Chinese d cor and the oriental artifacts that surround the boldly printed paper sign proclaim ing that peach is the flavor of the month.

title: Ali, Bleeding, Knocks Out Foster in 8th Round
description: STATELINE, Nev., Nov. 21 Embarrassed by a cut over his left eye and a purple bruise under it, Muhammad Ali retal iated with an eighthround knockout of Bob Foster tonight when the skinny lightheavy weight champion finally was counted out on his seventh knockdown.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: WEST BERLIN  The democratic world has once again seen reaffirmed by Willy Brandt's impressive electoral victory a new political theorem. This is simply that a resolute leader with a minority of voters behind him but with a clear idea of where he is going can impose his policies and, by succeeding, make good politics out of the pro cedure.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21  The New Jersey Education Associa tion, the bargaining agent for most of the state's public school teachers, announced to day that a suit had been filed to prevent the results of last week's statewide readirtg and mathematics tests for 4th and 12th graders from leaving the vaults of the State Education Department.

title: I.B.M. Case Judge To Go to Moonshot
description: Agreement was reached in Federal Court here yesterday for Chief Judge David N. Edel stein to visit the Kennedy Space Center on Dec. 6 for the Apollo moonshot as part of the pre trial discovery process in the Justice Department's antitrust action against the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: LAVELLE CHARGES DISMISSED AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP)  The Air Force dis missed today charges filed early this month against Maj. Gen. John D. Lavelle and 23 other officers accused of carry ing out illegal bombing strikes against North Vietnam.

title: Market Place: Stock Empire Of James Ling
description: It took James (Jimmy) Ling years to put together his empire, a complex con glomerate that flew high in the Great Bull Market of the late nineteensixties.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21A year ago tomorrow, one of the worst prison uprisings In New Jersey's history occurred at Rahway State Prison, when rebellious in mates took six guards as hos tages.

title: Amex Plans First Index To Measure Speculation
description: The American stock Exchange is developing an auto mated system to monitor the financial condition of its listed companies and will begin to compute an index to motitor the degree of market specu lation within a few months. The index will be the first of its kind in the securities in dustry and will be expected to provide an earlywarning sys tem on the speculative tone of the stock market. However, its fluctuations may not be public, lest the index itself become a speculative tool.

title: Bridge: Special Bidding Convention Pays Off at Fall Nationals
description: Most expert partnerships with ambitions at the na tional level have an armory of bidding devices and special understandings. They know they may go for a month, or a year, or even a bridge life time, before the prescribed situation will occur, but they are willing to make this ef fort, placing a small load on the memory, to have the chance of a small match point profit.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Sonny Jorgensen was sidelined for virtually the entire season last year, Billy Kilmer took over his quarterbacking assignment with such skill that Washington reached the playoffs for the first time in 26 years. Then Kilmer remained in the No. 1 spot this season even though Sonny had regained his health. But the wildeyed 'Skin fans have had a love affair with Jurgy for so long that a definite campaign was launched to have him restored to his varsity job. In the fourth game of the season Sonny resumed the controls, but later had to yield them again when he ripped an Achilles tendon. So it has been Kilmer ever since and he hasn't lost his winning touch. When Giant fans visited Washington for the return match with the Redskins a little over a week ago, they were amused to see outdated bumper stickers that had been used in the campaign to elect Jurgy as starting quarterback.

title: Saving the Seas
description: New Yorkers need look no farther than their own fouled beaches and the ominous dead sea area off Sandy Hook to appreciate the significance of the interna tional convention to curb the dumping of poisonous wastes at sea which was approved by representatives of 91 nations in London last week.

title: HONG KONG IMPASSE: A SPY NO ONE WANTS
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 21  For 11 days, a Soviet ship has been riding at anchor in the outer reaches of Hong Kong harbor with a Chinese aboard deported by British authorities here on charges that he spied for the Russians.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21  Earl Phillips, executive director of Newark's High Impact Anti crime Program, today resigned from the $30,000ayear post, charging that state and Federal divisions of the Law Enforce ment Assistance Administration had threatened to deprive New ark of the $20million program if he remained.

title: Britons Heatedly Debate a Custody Case
description: LONDON, Nov. 21The case of Caroline Desramault, a 2 yearold child in a Swiss chil dren's home, has stirred an emotional debate in Britain and emerged as one of the most widely discussed legal disputes in years.

title: LARSEN TOPS EVANS FOR CHESS LEAD TIE
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Grandmaster Bent Larsen of Denmark stole the initiative from Larry Evans, a former United States champion, near the end of a fivehour game last night, winning a share of the lead in the second round of the $10,000 San Antonio International Chess Tournament.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Before this crazy, mixedup Ivy League football season began to run its zany course, Dartmouth was a favorite to win the championship.

title: Foe Again Repulsed at Highlands Camp
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 22 (AP)  South Vietnamese troops, aided by waves of United States B52 heavy bombers, repulsed a Com munist assault in the Central Highlands yesterday.

title: GYPSY CAB DRIVER IS SLAIN IN HARLEM
description: The driver of a gypsy cab was shot to death in Harlem last night, the apparent victim of an attempted holdup, the po lice said.

title: HARTFORD SENATE BACKS A TAX CUT
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 21With out a hope that its action would become law, Connecticut's lame duck Senate voted today to cut the state sales tax from 7 per cent to 6.

title: Jets Brush Up on Pain Defense
description: As the Jets reported for a long day of workouts yester day, Jeff Snedeker's training room was busier than Macy's bargain basement on a pre Christinas sale day.

title: Raleigh Theater Pats Boxing Fans in Dark
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 24 (AP)A lastminute difficulty left fight fans watching signs that said Fight Canceled when they arrived at Memo rial Auditorium tonight to watch the closedcircuit tele cast of Muhammad AliBob Foster bout.

title: JERSEY GROUP SUES OVER PUPILS' TESTS
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21The New Jersey Education Association, bargaining agent for most of the state's public school teach ers, announced today that a suit had been filed in Superior Court to prevent the results of last week's statewide, reading and mathematics tests for fourth graders from leaving the vaults of the State Education Department.

title: Suspect in Many Slayings Charged in Two Murders
description: GREENVILLE, Tex., Nov. 21 (AP)  Danny McCrary, 19 years old, one of five members of a family being questioned about a string of slayings in six states, was charged with two counts of murder with malice today in connection with the killing of a Mesquite, Tex., couple.

title: City Rent Program Called A Disaster by State Unit
description: Although it was given the highest priority, maximum per sonnel and the use of more than $4million worth of con sultant contracts, the city's maximum base rent program has proven to be a disaster, according to a study published yesterday.

title: ALBERT POST
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 21A1 bert Post, an international economist for the Mellon Na tional Bank and a former official of the State Depart ment, died yesterday in Mercy Hospital. He was 57 years old.

title: U.S. AIDE HELPED 3 VISIT A PRISONER
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 21  Leonard W. Gilman, southwest regional commissioner of the Immigration and Naturalization Service, acknowledged today than he had used his official vehicle to drive three Mexican visitors 150 miles to a Federal prison farm, John S. Alessio, a convict who is described by the Federal authorities as hav ing been close to organized crime.

title: End Losing Streak, 42
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 21 After a team meeting that took on elements of group ther apy, the Islanders found the pride they thought they'd lost when they came back tonight band scored a 42 victory over the California Golden Seals.

title: Manager of Fund Urges Flexibility in Reporting Profit Data to Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21A senior officer of one of the nation's largest managers of mutual funds told the Securi ties and Exchange Commission today that it should permit but not require publicly held concerns to include earnings projections in reports and statements they file with the agency.

title: With your guns and drums and drums and guns Hurroo, Hurroo With your guns and drums and drums and guns Hurroo, Hurroo From Irish folk song, Johnny, We Hardly Knew Ye.
description: A few minutes before President Kennedy was shot in Dallas nine years ago today, two of his traveling companions, Dave Powers and myself, in the motorcade close behind his limousine, were saying how happy he seemed that morning. As longtime aides to the President, Dave and I had seen him through many memora ble days but we never saw him in a better mood than on that trip to Texas.

title: JAPAN SIGNS ACCORD TO BUY U.S. PLANES
description: TOKYO, Nov. 21  The United States and Japan ex changed documents today on Japan's import and production of United States Phantom re connaissance planes and inter ceptor fighters.

title: Enid Storm Married To Albert R. Dwyer
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 21Miss Enid Langdon Storm of Bronxville, who is retired from the Exxon Corporation, was married here this morn ing to Albert Richard Dwyer of Mount Vernon, a retired promotion writer for The New York Times. The Rev. Mark Sisk performed the cermony in Christ Episcopal Church, where the Rev. Ed ward G. Finnerty, a Roman Catholic priest, blessed the couple.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your postelection editorial Unused Franchise (Nov. 10) raises the ques tion as to why such a large percentage of those qualified to vote fail to do so. One cause of this apparent apathy might be the fact that citizens know that for the higest two officers in our land they still have no direct vote. For example, I know that my vote for President Nixon in Randolph, Mass., did nothing to aid in his reelection and was literally thrown away.

title: ISRAEL AND SYRIA FIGHT FOR 8 HOURS ALONG TRUCE LINE
description: NAHAL AL, IsraeliOccupied Syria, Nov. 21The heaviest fighting in more than two years along the ceasefire line be tween Israel and Syria erupted today here on the Golan heights.

title: Two Acquitted of Murder Of Queens Nightclub Owner
description: After hearing nearly two weeks of testimony in State Supreme Court in Queens, an allmale jury last night acquit ted Daniel and Ralph Jacobson in the murder of Conrad Greaves, a witness in a rackets inquiry.

title: Whose Right to What Life?
description: The fervor and tenacity of the Right to Life brigades has come very close to reversing the trend toward liberalized abortion laws in this country. Like all slogans advanced in the name of hu manity, the right to life has a noble ring. So has power to the people.

title: Drake in Pioneer Bowl
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Nov. 21 (AP)Drake will play Tennes see State in the Pioneer Bowl on Dec. 9, it was announced today. The game will be played in Wichita Falls, Kan.

title: N.L.R.B. Chief Here Named
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  Sidney Danielson, a career lawyer for the National Labor Relations board, has been ap pointed regional director of the board's Manhattan office. Peter G. Nash, the N.L.R.B. general counsel, announcedtoday that Mr. Danielson was succeeding Ivan C. McLeod, who retired last August after 15 years as regional director. The Manhat tan and the Bronx and in West chester, Rockland, Orange and Putnam Counties in New York State and Fairfield County in Connecticut.

title: Kissinger and Tho Confer for 4 Hours
description: PARIS, Nov. 21The Vietnam ceasefire talks continued to day, with no indication of what progress was being made.

title: WILLIAM JONSON, CONDUCTOR, DIES
description: William Jonson, a conductor and choral specialist, died yes terday at Leroy Hospital of cirrhosis of the liver, He was 51 years old and lived at 342 West 71st Street.

title: China Opposed to a Pact on Terrorism
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 21China insisted today that acts of terrorism be dealt with by the countries in which they occur not by international treaty.

title: To Joan O'Shea, the Race Is the Thing
description: Put him on the lead, John Nieminski told Joan O'Shea in the paddock be fore yesterday's first race at Aqueduct, and just try to hold him together. You know him better than I do.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Before this crazy, mixedup Ivy League football season began to run its zany course, Dartmouth was a favorite to win the championship.

title: SAIGON ASSUMING A JANUARY TRUCE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 21The South Vietnamese Gov ernment is carrying out a pro gram of political indoctrination and organization in expecta tion of a ceasefire about the beginning of January. That is the date Government planning seems to assume the shooting will stop and the political strug gle will begin.

title: G. RONALD M'KAY
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 21 G. Ronald Mc Kay, founder and retired president of the Mc Kay Chemical Company of Brooklyn, died Sunday of can cer at his home here. His age was 79.

title: CELTICS VANQUISH BUCKS BY 116102
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 21 (AP) A blistering fastbreak attack led by John Havlicek's 27 points and Dave Cowens's 23 swept the Boston Celtics to bight to a 116102 National Basketball Association victory over the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Canada Sets Conditions
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 21 (UPI) External Affairs Minister Mitch ell W. Sharp of Canada said today that he thought the United States Government now had a better understanding of why Canada would not yet commit herself to participating in a proposed truce observation force in Vietnam.

title: TV Review
description: The American Broadcasting Company is televising two Thanksgiving Eve specials starting at 8:30 tonight with a Julie Andrews Hour trib ute to Walt Disney. Young viewers probably will like most of it.

title: Mayor Picks Bardel To Head City Unit. On Plan for Midtown
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the resignation of Jacquelin T. Robertson as direc tor of the Mayor's Office of Midtown Planning and Devel opment and the appointment of William G. Bardel as Mr. Robertson's successor.

title: MRS. MARY E. JERGENS
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21 Mrs. Mary Elizabeth Jergens, the former wife, of the late Andrew Jergens Sr., an heir to the Jergens handlotion fortune, was found dead last evening in what police said was an accidental drowning.

title: Conquistadors Win, 105101
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 21 (AP) Larry Miller, breaking a scoring slump, got 17 points in the sec ond half tonight, leading the San Diego Conquistadors to a 105101 victory over the Dallas Chaparrals.

title: MRS. OLIVER C. M'NUTT
description: JACKSON, Tenn., Nov. 21 Mrs. Mae Beatrice Eddings McNutt, mother of John T. Mc Nutt, associate editor of The New York Times News Serv ice, died last evening at the Madison County General Hos pital here. She was 81 years old.

title: People and Business
description: When Mayor Lindsay goes to Tokyo next week for a conference of the world's great cities, he will also be involved in another important undertaking for New York City. While the conference is going on, a Business De velopment Mission of 11 city business executivesled by D. Kenneth Patton, New York's Economic Develop ment Administratorwill be meeting there with Japanese businessmen to encourage their investment here.

title: MIRIAM WALKER, 83, MISSIONARY WORKER
description: Miriam Dwight Walker, di rector emeritus of the Near East Foundation and a long time worker with missionaries, died on Monday at her home, 1120 Fifth Avenue. She was 83 years old.

title: SOUTH KOREA VOTE BACKS PRESIDENT
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Wednes day, Nov. 22South Koreans, voting in a closely supervised referendum, yesterday ratified President Park Chung Hee's moves to exercise almost com plete power for an unlimited time.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation reported yesterday that its board had declared a quarterly dividend of 25 cents a share, plus a special dividend of 25 cents a share, both payable Dec. 21 to holders of record Dec. 1.

title: Behind the Indian Siege
description: The dramatic occupation of the Bureau of Indian Affairs by some 800 angry Indian demonstrators early this month has created a highly misleading impression about an exceedingly dangerous incident. Public atten tion was focused on an illegal takeover and on the extensive damage done to the B.I.A. and its files. Out raged statements by Interior Department officials inten sified the public shock.

title: PERON PROPOSES A CIVILIAN ACCORD
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 21  Juan D. Pern, the former President of Argentina, has proposed that the civilian polit ical leaders of Argentina join in an agreement on the basic ways to transform the nation from military to civilian rule next year.

title: first National of Boston Raises Loan Rate to 57%
description: The First National Bank of Boston, which sets its minimum interest rate on business loans in line with rates in the open market, said yesterday that its best lending rate would be 5 per cent for the week beginning today, up from 5 per cent last week.

title: HULL'S JETS WIN AS HE WATCHES
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)  Chris Bordeleau scored two goals and had an assist to lead the Winnipeg Jets to a 42 tri umph over the Houston Aeros in the World Hockey Associa tion tonight.

title: Economic Analysis
description: The sweeping trade agree ment between the United States and the Soviet Union may prove to be the most im portant economic initiative of the Nixon Administration  and one that will set the seal on United States and Soviet foreign policy in the postcold war era.

title: Books of The Times
description: Though he bore little resemblance to JeanJacques Rousseau's cigar store Indian, the Noble Savage actually did exist. Before being corrupted by contact with more advanced cultures, there were probably a number of societies that qualified for the title. Given fertile land or good fishing and a diseasefree climate, there was no reason why a primitive people should not have evolved a simple, harmonious life. A few early anthropologists were fortunate enough to see and record such cultures, and their studies are heartening to those who would see a sign of man's immanent goodness.

title: Bears Rookie Gets Surgery
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21 (UPI) Bill McKenney, a rookie line backer with the Chicago Bears, had surgery today to repair cartilage damage to his left knee. The operation was per formed by Dr. Theodore Fox. McKenney injured his knee as a junior at West. Texas State, but avoided an operation and played without apparent harm during his senior year. The operation was performed now, the Bears said, to prevent any irritation of the situation so he could report completely sound for the 1973 season.

title: Christmas Is in the Wings Awaiting Its Cue
description: The peaceonearthgood willtowardmenseasonmoved into high gear here yesterday with some sentiment, some charity and some promotions.

title: Housing Starts Up
description: New housing starts in the third quarter rose 19 per cent above the level of the corre sponding period of 1971, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Sys tems Company reported yes terday.

title: Massachusetts Aide Named
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21 (AP)John R. Verani, currently chairman of the Massachusetts Depart ment of Public Utilities, was appointed today to the state Cabinet post of Secretary of Consumer Affair.

title: Harvard Professor Jailed In Pentagon Papers Case
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21A Federal judge today ordered Prof. Samuel L. Popkin of Harvard to begin serving a sentence for contempt of a Federal grand jury. The judge said that there is no immunity for either scholars or newsmen in testifying before a grand jury.

title: Dance: 2 Wendys and Parra Troupe
description: Wendy Perron and Wendy Summit, who regularly ap pear, with other dance com panies, decided to put on a program of their own work Monday evening at the Cubi culo.

title: Union Reports Accord Is Near In Strike by Chefs and Cooks
description: Leaders of the striking chefs and cooks here said yesterday that they had made great progress in negotiations with the Restaurant League and that they felt they were getting close to an agreement.

title: PLIMPTON TO HEAD BOARD OF ETHICS
description: Mayor Lindsay has appointed Francis T. P. Plimpton to the city's Board of Ethics to re place Bruce Bromley, the board's chairman, who has re signed, it was announced yesterday.

title: DISCIPLINE CRISIS IS FEARED IN NAVY
description: Many Navy officers, active and retired, believe their serv ice is in a disciplinary crisis arising in part from what they view as permissiveness and from the racialequality edicts of Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., Chief of Naval Operations.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: SAY WHEN FOR FUN, PI. ?? (Advt.)

title: Parker, 33, Quite Baseball After 9 Seasons in Majors
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21 (UPI) Wes Parker, the Los An vies Dodgers' Golden Glove first baseman, who celebrated his 33d birthday last week, asked to be placed on the ma jor league club's voluntary re tired list today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your editorials regarding Israeli air raids and attacks on terrorist bases in Lebanon are always a source of amazement to me.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21The acres of longbarren urban renewal tracts in the Central and South Wards of Newark have, to many, become a clich symbolizing the slow pace of rebuilding central cities.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The name is Next, and it was born out of an idea that our customer deserves the opportunity to be more sophisticated, according to John Gounaris, a merchan dise manager at Alexander's. Next, which opened yes terday, is a handsome shop with curved butcher block walls on the store's second floor. It's intended, ex plained Francine Farkas, Alexander's vice president of Fashion, for a type: the East Side New Yorker who's gone beyond being a hippie junior but is not yet a matron. It's also for the sort of person who has a strong feeling about the whole poli tical social movement.

title: Advertising:
description: Because of the poor performance of publicly held ad vertising agency stocks, Batten, Barton, Durstine and Os born will not make a public offering this year as planned and, because of technical considerations, will not be able to take such a step until next spring.

title: Women Hammer Away at Male Job Bastions
description: They still cannot be fa thers. Or Canadian Moun ties, for that matter. But many of the other allmale bastions have come tumbling down in recent months as women have been hired for jobs that were once reserved for the hairy arms of men.

title: Nixons Will Celebrate Holiday at Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., Nov. 21 (AP)President Nixon and his family will have Thanks giving Day dinner at the Presidential retreat at Camp David, near here. It will he the first time the Nixon fam ily has celebrated Thanks giving there.

title: Panel Supports Limiting Composite Quotations to Listed Securities
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  The Securities and Exchange Commission has asked the New York Stock Exchange to delay the major changes proposed early this month that would permit financial institutions to become exchange members under certain conditions, it was disclosed today.

title: City Rent Program Called A Disaster by State Unit
description: Although it was given the highest priority, maximum per sonnel and the use of more than $4million worth of con sultant contracts, the city's maximum base rent program has proven to be a disaster, according to a study published yesterday.

title: Diversification Is Urged For State Savings Banks
description: The $55billion savings bank industry in New York State should be allowed to diversify to offer a wide variety of household financial services, a major study by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York has concluded.

title: Alois Haba, Composer, Dies; Wrote QuarterTone Music
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 21 (AP) Alois Haba, a composer, is dead at the age of 79, the Czecho slovak news agency reported today.

title: Ford Agrees to Assemble Cars And Produce Engines on Taiwan
description: The Ford Motor Company signed an agreement yesterday to assemble automobiles and manufacture engines on Taiwan.

title: CITYCHARTER UNIT SETS UP HEARINGS
description: The City Charter Review Commission  whose composi tion is still a matter of con troversy  has scheduled day and night hearings in the five boroughi beginning next week.

title: Aspects of a Flute Exhibited in Debut By Betty Corpier
description: Betty Corpier's New York debut program in Carnegie Re cital Hall on Monday night was both sensible and refresh ing. The young Arkansasborn artist, who now lives here, had arranged a series of works that exhibited the flute in various uses: as an obbligato in two Bach cantata arias, as selfsuf ficient in Hindemith's Eight Pieces for Flute Alone and as an ensemble sharer in Rous sel's Trio for Flute, Viola and Cello, Ravel's Chansons Ma dcasses and Irving Joseph's Divertimento for Flute and Piano.

title: Former Cao Dai Leader Killed in Blast at Tayninh
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 22 (Agence FrancePresse)Gen. Nguyen Van Thanh, former commander of the Cao Dai military forces, was killed just before dawn to day when a plastic charge went off at the Caodist monastery at Tayninh, Government mili tary spokesman said today.

title: Price Changes
description: The nation's No. 2 steel maker, the Bethlehem Steel Corporation, announced yester day price increases similar to those made by the United States Steel Corporation last Friday. None of the other major companies has yet joined this round of increases.

title: Catholic Slain in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 21 (UPI)A Roman Catholic was assassinated by a burst of gunfire through his kitchen window in Belfast's predominantly Protestant Sand hill Drive district tonight, end ing a day of relative quiet in Ulster, the police said.

title: Daria Chubaty Wed to F. C. Apter
description: Miss Dania Theresa Chubaty was married here last even ing to Fredric Charles Apter, who heads his own broker age firm of Fredric C. Apter & Co. Rabbi David Greenberg performed the ceremony at the Plaza, where the Rev. George Maloney, a Roman Catholic priest, blessed the couple.

title: Court Voids 5 Convictions In 1968 Convention Case
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21  The United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit today reversed the five convictions in the Chicago Seven conspiracy case, citing, among other rea sons, what it called Judge Julius J. Hoffman's antagonis tic courtroom demeanor.

title: Minority Gap Is Found in Top TV Jobs
description: Fifty per cent of the coun try's commercial television sta tions employ no members of racial minority groups in pro fessional capacities, according to a study released yesterday by the Office df Communica tion of the United Church of Christ.

title: REPUTED MAFIOSO INDICTED 6TH TIME
description: A Kings County grand jury yesterday indicted Paul Vario Sr., a reputed Mafia leader, on charges of conspiring with three other men to strip a 30 foot motorboat of $6,000 worth of equipment, sink it and col lect $7,100 for the loss.

title: PUBLIC TV TO LIMIT APOLLO 17 COVERAGE
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting and the Public Broadcasting Service have de cided against massive coverage of the Apollo 17 moon walks by the nation's 228 public televis ion stations. They agreed to limit coverage to the highlights only.

title: MARTIN A. BLUM
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 21  Martin A. Blum, former promo tion director of Saturday Re view died Monday at the Great er Freehold Area Hospital. His age was 36.

title: A Fusion Mayor?
description: Although the term fusion has won acceptability in New York City, Governor Rockefeller's suggestion for a fusion candidate for Mayor would be detrimental to the democratic process.

title: Apollo 17's Crew Holds DressRehearsal Liftoff
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Nov. 21 (Reuters)The Apollo 17 rocket and spacecraft, sched uled for a liftoff on Dec. 6 on a moon mission, success fully concluded a major dress rehearsal tonight.

title: RATE OF INFLATION CONTINUES HIGHER THAN NIXON GOAL
WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The more the American people get, the more they seem to grumble about what they don't get, but at least this Thanks giving even most professional grum blers would probably admit that the world is now in better shape than it was a year ago.

title: Patterson Gets Fight Offer
description: BAYONNE, N.J., Nov. 21 (AP) Floyd Patterson, the former heavyweight champion, has been offered a $15,000 guaran tee to fight Chuck Wepner of New Jersey, Willie Gilzenberg, the promoter, said today.

title: Personalities: Hines Joins Track Pros
description: Jimmy Hines, who had trouble catching passes as a pro football player, will try to cash in professionally on his track and field talents. Hines, the 1968 Olympic 100 meter dash recordholder, yesterday became one of five more worldclass stars to join the professional International Track Association.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The 37yearold owner of a West 42d Street sex oriented bookstore has been found not guilty of wholesale promotion and distribution of hardcore pornographic films following a jury trial that began Oct. 11.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article by Prof. Cecil Hammer ton (OpEd Nov. 4), in which he termed Gen. William Tecumseh Sher man a malevolent genius, does not particularly redound to his credit as a military historian.

title: Consumer Price Index Up 0.2% In New York Region in October
description: Higher housing costs, were a major factor in pushing the Consumer Price Index up two tenths of 1 per cent in the New York metropolitan area last month, the Bureau of La bor Statistics reported yester day.

title: EUGENE D. TOWLER
description: SUN CITY CENTER, Fla., Nov. 21Eugene D. Towler, a former advertising man in New York, died today of leukemia in a nursing home in Braden ton. He was 77 years old and had been living in this com munity, near Tampa, in retire ment.

title: Laser Use Permits Fine Measurement Of Speed of Light
description: The speed of light, one of the most basic factors in na ture, has been measured to an accuracy about 100 times great er than before, according to the National Bureau of Standards.

title: Connecticut Beaten
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 21 Goals by Dick McEvoy and Bill Frost in the last half gave Brown a 42 victory over Con necticut in a first  round N.C.A.A. regional soccer play off game today. It was Frost's Second tally.

title: PLYWOOD OFFICIAL DEFENDS INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  The American Plywood Asso ciation asserted today that the Federal Government's system of price controls, as applied to our highly diversified indus try, has been both inequitable and unworkable.

title: News of Skiing
description: Operators of ski resorts from Maine to New Jersey will be competing for atten tion tomorrow with the home dining room and Tom Tur key. More than two dozen operators plan to have their ski lifts humming.

title: NEWSMEN AT C.B.S. WILL STAY ON JOBS
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System yesterday won a court fight to prevent its newsmen from following a performers' union order to honor picket lines of the striking technicians' union.

title: KNICKS SET BACK BLAZERS, 10880
description: In a situation where a less efficient performance would have been understandable, the New York Knicks cruised past the Portland Trail Blazers, 108 80, at Madison Square Garden last night for their 17th victory in 20 games.

title: Sales and Prof its At Gimbel Brothers And Grant Advance
Connecticut Beaten
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 21 Goals by Dick McEvoy and Bill Frost in the last half gave Brown a 42 victory over Con necticut in a first  round N.C.A.A. regional soccer play off game today. It was Frost's second tally.

title: The Ghost Guard at West Point Gathers Under the Moon (Part 2)
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 21  The moon hung high over the Hudson last night, and the statue of General MacArthur brooded above the Plains. An apparition did not appear in Room 4714 of the 47th Division Barracks, although people who say they believed in it did.

title: About Motor Sports
description: While the giants of Ameri can tire manufacturing, Goodyear and Firestone, con tinue concentrating on highly sophisticated race tires for the Indianapolis, stockcar and international roadrac ing circuits, B. F. Goodrich has found a more modest entry into racing that satis fies its own ob jectives. With em phasis on radial street tires, the company has just expanded its sponsorship of road races for the Baby Grand class of subcompact sedans and the international Motor Sports Association. Good rich is ?? up $135,000 for 10 races in 1973.

title: Strauss Feels His Image Hurts His Chance to Head Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 Robert Strauss said today that his image as a Texas conserva tive and favorite of anti McGovern labor leadersan image he considers unfairhas nearly eliminated his chances for the Democratic party chair manship.

title: Catholic Bishops' Secretary Is Named Archbishop
description: The Most Rev. Joseph L. Bernardin, general secretary of the National Conference of Catholic Bishops and of the United States Catholic Confer ence, has been named by Pope Paul VI to be Archbishop of Cincinnati. He succeeds Arch bishop Paul F. Leibold, who died last June 1.

title: Elton John, Rock Singer, Decorates His Performance
description: There are rock singers and musicians who believe that art is enough, standing un adorned onstage, paying hom age to their material as if it were the latest tablet down from the mountain. Not Elton John.

title: Reds Release Merritt
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 21 (AP) Jim Merritt, two years ago a 20game winner but last sea son a minor league pitcher, was released by the Cincinnati Reds to Indianapolis of the American Association today. The left hander is 28 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The University of Delaware, which was undefeated in 10 games this season, was named the winner of the Lambert Cup for the fifth time in a row yesterday. It was the eighth time the Blue Hens had been selected for the honor awarded each college football season to the best team in Division II. Delaware will receive the cup Dec. 7 at the annual Lambert awards luncheon at the Hotel Commodore. Delaware accumulated 80 points in the voting; Bridgeport, also unbeaten in 10 games, and Middle bury, undefeated in eight, were second and third, respectively.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)The Securities and Exchange Commission today placed a 10day suspension on trading in the securities of the Stirling Homex Corpora tion, one of the nation's biggest home builders. The sus pension was ordered because of the unavailability of ade quate and accurate information concerning the company, its operations, and financial condition, the S.E.C. said.

title: Blues Subdue Canucks, 42; Evans Scores Winning Goal
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 21 (AP) Chris Evans scored the win ning goal with 7:29 left tonight and teammate Mike Murphy connected into an open net with five seconds left in lead ing the St.Louis Blues to a 42 National Hockey League victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Orders Off in October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  New orders for durable goods dipped slightly in October from the record September level, but remained higher than in any pripr month, the Commerce De partment reported today on the basis of preliminary estimates.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: For the second consecutive session, stocks on the Ameri can Stock Exchange yesterday outperformed those traded on the overthecounter market.

title: Parade Time in the City
description: Macy's 46th annual Thanksgiving Day parade will start at 9:30 A.M. tomorrow at Central Park West at 77th Street. It will finish about noon in front of the store at 34th Street and Seventh Avenue.

title: Islam Retaining a Strong Grip on the Uzbeks
description: TASHKENT, U.S.S.R., Nov. 1 When the director of Tash kent's large Pedagogical Insti tute died a couple of years ago, officials proposed, to ac cord him the honor of burial in the Communist cemetery re served for outstanding figures. His family refused, insisting on burial in the Uzbek cemetery with a Moslem mullah chanting prayers.

title: Galactica Puts Off Opening
description: Via Galactica, the new space musical set in the year 2972, postponed its opening at the Uris Theater from yester day until Tuesday. A spokesman for the show attributed the de lay to the need for more time to perfect some of the produc tion's technical aspects. Only openingnight tickets will be honored Tuesday. Tickets bear ing that date will be exchanged for later performances.

title: Bulls Down Rockets, 113105
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21 (UPI)  Jerry Sloan scored a season high 31 points tonight to lead the Chicago Bulls to a 113105 victory over the Houston Rock ets, their 10th success in the last 12 contests.

title: SAIGON ASSUMING A JANUARY TRUCE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 21The South Vietnamese Gov ernment is carrying out a pro gram of political indoctrination and organization in expecta tion of a ceasefire about the beginning of January. That is the date Government planning seems to assume the shooting will stop and the political strug gle will begin.

title: Repertory Theater Battles Deficit Woes
description: Deficit is a way of life at the Repertory Theater of Lin coln Centeras it is with many other companies in the performing arts. But this year it has become a crisis, pre cipitating the curtailment of the season in the Forum Theater, the resignation of Jules Irving as the artistic director of the company and the jeopardizing, of the sea son in the Vivian Beaumont Theater.

title: Padgett Wins Golf Playoff In First Pro Tournament
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C., Nov. 21 (AP)Don Padg ett, a 23yearold rookie play ing in his first professional event, birdied the first two playoff holes today to win the $1,000 first prize in the Sea Pines satellite tournament to the Heritage Golf Classic start ing Thursday.

title: L.I.U.'S BOOTERS BEAT N.Y.U., 21
description: Long Island University post ed a 21 victory over New York University in the second sud dendeath overtime in the open ing round of the National Col legiate Athletic Association re gional soccer tournament yes terday at Columbia's Baker Field.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The General Electric Com pany has received a $174.5 million Navy contract for the design, development and manu facture of nuclear submarine components.

title: DR. PHILIP WILLNER
description: Dr. Philip Willner, director of orthopedic surgery at the Crippled Children's Hospital in Newark, died Monday in the New York Hilton Hotel. He was 62 years old and lived at 30 Dorison Drive, Short Hills, N. J.

title: Harvard Professor Jailed In Pentagon Papers Case
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21A Federal judge today ordered Prof. Samuel L. Popkin of Harvard to begin serving a sentence for contempt of a Federal grand jury. The judge said that there is no immunity for either scholars or newsmen in testifying before a grand jury.

title: Alexander's Sales Up but Net Slumps
description: EATONTOWN, N. J., Nov. 21Shareholders of Alexan der's, Inc., one of the New York area's largest retailers, were told here today that the chain's net income plummeted about 60 per cent in the firsts fiscal quarter ended Oct. 21 compared with the yearearli er level. Sales in the period, however, were up 9.4 per cent.

title: Moody's 137 Wins in Texas For Second Victory in Row
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Orville Moody of Lago Vista, Tex., the 1969 United States Open champion, was a repeat winner today in Professional Golf Manage ment's third weekly $30,000 tournament with a 36hole to tal of 137 and first prize of $5,000.

title: Lynch to See Heath Friday
description: LONDON, Nov. 21  Prime Minister Lynch will call on Prime Minister Heath here on Friday. The suggestion for the meeting came from Mr. Lynch.

title: SHORT INTEREST UP ON BIG BOARD
Cuba Negotiations Expected to Begin Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  State Department officials said today that indirect negotiations on an agreement to prevent the hijacking of airliners to Cuba were expected to open in Ha vana on Thursday.

title: Ground Is Broken in Brownsville For U. S.Aided Housing Project
description: A rebirth for Brownsville, said to be the most devastated neighborhood in the country, began yesterday with the break ing of ground for a $42million Model Cities lowincome hous ing project.

title: L.I.U.'S BOOTERS BEAT N.Y.U., 21
description: Long Island University post ed a 21 victory over New York University in the second sud dendeath overtime in the open ing round of the National Col legiate Athletic Association re gional soccer tournament yes terday at Columbia's Baker Field.

title: YOUNG POETS READ FROM OWN WORKS
description: The Yale Series of Younger Poets, a competition open to all poets under 40 who have not had a book published, cele brated a nonroundnumbered anniversary, its 52d, Tuesday evening at the Poetry Center of the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. before a goodly, nonsquare au dience.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The issue in Gaza is not whether garbage will be collected in the refu gee camps or even who will do the collecting. It is whether the Arabs must be forced to supervise their own destruction as a people. No one should understand this better than those Is raelis who witnessed the complete moral breakdown of European Jews when Jews were persuaded to man all the petty bureaucracies of the Nazi death camps. How better to subjugate a conquered people.

title: Workers in Newark Back on Housing Job
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21  The police escorted four black laborers past more than 300 demonstrators onto the Ka waida Towers construction site today with relative ease as the violent confrontation predicted by Assemblyman Anthony Im periale failed to materialize.

title: REPORTER ON COAST WINS JAILING DELAY
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21 (AP) William Farr, a reporter for The Los Angeles Times, was ordered to jail today but then won an unexpected reprieve from the judge who originally cited him for contempt.

title: City's Own Study Urges Action In SingleRoom Welfare Crisis
description: A confidential study, com pleted eight months ago for the Mayor's office and the city's Human Resources Admin istration but never made public, calls for legislation and a pro gram of construction to deal with the problem of welfare residents in singleroom occu pancy hotels and similar hous ing.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 21for More than 50 years, high school crosscountry runners have been competing for a number of state titles without being able to decide who's really the best.

title: Fed Proposes Plan To Aid Small Banks On Seasonal Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 The Federal Reserve Board pro posed today a change in its discount regulations to provide additional help to the hundreds of smaller banks whose depos its or loan demands have a strong seasonal element.

title: Archibald Sets Mark For Assists
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 21 (AP)Nate Archibald set a National Basketball Associa tion record for assists in consecutive games as the streaking Kansas CityOmaha Kings defeated the Phoenix Suns, 10196, tonight for their fifth straight victory and ninth in 10 games.

title: Alcoa Fills New Post
description: John L. Fleming has been named to the new post of vice presidentmill products at the Aluminum Company of Amer ica. Previously he was vice presidentsales for mill prod ucts. He will be responsible for mill product manufacturing and sales, government marketing and export sales.

title: Moody's 137 Wins in Texas For Second Victory in Row
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Orville Moody of Lego Vista, Tex., the 1969 United States Open champion, was a repeat winner today in Professional Golf Manage ment's third weekly $30,000 tournament with a 36hole to tal of 137 and first prize of $5,000.

title: Advertising:
description: For the last 15 years the Public Relations Society of America has wanted a film that would explain what pub lic relations was all about. The problem was that the members couldn't agree on just what it was.

title: 2 Arts Groups Join To Seek More Aid As Resources Ebb
description: Concerned over the financial plight of nonprofit arts institu tions, the Associated Councils of the Arts and the Partnership for the Arts have joined forces to gain wider Federal and local Government support for the arts.

title: Ads for L.I. School Found Deceptive
description: The Sands Point Country Day SchoolFetsch Academy has engaged in deceptive and misleading advertising and has agreed to stop represen tative itself as a school for gifted children or listing the honorary academic degrees from unaccredited schools of its director, Marie L. Fetsch, the Attorney General's Bureau of Consumer Frauds announced yesterday.

title: Volkswagen Owners Urged To Check Windshield Wiper
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N. J., Nov. 21 (AP)Owners of Volks wagens made between 1949 and 1969 were cautioned today by the manufacturer that wind shieldwiper performance had been impaired on some of the cars.

title: Foster: There's No Way Ali Can Dethrone Frazier
description: STATELINE, Nev., Nov. 21 (UPI)Sporting a rare cut over his left eye, Muhammad All de clared tonight he was the un crowned champion of the world after stopping Bob Foster.

title: Rockets Sink Stars, 106100
description: DENVER, Nov. 21 (AP) Marv Roberts scored 10 of his 19 points in the last quarter tonight as the Denver Rockets defeated the Utah Stars, 106100.

title: Prosecutor Charges Defendant Was Fixer of Narcotics Cases
description: A prosecutor declared in Federal Court here yesterday that taperecorded evidence in dicated that a bribery defend ant was the fixer of nar cotics cases involving assistant district attorneys and State Su preme Court justices.

title: Action Director Reported Planning to Resign Dec. 31
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) Joseph H. Blatchford, direc tor of Action, will resign ef fective Dec. 31, a spokesman said today. He may enter the Los Angeles mayoral race.

title: City's Own Study Urges Action In SingleRoom Welfare Crisis
description: A confidential study, com pleted eight months ago for the Mayor's office and the city's Human Resources Admin istration but never made public, calls for legislation and a pro gram of construction to deal with the problem of welfare residents in singleroom occu pancy hotels and similar hous ing.

title: Nixon Order Fails to Ease Access to Classified Data
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 President Nixon's pledge to lift the veil of secrecy from needlessly classified official pa pers is being throttled by bu reaucratic confusion, timidity and prohibitive costs, in the opinion of historians, other scholars and newsmen.

title: About Motor Sports
description: While the giants of Ameri can tire manufacturing, Goodyear and Firestone, con tinue concentrating on highly sophisticated race tires for the Indianapolis, stockcar and international roadrac ing circuits, B. F. Goodrich has found a more modest entry into racing that satis fies its own ob jectives. With em phasis on radial street tires, the company has just expanded its sponsorship of road races for the Baby Grand class of subcompact sedans and the International Motor Sports Association. Good rich is putting up $135,000 for 10 races in 1973.

title: Pistons Win in Overtime
description: DETROIT, Nov. 21 (AP)  Bob Lanier's 3point play with 65 seconds remaining in over time and a basket by Dave Bing 30 seconds later enabled the Detroit Pistons to defeat the Atlanta Braves tonight, 113110.

title: NEWSWOMEN NAME WINNERS OF AWARDS
description: The Newswomen's Club of New York yesterday announced the winners of its 1972 Front Page Awards for outstanding achievement.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: U.S.Bound Drug Cargo Seized Off Montego Bay
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Nov. 21 (Reuters)A narcotics raid on a shrimp boat off Montego Bay has uncovered a seventon shipment of ma rijuana, believed to be the largest single shipment des tined for the United States that has ever been seized.

title: Bullets Crush Braves
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 21 (AP)  The Baltimore Bullets hit 62 per cent of their shots in the second half to crush the Buffalo Braves, 12488, in the National Basketball Associa tion tonight.

title: Moscow Circus Comes to the Garden
description: The Moscow Circus arrived at the Felt Forum last night for a sixweek stand and proved that Juvenal and his fellow ancient Romans were as least half right in main taining that what people want most is bread and cir cuses. Perhaps members of the Jewish Defense League, who picketed outside, and a group of youths who momen tarily disrupted one team of performers inside and were quickly hustled into the night, didn't particularly want this circus. But the daz zling array of acrobats, aer ialists, jugglers, horses, bears and other fauna were as satisfying to the eye as, say, Russian bread is to the stomach.

title: Gillespie's Thrust Settles an Old Club Into Uptown Stride
description: The venerable Dizzy Gilles pie and the venerable Half Note Club on Monday night both showed in new surround ings how the old class can linger. The club, a wellknown Greenwich Village showcase for bop artists through the 1960's, moved uptown last month to a warm, spacious, but not fancy room on West 54th Street.

title: 680 Foreign Correspondents Find New York the World's Hottest Beat
description: New York is the hottest news beat in the world. The locals may not know it, but editors and their audiences abroad do, and at enormous expense they have posted some 680 reporters to cover the city and, from this van tage point, the United States and the Western Hemisphere.

title: SOUTH KOREA VOTE BACKS PRESIDENT
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Wednes day, Nov. 22South Koreans, voting in a closely supervised referendum, yesterday ratified President Park Chung Hee's moves to exercise almost com plete power for an unlimited time.

title: Film Shown at Pier Crime Hearing
description: A 45minute motion picture taken by a Waterfront Com mission agent and condens ing 11 days of comings and goings of underworld figures at 100 Madison Street on the Lower East Side was shown yesterday on the second day of a commission hearing in the case of Maintenance Associates, Inc.

title: Business Briefs
