description: TOKYO, Nov. 21Tokyo stock prices climbed again sharply to a new high today, breaking the record set last week. The local DowJones index closed at 4,618.27 yen, up 27.20 from yesterday, on a turnover of 430 million shares.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Christmas is coming (City Hall will get a 56foot fir), but not until after Thanks giving (for which holiday a Penthouse magazine model crowned a turkey at a pet show yesterday.) In addition, the Salvation Army and the Volunteers of America began their seasonal fund drives to aid the needy, and there were banquets in schools and set tlement houses all over the city.

title: Business Briefs
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Nov. 21 (UPI)The Alliance Tool and Die Corporation of Rochester announced today that it had signed a $7million contract with the Soviet Union to build a consumertableware factory in Kiev. The agree ment was reached Nov. 14 in New York City after nego tiations with officials of Stankoimport, a division of the Soviet Ministry of Foreign Trade, the concern said.

title: Brink's Workers Out
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Nov. 21 (AP)The 11 fulltime employes of the Worcester branch of Brink's, Inc., remained on strike today for the second day, but there were conflicting reports on the issues separating the negotiators.

title: SCRIBNER DECRIES CANARSIE DISPUTE
description: City School Chancellor Har vey B. Scribner declared last night that the understandable desire of parents in Canarsie or elsewhere for quality schools for their youngsters cannot be achieved legitimately by excluding minoritygroup chil dren from the same op portunity.

title: DISCIPLINE CRISIS IS FEARED IN NAVY
description: Many Navy officers, active and retired, believe their serv ice is in a disciplinary crisis arising in part from what they view as permissiveness and from the racialequality edicts of Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., Chief of Naval Operations.

title: David Chamber Ensemble Plays
description: Elder citizens may remem ber when chamber music referred largely to the per formance of string quartets by, not unreasonably, string quartets. So far as the con cert hall was concerned that certainly tended to be true, though there always did exist pockets of sophistication in which one could hear talk of trios and quintets and such recondite matters.

title: Two Women Injured in Fire At 5th Ave. Office Building
description: Two cleaning women work ing at a Fifth Avenue office building were injured last night when they jumped to a 16th floor setback from one floor up in an effort to escape a thick blanket of smoke from an elevator fire.

title: Notes on People
description: Do you want to accept Jesus Christ as your saviour? asked the Rev. Billy Graham of an audience estimated in the tens of thousands in Ko hima, the capital of the heav ily Christian Indian state of Nagaland, which borders Burma. The audience, crowded on a ballfield, heard Mr. Gra ham's words translated into 18 tribal dialectssaid to be a record for the North Caro lina evangelistand most of them stood up as a way of saying yes, they did accept. Mr. Graham and his Crusade for Christ had government permission to proselytize, and the evangelist was allowed to bring with him to Kohima a piano player from Silver Spring, Md., and a singer from Pittsburgh.

title: Israeli Troupe Due Jan. 4
description: The Grand Music Hall of Is rael, a show by Jonathan Kar mon, will open a twoweek en gagement at the Felt Forum in Madison Square Garden on Jan. 4. The company of 36 is made up of outstanding young per formers from Israel. Hy Ein horn and Madison Square Gar den Productions are the spon sors.

title: Padgett Wins Golf Playoff In First Pro Tournament
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C., Nov. 21 (AP)Don Padg ett, a 23yearold rookie play ing in his first professional event, birdied the first two playoff holes today to win the $1,000 first prize in the Sea Pines satellite tournament to the Heritage Golf Classic start ing Thursday.

title: SPECK RESENTENCED TO SERVE 400 YEARS
description: PEORIA, III., Nov. 21 (UPI) A criminal court judge re sentenced Richard Speck today to eight consecutive terms of 50 to 150 years for the murders of eight Chicago nurses and ex pressed hope that he would lie confined to the state peni tentiary for life.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Two suspects were named yesterday in last week's bank robbery in Kendall Park, in which a janitor was killed and $66,000 taken. The suspects, both at large, were charged with the killing of Henry Jackson, 64 years old, of Edison and the robbery of the National Bank of New Jersey.

title: Payne, ExHawk, Indicted
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Nov. 21 (AP)A former Atlanta Hawks basketball player, Tom Payne, was indicted today by the Cobb County grand jury on charges of rape and aggravated sodomy. Payne, previously convicted of rape in Atlanta, was accused of assaulting a 42yearold wo man in the backyard of her northeast Cobb County home.

title: Senator Jackson Asks NATO To Influence the Arms Talks
description: BONN, Nov. 21  Senator Henry M. Jackson urged the European members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organi zation today to take a greater part in the next round of dis cussions on limiting strategic arms.

title: The Right Track
description: Senators Hartke of Indiana and Weicker of Connecticut are on the right track toward the solution, or at least the easing, of a number of critical regional and national problems with their proposal for a federally financed superspeed railroad line connecting Boston, New York and Washington.

title: Autumn on a Fast Freight
description: GOODMAN, Wis.The ruffed grouse lurk in the river bottoms where blue spruce and cedar grow out of wet black earth. The birds drum up ahead of hunters just a heartbeat past the shotgun pellets that reach for them.

title: James Chestnut, 39, Dies; Sydenham Hospital Head
description: James D. Chestnut, acting executive director of Sydenham Hospital, died of a stroke Mon day in his apartment at 15620 Riverside Drive West. His age was 39.

title: Funds' Net Redemptions Slowed a Bit in October
description: The problem of net redemp tions continued to plague the mutualfund business during October for the ninth consecu tive month, industry figures showed yesterday.

title: Equity Financing
description: Directors of Cenco, Inc., have authorized pur chase by the company of up to 600,000 if its common shares from time to time over the next six months. The purchase program is designed to provide shares for the conversion of outstand ing preferred stock and the company's 4 per cent convertible subordinated notes. The company's stock closed at 23, up 1 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: PLYWOOD SLUMPS BY DAILY LIMIT
description: Plywood futures tumbled sharply yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade following word that the Price Commission was investigating a sharp rise in prices of lumber.

title: BAR PRESSES ROLE ON GOUT CHOICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  The American Bar Association is seeking a broader and more significant role in advising Presidents on their nominations for the Supreme Court.

title: FULL INTEGRATION URGED IN BUFFALO
description: A desegregation plan calling for the busing of more than 40,000 black and white school children in Buffalo was pro posed yesterday by the State Department of Education, which has given the Buffalo school board until early next year to react to the plan.

title: Project to Dam Carolina River To Flush Out Pollution Is Fading
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21A plan to use the water of the clean, upper New River in North Carolina to flush out the polluted Kanawha River at Charleston, W. Va., 260 miles away, is apparently going to be discarded.

title: CAN MERGER RULING BY E.E.C. OPPOSED
description: LUXEMBOURG, Nov. 21 (Reuters)The European Court of Justice has been advised by its advocategeneral to over turn a ruling by the European Economic Community's Com mission that the Continental Can Company divest some of its recentlyacquired European interests.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Oct. 26 news story entitled Housing Study: High Rise  High Crime reports data which may be ill conceived, dangerously misleading and based on highly arbitrary examples. Its conclusions, sponsored by a dis tinguished university with grants from the Federal Government, could inhibit logical city growth everywhere.

title: Monday Night Fights
description: PhiladelphiaSammy Goss, 129 pounds, Trenton, N. J., outpointed Jose Luis Lopez, 130, Durango, Mexico, 10 rounds.

title: VIENTIANE TALKS REMAIN STALLED
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 21. Delegations of the Laotian Gov ernment and the Communist led Pathet Lao held their sixth weekly peace negotiating ses sion today, after which each side accused the other of wait ing for a settlement in Vietnam before getting down to serious discussion.

title: AN AIRFARE RACKET DETECTED IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Nov. 21 (AP)  Security officials at London's Heathrow Airport said today they had uncovered a racket in airline tickets that was leaving scores of homebound American young people stranded in Britain.

title: Dance: A Stravinsky Retrospective
description: In the heat and haste of last summer's Stravinsky Festival, the New York City Ballet paid its very special homage to its own very spe cial composer, Igor Stravin sky. Now these ballets that comprised the festival, or at least a large number of them, are being brought into. the general repertory. This could be a crucial mistake. It is providing an enormous amount of Stravinsky music, a dangerous imbalance, I would suggest, for any reper tory, but presumably this will be sorted out in time.

title: Duke Is Routed, 90
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) Howard University broke loose in the second half today and crushed Duke, 90, in the first round of the N.C.A.A. Southern regional soccer tour nament.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21Secre tary of State Paul J. Sherwin comes up for sentencing tomor row on bribery and conspiracy convictions amid State House speculation that this will prompt his longexpected resig nation.

title: NEWSMEN AT C.B.S. WILL STAY ON JOBS
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System yesterday won a court fight to prevent its newsmen from following a performers' union order to honor picket lines of the striking technicians' union.

title: MISTRIAL IS ASKED IN ELLSBERG CASE
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21 (UPI)Attorneys for Daniel Ellsberg filed motions for a mis trial today in the Pentagon Papers case on the ground that Vice President Agnew had made highly inflammatory remarks about the affair on national television.

title: CHARLES C. GALE
description: DETROIT, Nov. 21  Charles C. Gale, treasurer of Parke, Davis & Co., the pharmaceu tical concern, died today in New Grace Hospital, where he was recovering from minor surgery. He was 58 years old and lived in surburban Brighton.

title: Penn, Penn State Win
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 21 (AP) Penn State defeated St. Jo seph's, 20, and Penn downed Drexel, 40, in the N.C.A.A. soccer regionals today.

title: HULL CALLS RULING N.H.L. HARASSMENT
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 21 (UPI) Bobby Hull of the Winnipeg Jets, who was forced out of tonight's game with the Hous ton Aeros by a Chicago judge, termed the action part of con tinued harassment he was receiving from the National Hockey League.

title: CARRIER SKIPPER TELLS OF TENSION
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 21The skipper of the aircraft carrier Constellation today told Con gressional investigators that he had called off maneuvers at sea and beached 137 crew mem bers to avoid open racial riot ing and possible sabotage aboard the 81,000ton warship.

title: CHINA DEVELOPING RADIO SATELLITE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21A Chinese scientist said today that his country was seeking to develop communications sat ellites, but had no plans for putting men in orbit.

title: Angelo State in Bowl
description: ARDMORE, Okla., Nov. 21 (AP)Angelo State of San An gelo, Tex., will meet South western State College of Weath erford, Okla., the host school, in the first Ardmore Shrine Bowl football game Dec. 9, of ficials announced today.

title: Atlanta Proves Tough Foe
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 21The At lanta Flames, a new expansion team of young hustlers in the National Hockey League, gave the proud New York Rangers a handful of trouble tonight, making the New Yorkers work extra hard for a 31 victory.

title: STREET CRIME OFF, MURPHY DECLARES
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy and Mayor Lindsay released crime statistics yes terday that the Commissioner said showed people are defi nitely safer in the streets of New York than they were a year ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The coattails didn't stretch very far because they were never very long. Now that Mr. Wallace has won his great victory we might examine how his surrogate, Mr. Nixon, really won. Your paper (and all the others) speak of a massive Democratic defection. Everyone deserted McGovern except the blacks, and many of them bought Nixon. Very interesting, but my arith metic doesn't add up to that answer.

title: Israelis Hit, Syria Says
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 21 A Syrian military spokesman said today that Israeli forces suffered heavy casualties in the daylong air, tank and artillery battles along the Golan heights ceasefire line.

title: Operation Tiger
description: Two days after he took office as the first Prime Min ister of Bangladesh, Sheik Mujibur Rahman banned the killing of the Bengal tiger and the export of its skin. Considering the dire state of the new nation, the act was a lofty recognition of the interrelationship of all forms of life. But unless a campaign undertaken by the Government of India and the World Wildlife Fund is a striking success, the last Bengal tiger will nevertheless have vanished from the earth before another decade has passed.

title: ExDolphin Sues N.F.L. Clubs Over Injury Compensations
description: MIAMI, Nov. 21 (UPI)  A former Miami Dolphin offensive lineman, Maxie Williams, has filed a class action suit in Fed eral Court here against all 26 clubs in the National Football League for $200million.

title: Pacers Top Tams On McGinnis Shot At End,121 to 120
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 21 (AP) George McGinnis scored 42 points, including a jump shot with one second left, to give the Indiana Pacers a 121120 American Basketball Associa tion victory over the Memphis Tams tonight.

title: I.R.A. Leader Arrested in Dublin Denounces Court Action and Promises to Continue Fast
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 21  Amid Irish Republican Army demon strations, Sean MacStiofain faced a Dublin court today and denounced Government efforts to jail him.

title: Man in the News
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 21Some see a certain irony in the jailing of Samuel Lewis Popkin. A specialist in Vietnamese village life, he continued to deal with Gov ernment experts despite his growing personal opposition to the war. He was once in vited to the White House to discuss Vietnam with Henry A. Kissinger, a for mer colleague at Harvard. And al though he would certainly not be considered a conservative, he has earned the enmity of radical students because, he says, he has not been a dogmatic critic of American policy.

title: Kissinger and Tho Confer for 4 Hours
description: PARIS, Nov. 21The Vietnam ceasefire talks continued to day, with no indication of what progress was being made.

title: 3 From Washington Post Win Award for Reporting
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP)  The Drew Pearson Founda tion announced today the selec tion of three reporters from The Washington Post to receive the $6,000 Drew Pearson prize for excellence in investigative re porting for 1972.

title: GOVERNOR MEETS NIXON AT RETREAT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  The White House appeared to confirm today what Governor Rockefeller has been indicating that he will not be a Cabinet member in the second Nixon Administration.

title: H.R.A. COMPUTER TO CUT ROLLS 14%
description: The City Human Resources Administrator, Jule M. Sugar man, announced plans yester day to start using a centralized computer to close 80,000 wel fare cases during November, December and January as a re sult of special eligibilitycon trol projects.

title: 34 Chicanos Held on Coast In Blocking College Doors
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Nov. 21 (AP)Thirtyfour Mexican American protesters16 women and 18 menwere arrested to day after they blocked all en trances to the University of Santa Clara administration building and locked the Roman Catholic institution's president in his office, the university re ported.

title: Painters Oust a Fighter of Corruption.
description: Frank Schonfeld, a painters' union official who has earned a reputation as a tough cor ruption figher, has been ousted from his union post by local officials who charged him with giving work jurisdiction to an other union.

title: ISRAEL AND SYRIA FIGHT FOR 8 HOURS ALONG TRUCE LINE
description: NAHAL AL, IsraeliOccupied Syria, Nov. 21The heaviest fighting in more than two years along the ceasefire line be tween Israel and Syria erupted today here on the Golan heights.

title: U.S. and Soviet Open New Arms Talks
description: GENEVA, Nov. 21The Unit ed States and the Soviet Union opened talks today on reaching a Comprehensive and perma nent agreement to limit strate gic nuclear weapons with both sides hopeful but aware of ma jor problems ahead.

title: CONTRACT CITED IN MURDER CASE
description: MINEOLA, Li., Nov. 21  Barry Glen Lipsky may have given the police a detailed ac count of the murder of Pat ricia Parks because he feared there was a contract out for his death, the defense implied today.

title: Ford in Spanish Talks
description: MADRID, Nov. 21  The Ford Motor Company is re ported to have begun negotia tions with the Spanish Govern ment for the establishment of a large manufacturing plant in Spain.

title: Duke Is Routed, 90
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) Howard University broke loose in the second half today and crushed Duke, 90, in the first round of the N.C.A.A. Southern regional soccer tour nament.

title: Workers in Newark Back on Housing Job
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21  The police escorted four black laborers past more than 300 demonstrators onto the Ka waida Towers construction site today with relative ease as the violent confrontation predicted by Assemblyman Anthony Im periale failed to materialize.

title: Day Dream Boy a Winner
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 21 (AP)Day Dream Boy drifted to a twolength victory in the $2,500 New Jersey Sports Writers Association pace at Freehold Raceway today and paid $7.60, $5.60 and $2.60. Day Dream Boy's time for the mile was 2:07 2/5.

title: Court Voids 5 Convictions In 1968 Convention Case
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21  The United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit today reversed the five convictions in the Chicago Seven conspiracy case, citing, among other rea sons, what it called Judge Julius J. Hoffman's antagonis tic courtroom demeanor.

title: Montreal Battens Down as Snow Season Looms
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 21In Montreal, which gets more snow every winter than any other big city in North America, nobody talks much about the weather, but every one seems to be doing some thing about it.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In your news article of Nov. 12 relating to trials of Croatian national ists in Zagreb there was mention of one defendant, Dragutin Scukanec, who was sentenced to four years under a charge of illegal, conspira torial contact with a foreign power.

title: 3 Rob Bishop Moore in Park
description: The Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr., the Episcopal Bishop of New York, has found that hold ing a high ecclesiastical office is no insurance against an ex perience many New Yorkers have enduredbeing held up in Central Park.

title: A Dance Solo, Cry, Given Special Elan By Judith Jamison
description: Since its first performance a year and a half ago, Cry has fastened itself firmly into the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater repertory and public popularity. Judith Jamison made a striking appearance in the work Tues day evening during this current season at City Center.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: 350 Years Later, Wild Turkeys Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 Federal wildlife experts be lieve that the nation's wild turkey population, rather than being decimated by the collective insults inflicted on the environment since the coming of the white man, is probably greater today than at any time since the first Thanksgiving Day.

title: Issue in Abeyance, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  A State Department official said today that the question of dip lomatic recognition of East Germany was not a live issue at this time.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I was very moved by President Nixon's Thanksgiving Proclamation, particularly because it was spoken with such solemnity and sincerity.

title: Evictions Ruled for CrimeRidden Hotel
description: State Supreme Court Justice Ivan Warner yesterday directed the owners of a hotel described by the police as one of the worst on the West Side to evict tenants allegedly engaged in prostitution, drug pushing and other criminal activities.

title: Freeman of M.I.T. to Head Eastman School of Music
description: Robert Freeman, an associate professor of music at the Mas sachusetts Institute of Technol ogy, has been named director of the University of Rochester's Eastman School of Music. The 37yearold conductor, pianist and musicologist succeeds Wal ter Hendl, who resigned last May.

title: 3,500 Pupils Kept at Home in East Harlem Protest
description: East Harlem parents kept 3, 500 elementary school children out of school yesterday  and forced the closing of one school  to protest the tranferring of 11 assistant principals and five teachers.

title: Chess: Redeploy Early? Of Course, But Beware the Sharp Riposte
description: In the Morphy Period of chess, more than 100 years ago, the emphasis in open ings was on rapid develop ment. Never move a piece twice in the opening was the orthodoxy of the day.

title: Tyranny by Picket
description: A judge's order has prevented the union to which Columbia Broadcasting System newsmen belong from forcing them off the air against their will, in a dispute that does not directly concern either them or their union. Salutary as is the court's action, it was based on special considerations of a technical nature that leave unchallenged a basic threat to the free flow of information.

title: Matlack Voted Rookie of Year
description: Jon Matlack of the New York Mets was voted the Na tional League's rookie of the year yesterday and joined Carlton Fisk of the Boston Red Sox at the head of base ball's freshman class of 1972.

title: $950,000 AWARDED FOR YONKERS FIRE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 22 A jury late last night awarded $950,000 to the survivors of eight children and three adults who died almost seven years ago in a fire at the Yonkers Jewish Community Center.

title: Shanker Charges Patronage in Hiring
description: Albert Shanker, president of the city teachers union, told a City Council committee yes terday that the Board of Edu cation had permitted a whole sale breakdown of the Civil Service system, with local dis tricts engaging in the patron age hiring of hundreds of teachers and specialists at widely varying salaries.

title: Interest Rates Edge Up For Home Mortgages
description: Interest rates on home mortgage loans increased slightly last month, the Fed eral Home Loan Bank Board reported yesterday. The ef fective interest rate on loans to purchase new homes, the Board said, was 7.62 per cent, up from 7.57 per cent in September.

title: Plane Crash Kills Two
description: WILLISVILLE, Ill., Nov. 22 (AP)A small plane crashed and burned on a strip mine property here last night. Its two occupants were killed. In vestigators said lights on the mine land may have led the pilot to believe it was an air field.

title: Norway Presses Hunt For Undersea Vessel
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 22 (Reuters)  Norway said to night that she would be pre pared to sink a submarine believed to be lurking in Nor wegian waterseven if it was a nuclear vessel belong ing to a major power.

title: LISBON URGED IN U.N. TO ACT ON COLONIES
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 22The Security Council, unan imously adopting a compromise resolution, called on Portugal today to enter into negotiations, leading toward selfdetermina tion and independence for her African territories of Angola, Mozambique, Guinea and Cape Verde.

title: U.S. to Check on Complaints Of Reverse Discrimination
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI) The United States Office for Civil Rights said today that it had appointed an ombudsman to investigate complaints of re verse discrimination against white male applicants for col lege and university jobs.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROME, Nov. 22 (Reuters)Bob Lutz of Los Angeles upset topseeded John Newcombe of Australia, 67, 76, 63, tonight in the first round of the $50,000 tournament winding up the World Championship Tennis summerautumn tour. Cliff Drysdale of South Africa avenged his defeats by Mark Cox in their last three matches, beating the British southpaw, 64, 63. The eightman playoff carries a $25,000 first prize. Newcombe had been favored because he won five of the 11 tournaments on the tour.

title: Markets Closed for Holiday
description: All domestic securities and commodities markets will be closed today for the Thanksgiv ing Day holiday. All banks and Government offices also will be closed. However, Canadian and London markets and banks will be open. Securities markets will be open for business tomorrow, but the New York Mercantile Exchange and the Chicago Mer cantile Exchange will remain, closed until Monday.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WENTWORTH LOCATION, N. H.When Adrian Bouchard of Hanover, N. H., and I parted beside a stream at 7 o'clock in the morning to begin a daylong hunt for deer, we were mildly optimis tic: a new snow, just right for tracking deer, had fallen the night before, and we had seen a few fresh signs of the animals in the general area.

title: HANOI TROOPS GET TRUCE DIRECTIVE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 22American intelligence officials report that Hanoi has ordered Communist forces in South Vietnam, both Vietcong and North Vietnamese, to ob serve a ceasefire scrupulously for the first 60 days after it goes into effect and to refrain from all acts of vengeance, as sassination and terrorism dur ing that period.

title: With All the Enthusiasm of an American in Paris, Saint Laurent Visits New York
description: The enfant terrible has turned into the grand old master of fashion, but he hardly looks it. Yves Saint Laurent has replaced his hornrimmed glasses with contact lenses that make his eyes seem bluer, shaved the beard he has been sporting the last few years, and shorn his shoulderlength locks. At 36 years of age, he could pass for a college boy or perhaps a graduate student.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Nov. 15 editorial supporting the decision of the Second Commit tee of the U.N. General Assembly to locate the new Environment Secre tariat in Nairobi deserves warm sup port.

title: U.N. Membership Foreseen
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 22Dr. Walter Gehlhoft, who heads West Germany's ob server mission here, predicted today that the two Germanys would be admitted to United Nations membership together when the General Assembly meets next September.

title: 2 Buffalo Youths Charged With StreetGang Slaying
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 22 (AP)  Two youths were arrested and charged with murder today fol lowing the streetgang slaying of one teenager and the wounding of another.

title: And for Dessert, Bah Humbug!
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass.That conse crated stereotype, the rile of Thanks giving, is at hand again with its threat to the civil liberties of those who, aware of the nature of family gatherings, would prefer to dine, per haps not frugally, but alone. The fam ily is not what it used to be. Its centripetal force has eroded in the competition of modern life until nowa days attendance at a family Thanks giving dinner comes about only as a matter of strained obligation or, still worse, of duress.

title: Scott Is Star and Director in Rage
NEW JERSEY
description: A hearing examiner for the State Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control has cautioned a Pennsauken bar against featuring topless dancers pending a decision on whether the performances were lewd and immoral.

title: State Police Quell Uprising at Prison At Concord, Mass.
description: CONCORD, Mass., Nov. 22 (AP)  About 75 riotequipped state policemen accompanied by a fourman team of sharp shooters entered Concord Re formatory this afternoon and put down a disturbance by in mates in E Building.

title: U.S. RULE BARRING SHIPS AND PLANES FROM CHINA ENDED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22In another move to improve rela tions with Peking, President Nixon today lifted the 22year old restriction on travel to China by United States ships and planes.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22The res ignation of James H. Blair, di rector of the state Division on Civil Rights, was accepted today by Attorney General George F. Kugler Jr.

title: 2 KOREAS TO TRACE DIVIDED FAMILIES
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 22The Red Cross societies of North Korea and South Korea held their fourth round of talks here today and agreed in prin ciple to set up a joint organi zation to trace divided Korean families as the first step in ef forts to reunite them.

title: Helicopter Is Used to Rescue a Steeplejack After He Falls Into a Silo
description: One steeplejack died and another escaped serious injury yesterday when they plummet ed from their rigging inside a 180foot high cement storage silo in Queens.

title: Personal Finance
description: Parents, grandparents and others preparing to set up custody accounts to hold se curities for children under the Uniform Gifts to Minors acts of various states may want to reconsider.

title: Screen: Four Nights of a Dreamer
description: Four Nights of a Dreamer, which opened yesterday at the Art Theater, was shown at the ninth New York Film Festival. The following is from Roger Greenspun's re view, which appeared Oct. 9, 1971, in The New York Times.

title: U.S. Jury Begins Investigation Of 1971 Harlem Camp Program
description: The 1971 summer camp pro gram set up for disadvantaged Harlem youths by the Harlem East Harlem Model Cities agency at a cost of $265,000 in Federal funds is under in vestigation by a Federal grand jury.

title: BIG BOARD RALLY GATHERS STEAM
description: The stock market staged an impressive preThanksgiving rally yesterday and closed at record levels for the second day in a row. The DowJones in dustrial average rose 7.29 to 1,020.54.

title: About Pro Football
description: Four of the 18 teams left in contention for the National Football League's eight play off berths are in action to day when the Jets play the Lions in Detroit (Channel 4, noon) and the 49ers meet the Cowboys in Dallas (Channel 2, 3:30 P.M.). Both home teams are favored by a touch down. The Giants are the choice over the Eagles here on Sunday. Televised con tests that day will be Green Bay at Wash ington (Channel 2, 1 P.M.) and Kansas City at Oakland Channel 4, 4 P.M.). The Mon day night game is St. Louis at Miami (Channel 7, 9 P.M.).

title: Broken Penn Central Rail Holds Up Evening Trains
description: A half dozen northbound commuter trains out of Grand Central Terminal were delayed during the evening rush hour yesterday when an express rail broke on the Penn Central line north of 56th Streets.

title: Honeycomb' Feeds on Fantasies
description: Not long after the night when his pretty young wife playfully sets fire to his hair, Peter, a reserved and successful businessman, agrees to take part in her elaborate, slightly frenzied personality games. Gradually her family's heirloomed junk in the basement begins appearing in every room of their sterile concrete-contemporary mansion. They draw the shades and lock the doors against the neighbors. Their happy complicity gives way to shared hostility. And the games increase in feverish intensity, until reality replaces fantasyand all too soon the terrible dare becomes tragic denouement.All too soon, but not soon enough for meat least in Carlos Saura's "Honeycomb," the latest and the least of those movies that mean to unlock the secrets of middle-class matrimony by means of a willful indulgence in everyday unreality. Such films (Peter Medak's "Negatives," Curtis Harrington's "Games," etc.) seem invariably to follow a process of elegant dissolution  never inelegant dissolutionuntil all is laid bare in the destructive psychodrama of life. But in "Honeycomb" nothing is laid bare except the dullest of make-believe constructions covering for the lack of insight that would be necessary to sustain the most ordinary unhappy domestic drama.Mr. Saura, normally a director of forceful personality, whether you like him or not ("The Hunt," "The Garden of Delights"), hardly exists except at the very beginning and end of the movie. And if there is any reason for "Honeycomb," it is to display the talents of what is virtually two-person cast: Per Oscarsson as the husband and Geraldine Chaplin as his wife.Oscarsson ("Hunger," "Here is Your Life," etc.) has no relation to his part and gives the impression of acting, reluctantly, through the discomfort of a persistent low-level headache. Miss Chaplin, looking now more than ever like the female image of her father, is better, but not good enough. The vacuities of the film, and of what I take to be her own screenplay, require not an interpretation but a kind of bravura improvisationand for this Miss Chaplin seems to lack the imagination, the self-fascination, the untrammeled bad taste."Honeycomb" opened yesterday at the Juliet I and Quad 3 theaters.

title: Rockefeller Center To Close a Sex Show
description: Rockefeller Center reported yesterday that it had reached a hastily concluded agreement to close a midtown massage parlor and sex movie theater after the giant realty corpora tion was identified as the prin cipal landlord.

title: Pressure On Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 22 (Reuters)Enemy forces are putting heavy pressure on Cambodian troops in Takeo Province on the border with South Vietnam, the Cambodian command here reported today.

title: HAMILTON SCORES SCOTT RENT STUDY
description: Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton yesterday dismissed as inflammatory rhetoric the finding of the Scott Commis sion that the city's maximum base rent program was a dis aster.

title: Joanna Helen Seinfeld Wed to Ronald Slevin
description: FLORHAM PARK, N. J., Nov. 22Miss Joanna Helen Seinfeld, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin C. Seinfeld of West Caldwell, was married here this evening to Ronald Arthur Slevin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mort Slevin of South Orange. Rabbi Morris Werb performed the ceremony at the Braidburn Country Club.

title: 57% IN POLL BACK A DEATH PENALTY
description: Despite the United States Su preme Court's ruling striking down the death penalty, public support for capital punishment is currently at its highest point in nearly two decades, accord ing to the Gallup Poll.

title: Sherwin Sentenced To One to Two Years
description: FREEHOLD, N.J., Nov. 22 New Jersey's Secretary of State, Paul J. Sherwin, and two other codefendants received sentences of from one to two years and were fined $2,000 each today in State Superior Court on charges involving bribery and a conspiracy to fix a $600,000 state highway con struction contract in return for a $10,000 kickback to the state Republican finance committee.

title: POLICEMEN'S BAIL CALLED MOCKERY
description: The chairman of the city's Board of Correction said yes terday that the setting of $100, 000 bail for three policemen arrested last week on charges of stealing $8,000 from a Fed eral agent posing as a nar coticscarrier was a classic example of the perversion and distortion of the criminal jus tice system.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In an exclusive preelection inter view published in The Washington Star News on Nov. 8, President Nixon reiterated his conviction that cuts that can be made in the defense budget certainly are minimal, except where we get mutual agreements with other countries. However, he also stated he will continue to work for strategic arms control with the Russians and mutual reductions of forces in Europe.

title: F. C.G. AUTHORIZES $145MILLION RISE IN PHONE CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22. The Federal Communications Commission decided today that the American Telephone and Telegraph Company should be permitted to earn at least an 8.5 per cent return immediate ly and as much as 9 per cent in the near future.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LIVE STOCK The Pet and Animal Fair is back for an other long stay (through Jan. 1), starting today at the Madison Square Garden Exhi bition Rotunda (5644400).

title: U.S. Study of Hospitals Charges Poor Designs Spur High Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22A Congressional study of con struction costs for medical fa cilities, which was released to day, found that poor planning and needless expense were helping to drive up hospital charges that are already at record heights.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, Nov. 22 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation announced today that it had decided to stop importing its subcompact Cricket for the remainder of 1972 because of lagging sales of the Britishbuilt car. Through Nova 10, the company's dealers sold 13,326 Crickets, compared with 23,845 in the 1971 period.

title: PENNSYLV ANIA CURBS ON SEX VOTED DOWN
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 22 (UPI)The State House voted yesterday to legalize premarital and extramarital sex.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your interesting news story on ear rings for men (Nov. 4) might have mentioned that some American sub marine crewmen in World War II adopted a fashion of wearing a single gold loop earring as a badge of serv ice (the custom was not universal and was confined to enlisted men). The wearing of jeweled earrings, often solitaire diamonds in pierced lobes, has been common for centuries among the princes of India.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The sleep that knits up the ravell'd sleeve of care is often elusive. Insomniacs looking for a gentle way to drift off might try putting their restless heads down on Evelyn Marshall's new Tran quility Herbal Pillow. Miss Mashall, the beauty expert who was the innovator of such ideas as blushers and brushon eyebrows, said she believes that the scent of leaves and herbs is calming and sleep inducing.

title: 350 Years Later, Wild Turkeys Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 Federal wildlife experts be lieve that the nation's wild turkey population, rather than being decimated by the collective insults inflicted on the environment since the coming of the white man, is probably greater today than at any time since the first Thanksgiving Day.

title: GROUP TO BE LED BY WESTINGHOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  The Westinghouse Electric Cor poration has been chosen to lead the industrial group that will build a $700million breederreactor nuclearelectric power plant at Oak Ridge, Tenn., it was announced today.

title: Wallace Urges Prayers
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 22 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace today called for Thanksgiving Day prayers for an early settle ment of the war in Vietnam.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 22 Francis J. Mertz, the execu tive vice president of St. Peter's College here, today announced plans for construc tion of a $5million recreation and sports complex on the campus of the 100yearold Jesuit school. Construction is scheduled to begin early in the spring.

title: B52 Downed by the North; First of the War, U.S. Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 23A United States B52 bomber crashed last night after a bombing run over North Vietnam. Military sources said it was the first of the war to be lost to enemy fire.

title: Connecticut Acts to Close Open Dumps as Polluters
description: STORRS, Conn., Nov. 22 (UPI)A State Environmental Protection Department official says most of Connecticut's 38 open dumps will have to be closed because they are pollut ing underground waters.

title: Pilgrims Wouldn't Recognize Today's Thanksgiving Turkey
description: To Michael Meshew, who used to raise them, the charm of turkeys starts long before they reach the Thanksgiving table.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 22 (AP)The University of Pitts burgh, seeking to bolster its lagging football program, announced today that it was pulling out of its agreement to participate in the Big Four with Penn State, Syracuse and West Virginia.

title: Big Creditors Seek Plan for Pennsy
description: The major creditors of the Penn Central Transportation Company yesterday recom mended to the trustees of the bankrupt railroad that they de velop a reorganization plan that would be based on the system relying on substantial govern ment support.

title: Court in California, 43, Makes Possible Abortion on Demand
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 22 (UPI)The California Supreme Court ruled today that limits in the state's abortion law were too vague to enforce, opening the way for women in Cali fornia to obtain hospital abor tions on demand.

title: JEROME HILL, 67, MOVIE PRODUCER
description: Jerome Hill, an artist and movie producer who gave both personal and financial encour agement to younger experi menters in the film arts, died Tuesday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at the Algonquin Hotel and at Cassis, near Marseilles, on the Mediterranean, where he spon sored festivals in all the arts.

title: PROABORTIONISTS GREET GOVERNOR
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 22  Pro abortion forces, apparently prompted by news reports that opponents of the state's liberal ized law have dominated the current series of Governor Rockefeller's town meetings, turned up at the meetings today.

title: Market Place: Investors' Guide For WriteOffs
description: Investors who have watched the stock market havoc that results when a company suddenly writes off millions of dollars of de ferred expenses may well be interested in a doityourself guide to the discovery of potential writeoffs.

title: They Only Kill Their Masters'
description: In "They Only Kill Their Masters," a Doberman pinscher pulled from a corpse on a beach eventually cues in a small-town police chief to the killer. This is the most original and likable whodunit I have seen in years.There's no supercunning sleuth here, no splattering violence or sex and no self-conscious sociology. Instead, a bright, plucky policeman tools around a rather humdrum little community confronting some bright but cagey characters who seem as real as he does.The cast of the picture, headed by James Garner, and a casual opening suggest a made-for-TV movie  but hang on. Subtly, simply and soon enough you'll find yourself in the middle of an intriguing puzzle that is being performed with casual relish and wisely amusing dialogue. The tone, text and mystery have been set up and sustained with exquisite sensibility by Lane Slate's script and James Goldstone's direction.The treatment extends through the denouement, opening a nasty, sexual can of worms with telling restraint.Front and center is Garner in his most becoming performance, low-pedaling that blandness with just enough amusing bite. Katharine Ross is excellent as a smitten secretary; so are Peter Lawford as the victim's ex-husband and Hal Holbrook as a veterinarian. They're all good, in fact. And let's not forget a brief, unorthodox appearance by June Allyson, who does beautifully.The picture's last one-word line, spoken by Garner, best pegs it. See it.

title: A Woman Is Killed And Detective Hurt In Gun Battle Here
description: One woman was killed and a police detective was wound ed last night in gun battles that flared after the police at tempted to arrest a robbery suspect in an Upper West Side apartment building allegedly frequented by heroin addicts.

title: Irving B. Goodman, Analyst With U.S. Economic Office
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Irv ing B. Goodman, a senior opera tions research analyst with the Office of Economic Prepared ness, died Monday at the Wash ington Hospital Center after a heart attack. He was 40 years old.

title: News of Skiing
description: JeanClaude Killy, once France's skiing superman, is about to try a comeback. After a fouryear absence from racing, the dashing 1968 Olympic triple gold medal winner is joining the North American professional troupe.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)American and Japanese officials will meet here before the end of the year to discuss possible Japanese violations of a voluntary agreement to limit steel exports to the United States.

title: GERMAN RED CHIEF BARS UNIFICATION
description: BERLIN, Nov. 22Erich Hon ecker, the Communist leader of East Germany, declared today that history has already made the decision in favor of two separate German states rather than a united one.

title: Rep. Reuss Charges Justice Department CoverUp in Armco Pollution Case
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  Representative Henry S. Reuss accused the Justice Department today of a massive coverup of White House intervention in a suit involving toxic waste discharges by the Armco Steel Company.

title: SCHOLARS DEBATE CLAIM BY POPKIN
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 22 While nearly all of his col leagues at Harvard support the decision of Prof. Samuel L. Pop kin to go to jail rather than disclose his sources, there is considerable disagreement in the academic community over his contention that scholars are entitled to special constitution al protections in their work.

title: Sergeant vs. Generals
description: An inspiring modern fable might well have told the story how a lowly sergeant caught the generals in the act of falsifying the records after they disobeyed the President of the United States. In this historic fairy tale, the sergeant would have triumphed over the awesome preponderance of rank. The brass would have been sternly held to account. The system which allowed such flagrant defiance of civilian policy by the military would have been reformed. The sergeant would have received the public thanks of the President.

title: Sports of The Times
description: STATELINE, Nev., Nov. 22In the fourth round, the skin under Muhammad Ali's left eye began to turn purple, the smooth cocoabutter skin that never had been bruised, the skin that he often had patted so vainly. Suddenly, in the fifth round, Bob Foster's left jab, rising from the light heavyweight champion's hip, snapped into Ali's left eye. Quickly, they were apart again, but blood appeared, oozing out of a narrow slit under the eyebrow, the first time Ali's own blood was on his face, the first time his charisma, as well as his body, had bled. Ali realized he was bleeding and in the corner after the bell, he said on his stool and looked up into the lights above the ring as his trainer, Angelo Dundee, peered into the wound.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22  J. Anton Jungherr, Newark's Finance Director, said today that the city's real estate taxes, already the highest in the state, would go up again next year, even though the city will have an $8million surplus at the end of the year.

title: Five Indians Are Indicted In Occupation of Building
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 22 (AP)A Federal grand jury in dicted five Indians today in connection with the recent oc cupation of a Bureau of Indian Affairs building in Washington.

title: Phil Baxter, Songwriter, 76; Composed Ding Dong Daddy
description: DALLAS, Nov. 22 (AP)Phil Baxter, a songwriter whose hits included I've Got a Girl Seven Feet Tall and Ding Dong Daddy From Dumas, died yesterday in a nursing home here. He was 75 years old.

title: PETROSIAN DEFEATS GLIGORIC IN CHESS
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 22 (AP)Tigran Petrosian of the Soviet Union, a former world chess champion, defeated the Yugoslav grandmaster Sve tozar Gligoric today, leaving Bent Larsen of Denmark alone in the lead of the international tournament being played here.

title: Robbery Case Recounted
description: A Vassar College freshman named Catherine Messinger dashed into the East 104th Street police station last July 11 to gasp out an account of being robbed of her purse at knife point in Central Park.

title: I Must Give Thanks
description: There is a halfforgotten story about an early settle ment on the New England shore that is worth remem bering. After the first two difficult years, this colony gathered a modest harvest, caught cod aplenty, took venison, had substantial cabins for shelter. They had even made friends with the Indians. But some people were dubious about the winter ahead, particularly the leaders, and a day of prayer and fasting was decreed.

title: Pacers Defeat Cougars
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 22 (AP) George McGinnis scored 24 points tonight as the Indiana Pacers beat the Carolina Cou gars, 114103, in a battle of American Basketball Associa tion division leaders.

title: Heath's Party Loses Vote In Commons on Migration
description: LONDON, Nov. 22  The House of Commons tonight turned down regulations pro posed by the Government for putting into effect an immigra tion act approved earlier this year.

title: BELGIAN CABINET QUITS IN DISPUTE
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 22 The 11monthold coalition Govern ment of Premier Gaston Eys kens collapsed today over the longstanding problems divid ing Belgium's Flemish and Frenchspeaking populations.

title: Soviet Space Engineers Due
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 22 (UPI) Nine Russian space engineers are to arrive tomorrow at the SpacecraftCenter for 10 days, of discussions on the planned 1975 United StatesSoviet space flight, a spokesman for the Na tional Aeronautics and Space Administration said today. The United States and Soviet groups will discuss guidance and con trol communications and track ing methods for the first inter national flight.

title: News Analysis
description: GENEVA, Nov. 22  The American delegation arrived a few minutes late yesterday for the start of the next series of armslimitation talks with the Soviet Union. It made scant dif fence: The two sides will be meeting for months and per haps years before they reach any conclusions. The Americans, led by Gerard C. Smith, a 58year old millionaire who believes in public service, and the Russians, led by Vladimir S. Semyonov, who has a fondness for Western art and is a lover of Beethoven, were settling in for a long stay. All talks will now be held here, un like the series that alternated for 30 months between Hel sinki and Vienna and finally led to the pacts signed in Mos cow in May.

title: Samford Five Moves Up
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. Nov. 22 (AP)  Samford University has officially joined the ranks of major college basketball teams, moving up from the smallcol lege division, school officials announced today. Samford was notified of the change in clas sification by Jack Waters, chairman of the National Col legiate Sports Services, the statistical arm of the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: Eastern College Football
description: John Hufnagel of Penn State is the outstanding col lege quarterback in the East this season based upon his ability to run, pass, manage an offense and win. But there are other good quarterbacks, such as Piel Pennington, a worthy successor to Greg Landry at Massachusetts; Kim McQuilken of Le high, who has passed for 4,393 yards in two sea sons; Tom Parr, Colgate's director of the wishbone, and Steve Stetson of Dartmouth, a mas terly field general like Huf nagel.

title: Prompt Rehiring of Scribner Is Urged
description: The city's Board of Educa tion came under additional pressure yesterday to renew the contract of Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: We members of the silent ma jority have at last spoken out in the landslide election of Richard Nixon. Not because we love him or because he is the incumbent President. We voted for Nixon because we are for what he is for. Our basic feelings are positive, not negative:

title: IN THE NATION
description: It is not going to be much of a Thanksgiving Day for Samuel Popkin, the Harvard scholar who has been sent to jail for refusing to tell the Govern ment how he knew of the existence of the Pentagon Papers before they were published. The day will be more cheerful for the five of the Chicago Seven whose convictions have been overturned by the Seventh Circuit Court of Appealsbut even they still have cause to fear the apparent will ingness of the Government to jail people for political and intellectual activity.

title: U.S. URGED TO STUDY JUSTICE IN BRITAIN
description: Senator James L. Buckley urged yesterday the appoint ment of a Presidential commis sion to study the criminal jus tice system in Britain and see if some of its procedures could be applied in this country.

title: CHEFS' UNION SEES HEADWAY IN TALK
description: Negotiators for the striking waiters and waitresses here continued their talks last night with restaurant owners in an effort to resolve differences and reach a new agreement.

title: News of Dogs
description: Col. Francisco Badrena, an engineer from Hato Rey, P.R., plots a careful course and follows it. This year he has turned to the dogshow world and his careful plan ning is meeting with success.

title: HANOI TROOPS GET TRUCE DIRECTIVE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 22American Intelligence officials report that Hanoi has ordered Communist forces in South Vietnam, both Vietcong and North Vietnamese, to ob serve a ceasefire scrupulously for the first 60 days after it goes into effect and to refrain from all acts of vengeance, as sassination and terrorism dur ing that period.

title: Uneasy Quiet on Heights
description: TIBERIAS, Israel, Nov. 22 An uneasy quiet returned to the Golan heights today as Israeli settlers and Syrian soldiers began repairing the damage of yesterday's heavy fighting along the ceasefire line.

title: Bridge: Sports Stars Given an Assist For play Out of Their Leagues
description: Whether an inexperienced player can do better playing doubledummy than an ex pert playing in the normal wayassuming limited time for reflectionis an interest ing speculation.

title: 3 MILLION ITALIANS ON STRIKE IN UNREST
description: ROME, Nov. 22Metal and construction workers, civil servants, bank employes, air port ground personnel and other groups  three million wage earnerswere on strike today as Italy's autumn of crippling labor unrest reached a peak.

title: Paris in the Sky
description: The French, they are discovering the skyscraper. Paris, uptodate, has the 58story MaineMontparnasse build ing, and promises that true cachet of progress, freeways on both banks of the Seine. It has demolished Les Halles. Pollution turns chestnut trees brown in the spring. The towers of La Dfense, the $2billion answer to Uris and his brothers, will disrupt the cherished vista of the Arc de Triomphe.

title: News of Skiing
description: JeanClaude Killy, once France's skiing superman, is about to try a comeback. After a fouryear absence from racing, the dashing 1968 Olympic triple gold medal winner is joining the North American professional troupe.

title: Almost All the Noncombat Jobs In Air Force Opened to Women
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 The Air Force joined the Army and the Navy today in decid ing that women's work in the military should be virtually any duties they are able and will ing to perform. But the Air Force kept a few jobsinclud ing piloting aircraftclosed to women.

title: 2 Commodity Exchanges Announce Rate Changes
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 22 (AP)The nation's two major com modity futures exchanges announced today that they would phase out minimum commission rates on nonmember trans actions and adopt a system of negotiated commission rates.

title: BROWN'S LAWYERS CITE DALEY STORY
description: Lawyers for H. Rap Brown charged yesterday that a re cent article by former Deputy Police Commissioner Robert Daley about the black militant leader's arrest and capture last fall had made it virtually im possible for him to get a fair and impartial trial.

title: COUNTER STOCKS REGISTER A GAIN
description: The overthecounter market yesterday broke its twoday losing streak and made a mod est advance in more active trading.

title: BRIBERY WITNESS ACCUSES LAWYER
description: Detective Robert Leuci testi fied in Federal Court here yesterday that he had delivered secret information about crimi nal investigations to Edmund A. Rosner, a lawyer charged with obtaining the confidential documents by bribery.

title: B52 Downed by the North; First of the War, U.S. Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 23A United States B52 bomber crashed last night after a bombing run over North Vietnam. Military sources said it was the first of the war to be lost to enemy fire.

title: Theater: A World Premiere for Beckett's Not I
description: Samuel Beckett's face, with its shock hair and lean, lined mapofexperience features, stares with mute and aggres sive compassion from the program at Lincoln Center, where the repertory company is having a Samuel Beckett festival. A festival? For Beck ett? Hardly festivea de spairing shout in a dank uni verse, sparse writing on a cluttered wall. Festive is not the first Beckett wordor even the 17th.

title: Jets in the Lions' Den Without Three Key Starters
description: After walking through a quick morning workout at Shea Stadium yesterday, the New York Jets limped out of town for today's game against the Detroit Lions in Tiger Stadium. They left be hind three key starters with injuries: Emerson Boozer, running back; Steve Tannen, cornerback, and John Elliott, defensive tackle.

title: LEOPOLD T. WELLISZ, INDUSTRIALIST, DIES
description: TUCKAHOE, N. Y., Nov. 22 Leopold T. Wellisz, an indus trialist, author and patron of the arts in Poland between world wars, died Monday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville. He was 89 years old and lived at 25 Howard Avenue.

title: CALIFORNIAN GUILTY OF BLACKMAIL PLOT
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 22 (UPI)A real estate salesman was convicted today of a plot to open gambling parlors in suburban Irwindale by black mailing the city's Mayor with lewd pictures.

title: Bullets Sink Souks, 11290
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 22 (AP) Elvin Hayes scored 16 of his 23 points in the fourth quarter tonight as the Baltimore Bul lets regained first place in the Central Division with a 11290 victory over the Seattle Super Sonics.

title: Nixon May Name So and So to Cabinetor He May Not
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 President Nixon may nominate Kenneth Rush to be Secretary of State and Elliot L. Richard son to be Secretary of Defense in the second Nixon Adminis tration. Then again, he may not.

title: Kissinger Continues Peace Talks in Paris
description: PARIS, Nov. 22Negotia tions on a Vietnam ceasefire continued for a third day here today, and another session was reportedly set for tomorrow.

title: Merger News
description: The Federal Trade Commision yesterday provisionally adopted a consent order requiring the GeorgiaPacific Corporation to divest itself of certain specified assets in order to create an independent company. The F.T.C. order Would settle a pre vious complaint by the Govern ment agency challenging cer tain acquisitions by Georgia Pacific with vio lation of the Clay ton Antitrust act and the Federal Trade Commission Act. Under terms of the F.T.C. order, Georgia Pacific would create an inde pendent company named the Louisiana Pacific Corporation having a net book value of not less than $150million. Such assets must have accounted for 120 per cent.of GeorgiaPacific's profits according to the F.T.C. order. As of Dec. 31, 1971, GeorgiaPacific had assets tot aling $1.8billion.

title: Composite Quotes Advised For Listed Securities Only
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) A proposed system of com posite stock quotations should carry price and other data only on listed securities, according to recommendations of an ad visory panel of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: BLACK RECRUITING CALLED NAVY FLAW
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 22Navy officials testified today that ra cial disorders aboard the air craft carrier Constellation and other ships of the Pacific fleet were largely a result of Navy emphasis on the recruiting of educationally handicapped black youths.

title: Pakistan to Allow 10,000 to Return to Bangladesh
description: Pakistan has decided to allow simile 10,000 Bengali women and children to return to their homes in response to India's and Bangladesh's decision this week to repatriate about 6,000 members of the families of Pak istani civilians and captured soldiers held in northern India.

title: Stein Expects Pay Raises to Moderate in '73
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 The chairman of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers said today that he ex pected labor settlements next year to be much more com patible with price stability than those negotiated two or three years ago.

title: BACK PAY DEMANDED FOR CITY TEACHERS
description: Albert Shanker, the president of the United Federation of Teachers, yesterday demand ed all back wages for 810 rull time city teachers who haven't received their lull pay since the school term started 11 weeks ago.

title: Price Changes
description: The Republic Steel Corpora tion and the Armco Steel Com pany yesterday became the third and fourth major steel makers to join the latest round of price increases.

title: Analyst Sees Promise in Counter Market
description: Now that the DowJones industrials have topped 1,000, what's happening in the overthecounter market? A boom in blue chips has a habitsometimesof spilling over even tually into the unlisted market, which for sheer numbers includes more issues than the stock exchanges. For a cur rent appraisal, Vartanig G. Vartan of The New York Times interviewed Palmer Weber, head of research and corporate finance at Troster, Singer & Co. This firm serves as a whole sale market maker in an estimated 700 stocks trading over thecounter.

title: C.B.S. Wins Injunction Against Strikers' Damage
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System yesterday obtained a preliminary injunction restrain ing members of its striking technicians' union from damag ing C. B. S. property and from threatening, intimidating or coercing C. B. S. employes crossing picket lines.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22  Lopsided scores can rupture relations in scholastic sports. But Barringer and East Orange High Schools have belted each other freely and have lived to tell about it. On Thanksgiving Day, these schools will meet for the 76th time in the longest, continuous high school football rivalry in New Jersey.

title: Lindsay Off to Try to Spur City Trade With Japanese
description: Mayor and Mrs. Lindsay left yesterday morning for a two week trip that will include a threeday businessdevelopment mission and a fiveday Con ference of the World's Great Cities in Tokyo.

title: Book's of The Times
description: WITHOUT A STITCH IN TIME. By Peter DeVries. 328 pages. Little, Brown. $8.95.

title: U.S. RULE BARRING SIPS AND PLANES FROM CHINA ENDED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22In another move to improve rela tions with Peking, President Nixon today lifted the 22Year old restriction on travel to China by United States ships and planes.

title: Robbery Case Recounted
description: A Vassar College freshman named Catherine Messinger dashed into the West 100th Street police station last July 11 to gasp out an account of being robbed of her purse at knife point in Central Park.

title: LANDLORDS WARNED ON EXCESS RENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 The Internal Revenue Service announced today that land lords who collect rents in ex cess of those allowed under the Government's rentcontrols program may have to pay penalties of up to $2,500 for each violation.

title: DEAD G.I. IS NOT SON, WOMAN TELLS ARMY
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 22 (AP) The United States Army has sent the body of a soldier killed in a traffic accident in Germany to Mrs. Marcella Smith of Buf falo, telling her it is the body of her son. But Mrs. Smith says the body is not that of Pvt. Lott D. Smith, her 21yearold son.

title: Robert Fletcher, 87, Dies; Wrote Don't Fence Me In
description: BUTTE, Mont. Nov. 22 (AP) Robert H. Fletcher, a West ern poet and writer perhaps best known for the song Don't Fence Me In, died Monday at the age of 87 in Escondido, Calif.

title: F.P.C. Aide Is Resigning
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) President Nixon has accep ted with special regret the resignation of Pinkney Walker as vice chairman of the Fed eral Power Commission, the White House said today.

title: U.S. Running Into Snags on Truce Force
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  Administration officials said today that the chances seemed remote that more than a token international supervisory com mission of Canadians, Hungari ans, Indonesians and Poles would be in operation at the time of a ceasefire in Vietnam.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WENTWORTH LOCATION, N. H.When Adrian Bouchard of Hanover, N. H., and I parted beside a stream at 7 o'clock in the morning to begin a daylong hunt for deer, we were mildly optimis tic: a new snow, just right for tracking deer, had fallen the night before, and we had seen a few fresh signs of the animals in the general area.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NEWARK, Del., Nov. 22 (AP)The unbeaten Univer sity of Delaware football team, the No. 1 ranked small college team in the nation, has turned down a bid to the Boardwalk Bowl game slated for Dec. 9 at Atlantic City and has criticized the National Collegiate Athletic Asso ciation's College Division bowl setup.

title: BIG BOARD MEMBERS END DIRECTOR RULE
description: The New York Stock Ex change's membership voted yes terday to abolish the require ment that each member firm must have at least one ex change member as a director.

title: Guard Dies in Saving Child
description: PALMDALE, Calif., Nov. 22 (UPI)A mother acting as a school crossing guard was killed today as she pushed a child out of the path of an on coming car. Mrs. Patricia Ed gar, 34 years old, was escorting 12yearold David Hoffmeyer across a street when a car came directly at them without slowing. The driver of the car, Patrice L. Webb told investiga tors that she did not see the two persons on the street until it was too late. She was booked on suspicion of manslaughter.

title: HOLIDAY TRAVEL JAMS HIGHWAYS
description: The Thanskgiving migration got under way last night with thronged highways and crowded terminals and airports.

title: Miss Brodie Bride Of John Scott Jr.
description: Miss Margot Brodie and John James Scott Jr. were married here yesterday at noon at the Plaza Hotel by the Rev. Walter Donald Kring of the Unitarian Church of All Souls.

title: U.S. Pledge Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Nov. 22 (UPI) Prince Souvanna Phouma, the Laotian Premier, said today that he had a commitment from the United States to continue bombing in Laos if an expected Vietnam war settlement did not include a ceasefire in his country.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: ELIZABETH, Nov. 22  The Essex County Blood Bank and Overlook Hospital in Summit planned today to appeal a court decision holding hospitals and blood banks liable for illness caused by transfusions of im pure blood.

title: Connecticut Getting an Exchange Seat
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 22  Con necticut was tentatively accept ed today as a member of the PBW Stock Exchange in Phila delphia.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The recent New York Times news report of Professor Piaget's talk to a seminar of clinical psychologists and others at the City University of New York Graduate School contains inac curacies and omissions that have created considerable misunderstanding. I would like to correct these.

title: Pressmen at Two Papers In New Haven Go on Strike
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 22 Pressmen at The Journal Courier and The Register, the morning and afternoon news papers here, walked off their jobs shortly after midnight.

title: Louisiana Orders Southern Campus Shut Until Jan. 3
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 22 (UPI)The Louisiana Board of Education today ordered the strifetorn Southern University campus here closed until Jan. 3 at the request of Dr. J. Leon Netterville, the school's presi dent.

title: Proxmire Assails the Use Of G.I.'s as Servants
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)  Senator William Prox mire, one of Congress's most, severe military critics, called today for an investigation into the practice of using enlisted men as personal servants for highranking officers.

title: Arrest Made at Airport
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov 22 (UPI)Richard Klein, 19 years old, was charged with unlaw fully carrying a pistol today af ter he was arrested at San An tonio International Airport where, the police said, he was overheard talking about hijack ing an airplane.

title: People and Business
description: Long Island's largest com pany  the Grumman Cor poration, with 23,000 em ployeshas named John C. Bierwirth, 47, as its presi dent and chief operating of ficer. The positions had been filled temporarily by E. Clin ton Towl, 66, chairman and chief executive officer, since the death of Llewellyn J. Evans last July 9 at the age of 51.

title: Nets Beat Squires, 109105, But Erving Steals Show
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 22 The Nets won their fourth straight game tonight, 109105, but it was Julius Erving of the Virginia Squires who kept the 8,673 fans, the largest, crowd of the Nassau Coliseum season, on the edge of their seats with a dazzling display of offensive basketball.

title: Richest Rookie Golfer Aiming Higher
description: HILTON HEAD, S. C., Nov. 22They called Lanny Wad kins a brash golf amateur here two years ago when, at the age of 20, he said he could beat Jack Nicklaus or Arnold Palmer on any given day. Then he went out and finished ahead of them, plac ing second to Bob Goalby in the 1970 Heritage Classic.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: This refers to your Nov. 11 editorial Mutinous Sailors. The cure for indiscipline is firm, rigid and inflexible discipline. A military force should not indulge in social experiments. The oldfashioned, timetested methods are the basis of military success. As for long periods of roundtheclock work, that is what men are for and what they should expect. Napoleon once wrote,  poverty, hardship, and suffering are the proper training for a soldier. They are good for sailors too.

title: Bigfoot Muses on the Nature of Twins
description: As Ronald Tavel envisions him, Esau was not just a hairy man, but the Abomin able Snowman. Bigfoot, Tavel's new play now run ning at Theater Genesis, is his metaphysical musings on the meaning of twindom and the nature of the beast in man. Rodomontade, rococo, plastered with puns, furbel owed with alliteration and aphorisms, Bigfoot is that rare play that titillates the brain while tickling the funny bone.

title: Ducks Win Florida Vote
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 22 (AP)The ducks have defeated the environmentalists. The City Council voted 3 to 2 Monday against ousting the ducks from the city's water showcase, Lake Eola. Studies by environmental experts had shown that the 50 resident Pekin and Muscovvy ducks were polluting the lake, now undergoing a $100,000 restoration.

title: Bilingual Shows for Young Are Planned for Public TV
description: Bilingual Children's Televi sion, Inc., a Federally funded nonprofit organization, is plan ning to produce a nationwide Spanish  English educational program for youngsters.

title: SEASONAL SHORTAGE OF HEATING OIL SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)An Administration offi cial said today that refineries in the East and Middle West are not producing enough home heating oil to assure an ample supply during the coming win ter months.

title: Wings 62 Victors
description: DETROIT, Nov. 22 (UPI)  Marcel Dionne scored a goal and assisted on four others to night, leading the Detroit Red Wings to a 62 victory over the Buffalo Sabres. It was his 23d tally of the season.

title: French Drop African Debt
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Upper Vol ta, Nov. 22 (AP)President Pompidou announced today that France was writing off debts of a billion francs$195 millionowed by her former African colonies. Speaking in Upper Volta'ss National Assem bly, he said the decision re flected France's desire to set an example and to lighten the burden of debt of the countries to which France is linked. Mr. Pompidou is on a fiveday visit to Upper Volta and Togo in West Africa.

title: Villa Recital
description: Joseph Villa, who gave an allLiszt program in his debut earlier this year, was back in Tully Hall on Tuesday night with a more varied list of works.

title: Contract Awards
description: The FMC Corporation re ceived a $29.3million Army contract for engineering, devel opment and production plan ning for the mechanized infan try combat vehicle MICV, it was announced yesterday. The vehicle is an armored troop carrier that will replace the M114 troop carrier.

title: U.S. and Soviet Back Sliding Rate Scale for Grain
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  The United States and the Soviet Union agreed today, after a week of negotiations, on a sliding scale of charter rates that Moscow will pay American shippers for the transport of grain bought here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your news article on the forthcom ing 75th anniversary of Greater New York intrigued me because of the memories it brought back. I have a vivid recollection of my father's re action when it was bruited about that a supercolossal urban complex was to be formed called Greater New York.

title: Heath's Party Loses Vote In Commons on Migration
description: LONDON, Nov. 22The House of Commons tonight turned down regulations proposed by the Government to implement a 1971 act designed to tighten immigration control.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22Four of the 10 laborers who showed up today for work on the Ka waida Towers housing develop ment stayed on their jobs de spite threats and taunts from white demonstrators.

title: Thanks
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn.  The Thanks givings of my boyhood were filled with excitement, if only because each one provided the most elaborate and unre stricted feast of my calendar year. My mother, a steadfast nature lover and pure product of the Yankee ethic, an nually besought me to be more thank ful and less interested in the bountiful fare, mentioning that I could be grate ful for the lovely rich land, the trees, the green hills of Connecticut and the seas of Long Island Sound, things that had contributed heartily to the harvest.

title: Meal Cost Up 32 Cents
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)  The cost of the traditional Thanksgiving turkey dinner for 2.4 million persons in military uniform has increased 32 centsa meal, Defense Department officials said today. The full pound of turkey and half pound of desserts in each meal will cost $1.33 against $1.01 last year.

title: C. B. S. Strike Situation at a Glance
description: PARTICIPANTSColumbia Broadcasting System and Local 1212, Radio and Broadcast Engineers, International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. Union represents 1,200 cameramen, audio engineers, lighting men and other tech nicians. The workers went on strike Nov. 3 and have affected C.B.S. operations at its New York, Los Angeles and Washington studios, as well as at TV and radio stations owned and operated by C.B.S. in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Detroit, Boston, St. Louis and Philadelphia.

title: Smith Is Lost to Saints
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 22 (AP) The New Orleans Saints of the National Football League have placed Royce Smith, a guard, on the injured reserve list, sidelining him for the year after he suffered a knee injury.

title: Marine Scientists Succeed in Growing A Tidal Salt Marsh in Only 7 Months
description: With a measure of devo tion not unlike that of anx ious parents rearing their first child, a small band of marine scientists has succeeded in planting and growing a tidal salt marsh in the Chesapeake Bay in the brief space of seven months.

title: ISLANDERS BEATEN ON LATE SURGE, 53
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 22 (AP) The Philadelphia Flyers, rain ing 60 shots on Bill Smith, clicked for four goals within 10 minutes in the final period tonight to take a 53 National Hockey League decision over the New York Islanders.

title: U.S. Study of Hospitals Finds Poor Designs Spur High Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22A Congressional study of con struction costs for medical fa cilities, which was released to day, found that poor planning and needless expense were helping to drive up hospital charges that are already at record heights.

title: Margin in Stock Purchases Is Raised to 65 From 55%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Federal Reserve Board an nounced today an increase in the margin requirement for purchasing stock to 65 per cent from 55 per cent.

title: Rockefeller Center To Close a Sex Show
description: Rockefeller Center reported yesterday that it had reached a hastily concluded agreement to close a midtown massage parlor and sex movie theater after the giant realty corpora tion was identified as the prin cipal landlord.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Nassau County Board of Supervisors yesterday unanimously agreed to appeal a State Supreme Court ruling Monday that declared unconstitutional the board's proposed reapportionment plan.

title: 3 Rob Bishop Moore in Park
description: The Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr., the Episcopal Bishop of New York, has found that hold ing a high ecclesiastical office is no insurance against an ex perience many New Yorkers have enduredbeing held up in Central Park.

title: TV: Charming Trip With Errant Boy
description: A genuine holiday treat for young and oldnothing to do with the Pilgrimsis on television tonight at 9 over WNET/Channel 13. The program is a stunningly beautiful version of the Ravel  Colette opera  ballet fantasy, L'Enfant et Les Sortilges (The Spellbound Child).

title: Personalities: From Ring to Mat
description: Duane Bobick, the heavy weight boxing prospect whose ring future was shat tered by the merciless fists of Cuba's Teofilo Stevenson at the Olympics, signed a longterm professional wres tling contract yesterday.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 1.06 million shares of the South Carolina Electric & Gas Company common stock at $25 a share was made yesterday by underwriters managed by Kidder, Peabody. Net proceeds will be used to repay part of the utility's shortterm indebtedness resulting from construction expenditures. The company's stock closed at 25, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: RAIDERS, WINNING 3D GAME IN ROW, TOP WHALERS, 31
description: Ron Ward, a player who ad mits that no one ever wanted me any place I played, re mained at the top in World Hockey Association scoring last night as the New York Raiders defeated the New England Whalers, 31.

title: Development Bank Sets Loan
