description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (Reuters)  The InterAmerican Development Bank today an nounced a $23.1million loan to help increase agricultural production in Mexico by pro moting more efficient irrigation techniques.

title: Penguins Rout Blues, 104
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 22 (AP)  The Pittsburgh Penguins poured in seven goals in the last period to smother the St. Louis Blues tonight, 104. They set a league record by scoring five times in 2 minutes 7 seconds. The total of 10 goals also was a team record.

title: Tear Gas Routs Peronists
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 22 (Reuters)The police used tear gas and a demonstrator fired a shot outside the home of Juan D. Pern here tonight, police sources said.

title: Workers Push to Get to Newark Site
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22Workers and pickets pushed at one an other across a line of policemen today as a handful of laborers went to work for the second day on the site of the em battled Kawaida Towers hous ing project.

title: Alexander's Is Weighing Sunday Openings in City
description: Alexander's, Inc., a major New Yorkbased retailer, is considering opening its four stores in the city on Sundays at least through the Christmas selling season.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22  Work ers and pickets pushed at one another across a line of police men today as a handful of laborers went to work for the second day on the site of the embattled Kawaida Towers housing project.

title: San Diego Zoo in Red
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 22 (AP) The new wild animal park run by the San Diego Zoological Society lost $565,000 during its first fiscal year even though attendance was higher than ex pected. City Auditor William Sage reported Monday.

title: PLYWOOD SHOWS ANOTHER DECLINE
description: Once again plywood futures dropped sharply, still under the impact of news that the Price Commission is investigating re cent high prices for building materials.

title: U. S. Aide Says Laotians Retake Key Town After a Week's Fight
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 22 An American spokesman re ported today that Laotian Gov ernment forces had taken the town of Saravane in southern. Laos from North Vietnamese troops after a week of fight ing. Heavy casualties were re ported on both sides.

title: New York Phone Names Its First Woman Director
description: Martha R. Wallace has been named the first woman mem ber of the board of the New York Telephone Company.

title: 2 SEIZED IN THEFT OF $50,000 IN ART
description: Two men were charged yes terday in the theft of six paint ings valued at $50,000 from the apartment of Prof. John Cavanna, chairman of the de partment of English and human ities at the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn on Oct. 1.

title: Man in the News
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 22 Anyone who visualizes the author of a major dictionary as a pedantic recluse reluc tantly and absentmindedly raising myopic eyes from dusty tomes would be pleas antly startled by even a brief encounter with Dr. Lin Yutang, famous scholar, au thor, translator, educator and hu manist, whose Chinese  English dictionary of modern usage should facilitate communica tion in the years to come be tween the world's two larg est linguistic groups.

title: THURBER BIERCE, FINANCE EXPERT
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 22  Thurber H. Bierce, a retired financial consultant, died today at Englewood Hospital of a heart ailment. He was 72 years old and lived at 277 Maple Street and Point O'Woods, L. I.

title: European Security Talks On in Finland
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 22 The Communist and non Communist nations of Europe, with the United States and Canada, met here today to begin consultations intended to form a 71 new framework for security on the Continent.

title: GEORGE A. FRANCE SR.
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 22  George A. France Sr., president of the France Stone Company, died today in a nursing home near here. He was 81 years old.

title: Amtrak Adds Holiday Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) Amtrak said today it had added more than 225 cars and more station personnel to help ease the Thanksgiving rush in the Northeast and Middle West. Scattered snowstorms are ex pected to drive people off the highways onto already over crowded trains.

title: 21 Junior League Debutantes Bow
description: The Junior League of New York held its 24th annua Debutante Ball in the Plaza's. Grand Ballroom last night. Twentyone provisional mem bers of ?? league, carrying the traditional fan of green ostrich ?? were pre sented at midnight to Mrs. James M. O'Neil, the league president.

title: KRONICK SETS MARK IN NEW JERSEY RUN
description: LAKEWOOD, N.J., Nov. 22 Harry Kronick of Franklin Township and Greg Miller of Northern Highlands Regional waged a shouldertoshoulder duel the entire distance today before Kronick outleaned Miller to win New Jersey's first all group crosscountry champion ship at Ocean County Park.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22  Seven reputed Mafia figures being held on civil contempt charges were released today from jail so that they can spend a three day Thanksginving holiday at home.

title: Lanusse Calls Peron's Return a Positive Contribution to Argentine Politics
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 22 President Alejandro A. Lanusse said today that Juan D. Pern's return from exile had been a a positive contribution to Ar gentine politics, consistent with the strict military timetable for a return to elected civilian gov ernment here early next year.

title: Oneonta Beats Adelphi, 60, In N.C.A.A. Soccer Replay
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 22  Carlos Camacho scored three goals, two in the first half, to lead Oneonta State College to a 60 victory over Adelphi today in a firstround game of the National Collegiate College Division soccer cham pionship.

title: Nixon Names Inaugural Head
description: THURMONT, Md., Nov. 22 (UPI)President Nixon today named J. Willard Marriott Sr., founder of the Marriott hotel chain and a personal friend of the President, to head the 1973 Presidential Inaugural Commit tee.

title: European Talks Open
description: The Communist and non Communist nations of Europe, with the United States and Canada, met in Helsinki yes terday to discuss new secu rity arrangements on the Continent. Details on Page 16.

title: GEORGE DOUGHMAN, A G.E. EXECUTIVE, 70
description: EASTON, Md., Nov. 22  George B. Doughman, retired General Electric executive, died Monday of cancer at his home here. He was 70 years old.

title: Finally, a Modern Chinese Dictionary
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 22  A milestone in communica tion between the world's two largest linguistic groups, the Chinesespeaking and Eng lishspeaking peoples, has been reached with the publi cation of a ChineseEnglish dictionary of modern usage by Dr. Lin Yutang, author, scholar, educator and hu manist.

title: Onassis, in Struck 21, Dines on $10 Hot Dog
description: Sheldon Tannen and Bob Kriendler waited on Aristotle Onasis at the 21 Club yester day, Mr. Kriendler recommend. ing the knockwurst and Mr. Tannen fetching the order.

title: Music: Tuba to Forefront
description: The tuba is a useful in strument in both symphony orchestras and bands, but it is somewhat clumsy in size and sound and as a solo in strument it has no charisma at all.

title: Museum in Syracuse Accused of Orgy
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 22The Everson Museum of Art, a fouryearold institution that sees itself as a bastion of the avantgarde, has become embroiled in a controversy, with the Onondaga County Legislature.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 22 (Reuters)Belgium today raised her bank rate to 4 from 4 per cent. The discount rate had been at 4 per cent since last March 2, when it was lowered from 4 per cent. The new rate is effective to morrow, the central bank said.

title: Parking Meters for Sale
description: CROWLET, La. (UPI)  For sale: used parking meters and poles. The city council put the parking restriction equipment on sale after agreeing to re move the meters from the downtown area because of complaints by merchants and shoppers.

title: GERMAN RED CHIEF BARS UNIFICATION
description: BERLIN, Nov. 22Erich Hon ecker, the Communist leader of East Germany, declared today that history has already made the decision in favor of two separate German states rather than a united one.

title: Sherwin Sentenced To One to Two Years
description: FREEHOLD, N.J., Nov. 22 New Jersey's Secretary of State, Paul J. Sherwin, and two other codefendants received sentences of from one to two years and were fined $2,000 each today in State Superior Court on charges involving bribery and a conspiracy to fix a $600,000 state highway con struction contract in return for a $10,000 kickback to the state Republican finance committee.

title: Helicopter Is Used to Rescue a Steeplejack After He Falls Into a Silo
description: One steeplejack died and another escaped serious injury yesterday when they plummet ed from their rigging inside a 180foot high cement storage silo in Queens.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Supreme Court Jus tice Ivan Warner, acting on a petition by State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz, ordered the owners of the Kent Hotel, 31 West 71st Street, to evict tenants al legedly engaged in prostitu tion, drug pushing and other criminal activities.

title: News of Dogs
description: Col. Francisco Badrena, an engineer from Hato Rey, P.R., plots a careful course and follows it. This year he has turned to the dogshow world and his careful plan ning is meeting with success.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Fall at Monthly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Gov ernment's monthly competi tive sale today of these short term securities.

title: European Talks Open
description: The Communist and non Communist nations of Europe, with the United States and Canada, met in Helsinki yes terday to discuss new secu rity arrangements on the Continent. Details on Page 16.

title: Notes on People
description: We have here with us, said Pope Paul VI to a Vati can audience of 3,000, a celebrated American bishop. The Pope said certainly you know his books and some among you may have listened to the sermons he has de livered on the American ra dio and television. The crowd applauded the 77year old Bishop in its midst: the Most Rev. Fulton J. Sheen.

title: Syrians Said to Reinforce Truce Line
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 22 Syria has reportedly moved re inforcements to the 90mile front along the Golan heights ceasefire line with Israel in the wake of the eighthour air, tank and artillery battles yes terday.

title: Don Loper, Fashion Impresario To Hollywood Stars, Dies at 65
description: Don Loper, an impresario of fashion, Hollywood style, died Tuesday night in St. John's Hospital in Santa Monica, Calif. at the age of 65. The cause of death was not given.

title: Israeli Reports Hitting Villages
description: TEL AVIV, Nov: 22 (AP)An Israeli commander in the oc cupied Golan heights said last night that his troops had shelled six Syrian civilian vil lages to make an example of them during the battle with Syrian forces yesterday.

title: Coast Botulism Kills Ducks
description: SALTON SEA, Calif., Nov. 22 (UPI)An outbreak of botulism has killed an estimated 3,500 ducks in less than two weeks, the State Department of Fish and Game reported yesterday. The outbreak was first noticed Nov. 10 around the Alamo River Delta at the south end of the Salton Sea, an inland body of salt water, a spokesman said. Such outbreaks are common in the spring and fall, but this was the most serious in years, he said.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Egged on by his wife who had told him, it would be easy as pie, Phelps sandwiched him self into the jampacked supermarket to buy a turkey.

title: F. C. C. AUTHORIZES $145MILLION RISE IN PHONE CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22. The Federal Communications Commission decided today that the American Telephone and Telegraph Company should be permitted to earn at least an 8.5 per cent return immediate ly and as much as 9 per cent in the near future.

title: Nebraska vs. Oklahoma: Main Dish on Card Today
description: The national championship won't be at stake but the Big Eight football title will be when those two bitter rivals, Nebras ka and Oklahoma, clash in Me morial Stadium at Lincoln, Neb., today before an expected 76,000 fans and several hundred thou sands more on national tele vision.

title: FLEET HERE TESTS A NEW SMALL CAB
description: About 150 models of an experimental, smaller taxi cab have been in use here for about a month.

title: A CHICAGO RETRIAL TIED TO WIRETAPS
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 22  Secret Government wiretaps and elec tronic surveillance appeared to day to be major factors that the Justice Department would have to consider in deciding whether to seek a retrial of the Chicago conspiracy case.

title: Madison Square Garden Expects Drop in Profits
description: Earnings of the Madison Square Garden Corporation for the 1973 fiscal year ending May 31 will fall short of the $4 million, or 17 cents a share, net income shown in fiscal 1972, Irving Mitchell Felt, chairman and president, said at the an nual meeting yesterday.

title: Margin in Stock Purchases Is Raised to 65 From 55%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Federal Reserve Board an nounced today an increase in the margin requirement for purchasing stock to 65 per cent from 55 per cent.

title: Deepening Shadow
description: In sending a Harvard specialist in Asian affairs to jail for contempt of court, a Federal judge in Boston has all but wiped out the right of either newsmen or scholars to protect confidential sources of information before grand juries. He has also taken a long step toward legitimizing misuse of grand juries as instruments of political intimidation.

title: Musk: Hungarians Play
description: Ambient noise is a Carne gie Hall tradition. The rum ble of the subway train we have always had with us, and the occasional passing fire engine on West 56th Street. But a new hazard made its debut at the Hun garian State Symphony Orchestra's concert on Tues day night: a rock band per forming in the Carnegie Hall Cinema next door furnished an obbligato of thumps, transmitted by acoustic osmosis.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Royal Copenhagen Porce lain opened a handsome new retail shop on Madison Ave nue last week and it would seem that the architects have caught the Scandinavian mood very well.

title: Bridge: American Contract League In Midst of Lost Weekend
description: The American Contract Bridge League, the ruling body for 200,000 tournament players, is at present in limbo, somewhere between Green wich, Conn., and Memphis. The league's Connecticut headquarters were closed Wednesday and will reopen in Tennessee on Monday in a new building that is almost, but not quite, ready.

title: Miss Hawk Feted At Supper Dance
description: Miss Laura Stinson Hawk, daughter of Mrs, Thomas Powell Fowler Milbank of New York and William Hawk Jr. of Tulsa, Okla., was guest of honor last evening at a supper dance given by her mother and stepfather, Mr. Milbank, at their apartment here.

title: Soccer Game Postponed
description: LONDON, Nov. 23 (Reuters) The English Soccer League's First Division game between Newcastle United and Leicester City, scheduled for next Satur day, has been postponed be cause Leiester players have been hit by a virus infection.

title: Job Finding and Training By City to Be Overhauled
description: Human Resources Adminis trator Jule M. Sugarman yes terday ordered a really tough look for a major overhaul of the city's Manpower and Career Development Agency and the city's job efforts for welfare clients. Both are pro grams within his administration.

title: ASHE, OKKER GAIN ROME SEMIFINALS
description: ROME, Nov. 23With a blare of trumpets and the wav ing of a little red flag, Arthur Ashe and Tom Okker moved tonight into the semifinals of the $50,000 World Champion ship Tennis winter champion ship.

title: More Constellation Discharges
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 23 (UPI) Nearly onefourth of the dis sident sailors from the carrier Constellation are being dis charged, a Pacific Fleet spokes man said today.

title: COHEN 2YEAROLD FIRST AT LAUREL
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 23 Nathan L. Cohen's heavily cam paigned Lou Rosenbush took the overland route and pulled away in the final 16th of a mile for a 3length victory in the $25,700 Maryland Futur ity today at Laurel Race Course.

title: Protest Captures Demoiselle Mile at Aqueduct and Returns $20.40
description: For the first part of the $30,675 Demoiselle at Aque duct yesterday Protest of the Elmendorf interests scampered along at the head of the pack on the way to what appeared to be a onesided victory.

title: ABORTION BATTLE PUSHED IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  A cam Paign to reform the French abortion law was reinvigorated today after light sentences were pronounced on two wo man in a trial that had be come national controversy.

title: DUBLIN PRESSING ATTACK ON I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN Nov. 23The Irish Government, under British pressure for years to crack down on the Irish Republican Army, has now initiated a ma jor legal effort to curb the re bel organization.

title: LISBON REBUFFS THE U.N.ON AFRICA
description: LISBON, Nov. 23The Portu guese Government tonight re jected a United Nations resolu tion calling for negotiations on the independence of her African territories and said, Lisbon cannot abdicate without grave injustice and irreparable dam age to the populations of its provinces.

title: Rhodesia to Delete The Racial Clauses In Land Tenure Act
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 23The Rhodesian Government announced tonight that segre gationist clauses would be re moved from the Land Tenure Act, which threatened to end interracial worship, education and social services, provided by missions of various religious denominations.

title: SAILORS DESCRIBE RACIAL BATTLING
description: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii, Nov. 23 (UPI)Crewmen aboard the U.S.S. Kitty Hawk, which left here for San Diego today, said it took clubswinging ma rines to quell a bloody 15hour racial battle on the carrier last month.

title: Notes on People
description: The man who has spent more time in space than any other American is now plan ning another departure from the space program. Capt. James A. Lovell Jr., now dep uty director of the Science Application Directorate at the Manned Spacecraft Center and head of the President's Council on Physical Fitness, said in Houston he was ex ploring offers from compa nies there and in New York and Chicago. I'm looking at several possibilities, the as tronaut said, but nothing will happen before the end of Apollo 17 or the end of the year. Captain Lovell flew two Gemini missions and the explosionmarred Apollo 13 mission.

title: Stage: The Ridiculous Company's Musical Corn
description: Corn is a change of pace and of face for Charles Lud lam's Ridiculous Theatrical Company. Instead of the baroque grotesqueries of Bluebeard and Eunuchs of the Forbidden City, Ludlam now transports us to country western territory for a finger lickin good musical hoe down. The selfspoofing, ad mittedly cornpone, material does not liberate Ludlam's feverish playwright's imagi nationhe is more at home in Transylvania than on the farmbut it still provides a thoroughly enjoyable enter tainment.

title: MOVIELAB ACCORD ON BERKEY DEAL
description: Movielab, Inc., announced yesterday that it had agreed with Berkey Photo, Inc., to set tle all outstanding disputes and litigation, involving $15million, resulting from the sale by Berkey of its professional film processing and optical effects division to Movielab in June, 1969.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: ENGLEWOOD, Nov. 23On a bright but chilly day, most of the 30,000 residents of this commuter suburb celebrated Thanksgiving Day with the tra ditional family dinners and vis its. Many went to the Macy's parade in New York City or watched St. Cecilia High School beat its arch football rival, Englewood High, by a score of 10 to 6.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 23 (AP)A fourgame series between the Soviet Union's national champions and Western Hockey League teams has been announced by Bill MacFarland, W.H.L. president.

title: India Sends Army to Curb Violence Over Jobs
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 23  In dian Army troops have been rushed to assist the local po lice in Andhra Pradesh in south ern India to control an out break of violence over job dis crimination.

title: FEW FOUND GUILTY IN MIAMI ARRESTS
description: MIAMI, Nov. 23  Dade County has virtually closed its judicial books on the two na tional political conventions.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: HAWKS SET BACK SONICS, 110 10 97
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 23 (AP) Walt Bellamy scored a season high 33 points at the Atlanta Hawks defeated the Seattle Supersonics, 11097 in a Na tional Basketball Association game.

title: Mussolini's Son on Jazz Tour
description: His name is Romano Mus solini and he comes, as he says, from a musical fami ly. His father, Benito, loved classical music but the son is a jazz pianist, and the posters for his appearance at Town Hall at 8 tomorrow night bill him as Romano Mussolini, a legendary name in Italian jazz.

title: Vaguely Familiar Is First By 2 Lengths at Churchill
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 23 (AP)A. I. Appleton's Vaguely Familiar moved to the outside in the stretch under German Vasquez and went on to win the Pocahontas Stakes at Churchill Downs today.

title: Jessica Ann Dunsay Wed to Harry Silver
description: The marriage of Miss Jes sica Ann Dunsay to Harry Raymond Silver, both of whom are lawyers in Wash ington took place here last night in the Terrace on the Park in Flushing Meadows, Queens. Rabbi Sidney Sterling performed the ceremony.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WENTWORTH LOCATION, N. H.  More than an hour after sunset, one member of our deerhunting party, an experienced woodsman, had not returned to camp.

title: Nassau
description: Tom Capozzoli, a freshman, completed the first chapter in what could be four years of re writing records at St. Domi nick's yesterday when he passed, ran and kicked St. Dom's to a 340 victory over Holy Trinity.

title: BergenPassaic
description: Clifton defeated Passaic, 35 6, yesterday in Clifton and gave Bill VanderCloster his first un beaten season in nine years as head coach.

title: New Rules for Evidence Widen Judges' Discretion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  The new rules of evidence is sued for the Federal court sys tem by the Supreme Court this week give more discretion to judges to admit evidence in both civil and criminal cases where access had previously been restricted both by statute and court ruling.

title: Koyo Okada Is Dead at 77; Noted for Photos of Mt. Fuji
description: TOKYO, Nov. 23 (AP)Koyo Okada, popularly known as Mount Fuji's personal photogra pher, died yesterday of cancer of the gall bladder. He was 77 years old.

title: Big Parade Makes It Big Again
description: The mood of the crowd varied from the smugness of experi enced parade watchers around 77th Street and Central Park West, where the Thanksgiving Day parade started, to the im patience of thousands who waited in the cold shadows of midtown department stores, where the parade ended.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: EAST BERLIN  Erich Honecker, boss of East Germany, remains a con vinced, hardline Communist who isn't going to alter his oldtime religion by one jot even though he is prepared to get along with those who disagree.

title: Relief Rooming House, Scene of Shootout, Is Feared by Residents and Police
description: The only way you can safe ly enter 9 West 102d Street is to have a policeman chasing you, a black detective said yesterday, referring to the five story rooming house near Cen tral Park West where, on Wednesday, one woman was killed and three men were in jured in a shootout with police. And, he added, a policeman who went into the building wouldn't come out.

title: 51 Whooping Cranes Sighted
description: ARANSAS PASS, Tex., Nov. 23 (UPI)  Officials at the Aransas National Wildlife Ref uge said today that 51 whoop ing cranes, including five young ones, had been sighted at the birds' winter grounds.

title: Environmentalists Halt Building of a Private Dam
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov, 23  Urban environmentalists and public officials in a rural Alabama county have joined hands to halt construction by a real estate developer of a pri vate dam on a historic Alabama river.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Britain today paid out $150million to compensate Commonwealth countries whose international currency reserves have been slashed by the downward float of the pound.

title: AMERICAN ACCUSED OF PLOT IN MANILA
description: MANILA, Nov. 23A Gov ernment spokesman said today that an American citizen was involved in a plot to assassi nate President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: 81YearOld Chess Teacher Averts Career Stalemate
description: Listen, Agnes Agatha Robinson said, you don't put your big paw on it. A touch is a move. Right? Mrs. Robinson, looking fierce, ex pected an answer.

title: Advertising:
description: While costs on almost everything you can think of have been climbing, the price a photographer's or illustra tor's work commands at an ad agency hasn't changed in 20 years.

title: Art: Drummond Show at the Corcoran
description: WASHINGTONThe retro spective exhibition of paint ings by Sally Hazelet Drum mond, which Gene Baro has organized at the Corcoran Gallery of Art, is remarkable in several respects, and not the least remarkable of these, surely, is the way it illumin ates the changes that have overtaken abstract painting since Mrs. Drummond first began to exhibit her work in the nineteenfifties.

title: The Chicago Debacle
description: In reversing the five remaining convictions in the 1968 Chicago conspiracy case, the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit went to unusual lengths to expose the offensive and injudicial behavior of Judge Julius J. Hoffman in an offensive and injudicial trial.

title: MonmouthOcean
description: Brick Township and Manas quan, the two unbeaten foot ball teams at the Jersey shore, completed perfect seasons yes terday.

title: HAWKS SET BACK SONICS, 110 T0 97
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 23 (AP) Walt Bellamy scored a season high 33 points as the Atlanta Hawks defeated the Seattle Supersonics, 11097 toonight in a National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Burfoot Wins Road Race Fourth Time
description: MANCHESTER, Conn., Nov. 23 (AP)Bearded Amby Bur foot, a teacher from Mystic, Conn., outran John Vitale in the last halfmile today to win the 36th Thanksgiving Day fivemile road race in a record time of 22 minutes 21.9 seconds.

title: Personalities: Braves Feel Fine $100 Each
description: Jack Ramsay, whose ap proach to the game of bas ketball has been described as intense, gave his Buffalo Braves a reason to concen trate more on their chores following his team's 12488 defeat at the hands of the Baltimore Bullets. The Braves' coach levied a $100 fine on each of the 10 players.

title: OneDay Strike, Called Over Manning of a Supertrain, Halts British Railways
description: LONDON, Nov. 23  Britain suffered the agonies and incon veniences of a oneday national railroad strike today as a re sult of a complex dispute over a passenger train that is being developed to run at speeds around 150 miles an hour.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23Tickets for the first drawing in the state's new daily lottery, sched uled for next Wednesday, will go on sale in about 4,000 candy stores, bars and other retail outlets tomorrow.

title: TV: A.B.C. Presents First of Late Night Specials
description: Perhaps, just perhaps, tele vision programing could come to a halt each day around, midnight. The coun try might, Just might, sur vive without Carson, Cavett and old movies.

title: BIG MELLON TRUSTS IN GULF OIL OFFERING
description: The sellers in the Gulf Oil Corporation's $224million sec ondary stock offering were dis closed yesterday in a prelim inary prospectus filed with the Securities and Exchange Com mission.

title: Experts Foresee Small Draft Calls, If Any, Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  If there are any draft calls at all next year, they will be ex traordinarily small, possibly not even tapping the pool of men that first becomes eligible for conscription in January, accord ing to military manpower ex perts.

title: Visas for Ideas?
description: Well before the end of the 1970's, a major technological development is likely to revolutionize world communica tions. It takes the form of a new generation of communi cations satellites that will be able to transmit radio and television broadcasts directly to home receivers, eliminat ing steps which now put barriefs between satellite trans missions and mass audiences all over the world.

title: Irvine's 32 Points Help Squires Beat Cougars, 116 to 106
description: HAMPTON, Va., Nov. 23 (AP) George Irvine scored a ca reer high of 32 points and led the Virginia Squires to a 116 106 victory over the Carolina Cougars in the American Bas ketball Association tonight.

title: A Physician Asks Colleagues to Try The Patient's Role
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (AP) A Canadian doctor believes that physicians might better understand some of their patients' frustrations in ob taining medical care if they had some firsthand experi ence as patients themselves.

title: EDMUND J. KARR, SHIPPING LEADER
description: Edmund J. Karr, a leading shipping and port official here until his retirement in 1960 as chief marine executive of the Bethlehem Steel Company, died Wednesday night at his home in Chatham, N. J. He was 88 years old.

title: WHATABREEZE,32, SCORES AT CALDER
description: MIAMI, Nov. 23 (AP)  The ElceeH Stable's 3to2 favorite, Whatabreeze, led from start to finish in the $20,000added Alli gator Handicap at Calder Race Course today, holding off Royal and Regal to win by a half length.

title: Books of The Times
description: 62: A MODEL KIT. By Julio Cortdzar. Trans lated from the Spanish by Gregory Ra bassa. 281 pages, Pantheon, $6.98.

title: Marie Wilson, TV's Irma, Dies at 56
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 23  Marie Wilson, the buxom and studiously dumb blonde of the My Friend Irma television series, died today at her home here. She was 56 years old. The cause of her death was not dis closed. However, friends said she had undergone surgery for cancer several times.

title: Boston Theater Stage Burns
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)A three alarm fire today caused an estimated $5,000 damage to the stage area at the Aquarius Theater, formerly the Loew's Orpheum, on Washington Street, fire department officials reported. A fire department spokesman said cause of the fire had not been determined. There were no injuries reported.

title: Mo Bay, $27.20, Captures Handicap at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 23 (UPI)Augustin Stable's Mo Bay scored an upset halflength victory lady in the $20,000 added Garrison Handicap at Liberty Bell Park.

title: Truck Volume for Week Shows Increase of 10.1%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 The American Trucking Asso ciations, Inc., reports that inter city truck tonnage last week was 10.1 per cent above the 1971 level. Based on a weekly survey of 35 metropolitan areas, increased tonnage was reported at 29 localities.

title: Potential Speaker
description: Representative Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. of Massachusetts has got the inevitable infighting among Democrats of the 93d Congress off to a fast start. Mr. O'Neill has already announced his candidacy for the post of House majority leader, which appears to have been left vacant by the disappearance of Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana in an illfated airplane flight over Alaska.

title: Local
description: Jefferson stole some of Far Rockaway's glory yesterday by upsetting the new Public Schools Athletic League cham pion, 280, at Far Rockaway. The Sea Horses won the title last Saturday with a 2822 over time victory over Brooklyn Tech. Tech had eliminated Jef ferson, the defending P.S.A.L. champion, the previous week, also in overtime.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  In the brutal language of politics, not only men and women but words lose their reputations. The word appeasement, for example, was a casualty of the Second World War, and in the present struggle between freedom and author ity in America, permissive and per missiveness have come to mean a slackness of human character and a menace to the Republic.

title: DUBLIN PRESSING ATTACK ON I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 23The Irish Government, under British pressure for years to crack down on the Irish Republican Army, has now initiated a ma jor legal effort to curb the re bel organization.

title: PLAYGROUND IS SITE OF BLAST IN BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 23 (AP)A British soldier was badly wounded yesterday when he stepped on a home made mine in a children's play ground here that terrorists have turned into a mine field.

title: Remedy for Hospitals
description: WASHINGTONDo we, or do we not, want to abolish the discredited twoclass system of hospital. Gore? Do we, or do we not, want to restrain the rise in hospital costs and hospitaliza tion insurance for all patients?

title: Argentine Party Heads Meet at Peron's Suggestion to Seek a Pact
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 23  Civilian leaders representing the majority of Argentina's po litical parties met today at the suggestion of Juan D. Pern and began working out a com mon position to be put before the military Government,

title: JOHN D. MOORE
description: John D. Moore, sales man ager of Professional Data Serv ices, Inc., and former national sales manager of the United States Borax and Chemical Cor poration, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 301 East 47th Street. He was 55 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Nov. 23 (AP)Sitoshi Niimi of Japan hurled a twohitter today to hand the United States its first loss in the 20th world amateur baseball champion ship, 30. Niimi, tagged for 10 hits in six previous innings of the tournament, yielded singles to Kerry Dineen in the fourth inning and to Tom McMillan in the ninth,

title: AFRICANS EXTEND DEMAND ON FRANC
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  President Georges Pompidou has just an nounced the remission of $200 million (1 billion French francs) of debts owed by countries in French speaking Africa, but the Africans are demanding a good deal more from France without offering offsetting advantages.

title: HAITIANS END SALE OF PLASMA TO
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, Nov. 23 (UPI)The Government to day canceled a contract made with a United States company by Luckner Cambronne when he was Minister of Defense and Interior to sell Haitian blood plasma in the United States.

title: Louisiana Oil Group Is Planning Superport
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 23 (AP)  The Louisiana Off shore Oil Port has announced that it has signed an option to lease 1,450 acres of land in Lafourche Parish to build a $500million superport in the Gulf of Mexico by 1976.

title: Severinsen's Father Dies
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 23 (UPI)Dr. Carl S. Severinsen, a dentist and father of Doc Severinsen, the bandleader, died here today, apparently of a heart circulation problem. He was 75 years old and was said to be the oldest practicing den tist in Oregon. Besides his son, he is survived by his widow.

title: Rockland Democratic Chief Says She Expects Party Gains in '73
description: WEST NYACK, N.Y.Dem ocratic leaders elsewhere in the state may still be licking their Election Day wounds, but the Democratic chairman of Rockland County, where Senator George McGovern got only 35 per cent of the vote, is back at work full time on a plan for a local Democratic takeover in 1973.

title: Protestant Church of Berlin Is Officiall Divided
description: BERLIN, Nov. 23  In the wake of the decision by West Germany and East Germany to recognize each other as sepa rate states through a treaty, the Evangelical, or Protestant, Church of the Berlin area has been split into east and west.

title: Restaurant Unions Reach Accord Here
description: Tentative agreements that would end the twoweekold restaurant strike were reached last night by negotiators for management and the striking waiters' and kitchen workers' unions.

title: Boy, 16, Dies in Shootout
description: TIPP CITY, Ohio, Nov. 23 (UPI)A 16yearold boy was killed last night in a shootout with law enforcement officers after he and a companion had allegedly shot and killed a Miami County sheriff's deputy. Deputy Sgt. William Morris was shot on a rural road where the two boys were spotted try ing to steal a car from a farm home.

title: Operating Problems Cited
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System faces serious operating problems in keeping its tele vision programs on the air, but it has not yet suffered any fi nancial losses despite a 21day strike by the union of its tech nicians, Arthur R. Taylor, the network's president, said yes terday.

title: Park Plan Weighed for Boston Islands
description: BOSTON, Nov. 22  The Massachusetts Legislature will be asked in January to approve plans for a project that would turn 30 islands in Boston Har bor into one of the most un usual park systems in the country.

title: North Carolina Bill Seeks Wide Powers To Preserve Coast
description: DURHAM, N. C., Nov. 23 (AP)The 1973 General Assem bly will be presented with a bill giving the state sweeping pow ers to control future develop ment of the North Carolina coast.

title: Sovietto Test Rockets at Sea
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23 (Reuters) The Soviet Union will begin a series of rocket tests in the Pacific next Saturday, Tass the official press agency, announced tonight.

title: Stage: Leers, Love Songs and Lunacy
description: There is a most engaging madness to Doctor Selavy's Magic Theater, which opened last night at the Mercer Arts Center. It is, in Tact, a musical about aliena tion and its therapy. It is all about who is crazy now and what can be done about it.

title: Alive If Not Well
description: New Yorkers, reading the report of a group of Columbia University social scientists, will be relieved to be told that their city is still very much alive. Perhaps the greatest contribution of the recently pub licized study by Dr. Eli Ginzberg and his colleagues is just this reassurance that while New York has some grim problems to solve it still has countervailing assets and some reason to think that the worst is over.

title: Violent LifeStyle Seems to Revive in Rural Brazil
description: RECIFE, Brazil, Nov. 19 The Sampaios and the Alen cars have signed a peace treaty, but hardly anyone believes that this is the end of the blood feud that has plagued the two families for nearly a quarter of a century.

title: DOLE DETERMINED TO KEEP PARTY JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23At a meeting this week of Repub lican state chairmen from the South, Senator Robert J. Dole wound up his discussion of the party's achievements and pros pects by stating his firm inten tion of staying on as chairman of the National Committee.

title: BRUINS TOP SEALS AS ORR SCORES 2
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)  Bobby Orr, flashing much of the form that has earned him the National Hockey League's most valuable player award the last three years, scored a pair of goals tonight in sparking the Boston Bruins to a 42 victory over the California Golden Seals.

title: BOLIVIA DECLARES A STATE OF SIEGE IN PROTEST STRIKE
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 23  President Hugo Banzer Surez imposed a state of siege through out Bolivia today, asserting there was an open conspiracy to overthrow his 15monthold rightwing Government.

title: 49ers Turn Back Cowboys, 31 to 10
description: DALLAS, Nov. 23The San Francisco 49ers, who have been staggering through the Na tional Football League this season like a lot of other teams, walked straight out of Texas Stadium tonight tall and erect. They had beaten the Dallas Cowboys, 3110, playing superior football of the kind that wins big games in the playoff stretch.

title: Joseph A. Meehan, 55, Is Dead; Long a Leading Wall St. Figure
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Nov. 23  Joseph Ansbro Meehan, vice chairman of Henderson Brothers, one of Wall Street's leading specialist firms, died today, apparently of a heart attack, at Adare, his country estate on First Neck Lane here. He was 55 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In your Nov. 15 issue, Walter E. Williams wrote: The underlying cause of the problem in inner city schools has as its roots, quite simply, poverty,

title: CITY TO KEEP USING WELFARE HOTELS
description: Despite the crime and other problems associated with sin gleroom occupancy buildings, two top city officials say, 2,500 welfare recipients will continue to be sent each month into such facilities.

title: RUMANIA PROTESTS AT HELSINKI TALKS
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 23 Rumania created a deadlock today during the first working session of preparatory talks for a projected European security conference.

title: Miss Cushing Is Bride Of Philip King Howard
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Nov. 23 Miss Alexandra Olivia Cochrane Cushing and Philip King Howard were married here today in the Episcopal Church of the Advent. The Rev. Herbert H. Beardsley, the rector, performed the ceremony, assisted by the bridegroom's father, the Rev. John R. Howard, a retired Presbyterian minister of Knoxville, Tenn.

title: ERICKSON FIRES 66 TO LEAD HERITAGE
description: HILTON HEAD, S. C., Nov. 23 On a cold gray day suitable for thermal underwear, hand warmers and doublesweaters, Bob Erickson of Columbia, S. C., led with a 66 today in the $125,000 Heritage Golf Classic.

title: NATO Technology Aims to Close Arms Gap
description: War's new technology, rang ing from lasers to pilotless bombers, impresses United States and European defense authorities as a possible answer to the Warsaw Pact's superior ity in tanks and aircraft in Cen tral Europe.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I'm from out of town and not fa miliar with your bus system. I would like to commend an unknown bus driver driving bus No. 3434 on Wed nesday the 8th of November.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Considering the great crowds walk ing on Fifth Avenue every day and the inadequate sidewalk space now exist ing, let us hope that when those 144 threefoot concrete tubs are removed for replanting it will be decided not to put them back. Let's face it, there just isn't room for them, and having to detour around them is a constant annoyance. They do not belong on the sidewalk of any crowded street today.

title: Fumes Fell 7 in a Garage After Parade
description: Panic broke out yesterday as carbon monoxide from backed up lines of cars filled the Lin coln Center garage and seven children were overcome in a grim aftermath to the Thanks giving Day parade.

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH THO 6 HOURS ON VIETNAM TRUCE
description: PARIS, Nov. 23Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho met for six hours today in continu ing efforts to complete an agreement for a ceasefire in Vietnam.

title: Oklahoma Defeats Nebraska by 1714
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Nov. 23 Oklahoma stopped Nebraska's elusive roadrunner, Johnny Rodgers, and spoiled Coach Bob Devaney's goingaway party with a 1714 victory over the Cornhuskers today.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Student Drive to Save Church Fails

title: Advertising:
description: For its article on the financial failure of Lennen & Newell, Credit and Financial Management, the publication of the National Association of Credit Management, inter viewed Adolph Tiogo, who headed Lennen while it sank, William C. Lyddan, who tried to make a lastminute rescue, and John D. Spiers, the chief financial officer.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: STATELINE, Nev., Nov. 23 (AP)Video Techniques, Inc., has been named to produce and distribute the closed circuit telecast of the world heavyweight championship boxing match between Joe Frazier, the champion, and George Foreman, Henry A. Schwartz, executive vice presi dent of the firm, announced today. The heavyweights meet in a Scheduled 15round outdoor bout in Kingston, Jamaica, next Jan. 22.

title: KENNEDY AND JAVITS BACK ATLANTIC TIES
description: BONN, Nov. 23  Leading Democrats and Republicans, led by Senators Edward M. Kennedy and Jacob K. Javits, took the rostrum at the North Atlantic Assembly here today to call for a renewal of trans Atlantic ties between the Uni ted States and Western Europe.

title: Experts Foresee Small Draft Calls, If Any, Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 If there are any draft calls at all next year, they will be ex traordinarily small, possibly not even tapping the pool of men that first becomes eligible for conscription in January, accord ing to military manpower ex perts.

title: U.S. SHIFT HINTED ON CULEBRA STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The Navy is keeping open thc pos sibility that Culebra, a small island with 850 residents off Puerto Rico, will remain a naval and aerial gunnery range indefinitely despite Administra tion assurances that a new site would be found by the end of 1972.

title: Nixon Returns to Capital After Camp David Holiday
description: CAMP DAVID, Md., Nov. 23 (AP)  President Nixon unex pectedly decided to return to Washington tonight after a Thanksgiving family gathering at Camp David that included turkey dinner and televised football games.

title: Market Place: How Leverage Helps Chrysler
description: Traders with a sense of history must find it a bit hard to believe Chrysler these days. The stock of the No. 3 auto maker set a 1972 high on Wednesday when it touched 40. It closed at 40, up one on the day and was the most actively traded issue with a 468,400share turnover.

title: Local
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Nov. 23East Rockaway, with a strong defense led by a 5foot 6Inch safety, Louis Tufone, de feated Eastern Military Aca demy, 186, today and took the Metropolitan Football League title with a 70 wonlost record. E.M.A. finished with six vic tories and two defeats.

title: U.S. War Losses in Week Put at One Killed, 2 Injured
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam (AP)One American was killed in combat last week, two died of nonhostile causes and two were wounded, the United States command reported. to day.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 23  Like most cities around the country, New Brunswick has problems that run the gamut of social life  crime, drug abuse, lack of housing, unemployment, businesses moving out of the downtown areas and an over burdening property tax struc ture. But unlike many cities, New Brunswick has problems that are almost manageable.

title: MorrisSomerset
description: Bound Brook completed an unbeaten season yesterday with an 18.0 home victory over Somerville to lengthen its un beaten string to 18 games.

title: SCHOOL FOOTBALL
description: THIELLS, N. Y., Nov. 23 North Rockland stretched its winning streak to 27the long est in Rockland County Public Schools Athletic League his tory  overcoming Clarkstown North, 140, today. The Red Raiders, who have lost only three times in the last five years, completed their third straight allwinning season for the 101st career victory for Ralph Cordisco in 17 seasons as head coach.

title: Music: Ceci Plays Entire Partita No. 2
description: Jesse Ceci asked no quar ter in his recital at Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night. The violinist, a former member of the Boston Sym phony Orchestra and the New York Philharmonic who now is on the New York University faculty, plays his instrument with the precision of a fine craftsman, and he obviously felt no need to dodge pitfalls.

title: ST. CECILIA HONORED IN CONCERT OF ODES
description: The Pennsylvania Pro Musica presented a St. Cedilla day concert at the New York Cul tural Center Wednesday night paying due honor to the patron saint of music. Framing the pro gram of Renaissance and Ba roque choral and instrumental music were two celebrated St. Cecilian odes: Look Down, Harmonious Saint by Handel and Purcell's Laudate Cecil iam.

title: DR. CLEMENT A. SMITH
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Nov. 23 (UPI)Dr. Clement A. Smith, professor of radiology at the West Virginia University Medi cal Center, died, apparently of a heart attack, yesterday. He was 58 years old.

title: Business Briefs
description: The International Controls Corporation, complying with Securities and Exchange Commission rules that a change in auditors must be made public, says that it had retained Laventhol, Krekstein, Horwath & Horwath as its new auditor.

title: Business Briefs
description: Wall Street executives, still relaxing after a festive Thanksgiving Day holiday, were reluctant to comment yesterday on the Federal Reserve Board's announcement of an increase in the margin requirement for the purchase of stock to 65 per cent from the former level of 55 per cent.

title: THE PAREE CINEMA STILL IN BUSINESS
description: A midtown massage parlor and sexmovie theater was still in business yesterday despite a statement on Wednesday by Rockefeller Center, the princi pal landlord, that an agreement had been reached to close the place.

title: RECOVERY IS SLOW IN NEW YORK AREA
description: The New York metropolitan area is not responding nearly so promptly nor so strongly to the national economic recov ery as in the past, according to the First National City Bank.

title: Hearing on Coast Is Told of Slaying Of Two Cyclists
description: RICHMOND, Calif., Nov. 23 (AP)  An allnight drug orgy of a Hell's Angels gang began with LSDspiked drinks and ended in the fatal beating and strangling of two motorcyclists from Georgia according to an informant who was granted im munity from prosecution.

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH THO 6 HOURS ON VIETNAM TRUCE
description: PARIS, Nov. 23Henry A. Kissinger and Le Due Tho met for six hours today in continu ing efforts to complete an agreement for a ceasefire in Vietnam.

title: HEAVY B52 RAIDS CONTINUE IN NORTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Nov. 24  The south ern part of North Vietnam came under heavy bombing by United States planes again yesterday, with highflying B52's carrying the major burden as bad weather cut strikes by fighter bombers.

title: Carl A. Scupin, 71, Dead; Associate of Eisenhowers
description: ABILENE, Kan., Nov. 23 (AP) Carl Albert Scupin, business adviser to the Eisenhowers and the guiding force behind one of the largest nonBell tele phone systems in the country, died here yesterday at the age 71.

title: Observing the Peace
description: Canada is showing justifiable reserve in engaging itself in the Vietnam ceasefire supervisory task, along with Indonesia, Hungary and Poland, before clear and effective ground rules can be defined and accepted by all parties involved. From the start Dr. Kissinger has acknowledged the difficulty of the supervisory task. At best it will be a delicate job, at less than best it will be futile.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 23 (AP)  Middlesex County au thorities are searching for a 35 yearold Unitarian minister ac cused of embezzling $112,000 from the county's Family Coun seling Service.

title: Big Parade Makes It Big Again
description: The mood of the crowd varied from the smugness of experi enced parade watchers around 77th Street and Central Park West, where the Thanksgiving Day parade started, to the im patience of thousands who waited in the cold shadows of midtown department stores, where the parade ended.

title: Cougars Overpower Nationals, 81
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23 (UPI) The Chicago Cougars scored five straight goals in the open ing 16 minutes of play tonight and coasted to an 81 victory over the Ottawa, Nationals in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Fumes Fell 7 in a Garage After Parade
description: Panic broke out yesterday as carbon monoxide from backed up lines of cars filled the Lin coln Center garage and seven children were overcome in a grim aftermath to the Thanks giving Day parade.

title: HEAVY B52 RAIDS CONTINUE IN NORTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Nov. 24  The south ern part of North Vietnam came under heavy bombing by United States planes again yesterday, with highflying B52's carrying the major burden as bad weather cut strikes by fighter bombers.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: MAHWAH, N. J., Nov. 23  In its second year of existence, Ramapo College has developed a sports program that provides some 2,000 students with activities from archery to karate to skiing to weightlifting.

title: Restaurant Unions Reach Accord Here
description: Tentative agreements that would end the twoweekold restaurant strike were reached last night by negotiators for management and the striking waiters' and kitchen workers' unions.

title: BISHOP PAUL HERRICK
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Nov. 23 (AP) The Rev. Paul M. Herrick, retired United Methodist Bishop of Virginia, died at his home here early today. He was 74 years old.

title: Gas Blast Rips Georgia Plant; 2 Killed, Damage at $1Million
description: CLAXTON, Ga., Nov. 23 (UPI)A gas explosion demol ished a huge poultry processing plant before dawn today, bury ing members of a holiday work crew under slabs of concrete and chunks of steel.

title: Inmates and Entertainers Mix at Ossining Prison
description: OSSINING, N.Y., Nov. 22 Inmates and entertainers, men and women, mingled onstage and backstage today at a four hour preThanksgiving Day program at the Ossining Cor rectional Facility. It was the first time this had happened in the 144 years since the prison  which used to be called Sing Sing  was completed.

title: New Rules for Evidence Widen Judges' Discretion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  The new rules of evidence is sued for the Federal court sys tem by the Supreme Court this week give more discretion to judges to admit evidence in both civil and criminal cases where access had previously been restricted both by statute and court ruling.

title: Works of Soviet Artist Surface in Tbilisi
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R.  With scribbled directions passed from hand to hand in the absence of official informa tion, scores of foreign visitors have made their way up a quiet side street here and found the prolific and essen tially unknown output of an abstract Georgian painter whose life illustrates the suf focating pressures that some unorthodox artists have con fronted in this country.

title: Music: Juilliard Quartet Begins a Beethoven Cycle
description: Year after year the Juilliard String Quartet goes on, and all of a sudden it is one of the oldest in the business, even though Robert Mann, its leader, still has a baby face. The illustrious foursome started a Beethoven cycle on Wednesday night at the Hun ter College Playhouse, giving the first of six concerts de voted to the 16 quartets, the Grosse Fuge and two other works thrown in for good measure.

title: Ambassador to Close
description: Ambassador, a new mu sical starring Howard Keel and Danielle ?? is tentative ly scheduled to close after Sat urday evening's show, after 9 performances, unless there is an increase in sales at the LuntFontanne Theater, at 205 West 46th Street.

title: Oslo Says That Object In Fjord Is Not a Sub
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 23 (AP)  The Norwegian De fense Command announced today that a mysterious ob ject lurking in the depths of a Norwegian fjord was not a foreign submarine, as was first believed.

title: Walter Brennan in Hospital
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Nov. 23 (AP)Walter Brennan, the 78yearold actor, is recov ering satisfactorily at Cottage Hospital here after surgery to correct an intestinal ailment. He was taken ill while working on Walt Disney's The Love Bug Rides Again.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Jon Matlack of the Mets and Carbon Fisk of the Red Sox have been elected by a committee of baseballwriting experts as the top rookies in their respective leagues. They are admirable choices. As a lefthanded pitcher of acknowl edged ability Matlack kept the tailspin of the Mets from going completely out of control. As a catcher of boundless potentiality Fisk lit a fire under the Bosox, generating so much heat that the Red Sox even made a run for the pennant. Here arc two superb young ballplayers, each at the start of careers that should be notable. Although becoming rookie of the year does not necessarily guarantee eventual designa tion as a superstar, many have made the trip some all the way to the top and others most of the way. Among them have been Jackie Robinson, Willie Mays, Frank Robinson, Pete Rose, Dick Allen, Tom Seaver, Johnny Bench and others.

title: Collusion in Strike Charged
description: The business manager of the technicians union on strike against the Columbia Broad casting System charged yester day that in taking the strike, C. B. S is acting in collusion with the other networks to break the back of the union hold on the television and ra dio industry.

title: Lovely Smile Lincoln Victor
description: LINCOLN, R.I., Nov. 23 (AP) Lovely Smile won the fea tured $4,000 Thanksgiving Day Purse at Lincoln Downs today, scoring by a neck in a field of nine. The winner of the five furlong sprint paid $14.80 for $2 to his backers in a crowd of 7,118.

title: Suffolk
description: Sayville completed an unde feated season yesterday and established a county season scoring record by overwhelm ing Bayport, 420. It was the ninth straight victory for the Golden Flashes, who extended a twoseason unbeaten string to 16 games. Sayville accumu lated 377 points during the sea son, surpassing the 339 points on a sevengame schedule set by Amityville in 1950.

title: EssexHudson
description: Barringer crushed East Orange 360, yesterday in East Orange to win its 21st straight game over the last three seasons.Five different players scored touchdowns to spark the of fense.

title: A Vogue for FirstClass Russian Dishes
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmos phere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Operating Problems Cited
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System faces serious operating problems in keeping its tele vision programs on the air, but it has not yet suffered any fi nancial losses despite a 21day strike by the union of its tech nicians, Arthur R. Taylor, the network's president, said yes terday.

title: EXCONGRESSMAN HUNTS FOR WORK
description: OMAHA, Nov. 23  Glenn Cunningham started his career in public life as a city council man and a member of the school board. He was elected Mayor of Omaha in the early nineteenfifties, then went to Congress, where he served seven terms in the House until his defeat two years ago in a Republican primary.

title: U.S. Investors Accept Mexico's Policy
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 23 The Mexican Government is making it clear that it will want greater Government par ticipation with foreigners who want to invest here. But after a month of major policy state ments to that effect, key Amer ican business spokesmen say they still believe Mexico re mains an attractive investment possibility.

title: Compact ColorTV Tube Is Generating New Fight
description: History appears to be repeat ing itself in the color television industry.

title: Utah State Triumphs
description: LOGAN, Utah, Nov. 23 (UPI) Mickey Doyle, filling in for injured Tony Adams, ran for one touchdown, passed for a second and kicked two field goals today to account for all his team's points in Utah State's 2016 victory over Weber State.

title: Lazar Compares Taxi Service Here With Europe's, and Finds It Doesn't
description: When it comes to taxi service, New York City is hopelessly behind the big European cities in many re spects, Michael J. Lazar, the chairman of the Taxi and Limousine Commission, said the other day. Mr. Lazar spent three weeks studying taxi problems in London, Paris and Rome last summer and has just completed his report to Mayor Lindsay.

title: There is no precedent for the slanders he visited upon the character of the President.
description: I hated him so much I lost my sense of balance. Of the Republican candidate in 1964, Mr. McGovern had said, I regard Mr. Goldwater as the most unstable radical and extremist ever to run for the Presidency. When, after a half century of service, J. Edgar Hoover died in his sleep, Mr. McGovern summed up his sentiments thus: Hoover had lived beyond the normal years, so I couldn't feel the pathos I would for a young man. I could feel nothing but relief that he was no longer a public servant. I thought he had become a menace to justice. And when his Democratic colleague and primary opponent Henry Jackson spoke out against forced busing, the great healer was there to charge him with embracing racism.

title: Seoul Charter Won 91 % Vote
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 23The Central Election Man agement Committee announced today that 91.5 per cent of the South Koreans who cast ballots in Tuesday's national referen dum voted for a new constitu tion. The new constitution clears the way for President Park Chung Hee to stay in of fice indefinitely.

title: Bay State Prison Quiet
description: CONCORD, Mass., Nov, 23 (UPI)The Massachusetts Cor rectional Institution here was quiet today after three days of unrest in which 14 prisoners escaped. Only one has been recaptured.

title: The Night Many on 77th St. Don't Sleep
description: It was 7 A.M. yesterday when Albert Bronson, who lives at 40 West 77th Street, woke up and looked out of his window and saw Smokey the Bear look ing right back at him.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Yale meets Harvard in The Game tomorrow at Cam bridge, Mass., and as far as the Yale seniors are con cerned this is their last chance to upend the Crimson.

title: The Screen:Chekhov Plants Seeds for 'Belated Flowers'
description: A very young writer at the beginning of his career and an elderly film maker, nearing the end of his, reach a lovely, tactful kind of accord in "Belated Flowers," based on the novella that Chekhov wrote in 1882, when he was 22, and now made into a film by Abram Room, who is 78.The novella, more evocatively titled "Late-Blooming Flowers" in the translation by I. C. Chertok and Jean Gardner, is a gently comic, bourgeois fairy tale about the redemptive love of the beautiful, consumptive and flatbroke Princess Marusya Priklonsky for the vain, hugely ambitious Dr. Toporkov, who'd once been a bootboy in the Priklonsky palace.The Priklonskys are at the end of their rope when the doctor comes back into their lives, though he scarcely remembers the name when he visits the palace to treat young Prince Yegorushka for delirium tremens. The old princess frets about the doctor's arrogance and wishes that he weren't so ill-born. He is, she knows, a catch. The young prince thinks the doctor is a bore and the young princess falls madly in love with him.Time passes. A disreputable old matchmaker comes by and suggests that the doctor would marry Marusya if she could produce a dowry of 60,000 rublesthe sum the doctor needs to acquire a fine new house. It's an unthinkable amount, and the doctor, instead, marries the daughter of a wealthy trademan.More time passes. The Priklonsky palace and possessions are lost to debtors. The old princess dies. The young prince acquires a rude, noisy mistress, and Marusya slips farther into a consumption that finally breeds its own kind of emotional antibodies. One day she goes to the doctor's office, pays her five-ruble fee and confesses to the amazed man that she loves him desperately.The doctor, whose entire life until then has been devoted to money, is transformed. Although it's too late to save Marusya, he takes her on an idyllic holiday to the South of France and, later, when last we see him, he is still making as much money as he can, but now he has taken the ridiculous, dissolute prince into his household, to feed and care for him and to indulge his whims. Writes Chekhov: "Yegorushka's chin reminds [the doctor] of Marusya's chin, and because of this he allows Yegorushka to squander his five-ruble notes. . . ."Abram Room, who was a pupil of Kuleshov, is known in this country almost exclusively for his 1927 silent film, "Bed and Sofa," and for "The Garnet Bracelet," which was shown here in 1967 without creating any interest whatever. Compared with other great early Soviet directors, all of whom he has outlived, he is a most conservative director, yet the conservativism of "Belated Flowers" has the effect of being spectacular today.The film is conceived almost as if it were a theatrical piece. Sets never seem to have more than three sides, and it's a shock when the director occasionally turns his camera to show us the fourth wall. Most of the scenes are photographed in soft focus, in medium long-shots, through wide-angle lenses that have the effect of distorting perspective in such a way that we feel as if we're looking at a world enclosed in a glass sphere, as if it were in an antique paperweight. There's very little cutting so that even the slightest movement of the camera becomes somehow a momentous gesture, the visual equivalent of the emotions that rock the ill-fated princess.Not all of Room's decisions are happy. I could have done without the passages from Berlioz's Symphonie Fantastique, even though in the opening credits he makes the courtly acknowledgement that this music has helped him to interpret the story. The performances, however, are charming, as is the deference with which this venerable old director, handles an early work by a man whose youthful romanticism was disciplined by a humane irony that more mature writers seldom achieve."Belated Flowers" opened yesterday at the Regency Theater.

title: Optimism on Christmas MaiI
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI) A spokesman for the Govern ment's mail delivery system voiced confidence today that Cristmas mail would reach its destination with a minimum of delay, despite the usual crush. We can give prompt service if mailers get their goods on the path promptly, Herbert Wurth of the Postal Service said in an interview.

title: CITY TO KEEP USING WELFARE HOTELS
description: Despite the crime and other problems associated with sin gleroom occupancy buildings, two top city officials say, 2,500 welfare recipients will continue to be sent each month into such facilities.

title: Mrs. Natalie Owings Married To Leon J. Luey, a Teacher
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 23 Mrs. Natalie Owings was married here this afternoon to Leon James Luey, a teach er of higher mathematics at the City College of San Fran cisco, The Rev. Harry Schole field performed the ceremony at the First Unitarian Church.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The history of our part in the con flict in Vietnam will soon begin to be written and most scribes will un doubtedly call this war unpopular and senseless. There is no doubt that it is unpopular, but the many truths about Vietnam should not be obscured just because people do not like this fight. The fact remains that our pres ence in Vietnam has slowed the advance of Communism.

title: Louisiana Blacks Urged to Continue Campus Struggle
description: LETTSWORTH, La., Nov. 23 (AP)Speaking today at the funeral of a student killed last week in a confrontation with the police on the Southern Uni versity campus, the field direc tor of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference urged Louisiana blacks to keep that struggle going at the school.

title: Grandparent and Child: They Need Each Other
description: WOODBRIDGE, N. J.La mont, who is severely re tarded mentally and handi capped physicallyhe has never walked or learned to talk and looks more like a delicate 8yearold as he sits in his wheelchair than the 14yearold he ishad be gun to respond to his pre tend grandmother.

title: Using the Leftovers
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: 5 Killed in Crash in Ohio
description: McCONNELSVILLE, Ohio, Nov. 23 (UPI)Five persons, four of them members of one family, were killed today in a twocar headon crash on Ohio Route 266, south of this south eastern Ohio Community. State troopers identified those killed as Marlowe D. Sells, 43 years old, of Marietta; and four mem bers of the Earnsworth family Bonnie, 18; Phyllis 10; Ann, 16, all of Coal Run; and Ronald, 22, of Marietta.

title: BOLIVIA DECLARES A STATE OF SIEGE IN PROTEST STRIKE
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 23  President Hugo Banzer Suarez imposed a state of siege through out Bolivia today, asserting there was an open conspiracy to overthrow his 15monthold rightwing Government.

title: BRITAIN EXPANDS AID FOR CONCORDE
description: LONDON, Nov. 23The Gov ernment today again increased its commitment to the Con corde, the controversial 1,300 mileperhour airliner, raising to $822million the amount it is willing to lend the British Air craft Corporation to finance production of the plane.

title: News Analysis
description: LONDON, Nov. 23The com bination of the two most com bustible issues in British politi cal life  colored immigration and the Common Markethas painfully scorched the Conser vative Government of Prime Minister Heath.

title: British Trawlers in Clash With Icelandic Fishing Boats
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Nov. 23 (Reuters)A group of British trawlers clashed with Icelandic fishing boats today after an Icelandic gunboat cut the trawl wires of one of them, the Ice landic Coast Guard announced.

title: Mrs. Streit Gets Golf Honorl
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23 (Canadian Press)Mrs. Marlene Stewart Streit of Stouffville, Ont., has been named the country's top woman golfer for 1972 by the Canadian Ladies Golf Associa tion.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 23 (Reuters) Harold Henning of South Africa shot a 68 today and took the lead after two rounds of the South African Professional Golfers Association championship with a total of 137.

title: Surge in Durables Buying Continues, Survey Shows
Letters to the Editor
description: Senator McGovern's defeat may be viewed as a classic example of the politics of resentment.

title: Lay Catholics Give Communion Here
description: Roman Catholic parishioners will be receiving holy com munion from laymen at a church in Brooklyn's Williams burg section from now on, and the practice is likely to spread.

title: Chairman Formally Named By Chemical New York
description: The Chemical New York Cor poration, together with its prin cipal subsidiary, the Chemical Bank, announced yesterday the formal election of Donald C. Platten as chairman of the board, Norborne Berkeley Jr., as president and chief admin istrative officer, and Richard K. LeBlond 2d, as vice chairman.

title: Irvine's 32 Points Help Squires Beat Cougars, 116 to 106
description: HAMPTON, Va., Nov. 23 (AP) George Irvine scored a ca reer high of 32 points and led the Virginia Squires to a 116 106 victory over the Carolina Cougars in the American Bas ketball Association tonight.

title: Six Presented at the Gotham Ball
description: The 23d annual Gotham Ball was held last night in the Plaza's Grand Ballroom for the benefit of the New York Foundling Hospital.

title: Hemophiliac Bill Voted
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 23 (UPI)The Pennsylvania House has unanimously passed a bill setting up a pilot program to Treat hemophiliacs. The bill gives the Health Department $250,000 to start the program of treatment and blood donor recruitment.

title: DR. RANKO BRASHICH, LAWYER HERE, DIES
description: Dr. Ranko M. Brashich, an international lawyer and a leader in the SerbianAmerican community, died Wednesday at the Eastern Long Island Hospi tal in Greenport. He was 62 years old and lived in New Suffolk, L. I.

title: Koreans to Play in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23 (Canadian Press)The South Korean na tional volleyball teams have accepted an invitation by the Canadian Volleyball Association to play a series of exhibition games in Canada. The women's team will play in the Vancouver and Victoria areas Dec. 1620, the men's team in Vancouver, Dec, 17. Calgary, Dec. 18, and Edmonton, Dec. 19.

title: COUGARS DEFEAT NATIONALS, 8 TO 1 Score Five Goals in Opening 16 Minutes at Ottawa
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23 (UPI) The Chicago Cougars scored five straight goals in the open ing 16 minutes of play tonight and coasted to an 81 victory over the Ottawa Nationals in a World Hockey Association game.

title: City and State Seek to Aid Knickerbocker Hospital
description: City and state officials were reported yesterday to be work ing on a plan to stave off the financial collapse of Knicker bocker Hospital, the only volun tary hospital serving the Har lem community.

title: Meany Hospitalized Again After Slight Chest Pains
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y. Nov. 23 (AP)George Meany, the labor leader, was admitted to Phelps Memorial Hospital for observa tion today after suffering slight chest pains, a hospital spokesman said.

title: Collusion in Strike Charged
description: The business manager of the technicians union on strike against the Columbia Broad casting System charged yester day that in taking the strike, C. B. S is acting in collusion with the other networks to break the back of the union hold on the television and ra dio industry.

title: Markets Were Closed
description: Domestic securities and com modities markets were closed yesterday for the Thanksgiving Day holiday. Banks and Gov ernment offices also were closed. Canadian and London markets, however, remained open. Securities markets are open for business today except for the New York Mercantile Exchange and Chicago Mer cantile Exchange, which remain closed until Monday.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Subway Changes Announced

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Recent reports in The Times about the outbreak of disease at the Day croft School in Greenwich, Conn., omitted several points of relevance and reassurance.

title: Ship to Load Soviet Grain
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)An 810footlong freighter, the first American ship to haul part of the 17 million tons of United States grain bought by the So viet Union, will begin loading tomorrow at the Port of Hous ton. The 65,532ton National Defender, moored at the Union Equity Company grain elevator, will load under a new shipping rate formula worked out yes terday in Washington.

title: Florida NoFault Insurance Law Seen Speeding Claim Payments
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 23 (AP)As nofault insurance nears the end of its first year in Florida, the officials who administer the law say that it has been overwhelmingly suc cessful in bringing about prompt payment of claims and in taking most accident cases out of the courts.

title: WILLIAM M'ELWAIN OF JERSEY LIGHT CO.
description: William H. McElwain, who retired in 1969 as president of the Jersey Central Power and Light, Company and of the New Jersey Power and Light Com pany, died Tuesday in Philips burg in the Dutch Antilles, while on vacation. He was 68 years old and lived at 120 Fieldstone Drive in Basking Ridge, N. J.

title: Progress Cited in Talks On Coast Shipping Strike
description: Union negotiators reported progress here yesterday in talks to end a fourweek strike of deck officers that has tied up 34 ships on the West Coast.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Dr. Scribner continues to astound me. After three years of his reforms, first the Fleischmann Commission and now the yearly schoolranking report have shown that reading skills in our schools have fallen from the bad to the disastrous.

title: Sabres Rally to Set Back Rangers First Time, 53
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 23Joe Cro zier, whose young Buffalo Sabres finished 29 points away from the final playoff spot last season, has one overriding am bition this seasonto make the playoffs.

title: 2 BUFFALO YOUTHS SEIZED IN KILLING
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 23Two teenaged youths were in cus tody today as a result of gang warfare here in which two youths were killed.

title: Business Briefs
description: FREDERICTON, New Brunswick, Nov. 23 (Canadian Press)An appeal involving dissident shareholders and the former chairman of Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., Robert Vesco, has been recessed until the February sitting of the New Brunswick Supreme Court appeals division.

title: UnionMiddlesex
description: Summit and Westfield com pleted unbeaten seasons yes terday in a pair of Union County holiday contests that drew a total of almost 20,000 fans.

title: Senator's Home Vandalized
description: CUNDYS HARBOR, Me., Nov. 23 (AP)Vandals broke into the summer home of Senator Margaret Chase Smith here and did considerable damage, the Cumberland County sheriff's office reported today. The au thorities said that they had not been able to reach Mrs. Smith and that they did not know whether anything was stolen from the house. The 74yearold Republican Senator was de feated Nov. 7 in her bid for a fifth term.

title: Nationalistic Locals Face U.S.Led Unions in Canada
description: TORONTO, Nov. 23The Canadian sections of the big international unions with head quarters in the United States have had many differences with their American partners over the years, but the new air of nationalism that pervades many things in this country today has carried these differences now to a crisis point. There is talk of secession.

title: Suns Down Pistons
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 22 (AP) Charlie Scott, with 42 points, helped Phoenix snap a five game losing streak as the Suns defeated the Detroit Pistons, 128122, in a National Basket ball Association contest tonight.

title: Books of The Times
description: GEORGE WASHINGTON. Anguish and Farewell (17931799). By James Thomas Flexner. Illustrated. 554 pages. Little, Brown, $15.

title: U.S. Steel Is Sued
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 23 (AP)  The state filed suit yesterday against United States Steel Corporation seeking civil penalties of $518,000 for 94 alleged violation of Pennsyl vania's water quality standards. The suit was filed with the En vironmental Hearing Board.

title: 5 Mexicans Shot to Death in Texas Ranch House
description: LAREDO, Tex., Nov. 23A rancher who had served a pris on term for murder returned home from a day of deer hunt ing yesterday, found five Mex ican aliens in his kitchen and shot them all to death, the Webb County Sheriff's office reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It is regrettable that so distinguished a scholar as Eugene Rostow should do disservice to a cause he has well served in public life. I refer to his con tentions (letter Nov. 15) concerning the rights and obligations of the United States under regional collective se curity arrangements in general and the South East Asia Treaty in partic ular. The terms and the legislative history of that treaty make clear the limits of the undertaking and neither required nor justified U.S. military in tervention in Southeast Asia.

title: BRUINS TOP SEALS AS ORR SCORES 2
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)  Bobby Orr, flashing much of the form that has earned him the National Hockey League's most valuable player award the last thre years, scored a pair of goals tonight in sparking the Boston Bruins to a 42 victory over the California Golden Seals.

title: Quality of Mercy Strained as Post Punishes Hofstra
