Earlier Clash Reported
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 24 (AP) The Israeli command said to day that the clash with a band of Arab guerrillas came shortly after last midnight while an Israeli Army unit was patrol ling inside Lebanon.

title: Trade With Moscow
description: The Soviet economy has entered a period of deep austerity. That has been made clear in a speech by Premier Kosygin to Soviet planners, a speech of such potential impact that several weeks were allowed to pass between its delivery and public announcement of its contents. In terms as grim as those used by Nikita Khrushchev in an earlier period of economic stringency a decade ago, Premier Kosygin demanded an end to the initiation of all but the most essential new construction projects, maximum parsimony in the expenditure of for eign exchange and primary emphasis upon obtaining higher productivity from existing capital investment. Just as in the Khrushchev era, the present Kremlin stress on economy is a product of difficulties in agriculture and of the problems posed by the continued inefficiency of resource utilization in construction and industry.

title: News Picks Financial Editor
description: Donald K. Campbell, former ly business and financial editor of The Arizona Republic, has resigned to become financial editor of The New York News. He replaces Charles J. Elia, financial editor since 1970, who will join the editorial de partment of The Wall Street Journal. The announcement was made by Michael J. O'Neill, managing editor of the News.

title: Miss Schlossman, Jeffrey M. Pine Wed
description: FORT LEE, N.J, Nov. 24 Miss Doralynn Schlossman, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Howard H. Schlossman, was married here today at her parents' home to Jeffrey Mar tin Pines, son of Dr. and Mrs. Kermit L. Pines of Tenafly. Judge Abraham L. Rosenberg of the Juvenile and Domes tic Relations Court in Hack ensack performed the cere mony.

title: Paree Sex Theater Is Closed Down
description: The Paree, where sex movies, live sex shows and massages had been purveyed through Thanksgiving Day, was closed clown yesterday by workmen sent by the lessees, Irving and Murray Riese.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: The New Jersey high school crosscountry season has just ended and Merrill Noden of Lawrenceville School and Harry Kronick of Franklin Township can reflect on highly successful seasons.

title: CITIES LOSE ON AID FOR HOUSING POOR
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24  The Chicago Housing Authority says it will lose nearly $5million by the end of this year because the Nixon Administration has refused to compensate it fully for the money it is losing on its lowincome housing program by complying with a Congres sional directive.

title: ROGER L. PUTNAM, 78, TRUMAN AIDE, DEAD
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 24 (AP)Roger L. Putnam, a Springfield manufacturer who headed the Economic Stabiliza tion Agency under President Truman during the Korean war, died today at Mercy Hospital after suffering a stroke. He was 78 years old.

title: DELINQUENCY RISING ON MORTGAGE LOANS
description: The rate of delinquency on Federallysubsidized mortgage loans has risen sharply to nearly three times the national average, the Mortgage Bankers Association of America re ported yesterday. This had the effect of pushing delinquency rates upward generally, the re port said.

title: U.S. Keeps Up Its Bombing of North to Slow Supplies
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, Nov. 25 (AP)Heavy B52 raids continued against. North Vietnam yesterday as the United States sought to cut the flow of military supplies Communist forces in South Vietnam.

title: Lynch Sees Heath
description: LONDON, Saturday, Nov. 25 John Lynch, Prime Minister of Ireland, left London early today in a hopeful mood after a dinner meeting with Prime Minister Heath in which he said there had been a closer meeting of minds that I have ever experienced before.

title: Michigan Exporting Christmas Trees
description: PELLSTON, Mich. Nov. 23  Christmas trees by the thou sands are being cut, baled and shipped from here these days not to Michigan's metropolitan areas around Detroit or Grand Rapids, but to Florida, Okla homa, Texas and California.

title: Showdown Time in the Big Ten
description: The Ivy League and the Big Ten are worlds apart in their attitudes toward in tercollegiate football, but at the end of this 104th college football season the two leagues have arrived at just about the same point. Each league race will be decided to day in a game that has generated unusual excitement, particularly in the case of the Ivy League.

title: Sales in Daily Lottery Begin in jersey
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24  With hopes of a $25million annual profit, New Jersey began ad vance ticket sales today in the nation's first daily state lot tery, and officials called busi ness brisktobooming at near ly 4,000 outlets across the state.

title: C. B. S. Strike Situation at a Glance
description: PARTICIPANTSColumbia Broadcasting System and Local 1212, Radio and Television Broadcast Engineers Union, International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. Union represents 1,200 cameramen, audio engineers, lighting men and other technicians. The workers went on strike Nov. 3 and have affected C.B.S. operations at its New York, Los Angeles and Washington studios, as well as at TV and radio stations owned and operated by C.B.S. in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, Boston and St. Louis.

title: Market Place: Investors Ignorer Margin Change
description: Investors shrugged yester day as they bought stock un der the new margin rule re quiring a 65 per cent down payment. This was obvious as the exchange steamed ahead despite the 10centona dollar increase in margins decreed by the Federal Re serve Board late Wednesday.

title: Sotheby to Offer Guarantee On Prices for Auction Sale
description: Sotheby Parke Bernet an nounced yesterday that they would guarantee prices to sellers who consign works of art to them for auction.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The college basketball season gets under way this weekend with the University of California, Los Angeles, the national champion, going after its 46th straight victory.

title: BLUE SHIELD SEEKS TO INCREASE RATE OF THIRD OF ROLLS
description: It Would Provide Maximum Protection at Greater Cost to Subscribers United Medical Service, which provides doctorbill in surance for 6.4 million sub scribers in the 17county Greater New York area, an nounced yesterday that it would seek rate increases for more than onethird of them  those who pay their own premiums.

title: CHARGE ON FACISM IS STUDIED IN ROME
description: ROME, Nov. 24Violence in and near high schools here in recent months has touched off inquiry into allegations that extreme rightist groups are re organizing the outlawed Fascist party.

title: Protect Aged Poor
description: A simple way to safeguard the elderly poor from muggers in welfare hotels would be to restrict some of these hotels to older people. The Human Resources Department could easily assign old and young relief recipients to different hotels. Younger people, from whom most muggers are recruited, would be barred from buildings for the elderly, unless they had passes to visit friends or relatives.

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH THO 5TH DAY AS SITE IS SHIFTED
description: PARIS, Nov. 24Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho met for about an hour this morning, the fifth day of their current talks, after letting out word that there would be no meeting to day in the effort to complete a Vietnam settlement.

title: People and Business
description: John W. Partridge, chair man or the Columbia Gas System, said yesterday that his utility had gone about as far as it could in meeting the objections of conserva tionists to its proposed liq uefied gas terminal at Cove Point, Md.

title: This Marriage Rolls Along: He Drives, She Steers
CITY MONITORING WEST SIDE GARAGE
description: The city installed air monitor ing devices in the Lincoln Center garage yesterday after a Thanksgiving Day incident in which seven children were overcome by carbon monoxide in a line of cars waiting to get out of the only exit open then.

title: INDIANS IN CANYON START TO PROSPER
description: GRAND CANYON, Ariz., Nov. 24  The Havusupai Indians, who have been living for more than 1,000 years on the floor of the Grand Canyon, are coming into better times in agriculture and crafts, and the tribes, known as the People of the BlueGrass Waters, foresee a steady rise in its economy.

title: Eleciton by Marist College
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 24John J. Gartland Jr., presi dent of the McCann Founda tion, was elected chairman of the board of trustees of Marist College, Dr. Linus R. Foy, the college's president, announced today. Mr. Gartland graduated from Georgetown University in 1935 and also received law de grees from Fordham and St. John's Universities.

title: Equity Financing
description: Irvin Industries Inc. yesterday filed with the Se curities and Exchange Commission 425,000 common shares to be offered through underwriters headed by Halle Stieglitz Inc. The company is offering 400,000 shares and a certain shareholder 25,000. The company said it will use the net proceeds to repay shortterm bank loans and to purchase ad ditional machinery and equipment. The company's stock was down  at 10 on the American Stock Exchange.

title: ArmyNavy Game Tickets Go Begging in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24 (AP) Tickets to the anuual Army Navy game in John F. Kennedy Stadium are usually a rare commodity here, but this year a sizable block of tickets set aside for Philadelphia area residents could go begging.

title: Kathryn Johnson, Neal Kellogg Wed
description: SADDLE RIVER, N. J., Nov. 24Miss Kathryn Ann john son, daughter of Howard T. Johnson, was married here today in St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church to Neal Dow Becker Kellogg, son of Alex ander S. Kellogg of Green wich, Conn., and Bar Harbor, Me. The Rev. Joseph Colrick performed the ceremony.

title: Carrier's Sailors Tell Inquiry Captain Wouldn't Hear Grievances
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 24Black crew members of the aircraft carrier Constellation told Con gressional investigators today that the ship's commander re fused for three weeks to listen to their grievances while racial tension was mounting steadily aboard the warship.

title: DETECTIVE ADMITS CRIMINAL GUILT
description: Detective Robert Loud ad mitted under crossexamination yesterday that he had commit ted criminal acts as a police man, but that he did not expect to be prosecuted.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The suggestions of the committee studying civil service that the system may not be necessary neglect to offer any alternative which will avoid the evils of nepotism, bribers and ineffi ciency, which brought thf! system into being. If the present examinations have no validity in determining the fitness of applicants for publicservice positions, new examinations must be devised. But placing the decisions as to who shall be employed, who shall be discharged and who shall receive what salary in the hands of immediate superiors, as was suggested, will give rise to such abuses as will seriously impair the efficiency as well as the equitability of public service.

title: Search for Boggs Is Suspended As Weather in Alaska Worsens
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 24An Air Force Rescue Coordination center officially Suspended to day the search for Representa tive Hale Boggs of Louisiana, Representative Nick Begich of Alaska and two others who have been missing since taking off Oct. 16 in a twinengine plane for a 550mile flight from here to Juneau.

title: Price Changes
description: A new round of metal price increases may be in the offing in the zinc industry. The Noranda Sales Corporation, Ltd., a sales unit of Noranda Mines, Ltd., announced yester day that it had raised its base price for zinc in North America by onehalf cent to 19 cents a pound, effective immediately. The company add ed that for over seas sales its base price was increased from 160 ($376) to 173 ($407) a metric ton, including an adjust ment.

title: WinstonSalem Five to Play Howard in Benefit Tonight
description: WinstonSalem State Univer sity meets Howard University's basketball team tonight in a benefit game at the new City College gymnasium, Convent Avenue and 138th Street. Win stonSalem's Alumni Associa tion will sponsor the contest. Proceeds will be applied to the school's scholarship fund.

title: Dying Poet Reunited With His Daughter
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (AP) Vasile Posteuca, a poet dying of stomach cancer, was re united today with his daugh ter, whose threeweek effort to obtain permission to leave her native Rumania had suc ceeded.

title: CANARSIE BOARD SETS SCHOOL PLAN
description: Canarsie's Isaac Bildersce Junior High School 68, now 97 per cent white, would have a 15 per cent black and Puerto Rican enrollment within the next three years, under objec tives approved by the local school board.

title: Ulster Catholic Detained Here
description: Denis Cassin, a member of the Northern Ireland Civil Rights Association, was briefly detained by immigration au thorities in New York yester day after the State Department entered reservations about his admission to the United States.

title: By John Gardner
description: WASHINGTONSecrecy is a ruling attribute of our government at every level. Secrecy touches every aspect of the public process. Secret nominating processes shut off the citizen's access to his political institutions.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 24 (UPI) The Camden City Council to day unanimously approved a measure that would impose fines up to $500 with a possi ble 90day jail term on par ents of delinquent children.

title: Miss Hammer, T. E. Brydges Marry Upstate
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Nov. 24St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church was the setting here this after noon for the marriage of Miss Roxanne Catherine Hammer, daughter of Mrs. Joseph Hammer Jr. of Sara toga Springs, to Thomas Eugene Brydges of Syracuse, son of Earl W. Brydges, State Senate majority leader, and Mrs. Brydges of Niagara Falls.

title: Art:
description: With no show of fanfare or any of the other self congratulatory noises that museums are nowadays in clined to employ for even modest events, the Frick Col lection has mounted a small but extraordinary exhibition as a memorial to its former director, Harry D. M. Grier, who died on May 30. Unfor tunately, the duration of the exhibition is as short as its quality is high. It opened Nov. 13, and tomorrow is the last day.

title: Socialists Seek Expansion
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 24 (AP) Delegates to the Young Social ist National Convention accept ed by unanimous vote today a proposal to send 10 teams of young Socialists on a tour of the country next spring ex panding the Socialist movement land building the mass move ments for social change.

title: Aides Say U.S. Will Keep Strong Force in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 24The United States and Thailand have agreed to the maintenance of a substantial American military presence  mainly air poweron Thai soil for an unspecified period after a Vietnam ceasefire, according to senior officials here.

title: Thursday Night Fight
description: Portland, Me.Bobby Richard, 134 pounds, Portland outpointed Phil Hudson, 130, Portland, 10 rounds.

title: Inmate Stabs Guard in Neck At the Green Haven Prison
description: STORFVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 24 A guard at Green Haven State Correctional Facility was slashed in the neck today by an inmate as he was escorting a group of prisoners to breakfast in the institution's mess hall, a State Correctional Services spokesman said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Aubrey L. Cox, in his eminently rea sonable WarPermit Application [Op Ed Nov. 15], has omitted a provision which requests the names and ad dresses of at least three military ex perts who are familiar with the record of the applying country and who are competent to pass judgment upon its application.

title: JEWISH GROUP HERE IS PRAISED BY NIXON
description: The National Committee for Labor Israel, opening its 49th annual convention at the Com modore Hotel, heard yesterday a message from President Nix on, praising the organization's efforts in behalf of Histadrut, Israel's labor federation.

title: British Paper Reports Bormann Alive
description: LONDON, Nov. 25The Daily Express said today it had in controvertible evidence that Martin Bormann, Hitler's dep uty who has been long sought as a war criminal, was alive in Latin America. It described Bormann, now 72 years old, as a prosperous business man who had evaded capture thanks to the protection of six South American presidents, govern ments and police departments.

title: Leonard Schoffman, 55, Dead; A Lefrak Organization Official
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Nov. 24 Leonard Schoffman, vice pres ident and assistant to the pres ident of the Lefrak Organiza tion, a leading real estate de velopment and construction firm, died today of a heart ail ment in North Shore Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived at 18 Ridge Drive West, Great Neck.

title: NAOMI LANG
description: Naomi Lang, a psychiatric social worker at Mount Sinai Hospital for the last six years, died there yesterday of a brain hemorrhage. She lived at 392 Central Park West.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The City Correction Commissioner, Benjamin Malcolm, was threatened yesterday with 31 days in jail and a $2,500 fine unless he can explain in State Supreme Court Monday why he did not obey a Sept. 5 court order to return prison data such as Xrays, fingerprints and blood samples on a man who was sentenced to a criminal jail, rather than a civil jail, for nonpayment of alimony.

title: 2D WELFARE HOTEL Is DROPPED BY CITY
description: The city's Department of So cial Services said yesterday that it would no longer refer welfare recipients to a single roomoccupancy building at 9 West 102d Street, described by the police as one of the major crime centers on the West Side.

title: ROBERT MOUNTSIER, FORMER SUN EDITOR
description: Robert Mountsier, an author and former aviation and auto motive editor of The New York Sun who had also been a liter ary agent here for D. H. Law rence, died Thursday at the DeWitt Nursing Home, 211 East 79th Street. He was 84 years old and had lived in Crestwood, N. Y.

title: VELMA VARNER, 56; VIKING PRESS EDITOR
description: Velma V. Varner, director and editor of children's books for the Viking Press since 1964, died of cancer yesterday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 56 years old and lived at 345 East 50th Street.

title: Man Sought in Shooting Is Killed by a Patrolman
description: A 27yearold fugitive was shot and killed in a Lower East Side bar last night after he pulled a gun on a patrolman attempting to arrest him.

title: Most Men Up to Number 70 Got Draft Induction Exams
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) Most men with lottery num bers up to 70 eligible for next year's draft pool have been given induction exams, but few, if any, are expected to be drafted, Selective Service of ficials said today.

title: BLUE SHIELD SEEKS TO INCREASE RATE OF THIRD OF ROLLS
description: United Medical Service, which provides doctorbill in surance for 6.4 million sub scribers in the 17county Greater New York area, an nounced yesterday that it would seek rate increases for more than onethird of them  those who pay their own premiums.

title: Rail TonMileage Up 11.9% From the Like 1971 Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Association of American Rail roads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 16.1 billion tonmiles, 11.9 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago. Traffic in the comparable week of 1971 was affected by coal and dock strike.

title: Survivor of Mine Blast Dies in an Auto Crash
description: ROCK FALLS, III., Nov 24 (UPI)Cecil Sanders, who in a 1951 Christmas eve mir acle was the only survivor of a southern Illinois mine disaster that killed 119 men, died in a car crash on Thanksgiving day.

title: The Talk of GifsurYvette
description: GIFSURYVETTE, France, Nov. 23The 10,000 or so citizens of this semirural ex tension of Paris face with equanimity the prospect that the Vietnam war may soon be ended with the Peace of Gif surYvette.

title: A Rustic Store That Became Awfully Chic
description: FREEPORT, Me.The closest L. L. Bean, Inc., ever came to offering what passes for fashion occurred last winter when traditional hunters' boots took off as popu lar footgear for women in cities and suburbs. We were inundated with orders, some of which had to be custom made because they were for size 5 feet, recalled Leon A. Gorman, the 37yearold president and grandson of the late founder of this sporting goods concern.

title: Waiters Vote Pact; Restaurant Owners Predict Price Rise
description: Many of the city's better known restaurants may raise prices and some may go out of business in the near future as a result of contract settle ments with waiters and waitres ses and with chefs and cooks, restaurateurs warned yesterday.

title: Japan and Soviet Agree On Joint OilGas Project
description: TOKYO, Nov. 24  Japan and the Soviet Union signed a memorandum today agreeing in principle on a joint project to exploit oil and natural gas resources on the continental shelf off Sakhalin island.

title: Notes on People
description: Every so often, the Joint Chiefs of Staff meet at the Pentagon with no apparent official business other than to smile. Yesterday was such a day, as the Chiefs met and were photographed with their newest member, Gen. Creigh ton W. Abrams, Chief of Staff of the Army.

title: Heidelberg Wins, 2816, Over Fort Valley State
See Here, Dr. Sherfey!
description: We read with astonishment Dr. Sherfey's excursion into anthropology concerning the relationships of men and women throughout the history of culture. It is scarcely worth refuting this nonsense point by point Dr. Sherfey, however, has misused anthropology, and as anthropologists at Brooklyn College, as well as women, we would be remiss if we did not illustrate the fallacious nature of her entire argument by refuting at least some of its ludicrous contentions.

title: Bar Association to Admit Nonlawyers as Members
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (AP) The American Bar Association said today that nonlawyers closely associated with the legal profession may join its ranks for the first time in its 94year history.

title: Postal Aide Reappointed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) President Nixon announced today that he had reappointed Howard Elliott Jr. of Jefferson City, Mo., as commissioner of the Postal Rate Commission for a sixyear term. Mr. Elliott was first appointed to the five man commission for a two year term in November, 1970. The agency recommends postal rates and classifications for adoption by the United States Postal Service.

title: JOHN BORNEMANN OF COLUMBIA, 47
description: John A. Bornemann, assistant vice president of Columbia Uni versity and special assistant to two Columbia presidents, died Thursday at the ColumbiaPres byterian Medical Center after a long illness. He was 47 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Restaurants Here Are Cheerful Again
description: The telephone rang steadily at Sardi's front desk yesterday afternoon, and after each call Vincent Sardi wrote another name in his big reservation book.

title: Cougars Down Tams, 119105
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Nov. 24 (AP)The Carolina Cougars gained an 80 lead tonight and rolled on to a 119105 victory over the Memphis Tams, 119 105.

title: Bonds Set for 3 Indians
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 24 (AP)Bonds of $10,000 each were set today for three In dians accused of possession of Government property allegedly taken earlier this month from the Bureau of Indian Affairs offices in Washington. The threeAlida Victoria Quiroz, 18 years old and her sister, Andrea Quiroz, 22, both of Rialto, Calif., and Myron Thom as, 31, of San Francisco, are among five persons indicted Wednesday by a Federal grand jury. The other two have not been arrested.

title: Bridge: Top Teams Competing Here In Step Toward U.S. Finals
description: Quality rather than quan tity will be the hallmark of the Swiss team contest being played today and tomorrow at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: COMMISSION CUT URGED BY BROKER
description: A leading brokeragehouse official suggested yesterday that Wall Street should encour age trading by individual in vestors by granting a sharp re duction in the sales charges for buying and selling stocks with in a onemonth period.

title: EXAIDE IN JERSEY IS EXTORTIONIST
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24The for mer Atlantic County Engineer, Patrick J. Doran, was convicted today by a Federal jury on charges of extorting more than $250,000 from contracting and engineering concerns doing business in Atlantic County.

title: Dance: Ukrainian Dukla
description: The true genesis of the Dukla Ukrainian Dance Com pany from Czechoslovakia may not be clear without go ing into the entire history of the AustroHungarian empire.

title: Thai Attempt at Boycott Of Japanese Goods Fails
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 24The first postwar boycott of Japanese goods began here four days ago and failed almost immediately. But the publicity and attention it evoked has been educational for the Thai students who began it and un derscored for Tokyo the grow ing concern over Japan's eco nomic dominance in Southeast Asia.

title: Rev. Eugene Maceluch, 79, Ukrainian Pastor on S. I.
description: The Rev. Eugene Maceluch, pastor of Holy Trinity Ukrain ian Catholic Church, Stapleton, S. I., died Tuesday in Miseri cordia Hospital in the Bronx. He was 79 years old and lived in the Bronx.

title: TV: BachLover's Feast
description: Fantasy and Fugue: Rosa lyn Tureck Plays Bach is a splendid hour of TV view ing andwonder of wonders an earthy pip that should hold anyone, even at 10 to morrow morning. Get up and grab it on the Columbia Broadcasting System.

title: GENERALS TO WEIGH INDIAPAKISTAN LINE
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 2Mili tary leaders of India and Paki stan will meet in an effort to resolve the deadlock over the delineation of the ceasefire line between the two countries, the Defense Ministry announced here today.

title: Ballet: Ailey Presents Butler's According to Eve
description: John Butler has a kinship with the Bible. Some of his best works have relayed Bib lical images, and now in Ac cording to Eve, he is offer ing an Eve'seyeview of Cain and Abel. The ballet, given by the Alvin Ailey City Cen ter Dance Theater, had its of ficial premiere last night at the New York City Center.

title: U.S.Cuban Negotiation on Hijacking Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) The start of talks be tween the United States and Cuba on airline hijacking has been delayed, apparently be cause of technical communi cations problems between the Swiss Embassies in Washing ton and Havana, United States officials said today.

title: See Here, Dr. Sherfey!
description: Dr. Mary Jane Sherfey (0pEd Nov. 1314) writes that the Adamoutof Eve finding remained the bestkept secret in the history of biology.

title: WINE TALK
description: AY, FranceThere is said to be a family here whose men have worked in the wine fields and cellars, in a direct line of descent, since the 13th century.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24  With hopes of a $25million annual profit, New Jersey began ad vance ticket sales today in the nation's first daily state lot tery, and officials called busi ness brisktobooming at near ly 4,000 outlets across the state.

title: Antiques: Artifacts of Whaling Era
description: BOSTONIt was far from a whale of a whaling auc tion.

title: Dow Index Climbs to Another Record
SAMUEL T. CHERR, 80, OF YOUNG & RUBICAM
description: Samuel T. Cherr, a specialist in advertising and marketing who for 32 years had served Young & Rubicam, Inc., one of the country's largest advertis ing agencies, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 45 Sutton Place South.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I would like to take issue with the Nov. 4 letter from Maurice M. Wheeler regarding the project which the state has promised to develop in the In woodSherman Creek area of Manhat tan, The author of the letter deplores the costs and financing of the project under the misguided belief that the entire development will require state credit.

title: CITIES LOSE ON AID FOR HOUSING POOR
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24  The Chicago Housing Authority says it will lose nearly $5million by the end of this year because the Nixon Administration has refused to compensate it fully for the money it is losing on its lowincome housing program by complying with a Congres sional directive.

title: Alaska Governor to Ask Court To Call Begich Death Hearing
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 24  Gov. William A. Egan has in dicated that he will soon ask the State Superior Court to call for a presumptive death hearing in the case of Repre sentative Nick Begich.

title: OTC AND AMEX SHOW ADVANCES
description: Prices in the overthecounter market and on the American Stock Exchange finished higher yesterday in slow trading.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 24 (AP)The European Economic Community's trade balance took a turn for the worse in August and September, after improving sharply in the spring months, but still remained in substantial surplus, the Common Market commission said in its latest monthly report.

title: Business Briefs
description: A committee of the Swedish legislature, after a three year study, has issued a report that calls for a law barring foreign interests from operating consumer credit reporting agencies.

title: Subway Changes Set for Jan. 2 Praised
description: The Transit Authority con tended yesterday that five sub way route changes that are scheduled to be put into effect on Jan. 2 would provide great ly increased service for the 200,000 daily riders who, an authority spokesman said, have encountered frequent de lays and bottlenecks on these lines.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Nov. 24 (AP)Walter God frey of New Zealand and Peter Crocker of Australia shared a twostroke lead at 137 today after two rounds in the New Zealand Open golf championship.

title: Aluminum Workers Get Rise
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 24 (AP) As a result of costofliving escalator clause included in the United Steelworkers' contract with five major aluminum com panies, 34,000 workers will be earning three cents an hour more Dec. 1, the union an nounced today.

title: F.T.C. Says 3 Concerns Violate Law on Directors
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Federal Trade Commission ac cused three major corporations today of violating the law that bans the same individual from being a director of large, com peting corporations.

title: ALABAMA OFFICER OUSTED OVER SUIT
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov 24 The chief probation officer of Montgomery County has been dismissed because he filed suit earlier this week in Fed eral District Court charging that the Alabama Welfare De partment had conspired with six private orphanages to main tain segregation in foster homes.

title: Soviet Explosion Indicated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI) The Atomic Energy Commis sion said today that it had de tected seismic signals, presum ably from a Soviet underground nuclear explosion, in the south eastern Ural area of the Soviet Union.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGON, Nov. 24The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.109billion, up 13 per cent from the year earlier $984million. Total retail store sales were an estimated $9.245 billion, up 9 per cent from the year earlier $8.448billion.

title: Finns Recognize Germanys
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 24 (AP)Finland recognized both West and East Germany today. The official notifications were sent to Bonn and East Berlin after a Cabinet meeting. Recog nition came just one week after the Finns decided to recognize both German states in princi ple. There was no immediate word when the exchange of dip lomatic representatives would take place.

title: ROCK MUSICIAN SHOT AT MASSAGE PARLOR
description: A 28yearold rock musician was shot and critically wounded yesterday afternoon during a dispute at the Geisha House Massage Parlor, at 414 West 42d Street.

title: Still Another Jet Injury: Galigher's Wrist Broken.
description: Ed Galigher, the rookie de fensive tackle, was added to the growing list of wounded Jets yesterday as team mem bers and their families gathered a day late for their Thanks giving dinner at Shea Stadium's Diamond Club.

title: Director Weds Actress
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Nov 24 (AP)Yvette Mimieux, the movie actress, and Stanley Donen, director and producer, have been married at the home of his sister. Mrs. Lawrence G. Goldstein, the sister, had re ported Wednesday that the couple had changed their minds about being married in Colum bia, and had flown to the Virgin Islands. She said yester day, however, that the two were married at her house be fore leaving the city.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Reflecting on the recent Presidential election, it is apparent that there is a middle ground between sour grapes and a sentimental, wishywashy at titude of, O.K., now let's all back our President 100 per cent. For those who voted Democratic, the former is unworthy of a fairminded citizen; the latter is unworthy of a concerned citi zen.

title: Music: 2 Novelties by Philharmonic
description: The New York Philhar monic began this week's con certs yesterday afternoon in stead of Thursday night, be cause of the holiday. The program, conducted by Stan islaw Skrowaczewski, in cluded two quasinovelties, works far apart in time and character. The first was a fivepart suite from Rameau's Six Concerts en sextuor, arranged by the conductor. The second was Alberto Gi nastera's Piano Concerto, with Natalie Hinderas as soloist.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Tariff Commission ruled by 40 today that imports of wool and polyesterwool worsted fabrics from Japan at dumping prices are not injuring the domestic industry.

title: British Bill Rate Rises
description: LONDON, Nov. 24 (Reuters) The average rate at today's auction of Treasury bills rose to 6.9346 per cent from 6.8558 last week This week's 140 million offer of 91days bills met applications of 456.36million.

title: Bridgeport Needs A Late Touchdown To Win 21st in Row
See Here, Dr. Sherfey!
description: Dr. Sherfey accuses biologists of disregarding factual science but it is feminists like Dr. Sherfey who seem to disregard the facts.

title: REVISION LIKELY IN MONEY SUPPLY
description: The Federal Reserve Sys tem's overhaul of its regula tions governing the collection of checkswhich went into effect on Nov. 9has uncov ered a substantial shortfall in the measurement of the nation's money supply, the central bank disclosed yesterday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24Pickets and policemen returned to the Kawaida Towers housing proj ect for two hours this morning, but left after learning that no construction work was planned on the 16story low and mid dleincome housing project.

title: MRS. ITALO PALERMO
description: Mrs. Giovanna Lojacono Palermo, widow of Italo Paler mo, president of the Bank of Sicily Trust Company of New York from its inception in 1924 to World War II, died at Villa Fontedamo in Jesi, Italy, on Oct. 31 after a brief illness. She was 88 years old and had lived at 325 East 72d Street.

title: Alexander Smallens Dies; Symphony Conductor, 83
description: Alexander Smallens, who had a long and successful career in the United States and abroad as a conductor of symphony, opera and ballet music, died yesterday at St. Joseph's Hos pital in Tucson, Ariz., after a long illness. He was 83 years old and was a resident of New York City.

title: Brooklyn Acting to Set Up A Fulton St. Artists' Colony
description: Bypassed by time and the bridge above, the blocklong length of Brooklyn's Fulton Street that runs to the shore of the East River is stirring with ate hop'e of better times.

title: PART OF MICHIGAN SEEKS TIME SHIFT
description: ESCANABA, Mich., Nov. 24 A group in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, disturbed by the state's vote Nov. 7 to adopt Eastern daylight time, plans to petition the Federal Govern ment to put the Upper Penin sula in the central standard time zone.

title: Sherwood Clark Chatfield, ExBristolMyers Official
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., Nov. 24 Sherwood Clark Chatfield, a retired personnel executive with the BristolMyers Com pany, died of a heart attack today at his winter home here. He was 67 years old and lived in Sharon, Conn.

title: See Here, Dr. Sherfey!
description: I am somewhat taken aback that The Times would publish such shoddy scholarship as the article by Dr. Sherfey.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 Under a grant from the Na tional Institutes of Health, researchers at Stanford Uni versity in California have in vented a device for treating diseases of the eye with a laser beam.

title: Undermining Zoning
description: Desperate for answers to the New York housing crisis, the city is coming up with some very dubious solutions. Among the more illadvised is a currently proposed zoning amendment that would give special dis pensation to owners of split lots in Manhattan now zoned for both high and medium density. The purpose is to permit the developers to raise the density of these sites, to construct luxury housing. Without this help to combat high costs, the builders claim that they cannot add to the city's inadequate housing stock.

title: NewCar Sales Fell in MidNovember
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24New car sales in the middle third of No vember declined from the levels a year earlier, but the drop was small considering there was one less day to sell cars this year.

title: MRS. SCHONEMAN
description: Mrs. Irene Schoneman, vice president of the Schoneman Galleries, art dealers at 823 Madison Avenue, died yester day in Lenox Hill Hospital after a short illness. She was 78 years old and lived at 120 Cen tral Park South.

title: Soviet Grain Loading Delay
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 24 (AP) Rainy weather today delayed the loading of the National De fender, the first American ship to haul part of the 17 million tons of United States grain bought by the Soviet Union. Loading operations were re scheduled for Monday.

title: New Microfilm Method Puts Book on a Sheet of Film
description: A microfilming method that can record 625 booksize pages on a single sheet of film no larger than one of those pages has been invented. They can then be displayed, one page at a time, in a portable device no larger than a book.

title: Woody Guthrie Home Town Ends Ban on Claiming Him
description: OKEMAH, Okla., Nov. 24 (UPI)Three men began paint ing Home of Woody Guthrie on Okemah's third water tower yesterday, ending a city policy of ignoring the town's native son who was considered too leberal because of his Dust Bowl ?? ballads.

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH THO 5TH DAY AS SITE IS SHIFTED
description: PARIS, Nov. 24Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho met for about an hour this morning, the fifth day of their current talks, after letting out word that there would be no meeting to day in the effort to complete a Vietnam settlement.

title: LADLEY K. PEARSON
description: MENOMONEE FALLS, Wis., Nov. 24 (UPI)Ladley K. Pear son, urbanaffairs reporter for The Milwaukee Sentinel, died today. He was 29 years old.

title: By M. L. Stein
description: New York shares with four other statesMississippi, South Carolina, West Virginia and Rhode Islandthe shoddy distinction of having no open meeting or open record laws.

title: New Microfilm Method Puts Book on a Sheet of Film
description: A microfilming method that can record 625 booksize pages on a single sheet of film no larger than one of those pages has been invented. They can then be displayed, one page at a time, in a portable device no larger than a book.

title: FIRST JERSEY CORP. WEIGHING WRITEOFF
description: The First Jersey National Corporation, the parent com pany of the First Jersey Na tional Bank, has announced that it is contemplaitng charg ing off up to $2.7million in loans. According to Thomas J. Stanton, president of the company, this writeoff, if taken, would severely de press fourthquarter earnings which had been expected to show a sizable increase.

title: TUQUI II TRIUMPHS BY THREE LENGTHS
Moral Issue Haunts Heisman Voters
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Nov. 24 With official ballots in the mail, a delicate moral ques tion continues to haunt the final Heisman Trophy selec tions, already the source of increasing national debate.

title: Art:
description: Remember the old movie version of Robert Louis Ste venson's Treasure Island the cutthroat pirates climb ing the stockade, the smarmy Wallace Beery (Long John Silver) sidling up to Jackie Cooper as the intrepid but incorrigibly dumb Jim Hawk ings? If so, the N. C. Wyeth exhibition now on view at the New York Cultural Cen ter, 2 Columbus Circle, should prove an exercise in nostalgia.

title: No Exit
description: The underground traffic jam in the Lincoln Center Parking Garage, with its resulting panic amid an air thick with exhaust fumes, was an unhappy aftermath to the Thanksgiving Day Parade. Spokesmen for the garage have minimized the incident, yet seven children required treatment for carbon monoxide inhalation, and for many others the long subterranean delay was a most frightening experience.

title: Miss Albers in Golf Return
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 24(UPI) Roberta Albers, former na tional collegiate golf champion, announced today she would turn professional this weekend when she competes in the Johnny Bench celebrity golf tournament. The 25yearold former University of Miami star has been away from com petitive golf for three years. Miss Albers said she would join the professional golf tour Jan. 1

title: BUCKS OVERCOME KINGS, 115 To 106
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 24 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks, helped by 3point plays by Oscar Robertson and Curtis Perry, held off a Kansas CityOmaha rally and posted a 115106 Na tional Basketball Association victory over the Kings tonight.

title: Rome Magazine Says Photo Spies Pictured Mrs. Onassis in Nude
description: ROME, Nov. 24  Playmen magazine of Rome today pub lished nine pages of nude photographs of a woman it identified as Mrs. Aristotle Onassis.

title: Business Briefs
description: The PBW Stock Exchange in Philadelphia is consider ing the establishment of satellite trading floors in several additional cities, according to Elkins Wetherill, president.

title: Public Library Receives Rare Gift From The Times
description: The New York Public Library announced yesterday that it had received a rare gift for its newspaper archive from The New York Times.

title: News Analysis
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 24The relationship be tween President Nguyen Van Thieu's Government and the United States has been funda mentally altered by the prog ress toward a peace settlement in the last six weeks, and Thieu does not seem to know quite what to make of it. The United States Em bassy is saying that the allies can accept the conces sions being made by the Communists because the Vietnamization policy has succeeded in defeat ing the enemy on the battle field and making him sue for peace on favorable terms.

title: STUDENT CONFESSES TO KILLING PARENTS
description: DOUGLAS, Ariz. Nov. 24 (AP)A teenage honor stu dent described as the nicest boy you would want to meet faced murder charges today in the slayings of his parents. Officials said the youth had wanted to know how it felt to kill someone.

title: Art:
description: Willard Midgette's Chore ography: The Paul Taylor Dance Company, installed at the Allan Frumkin Gallery, 41 East 57th Street, is a walkin painting that sur rounds you with lifesize fig ures leaping, bending and resting, and shows as well their reflections in a painted mirror and the artist, in a selfportrait, working at what you are looking at.

title: F.T.C. Says 3 Concerns Violate Law on Directors
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Federal Trade Commission ac cused three major corporations today of violating the law that bans the same individual from being on the boards of direc tors of large, competing cor porations.

title: TOURING CHINESE VISIT UNIVERSITY
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Nov. 24 The first delegation of physi cal scientists and engineers from mainland China to visit the United States in nearly 20 years made the first tour of their trip today. They spent the day at the State University of New York at Stony Brook as guests of C. N. Yang, a Nobel Prizewinning physicist.

title: 40 Sidewalk Santas Are Told to Be Good
description: Forty sidewalk Santa Clauses here got their final briefing yesterday on how to behave, including the ad monition to keep your breath clean, avoid eating garlic or onions, before set ting out on the 76th annual Christmas campaign conduct ed by the Volunteers of America.

title: Wendy Garthwaite Bride of R. B. Kling
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Nov. 24 Miss Wendy Lee Garth waite and Robert Booth Kling were married here this after noon. The Rev. Robert D. Morrison Jr. of St. David's Episcopal Church in Radnor performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's par ents, Mr. and Mrs. Albert A. Garthwaite.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Restaurants are rated for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmos phere, service and decor (four triangles to none.)

title: 2D WELFARE HOTEL IS DROPPED BY CITY
description: The city's Department of So cial Services said yesterday that it would no longer refer welfare recipients to a single roomoccupancy building at 9 West 102d Street, described by the police as one of the major crime centers on the West Side.

title: LEASING DEAL SET BY GREYHOUND UNIT
description: World Airways, Inc. and the Greyhound Leasing & Financial Corporation, a subsidiary of the Greyhound Corporation, an nounced a financing agreement covering the purchase of two 747C convertible aircraft from the Boeing Company.

title: Boston Lights Going On
description: BOSTON Nov. 24 (AP)Mayor Kevin H. White will flick a switch at 5:30 P.M. Monday to light trees on Boston Common, and the city's 22d annual Christ mas Festival will be under way.

title: Minister Is Said to Resign From the Canadian Cabinet
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 24 (Canadian Press)Bryce Mackasey, the minister of Manpower, has re signed from the Cabinet, relia ble informants said tonight.

title: BRUINS TRIUMPH OVER FLAMES 40
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 24 (UPI) Bobby Orr, playing in his sev enth game since returning from knee surgery, scored one goal and assisted on two others to night to help the Boston Bruins to a 40 victory over the At lanta Flames in a National Hockey League game.

title: Purlie Returning to Stage
description: After a year on tour. Pur lie, the musical based on Os sic Davis's Purlie Victorious, will return to Broadway for five weeks at the Billy Rose Theater, starting Dec. 26. Philip Rose is the producer. The cast includes Robert Guillaume, Pat ti Jo, Art Wallace, Sherman Hemsley, Helen Martin and Shirley Monroc.

title: LAWRENCE J. BOOHER, IRRIGATION EXPERT
description: DAVIS, Calif., Nov. 24 (AP) Lawrence Joseph Booher, an internationally known irriga tionist who taught at the Uni versity of California here, died Wednesday at the age of 62, school officials said today.

title: Theater: Jeff Weiss, AuthorActor, Is Seen in F.O.B.
Geniality Warms Talks in Helsinki
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 24 Helsinki in winter seems an inappropriate place to try to end the cold war, but that is what diplomats from 34 na tions are trying to do here. They seem to be off to a good start.

title: Outboard Racer Suffers Paralysis in Trial Spill
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 24 (UPI)Michael Schnell of Stockton, Calif., one of the entrants in the world outboard motorboat championship, was severely injured today when his boat flipped over while moving at more than 80 miles an hour in a practice run.

title: C.B.S. Stiffens Security In Strike by Technicians
description: Security measures at Colum bia Broadcasting System fa cilities here have been sub stantially tightened since Nov. 3, when C.B.S. was struck by the union representing its cam eramen and other technicians.

title: 150 FORCED TO FLEE MIDTOWN HOTEL FIRE
description: A fire on the fourth floor of the Woodstock Hotel near Times Square, sent thick columns of black smoke billow ing up through the upper floors of the 350room, 14 story build ing last night and drove some 150 hotel residents down fire stairs to the lobby.

title: New Dam Brightens Economic Picture in Ivory Coast
description: KOSSOU, Ivory Coast  In the words of Chief Tuy Quadro, We have better schools here, better houses, running water  and soon electricity.

title: Preserving the Catskills An Author's Main Goal
description: SHADY, N.Y., Nov. 24When Alf Evers was a boy, he could look out of his bedroom win dow in his father's farmhouse in Ulster County and see the Catskill Mountains on the hori zon to the northwest.

title: Debutantes at Assembly Note Traditions, Old and Changing
description: New York's seasonal crop of debutantes came into full flower last evening at the Plaza, where the Junior As sembly was held under a Grand Ballroom ceiling of yellow, coral, orange and light blue balloons.

title: Pern Talks With Newsmen
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 24 (AP)Mr. Pern stepped out of his home today and had his first brief talk with journalists since his return to Argentina a week ago.

title: Ohio Declared Disaster Area
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) President Nixon declared Ohio a major disaster area to day as a result of severe storms and flooding along the Lake Erie shoreline. The declaration will enable the state to use Federal funds in relief and recovery efforts.

title: Pop Music
description: There were problems about the Sly and the Family Stone concert Thursday night at Madison Square Garden, but they couldn't invalidate the fact that when Sly and his soulrock ensemble finally get it on, his audiences get it on, too.

title: Screen: Horse Operas
description: Of all the great mindless movie genres none has suf fered more from filmmakers with ideas than the Western. There have been message Westerns and comic West erns, adult Westerns and neurotic Westerns, anti Westerns, ecological West erns, homosexual Westerns, black Westerns, Italian West erns, Maoist Westerns, and Westerns that could conceiv ably appeal only to New York Reform Democrats sin cerely committed to boy cotting lettuce.

title: EON TRIUMPHS BY THREE LENGTHS
description: Making his way into the lead entering the stretch, and keep ing it to the wire, Henry Alex ander's Tuqui II stepped to a threelength triumph in the feature race at Aqueduct yes terday. Marco Castaneda rode the Argentinebred campaigner, whose success was worth $27 for $2 to those among the 25, 426 customers who backed him.

title: U.S. PLANS A CURB ON BLIND VENDERS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24In an effort to eliminate the com petition for privately owned cafeterias operating in Federal buildings, the Government plans to restrict the sales of certain food items by blind venders.

title: Makers of Pet Food Ordered by F.T.C. To Prove Ad Claims
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI) The Government announced today that makers of pet foods were being ordered to back up advertising claims of their products.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 1.2 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and in dustrials rose to 126.5 from 125.3 last week.

title: See Here, Dr. Sherfey!
description: If Dr. Sherfey is actually a practicing psychiatrist, as stated in the footnote to her articles, I think she furnishes a prime example of why laymen are becoming increasingly distrustful of her profession.

title: Dublin Ousts TV Board Over I.R.A. Talk
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 24The Irish Government tonight dismissed all nine members of the board of management of the state radio and television network over an interview with Sean MacStiofain, the reputed chief of staff of the Irish Republican Army.

title: Nixon, on Visit to City, Greets Old Friends
description: President Nixon and his fam ily arrived in New York City for a visit back with old friends yesterday, and he im mediately went to his old Wall Street law firm for a chat with former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and other col leagues.

title: Joan Studdiford Is Bride in Jersey
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 24 Miss Joan Kerney Studdi ford, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Stryker Studdi ford of Morrisville, Pa., was married here this evening to Alan David Breward of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Breward of Whaka tau, New Zealand. The Rev. Ernest Gordon, a Presbyte rian minister and dean of the Princeton University Chapel, performed the ceremony in the chapel.

title: NO OPEN HEARINGS ON PACT AT CITY U.
description: A factfinding panel appoint ed by the state ruled yesterday against holding public hearings in the contractnegotiations dis pute between the City Univer sity of New York and the Pro fessional Staff Congress, the bargaining agent for 16,000 faculty and staff members of the 20 colleges in the system.

title: Gunman Holds Jet And a Stewardess At Frankfurt Field
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Saturday, Nov. 25 (Reuters)A hijacker seized a Canadian air liner and held a stewardess hostage yesterday, first de manding the freeing of a Czechoslovak hijacker jailed in Germany and then the freedom of a West German anarchist group.

title: Paree Sex Theater Is Closed Down
description: The Paree, where sex movies, live sex shows and massages had been purveyed through Thanksgiving Day, was closed down yesterday by workmen sent by the lessees, Irving and Murray Riese.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Nov. 24 (AP)The United States took sole possession of third place in the world amateur baseball championship with a 73 victory over the Dominican Republic. The triumph gave the Americans a 61 wonlost record. The Dominican Republic, which had been tied with the United States, dropped to 52.

title: Thieu Aide Says Foe Is Snagging Talks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 24A close aide of Pres ident Nguyen Van Thieu said today that no progress had been made toward a peace set tlement in the first four days of renewed secret talks in Paris between the United States and North Vietnam.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Navy's morale crisis, to which you referred in a Nov. 11 editorial, arises more from problems within the Navy than from problems in the civil ian society from which most of its manpower is drawn. After nearly three years as a junior officer afloat with the Pacific Fleet, I feel what touches Navy men more deeply than the issues of the war or social problems at home is the lack of effective communication between whites and blacks, officers and enlisted men, young and old.

title: PRICES ADVANCE IN SOYBEAN MEAL
description: Heavy foreign demand for soybean meal spurred further price increases yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The January futures contract was up the daily permissible limit of $5 a ton during the session and it closed at the same price, $125 15/100 a ton, a new life of contract high.

title: Celtics Thwart Knicks' Bid For Lead on 11497 Victory
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24With an impressive team display of de termined defensive play and slashing offensive opportunism, the Boston Celtics decisively thrashed the New York Knicks, 11497, tonight in a battle for first place in the National Bas ketball Association Atlantic Di vision.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24 (UPI)The World Hockey Association posted a surety bond of $2.5million today, ful filling the final requirement that will allow Bobby Hull to play for the Winnipeg Jets.

title: A Responsible House
description: Retirements and defeats in party primaries have brought a considerable change this year in the com mittee leadership of the House of Representatives. When the 93d Congress meets in January, five of the 21 standing committees of the House will have new chair men, among them such powerful committees as Rules, Judiciary and Interior.

title: Miss Allwork Married Here
description: Miss Winifred Allwork, president of the Women's Architectural Auxiliary of the New York Chapter of the American Institute of Archi tects, was married here yes terday morning to George Harry Treadwell Jr. of Tucson, Ariz., vice president of the Treadwell Realty Corporation of Memphis. The Rev. Dr. Robert A. Edgar performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Central Presbyterian Church.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Nov. 8 letter South Korea: Wit nessing the Rape of Democracy, by a former U. S. foreign service officer, Gregory Henderson, fails to convince a former Korean foreign service officer.

title: Holiday Specials (at $10,500?) for Those Unfazed by Cost of Giving
description: It is the time of the year again, with Thanksgiving over, for fantasy, for the Christmas catalogue aimed not at the trendy, but at the affluent.

title: Search for Boggs Is Suspended As Weather in Alaska Worsens
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 24An Air Force Rescue Coordination center officially suspended to day the search for Representa tive Hale Boggs of Louisiana, Representative Nick Begich of Alaska and two others who have been missing since taking off Oct. 16 in a twinengine plane for a 550mile flight from here to Juneau.

title: PhoneaHome Program Gives Runaways a Place to Run To
description: WESTPORT, Conn.  Peter Abeson was eating dinner one night recently in his big, airy, brown colonial house on one of those twisting, treefilled lanes in Westport, when the telephone rang.

title: Six Belgian Soldiers Guilty Of Torturing Prisoners
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 24A mili tary tribunal in Lige has found six Belgian soldiers guilty of violating the Geneva conven tion on treatment of war pris oners and the International Convention on Human Rights by torturing a dozen prison ers during maneuvers in east ern Belgium in November, 1971.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24  A Newark policeman, a fireman and a state trooper will re ceive valor awards Monday night at the annual dinner of the 200 Club, an organization of leaders of business and in dustry in the greater Newark area.

title: Barricaded La Paz Strikers Defy Regime
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 24 (AP) Government and trade union leaders reached a compromise accord late today, ending a twoday strike that had para lyzed industry and commerce.

title: International Paper Plans More Colombian Investment
description: The International Paper Company and W. R. Grace & Company announced yesterday that they would make further investments of $24.1million over the next five years in a Colombian paper mill.

title: See Here, Dr. Sherfey!
description: I observe that the illustration ac companying Dr. Sherfey's contention that Eve was Number One endows Eve with a navel. If Eve really was first, who, pray, was on the other end of that umbilical cord?

title: A LOSS IS SHOWN BY OMEGAALPHA
TEXAS CONQUERS A. AND M., 38 TO 3
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 23 (AP) Alan Lowry, Texas quarter back, threw his first touch down pass of the season and ran for two more tonight as the Longhorns prepared for the Cotton Bowl with a 383 Southwest Conference victory over Texas A. and M.

title: EDWIN PETERSON, 68, TEACHER OF WRITING
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 24Ed win L. Peterson, a professor of English for 40 years at the Uni versity of Pittsburgh, where he taught creative writing, died today after a brief illness. He was 68 years old.

title: Israelis and Commandos Clash Just Inside Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 24 An Israeli patrol clashed with Palestinian guerrillas just inside Lebanon early today in the first such reported action since mid September.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Nov. 24In the period of domestic American Communisthunt ing after World War II, one outrageous case was that of Edward K. Barsky, a New York doctor. When he refused to give the House UnAmerican Activ ities Committee the records of the Joint AntiFascist Refugee Committee, Dr. Barsky was jailed for contempt. The New York Regents then suspended his license to practice medicine, and the Supreme Court found that action constitutional, Justices Black, Franks furter and Douglas dissenting.

title: Fund Shortage Foreseen By Port Authority Official
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24The acting director of the Port Au thority of New York and New Jersey said yesterday that the huge agency might soon be in serious need of capital funds and was apparently unable to raise any through the sale of its bonds at favorable rates.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: A New Jersey osteopath and an employe who imper sonated a registered nurse were found guilty yesterday in Federal Court in Newark of conspiring to distribute and distributing drugs in violation of Federal law. Dr. John G. Miele, 56 years old, of 158 West Northfield Road, Living ston, and Richard Cutillo, 29, of 223 West Kinney, Newark, each face a maximum sentence of up to 50 years in prison, a $100,000 fine or both. They were indicted last Feb. 22.

title: Merger News
description: The First Leisure Corpora tion announced yesterday it has reached an agreement with its subsidiary, Goldstein, Samuel son, Inc., a commodity options dealer, rescinding the May, 1972, acquisition of Goldstein, Samuelson by First Leisure.

title: DELAY IS REPORTED IN DCL'S DEBT TALKS
description: Negotiations between DCL, Inc., the parent company of Diebold Computer Leasing, Inc., and its creditors over an exten sion of the company's debt have not been concluded as quickly as originally hoped, John J. Graham, president of DCL, said yesterday.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24The for mer Atlantic County Engineer, Patrick J. Doran, was convicted today by a Federal jury on charges of extorting more than $250,000 from contracting and engineering concerns doing business in Atlantic County.

title: MRS. ROBERT H. BLAIR
description: MAPLEWOOD, N.J., Nov. 24 Mrs. Dorothy Eunice Hinck ley Blair, a stage actress known as Dorothy Hinckley, died yesterday at her home, 357 Elmwood Avenue, after a long illness. She was the wife of Robert H. Blair, manager of the Ward Home for Retired Men in Maplewood.

title: Personalities: A Happy Skier
description: Maybe I ought to make a comeback, Stein Eriksen said jokingly yesterday after learning that the Park City (Utah) Resort had been picked as a permanent train ing site for the United States' national Alpine and Nordic squads. Eriksen, per forming at the Winter Sports Show at the Nassau Coli seum, which opened a three day stand yesterday, said the decision to move the training base to Park City had been made by officials of the United States Ski Associa tion. Ericksen is the ski director of the Utah resort.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is doubtful whether his publishers have done John Collier the good they intended in assembling in one volume such a generous selection of his work: a lengthy novel, bits from another, 47 short stories. He is a writer better served in small takes. One tale in The New Yorker provokes an appreciative chuckle. But 47 of them or even a decent fraction of that number in duce a numb colorless satiety. The cleverness, the literary by play, the culti vated writing dis solve in the thin ness of structure, the bloodlessness of the characters, the archness of tone. The clever ness shows its joinery, the book ishness becomes assertive, the writ ing is the skill of a sculptor working in ice. His strengths remain in this book, but his faults accumulate. No one really dis likes the orchestral work of SaintSans, but I don't know of anyone who would attend a fourday festival of his music.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24  After reading in the papers the other day that President Nixon has no intention of advocating new social programs next year. Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. of New Jersey and his staff began preparing for battle sta tions even though the 93d Con gress does not convene until Jan. 3.

title: Junta in Argentina Sidetracks Negotiations With Peron Group
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 24  Argentina's military Govern ment tonight postponed the opening of direct political ne gotiations with Juan D. Pern, the country's former President, by delegating the job of meet ing with a loose grouping of political parties that he formed this week.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The city announced it would soon require the own ers of 14,000 cigarette vend ing machines to maintain a 5cent price differential be tween lowtar and hightar brands.

title: MUNICH GUERRILLAS SAID TO BLAME BONN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 24 Three Palestinian guerrillas who participated in the attack on the Israeli Olympic team at Munich were quoted today as having said that West German authorities were responsible for the deaths of the 11 Is raelis.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The construction strike that began on July 1 and has shut down $2 bil lion worth of construction in the city is a horror that should not be per mitted to occur again.

title: Canadians Win, 91
description: VANCOUVER, B. C., Nov. 24 (UPI)  Frank Mahovlich, Jacques Lemaire and Murray Wilson scored two goals each as Montreal trounced the Van couver Canucks. 91, tonight. Chuck Lefley, Guy Lafleur and Marc Tardif added single goals as the Canadiens increased their East Division lead over the New York Rangers to 6 points.

title: O'DWYER ASPIRES TO COUNCIL POST
description: Paul O'Dwyer said yesterday that unlike many of his fellow Democrats who want to be Mayor he would just like to be President of the City Coun cil.

title: Nixon, on Visit to City, Greets Old Friends
description: President Nixon and his fam ily arrived in New York City for a visit back with old friends yesterday, and he im mediately went to his old Wall Street law firm for a chat with former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and other col leagues.

title: NEW SCHOOL PLAN ASKED IN ATLANTA
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 24 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit remanded the 14yearold At lanta school case to a lower court today with instructions to supervise preparation of a new desegregation plan and straight en out the confusion over legal representation.

title: F15 PASSES TEST IN INITIAL FLIGHTS
description: Three new fighter aircraft whose performances may in fluence drastically the seesaw competition for air superiority between the United States and the Soviet Union have done well in their initial trials, Air Force sources have reported.

title: Sports of The Times
description: For the sports bettor, the torture is not in the winning or the losing of the wager, it's in the waiting to find out.

title: Fund Shortage Foreseen
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24The acting director of the Port Au thority of New York and New Jersey said yesterday that the huge agency might soon be in serious need of capital funds and was apparently unable to raise any through the sale of its bonds at favorable rates.

title: Nets Top Stars, 109102, As Carter and Taylor Star
Aides Say U. S. Will Keep Strong Force in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 24The United States and Thailand have agreed to the maintenance of a substantial American military presence  mainly air poweron Thai soil for an unspecified period after a Vietnam ceasefire, according to senior officials here.

title: U.S. INVESTIGATING CITY ON ASPHALT
description: The Federal Bureau of in vestigation and a Federal grand jury are investigating purchases by the city of $5.6million worth of asphalt from six pri vate asphalt companies in the last year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The current discussion of the possi bility of running a fusion candidate for Mayor of New York should be viewed in the light of the considera tion that the political bosses, including Nelson Rockefeller, will only under take a course of action which they believe to be in their own political and financial interests.

title: U.N. AT AN IMPASSE ON DUES PROBLEM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 24  An intensive nine month effort by a special com mittee to solve the critical fi nancial problems of the United Nations has failed because the Soviet Union refuses to accept a compromise solution that the majority of the committee de cided upon.

title: Waiters Vote Pact; Restaurant Owners Predict Price Rise
description: Many of the city's better known restaurants may raise prices and some may go out of business in the near future as a result of contract settle ments with waiters and waitres ses and with chefs and cooks, restaurateurs warned yesterday.

title: WAR DRESS WINS AT BOULDER BROOK
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Nov. 25 Nancy Baroody, a 16yearold senior at the Millbrook School in Millbrook, N.Y., rode War Dress to the junior working hunter championship and swept the equitation division today at the Boulder Brook fall horse show.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In this era of minorities with political clout, small shopkeepers are one of the few groups without power. It was therefore gratifying to see one of the most dis turbing problems facing the owners of small stores rec ognized by Simeon Goldstein in Build Housing, But Save Stores [Oct. 15].

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 25  When her automobile broke down recently, Mrs. Marie De Blassio found herself with out transportation. Living in rural Long Branch Borough, off a country road in south western Pennsylvania, she and her family are without bus or taxi service.

title: The Talk of Livingston
description: LIVINGSTONAmong the dozen advisory committees that serve town officials here is one that specializes in preserving the appearance of this community. For the 31, 500 residents, the Township Appearance Committee prob ably is the most important group functioning, for, as a gasoline station attendant put it, The thing we want most is to maintain the ap pearance and es thetics of this community.

title: On the Town In New York
description: President Nixon, taking some time off from deliberations at Camp David, dropped in last Friday on those twin bastions of New York: Wall ?? and Broadway.

title: SAD SPECTACLE
description: Lindsay Patterson, with a certain undisguised pique, in forms us that the Louisiana of the 1930's, as depicted in the enjoyable film Sounder, failed to describe truthfully either the time or the place. He tells his readers that he gained his expertise by liv ing among and observing the Black sharecropper of that unhappy era. Therefore any one who hastily and unques tioningly embraces the film finds himself a part of the saddest spectacle of all.

title: Great Swamp: Life Is Hard As Winter Sets In
description: MEYERSVILLEThe bat tered pickup truck stopped behind a shed. Two dead fawns, each bearing deep red gashes, lay on their sides, hidden from the public road.

title: L.I. Museum Group Tours Bay State Site
description: NORTHFIELD, Mass,  A band of 70 ecological enthusi asts from Long Island's North Shore Junior Science Muse um, their friends and rela tives, spent a lively weekend exploring powergenerating electrical plants, analyzing river specimens for pollution, visiting ancient American In dian haunts, geological digs and an Early American vil lage.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: I suppose I ought to be flattered that you would so utterly break precedent with your letters column  indeed, all letters columns of my ac quaintance as to publish an attack on me when I have not contributed to the Book Review. Probably Barbara Laurens was moved to her outpouring, pub lished in your issue of Nov. 12, by the sight of your recent re view of my book, The New Chastity and Other Arguments Against Women's Liberation, by George Stade. Still, mod esty inclines me to the be lief that it was not any in dividual importance or my own which impelled you to publish not one but two comments on my efforts. Rather, I must some what disappointedly conclude that even such a publication as yours has proclaimed  for those with the temerity to fly in the face of current political piety with respect to the ever sodelicate Woman Question  open season.

title: Child for the Sheers
description: A daughter was born to Rabbi and Mrs. Charles Sheer of Riverdale, the Bronx, Nov. 3 in the hospital of the Albert Einstein Col lege of Medicine in the Bronx. The child is named Rachel Debra. Her father, formerly associate rabbi at the Riverdale Jewish Center, is Jewish Chaplain at Colum bia University.

title: FLORIDA FIELD GOAL TIES L.S.U., 3 TO 3
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Nov. 25 (UPI)  Louisiana State blew two shots at a gamewinning field goal in the closing seconds today and had to settle for a 33 tie with Florida in the rain.

title: Movies
description: EVEN the growing audi ence that is already familiar with the se vere and difficult style of the great French director Robert Bresson is likely to find some surprises in Four Nights of a Dreamer, which is currently at the Art Theater. His second movie in color (after Une Femme Douce, 1969), and his first to deal with an essentially ro mantic subject since the early Les Dames du Bois de Bou logne (1944), Four Nights of a Dreamer is unique not for its greater severity and difficultybut for its opu lence, its lyricism, its open ness to ordinary ways of feel ing and behaving.

title: LUTZ, ASHE GAIN ROME NET FINAL
description: ROME, Nov. 25Though he played poorly, Bob Lutz had a perfect night: he advanced to the final of the World Cham pionship Tennis winter cham pionships and will play the man of his choice, Arthur Ashe.

title: Tulsa Crushes North Texas As 3 Score 2 Touchdowns
DINNER WILL HELP TEL AVIV CENTER
description: A dinner to help initiate a national campaign for the Olympian Memorial Center for Physical Education at Tel Aviv University in Israel will be held Wednesday night at the Hilton Hotel in Washington.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: You could say (and I do) that there's a trend among the creative crowd on Madi son Avenue: To go Off Madi son Avenue. To do your own thing, in your own way, on your own. Away from the Es tablishment, away from big ness, Working alone or in small groups. Spending your time doing what you like best and what you do best. De liberately walking away from what on Madison Avenue has always been the ultimate: a top creative job in a top agency.

title: The World
description: BUENOS AIRESVulture Two, this Is Vulture Five, said the plainclothes policeman, talking into his walkie talkie outside Juan Domingo Pern's hotel room. Senor Pern wants to leave. What do we do?

title: Mary Maloney Married
description: Miss Mary Maloney, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Maloney of Violet Hill, Ire land, was married yesterday morning to Thomas Whyte, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Whyte of Dunmore, Ireland. The Rev. Angelo Pizzula per formed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception in Astoria, Queens.

title: Queens College Triumphs In Basketball Opener, 5844
description: Queens College opened its basketball season with a 5844 victory over York College.

title: Ohio Industrialist Reports Democrats Offer Him Post
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 25 (UPI) Joseph E. Cole said today that he had been offered the post of treasurer of the na tional Democratic party, but I definitely have not yet made a decision.

title: Land Fraud Target of U.S. Crackdown
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 25 Two and onehalf months of Federal hearings across the country have produced evi dence of widespread disrepu table practices by land devel opers in the face of a Federal crackdown that has resulted in indictments, convictions, fines and jail terms.

title: Graduate Sues for 1Million; Says School Failed to Teach
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 25 (AP)An 18yearold San Fran cisco resident, contending he can neither read nor write ade quately although he was graduated from a public high school, has asked for more than $1million in a suit against the school system.

title: New &Novel
description: MacKinlay Kantor's latest is an effervescent Valentine to the first two years of a happy marriage. These were the salad days in the mid1920's when the narrator accumulated the occupational versatility asso ciated with dust jacket bios: surveyor, departmentstore ad juster, reporter. In the midst of these adventures he married Irene Layne, a girl he met at a Little Theater group in Chi cago. And he never ceased to write. Verse for Line O Type, a newspaper column of the day. Short stories for College Humor and the boom fiction market.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: After the leading stock averages finish at record levels one week, what can they do for an encore?

title: Turin Police Battle Leftists
description: TURIN, Italy, Nov. 25 (Agence France  Presse)  Policemen hurled teargas grenades and several people were injured here today in a clash involving a thousand leftist demonstra tors. About 40 people were ar rested.

title: American Airlines
description: The purpose of the fare sale was to generate additional traffic. We established certain qualifica tions in our plan to help reduce the diversion of traffic that we would carry in any case during the period. The proposal was deemed by us to be economically feasible, and it was submitted to the Civil Aeronautics Board, which gave its approval.

title: INCREASED OUTLAY BY T.V.A. FORESEEN
description: KNOXVILLE, Nov. 25The cost of the Tennessee Valley Authority's environmental pro tection actions in a sevenstate region is averaging more than $1million a week this fiscal year, and next year it could nearly double, Aubrey J. Wag ner, the authority chairman, says.

title: Dance
description: ARTHUR MITCHELL'S Dance Theater of Har lem was in town for the final week of the American Dance Marathon that the City Center put on at the ANTA Theater. This was the only classic ballet com pany to appear in what was otherwise an exclusively mod erndance preserve. Yet the Dance Theater of Harlem has always done things in excep tional ways.

title: Court Upholds Hempstead In Barring Tank for Oil
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I.Fran cis T. Purcell, Presiding Supervisor of the Town of Hempstead, announced last week that the Appellate Di vision of the State Supreme Court had affirmed a lower. court ruling supporting the board's rejection of a request by the American Oil Com pany for a 995,000gallon gasoline storage tank in In wood.

title: The Tree Where Man Was Born
description: The loss of its animals is East Africa's symptom of tragedy, not only of the end of the splendid game, but a sign of the collapse of life itself, of soil, streams, of the fecun dity of the earth, and of something without name at the heart of the human experience.

title: Doctor Pleads in Drug Case
