description: BOSTON, Nov. 25 (AP)Dr. Max Faber, chief physician ex amining inductees at the Boston Army Base, pleaded not guilty in Chelsea District Court today to charges of illegally dis pensing prescriptions for nar cotics. The 68yearold Chelsea physician was arrested yester day and charged with nine counts of dispensing narcotic prescriptions. He was released for a hearing Dec. 15.

title: Second Bar, $8.40, Victor; Hold Your Peace Is Second
description: MIAMI, Nov. 25 (AP)J. C. H. Bryant's Second Bar outfin ished heavily favored Hold Your Peace today to win the $20,000added City of Miami Handicap at Calder Race Course by threequarters of a length.

title: Letters
description: In his zeal to reassure him self and his readers of the soundness of past literature on North Vietnam, John S. Carroll (After we get out, will there be a bloodbath in South Vietnam?, Oct. 15) violated the first rule of honest argumentation, which is to represent with reason able accuracy the text which you wish to refute. Having chosen my revisionist cri tique of past and present alle gations of a bloodbath in North Vietnam as his target, Carroll manages nevertheless to avoid reference  with a single exceptionto any of the specific evidence which I have offered in the two which he cites.

title: Newark Airport: Boom Is On
description: NEWARK  The interna tional air traveler is still a year away from landing here, but two projects designed with him in mind were an nounced last week.

title: Plane Triggers Minuteman
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Nov? 25 (AP)A Minuteman 3 missile was suc cessfully launched from a ground silo by an Air Force crew flying above this missile test base last night, the Air Force says. An Air Force spokesman termed the launch ing very unusual in that an air borne crew triggered the mis sile firing while aboard an EC135 aircraft.

title: Food: Quick With Quiche
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y. They are not related, but it's a sure bet that Rhoda Lee and Sara Lee have more in common than similar trade names. While one is a multi milliondollar corporation, pe tite Rhoda Lee (Prensky) is a young Spring Valley house wife and mother who turned her mother's baking lessons into a profitable business.

title: DR. SARA HIRSDANSKY
description: Dr. Sara Ryshpan Hirsdan sky, a psychiatrist for the Board of Education here from 1929 to 1949, working with mentally retarded children, died Friday at her home in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. Her age was 90.

title: Nicklaus, Miss Whitworth Honored
description: Jack Nicklaus and Kathy Whitworth have been named winners of the annual tour nament champion awards presented by Golf Digest mag azine.

title: Job Opportunities Frequently Vary Sharply Over the State
description: Whether today's labor mar ket is easy for the jobseeker to crack seems to depend to a great extent on where he or she lives in the state.

title: The World
description: GENEVAA new round of strategic arms limitation talks (SALT) between the United States and the Soviet Union opened here last week with the pri mary goal of making permanent and comprehensive an interim agreement that limits offensive weapons.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Businessmen have linger ing doubts about the impact and strength of the current wave of antibusiness feeling, particularly as expressed by the consumer advocates. It is clear that the outcome of this sentiment and its effects on corporate profits and con sumer prices are yet to ma terialize.

title: All at sea
description: Although we live in an age of astronauts, tales of the sea will al ways grip the imagination. There is a robotlike quality to these probes in outer space that is entirely miss ing from the struggle of a man alone against the everchanging sea.

title: McGrawHill Encyclopedia Of World Drama
description: Specialized encyclopedias are extremely necessary in fields such as medicine and law and, though they all may not be equally technical, we have multivolume encyclopedias in biography, philosophy, religion, the social sciences, photogra phy, and many other areas. Until now, however, I cannot recall (in English) an en cyclopedia of more than one volume devoted to drama. (Many research libraries have the Italian 10volume Enciclo pedia dello Spettacolo, but language barriers limit its use fulness.) Now, with the publica tion by McGrawHill of a fourvolume Encyclopedia of World Drama, the situation is changed. This, in itself, is enough to make the occurrence a happy and important one.

title: Aime Michaud Marries Joy Powers
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Nov. 25 Miss Joy Powers was married here this after noon to Aimd Michaud, for mer president of the Del Monte Properties Corporation. The Rev. David Hill per formed the Episcopal cere mony at the home of Col. and Mrs. Allen Griffin.

title: Music Mailbag:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: BLOOD SUBSTANCE USED FOR LEPROSY
description: A team of researchers has re ported promising results after treating a few leprosy patients with an experimental immun ologic therapy based on injec tions of a blood substance that has been the center of a scien tific mystery since it was dis covered in New York almost 25 years ago.

title: Jury to Weigh Hijacking
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 25 (UPI)A special Federal grand jury will meet Monday to con sider charges against three men accused of hijacking a Southern Airways jet Nov. 10, Justice Department officials said Fri day. The threemenHenry D. Jackson Jr., 27yearsold, Louis Moore, 27, and Melvin C. Cale, 22, remained in Havana when the 31 passengers and crew members returned to the Unit ed States Nov. 12.

title: SETON HALL TOPS MARIST FOR TITLE
Music Mailbag:
description: BRAVO Harold Schon berg for his protest against amplification in our musical thea ters!

title: POVERTY UNCLEAR AS A SEX FACTOR
description: An analysis of sexual experi ence among unmarried young women in the United States indicates that poverty by itself does not account for the fact that black women are more likely than whites to have pre marital sexual intercourse in their teen years.

title: The United Mine Workers holds an election
description: Back in the midnineteenthirties the coal miners in the United Mine Workers of America (U.M.W.) were the battering ram of organized labor. They were the strongest labor union in the United States. All that has been forgotten by most Americans now, by most union men as well, but next month when the 207,000member union elects its top offi cers the U.M.W. will once again be making labor history. The miners will be voting in the most closely regulated union election in American his tory. If they should elect Arnold Miller of the insurgent Miners for Democracy (M.F.D.) over W. A. (Tony) Boyle, it will be the first time contemporary history that a union has chosen a rankandfile leader over an incumbent union presi dent. This is an election that once again may thrust the U.M.W. to the forefront of American labor, an election between two men who in their campaign ing and in their lives are about as different as two men can be.

title: Allison Voted Driver of Year, Leading Follmer by Five Points
description: Bobby Allison, who won the money battle in stock car rac ing but lost the championship war to Richard Petty, hag been named Driver of the Year by panel of automotive sports writers.

title: Criminals At Large
description: It's hard to believe, but for over 50 years Agatha Christie has been writing stories fea turing her Belgian detective, Hercule Poirot. The first in the seriesThe Mysterious Affair at Styleswas published in 1920. And still Christie con tinues to publish. It is as if Edgar Allan Poe were still among us. No; that's unkind to the good lady. Conan Doyle, say. Maurice Leblanc. Sax Rohmer. Christie's record is un precedented. And so are her sales. Both have made history.

title: Photography
description: THE works of Lee Fried lander and Naomi Savage, currently on joint exhibit at the Witkin Gallery, 243 East 60th Street, are so diametrically opposed  right down to their basic premises  that they have virtually nothing in common. Both are photo graphic in origin, but beyond that juncture they do not meet again.

title: Connecticut Slates Hearing On Cable TV Moratorium
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 25 (UPI) The Connecticut State Public Utilities Commission will hold a public hearing Dec. 13 on a request by a coalition of com munity groups to suspend all cable television franchising in Connecticut until new licensing regulations are drawn up.

title: Miss Kumler Bride on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 25 Miss Suzanne Marie Kumler and John Leisenring Kem merer 3d were married here this morning by the Rev. Norman Y. Ishizaki in St. Alban's Episcopal Church.

title: Kissinger Meets With Nixon
description: Mr. Kissinger arrived at Ken nedy International Airport last night and went immediately by helicopter and limousine to the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, where he met with President Nixon.

title: Amelia Wood Wed To James K. Weber
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Nov. 25 Miss Amelia Gaillard Wood was married here this after noon to James Karl Weber, a student at the Columbia University College of Physi cians and Surgeons. The Rev. Henry Powers performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Atonement.

title: Music Mailbag:
description: Poor Steve Stills! Over and over again, he must be sub jected to the criticism of certain music reviewers who, like Loraine Alterman, have no real knowledge of the topic which they are review ing.

title: How Fair a Fare?
description: AS a commercial traveler who spends a sizable portion of his time up in the air, I was intrigued by a spate of recent advertisements describing a flying bargain: The Great Airfare Sale, offered by American Air lines. United Air Lines, Trans World Airlines and other competitors have similar offerings.

title: Minnesota Tops Notre Dame
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Nov. 25 (AP)  Cal Rossalter scored three goals and Jim Gambucci two tonight as Minnesota smashed Notre Dame, 71, in a Western Collegiate Hockey As sociation game.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: AS the author of the screenplay for Sounder, I was, of course, shocked by the doublebarrelled attack on this film by Vincent Canby and Lindsay Patterson that ap peared in a single issue of the Sunday Arts and Leisure Section.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WOODSVILLE, N. H.  Upper Connecticut River wa terfowlers make do with very little in the way of birds.

title: The World
description: PARIS  Henry Kissinger's one more round of negotiations lasting three or four days stretched through six days last week, and still there was no glimpse of an agreement to end the Vietnam war.

title: Jordan Said to Foil Plot to Overthrow Hussein and to Proclaim a Republic
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 25  Jordan has reportedly foiled an attempt to overthrow King Hus sein and proclaim a republic.

title: STRICT CURBS URGED ON CAMPAIGN FUNDS
description: The head of the New Jersey State Commission of Investiga tion said yesterday that tighter government control on cam paign contributions and spend ing could reduce the number of cases like that of Secretary of State Paul J. Sherwin.

title: Education
description: Grades, which have been as close ly associated with education as books, teachers and examinations, are being eliminated for more and more students from elementary school through college. And the issue has become a matter of spir ited debate in academic circles as well as student groups.

title: LETTERS
description: I wish to take issue with Dr. Pierre Rinfret's charge that Canada is increasingly antiAmerican. President Nixon's chief campaign spokesman on economics has evaded a few issues related to Canada's economic situa tion and rather than be con structive to the economy of both countries, he and the Nixon Administration are us ing a political issue to be de structive. [In Support of Nix onomics, Oct. 29.]

title: Potato Book Combines History and 100 Recipes
description: SAG HARBOR, L. I.The only way Truman Capote can bear to eat a potato is baked and then heaped with mounds of sour cream and caviar, the freshest, the grayest, the biggest Beluga.

title: Margaret Webster 19051972
description: I KNEW Margaret Webster for over 60 years, She was 4 and I was 10 when we first met. I can still see her as she was then: a very small rather plump child, her brown hair worn in two tight little plaits, her big blue eyes made rounder by large roundlensed glasses. These made a great impres sion on me, for in those far off days very few children wore glasses, and had it not been for them I should prob ably not even have noticed her. Since I was at the lofty age of ten, she struck me as very small fry indeed, and al together unworthy of my at tension.

title: Exacta Returns a Record $3,106.20 at Laurel Ancient Line Triumphs
U.S. REJECTS TALK OF PEACE SNAGS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 The Nixon Administration sought to convey the impres sion today that Henry A. Kis singer's return from Paris did not mean that the negotiations with North Vietnam on reach ing an Indochina settlement had broken down.

title: DUKLA REPERTORY IS A MEETING POT
description: I am Slovak but I had a Ukrainian grandmother and speak Hungarian, Slovak and Ukrainian, said Melania Nem cova, summing up in one sen tence what it means to grow up in Presov, the homebase for Czechoslovakia's Dukla Ukrain ian Dance Company. The troupe, for which Miss Nem cova is artistic director and choreographer, closes its brief run at Carnegie Hall this after noon. It will appear next Satur day evening at Queens College.

title: Nixon Aide Defends Notion Of Education for Careers
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 25 (AP) The top education official in the Nixon Administration says that the idea of educating peo ple for careers is not as anti intellectual or antihumanistic as some educators suspect.

title: Seoul Bars All Politicians From New Electoral College
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)Presi dent Park Chung Hee today barred all professional politi cians from membership in the electoral college that will re elect him for a sixyear term under the new constitution.

title: Music Mailbag:
description: How right Harold Schon berg is! My family and I were in the second row cen ter of the mezzanine for Two Gentlemen of Verona and the sound was appalling. When that chap started to squeal out Love in Bloom in a grotesquely inhuman voice, I wanted to run from the theater. Unfortunately, I remained, there being no refund provision for those of us so odd that our ears are attuned only to the sound of natural voice.

title: Elizabeth J. Bonan Fiancee of Paul BertinBoussu
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 15Mr. and Mrs. Seon Pierre Bonan of Greenwich have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Janet Bonan, to Paul Augustin BertinBoussu, son of Mrs. Ame BertinBoussu of Amiens and Morzine, France, and the late Mr. Ber tinBoussu.

title: 30 Injured in Explosion Outside Dublin Theater
description: DUBLIN, Sunday, Nov. 26 (AP)A powerful explosion ripped through the foyer of a downtown Dublin movie the atr early today, injuring at least 30 persons.

title: Israel vs. Syria
description: JERUSALEM  For both sides, it was the most bitter, sustained and costly battle along the IsraelSyrian ceasefire line in more than two years.

title: Allen Paces 2215 Victory
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 25 Cornell wound up its 1972 foot ball campaign on a winning note in Palmer Stadium this afternoon, beating Princeton, 2215, before 16,000 fans.

title: Miss Andreae, Marketing Aide To Be Married
description: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich., Nov. 25Mr. and Mrs. May nard Rudolph Andreae have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Adriane Andreae, to Delano de Windt 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ed ward Mandell de Windt of Lyndhurst, Ohio.

title: 90,000 IN MEXICO TO BE WED FRIDAY
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 25 (Reuters)Some 90,000 Mexi can couples living out of wed lock will be married Friday under a campaign sponsored by the wife of President Luis Ech everria Alvarez.

title: Winter Sports Guides Of E.C.A.C. Go on Sale
description: Applications for the two winter sports guides of the Eastern College Athletic Con ferencethe 112page 1972 73 Basketball Guide and the 56page 197273 Hockey Guideare now being ac cepted by mail.

title: Freshman's Heroics Pace Idaho to 2221 Victory
Jerry West Is Ejected First Time in 13 Years
description: PHOENIX, Nov. 25 (AP) For the first time in his 13 year career, Jerry West of the Los Angeles Lakers tonight was tossed out of a National Basketball Association game.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 25 (UPI)The police are providing aroundtheclock protection for Judge Colvin. Police Sgt. Ver non McDowell disclosed yester day that the judge had asked for protection after receiving threats through the mail.

title: Minnesota 146 Victor
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 25 (AP)Bob Morgan scored two touchdowns, the second after Wisconsin lost the ball on downs on its 22yard line, to spark Minnesota to a 146 Big Ten victory today.

title: NEW STARS
description: The only disturbing thing about Donal Henahan's arti cle on the overpayment of opera stars in his apparent (tacit) acceptance of the value of the star system. Cer tainly in Europe the major opera houses are proving that not only are the so called superstars gradually in less demand, they are almost not missed or in some cases not even wanted) by sophis ticated audiences. During the past two seasons at Covent Garden, Nilsson sang only about ten performances.

title: What's New at the Movies?
description: 1776, directed by Peter Hunt from a screenplay by Peter Stone and starring William Daniels, Howard Da Silva and Ken Howard, got 7 favorable reviews (Wanda Hale, News; Jeffrey Lyons, WPIXTV; Judith Crist, New York; William Wolf, Cue; Frances Taylor, New house Newspapers; Joseph Gelmis, Newsday; Bernard Drew, Gannett News Serv ice), 3 mixed (Vincent Can by, Times; Archer Winsten, Post; Gene Shalit, NBC) and 8 unfavorable reviews (Howard Kissel, Women's Wear; Leonard Harris, WCBSTV; Pauline Kael, New Yorker; Stanley Kauff mann, New Republic; Jay Cocks, Time; Paul D. Zim merman, Newsweek; Rich ard Schickel, Life; Rex Redd, News).

title: Atlanta Has Discovered a New Flame: The Boomer
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 25  Ice hockey is not exactly indig enous to this Southern me tropolis, but overnight it has become one of the most pop ular sports because of the heady success of the brand new Atlanta Flames. A bunch of youngsters, in their first season, rocketing off into the upper regions of the West Division of the National Hockey League.

title: Minnesota Wins, 93 to 71, From CaliforniaIrvine Five
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 25 (UPI)  Fourth  ranked Minnesota, getting 26 points from Ron Be hagen and 20 more from an Olympic star, Jim Brewer, to night coasted to an easy 9371 opening basketball victory over the University of California Irvine.

title: Janet Isham Becomes Bride Of H. J. Field Jr.
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill., Nov. 25Miss Janet McPherson Isham, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Snow Isham, was married here this after noon to H. James Field Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold James Field of Providence, R. I. The Rev, Frederick W. Finney, assisted by the Rev. Dr. George D. Langdon, per formed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Holy Spirit.

title: Miss Simpson Plans Nuptials
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 25 Mr. and Mrs. Walter Sumner Simpson have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Wendell Logan Simpson, to Haughton Fitz Randolph Jr., son of Mr. Ran dolph of New Orleans and Mrs. Gordon P. Franklin of New York.

title: Grant Van Sant Dies at 63; Executive of L. I. Banks
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Nov. 25 Grant Van Sant, retired execu tive vice president of the Security National Bank of Long Island, died Thursday of a cere bral hemorrhage at his home here. He was 63 years old.

title: CharterRevision Panel Slates Five Weeks of Public Hearings
description: The City Charter Revision Commission has sent thousands of invitations to civic organiza tions and block associations in an effort to make its five weeks of public hearings a vir tual town meeting on what is right and wrong with city gov ernment.

title: 61st Neediest Cases Appeal to Start Next Sunday
description: The 61st annual appeal for the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund will open next Sun day. Since 1912, the fund has been aiding thousands of desti tute and unfortunate individuals throughout the metropolitan area.

title: The Popkin Casean Ominous Chill
description: BOSTON  Manacled, wrapped in chains, Professor Samuel L. Popkin of Harvard was led off to prison last week after a futile 15month legal bat tle. The tall, 30yearold political sci entist, a specialist in Vietnamese vil lage life, thus became the first American scholar ever to be jailed for protecting his sources of information.

title: Miller to Start for Cards
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 25 (UPI) Terry Miller will replace Jeff Staggs at right linebacker in Monday night's game against the Dolphins in Miami, the St. Louis Cardinals said today. Staggs broke his right arm in last Sunday's game with the Giants. A defensive back, Chuck Beatty, will be activated to replace Staggs.

title: Recalling Munich Killings and Colorado Vote, Some in Montreal Oppose Being Host to '76 Olympics
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 25This cosmopolitan city is scheduled to be host to the 1976 Summer Olympics, but suddenly some of its residents are raising doubts.

title: The problems of giving money away
description: Has Andhrew Carnaygie given ye a libry yet? asked Mr. Dooley. Not that I know iv, said Mr. Hennessy.

title: Thomas Edward Engel Marries Suzanne Middlebrook Gallaudet
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25Trinity Episcopal Church was the setting here today for the marriage of Miss Suzanne Middlebrook Gallaudet to Thomas Edward Engel. The Rev. Thomas Kennedy per formed the ceremony.

title: A Pair of Old Pacers Form Perfecta Team
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Nov. 25Paddys Night, a 13 yearold pacer, who was the oldest competitor on today's harnessracing card at Monti cello Raceway, won the third race at a $16.40 straight pay off and was the lead part of a $206,40 perfecta payoff with Royal Rino, a 10year old. The winner, coowned and driven by Ed Gomoras, paced the mile in 2:104/5.

title: Books: C. P. A. Gimmickry
description: Whenever accountants gath er these days and discuss the changes that are being forced upon them, they are apt to voice their distaste for ivory tower thinking. It's no won der.

title: Brother of Kissinger Breaks Leg in a Fall
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Nov. 25 (AP)Walter Kissinger, the 48yearold brother of Henry A. Kissinger, was re ported resting in good condi tion at Huntington Hospital today after breaking his leg in a riding accident yesterday.

title: Spreading Malaise Vexes Italy
description: ROME, Nov. 25  Amid strikes, persistent economic stagnation and a widespread mood of lassitude, some Ital ian thinkers are worrying whether their nation will be able to keep up with the ad vanced western and north ern countries of Europe.

title: Bring Back the Turbans
description: Football helmets go back to the scarlet turbans wrapping thick heads of hair worn by Rutgers College players in the eighteenseventies.

title: About Motor Sports
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga., Nov. 25Last January, while trying to cross a street in Bangkok, Thailand, Bob Tul lius suffered multiple frac tures of the left leg and left arm in an encounter with a hitandrun chauffeur. Tul lius was flown back to Wash ington for treatment (surgery plaster cast, ev erything) in an orthopedic hospi tal. Even there he couldn't relax. He ran his Group 44 business from his hospital bed, working two telephones as doctors worked over him; he attended hospital parties that he describes as some of the best ever.

title: In the words of the Hon. John V. Lindsay: We have too many slobs.
description: In the bleached light that drifts through the iron rail down onto the IRT tracks at 96th Street, Tadzio D'allegro stops to watch the dust settle in the air. His eyes follow a fluttering scrap of newspaper and he begins to reflect on the random nature of art. If you really open up your head, make yourself receptive to everything, you'll see it's all art. All of it. That dirt, this paper, every last bit. To change it, to try to shape what is already in its optimum form is to misunderstand the nature of art. Crap is all and the city is crap. Slobs are every where and slop is art.

title: State Acquiring Suffolk Wetlands
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I.New York State began negotia tions last week with several Suffolk County landholders to buy the first parcels of 5.000 acres of wetlands on the Island. The property will be purchased with $18mil lion of the recently passed environmental bond issue funds.

title: ASIAN QUARTERBACK GETTING REORIENTED
description: LOGAN, Utah, Nov. 25 (AP) When Utah State University went to Japan to play football against two Japanese allstar teams last Christmas, it brought back a souvenir one of the Japanese quarterbacks.

title: Japanese Accident Kills 5
description: SHIZUOKA, Japan, Nov. 25 (AP)A tourist bus carrying 27 persons plunged 50 feet off a national highway this morning, killing five occupants and in juring 21, authorities said.

title: Manalapan Battles Road Plan
description: MANALAPAN TOWNSHIP Residents of this Mon mouth County community have united to fight a pro posed New Jersey Turnpike spur that is slated to pass within 200 feet of an ele mentary school and elimi nate 23 homes. Ironically, the highway was placed on the Monmouth County Plan ning Board map eight years ago, when the school and many of the dwellings were not built, so as to allow the town to plan around it.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Tom Dempsey kicked his pre posterous 63yard field goal two years ago, the New Orleans Saints clamped a halo on his head and elevated him instantly to the upper reaches of their heavenly hierarchy. It was an angelic existence for only a brief while, because trouble already had entered paradiseor at least Demp sey's corner of paradise.

title: FOOTBALL AUDIT IS ALMOST READY
description: A certified audit covering the National Football Foundation's 19 years of operation is nearly complete, the foundation's pres ident, former Senator George L. Murphy, has announced. He expressed the hope that critics of the foundation will have the decency to print the facts rather than their, up to now, damaging fictions.

title: What's New in Theater?
description: ENEMIES, the Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center's production of Maxim Gor ky's play, got four favor able reviews (Barnes, Times; Wallach, Newsday; Gayer, UPI; Harris, CBS TV), three mixed (Watt, News; Watts, Post; Book span, WPIXTV) and four unfavorable reviews (Gott fried, Women's Wear; Raidy, Newhouse News papers; Glover, AP; Klein, WNEWTV).

title: 5 West Texas Farmers Sue Over Grain Sale to Soviet
description: AMARILLO, Tex., Nov. 25 (AP)Five West Texas farmers have filed a suit contending that information about the sale of grain to the Soviet Union was withheld from them, caus ing them to sell their wheat for more than a dollar a bushel less than they could have obtained later.

title: Changes Made In Master Plan
description: A revision of the Master Plan for the city will include top priority low and middle income housing for Brooklyn and new health services for Queens.

title: Mich. Tech Six Wins
description: HOUGHTON, Mich., Nov. 25 (AP)Michigan Tech remained unbeaten in college hockey to night night by downing Bowling Green, 64. The Huskies scored four times in the final period.

title: Platform Tennis Purists Disdain Fashions
description: Something chic is happening to plat form tennis.

title: Rutgers Ends Season With 4313 Trouncing of Colgate
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 25Rutgers closed its football season today with its fifth straight victory, a 43to13 trouncing of Colgate. The triumph was the Scarlet's sixth in a row over the Red Raiders.

title: Jeanne Seibold Bride of G. R. McLaren
description: Miss Jeanne Seibold, daughter of Prof and Mrs. Francis Joseph Seibold of Sharon, Pa., was married here yesterday afternoon to Gordon Robert McLaren, son of Mrs. Milton C. McLaren of Fishkill, N. Y., and the late Mr. McLaren. The Rev. Thomas Bryden performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More. He was as sisted by the Rev. William Boak, a Presbyterian minis ter.

title: Middlesex to Debate A New Water Plan
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  A longrange plan to bolster Middlesex County's water re sources will be presented Tuesday night at a public hearing in the County Ad ministration Building here. Middlesex, with its 26 mu nicipalities, thus joins the many other New Jersey coun ties that have adopted or arc working on such plans for meeting future water needs.

title: About Pro Football
description: The wheel spins in the Na tional Football League again today and of the 10 games the key ones will be Green Bay at Washington, Kansas City at Oakland and Minne sota at Pittsburgh. The first two will be televised here, the Washington game on Channel 2 at 1 P.M., and the Oakland game on Channel 4 at 4 P.M. The keen competition for the playoffs is best exemplified by the National Conference's Central Division. If the Pack ers lose to the Redskins and the Vikings beat the Steelers, there will be a tie for first in that division among the Packers, the Vikings and the Detroit Lions, with seven victories, four defeats and three games to go.

title: Judge Backs a Suit By Inmates on Rights But Bars Injunction
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Nov. 25 A Federal judge supported the arguments of some prisoners here this week but denied their request for an injunction be cause of changed conditions since the suit was filed.

title: Kathleen M. Flanagan Bride of George Koyl
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Nov. 25Miss Kathleen Ma rie Flanagan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James J. Flanagan of Scarsdale, N. Y., became the bride at noon today of George Leslie Koyl. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert W. Koyl of Eaton Rapids.

title: Deer Hunt May Be Put Off
description: TRENTONGovernor Ca hill is expected to sign soon a bill banning the shooting of deer of either sex in eight southern New Jersey coun ties on Dec. 13, a day that has been designated as Doe Day. A doe is a female deer.

title: Hypertension Tests Offered
description: Visitors to the Kings Plaza Shopping Center at 5502 Ave nue U, Brooklyn, tomorrow and through next Thursday will be offered a free test for hyperten sion. The shopping center and the city's Health Service Ad ministration will offer the tests from 11 A.M. to 3 P.M. daily.

title: Environment
description: The nation's new ecological con sciousness, awakened in many com munities in just the last five years, is responsible for preserving vast areas of America's most lush and virgin wilderness territories. At the same time, however, it has created hard ship for thousands of families caught in the path of environmental progress.

title: Profession: concert singer, Freedom Movement lecturer
description: ATLANTA: Some of her closest friends say Mrs. Martin Luther King Jr. is so uppity these days that when a major Eastern foundation offered $70,000 for the memorial to her late husband, she had it turned down by a secretary. It should have been $100,000.

title: IN THE NATION
description: BENNINGTON, Vt.Driving north along the New York Thruway just before Thanksgiving, motorists could see numerous cars headed south with dead deer strapped on their roofs. There is something shocking about thisthe beautiful, stiffening animals hurtling atop the quintessential ma chine of the twentiethcentury toward the city and its wellstocked stores. But it does not seem so unnatural or contradictory to see the carcass of a deer hanging from a tree beside an old house along Route 7 near Arling ton, Vt.

title: Mrs. Noel LaMotte Miles Rewed
description: SALISBURY, Conn., Nov. 25Mrs. Noel LaMotte Miles, widow of Frederick W. Miles, and David Adams 4th, a vice president of finance of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation, were married here this after noon in the Congregational Church by the Rev. Charles Ranson.

title: Yugoslav Court Sentences 3 Croatians to Jail Terms
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 25  A Zagreb court trying Croatian intellectuals accused of counterrevolutionary activi ties has sentenced Dr. Marko Veselica, a university profes sor, to seven years of strict imprisonment.

title: State and Horse Tracks Look Back on SoSo Year
description: TRENTONThe horse rac ing season in New Jersey ends Dec. 5, and so far, the State Treasury, which derives a substantial amount of rev enues from the betting handle, and two of the largest tracks are disappointed with their take.

title: White Root Nut Still Reigns in Suffolk
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I.  Ask anyone what conies to mind when one mentions Long Is land, and the answer may well be, potatoes. Agricul ture has been a hallmark of the island's economic history since preColonial times.

title: Illinois Parachutists Claim Record With 162Man Jump
description: ZEPHYR HILLS, Fla., Nov. 25 (AP)  A record in freefall parachute jumping was claimed today by 162 men and a 6foot tall stuffed frog.

title: Pupils Write Text on Matawan
description: MATAWANThe first text book ever written on the town of Matawan will soon be off the press, and Mata wan Past and Present  A Look at Our Town also may be the first such text ever written by 9and 10year olds. Much of the content is based on original research.

title: E. Windsor Is Seeking To End Role As AlsoRan
description: EAST WINDSOR  These are trying times for a lot of residents in this central Jer sey community of 18,000, the fastestgrowing municipality in the state. For example:

title: Florham Park Children See Newark in a New Light
description: FLORHAM PARKFor her first class trip of the semes ter, Marie D'Amico decided to take her thirdgrade class at Brooklake School to a place very different from their suburban community. She knew that few children in Florham Park, a town in Morris County, ever saw any more of Newark than the parts that border the high ways passing through it, al though many of their fathers worked there every day.

title: In London, Mousetrap Is 20 Going on Forever
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP) Agatha Christie's detective thriller The Mousetrap be gins its record 21st year on the London stage today with its 8,311th performance.

title: A Bad Call Could Lead To a Family Quarrel
description: EDMONTON, Alberta (Ca nadian Press)Bill Bucyk, a Western Canada Hockey League referee, doesn't plan to let family ties prevent him from doing his job.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article City Battling Turmoil in New Rent Sys tem [Nov. 19] points up a few facts that we in the real estate industry have been aware of since Jan. 1, 1972.

title: Brigham Young Triumphs Over New Mexico, 217
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov. 25 (UPI)Pete Van Valkenburg scored two touchdowns, includ ing one on a 93yard kickoff return, and rushed for 190 yards today to lead Brigham Young University to a 217 Wsetern Athletic Conference victory over New Mexico.

title: A Beach Boys Concert
description: Call the Beach Boys surviv ors, survivors who continue to put their ebullience on dis play whenever they are given the opportunity.

title: Franco Honors His Granddaughter
description: MADRID, Nov. 25 (UPI) Generalissimo Francisco Fran co has conferred the titles of Duchess and Duke on his granddaughter, Maria Del Carmen MartinezBordiu, and her husband, Alfonso de Bor bon y Dampierre, the offi cial State Bulletin said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The letter entitled Pro tecting Buyers [Nov. 19] misinterprets the scope and limitations of the law relat ing to public offerings of condominiums and develop ments using homeowners' as sociations.

title: LETTERS
description: I was most interested in the ideas in the article The Cost of Being a Citizen by Arthur Dahlberg (Nov. 12).

title: A dress + a little something extra = a costume
description: Dresses are back. And back with a bonusa jacket, a cardigan, or a vest. Wear both parts by day and sub tract the coverup by night. The dress costume is gathering momentum fast and should be in full swing come spring. Shown here are four early versions for those who like being ahead of the times.

title: RAIN POSTPONES HILTON HEAD GOLF
description: HILTON HEAD, S. C., Nov. 25  Heavy rains forced the postponement of the third round of the $125,000 Heritage Classic Golf tournament at the Harbour Town links today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Prof. Jane VanDerKarr Basile's Nov. 19 letter commenting on the legality of Pern's rule in Argentina from 1946 to 1955 is in need of a correction.

title: WHAT PERCENTAGE?
description: Donal Henahan's wording of the question Are Opera Stars Worth Every Cent They Are Overpaid? implies the answer. But is this the sole reason that we are paying (or not paying) such high prices for our seats at the Met?

title: Environment
description: Pollution shock came to Maine's Chebeague Island last summer. Shell fishing was closed in Casco Bay after a tanker collided with a reef outside Portland, dumping 40,000 gallons of crude oil into the sea. Lobstermen quit because their line buoys were too mucky to handle; the seabirds began to die, their blackened feathers unable to hold the air that would insulate them from cold and keep them buoy ant. Then the vacationers left in droves, taking with them the money they otherwise would have spent. It's bad enough the swordfish is poisoned, said one departing visitor, but now you can't even swim.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: WEST BERLINThis, the most fa mous symbol in the Western world over the last quarter of a century and a lighthouse of freedom in Com munist Europe's geographical middle, seems doomed to start sliding into the backwaters of historyand there is probably little to be done about it.

title: Anne Berwick Wed to Robert Bell
description: BRISTOL, R. I., Nov. 25 Miss Anne R. Berwick, a staff member of the Environmen tal Policy Center in Wash ington, was married here this afternoon to Robert A. Bell, a Washington architect. The Rev. Johannes K. Jespersen, a Presbyterian minister, per formed the ceremony at the home of Mrs. Edward L. Leahy, the bride's grand mother.

title: TRUE KNIGHT WINS ROAMER AT $15.40
description: True Knight of the Darby Dan Farm came from way back in the 13/16mile Roamer Handicap at Aqueduct yester day and succeeded in posting a 1length victory in the $68,100 event for 3yearolds.

title: Linda Runyan to Wed
description: CHEVERLY, Md., Nov. 25 Mr. and Mrs. Howard G. Runyan have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Linda Jane Runyan, to John R. Flato, son of Mr. and Mrs. George S. Flato of Woodmere, L. I. Miss Runyan is an alumna of the Univer sity of Maryland. Her fianc, a graduate of Washington College in Chestertown, is assistant director of alumni relations at the Catholic Uni versity.

title: Alberta Star Sidelined
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 25 (Canadian Press)Jim Har rison, a leading scorer in the World Hockey Association, will be lost to the Alberta Oilers for more than a month because of a fractured knee suffered Wednesday in crashing into a goalpost in a game in Philadel phia.

title: A Supplement to the Oxford English Dictionary
description: Published in 1933, the first Supplement to the Oxford English Dictionary was intended to cover accessions to the language over the years 18841928, in which the original OED had been produced. The new Supplement, of which, AG is now published, will run to three volumes. It is far more am bitious than its predecessor. It will incorporate and thus supersede all the material assembled in 1933. It will include words in current use excluded from the original OED on grounds of technicality or decorum. It will attempt to cover and record the mutations in the language from 1884 to the present.

title: Queens BusGarage Plan Is Protested
description: Residents of Queens Village fan protesting plans for a new city bus garage in their area that they fear would re sult in increased air pollution.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Campaign and Election '72 will give thinking Americans much to ponder in the coming months and years, not the least being the ability of an in cumbent President to hide in the White House and behind the trappings of office to avoid ever facing his op ponent, to avoid popular examination and to present himself to the elector ate only under the most stringently controlled and manipulative conditions.

title: Hall Overton of Juilliard Dead; Symphonic and Jazz Composer
description: Hall Overton, a composer whose works bridged jazz and contemporary symphonic music, died Friday in Roosevelt Hos pital after a long illness. He was 52 years old and lived in Englewood, N.J.

title: Amor Artis
description: In moving from a conven tional concert hall to a church, Amor Artis has en abled itself to deal effective ly with interesting music literature that might seem somewhat out of place in an impersonal hall, even if it could be performed satisfac torily there.

title: WARSAW SENSES WORKER UNREST
description: WARSAW, Nov. 25Polish workers, whose violent uprising in 1970 forced a change in the nation's leadership, appear in many cases to be still dia satisfied and potentially dis ruptive two years later.

title: Does education guarantee a decent life? No
description: This book has already created a big fuss, and it is almost certain to create a bigger one. But the fuss is likely to come from the wrong places. Everyone involved in recent attempts to bring genuine education to minor ity students or to make the class room more alive and responsive to individual students will almost surely feel threatened. And professional educators will see the evidence pro duced by Christopher Jencks and a team of researchers as a direct attack on the whole institution of education. But Jencksassociate professor at the Harvard Graduate School of Edu cation and lecturer in sociology at Harvard Universityis not arguing against experiment in education, or against education itself, or against busing or desegregation. His case is against inequality and, therefore, against the economic and social structure of America. Though the central subject seems to be educa tion (that is what all the statistics are aboutwe use a lot of num bers, Jencks says), it really is only part of an argument that tinkering with institutions within society will not seriously reduce inequality.

title: Bureaucratic Wall
description: Government directives are no stronger than the officials charged with carrying them out. When President Nixon promulgated his Executive Order on Security Classification last March, his action was expected to hasten the declassification of Government records that are at least ten years old.

title: ExGovernor Is Fined
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Nov. 25 (AP)Former Gov. Philip H. Hoff, now a Burlington lawyer, pleaded no contest yesterday to a charge of driving while in toxicated. He was fined $100.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Sixteen months ago the Post Office Department be came the United States Post al Service, a quasipublic corporation, and Elmer T. Klassen, Postmaster General, began wrestling with a wide ly, criticized system that this year will cope with an esti mated 87 billion pieces of mail.

title: In Morristown, the Social List Tradition Dates to 1914
description: MORRISTOWN  Morris town is social to a degree. Very quietly social. And it has its own blue book.

title: Music
description: WHEN Charles Treger last week played the Hungarian Con certo by Joseph Joachim, he not only introduced a large scale romantic concerto that has not been played in New York in our time, he focused attention on a man who was one of the most important musicians of the 19th century, generally forgotten though he is today. Joseph Joachim: he lives on, faintly, as a friend of Brahms; as the composer of the cadenza to the Brahms Violin Concerto and the arranger for violin of several of the Brahms Hungari an Dances. What a fate for the greatest classical violinist of the century, for the famous teacher, composer, conductor, concertmaster, for the leader of the Joachim Quartet, for this large, bearded, dignified man who was such a legend in his time!

title: Mailbox:
description: It was pleasant to read Dr. John Nelson Washburn's re markable analysis of Soviet gamesmanship and the Olym pics, which appeared in the Nov. 5 Times. Having long ago concluded that Kremlinologists manage to stay employed most ly by making the obvious seem mysterious, I was reassured to discover that lockerroom ex perts on the Soviets are like all the rest.

title: BowlBound Tampa Stuns Vanderbilt in 307 Rout
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 25 (AP) Tampa's Eddie Caldwell raced 55 yards with an intercepted passe in the first period and started a 307 rout of Vander bilt tonight before a sparse, rainsoaked crowd of 11,931.

title: WOES OF HOSPITAL TIED TO STATE CUTS
description: A Brooklyn legislator charged yesterday that the quality of medical service and education at the Downstate Medical Cen ter had deteriorated over the last 10 years, largely because of state budget cuts.

title: If You Go
description: flying with Island Airlines, you may want to spend some time in the town of PutinBay on South Bass Island. It is enjoying a revival of its once formidable tourist trade with Island Airlines' Tin Goose hauling an increasing number of passengers each year and two ferry lines linking it with the mainland in the summer.

title: Letters:
description: Your travel stories have always been of special interest to me. However, I was shocked at the fact that a decent and serious paper such as yours would not only print but print on the first page an article like Dan Carlinsky's America on $0 a Day: the Private World of a Compulsive Hobo (Travel section, Oct. 22). How can you glorify this kind of lifestyle? Aren't there already enough parasites around? Everyone who works for a living must feel disgust at this article.

title: Theater: Zorilla's Don Juan Tenorio
description: One way to approach Don Juan Tenorlo, a Spanish masterwork written in 1844 by the poetplaywright, Jos Zorrilla, is to sit down and read it in English. William I. Oliver's English translation happens to be excellent.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: The length and displaypage position of James Peck's com ment on my book, Mao and China suggest that you con sidered it important. However, instead of reviewing the book, Peck used it as a platform from which to launch his own convictions. In so doing, he at tributed to me a rival ideologi cal bias he can conveniently assail.

title: 2 YOUTHS WITH BAT ROUT 4 WITH GUNS
description: Four teenagers with two guns who tried to rob a Staten Island delicatessen were routed by two 17yearold youths with baseball bat, the police re ported yesterday.

title: Oil Well on Football Field Opposed
description: BURKBURNETT, Texas., Nov. 25Samuel H. Walton owns 100 oil wells, but he wants to own 101.

title: Thousands Sample Foods and Wares At Muslim Bazaar
description: Thousands of black New Yorkers trekked through Har lem's old 369th Regimental armory yesterday scrutinizing and sometimes sampling the wares at the semiannual Na tion of Islam bazaar, now in its 15th year.

title: Steubenville Five Wins
description: WHEELING, W.Va., Nov. 25 (AP)Jim Garrigan's 21 points paced Steubenville College to a 6053 basketball victory over Mt. St. Mary's, Md., tonight in a firstround game of the Gol den Valley tournament.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: VIENNA, Nov. 25 (Reuters) Simon Wiesenthal, who has made a career of hunt ing Nazi war criminals, said he was very, very skeptical as there have been about 25 or 30 false Bormanns since the war.

title: Giants Are Picked By 13 Over Eagles
Harold Jacobs Heads Jewish Unit
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 25The election of Harold M. Jacobs of New York as president of the Union of Or thodox Jewish Congregations of America was announced here today.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 25 (AP)The Arizona Highway Department is testing an ex perimental sound screen de signed to make freeways quieter.

title: Mel Brooks Goes West
description: THE Old West may never be the Old West again, once a certain tough critter has gone thataway. And we do mean Mel Brooks, who has announced his plan to put the whammy on all the Western clichs in one bold cinematic sweep called Black Bart. The comedyadventure, which Brooks will begin directing for Warner Brothers next February in Arizona, is the brainchild of Brooks and a battery of writers that includes Andy Bergman, who wrote the original story, Norman Steinberg, Alan Uger and black comic Richard Pryor.

title: FRENCH COMBAT COMMANDO PERIL
description: PARIS, Nov. 25 (Reuters) The international threat of hi jackings and urban guerrilla ac tion has led the French police to form a specially trained 40 man AntiCommando Brigade in the capital.

title: ROLE OF AUDITOR UNDER OHIO STUDY
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 25An investigation has begun here into the possibility of a conflict of interest involving the Cuya hoga County Auditor's office when Mayor Ralph J. Perk of Cleveland was the Auditor.

title: MiniGrants Are Producing a Wide Variety of Art in State
description: TRENTON  New Jersey artists are competing for state funds under a program called Operation MiniGrant.

title: Scientists to Examine Prospect Park's Fallen Elm
description: Prospect Park's 300year old Great American Elm, which was cracked at its root and toppled over by a raging storm recently, is to be hauled away tomorrow and made the object of a close scien tific study by horticulturists, botanists and historians.

title: Montclair Red Cross Buses Aged to Food Stores
description: MONTCLAIR  On Tues days, Thursdays and Fridays, a sleek, yellow station wagon bearing the Red Cross insignia tours Montclair, picking up shoppers for the local supermarkets.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: One of your recent ads for the Decter book read as fol lows: These women, in her view, really desire a return to childhood, to a state in which they can evade all adult re sponsibility. To Decter, the con tradiction is not that women today are denied freedom, but rather that they are afforded such unlimited freedom.she added. Next thing you know, they'll be wanting to vote.

title: Toy's Strap Strangles Boy
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Nov. 25 (AP)William F. Mac Fie, the 11yearold son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew MacFie, was found yesterday in the kitchen of his home strangled in the strap of his toy rifle. The police said the boy apparently fell from the sink and the strap caught him around the throat.

title: Van Is Saving Newark Babies
description: NEWARKChildren's Hos pital is breathing life into Newark, a city whose via bility has been threatened by economic, social and political crises since the 1967 riots. The hospitalit is now an autonomous part of the Unit ed Hospitals Medical Center at South Ninth and West Market Streets, on the edge of the black ghettowas formerly known as Babies Hospital. It was founded in 1896, and is one of the old est pediatric centers in the country.

title: DEEPLY MOVED
description: As a school librarian who was so deeply moved by the book Sounder when it was published in 1969 that I read parts of it to my classes even before it received the New bery Medal in 1970, I have been extremely interested in the highly laudatory reviews of the film in various maga zines. But I've kept wonder ing how a Black critic or a Black teacher might evaluate it. So I was delighted and grateful to read the realistic, no nonsense article by Lindsay Patterson. It fitted in well with Vincent Canby's honest, cleareyed comments about the film in the same section.

title: CLEVELAND RIFT DIVIDES BLACKS
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 25A power struggle in Cleveland's black community has split the 21st District Congressional Caucus, formed several years ago to consolidate political control.

title: DUTCHMAN LEADS IN OUTBOARD RACE
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 25Cees Van Der Velden, aradiotelevision dealer from Boxtel, the Netherlands, took the lead today after the first of two days of racing in the $65, 000 PepsiCola outboard world championship.

title: Three Die in Car Crash
description: FORT WASHINGTON, Pa., Nov. 25 (UPI)Three persons were killed early today near this Philadelphia suburb when their car ran off the road and tumbled into a quarry filled with water. The police identi fied the victims as David W. Armstead, 27 years old, and his wife, Georgianna, 25, of North Hills, Pa., and her cousin, Pur nell Jones, 28, of Rochester.

title: PEKING REDUCING EXODUS TO FARMS
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 25This year fewer young people than before are having to leave the cities to work with peasants in rural China.

title: The Mng Aft 6 Rms Riv Vu
description: IT IS the morning after the opening night of my first play, 6 Rms Riv Vu. The play is a hit. I ?? at eleven, climb out of my canopied Louis XV bed and wander into the sun drenched kitchen. A strange man is making eggs Bene dict. It is Noel Coward.

title: Suspect in Slaying Dies
description: NORWALK, Conn., Nov. 25  Richard D, Norwood, 42 years old, who the police said fatally shot his divorced wife in the head on Nov. 18 at her nome in Wilton and then turned the gun on himself, died yesterday at Norwalk Hospital after failing to regain conscious ness since the shooting. His wife, Juanita, died there shortly after the shouting. Mr. Nor wood operated a Darien travel agency and a merchandising distributing concern in Bridge port.

title: Beanie Urges One Agency to Run All City JobTraining Programs
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame proposed yesterday that all of the city's jobtraining programs be turned over to the Economic Development Admin istration instead of being split up among eight city agencies.

title: ARKANSAS DEFEATS TEXAS TECH BY 2414
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Nov. 25 (UPI)Arkansas, fighting to re main out of the Southwest Con ference cellar, defeated Sun Bowlbound Texas Tech, 2414, today.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: It was good to see The Times switch from sniggering articles about railroad nostalgia to the serious and accurate report by Paul Friedlander on the Mon trealer. The only thing missing from his properly unfriendly review of Am trak's latest feat of running steel trains over marshmallow tracks was a de scription of the stations along the way.

title: Tufts Finishes With Surplus For Second Straight Year
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Nov. 25 (AP)Tufts University said to day that it finished the 1971 72 fiscal year with a $103,082 surplus, largely because of bet ter budget management and economies in some areas.

title: New Brooklyn Youth Center
description: The city's Youth Services Commissioner, Amalia V. Bet anzos, yesterday announced the formal opening today of a new youth center in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn. The facil ity at 11131117 Flatbush Ave nue, will provide services in job opportunities, school help and recreational facilities and is expected to serve more than 10,000 young people in their preteens and teens.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: I was glad to see Paul J. C. Fried lander's review of Amtrak's newly re stored New YorkMontreal rail service (The Traveler's World, Oct. 22). As a veteran of over 12,450 Amtrak miles, I believe most of his criticisms are properly directed; however, a few of his intended compliments are not al together flattering to Amtrak's efforts. I object particularly to his liberal, in deed excessive, use of the term old. It sounds as though he is describing a train of 1925 vintage, a museum piece. Now, I grant that the Montrealer, like most of Amtrak's trains, isn't composed of the newest equipment on American rails, but good heavens, it's far from old. Your highceilinged diner was probably built around 1948, and th heavy old Pullman sleeper is a few years newer than that.

title: The World
description: DUBLIN  Shortly before dawn last Sunday the Irish police stopped a car in the northern suburbs of Dublin and seized one of the occupants, Sean MacStiofain, the Londonborn chief of staff of the terrorist Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army. He was arrested under the Offenses Against the State Act, which gives the police power to stop, search, interrogate and arrest a person without a warrant.

title: Reflections at the Camp
description: WASHINGTONFor two weeks now, the helicopters have been ferrying Cabinet members, Presi dential aides and high officials to and from Camp David, the moun taintop retreat where President Nixon has been studying ways of shaking up and paring down the Government as he begins another fouryear term.

title: Clothing Workers' Union Head Assails Multinational Concerns
description: The newly elected head of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America warned yesterday that multinational corporations posed a serious threat to the welfare of Amer ican workers.

title: An Expert Tourist's Guide to Tourist Guides
description: ONE day last spring during a visit to the Nile Valley my traveling companions and I reached our fourth temple of the day at 3 o'clock in the afternoon. The sun, piti less, shimmered over the awesome ruins. Suddenly all I wanted to do after a long indoctrination into Egyptology was to sit on a stone and contemplate. So I did. Sat on a stone and declared quite firmly that I would pass this temple up.

title: KEY TEST AVOIDED ON EAGLE DEATHS
description: DENVER, Nov. 25Two men have been sentenced to fines below the maximum permitted and placed on probation after pleading guilty to reduced charges stemming from the kill ing of several hundred golden eagles in Wyoming and Colo rado.

title: Purlie Returning to Stage
description: After a year on tour, Pur lie, the musical based on Os sic Davis's Purlic Victorious, will return to Broadway for five weeks at the Billy Rose Theater, starting Dec. 26. Philip Rose is the producer. The cast includes Robert Guillaume, Pat ti Jo, Art Wallace, Sherman Hensley, Helen Martin and Shirley Monroe.

title: Bake it yourself
description: No one should have to bake bread at home. But the bread companies seem to have decided that the majority of their customers have no teeth and no tastebuds. Those of us who still want crust and texture are thus driven to this ancient procedure from time to time, if for no other reason than to give our children an occasional experience with a real loaf; which is to say, a food made with flour, yeast and liquid that cannot be compressed into the size of a walnut with a gentle squeeze. This dark, substantial bread takes its color but not its taste from coffee.

title: Home Improvement
description: As originally pointed out in this column about three months ago (Sept. 3), there has been a tremendous growth in interest in the use of brick or at least synthetic mate rials that look, feel and wear like brickaround the inside of the house. In addition to the two brands mentioned at that time (Cavrok which comes in panels or as indi vidual bricks, and Bricover which comes as individual bricks), there are at least three others now available that should prove of interest to readers who may be thinking of using one of these brick materials on a wall, or part of a wall, inside their home or apartment.

title: A Political Life Begins at 20
description: GLEN GARDNER  Terry Novacek is a 20yearold ca ble splicer who decided to run for a seat on the Borough Council after town officials had questioned his ability early this year. Now he is one of New Jersey's youngest municipal officers.

title: Suharto Meets With Pope At End of European Tour
description: ROME, Nov. 25President Suharto of Indonesia, conclud ing a tour of European coun tries, met today with Pope Paul VI in the Vatican. The papal audience came at the end of threeday visit to Rome by the Indonesian head of state.

title: World News Briefs
description: BAHRAIN, Nov. 25  Fire fighting equipment was rushed to this Persian Gulf island today from Kuwait and Qatar to help control a fire that burned out of control at the Bahrain Petro leum Company here.

title: Elizabeth Garvey Fiancee of Officer
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Nov. 25The engagement of Miss Elizabeth Lee Garvey to Lieut. Steven George Delaney, U.S.N.R., has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. John James Garvey, parents of the future bride. Lieutenant Delaney, who is serving with the Judge Advocate General Corps in Newport, R. I., is the son of Mr. and Mrs. George Delaney of Demarest, N. J.

title: Pleasant Little Ranger Goalie Ranks as Toughest in N.H.L.
description: The No. 1 goalie in the National Hockey League hardly stands out in a crowd. His name isn't a household word. He has never led the N.H.L.

title: U.S. Says System Of Interstate Roads Is 80% Completed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) The interstate highway sys tem, the most ambitious and expensive road project in the nation's history, is 80 per cent completed, the Government an nounced today.

title: UNESCO on Jerusalem
description: In another of those empty gestures that have made some United Nations specialized agencies so ineffective in the Middle East, the United Nations Educational, Sci entific and Cultural Organization's general conference has demanded that Israel halt all archeological excava tion in old Jerusalem.

title: Music
description: SOLILOQUIZING the other day about the state of the symphony orchestra, in which he is vitally concerned, Lorin Maazel had a good many opinions to offer. There have been some of my colleagues, he said, who have argued that the sym phony is dead. I don't believe that the last masterpiece has been written. In fact, I think we are in a most glorious age, in which one idea does not sup plant another. Many ideas and styles can exist side by side. We may be af fronted by the amalgam, but we look for the substance, of which any expres sion is valid.

title: Stamps
description: BOSTON'S Tea Party of Dec. 16, 1773, did not include a cotillion, al though Paul Revere, Samuel Adams and other American patriots disguised as Indians more than likely warwhooped a bit as they dumped tea from British ships anchored in Boston harbor that night. The event, a forerunner to the American Revolution, will be com memorated postally next July 4 when a block of four 8 cent stamps reconstructing the event will be released in Boston.

title: 650,000 DONORS AIDED M'GOVERN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 Although Senator George Mc Govern was overwhelmingly defeated for the Presidency, his candidacy prompted such an unmatched outpouring of con tributions that Democratic fi nance aides believe he may be out of debt by Jan. 1.

title: Scene of 228 Thanksgivings
description: At Thanksgiving, more than any other time of the year, we celebrate our Colonial heritage so evident in houses like this 18thcentury New England homestead, Its simple strength testifies to the honest com petence of the carpenters, neighbors, carvers, potters, silversmiths and weavers who built these houses and crafted the furnishings. This saltbox in South Egremont, Mass., was built 32 years before the signing of the Dec laration of Independence, and is es sentially unchanged. The exterior, the windows, the beams and wide board floors are all originalsomething of a rarity these nays. Mr. and Mrs. Joseph McGoldrick of New York who bought it as a retirement home eight years ago, restored many of its earli est features, including the keeping room (opposite page). They furnished it with authentic examples of early Connecti cut and Massachusetts furniture, and hung antique baskets from the beams. The long trestle table (its top is a single handhewn hoard) is set for the Thanksgiving feast with early pewter plates and beakers, handwoven place mats and napkins.

title: EARLIER PROGRAM ON DRUGS URGED
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Nov. 25 A survey of 10,000 junior and senior high school students in Suffolk County concluded today that drugeducation programs should begin as early as the fourth grade and no later than the seventh, instead of in the 11th and 12th grades as is now the nearly universal practice throughout the state.

title: New HowTo Books
description: TWO new howto books have recently been pub lished that should prove helpful to home car penters and woodworking en thusiasts.

title: The Queens' Vernacular
description: Homo lexicographicus is a chalcenterous subspecies of mankind (from the Greek for brazen bowels, applied to the grammarian Didymus). The latest members of this sub species, Mr. Bruce Rodgers (particularly) and Mr. Robert A. Wilson, should qualify for some kind of bronze (or brazen!) medal for completing these two monumentally bowel testing tasks. There must be many peoplepolicemen, pris on staff, male nurses in mental hospitals, brothel bouncers, and so onwhose normal round of duties brings them into con tact with unattractive aspects of modern life, but scholars and writers can normally opt out of unpleasantness if they wish to Lexicographers can not at any rate those respon sible for compiling the largest dictionaries and the dictionaries of slang. And some lexicogra phers must focus on the sad language of sexuality, includ ing the clinical terminology of sexual behavior as described by Havelock Ellis, A. C. Kinsey and other medical writers and the erotic and scatological vo cabulary of the more sexually oriented people themselves. How do they find out the facts?

title: Hearing Sought for Train Schedules
description: A Brooklyn legislator said yesterday that he would file a suit tomorrow in State Supreme Court to compel the Transit Authority to hold public hear ings before instituting schedule changes.

title: CHINESE DIGGING FOR ANCIENT MAN
description: CHOUKOUTIEN, China, Nov. 25The original Peking Man is gone, perhaps forever, but in the rugged limestone hills above this little town the search for others like him con tinues.

title: FILION WINS TWICE THEN BREAKS PACE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 25 By winning two of nine events at the Freehold N. J., Raceway this afternoon, Herve Filion registered his 539th and 540th triumphs of the season.

title: Chris Evert Is Looking Beyond Money
description: Chris Evert has made her decision and the tennis world has stopped guessing.

title: An Arena to Rival Garden Is Planned
description: MOUNT LAUREL TOWN SHIP  An indoor sports arena as large as Madison Square Garden in New York, and probably boasting its own professional hockey team, may be under construc tion here by next spring.

title: 87,040 at Columbus See Wolverines Frustrated at Goal Line
The red kimono
description: PIPERSVILLE, Pa.The Japanese follow an at tractive custom whereby a man, when he reaches the age of 60, is free to wear his kimono lined with red. And the more flaming the red, the better.

title: Lutherans Welcome Ugandan Refugees Into Minneapolis
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 25I hear that it is very cold here, said the young Ugandan as he emerged from an airplane at the Twin Cities International Airport. And that you have a great holiday tomorrow or the next dayThanksgiving it is called.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD increased stock purchas ing margins from 55 per cent to 65 per cent.  A Conference Board survey shows strong continuing demand for cars, homes and appliances.  A group led by Westinghouse Electric will build a $700million breeder reactor nuclear power plant at Oak Ridge, Tenn.  A group of five companies, including two banks and their leasing subsidiaries, arranged $250million financing to build three ships to carry liquefied natural gas to the United States.

title: Richey Advances
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 25 (Agence FrancePresse) Cliff Richey of the United States eliminated Frew McMillan of South Africa in the openingi round of another World Cham pionship Tennis tournament here today. Richey won, 62, 16, 61.

title: Sydney McDowell Wed to Ad Man
description: St. James' Episcopal Church was the setting yesterday aft ernoon for the marriage of Miss Sydney Bradford Mc Dowell, daughter of Mrs. Breck McDowell of Small Point, Me., and the late Alan McDowell, to Merrill Sheri dan Snyder. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Merrill W. Sny der of Ridgewood, N. J.

title: The Happy Exile:
description: ANCHORAGE ISLAND, South Pacific  On the white, sandy shore where the palm trees meet the coral and crying frigate birds circle overhead, a man scans the horizon, shielding his eyes from the strong afternoon sun. He is 5 feet 10 inches tall and looks taller because he weighs only 130 pounds; he is remark ably trim and free of wrinkles, consider ing his age, and his body is tanned the color of mahogany. His face is clean shaven, his gray hair cropped short. He wears faded green and white shorts, held together in front with a pair of large safety pins, and a straw hat.

title: Cambodia Acts to Halt Pay For Her Phantom Troops
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)A drive to rid the Cambodian Army of its phantom troops has been opened here.

title: Volunteers Helping Burlington Inmates
description: MOUNT HOLLYMrs. De anna Slate of Moorestown sighed as she recalled the let ter from the prisoner. It was so nice of you to think of me as a person, it began.

title: MAFIA ACTIVITIES STARTLE ROMANS
description: ROME, Nov. 25  Romans are startled to learn that Ma fiosi and other criminals are ensconced in a central neigh borhood near the Colosseum that was of ill repute in anti quity but has lately seemed staid enough.

title: Changing Style on Seventh Ave.
description: To the outsider, the Sev enth Avenue garment district is a tangle of confusion traffic, hand trucks, street vendors, buyers, loafers, modelsall somehow sug gesting but never quite iden tifying the business that goes on in the buildings along the street.

title: Variable Life: Decision Near
description: Imagine a revolutionary kind of life insurance policy that takes the money paid the policyholder, invests it in the stock market and, if the stock goes up, the policyhold er gets the benefit. If it goes down, then the company guarantees at least a fixed death benefit and takes the loss itself.

title: Bridge
description: The tournament bridge world contains a number of eccentrics whose chief delight is to make weird bids and dis locate the normal bidding. There is one situation that in variably provokes their wild est excesses  not vulnerable against vulnerable, and in third seat with a weak hand.

title: Book Ban Still Splits School Unit In Queens
description: I am firmly opposed to censorship. It is selfdefeat ing, useless and wrong, said Hyman Rosner, a mem ber of School Board 25 in Flushing, Queens, comment ing on the board's decision to ban from the school library shelves Down These Mean Streets, an autobiog raphy of Phi Thomas that depicts his growing up in Spanish Harlem. The ban was upheld recently when the United States Supreme Court refused to review a lower court ruling.

title: March Enders, W. R. Kornack To Be Married
description: AVON, Conn., Nov. 25 Mr. and Mrs. Ostrom Enders of Avon have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Dr. March Enders, to Wallace R. Kornack of Beth esda, Md., son of Mr. and Mrs. George Kornack of Chelsea, Mass.

title: CANADA FOOTBALL IS LOOKING TO U.S.
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 25 (UPI) The prospect of the Canadian Football League's expanding to include United States franchises has started a nationwide debate that has as much to do with politics and social identity as it does with sport.

title: Mrs. Rogers Has Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. John S. Rogers Nov. 2 at Roosevelt Hospital. The child, the couple's third son, has been named Andrew Lewis. Mrs. Rogers is the former Miss Elizabeth Kirkor of London. Her husband, an admiralty lawyer, is with Burlingham, Underwood & Lord here.

title: Audible, visible, risible, but not to be taken seriously
description: The subject of this excellent biog raphy illustrates the difference be tween prominence and importance. Posterity almost certainly will be be wildered by her immense contem porary reputation: Whatever was all the fuss about? Even now, not quite 10 years after her death, one is bemused by the phenomenon. Who ever is interested in English life in the first half of the 20th century must have been made aware of Nancy Astor. He will have caught flattering, but more frequently un favorable glimpses of her in one or another memoir, diary, biography, or political account of the period. At the very least, she was someone to whom attention was paid.

title: Navy Air Reserve Command And Surface Division Unite
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP) Consolidation of the Naval Surface and Air Reserve Com mands was announced today in a move that the Navy said was designed to strengthen the naval reserve.

title: Troops Abroad to Get Free Christmas Calls
description: Men and women serving overseas in the armed forces will be able to call home at Christmastime free of charge again, The Associated Press reported.

title: Program Helps Over40 Pregnancies
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L.I. Some pregnant women over 40 years old who are troubled by the increased risk of pro ducing a defective baby at their age are being helped by a new hospital program that tests for defects and requires that the woman undergo an abortion if the fetus is mon goloid.

title: LEGAL NUMBERS URGED FOR STATE TO REDUCE CRIME
description: An elaborate study of gam bling in New York estimates that illegal gambling operators in the city gross more than $1.7billion a year and that one out of four New Yorkers plays the numbers game.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONThe day is near when a merchantman flying the Stars and Stripes will drop anchor at Shang hai, or an American chartered jet transport will land in Shanghai, Peking or Canton with American businessmen, visitors or cargo.

title: British Army Scraps Khaki Shorts
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 25 (AP)A Chinese salesgirl thinks they're cute. A British Army sergeant thinks they're practical. An American ser viceman on leave here wishes G.I.'s had them.

title: West 100th St.: Prosperity Ends and Crime Begins
description: Almost like a wall, the bar rier between moderate, middle class prosperity and the social disorders of poverty runs along 100th Street on the Upper West Side.

title: Peron Demands Pure and Unrestricted Elections
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 25  Juan D. Pern today made his conditions for political peace with Argentina's military Gov ernment clear for the first time since he returned from exile eight days ago.

title: Japanese Announce Device
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)  A Japanese company has announced what it describes as the first audio visual system for selfteaching of English, with 7,000 photo graphs reflecting the entire spectrum of American society. The student could use sight, hearing and speaking to give him the environment of an Englishspeaking country, the company, Eduputor, said.

title: Twists, turns
description: Somehow I find it hard to believe in the pubescent book market. In my, no doubt inadequate, experience with the 1015 age group, those who can read seem much to prefer adult fiction, however imperfectly under stood, to adult condescension, how ever well disguised. Left to them selves, these increasingly worldly 5ththrough10th Graders would, I suspect, pass over books like THE POWER OF STARS by Louise Law rence (Harper & Row. $4.95) and settle for Jonathan Livingston Sea gull like everybody else.

title: A Foreigner's America, From the Old Beginning to the New One
description: ONE goes to other countries to see the past, the preserved remnants of history and ethnicity; the peo ple and places often are, in a word frequently used, charming. But one comes to the United States  al ways, no matter how oftento see the future. America has revealed itself so much through movies and television that it is really foreign to no one, it is vicar iously part of everyone's life. But for the visitor, it is also a projection of what life in his own country will be like five, ten, twenty years from now.

title: Socialists Support Blacks
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 25 (AP) Plans were announced at a national convention of Social ists here today to organize national support for black stu dents at Southern University.

title: Women Emerge as Force in Australian Election
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 25  Australian women, long con sidered a passive element in the largely maleoriented poli tical scene here, have emerged suddenly as an organized and formidable factor in the cam paigning for the elections to the House of Representatives next Saturday.

title: U.C.L.A. Gains in Soccer
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 25 (AP) Bernardino Ortiz broke a scoreless tie in the second half today and the University of California, Los Angeles, went on to a 50 victory over Wash ington in a National Collegiate Western Regional soccer match. U.C.L.A. next plays the win ner of the San Jose State Fresno State game.

title: The Nation
description: Last June 29, the United States Supreme Court by a 54 majority is sued a ruling that, in effect, spelled the end of capital punishment. For the 600 inmates then housed on the country's death rows, and for the civil libertarians pleading their cause, it was a signal success. The prevailing theme of the decision seemed to be that the death penalty was being meted out unfairly, almost capricious ly, and affected primarily the poor and the nonwhite in America. As Justice Potter Stewart said: These death sentences are cruel and unusual in the same way that being struck by lightning is cruel and unusual.

title: Future a Hazy One At Fairfield Airport
description: FAIRFIELD  With Cald well Wright Airport's future in doubt, Peggy Naumann, a 28yearold flight instructor, is wondering what the future holds in store for her, as well.

title: FREEPORT TIES BETHPAGE 6 TO 6
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 25  High  scoring Bethpage was willing to settle for a 6.0 vic tory over Freeport today in the Nassau County Division II play off, but Torn Garrity, a Free port lineman, was not.

title: Poetry Readings Attracting Young
description: HACKENSACK  Poetry readings may not rival rock concerts as a favorite pas time of youth. However, they seem to be enjoying some thing of a boom among young people in a number of New Jersey communities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: NYT

title: Reporter Weds Judith Adamek
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 25Miss Judith Lee Ada mek, daughter of Maj. Vic tor W. Adamek, U.S.A.F., re tired, and Mrs. Adamek of Sacramento, was married here this afternoon to Patti son Fulton. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. James M. Ful ton of Far Hills, N. J., and Vineyard Haven, Mass.

title: Chaparrals Win, 9794
description: DALLAS, Nov. 25 (UPI)The Dallas Chaparrals, with Rich Jones doing the bulk of the work, scored 11 straight points early in the final period and then held on tonight to defeat the Utah Stars, 9794.

title: Education
