description: President Nixon clasped hands with a 21yearold Israeli and a 23yearold Egyptian amid a smiling, applauding crowd in Rockefeller Center yesterday and said, This is the way we, would like the whole world to look.

title: Music Mailbag:
description: Janos Starker is entitled to say whatever he wants in an interview, including the claim that he is one of the world's three best cellists, but I think some clarification might be in order and I would like to comment on this twaddle.

title: The greatest filmmaker the world has seen so far
description: The necessity of a book on Ingmar Bergman now seems prefigured from the very beginning of John Simon's film criticism. No other director has consistently won from him such un stinting praise. In Simon's Movies Into Film (1971) one finds Bergman extolled as the truest, most selfsus taining, least exhaustible genius of the cinema, and as early as Acid Test (1963), the Swedish director takes on Shakespearean dimensions. This present homage thus acquires a certain inevitability, as does the ini tial sentence of its critical portion, which declares that Ingmar Berg man is, in my most carefully con sidered opinion, the greatest film maker the world has seen so far.

title: PRO GRAND SLALOM TAKEN BY STUEFER
description: ASPEN, Colo., Nov. 25The world champion professional ski racer and Jean Claude Killy of France were defeated easily today by Harald Stuefer of Austria in the first race of the 12event Benson & Hedges 100 grand prix of professional ski racing.

title: The Uses of Power
description: The power of government in a selfgoverning society has to be responsive to the will of the political leaders whom the people have chosen. But if freedom is to be protected and nourished, power also has to be visible, accountable, and subject to legal and institutional re straints.

title: The Airline With the Ford in Its resent
description: PORT CLINTON, OhioOne of the few gifts remaining for the man who has flown everywhere on everything is a ride on Island Airlines, which links four Lake Erie islands with this lakeshore city and calls itself, probably accurately, the shortest airline in the world. The full trip in cludes a dozen takeoffs and landings and takes only 55 minutesin a Ford trimotor plane, known affectionately as the Tin Goose. Almost half a century old, the trimotor is one of the first aircraft ever built with allmetal wings and fuselage.

title: Music Mailbag:
description: The Metropolitan Opera seems determined to rid itself of its most loyal band of opera loversthe standees by making it virtually im possible for them to purchase standing room.

title: Legislative Notes: Cemetery Investigation Urged
description: TRENTONTo Assembly man Christopher Jackman, it sounded like something straight out of Edgar Allan Poe.

title: A.M.A. TRUSTEES SAY DUES MAY BE RAISED
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 25 (AP) The American Medical Asso ciation was warned today that an increase in dues might be necessary unless the organiza tion's power structure exercised fiscal restraints and cut down on extraneous activi ties and manpower.

title: Letters:
description: Reading and rereading the Oct. 8 article dealing with five young Amer icans on their travels abroad, I felt as if I were reunited with close friends.

title: State Leads The Blind Into World Of Sighted
description: LODIWhen the class room door opened, Mary Ann Patti cocked her head ex pectantly and listened for footsteps. Then she swiftly gathered up an abacus, a Braille writer and a tape recorder, eager to begin the special lesson with Mrs. Ger aldine Markowitz, a teacher for the blind.

title: D. S. Abelson to Wed Alison Cohen
description: The engagement of Miss Alison Rose Cohen to Donald S. Abelson has been an nounced by her parents, Prof. Henry Cohen, dean of the center for New York City Affairs at the New School for Social Research, and Mrs. Cohen, of New York and Gay Head, Martha's Vineyard. The future bride groom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold D. Abelson of Roslyn, L. L, Hubbardton, Vt., and Queenstown, New Zea land.

title: Mrs. Sarah G. Arrowsmith Is Rewed
description: MADISON, N.J., Nov. 25 Mrs. Sarah Goodbody Arrow smith of Madison and John Douglas Norris of Summit were married here this noon in Grace Episcopal Church by the Rev. William L. Nei man Jr.

title: NO LATER STEPUP SEEN IN THAI WAR
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 24  Intelligence analysts here foresee no dramatic increase of Communistled insurgency in Thailand after a Vietnam set tlement even if American air bases remain on Thai soil.

title: CONNECTICUT ACTS TO EASE BUS CRISIS
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 26Emer gency parking areas, city owned shuttlebus service and car pools were being set up to day to cope with a transporta tion crisis 110,000 bus riders will face tomorrow in Hartford, New Haven and Stamford.

title: Book Says Churchill Praised Truman
description: Winston Churchill told Harry S. Truman in 1953 that he had taken a dim view of him as President when he had suc ceeded President Roosevelt in 1945, according to a new biog raphy written by Mr. Truman's daughter. I misjudged you badly. Since that time, you, more than any other man, have saved Western civilization, the Prime Minister is quoted as saying to the President.

title: `Dustpan Boats and Recycling Help to Free Harbor of Debris
description: Every morning Charlie Sprague leaves the blueand white trailer in which he lives in a rotting area of the Jersey City waterfront not far from the Statue of Lib erty, and walks about a hun dred yards to a primitive sawmill, just like the ones in the Adirondack Mountains, where he grew up.

title: Curran Discloses State Inquiry Into Light Sentences of Mafiosi
description: Paul J. Curran, chairman of the State Commission of In vestigation, disclosed yesterday that his agency was looking into several cases in which Mafia figures had received lenient sentences.

title: ARTHUR LEJWA, 77, BIOCHEMIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Arthur Lejwa, Polishborn biochemist, who embarked on a new career in the 1950's, when, with his wife, Madeline Cha lette, he established the Galerie Chalette in New York and spe cialized in 20thcentury art, died here Oct. 27. He was 77 years old and lived at 9 East 88th Street.

title: N. A. S. D. Punishes 7 Member Firms For Violating Rules
Nation's First TV Repair Coop Finds It Pays to Put Service Before Profits
description: It looks like an ordinary television repair shop, with its blank screens and spa ghettiwired chassis piled in every available corner.

title: SECURITY NATIONAL FORECASTS EARNINGS
description: The Security National Bank expects to earn between $3.5 million and $4million in the fourth quarter of 1972, Patrick J. Clifford, chairman of the bank, said in an interview over the weekend. In the same pe riod last year, Security National earned $3.7million, or 78 cents a share.

title: DALMATINAC BEATS ELIZABETH IN FINAL
description: For Elizabeth of New Jersey, the holder of the United States Challenge Cupthe most cov eted prize in American soccer yesterday was possibly the darkest day in the team's his tory as Dalmatinac scored three times in the first half to take the New Jersey final of the 60yearold competition with a 30 victory.

title: CITY BIDS PARTIES MEET HERE IN 1976
description: New York City, which has not had a Presidential conven tion since 1924, is making a pitch for the 1976 Democratic and Republican conventions, with plans to house them in the mammoth convention and exhi bition hall that will get under construction here next year.

title: Three Girls Killed by Logs
description: ABERDEEN, Wash. Nov. 26 (UPI)Three girls playing on beaches were killed yesterday by logs tossing in a heavy surf. The victims were Margaret Woreley, 8, years old, of Port Orchard, and Kathy Eader and Becky Schutt of Bermerton, both 14. Logs are common in the ocean in this lumber region.

title: Canadian Wins Bowling Title
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, Nov. 26 (Reuters)Ray Mitchell of Canada won the World Cup bowling championship tonight when he defeated the Philip pines champion, Loreto Mara nan, 550 pins to 532. Roger Delkin of Normal, III., the de fending champion, was elim inated when he finished fourth in the preliminary round.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LAKE HAVASU, Ariz., Nov. 26 (AP)Johnnie Sanders of Denver won the $18,000 first prize in the world out board championships on the Colorado River today. Sanders covered 696 miles at a record 87 miles an hournearly 5 m.p.h. better than the mark set last year by Bill Sirois of Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: Brandenburg Ensemble Excels in Bach Program
description: The Brandenburg Ensem ble, which made its debut at Philharmonic Hall yesterday afternoon, will be welcomed enthusiastically by all Bach lovers who regard arguments over authentic performance practice as petty, pedantic and rather a bore. The en semble, led by Alexander Schneider, is made up of 15 string players, predomi nantly young and uniformly excellent. It boggled not at all at giving the modern piano, played with quick silver brilliance by Murray Perahia, a dominant role in two of the four works.

title: Advertising:
description: Since Dick Calderhead and Dick Jackson started Calder head, Jackson, Inc., in 1969 they've spent about $27,000 for advertising  themsevles.

title: Pennsylvania Officials Accuse 9 Of Poaching and Marketing Deer
description: STROUDSBURG, Pa., Nov. 26 Nine persons have been ar rested here in what a game of ficial says was the illegal slay ing of hundreds of deer over about two years on state game lands in the Pocono Moun tains.

title: Advertising:
description: Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn International's planned acquisition of Rob ert E. Wilson, Inc., an agency with $5.5million billings in the healthcare field, has come off.

title: Miss Robin Silverman Married
description: MILLBURN, N. J., Nov. 26 Miss Robin Silverman, edu cational adviser with the in vestment banking firm of Loeb Rhoades & Co., was mar ried here today to Howard Lasher, a member of the American Stock Exchange and senior vice president and member of the board of di rectors of Pressman, Frohlich & Frost, stockbrokers.

title: Brooklyn Man Is Arrested In Slaying of Babysitter, 13
description: A 20yearold Brooklyn man has been charged with the knife slaying Saturday of Denise Washington, a 13yearold baby sitter, in the Tompkins housing project in Williamsburg.

title: EMPHASIS URGED ON ISRAEL'S AIMS
description: An economist warned yester day that fundraising on behalf of Israel would lose its appeal and moral justification unless Jewish organizations placed greater emphasis on Israel's social purposes and human, achievements.

title: Books of The Times
description: GOLF IN THE KINGDOM. By Michael Murphy. 205 pages. An Esalen Book. Viking. $7.95.

title: RANGERS DEFEAT MAPLE LEAFS, 74
description: After a week of indifferent performances against inferior teams, the Rangers came up with the effort they needed last night to send them on a long trip in good spirits.

title: Pitt Racing Team's Car Falters in a Final Test
Final Contract Drawn Up In West Coast Dock Strike
description: The West Coast dock work ers' strike appeared close to settlement yesterday, with the announcement ?? a final draft contract was ready for examination by the Govern ment's chief labor trouble shooter.

title: North Stars Beat Canucks
description: VANCOUVER, CP British Co lumbia, Nov. 26 (Canadian Press)Lou Nanne's seventh goal of the season carried the Minnesota North Stars to a 31 victory over the Vacouver Ca nucks today.

title: Bridge: After Problems in Bidding. A Wealth of Pitfalls in Play
description: The grand national quali fying contest at the New York Hilton during the week end proceeded according to expectations. With 9 matches of 12 completed, all the top seeded teams seemed likely to qualify comfortably.

title: Mars Variety Shown In First Detailed Map
description: The first detailed map of the entire globe of another planet has been completed by cartog raphers working with a mo saic of photographs of Mars taken by the Mariner 9 space craft.

title: Wendell Smith, Sportswriter, Jackie Robinson Booster, Dies
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 26 (UPI) Wendell Smith, television sports caster and former newspaper man who played a large role in the signing of Jackie Robinson as the first black major league baseball player, died of cancer today at the St. Joseph Hospi tal. He was 58 years old.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: PATERSON, Nov. 26 (UPI) Paterson Police Chief James T, Hannan has suspended Patrolman Robert McNamara for wearing his hair too long.

title: The Year of Europe
description: Henry A. Kissinger recently dropped the remark that 1973 will be the year of Europea prophecy that many European leaders have been quoting with a mixture of hope and trepidation.

title: Oilers Turn Back Nationals, 2 to 1, On Walters' Goal
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 26 (UPI) The Alberta Oilers allowed the Ottawa Nationals an early goal by Gavin Kirk and then came back to take a narrow 21 de cision in a World Hockey As sociation game tonight.

title: An Argentine Aide Spoke to Bormann, British Paper Says
description: LONDON, Monday, Nov. 27 According to The Daily Express of London, Martin Bormann, Hitler's deputy, was questioned last month at a checkpoint at Mendoza in northern Argentina by a highranking Argentine security officer, Jose Juan Velasco. The man questioned admitted being a German, the story said, and insisted his name was Ricardo Bauer, which tallied with that on his pass port.

title: Raiders Trounce Chiefs; Steelers and Browns Win
description: The Oakland Raiders had a firm grip on the lead in the Western Division of the Ameri can Conference, but two other divisional titles were very much undecided after yesterday's ac tion in the National Football League.

title: Shelling Hits Saigon Troops in Quangtri
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 26 (AP)North Vietnamese gunners for the second straight day pounded South Vietnamese marines ad vancing up the coastal plain below the demilitarized zone military sources reported to day.

title: Arts Abroad
description: PARISAnybody still in doubt about the intimate relations between art and sex should see L'Ecole de Fontainebleau, the season's most important exhibition, at the Grand Palais. Scholars have spent a decade prepar ing this colossal assembly of paintings, sculptures, draw ings, engravings, tapestries, ceram ics, etc in the hope of proving that the oblivion into which un like other disciplines of the Renaissancethe arts had fallen was unjust. Was it?

title: City and Montefiore Start Talks on Bronx Hospital
description: The city has started prelim inary negotiations with Monte fiore Hospital and Medical Center regarding joint pro grams for the new North Cen tral Bronx Hospital, scheduled to open in early 1974.

title: Adirondack Precedent
description: Still another area of the Adirondack Park, which is already under attack elsewhere by Horizon Corporation developers, is threatened with conversion from placid village to rural housing colony. If the plans of one Louis Paparazzo, a wouldbe developer, are approved by the Department of Environmental Conservation, a particu larly wild and beautifulbut privately ownedtract of 18,500 acres north of Tupper Lake in the midst of the park will become a secondhome community of some 20,000 residents. It should properly be incorporated into the Preserve itself.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Nov. 26When new pub lic concerns roil the surface of politics, we often wait for someone with a longer view of society to identify the issue underneath. In the case of the new American concerns about busing, quotas and the like, that function has now been brilliantly performed by Daniel Bell, the Harvard sociologist.

title: Two Shot in Harlem Fight
description: Two men were shot and wounded, one seriously, by a man who pulled a pistol and fired at them several times dur ing an argument in Harlem yes terday. The gunman fled with a companion after shooting Eu gen Rodgers, 21 years old, in the chest and Winston Overton, 23, in the right hand at West 120th Street and Eighth Ave nue. Mr. Rodgers was in seri ous condition at Sydenham Hospital.

title: Watts Reasserts His Pianistic Mastery
description: Andre Watts, at 25, is an authentic champion of the piano world. A keyboard athlete of undisputed superiority, he is now at the height of his muscu lar power and has, in addition, the right combination of looks, charm and hint of mystery to qualify as an ideal American hero. To complete the picture, he has a big, adoring public and earns scads of money.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Inquiry Threatened in Newark

title: Five Bowl Teams Left Blushing
description: All that glitters between now and New Year's Day will not be bowl games. Enough bowl bound teams were embarrassed by a defeat or a tie last week end to take much of the luster from the Orange, Liberty, Sun, Fiesta, Astro Bluebonnet and even the Rose Bowl.

title: The MasterServant Relationship
description: Like many American blacks, my wife and I count among our friends and colleagues numbers of whites Protestants, Roman Catholics, Jews, humanists, etc. And when, in conver sation with them, the problem of racial tension is broached (as it inevitably is), one or more of them will say, Some of our best friends are do mestics. In such situations I some times find myself forced to declare my unalterable opposition to hiring household servants. Whereupon a screaming silence descends, and I be come aware of a coolness in the at mosphere.

title: HUGHES'S HOLDINGS UNDER U.S. INQUIRY
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 26 (AP)An intensive investiga tion by Federal agents into the $250million Nevada empire of Howard R. Hughes may result in indictments in Las Vegas early next year, The Oakland Tribune reported yesterday.

title: TV;Un Ballo in Maschera as a Swedish Tragedy
description: Opera returns to public television tonight with Gen tele's Verdi, a collection of scenes from the late Goeran Gentele's production of Un Ballo in Maschera. More sig nificant for public televi sion, however, Opera Thea ter, formerly known as N.E.T. Opera, returns with Peter Herman Adler continu ing as executive producer.

title: HANOI POSTPONES U.S. DOCTORS' VISIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  North Vietnam has requested the postponement, for the time being, of a visit to Hanoi by five United States physicians.

title: Rise in Youth Gang Killing Alarms Police in 3 Cities
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26 Youthful assassins in three ma jor American cities have com mitted more than 100 murders this year in what some police officials fear may be a resur gence of the street gang war fare that swept urban America in the nineteenfifties.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: LAKE LENAPE, Nov. 26 (UPI)Three children burned to death when fire swept their home today. Their mother, Mrs. Ann Marie Riedinger, 32 years old, broke her neck and back and was paralyzed from the chest down after jumping from a secondfloor window in a desperate attempt to save their lives.

title: PekingHanoi Pact Signed
description: TOKYO, Nov. 26 (AP) China and North Vietnam signed today in Peking an agreement on China's gratui tous economic and military materials assistance to Viet nam in 1973 and a protocol on China's gratuitous supply of military equipment and mate rials to Vietnam in 1973, Hsinhua, the official Chinese press agency, reported.

title: Two Chiefs Appraise South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 26After cock tails and a buffet dinner at his official residence in Pre toria one night last week, Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa was asked if the area set aside for the Zulu tribe was sufficiently large, wealthy, and developed to be economically viable if it reaches the independence he wants it to attain.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HOPE TOWNSHIP, Nov. 26 The Department of Transporta tion's plan to build a 50mile highway through Warren and Sussex Counties, linking Inter state 80 in New Jersey with In terstate 84 in New York, has run into strong opposition.

title: Ashe Tops Lutz in 5Set Final, Wins $25,000 Prize at Rome
description: ROME, Nov. 26Though it was only by five points, Arthur Ashe tonight helped reestab lish a reputation that he said had been prematurely built.

title: I.R.A. RESCUE BID FOILED IN DUBLIN
description: DUBLIN, NOV. 26Eight gunmen attempted tonight to free Scan MacStiofain, the leader of the Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army, from a Dublin hospital here, but were foiled.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: HACKETTSTOWN, Nov. 24 A rural Warren County area near here is being eyed by the Hackensack Meadowlands De velopment Commission as a landfill site for the 42,000 tons or garbage a week now being deposited in the Meadowlands.

title: Reserves Help Add 21 Points Late in Game
description: A recordbreaking 6210 rout by the New York Giants of the Philadelphia Eagles at Yankee Stadium yesterday may become evidence in a Philadelphia law suit, and certainly projected the Giants deeper into the National Football League championship race.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: McAFEE, N. J., Nov. 26Once best known for its flat pasturelands, summer retreats and zinc mines, this Sussex County region suddenly has blossomed into the scholastic skiing capital of the world.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Regarding your Nov. 115 editorial Fasten Your Cigarette, how about coming down to earth? Our franchised bus lines currently plying their routes to and from Manhattan are often as polluted as any smokefilled political caucus room. An enforceable law could easily correct this situation.

title: Boardwalk Stroll Won By 15Yearold Student
description: Larry Young couldn't make it, but two highschool stu dents' and a 78yearold re tired dentist gave the hippies of the sports world something to talk about yesterday in the 62nd annual Coney Is land Walk.

title: Hearing at Florida U. to Dramatize PresidentFaculty Clash
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Nov. 26 When the president of the University of Florida an nounced last June that he was dismissing a young philosophy professor, no one around here was really very surprised.

title: Lakewood Junior Miss Wins
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 26 (AP) An aspiring actress is New York State's 1973 Junior Miss. Shannon Alice Carroll, a 17 yearold 5foot5inch brunette from the Jamestown suburb of Lakewood, won the crown last night, along with an $11,500 college scholarship and the right to represent the state in the national Junior Miss pageant at Mobile, Ala., next May.

title: JAMES R. WAITE
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Nov. 26 James R. Waite, a selftrained bird authority who built a busi ness on his knowledge after he was crippled by polio, died Fri day at his home, 95 North Woods Road. He was 39 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Criticism of public transportation has always been a popular subject for propaganda by selfseeking politicians, railroad union leaders and crusading news media. Scare tactics used in ef forts to condemn railroad automation are refuted by the fact that the pur pose of automation is to reduce acci dents due to human failure.

title: CANARSIE GROUP BACKS NEW PLAN
description: After two and a half hours of noisy and emotional debate, several hundred white Canarsie parents voted last night to ac cept for the time being a preliminary zoning plan for three junior high schools pro posed by Brooklyn's Com munity School Board 18 to in crease integration in District 18 schools as mandated by the central Board of Education.

title: Credit Markets
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company will tap the capital markets for $500 million this week in financings that will go a long way to de termining the course of interest rates for the balance of 1972.

title: Conquistadors End Nets' Streak of Five By 131116 Victory
Blues Pick Barclay Player
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 26 (AP) Barclay Plager has been named captain of the St. Louis Blues for remainder of the National Hockey League season. Plager, a defenseman with the club since November, 1967, had been an alternate captain with his brother Bob and Garry Unger and Frank St. Marseille.

title: Peter Link Weds Marta Heflin, Actress
description: Peter Link, composer of two Broadway shows, Lysis trata and Much Ado About Nothing, and Marta Heflin, an actress currently playing Mary Magdalene in Jesus Christ Superstar, were wed yesterday afternoon.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Nov. 26 (AP)Minnesota's Fred Speck scored on a rebound with 11 seconds left in the first period tonight as the Fighting Saints beat the Whalers, 31.

title: Norwegians Report Mystery Submarine Has Escaped to Sea
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 26  The Norwegian Defense Com mand said tonight that an un identified submarine that had been hunted in the Sogne Fjord for the last two weeks had escaped to the open sea.

title: STREAKING BRUINS DOWN FLYERS, 64
description: BOSTON, Nov. 26 (AP)  Gregg Sheppard, a rookie, con tinued his hot scoring with a goal and two assists tonight as the Boston Bruins posted their sixth consecutive National Hockey League victory, a 64 decision over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Hansen Country
description: EAST LANSING, Mich.Cattle don't belong in national parks, especially in Wyoming's Grand Teton National Park, one of the great landscapes of the West. The Grand Tetons and the sur rounding land are a magnificent park, a rich wildlife haven that was set aside by Congress to be unimpaired for the enjoyment of future genera tions.

title: Hawks Topple Canadiens
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 26 (UPI)  Chico Maki scored his second goal with 4:43 to go to give the Chicago Black Hawks a 32 victory over the Montreal Ca nadiens tonight in a game en livened by a thirdperiod brawl involving five players.

title: Nader Bids Congress Sue To Recover Lost Powers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP) Ralph Nader has urged that Congress establish its own bat tery of attorneys to help win back the power Mr. Nader said had shifted to the White House.

title: Pilot Killed in Crash
description: HAMILTON AIR FORCEBASE, Calif., Nov. 26 (UPI)An Air Force fighter crashed within a few feet of five young persons horseback riding today in rural Marin County. The pilot, Capt. Michael D. Burmeister, 25 years old, of Northfield, Minn., was killed. None of the young per sons were seriously hurt.

title: CUT IN RATE SPURS CRIME INSURANCE
description: The Federal Crime Insur ante program, hampered from its beginning by a lack of pub lic awareness, had quadrupled its sales since it cut its rates in half last August, an official of the program says.

title: News Analysis
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 26The United States and the United Nations face a stern, perhaps crucial, test this week in the vote on reducing the United States share of the United Nations budget.

title: Armed Guards Proposed For Ghetto Health Centers
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 26 (AP) The president of the American Medical Association recom mended today that armed guards and other security measures be used at neighbor hood health centers in ghetto areas to overcome the reluc tance of some doctors to enter such areas.

title: Robber's Offer to Pay For Old Theft Refused
description: CARLSBAD. N. M., Nov. 26A welldressed man in his 40's entered the police station here this weekend and asked Sgt. Leo Arm strong to help him find the owner of a hardware store he had robbed 18 years ago. The stranger said he wanted to pay back four times the value of the stolen goods.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Badillo to Join VoteSupervision Suit

title: MARY CRAWFORD, SURGEON, 88, DIES
description: Dr. Mary M. Crawford, Brooklyn's first woman ambu lance surgeon, who was medi cal director of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York from 1919 until her retirement in 1949, died Saturday in Midtown Hospital. She was 88 years old and lived at 333 East 57th Street.

title: Power Plant Opens In Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Nov.26  The Soviet Union announced today the inauguration of one of the world's largest steamelectric stations as it moved ahead with an ambitious powerex pansion program virtually un hampered by public debate over pollution and other issues af fecting the electric power in dustry in the United States.

title: DR. ISRAEL RAPPAPORT
description: Dr. Israel Rappaport of 350 Central Park West, a retired specialist in chest diseases, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He would have been 80 years old Tuesday.

title: Dance: Chords, Dunham Gem, Unveiled
description: Chores, a gem of a lit tle dance that sparkles and glitters on every facet cut out by its gramle dame of a choreographer  the great Katherine Dunham  was given Saturday night at the City Center in a company premiere by the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater.

title: Hanoi to Allow P.O.W.'s To Get Christmas Package
description: American prisoners of war in North Vietnam will each be allowed to receive an 11pound package and a card from their families for Christmas, accord ing to Cora Weiss, cochairman of the Committee of Liaison With Families of Servicemen Detained in North Vietnam.

title: Kermit McFarland, Wrote ScrippsHoward Editorials
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP) Kermit McFarland, chief edi torial writer for the Scripps Howard Newspaper Alliance, died today apparently of a heart attack. He was 67 years old.

title: Sevareid Fears Effect on C.B.S., As Newsmen React to the Strike
description: A long strike against the Co lumbia Broadcasting System could inflict serious and lasting damage on C.B.S. News if newsmen were prevented from working by union order, Eric Sevareid said last night.

title: Ox Ridge Poloists Win
description: DARIEN, Conn. Nov. 26 Mike Saaf and Reid Graham each scored nine goals today in leading the Ox Ridge Hunt Club polo team to a 2314 vic tory over the Fairfield County Hunt Club of Westport, Conn.

title: Cornell Tops L.I.U. in Soccer, 32
description: William Murray, a senior for ward, scored two goals in they second period to lead Cornell to a 32 victory over Long Island University in the National Col legiate Athletic Association state regional soccer playoff yesterday at Columbia's Baker Field.

title: Heavy Raids Resume
description: SAIGON, Monday, Nov. 27 (UPI)United States B52 bombers resumed heavy raids on North Vietnam's panhandle during the night, striking sus peeled supply areas in 12 for mations, the United States com mand said today.

title: Strike on the Long Island Set For Thursday by 12Union Vote
description: A coalition of 12 Unions rep resenting 5,000 nonoperating employes voted yesterday to strike the Long Island Rail Road at 12:01 A.M. Thursday.

title: U.S. to Keep Many Civilians in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 25Even as the United States military is packing up for its expected exit from Vietnam, American offi cials here arc secretly planning a major postwar presence of United States civilians in Viet nam, with many of them doing jobs formerly done by the mili tary.

title: Personal Finance: Casualty Losses
description: If your home has ever been ransacked by burglars, dam aged by fire or inundated by water, you may have dis covered the hard way that one of the most valuable rights available to you under Federal tax law is the right to take the loss as an inoome tax deduction.

title: YOUNG SOCIALISTS BID FOR CHANGES
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 26The Young Socialist Alliance, which says it represents the most radical and bestorganized col lege and high school youth in the country, ended a convention here today calling for massive peaceful demonstrations in sup port of changes in American society.

title: Rise in Youth Gang Killing Alarms Police in 3 Cities
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26 Youthful assassins in three ma jor American cities have com mitted more than 100 murders this year in what some police officials fear may be a resur gence of the street gang war fare that swept urban America in the nineteenfifties.

title: Airline Office Occupied
description: LONDON, Nov. 26 (Reuters) More than 50 Londonbased members of Sinn Fein, the po litical arm here of the Irish Republican Army, tonight oc cupied the local offices of the Irish airline, Aer Lingus to protest the sentencing of Sean MacStiofain in Dublin.

title: Norwegians Report Mystery Submarine Has Escaped to Sea
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 26  The Norwegian Defense Com mand said tonight that an un identified submarine that had been hunted in the Sogne Fjord for the last two weeks had escaped to the open sea.

title: Convicts Escape in Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 27 (Reu ters)  Thirtythree youths broke out of a training center for young convicts here yester day, and the police are still hunting for 26. Six were cap tured soon after the escape, and one fell to his death down a 150foot cliff four miles from the center, the police said.

title: Local Italian Vote Tests Rome Coalition
description: ROME, Nov. 26  Italians started voting today in scat tered municipal elections that will test the present centrist coalition of Premier Giulo An dreotti.

title: OilPrice Agreement Is Reached in Kuwait
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 26 (AP) Kuwait and the Western owned Kuwait Oil Company have reached agreement on the buyback price of the Government's share of oil production to be sold back to the company, it was an nounced here today.

title: Will Galaxy Reveal a Technological Cancer? A Physicist Wonders
description: PRINCETON, N. J.  It seems to me entirely con ceivable that a technological civilization which had not wished to go the route of heavy machinery might, in fact, have colonized the galaxy.

title: Reserves Help Add 21 Points Late in Game
description: A recordbreaking 6210 rout by the New York Giants of the Philadelphia Eagles at Yankee Stadium yesterday may become evidence in a Philadelphia law suit, and certainly projected the Giants deeper into the National Football League championship race.

title: Wet, Windy Storm Swells Rain Mark, Then Yields to Sun
description: A wet and windy storm moved across the metropolitan area yesterday, raising the city's already recordbreaking rain totals a bit and then giv ing way to sunny, azure skies.

title: Romano Mussolini Stops at Town Hall In Jazz Piano Tour
description: The red, white and green of Italian unity dominated Town Hall Saturday night for the first New York concert of Ro mano Mussolini, son of the Italian dictator.

title: Webster Scolds Randy Johnson for Piling It Up
description: Alex Webster was so em barrassed that the Giants ran up an astronomical score against the Eagles yesterday that he berated Randy John son, his secondstring quar terback, in full view of 62,586 fans at Yankee Stadium.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Since I have been striving for years to invalidate the 1962 statutory cove nant prohibiting use of Port Authority revenues and reserves for mass trans portation, I should welcome Governor Rockefeller's assertion in his letter to your newspaper [Nov. 21] that he and Governor Cahill are now recommend ing legislation that would eliminate this restriction on the Port Authority capacity to finance masstransport improvements.

title: U.S. Nine Wins, 153
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua. Nov. 26 (AP)The United States kept alive its hopes in the world amateur baseball cham pionship today by routing EL Salvador. 153. The victory gave the Americans an 81 wonlost record, against 89 for Cuba.

title: Flames Defeat Penguins
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 26 (UPI) Jacques Richard scored two goals tonight in leading the Atlanta Flames to a 62 tri umph over the Pittsburgh Pen guins.

title: Puerto Rican Brooklyn Lawyer Is Named to City Charter Panel
description: A Brooklyn man who is Puerto Rican was named to the Temporary State Charter Revi sion Commission for New York City yesterday in an attempt to counter criticisms of the body, which begins today the first of a series of public hearings aimed at devising more realistic power relationships in the city.

title: Jarring Here for U.N. Debate
description: Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations special representative for the Middle East, arrived here last night for the United Nations debate on the Middle East.

title: Man in the News
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Nov. 26Norman Eric Kirk, who will become New Zea land's fourth Labor Prime Minister as a result of his party's victory in yesterday's elections, is viewed as es sentially a moderate without close ties to either the trade union or intellectual wings of his party. He makes an im mediate impres sion because of his size. Over 6 feet tall, he weighs more than 250 pounds and has weighed more. His size makes inevi table the nickname of Big Norm. Handsome and gray ing at 49 years old, Mr. Kirk, in private, makes a strong impression as an intelligent, reasonable, thoughtful and wellbalanced politician. His platform style is quite differ ent howeveran accusatory style, developed from a long period in opposition.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 26In a little brick church here, 98 per cent of whose members are black, the Most Rev. Thomas A. Boland, Archbishop of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Newark, presided today at a special mass marking the 50th anniversary of his ordination to the priesthood.

title: Seals Down Wings, 64
description: DETROIT, Nov. 26 (AP) Two goals by Joey Johnston and brilliant goaltending by Gilles Meloche carried the Cali fornia Golden Seals to a 64 victory tonight over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: BIG BOARD'S C.C.S. FACING CHANGES
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced over the weekend that its Central Certif icate Service would be reor ganized as the Depository Trust Company and would apply for membership in the Federal Re serve System.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt criticized the Palisades Inter state Park Commission yester day, especially for what he said were its loose fiscal controls.

title: Gun Battles in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 26  Irish Republican Army gunmen made a series of attacks tonight on British Army observation posts in the Roman Catholic Ardoyne dis trict of Belfast. The attacks were apparently intended as a show of support for Sean MacStiofain, who has spent some time in the district during the last three years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As one who has had firsthand expe rience in regional planning, six years as chairman of the Greater Bridgeport Regional Planning Agency, I could not agree more with your Nov. 4 edito rial Metro Limited. To those who fear regional planning as a step to ward regional government let me say I know of no one in regional planning who wants regional government. We don't need another layer of govern ment. What we do need, working within the framework of present gov ernment, is to get communities to work together to solve various indi vidual intertown problems: functional cooperation where the old arbitrary geographical and political boundaries have become meaningless.

title: Pitt Racing Team's Car Falters in a Final Test
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga., Nov. 26  Bob Fryar is the only driver in the American Road Race of Champions whose racing uniform has flare bottoms. He also runs the only racing team recognized by a university as a fullfledged extracurricular activity.

title: For Those Who Live Alone, It's Important to Know How
description: There is something about the idea of living alone that undoes many strong men and stalwart women. But Harriet La Barre maintains that living alone can be a de lightful, rich and satisfying experience for almost any one. It's all in knowing how.

title: Sports of The Times
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 26The weather never seems to change much here at this time of year, It's usually cloudy and gloomy, with the mist rising above the Ohio River between the hills behind the Three Rivers Stadium, as it was today. Art Rooney never seems to change much, either. His old Irish face surrounded by a gray fedora, a cigar and the turnedup collar of a gray tweed overcoat, he moved quietly through the ramps of the stadium, as he always has. But his Pittsburgh Steelers have changed. They used to find a way to lose. But today they found a way to win a big game, 2310, from the Minnesota Vikings, and if they find a way to win from the Cleveland Browns here next Sunday, they may go on to win the first division title in the 40year history of the franchise. In other National Football League cities, a divi sion title is a stepping stone to the playoffs. Here it's a milestone.

title: Ryan Keeps Baseball Post
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 26 (UPI) Joe Ryan was reelected presi dent of the American Associa tion for a threeyear term at the winter baseball meetings today.

title: Talks Off in Bakers' Strike
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov 26 (AP) Negotiations in a twoweek old bakers' strike broke off to day and a union official pre dicted that the strike would spread to the East Coast Tues day.

title: City Dwellers Who Teach in the Suburbs
description: Early every weekday morning, Mau reen Paulson gets up and drives her husband, Robert, to the train; like mil lions of other couples, the Paulsons are involved with commuting.

title: HUSSEIN WAS HURT IN PLOT, PAPER SAYS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 26 (Reuters)A leading Lebanese newspaper, An Nahar, said to day that King Hussein of Jordan has been wounded in the thigh by rocket shrapnel and was admitted to a military hospital on Saturday Nov. 18, after an attempt on his life.

title: 2 Fires Leave 14 Homeless
description: TROY, N.Y., Nov. 26 (UPI) Two fires left 14 persons home less in this Rensselaer County city over the weekend. One woman was in critical condi tion after being overcome by smoke. Nine apartment resi dents were routed from their homes last night as a fire swept through their building. This morning, another fire left five homeless, including Mrs. Nesta Lutes, 79 years old, who was listed later as in critical con dition in Samaritan Hospital from smoke inhalation and other injuries.

title: John Miller, at 211, Gains Shot Edge in Cold, Wind
description: HILTON HEAD, S.C., Nov. 26 It's hard to believe I'm lead ing after a 75, said John Miller today after his fourover par third round gave him a 21] aggregate for 54 holes in the $125,000 Heritage Golf Classic.

title: Mars Variety Shown In First Detailed Map
description: The first detailed map of the entire globe of another planet has been completed by cartog raphers working with a mo saic of photographs of Mars taken by the Mariner 9 space craft.

title: Bucks on Top, 10896
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 26 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks poured in 17 points in a row, including three baskets by Bob Dand ridge, in the third period to night, breaking open a tight game and cruising to a 10896 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Ruling on Marriage In Israel Is Assailed By a Hasidic Leader
description: The leader of the worldwide Lubavitcher Hasidic Movement sharply criticized the Israeli Government yesterday for using what he called coercion and influence in a recent decision made by Chief Rabbi Shlomo Goren on a religious contro versy.

title: Pakistan Defeats China
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 26 (Agence FrancePresse) Pakistan defeated China in their first volleyball test match today, 415, 1510, 159, 1315, 157.

title: Bunker and Thieu Confer
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 27 (AP)Ambas sador Ellsworth Bunger met for 10 minutes this morning with President Nguyen Van Thieu at Independence Palace. a United States Embassy spokesman said. What they discussed was not disclosed.

title: Haywood Tallies 39
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 26 (UPI) Spencer Haywood scored a seasonhigh 39 points tonight to lead the Seattle Super Sonics to a 10396 victory over the Detroit Pistons. Haywood also pulled down 18 rebounds and blocked five shots.

title: Port Notes
description: Continued and substantial Federal support to the Amer ican marine insurance indus try has been pledged by the highestranking Federal ship ping official.

title: Joan Hammill Becomes Bride
description: HAWORTH, N. J., Nov. 26 Miss Joan Veronica Ham mill and Dr. Norman Glass ner were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. James Francis Hammill. The Roman Catholic ceremony was performed by the Rev. Martin T. Crowe.

title: PRESIDENT CALLED STILL CONFIDENT ON TRUCE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  The White House said today that, after conferring with Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon remained confident that. an Indochina settlement would be achieved, but it was unclear how long this might take.

title: Theater: Mother of Us All Revived
description: The sparse and stony road that Susan Brownhill An thony traveled toward wom an's suffrage ended some years after her death with the 19th Amendment in 1920. But Ms Anthony fought the good fight both for women and blacks. In Gertrude Stein's opinion she was The Mother of Us All, and when in 1946 the redoubtable Ger trude sat down to write her last completed work it was about Susan B. Anthony, and she called it just that.

title: PANEL ON CHINA TIES PICKS NEW CHAIRMAN
description: W. Michael Blumenthal, chairman of the Bendix Cor poration, has been elected chairman of the board of the National Committee on United StatesChina Relations, the pri vate educational group an nounced yesterday.

title: S.E. C. Delays du Ponts on Christiana Dissolution
description: A complex plan by the du Ponts, one of the nation's wealthiest families, to dissolve its $2.2billion financial holding company at an extraordinary profit, has been delayed by the Securities and Exchange Com mission, which wants to take a closer look.

title: Scribner Should Stay
description: Harvey B. Scribner became the first chancellor of the city's school system almost three years ago under extraordinarily difficult circumstances. The schools had barely emerged from some of the most acrimonious conflicts in their history. Decentralization had just come off the legislative drawing board. New relationships and procedures had to be established; old wounds bound up; suspicions and hostilities overcome.

title: REV. J. A. ANDERSON
description: The Rev. Dr. J. Alfred Ander son, pastor emeritus of the Sa lem Lutheran Church at 450 67th Street in Brooklyn, where he had served for 45 years, died Saturday at his home, 9201 Shore Road in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn. He was 101 years old.

title: Five Sharp Earth Tremors Strike Wide Area in Italy
description: ASCOLI PICENO, Italy, Nov. 26 (AP)Five sharp earth trem ors struck this ancient Sabine city 120 miles northeast of Rome today, toppling a farm house and cracking the walls of old buildings.

title: Cuba Reorganizes Government Setup, Names High Aides
description: MIAMI, Nov. 26Cuba has announced, in a communiqu broadcast by the Havana radio a reorganization of her, governmental structure.

title: Thais Act to Bar Foreigners From 12 Kinds of Businesses
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 26 (AP)Thailand's ruling mili tary junta announced sweeping business restrictions on for eigners yesterday. The decree, effective today, restricts 12 types of businesses among them law, architecture, adver tising and building construction to Thais only.

title: Redskins Make Playoffs, Downing Packers, 2116
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Like Old Man River, the Red skins keep rolling along. The team with the most senior players in the National Foot ball League won its eighth straight game today and its 10th of 11 this season by de feating the Green Bay Packers, 2116, before the usual rap turous audience of 53,039 in Robert F. Kennedy Stadium.

title: TigrCats Triumph, 238, For Canadian Eastern Title
description: HAMILTON, Ontario, Nov. 26 (UPI)  The Hamilton Tiger Cats, led by a rookie place kicker, Ian Sunter, defeated the Ottawa Rough Riders, 238, to day to take the twogame, totalpoint series, 3027, and earn the right to represent the Canadian Football League's Eastern Conference in next week's Grey Cup game against the Saskatchewan Roughriders.

title: CITY BIDS PARTIES MEET NERE IN 1976
description: New York City, which has not had a Presidential conven tion since 1924, is making a pitch for the 1976 Democratic and Republican conventions, with plans to house them in the mammoth convention and exhi bition hall that will get under construction here next year.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Carlton Fisk of the Boston Red Sox and Jon Matlack of the Mets head the major league allrookie team an nounced yesterday. Fisk, a slugging catcher, was the lead ing votegetter with 445 in a poll conducted by the Topps Chewing Gum Company.

title: BASIL SCHONLAND, A BRITISH PHYSICIST
description: WINCHESTER, England, Nov. 26 (AP)  Sir Basil Schonland, a scientific adviser to Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower in the closing years of World War II, died Friday at the age of 76.

title: Biedrzycki and C. W. Post Triumph in CrossCountry
description: John Biedrzycki, a sophomore at C. W. Post College, won the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union Junior crosscountry championship yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx. He covered the four miles in 20 minutes 52 seconds to beat a teammate, Mike Butynes, a freshman, by a step.

title: A Welfare Hotel Where Gaiety Is Just a Memory
description: Thirty years ago, in a differ ent world, Ronnie Ali and Her Original Redheads topped the bill at Tony Pastor's downtown jazz club. Now she is an old blues singer living out her de spairing days on West 76th Street, trapped in a rooming house where the sweetish reek of garbage pervades the halls, junkies nod in corners and crimes of violence are nearly as common as empty pint bot tles.

title: Hoax Issue at Harvard Has Kissinger Quitting
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 26if Henry A. Kissinger is planning to reclaim his old job teaching political science at Harvard University, Har vard doesn't know anything about it.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Nov. 10 editorial Unused Franchise and the letter dated Nov. 8 about a young man's problems in securing his right to vote serve to illuminate a dismal situation.

title: Brazil Peasants Find Their Plight Worsens
description: ESCADA, Brazil, Nov. 16 On some days the people on the sugar plantation called Provi dence have nothing to eat, but like most farm workers in Bra zil's impoverished Northeast, they appear resigned to their empty lives.

title: Shark Sextet Ends Raider Streak, 62
description: Two streaks came to an end in Madison Square Garden yes terday afternoon, unfortunate ly for the New York Raiders. Their fourgame winning skein was stopped as the Los Angeles Sharks beat the local World Hockey Association team, 62.

title: October a Banner Month For MachineTool Orders
description: October was the strongest month of the year to date for orders, the National Machine Tool Builders' Association re ported over the weekend.

title: GOLF LEAD TAKEN BY JOHN MILLER
description: ?? success because he went out in 40 and his putts lipped the cup on 10 of the first 12 holes. His first oneputt green came at the 13th hole. After that he ran in a 25footer for a deuce at the 14th and then recovered from bunkers at two subse quent holes for pars. He came back in 35.

title: Islanders Lose to Sabres
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 26 (AP) Rick Martin scored his 17th and 18th goals of the season tonight and assisted on two more as the Buffalo Sabres de feated the New York Islanders, 92.

title: LAKERS CAPTURE 13TH IN A ROW
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26 (AP) Jerry West scored 15 of his 26 points in the fourth period, Wilt Chamberlain grabbed a to tal of 25 rebounds and the Los Angeles Lakers won their 13th game in a row tonight, beating the Phoenix Suns, 112107.

title: 3 Jersey Children Die in Fire; Mother Hurt in Rescue Attempt
description: LAKE LENAPE, N.J., Nov. 26 (UPI)  Three children burned to death when fire swept their home today. Their mother, Mrs. Anne Marie Riedinger, 32 years old, broke her neck and back and was paralzyed from the chest down after jumping from a secondfloor window in desperate attempt to save their lives.

title: CHAMBER MERGER STIRS PROXY FRAY
description: The 1972 plan to merge the New York Chamber of Com merce and the Commerce and Industry Association has come under sharp attack from some chamber members  as did a similar and unsuccessful pro posal eight years agoand an other proxy battle is underway.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Mrs. Walter Liggett Dies; Widow of Crusading Editor
description: FAIRFIELD, Calif., Nov. 26 Mrs. Edith E. Liggett, widow of Walter W. Liggett, the cru sading Minneapolis newspaper editor who was assassinated in front of his home in 1935, died Wednesday at the age of 71.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: BAYONNE, Nov. 26  The ninemember Hudson County legislative delegation, angered because a $650million mass transit plan virtually bypassed their county, asserted today that they are not committed to voting for the package.

title: Lawyers Find a New Bar To CarInsurance Reform
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Organized trial lawyers have devised a new lobbying tack for the renewal of legislative battles next year over automo bile insurance reform.

title: Shopping Center Santa Dies
description: DALY CITY, Calif., Nov. 26 (UPI)A shopping center San ta Claus, Martin Thonnison, 66 years old, collapsed as a child was talking to him here and was pronounced dead at Mary's help Hospital.

title: I.R.A. RESCUE BID FOILED IN DUBLIN
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 26Eight gunmen attempted tonight to free Sean MacStiofain, the leader of the Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army, from a Dublin hospital here, but were foiled.

title: NIXON, IN CHURCH, PRAISED BY PEALE AS A PEACEMAKER
description: President Nixon returned yesterday to the church in which he worshiped as a New Yorker and in which his daughter, Julie, was married and heard the Rev. Dr. Norman Vincent Peale extoll him as one of the great peacemakers of history.

title: JOHN L. SUTTON
description: WEST NEW YORK, N. J., Nov. 26John L. Sutton, a re tired supervisor with the Cur tiss  Wright Corporation in WoodRidge, died today in Christ Hospital, Jersey City. He was 72 years old and lived at 6515 Boulevard East.

title: C.B.S. Strike Situation
description: PARTICIPANTSColumbia Broadcasting System and Local 1212, Radio and Television Broadcast Engineers Union, International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. Union represents 1,200 cameramen, audio engineers, light ing men and other technicians. The workers went on strike Nov. 3 and have affected C.B.S. operations at its New York, Los Angeles and Washington studios, as well as at TV and radio stations owned and operated by C.B.S. in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, Boston and St. Louis.

title: Judith Ebenstein Wed to Richard Grose
description: PEEKSKILL, N.Y., Nov. 26 Miss Judith Low Ebenstein and Richard Marc Grose, third year students at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, were married here this afternoon by Rabbi Claude Marx in the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Benno Eberstein. Mr. Grose is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Grose of Chevy Chase, Md.

title: East Texas in Bowl
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 26 (AP) The annual National Associa tion of Intercollegiate Athletics Champion Bowl football game will be played Dec. 9 between East Texas State of Commerce, Tex., and CarsonNewman Col lege of Jefferson City, Tenn., at East Texas's field.

title: EXPERTS ASSAIL STRIP MINING LAW
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 26West Virginia is not get ting satisfactory results from it first attempt to reduce ugly high walls left by strip mining along hundreds of miles of mountainsides, a group of ex perts has concluded.

title: Syria Due to Form a New Cabinet to Bolster Defense
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 26 A new Syrian cabinet will be formed soon to cope with the mounting tension along the ceasefire lines with Israel, ac cording to reliable information from Damascus.

title: AntiBoyle Man Slightly Ahead in Miners' Poll
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 26  As the bitter struggle within the United Mine Work ers heads for its courtordered election beginning next Friday, the insurgent candidates say they hold a narrow margin over the incumbent slate.

title: COLD DRINKS GAIN IN PUBLIC FAVOR
description: The other day I went to lunch with three friends, said Aldo Whitmeyer, a young Mi ami executive, and I realized that all of us ordered iced tea. This would not have happened two years ago, even in sum mer.

title: TALKS OPEN TODAY ON MONEY REFORMS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Formal negotiations for inter national monetary reform be gin here tomorrow among high financial officials from 20 in dustrial and less developed countries.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Badillo to Join Suit On Vote Monitoring

title: LEVITT CRITICIZES PALISADES PARKS
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt criticized the Palisades Inter state Park Commission yester day, especially for what he said were its loose fiscal controls. He cited, among other things, a golf pro at one statepark shop doing business from an open cash register without ringing up saleson which the state's revenue was based because he didn't know how to operate the cash register.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In his Nov. 20 letter, Prof. George Rosen seems to predicate American friendship for President Marcos on the American businessmen's belief that their investments will be protected against the effect of various court de cisions by the President under martial law. This is a false premise. The Americans know that President Mar cos proved his friendship for the United States when he fought under the American flag during the Second World War and emerged the most decorated Filipino for his bravery in battle. His sevenyear administration showed to the Americans in the Phil ippines and in Washington that his official actions have always been those of a true friend of the United States.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Nov. 26 (UPI)The Winnipeg Jets spotted Quebec a 10 lead in the first 78 seconds tonight, then rebounded for a 41 vic tory over the Nordiques.

title: Norells Designed 40 Years Apart: Strikingly Similar
description: Question: How can two virtually identical dresses by Norman Norell have price tags that read $725 and $125?

title: Stern to Play in Brooklyn
description: Isaac Stern will give a violin concert as a feature of the Fes tival of Arts weekend to be held Sunday, Dec. 10, at the New York City Community College branch at 300 Jay Street, Brooklyn. He will play before an audience of students, faculty members and local res idents.

title: A Touch of Home
description: For the last 30 years, mem bers of the United Service Organizations have brought that touch of home to serv icemen around the world. To day, U. S. O. continues to provide for the recreation, welfare, and mo rale needs of the almost three million young people in uniform, at a time when these services are perhaps more vital and meaningful than ever before.

title: Full Mtisieal Partnership In Kreger and Ohisson
description: At their last New York duo recital in ?? 1971, James Kreger, cello, and Garrick Ohls son, piano pooled their talents for what turned out to be an exhilarating musical collabora tion. The pair returned to Tully Hall Saturday night for an equally stimulating evening of music making.

title: Robinson Piano Recital Emphasizes Contrasts
description: Julius Robinson, a young Chicagoborn pianist with con siderable solo and chamber concert experience, made his New York debut at Carnegie Recital Hall Saturday night. Since Mr. Robinson is also a musician of obvious talent, it was upsetting to find him mis treating his gifts so frequently.

title: Armenian Diocese Presents Young Musicians
description: The Town Hall concert spon sored by the Diocese of the Armenian Church of America yesterday afternoon focused on three young musicians, Anita Terzian, a mezzo; Patricia Mi chaelian, a pianist, and Vartan Manoogian, a violinist.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In his coverage of events at South ern University, Roy Reed touches, albeit lightly, upon an issue rarely mentioned publicly: the incongruity of Negro colleges, particularly statesup ported Negro colleges, in a nation of ficially dedicated to racial integration.

title: WrongWay Taxi
description: The city's taxicab czar, Michael J. Lazar, has returned from a study trip to European capitals with all the right conclusions about what needs to be done to improve New York's taxi service. Most pertinent is his praise for the admirable Leyland Austin cab used in London, a cab built for rider comfortentering, leaving and in motion unlike the miniature Dodge torture box that now passes for a taxi in this city, but was obviously designed for the exclusive use of contortionists.

title: 400 Pay Tribute To 2 Slain Students At Louisiana Capitol
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 26 (AP) A memorial service for the two black students slain at Southern University drew 400 people to the steps of the State Capitol today. Meanwhile two independent commissions pre pared to begin fullscale inves tigations tomorrow of the Nov. 16 policestudent confrontation at the school.

title: Music: Two Contrasting Song Styles
description: Don't expect Gordon Light foot to appear onstage with silver sequins pasted to his fair. The Canadian folk sing er's presentation at Philhar monic Hall Friday evening was as austere as a Samuel Beckett play.

title: Wallace Undecidedon'76; Calls Health No Obstacle
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Gov. George C. Wallace said to day that he had not decided whether he would run for the Presidency in 1976 but that he would be physically able to make the race should he decide to do so.

title: U.S. to Keep Many Civilians in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 25Even as the United States military is packing, up for its expected exit from Vietnam, American offi cials here are secretly planning a major postwar presence of United States civilians in Viet nam, with many of them doing jobs formerly done by the mili tary.

title: Poll Finds 48.9% Here Rate Streets as Poorly Cleaned
description: A private poll on the cleanli ness of city streets and the performance of the Sanitation Department has found that 48.9 per cent of those polled consider the streets poorly cleaned and 32.1 per cent consider them very dirty.

title: Kansans' Gift Helps Man Get Sclerosis Treatment
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 26 (UPI)A dying man entered a hospital today for experimental sclerosis treatment paid for by his Kansas neighbors as a Thanksgiving Day gift.

title: PRESIDENT CALLED STILL CONFIDENT ON TRUCE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  The White House said today that, after conferring with Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon remained confident that an Indochina settlement would be achieved, but it was unclear how long this might take.

title: Municipal League Elects
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 26 (AP)  The National Municipal League elected Wilson W. Wyatt, former Lieutenant Gov ernor or Kentucky, as president today. Mr. Wyatt, a Louisville lawyer who was named to a oneyear term, succeeds Wil liam W. Scranton, former Penn sylvania Governor who has served three years.

title: Wallace Undecided on '76; Calls Health No Obstacle
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Gov. George C. Wallace said to day that he had not decided whether he would run for the Presidency in 1976 but that he would be physically able to make the race should he decide to do so.

title: DR. ISAAC NEUWIRTH
description: Dr. Isaac Neuwirth, chairman of the pharmacology depart ment at the New York Univer sity College of Dentistry from 1947 until his retirement in 1960, died yesterday at a nurs ing home in Hollywood, Fla. He was 77 years old.

title: NIXON, IN CHURCH, PRAISED BY PEALE AS A PEACEMAKER
description: President Nixon returned yesterday to the church in which he worshiped as a New Yorker and in which his daughter, Julie, was married and heard the Rev. Dr. Norman Vincent Peale extoll him as one of the great peacemakers of history.

title: Treasurer for Democrats Will Leave Position Dec. 6
description: Howard Weingrow said yes terday that he would leave his post as treasurer of the Demo cratic National Committee Dec. 6, The Associated Press re ported.

title: Congress May Be Asked To Decontrol Gas Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26As part of a package of measures to relieve this country's energy shortage, the Administration is giving serious thought to asking Congress to decontrol natural gas prices, if only for new gas supplies.

title: MRS. WALTER E. TRAVERS
description: Mrs. Genevieve Butler Trav ers, a member of the New York Stock Exchange, died Saturday, at her home, 150 East 69th Street. She was 82 years old.

title: Mrs. Onassis Is Reported To Shrug Off Nude Pictures
description: Mrs. Aristotle Onassis was quoted by Newsweek magazine yesterday as having said of the nude pictures, purportedly of her, published in the Italian magazine Playmen, It doesn't touch my real life, which is with my children and my husband.

title: Builder Of Bridges East
description: It is always hazardous to anticipate history's assessments, but if the Fed eral Republic of Germany survives down the years in freeddm, historians may well say this of Willy Brandt:

title: TRUDEAU NAMES 8 NEW MINISTERS
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 27Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau today announced 18 changes in his Cabinet as a result of the Oct. 30 election in which his Liberal Government lost its ma jority in the House of Commons.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., Nov. 27Three of the four Dull brothers who played football at St. Mary's High School ?? got college football scholarships, but only John, the poet, songwriter, musician, psychologist and lover of the Russian language, is still active in the sport.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The City Housing Authori ty announced that it was blocking rent increases for more than 20,000 families, virtually all elderly, that would have resulted from the recent increase in their in comes from a 20 per cent Federal rise in Social Securi ty benefits. Simeon Golar, the authority chairman, said the agency would forgo at least until June 1 such rent rises, which are expected to run at the rate of $1.4million a year, while urging the Fed eral Department of Housing and Urban Development and Congress to sanction the moratorium on rent in creases.

title: Peter O'Reilly to Wed Nathalia Crane
description: SPRING VALLEY, Calif., Nov. 27  Nathalia Crane, poet and teacher, and Dr. Peter O'Reilly, a Roman Cath olic priest who has given up his priestly functions, both of Spring Valley, have become engaged and will be married next month.

title: Mailers Union Terminates Contract at 4 City Papers
description: New York Mailers Union No. 6 notified the city's four major daily newspapers yesterday that it was terminating its con tract because of a reduction by the Federal Pay Board of the wage increase granted last March.

title: Cahill's FloodPlain Bill Wins Final Passage in Legislature
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27Gover nor Cahill's controversial meas ure that would impose state control over the use and de velopment of lowlying, flood prone regions in New Jersey cleared the State Legislature this afternoon.

title: Ambassador, F.O.B. Close
description: Ambassador, a musical based on the Henry James novel, The Ambassadors, closed on Saturday after its ninth performance at the Lunt Fonlanne Theater. F.O.B., a play by Jeff Weiss, ended its Off Broadway run at the Mer cerBrecht Theater on Sunday after three showings.

title: DETROIT REBUFFED IN SCHOOL AID PLEA
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 27 (AP) A Federal appeals court refused today to consider whether the state of Michigan should be or dered to provide funds to keep Detroit public schools open.

title: Filion Sets World Mark On 544th Trot Victory
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 27 Helve Filion established a world harness driving mark for 544 victories in a single season tonight when he brought home Eden All in the sixth race at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan, U. N. Commissioner, and Mrs. Sursock Married
description: Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan and Mrs. Catherine Aleya Bereketti Sursock were mar ried Saturday in the West Indies.

title: Vanishing Heritage
description: The United Nations faces a fleeting opportunity this week to advance the prospect for international control over more than half of the earth's surfacethe ocean floor beyond the limits of national jurisdiction.

title: Yippies Exclude Hoffman And Rubin as Spokesmen
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 27 (AP)  About a hundred representatives of the Youth International party from 25 states voted at a weekend meeting here to exclude Jerry Rubin and Abbie Hoff man as official spokesmen for the Yippie movement, a spokesman said.

title: The Unknown Soldiers
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.In the selection of American decision  makers, politi cians are subject to scrutiny, and sus picion but it appears generals are not. Much of this has to do with the myth that military men simply follow the orders of elected officials; that is, im plement the decisions of politicians. But it is the military which develops the critical input into much of the for eign policy decisionmaking process. Military men often carry out their own policies, as has so often been the case in Vietnam.

title: NeoFascists and Reds in Italy Appear Set Back in Local Voting
description: ROME, Tuesday, Nov. 28 Incomplete returns in the mu nicipal elections held in many areas of Italy Sunday and yes terday indicated early this morning that the neoFascist and Communist parties had lost ground.

title: Stock Market Drops on Profit Taking
description: The bullish stock market ran out of steam yesterday as de clines outnumbered advances for the first time in 12 sessions in steppedup trading.

title: TV Film of Population Report Fought by AntiAbortion Groups
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 27 Despite heated opposition and a possible lastminute legal challenge from antiabortion groups, the Public Broadcast ing Service plans to proceed Wednesday with a film version of the report of the Commis sion, on Population Growth and the American Future.

title: INSURERS ASSAIL PROPOSAL OF S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  The lifeinsurance industry told the Securities and Exchange Commission today that its pro posed rule on membership for all securities exchanges would per petuate discrimination against insurers managing pension funds.

title: IN THE NATION
description: No matter what happens after the Indochinese peace talks resume on Dec. 4, it now seems reasonably clear that Dr. Henry Kissinger had little basis for his statement on Oct. 26, twelve days before the election, that peace is at hand, subject only to a few minor details of negotiation. He had, it is clear, no real agreement with Hanoi and Saigon on ending the war; no such agreement seems to exist a month later; and it is highly question able whether either Dr. Kissinger or President Nixon could have believed on Oct. 26 that they actually had reached an agreement that would bring what Mr. Nixon called that night in Ashland, Ky., peace with honor and not peace with surrender.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Narrotved in October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  The nation's trade deficitim ports over exportsnarrowed by $100million in October but remained large by, standards of previous years, the Com merce Department reported today.

title: STUDENT TRUSTEES A SMALL MINORITY
description: Although more colleges and universities than ever before are including students on their governing boards, these cam puses still make up a small minority14 per centof all institutions of higher educa tion, according to a national survey by the American Coun sail on Education.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I am writing with regard to the advertisement published in the Oct. 27 edition of The Times by the American Civil Liberties Union and headed: It took a court order to get this adver tisement printed.

title: Students Earn a Year's Credit for Aiding Poor
description: Students from Queens Col lege in New York are helping residents of a housing project to organize a tenant's associ ation. Students from Federal City College in Washington are teaching expectant moth ers about nutrition. Students from the University of Colo rado are operating a learn ing center on an Indian reservation.

title: H. LESLIE SAWYER; LED JUNIOR COLLEGE
description: NEW LONDON, N.H., Nov. 27 (AP)H. Leslie Sawyer, first president of Colby Junior Col lege, died Friday after a long illness. He was 86 years old.

title: Phone Service Restored
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 27 (AP) Repairmen for the New York Telephone Company restored service to about 1,000 custo mers in the suburban Town of Clay today after a 19hour in terruption caused by a water soaked underground cable.

title: Rev. Theodore Ferris Rector Of Boston's Trinity Church
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27The Rev. Dr. Theodore P. Ferris, rector since 1942 of Trinity Episcopal Church, died of cancer at the rectory yesterday. He was 63 years old.

title: State Expanding Evictions At SingleRoom Buildings
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz disclosed yesterday that he planned to go to court to obtain eviction of undesir able tenants at four more sin gleroom occupancy buildings whose tenants include welfare recipients.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  The State Department today emphatically denied a report that the United States might soon recognize Rhodesia.

title: Cozza Named Shrine Coach
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 (AP)Carmen Cozza of Yale and Dee Andros of Oregon State were named today to head threeman coaching staffs for the 48th annual Shrine EastWest football game Dec. 30. Assisting Cozza on the East team will be Bo Schembechler of Michigan and Bob Blackman of Illinois. Assistants to An dros on the West team will be Rudy Feldman of New Mexico and Bill Yeoman of Houston.

title: APOLLO 17 CREW IN FINAL TRAINING
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Nov. 27The Apollo 17 astronauts began their final week of train ing today for the mission to end all missions to the moon in the Appollo series.

title: Wilkens and the NewLook Cavs Face Knicks at Garden Tonight
description: Tile Knicks, still in a virtual tie with the Boston Celtics for first place in the National Basketball Association's Atlan tic Division after a split of a twogame weekend series with the Celtics, take on a Cleve land Cavalier club tonight that may not be as submissive as in the past.

title: Wall Street Journal Names Editor of Its Editorial Page
description: The Wall Street Journal yes terday announced the appoint ment of Robert L. Bartley as editor of its editorial page, suc ceeding Joseph E. Evans, who died last Dec. 27.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Chrysler Corporation disclosed yesterday that it had formed a new life insurance company to cover people who buy its cars on the installment plan.

title: People and Business
description: Following the next annual meeting in March of the Con tinental Illinois Corporation the holding company for the Continental Illinois Na tional Bank and Trust Com pany, the nation's ninth largest bankits directors plan to elect a new president and a new chairman.

title: PAPER SAYS PERON HELPED BORMANN
description: LONDON, Tuesday, Nov. 28 The Daily Express said today that the man it reports is Martin Bormann bought his way to freedom and safety in Argentina with the aid of Juan D. Pern and his wife, Eva, and $500million in Nazi loot.

title: Pentagon Asked for Details Of War Crimes by G.I.'s
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, told the Pentagon yesterday that it should make public full details of war crimes committed by American servicemen in Viet man that the Defense Depart ment said it had substantiated through investigations.

title: O'BRIEN SEEKING DEMOCRATIC POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  Aggressively if not quite for mally, Lawrence F. O'Brien is campaigning for a third, come back term at the head of the Democratic National Commit tee.

title: Officer Is Accused of Allowing Payoffs by Hot Dog Peddlers
description: A police captain who com manded the Old Slip precinct in lower Manhattan was accused yesterday of failing to act when some of his men allegedly shook down hot dog venders and other itinerant peddlers. He was or dered to stand departmental trial.

title: CITY BALLET SETS A DIFFICULT TASK
description: New York City Ballet's crowded weeks of repertory, before the onslaught of The Nutcracker, are ordinarily a frenzied time. This season the task of placating the adults be fore satiating the children has been complicated by the at tempt to include as many of the Stravinsky Festival ballets as possible on the regular pro grams.

title: CoalMine Disaster in Japan Points Up Dilemma of an Uneconomical Industry
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27Torataro Asari was 62 years old and had spent 30 years in the coal mines when he was killed three weeks ago in an explosion of methane gas that tore through a small mine on Hokkaido, Japan's northern island.

title: Talks Open in Washington On World Money Reform
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Formal negotiations for reform of the international monetary system began today, with about 150 financial experts from more than 50 countries present at a closeddoor session in a large 12thfloor meeting room at the International Monetary Fund.

title: Illinois Agent Found Dead
description: JACKSONVILLE, Ill., Nov. 27 (AP)An Illinois Bureau of In vestigation agent was found dead with his throat cut early today in his automobile near here. The Department of Law Enforcement identified him as Peter Lackey, 30 years old, a specialist in narcotics investi gations. It said there was no known connection between his death and any current investi gation.

title: 300 Newark Whites Push Back Police And Workers at Kawaida Towers Site
description: NEWARK, Nov. 27  About 300 white demonstrators pushed back a squad of tactical police today and blocked eight con struction workers from getting to the site of the Kawaida Tow ers housing project.

title: Peking Signs Pact to Aid Hanoi in '73
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 27  An agreement for Chinese eco nomic and military aid to North Vietnam in 1973 was signed in Peking yesterday.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The striped bass will dis appear from the Atlantic shore, unless those inter ested in its welfare act now, says David Seymour, presi dent of the Hudson River Fishermen's Association, Inc., in announcing a meeting to be held Dec. 9 at the Science Hall Auditorium of the Col lege of Mount St. Vincent in Riverdale.

title: HUGHES'S HOLDINGS UNDER I.R.S. INQUIRY
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 27 (AP)  Federal officials con firmed today that Internal Rev enue Service agents are investi gating Howard R. Hughes's Nevada holdings, but said the billionaire recluse apparently is not a target of the inquiry.

title: Inco Sets Expansion Move
