description: The International Nickel Com pany of Canada, Ltd., an nounced yesterday that it planned to spend $36million for new minetailings and watertreatment facilities at its nickel operations at Copper Cliff, Ont. A spokesman said construction would get under way as soon as governmental approval was received. He esti mated the facilities would be completed between 1977 and 1979.

title: Christ Church in Bronxville To Get New Rector Dec. 13
description: The Rev. Christopher L. Web ber has been named rector of Christ Church in Bronxville, N. Y.

title: Canada's Trade Surplus Up
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 27 (Reuters) Canada had a seasonally ad justed trade surplus in October of $191million, compared with a surplus of $44million in Sep tember, Statistics Canada re ported today.

title: Stage: 1787's The Contrast Returns
description: Against all probability, and indeed against part of my better judgment, I found my self enjoying The Contrast at the Eastside Playhouse last night. It needs time to settle down, but I suspect that with the right audiences accepting this 18thcentury, allAmeri can spoof in the right fashion, it could give a lot of innocent pleasure to not altogether in nocent people.

title: Nixon Terms Vote a Call For Change That Works
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27President Nixon, making his first public commentary of any length on the significance of his reelection victory, said today that he did not view it as simply an approval of things as they were or an endorsement of the status quo.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Equity Financing
description: ATO, Inc., announced yesterday that the ex piration date of its offer to purchase up to one million of the company's common shares at $10.60 per share has been extended to the close of busi ness Dec. 1. The offer, which became effective Nov. 10 had been scheduled to terminate yesterday. The company's stock closed at 10, down  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: DrugRelated Deaths Rise
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27(AP) Drugrelated deaths in the city rose 47 per cent during the first nine months of this year, the county medical examiner said today. He attributed the rise primarily to a 133 per cent rise in drugrelated homicides.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27  The State Assembly approved over whelmingly today plans by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey for a $650 million mass transit program in, the bistate metropolitan area.

title: Cleveland Police Told: Cut Crime or Lose Pay
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 27 (AP) Mayor Ralph Perk told the city's policemen today that if they could not cut crime by 5 per cent next month he would block pay increases due Jan. 1.

title: H. J. Adios Wins at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 27 (AP)  H. J. Adios won the $3,000 Petersburg pace at Free hold Raceway today. He paid $28, $8.40 and $4.60 for $2 across the board. Coastman was second, paying $4 and $3.20 and Hello Yankee, third, at $2.60.

title: Fiat Is Believed Seeking Italy Publishing Empire
description: ROME, Nov. 27A sequence of takeovers and merger talks in the Italian publishing indus try is widely being read as part of a grand design by the own ers of the Fiat Motor Company to build a new communications empire.

title: With Stall Short, Roving Crews Clean the City's Smaller Parks
description: The city's labor shortage has caused the use of roving crews instead of individual staffs to clean smaller parks and playgrounds.

title: Advertising: Television Clutter
description: DORADO BEACH, Puerto Rico, Nov. 27With one of the largest turnouts in its history, the Association of National Advertisers opened its 63d annual meeting here today. Outside the sun was warm, the ocean blue and sparkling and the foliage lushly green. But inside the modern new Cerromar Beach Hotel advertising industry leaders, for the morning at least, heard about some of their problems. And two of their favorites  television advertising clutter and gov ernment regulation  were not overlooked.

title: U.S. FINANCIAL ASKS FOR HALT IN TRADING
description: U. S. Financial, Inc., an nounced yesterday at San Diego, Calif., that it had asked the New York Stock Exchange to halt trading in its securities pending a further review of its sale last December of certain mobile home parks to the Coastal Land Corporation. The transaction resulted in profits after taxes of $1.5million, which contributed 31 cents to previously reported fully di luted earnings of $1.38 a share in 1971.

title: FOOD TALK
description: Quiche Lorraine has be come so popular in recent years that it is almost a clich. No matter. Its popu larity has not detracted from its taste.

title: Navy Says Sailor Confessed He Set Blaze on Carrier
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 27 (AP)  A Navy prosecutor opened the courtmartial of Seama Jef frey G. Allison today by prom ising to introduce a totally corroborated confession in which the 19yearold sailor allegedly admitted setting a major fire last summer aboard the aircraft carrier Forrestal.

title: Two of Brown's CoDefendants Said to Have Admitted Holdup
description: Prosecution witnesses yes terday quoted two of H. Rap Brown's codefendants as ad mitting in effect that they had held up a West 85th Street bar moments before they were all arrested and charged with robbery and attempted murder of three policemen. One was quoted as saying they went there specifically to hold up a bigtime drug dealer.

title: Price Changes
description: The Anaconda American Brass Company, a subsidiary of the Anaconda Company, said yesterday that it was reducing discounts on free cutting brass rods by 1.5 cents a pound.

title: AILING LOCKHART OUT OF NEXT GAME
description: Spider Lockhart, defensive captain of the New York Gaints, won't be able to play at Cincinnati this Sunday be cause of a slight shoulder sepa ration, but he may get back against Miami the following week, the Giants learned yes terday.

title: RANGERS ON ROAD; ISLANDERS ON SKID
Heavy Fighting Reported In Foothills Near Quangtri
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 28 (AP)Heavy fighting was reported on the northernmost front of South Vietnam yesterday, and Gov ernment forces were said to have made some gains in their drive to expand the territory they control before any cease fire.

title: Met Former Tiger Pilot
description: Bob Scheffing, general man ager of the New York Mets, piloted the Detroit Tigers to 101 victories in 1961.

title: Spokesman for 12 Unions Tells L.I.R.R. to Get Ready for Strike
description: Twelve nonoperating unions went ahead yesterday with plans to strike the Long Island Rail Road at 12:01 A.M. on Thursday.

title: Detective Says He Sought Wider Inquiry
description: A police detective testified yesterday that he became a spe cial undercover agent in an ef fort to expand a corruption in vestigation beyond the Police Department to Include judges, prosecutors, lawyers and bail bondsmen.

title: Roman Police Suspect Four At Airport Were Terrorists
description: ROME, Nov. 27The police here said today that four un identified men with Libyan passports were suspected of having abandoned four attach cases full of submachine guns, hand grenades and pistols in the transit passengers' lounge of Fiumicino airport late Sat urday night.

title: 16 IN HOUSE NAMED TO SPENDING PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) Sixteen House members, in cluding a number of national fiscal conservatives, were ap pointed today by the House Speaker, Carl Albert of Okla homa, to a HouseSenate com mittee charged with monitoring Federal spending.

title: Market Place: Retail Brokers In Bear Market
description: You probably think that the small investor these days is spending most of his free time at the office sneaking calls to his brokera long lost friend.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The striped bass will dis appear from the Atlantic shore, unless those inter ested in its welfare act now, says David Seymour, presi dent of the Hudson River Fishermen's Association, Inc., in announcing a meeting to be held Dec. 9 at the Science Hall Auditorium of the Col lege of Mount St. Vincent in Riverdale.

title: Morales, as Usual. Outlasts Stevens on Garden Mat
description: Pedro Morales and Ray Stev ens tossed each other around, out of and under the Madison Square Garden ring last night in their featured professional wrestling exhibition until Mo rales was declared the winner. Danny Bartfield, the referee, ruled that Stevens could not continue after 11 minutes 58 seconds.

title: Meir Aide Seen as Envoy to U.S.
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 27 Simcha Dinitz, Premier Golda Meir's political counselor and closest aide, is expected to be named shortly as Israel's next Ambassador to the Unit ed States, succeeding Itzhak Rabin.

title: Notes on People
description: Arriving in Budapest for a fiveday visit, Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Com munist party leader, was in a jovial mood as he kissed a Hungarian woman and chat ted amiably with the Swiss and United States ambassa dors. Mr. Brezhnev, in Hun gary for talks with Janos Kadar, the Hungarian party leader, recoiled in mock dis belief as he looked up at the Swiss ambassador, Richard Arran, who is more than six feet tall. A typical repre sentative of Switzerland, said Mr. Brezhnev. His words to the American ambassador, Alfred Puhan, were trans lated variously by diplomats within earshot. One said the Brezhnev How are you? was a personal greeting; another said it referred to United States relations, Mr. Puhan's single reply was Fine. To Which Mr. Brezhnev said, Great. Then, as the official cars were slow to pick up the dignitaries, the Soviet leader stood waiting and said, Well, Brezhnev has arrived, but I'm not sure what we're doing now.

title: KENNY'S SENTENCE CUT TO 18 MOTHS
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27  An 18year prison term imposed on John V. Kenny, the former Hudson County Democratic boss, was reduced in Federal Court here today to an 18 month sentence, thus making the ailing, 80yearold Kenny eligible for parole.

title: Seoul Sets Vote Dec. 15
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 27President Park Chung Hee announced today that the elec tion of 2,359 delegates to choose a new President of South Korea would be held Dec. 15.

title: Norway Aides Concede Oslo Let Soviet Sub Flee
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 27 (UPI) To bitter criticism from some members of Parliament, Gov ernment sources said privately today that a submarine bottled up in a Norwegian fjord for two weeks was the Soviet Union's and was allowed to escape to avoid an international incident.

title: Urban Choices for '76
description: The Regional Plan Association, an organization of long established usefulness in the metropolitan area, has launched a campaign to involve citizens, to a greater degree than is common, in decisions affecting their fu ture. Under the rubric choices for '76, machinery is being set up for organized discussions next spring on policies to improve housing, combat poverty, evolve a satisfactory concept of transportation, protect the envi ronment and, in general, better the quality of life in the ConnecticutNew JerseyNew York urban region.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The average rate on three month Treasury bills climbed today to 4.886 per cent  highest since August, 1971, when the Nixon Administra tion imposed price and wage controls. The rate last week was 4,776 per cent.

title: JORDAN LAYS PLOT TO PALESTINIANS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 27 King Hussein of Jordan was quoted here today as having accused the Palestinian guer rillas of plotting to overthrow him recently with help from Libya.

title: PERON'S WIFE SAYS SHE'LL EMULATE EVA
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 27 (AP)  Juan D. Pern's third wife, Isabel, said today that she felt morally obligated to fol low in the footsteps of her predecessor, the late Eva Pern, still venerated by thousands of Peronists.

title: Capt. Robert Crowder, 71, Headed the Texas Rangers
description: DALLAS, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Capt. Robert A. Crowder of the Texas Rangers, who was cred ited with creating the Rangers' unofficial motto, One Riot, One Ranger, when he singlehanded ly calmed a boomtown during the 1930's, died yesterday of a heart attack. He was 71 years old.

title: COERCION IS LAID TO A CITY OFFICE
description: An assistant corporation counsel charged the city and the Corporation Counsel's of fice with unfair labor practices yesterday.

title: LANDLORD TO SHUT 4 SEX SHOPS HERE
description: Sex  oriented bookstores, a movie house and peep shows in properties held by Edward R. Finch, a prominent real estate man and lawyer, will be removed by spring, a spokes man for Mr. Finch said yester day.

title: YALE DRAMA SCHOOL ADDS 9 TO FACULTY
description: The Yale School of Drama has added nine new members to its faculty, each an expert in a different aspect of the drama arts, it was announced by Howard Stein, acting dean.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Morris County's Freeholder Director, Victor E. Wood hull, pleaded guilty to two counts of failing to turn over almost $7,000 he had collected from employes in his pri vate firm to Federal tax authorities. Woodhull, who served as Mayor of Morristown for three years before becoming a Freeholder, faces a twoyear prison terra and a $20,000 fine. No sentencing date was set.

title: ExFireman Gets 4 Years
description: A former New York City fireman who pleaded guilty to the sale of narcotics was sen tenced in State Supreme Court, the Bronx, yesterday to four years in prison. The former fireman, Frank Billings, 31 years old, of 1380 University Avenue, the Bronx, had been assigned to Engine Company 69 at 143d Street between Seventh and Eight Avenues when he sold heroin to an un dercover policeman last April.

title: Bridge: Remarkable Claim Is Feature Of Swiss Team Qualifying
description: The Swiss Team qualifying stage of the Grand Nationals at the New York Hilton dur ing the weekend produced no surprises. All the teams that were expected to qualify for the knockout stages that will eventually produce the New York Champions duly did so.

title: About Pro Football
description: Of the many ascents and descents among the teams of the National Football League this season, the rise of the Cleveland Browns is the most surprising and has received the least attention. The suc cesses of the Miami Dolphins, the Washington Redskins and the Pittsburgh Steelers have all been documented but few seem to real ize where the Browns are, and where they came from. They are in first place for one thing, tied in the Amer ican Conference's Central Division with the Steeler's, their opponent on Sunday in a big game at Pittsburgh.

title: SUIT SEES MISUSE OF $224MILLION IN MUTUAL FUNDS
Board Begins Task of Rezoning District 18 for Racial Balance
description: The community school board in the CanarsieEast Flatbush section of Brooklyn last night began redrawing at tendance zones that would im plement realigned racial bal ances the board has proposed for two junior high schools in the district.

title: Biggs, at the Organ, Plays Rheinberger To Stunning Effect
description: The revival of interest in ob scure 19thcentury composers has not really affected the or gan to any extentwhich is not surprising since the roman tics had comparatively little use for the instrument. Of course there is always an exception Josef Rheinberger (18391901), for instance, wrote 20 organ sonatas and a pair of concertos, and on Sunday night at St. George's Episcopal Church, E. Power Biggs unearthed the two concertos for our inspection and possible reevaluation.

title: Mets Send Agee to the Astros for Pair; Yanks Trade Four to Get Graig Nettles
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 27Five thousand miles from home, New York's baseball teams rattled the winter trading market today in three deals involving 12 players. In the biggest, the Mets sent Tommie Agee to the Houston Astros and the Yankees got Graig Net tles from the Cleveland Indians.

title: AUPRES DE MA BLONDE
description: A hush fell over the little group, broken by a muffled oath and the creak of heavy footfalls on the stairs out side.

title: Strict Censorship in Israel Termed Outdated by Paper
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)An influential independent daily, Haaretz, crit icized Israeli press censorship today and described it as out dated and one of the most strict in the world.

title: Coast Reporter Ordered to Jail For Refusing to Disclose Source
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 27  William T. Farr, a Los Angeles reporter, was ordered to jail today for contempt of court after again refusing to disclose his sources for an article he wrote concerning the 1970 mur der trial of Charles M. Manson.

title: Jacob W. Hostetter, a Dean At Polytechnic Institute, 62
description: ROCKVILLE, CENTRE, L.I. Nov. 27Jacob W. Hostetter, clean of students and director of financial aid at Polytechnic In stitute of Brooklyn, died Satur day in Mercy Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 5 Albany Court.

title: TURBINE CONTRACT GOES TO CHRYSLER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The Federal Environmental Protection Agency announced tonight that it would sign a $6.4million contract with the Chrysler Corporation to im prove its gas turbine engine.

title: Nixon Terms Vote a Call For Change That Works
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27President Nixon, making his first public commentary of any length on the significance of his reelection victory, said today that he did not view it as simply an approval of things as they were or an endorsement of the status quo.

title: JURORS CHARGES STUDIED BY HOGAN
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan's office is investigating statements by two jurors that they were offered bribes of $5,000 each to vote for acquit tal in a recent trial of a book store owner charged with wholesale distribution of porno graphic films.

title: Israelis Voice Skepticism
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 27Israelis are generally skeptical about the report that Martin Bormann is alive in Argentina.

title: BIG BOARD FIRM ENDS ITS PUBLIC BUSINESS
description: ?? Friedman & Co., Inc., a ?? Louis brokerage firm with nine salesmen, disclosed yester day that by mutual agreement with the New York Stock Ex change, of which it is a mem ber, it would no longer do busi ness with the public as of Dec. 31.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27  The Legislature today passed and sent to Governor Cahill a bill permitting the City of Newark to continue special taxes on payrolls and parking for an other year. The Governor is expected to sign the measure.

title: Merger News
description: The International Minerals and Chemical Corporation reached a tentative understand ing yesterday to acquire Wes trans Industries, Inc., for stock valued at about $39million. I.M.C. is the world's largest producer of fertilizer materials and also mines and refines potash and phosphate rock. Westrans Indus tries, a New York based natural re sources company engaged in gas and oil exploration and development, coal production and naturalgas transmission, has sizable foreign gas and oil concession interests.

title: CHARTER REVISERS SEE BRONX SLUMS
description: The City Charter Revision Commission took a fourhour bus tour of the worst areas of the Bronx yesterday and heard Borough President Rob ert Abrams plead every block of the way to be accorded much of the neighborhood au thority now exercised by the Mayor.

title: WASHINGTON POST DENIES JOB BIAS
description: WASHINGTON, Nova 27  The Washington Post has re jected as vague, unsupported and obviously baseless charges that ?? has discriminated against blacks in hiring, promotion and jobassignment.

title: 5 STUDENTS SHOT IN PONTIAC, MICH.
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Nov. 27 Five students were shot and wounded, one seriously, at Central High School here today after an apparent confrontation between black and white stu dents in a courtyard during a change of classes.

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH NIXON TWICE ON PEACE EFFORT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 President Nixon met twice with Henry A. Kissinger on Vietnam today and Mr. Kissinger made a rare trip to the State Depart ment to confer with Secretary of State William P. Rogers, as Administration officials pri vately asserted that efforts to achieve a settlement of the war were on course.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Aram Bakshian's obituary for Mc Governism or new left philosophy [OpEd Nov. 17] may reflect the think ing of his employer in the White House, but that does not necessarily make it valid or prophetic. His em phasis on one of the most crushing majorities in history ignores the sad fact that more potential voters than the 44 million who voted for Nixon stayed home (53 million). Is this showing overwhelming faith in the Administration?

title: Visitors to Italy Find It Harder to Overstay Visa
description: ROME, Nov. 27A recent crackdown is making it more difficult for foreigners to re main in Italy beyond the three month period that the authori ties automatically grant to vis itors from abroad.

title: Belfast Schoolboy Shot Dead
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 27A 14yearold Catho lic schoolboy was shot dead today and his father and brother were wounded when two gunmen riddled their car in a Protestant area of Belfast.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: SALISBURY, Md., Nov. 27 (AP)A 15event United States indoor tennis circuit worth more than $360,000 in prize money was announced today by William F. Riordan, who put it together in cooperation with the United States Lawn Tennis Association.

title: JOHN LEO, REALTOR, N. Y. A. C. OFFICIAL
description: John P. Leo, a real estate and life insurance broker, who was a leader of the New York Ath letic Club, died Saturday of a coronary ailment at his home, 150 Pinehurst Avenue. He was 61 years old.

title: Paris Opera Director Describes Path to Success
description: PARIS, Nov. 21  Ber nard Lefort, who has turned the Paris Opera from col lapse to triumph in two years, has some firm ideas about how to run an opera house.

title: Harold V. Bozell Dead at 86; ExHead of General Telephone
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Nov. 27  Harold V. Bozell, retired president of General Telephone Corporation, which became the General Telephone & Elec tronics Corporation, the second largest telephone company in the world, died today at New Rochelle Medical Center. His age was 86 and he lived at 37 Lincoln Street here.

title: C. B. S. Strike Situation
description: PARTICIPANTSColumbia Broadcasting System and Local 1212, Radio and Television Broadcast Engineers Union, International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. Union represents 1,200 cameramen, audio engineers, light ing men and other technicians. The workers went on strike Nov. 3 and have affected C.B.S. operations at its New York, Los Angeles and Washington studios, as well as at TV and radio stations owned and operated by C.B.S. in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, Boston and St. Louis.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27The American Motors Corpora tion reported retail sales of 8,407 cars in the middle third of November, up from 7,455 a year ago. There was one less selling day in the Nov. 1120 period this year, mean ing that A.M.C. dealers averaged 1,051 sales a day, a gain of 27 per cent from an average of 828 a day last year.

title: Big Salvation Army Kettle Stolen
description: The big Salvation Army kettle that stood next to Macy's in Christmases past is missing. It was a vermillion piece of cast iron into which people dropped money, and it weighed between 300 and 400 pounds. Last Friday night, or perhaps in the small hours of Saturday morning, it was stolen.

title: Business Briefs
description: VIENNA, Nov. 27 (Reuters)The Austrian bank rate was raised today to 5, per cent from 5 per cent, effective tomorrow. The Austrian national bank, announcing the decision, said it was part of a move to combat inflation, now running at an annual rate of 7 per cent.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The city's Department of Air Resources has found peak concentrations of poisonous carbon monoxide gas as high as 60 to 70 parts per million in the Lincoln Center Garage, twice as high as the 35 parts per million set by the state as the maximum eighthour exposure for a Garage. Monitoring equipment was set up in the garage Friday after seven children had been overcome by fumes on Thanksgiving while waiting in a line of cars trying to get out of the only exit open at the time.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Coast Guard will shortly be giving sea trials to a water waste man agement system developed by Lundy Electronics and designed to treat human, galley and laundry wastes of a fiftyman crew and return to the sea the effluent of a quality cleaner than swimmingpool water.

title: HIJACKING TALKS WITH CUBA OPEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The State Department an nounced today that negotia tions on an accord to halt the hijacking of airliners to Cuba began in Havana last Saturday with the Swiss Ambassador there representing the United States.

title: Whalers Top Crusaders, 30, As Smith Gets First Shutout
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)The New England Whalers scored once in every period and Al Smith registered his first shut out tonight in a 30 World Hockey Association victory over the Cleveland Crusaders.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The enclosed short report is self explanatory and requires immediate attention.

title: Heritage Golf Won By Johnny Miller
Books of The Times
description: Since Freud systematized the treatment of mental illness there has been a constant movement toward finding a short cut to psychological cure. This is not surprising, for ours is an impatient age, and Freudian analysis may be the most painstaking example of the 19thcentury handcrafting tradition. In some cases, it amounts to nothing less than the total repair of the total personality. But in our time, repair ing is almost disappearing as a craft or industry. No one wants to bother with a used or secondhand object. It is often cheaper to buy a new one than to fix the old.

title: 8 SEIZED BY FRANCE IN HEROIN SMUGGLING
description: PARIS, Nov. 27  French narcotics agents announced to day that they had seized 132 pounds of pure heroin here and arrested eight smuggling sus pects shortly before the heroin was to have been shipped to Latin America Saturday on its way to the United States.

title: The 76ers: From Best to Worst And Nightmare for a New Coach
description: Play the tough D now! bellows Coach Roy Rubin, a 46yearold bachelor whose recent marriage to the Phila delphia 76ers seems to have been made in purgatory. Play 'em, play 'em!

title: TV Review
description: It's high time the American Broadcasting Company made a Tuesday Movie of the Week with nothing but thunder, lightning and rain. Why bother with actors or a plot? Last week poor Eliza beth Montgomery was slosh ing around hysterically in a whodunit called The Vic tim and the actress was just that.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: SAY WHEN, SAY WHEN, SAY PL A3033 Advt.

title: HIJACKER GETS LIFE IN WEST COAST CASE
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 27 (AP)  Frank Markoe Sibley Jr., the bicyclist who hijacked a jet liner and demanded ransom money for warcrippled chil dren in Vietnam, was sentenced to life in prison today. But Judge Morell Sharp of the United States District Court made the sentence contingent on the outcome of a three month study of Sibley's back ground and physical and men tal condition.

title: PAKISTAN FREES 617 INDIAN P.O.W.'S
description: LYALLPUR, Pakistan, Nov. 27  President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto freed all 617 Indian prisoners of war held in Paki stan today in a move aimed at persuading India to release the more than 84,000 Pakistani prisoners of war captured last December.

title: Two Killed in Nebraska Fire
description: KEARNEY, Neb., Nov. 27 (AP) Two elderly residents were killed and four were injured early today when a fire swept through a boarding house that the authorities said had lost its license as a nursing home. Erna Sexton, the owner, said the home had lost its license after failing to meet state fire regu lations.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 27 Walter Zirpolo, the former mayor of Woodbridge Town ship, and Robert E. Jacks, onetime president of the town ship council, pleaded guilty in two bribery cases today.

title: Force Is Charged
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)Mrs. Sean Mac Stiofain said at a news confer ence here tonight that her hus band had been transferred by force from Mater Hospital here to an army hospital out side Dublin.

title: DANIEL V. WRENN, 81, OF CUSTOMS BUREAU
description: Daniel V. Wrenn, who re tired in 1961 as assistant to the Collector of Customs here after 54 years of service with the Bureau of Customs, died Sunday in Booth Memorial Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 3528 77th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: 2 BROOKLYN BOYS DIE IN STEAMY BEDROOM
description: Two small brothers in Brook lyn's Williamsburg section died early yesterday when the po lice said, steam from a faulty radiator filled their bedroom in a topfloor apartment of a fivestory building at 265 South Second Street.

title: Widening Boycott Closes 9 Schools in East Harlem
description: A widening boycott by par ents angry over school budget cuts forced nine schools in East Harlem with more than 7,500 pupils to close yesterday.

title: Navy Links Air Force To Alleged Kidnapping
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 27 (UPI)The Army may have gotten Navy's goat, but it appeared today that the Air Force may have helped the Cadets with the kidnapping of the Midshipmen's mascot, Billy XVIII.

title: ACCORD REACHED IN BAKERY STRIKE
description: Negotiators for 18 specialty bakeries and their 2,500 striking driversalesmen agreed yester day to a new contract providing for higher pay and improved benefits.

title: OTC AID AMEX SHOW DECLINES
description: Prices on the overthecoun ter market and the American Stock Exchange declined yes terday. Trading volume was higher than on Friday, when many traders took the day off following the Thanksgiving holiday.

title: City Stays Rent Increases In Social Security Cases
description: The City Housing Authority announced yesterday that it was blocking rent increases for more than 20,000 families, vir tually all of them elderly peo ple, that would have resulted from the increase in their in comes because of the 20 per cent rise in Social Security benefits they started receiving last month.

title: India Offers P.O.W. Release
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 27 (AP) Foreign Minister Swaran Singh of India said in Parliament to day that India was willing to free the 540 Pakistani prison ers that India had captured on the western front. He said India had made the offer last sum mer but that Pakistan had ignored it. The Pakistan radio quoted a Pakistani Government spokesman as having denied that India had made such an offer.

title: HIJACKING TALKS WITH CUBA OPEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The State Department an nounced today that negotia tions on an accord to halt the hijacking of airliners to Cuba began in Havana last Saturday with the Swiss Ambassador there representing the United States.

title: Western Oil Consortium Offers New Plan to Iraqi
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 27 (AP)  The EuropeanAmerican owned Iraq Petroleum Com pany has submitted a new package proposal to the Iraqi government to settle all dis putes between the two sides, an oil industry publication said today.

title: Widening Boycott Shuts Nine Schools
description: A widening boycott by par ents angry over school budget cuts forced nine schools in East Harlem with more than 7,500 pupils to close yesterday.

title: Trackmen Warn A.A.U. of Meet Boycotts
description: Top American track and field athletes are prepared to boycott major meets in the United States next year un less the Amateur Athletic Union agrees to establish to tal autonomy for the sport in this country.

title: The Vietnam Handshake
description: One month has elapsed since that dramatic White House briefing by Dr. Henry Kissinger. We remain con vinced that the issues that I have mentioned are soluble in a very brief period of time, President Nixon's negotiator said. We have undertaken, and I repeat it here publicly, to settle them at one more meeting and to remain at that meeting for as long as is necessary to complete the agreement. This undertaking to the people of the United States and of Vietnam has now been broken. Perhaps the reasons are technical, but there are ominous signs that more profound considerations may be promoting ruinous second thoughts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: How many more deaths and maim ings as a result of brutal assaults, how many more firms and families leaving New York forever will it take before the authorities recognize that, what ever its failings, the British system of narcotics control is working?

title: NeoFascists and Reds in Italy Appear Set Back in Local Voting
description: ROME, Tuesday, Nov. 28 Incomplete returns in the mu nicipal elections held in many areas of Italy Sunday and yes terday indicated early this morning that the neoFascist and Communist parties had lost ground.

title: U.N. Begins Debate on a New Code of Law for the Sea
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 27Debate was opened here today on the law of the sea, considered one of the most delicate and crucial areas of International negotiation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I read with interest John Herbers news article of Nov. 15 which foretells a major fight in Congress and the Administration regarding two conflict ing housing studies. Since Philadelphia is a nationally famous housing disas ter area, we are well equipped to evaluate this nation's housing pro grams. Our specialty is generating abandoned houses. Our knowledgeable commentators quite rightly perceive that we have only seen the beginning of the phenomenon as the momentum increases and housing on good blocks as well as bad is abandoned. Life in the spreading areas of decay is not to be envied, Neighborhood after neighborhood turns into a nightmare of danger, fear and blight.

title: WEATHER IS KEY TO SOYBEAN GAINS
description: Bad weather was the key to understanding the sharp rise in soybean and corn futures prices yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade.

title: F.T.C. Asks Rules to Discourage Misleading Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  The Federal Trade Commission moved today to discourage what officials called the sub stantial use of misleading tes timonials and endorsements in television and radio commer cials and other advertisements.

title: Giants, Jets and If's
description: Here are playoff possibilities concerning the Giants and Jets. They are not all inclusive, because any game may end in a tie. Neither New York team can finish first in its division. (Even if the Giants win three while Washington loses three, the Redskins won both games between the two teams.) So the only way a New York team can reach the playoffs is to finish second in its own division with the best record of the secondplace finishers in its conference.

title: Phone Company to Check Its Professional Listings
description: After prodding by the State Attorney General's office, the New York Telephone Company has agreed to start checking the professional qualifications and licenses of persons listed in telephone books throughout the state as physicians or psy chologists.

title: SUIT SEES MISUSE OF $224  MILLION IN MUTUAL FUNDS
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged yesterday that Robert L. Vesco, former chairman of the International Controls Corporation, and 41 other defendants had spirited away some $224million in cash and securities from four mutual funds.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27  An 18year prison term imposed on John V. Kenny, the former Hudson County Democratic boss, was reduced in Federal Court here today to an 18 month sentence, thus making the ailing, 80yearold Kenny eligible for parole.

title: OBSERVER
description: Among sons of the welltodo, there is a trend toward careers in the manual skills and cottage industries. Carpentry has become very popular. So has candlemaking. It has been es timated that one of every three chil dren of the American Upper Class, between ages 18 and 25, is now living in a woods making candles.

title: City College to Offer An M.D. in Six Years
description: City College plans to es tablish a Center for Biomed ical Education in the 197374 academic year and reduce the time it takes to get a medical degree from eight to six years.

title: Army Parole Unit Visits Galley In Review of 20Year Sentence
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Nov. 27A military panel that could rec ommend that First Lieut. Wil liam L. Calley Jr. be uncondi tionally released spent two hours today with the 29year old Army officer, who was con victed last year of murdering 22 South Vietnamese civilians.

title: U.S. Housing Official Gets 3 Years in Bribery Case
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 27 (AP)The former West Vir ginia director of the Federal Housing Administration, James Frederick Haught, was sen tenced today to three years in prison and fined $1,000 on charges of defrauding the Gov ernment, bribery and use of in terstate commerce facilities for racketeering activities.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Bill Bowerman, head coach of the Olympic track team, said yesterday that treatment of Americans at the Games in Munich had so upset him that he had considered quitting the United States Olympic Committee.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Know what a gee haw whimmy diddle is? Or a flip perdinger? How about a moonwinder?

title: M'GREGOR FORESEES U.S.RHODESIAN TIES
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 27Rhodesian television audi ences were told last night by Clark MacGregor, former coun sel to President Nixon for Con gressional relations, that the United States might soon recog nize Rhodesia's sovereignty.

title: Laotian Garrison Surrounded
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Military sources re ported today that North Viet namese and Pathet Lao forces had surrounded the provincial capital of Thakhek in southern Laos, which had come under constant attack for the last two weeks. Strong air support was being given to the Thakhelc garrison, 250 miles south of Vientiane, but the enemy's pressure was increasing, the sources said.

title: Night Visibility for Bikes Argued at State Hearing
description: Ghostly white, a pair of circles and a diagonal bar fairly leaped out of a dark ened projection screen at a Department of Motor Vehicles hearing yesterday. Caught by the headlights of a car, the wheels and frame of a bicycle treated with crystalline re flective material were recog nizable instantly and unmis takably.

title: DONALD TILLEMAN
description: Donald Tillernan, Mayor of Green Bay, Wis., died yesterday of a heart attack in his room at the Holiday Inn in Manhattan. He was 54 years old.

title: Personalities: Pitt Coach Is Out
description: Pittsburgh, a loser in big time college football, yester day dismissed Carl DePasqua, its third coach in eight years. Casimir Myslinski, the ath letic director, in announcing the dismissal of DePasqua, whose fouryear, wonlost record was 1329, said:

title: Chess: Trying to Trap the Trapper Can Trap the Trapee Instead
description: Anthony E. Santasiere, one of America's most prominent masters in the nineteenfor ties, has always vehemently insisted that the swash buckling attack, preferably studded with glorious sacri fices, is the measure of chess prowess. Endless hours of argument could never per suade him that the defense was anything but a grubby business or that winning games by snatching pawns could rise above the ignoble.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: ANN & IRV MILLER: RVCs loss is FLAs gainLoveJon, Steve Lynn. S&SAvdt.

title: Southern U. Students Restive as 2 Inquiries Open
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 27 Two inquiries into the deaths of two Southern University stu dents got under way here today, but the calm that officials had asked for was missing.

title: Business Briefs
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 27 (UPI)Four leading cop perproducing nations opened a special conference today to combat what they call economic or commercial aggres sion against their sales of the metal. The Intergovern mental Committee of CopperExporting Nations met against the background of court action by the Kennecott Corpora tion against payment on Chilean copper shipments to France and Sweden.

title: Stage: Politics of Heroin
description: Political theater often sac rifices art for the sake of politics, but this is not the case with the San Francisco Mime Troupe. It is clear from The Dragon Lady's Revenge, a scathing musical cartoon (with dialogue), that the Mime Troupe is an excellent com pany of theatrical artists, polemicists and satirists. The Dragon Lady opened this weekend at the Washington Square Methodist Church, where it will run through Dec. 10.

title: Music: A Political Journey Depicted
description: It is not every day that a composer provides one with the operative word, right there in his title, to describe his work, but Hans Werner Henze does just that in The Tedious Way to the Place of Natascha Ungeheuer. The score, which is in effect a oneact opera or an 11scene cantata, proved monstrously tedious indeed in its first American performance on Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall. Dennis Russell Davies conducted The Ensemble in what sounded like an admir ably precise reading.

title: COAST KIDNAPPER SLAIN AFTER CHASE
description: CORONA, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Richard Lee Driskill, who led the police on a 400 mile chase at speeds up to 100 miles an hour through central and southern California and held a teenage girl hostage, was killed yesterday by a marksman as he tried to talk his way out of a ring of police cars.

title: RATE SUIT SETTLED BY COCOA EXCHANGE
description: The New York Cocoa Ex change announced yesterday that it had agreed to settle an antitrust suit challenging mini mum commission rates in the same way as the Chicago Board of Trade and the Chicago Mer cantile Exchange. The Chicago exchanges announced last week that they would phase out min imum commission rates on non member transactions and adopt a system of negotiated commis sion rates.

title: MRS. N. W. MORROW
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Nov. 27Mrs. Laura Bang Morrow, wife of Nathaniel W. Morrow, retired vice president of the New Britain Machine division of Litton Industries, died today in New Britain General Hospi tal. She was 70 years old and lived at 136 South Mountain. Drive.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As many dog owners in the Sydney, Australia, area do, I take my Old English sheep dog to a kennel club training school where it is requested that dog owners pick up after their pets. Newspapers (sorry!), a trowel and the public park's refuse bins are supplied for some 150 dog owners. People do clean up and, of course, the net result is a clean park for them selves and their children.

title: ROMNEY AND LAIRD LEAVING AS NIXON RESHAPES CABINET
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 President Nixon announced to day that he had accepted the resignations of two Cabinet members, George Romney and Melvin R. Laird, and would be gin tomorrow designating new players in his second Admin istration.

title: Excerpts From President's Remarks to Reporters
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Following are excerpts from remarks of President Nixon on reorganization today at Camp David, Md.:

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH NIXON TWICE ON PEACE EFFORT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 President Nixon met twice with Henry A. Kissinger on Vietnam today and Mr. Kissinger made a rare trip to the State Depart ment to confer with Secretary of State William P. Rogers, as Administration officials pri vately asserted that efforts to achieve a settlement of the war were on course.

title: Parents Demand Explanation by Soviet Authorities of Poet's Death After Surgery at a Labor Camp
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (AP)The parents of a poet who died in a forced labor camp have de manded a comprehensive and official explanation from So viet authorities.

title: TROUBLED DUTCH VOTE TOMORROW
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, Nov. 23  Fundamen tal changes in the structure of Dutch society are behind a po litical crisis in this country of 13 million, and few expect to see a resolution even after the general elections on Wednes day.

title: PROFESSOR SCORES INSIDER ATTITUDE
description: If only black scholars can understand blacks, then one must necessarily conclude that only women can understand women; men, men; capitalists, capitalists; and Catholics, Cath olics, said Robert K. Merton in an address to 300 people at Columbia University's second University Lecture last night in Low Memorial Library.

title: MRS. JULIA CRANDALL
description: EAST ORANGE, N.J., Nov. 27 Mrs. Julia Kuenemann Cran dall, a retired librarian, died today in East Orange Memorial Hospital. She was 85 years old and lived at 77 South Munn Avenue.

title: BLUE LAW STUDIED BY ALEXANDER'S
description: Law enforcement authorities in New York said yesterday that they would not act against Alexander's, Inc., which is re ported to be considering open ing five of its stores in the city for Sunday operations, unless a complaint was filed. The management of the company, meanwhile, withheld a deci sion on the move last night.

title: Thieu Said to Seek Summit
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 27According to informed speculation in South Vietnam ese political circles, President Thieu's special assistant, Mr. Duc, is bringing with him to Washington a request for an American  South Vietnamese summit meeting.

title: Paul Taylor Assays Modern Dance
description: Paul Taylor, a big, generous man who moves on stage with amazing grace, high in telligence and wicked wit, is one of the bestknown Amer ican choreographers and dancers in the world. So closely is he identified abroad with American modern dance that when the Alvin Ailey company toured the Soviet Union, Soviet officials pub lished a silhouette of Mr. Taylor on the cover of the Ailey program.

title: Dog Finds Hashish in Cargo
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 (AP)The seizure of 350 pounds of hashish in an air shipment of jewelry from India was reported today by Bureau of Customs agents. They said that the hashish was worth $1.5million and that it had been detected by a bureau dog. Jonathan L. Cook, 30 years old, a son of Superior Court Judge Lyle E. Cook of Alameda Coun ty, was arrested after he picked up the shipment, the agents said.

title: Part of Report Supported
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 27 (Reuters)  Argentine secret service sources said today that Martin Bormann was sheltered in this country after the World War II, but could not confirm reports that he still lived here.

title: DR. A. P. BEUTEL DIES; DOW CHEMICAL AIDE
description: BRAZOSPORT, Tex., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Dr. A. P. Beutel, who helped found the petrochemical industry along the TexasLou isiana coast, died today ap parently of a heart failure in a hospital here. He was 80 years old.

title: S.E.C. EXONERATES SELF UNDERWRITER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  The Securities and Exchange Commission set aside today the disciplinary actions taken by the National Association of Se curities Dealers against the Ex ecutive Securities Corporation of Miami and three of its of ficials.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: Combustion Engineering, Inc., has received a commitment for an 890,000kilowatt nuclear steam supply system valued at approximately $44million from the Florida Power and Light Company. This would be the second nuclear unit at the util ity's St. Lucie plant and would be a duplicate of the first which is now being installed at the site. The second unit is scheduled for operation in 1979.

title: KAPLAN FUR SALON TO CLOSE DEC. 22
description: Georges Kaplan, the retail fur salon at Fifth Avenue and 57th Street, will close on Dec. 22 after 30 years of operation in New York.

title: Body repairmen now are just as much overpaid as plumbers.
description: PACIFIC GROVE, Calif,The state of the art in the automotive industry has not advanced in at least twenty years.

title: Man in the News
description: LONDON, Nov. 27Many years ago little John Ste phenson trembled and cried with terror when his father stumbled into their London home and began beating his mother in an alcoholic rage.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)A Federal grand jury today accused three men of air piracy, kidnapping and obstruc tion of interstate commerce in connection with the hijacking to Cuba of a Southern Airways jet Nov. 10.

title: Romney Departs
description: The resignation of George W. Romney as Secretary of Housing and Urban Development has started the long awaited major shakeup in the Nixon Administration. He is to be followed out of the Cabinet by Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird and undoubtedly others will leave, willingly or otherwise.

title: ROMNEY AND LAIRD LEAVING AS NIXON RESHAPES CABINET
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 President Nixon announced to day that he had accepted the resignations of two Cabinet members, George Romney and Melvin R. Laird, and would be gin tomorrow designating new players in his second Admin istration.

title: Devaluation Pressures Build in Italy
description: ROME, Nov. 27  Public debate on whether the lira should be devaluedand, if so, when and by how muchhas gained momentum during the last few days, sending Italians with cash on their hands scur rying for shelter.

title: MAGEE IS EJECTED AS TRIAL BEGINS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 Ruchell Magee, the only inmate from San Quentin Prison to survive the escape attempt at the Marin County Courthouse in August, 1970, went on trial today for the murder of the judge who was killed in the incident.

title: LANDLORD TO SHUT 4 SEX SHOPS HERE
description: Sex  oriented bookstores, a movie house and peep shows in properties held by Edward R. Finch, a prominent real estate man and lawyer, will be removed by spring, a spokes man for Mr. Finch said yester day.

title: 300 Push Back Police and Workers at Kawaida Site
description: NEWARK, Nov. 27  About, 300 white demonstrators pushed back a squad of tactical police today and blocked eight con struction workers from getting to the site of the Kawaida Towers housing project.

title: Rochefort Goes to Flames
description: ATLANTA, NOV. 27 (UPI) The Atlanta Flames of the Na tional Hockey League got Leon Rochefort from the Detroit Red Wings today in exchange for Bill Hogaboam, a young for ward. Rochefort, a right wing, has played in more than 400 N.H.L. games.

title: PAKISTAN FREES 617 INDIAN P.O.W.'S
description: LYALLPUR, Pakistan, Nov. 27President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto freed all 617 Indian prisoners of war held in Paki stan today in a move aimed at persuading India to release the more than 84,000 Pakistani prisoners of war captured last December.

title: City Concedes Delay in Notifying Tenants of RentIncrease Status
description: Officials of the housing and Development Administration ac knowledged at a City Council hearing yesterday that 39 per cent of the tenants in rent controlled apartments in the city had not yet been notified whether their rents would be increased.

title: Iowa Power to Expand
description: The Iowa Power & Light Company said yesterday it planned to build a $170million electric generating unit at Council Bluffs. Construction of the 600,000kilowatt generat ing unit is to start in 1974 with completion set for early 1979.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: ONEONTA, N. Y., Nov. 27 (AP)  Oneonta State defeated its crosstown rival, Hartwick, by 30 today to become the state National Collegiate collegedivision soccer champion. Hartwick won the state title the three previous years. The victory put Oneonta into the national quarter finals against Springfield on Friday at Damasche Field here.

title: Consolidation Called Key to Cities' Hopes
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 27 Mayors and city councilmen from many of the nation's larg er communities assembled here today to discuss their many problems and seek ways to pre vent losses of Federal money in the substitution of revenue sharing for the old system of Federal grants in aid.

title: Carrier Corp. Raises Net To a Record for Quarter
description: The Carrier Corporation achieved the highest earnings and sales in its 57year history, in the quarter and 12 months ended Oct. 31, the company said in its annual report issued yesterday.

title: Dublin Seeks Wide Powers To End I.R.A.'s Terrorism
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 27The Government of Prime Minister John Lynch announced today that it would seek new emer gency powers to end the terror campaign of the outlawed Irish Republican Army. It made public a bill to be de bated in Parliament Wednes day that would give the police and special courts vastly in creased powers to jail ter rorist suspects.

title: Dublin Seeks Wide Powers To End I.R.A.'s Terrorism
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 27The Government of Prime Minister John Lynch announced today that it would seek new emer gency powers to end the terror campaign of the outlawed Irish Republican Army. It made public a bill to be de bated in Parliament Wednes day that would give the police and special courts vastly in creased powers to jail ter rorist suspects.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Knute Rockne of Notre Dame was on his way to recognition as the dominating coac.h in football a half century ago, he was asked where his brilliant ideas and imaginative concepts had come from. Rock never hesitated. A note of tenderness even crept into his metallic voice.

title: C.B.S. Newsmen Here to Weigh Changing Position During Strike
description: New Yorkbased newsmen of the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem will meet today to discuss perhaps changing the stance they should take in the techni cians' strike against C.B.S., ac cording to Walter Cronkite, the network's leading cor respondent.

title: 116 Safe in Jet Blowout
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 27 (AP) One hundred and eight pas sengers and eight crew mem bers slid down emergency chutes after two tires on a land ing jetliner blew out and started a fire in a wheel well. Airport officials said the Continental Airlines Boeing 727 had just touched down last night after a flight from Phoenix, Ariz., when the tires blew out on the left main landing gear.

title: Body of Jersey Pilot Found
description: LIGONIER, Pa., Nov. 27 (UPI) The body of a New Jersey pilot was pulled from the wreckage of a helicopter today, almost a week after his craft had disappeared in the moun tains of western Pennsylvania. The state police identified the victim as Hank Zieger of Teter boro. He was reported missing last Tuesday after he left Latrobe, Pa., on a flight to Teterboro.

title: To Collectors, Navajo Design Is Irresistible
description: Frank Stella uses his Navajo blankets more or less tradi tionally: he sleeps under them, Kenneth Noland used them to upholster his outsized hassocks. Andy Warhol draped some of his considerable stock of Indian weavings on the Art Deco chairs and sofa in his Union Square studio. And Donald Judd, for want of sufficient wall space, keeps his 19thcentury collection in neat, tall stacks on the floor of his Lower East Side ware housestudiohome.

title: Cahill's FloodPlain Bill Wins Final Passage in Legislature
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27Gover nor Cahill's controversial mea sure that would impose state control over the future land use and development of low lying floodprone regions in New Jersey cleared the State Legislature this afternoon.

title: Jill the Queen Outruns Favored Flashy Leviss at Aqueduct
RACE SEEN FACTOR IN 2 NAVY CLASHES
description: Two apparent racial incidents have erupted at United States Navy facilities in the latest clashes between blacks and whites in the military branch.

title: Production of Steel Was Up By 1.8% in Latest Week
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 25 rose by 1.8 per cent to 2,683,000 net tong, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute reported yesterday. This produced an index level of 110 and compared with the 2,636, 000 tons poured a week ago when the index was 108.

title: $1.5Million Rail Settlement
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 27 (UPI)Larry Callis, a 28year old father of three who lost both legs and an arm in an ac cident last summer, has won a $1.5million outofcourt settle ment with the Southern Pacific Railroad. Mr. Callis, of Yuma, Ariz., was working as a switch man in the Yuma yards July 11 when a freight car was shoved by a switch engine into another car on which he was working.

title: Pompidou Trip to Former Colonies Highlights Their Ties With France
description: LOME, Togo, Nov. 26Presi dent Pompidou has just ended a fiveday trip to Upper Volta and Togo that reinforced France's considerable influence in most of her former African colonies and pointed up their continuing dependence on her.

title: Special Meeting Adjourned
description: A special meeting of share holders of the General Fire proofing Company in Youngs town, Ohio, was adjourned yes terday until Dec. 18 to allow election inspectors to continue to count proxies on a proposal to change of the name of the company to GF Business Equip ment, Inc

title: SUIT CHARGES SPYING BY KENT STATE AIDES
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 27 (AP) The American Civil Liberties Union filed suit in Federal court today charging Kent State University officials with what it called unlawful sur veillance and entrapment.

title: Girls' Sport Rule Annulled
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 27 (UPI)The Indiana Supreme Court ruled unconstitutional to day a rule by the Indiana High School Athletic Association banning girls from participation in interscholastic noncontact sports such as golf. The reversal came in the case of Johnell Haas, a girl who was qualified as a member of the South Bend Riley High School golf learn but was denied the opportunity to participate in interscholastic team competition because of the rule.

title: IndiaPakistani Talks Fail To End Kashmir Deadlock
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 28India and Pakistan failed once again today to break the fourweek deadlock over the Kashmir ceasefire line despite a meeting between the army chiefs of the two countries.

title: Oil Spilled in Arthur Kill
description: Between 2,000 and 6,000 gal lons of heavy bunker oil was spilled in a twomile section of the Arthur Kill early yesterday. A Coast Guard spokesman said that the origin of the spill was unknown and that it was hug ging the New Jersey coast be tween Sewaren and Perth Am boy. The Coast Guard is moni toring the cleanup of the oil by Paul Pniss & Son, Inc., of Se waren.

title: West Virginia Gives Moonshine Its Blessing
description: CHARLESTON. W. Va., Nov. 28 (AP)The state of West Virginia has gone into the business of selling moon shine.

title: Kitty Hawk Back at Home Port; Sailors Describe Racial Conflict
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 28The aircraft carrier U.S.S. Kitty Hawk returned to her home port here today with crewmen defying orders not to discuss incidents involving racial con flict at sea.

title: Mediator Enters L.I.R.R. Dispute as Strike Nears
description: The National Mediation Board intervened yesterday in the contract dispute between the Long Island Rail Road and 12 nonoperating unions in an effort to avoid a strike threat ened for 12:01 A.M. tomorrow.

title: Harvard Enlists Editor
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  Louis Banks, editorial director of Time Inc. publications, will join the Harvard Business School faculty as a visiting professor, the university announced today.

title: Men in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Elliot Lee Richardson, Presi dent Nixon's nominee for Defense Secretary, will bring to the Pentagon the pers pective of a man who once had a worm'seye view of the Army. Four times re jected for service in World War II because of poor eye sight, he volun teered for non combat duty as a private, won a commission and was wounded and and decorated on the beaches of Normandy. But while Mr. Richardson was once a com mon G.I., he has neither viewed himself nor acted like a common man.

title: Broker Asks Reform
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  A New York Stock Exchange member firm called on the Securities and Exchange Com mission today to order sweep ing reforms in the securities in dustry.

title: HERMAN'S PLAYING SETS HERD'S PACE
description: The blowups of Woody Her man's arrangements that cover the wall behind the bar at the Half Note are more than mere decoration this week. They also serve as a form of illustrated program because the Herman band is on the Half Note's ex pandable bandstand playing some of the very notes of Woody's Whistle, Early Au tumn and Four Brothers that can be followed on the wall by a musically versed bar patron.

title: Simon & Schuster to Publish Book Saying Bormann Lives
description: Simon & Schuster said yes terday that it had contracted to publish a book about Martin Bormann and other Nazis after the author, Ladislas Farago, had displayed what one editor called an enormous quantity of documents that seemed very convincing.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28When 15 college basketball coaches get together to talk to the press, everyone is delightful, talking about doing this and that, until the season begins, which, for some of them, opens tomorrow.

title: U.S. AND SOVIET PLAN ARMS TALKS GROUPS
description: GENEVA, Nov. 28  The United States and the Soviet Union decided today to begin having their experts meet in small groups to take up spe cific issues at the talks on limitation of strategic arms.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: KEARNY, Nov. 28  Morning traffic on the New Jersey Turnpike was slowed to a crawl between here and Newark today when a crane fell across the eastern part of the roadway.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: Twentyfive persons were arresed on drug charges in Middlesex County in a wideranging narcotics raid. Accord ing to a police spokesman, the suspects were arrested at homes in Piscataway, Edison, New Brunswick and Perth Amboy, most on charges of possession and distribution of heroin, marijuana or other drugs. Another 25 suspects were being sought, the spokesman said. More than 100 policemen participated in the raid, according to the spokesman.

title: Nixon Urged to Choose Woman for His Cabinet
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)The nonpartisan Na tional Women's Political Cau cus asked President Nixon today to choose women for his Cabinet, as the Republi can party platform recom mends.

title: SILVER FUTURES SHOW BIG UPTURN
description: Prices of silver futures con tracts jumped more than five cents an ounce for most deliv eries yesterday on the Com modity Exchange, Inc.

title: INDUSTRY LEADERS AT MEEHAN'S RITES
description: Leaders prominent in Wall Street, politics, publishing and industry attended the funeral yesterday of Joseph Ansbro Meehan, vice chairman of Henderson Brothers, a leading specialist firm in Wall Street.

title: DR. PAUL R. ROSENBLUTH
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 28Dr. Paul R. Rosenbluth, a neurosurgeon, died in his sleep this morning at the age of 49.

title: Millionth Boys Club Member
description: Elevenyearold James Man ning of Pittsfield, Mass., yes terday was designated as the millionth member of the Boys' Clubs of America. His member ship card was picked by Attor ney General Louis J. Letkowitz from a drum at. Grand Central Terminal that contained the names of 25,000 boys who joined recently.

title: Harvard Has $1.5Billion
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP)Harvard University said today that its endowments and other investments had a mar ket value of $1.5billion. In a special financial report, Har vard said that it had finished the fiscal year last June 30 with a balance of $177,000 despite record expenditures, which surpassed $200million.

title: CAR SAFETY RULES DELAYED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said today it would delay for two years the effective date for a proposed 95mile top speed for automobiles and for tire standards for consumers.

title: BUCKLEY SHIFTS MARIJUANA STAND
description: William F. Buckley Jr., the conservative columnist and editor, said yesterday that he now advocated removing crimi nal penalties against the use of marijuana.

title: 2 Playground Designers Who Used to Be Rebels
description: In the last six years, the New Left of playground de signers has practically be come Establishment. Cham pioned by parents, en couraged by a few farsee ing city officials, and under written by foundations, the designers have created con crete mounds and soaring wooden structures that are steadily replacing or aug menting the old swingand seesaw playgrounds.

title: URBAN KISSINGER URGED BY ALIOTO
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 28 The appointment by President Nixon of a Kissinger for the cities was urged today by Mayor Joseph L. Alioto of San Francisco.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Nov. 22 news story about foreign correspondents in the United States contained the item that foreign ers are rarely if ever recognized at White House news conferences.

title: CONSUMERS UNION SCORES DRUG LAWS
description: The Consumers Union, after a fiveyear study of drugs, has recommended the immediate repeal of all Federal and state laws against marijuana, the es tablishment of experimental heroin maintenance programs and a nationwide ban on cig arette and alcohol advertising.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28Assem blyman Millicent H. Fenwick, Republican of Somerset, was named by Governor Cahill to day to be director of the State Division of Consumer Affairs.

title: Caspar Willard Weinberger
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Caspar W. Weinberger, whose nomination as Secretary of Health, Education and Wel fare was announced today, told his staff at the Office of Management and Budget yes terday that he would be leav ing.

title: SMITH STRUGGLES TO BEAT CONNORS
description: BARCELONA, Spain (UPI) Stan Smith overcame a nervous first set tonight and beat Jim Connors in the opening match of the $50,000 Grand Prix mas ters tennis tournament.

title: Seoul Comes to the Garden Ring
description: It took Teddy Brenner, the Garden Boxing Club's match maker, II days and $750 in telephone tolls to set up next Monday night's program in volving two South Korean boxers.

title: Nets Battle Stars, Seeking 8th In Row On Coliseum Court
description: The New York Nets are going after their eighth straight homecourt victory tonight when they face the Utah Stars at Nassau Coliseum. If they win, they will shatter a club record they set in their last game.

title: Hanoi Denies Army Rebellion Against Leaders of Vietcong
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Nov. 28 (Agence FrancePressel  Nhan Dan, the official party newspaper, said today that a report of an unsuccessful re bellion by North Vietnamese military men against leaders of the Vietcong in South Vietnam was a ono hundred per cent fabrication intended to serve the psychological warfare purposes of the Central Intelli gence Agency in the United States.

title: U.M.W. Official Appointed
description: EBENSBURG, Pa., Nov. 28 (AP)The United Mine Work ers president, W. A. Boyle, has appointed John M. Lease as interim president of Dis trict 2, succeeding Owen Slagle, who died last week, the union announced yesterday.

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS $6BILLION SLASH IN POLLUTION AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  President Nixon has ordered the Environmental Protection Agency to allot to the states only $2billion of the $5billion authorized by Congress in the present fiscal year for waste treatment plants, and only $3 billion of the $6billion authorized for the fiscal year 1974.

title: Karl L. Zerbe, 69, Expressionist Known for Still Liles, Is Dead
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 28 (AP)Karl L. Zerbe, a German born expressionist painter whose works have been shown widely, died of a heart attack at a hos pital here today. He was 69 years old.

title: CONTRACT AWARD
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Com pany said yesterday it had been awarded a contract for over $50million from the Wash ington Public Power Supply System of Kennewick, Wash., to supply the nuclear steam generating system and initial fuel core for the plant to be located at Hanford, Wash. The nuclear unit will provide 1.2 million kilowatts of electricity. It is planned for operation in 1980. The order was the sixth nuclear unit placed with Bab cock & Wilcox this year.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: NOW IS THE TIME for all good Femi nists to come to The Guggenheim to see The Mother Of Us AllAP (Advt.)

title: Terrorists of I.R.A. Stage A Series of Rocket Attacks
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 28Terrorists of the Irish Republican Army staged their first coordinated series of rocket attacks today on targets throughout Ulster. The rocket attacks and other incidents to day claimed a total of four lives.

title: SEOUL PERMITS SCHOOLS TO OPEN
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 28The South Korean Govern ment allowed the nation's uni versities and colleges to reopen today in a first step toward relaxation of martiallaw re strictions.

title: Music: Lute Songs of a Quieter Time
description: The ear, luckily, is an accommodating instrument. When this reviewer entered Carnegie Recital Hall on Mon day night, after stepping out of a subway while a fire siren screamed deafeningly nearby, he discovered a standing roomonly audience hunched forward in rapt anticipation. Two young women came on stage, and sat there in seem ing silence, miming a concert. What sort of dumb show had one wandered into, anyway?

title: Yaroslav Smelyakov, Poet, Survived Stalin's Purges
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28Yaroslav Smelyakov, a poet who sur vived Stalin's purges, died yes terday at the age of 59.

title: DR. BION R. EAST, 87, DENTISTRY EXPERT
description: Dr. Bion R. East, Professor Emeritus of Dental Public Health Practice at Columbia University and former execu tive officer of the Columbia School of Dental and Oral Sur gery, died yesterday at his home in Plainfield, N. J., after a long illness. He was 87 years old.

title: IsraelUganda Dispute Reaches Into Court Here as Bank's Assets Are Ordered Attached
description: The embittered relations be tween Israel and Uganda fig ured in a court case here yesterday.

title: U.S. Cities Kept in Servitude, Lindsay Says at Tokyo Parley
description: TOKYO, Nov. 28Mayor Lindsay renewed his attack on state governments today, accus ing them of keeping American cities in servitude.

title: OwensCorning Plans Plant
description: Owens  Corning, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it would build a multimilliondol lar glass container plant to a 47acre site south of Winston Salem, N.C. The facility will employ about 200 people.

title: Police at Southern U. Called Confused
description: BATON ROUGE, Nov. 28 Two Army officers told a black investigating committee today that during a campus incident Nov. 16 when two Southern Unversity students were killed, the police were belligerent and undisciplined and that several faculty members were indif ferent.

title: A.M.A. Urges Drive To Help Doctors Combat Addictions
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 28 (UPI)  The American Medical As sociation's House of Delegates approved today a report calling for a concerted effort by the medical profession to help doctors with alcoholism, drug addiction or other mental problems.

title: Enough Lamentations
description: JERUSALEMOne would have imagined that it was the Fast of Tisha B'Av. Few of the Cabinet ministers of Israel wept and wailed so, on the anniversary of the destruction of the Temple, as they did on radio, television and before the eager press of the Jewish State. The tears, however, were not so much of sorrow as of outrage and they were accompanied by all manner of expressions of indignation, amaze ment and incantations.

title: Library Turning Card File Into Multivolume Catalogue
description: The main card catalogue at the New York Public Library on Fifth Avenue at 42d Street starts way ahead of the al phabet. The first card is marked with three dots, and the last entry is headed Zyzykin, Michal.

title: YONKERS TO TAKE QUINIELA WAGERS
description: YONKERS, Nov. 28  When Yonkers Raceway opens its 1973 season on Jan. 3, the four exactas that had been offered there nightly since Oct. 19, 1967, will he replaced by five quinielas. The switch in the form of wagering was an nounced today by Timothy J. Rooney, the president of the Westchester County harness racing course, after permission to make the change was given to the raceway by the New York State Harness Racing Commission.

title: NEW JERSEY
description: KATONAH, N. Y., Nov. 28 (UPI)  The Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts offered a $10,000 reward today to any one providing information lead ing to the recovery of 12 works of art stolen last month from the center.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It was interesting to read the care fully reasoned analyses of McGovern's defeat offered by the authors of four recent letters to The Times. One said, Those of us who have a sense of God and conscience will mourn the moral death of a oncegreat United States. One said, In a time when man ignored morality, Massachusetts voted from the heart of JudeoChristian ethics. One said, This nation has temporarily delayed its day of reckoning, but it cannot put the truth off forever. And, finally, one said; Psychothera pists have long observed that man is that being who surrenders selfaware ness and then suffers the neurotic consequences. The recent campaign seemed a national case in point  McGovern lost, then, not because peo ple lost faith in him but because the very opposite reaction occurred.

title: New Oil Find Is Recorded
description: The Mountain Fuel Supply Company said yesterday that it had discovered significant new quantities of crude oil and natural gas at its Brady Unit No. 1 wildcat well in South western Wyoming in a drill stem test made in the deeper Weber formation.

title: Nude Brooklyn Bather Acquitted of Lewdness
description: A 27yearold woman who was charged with public lewdness for removing her bathing suit on a Brooklyn beach last summer was ac quitted yesterday in Criminal Court in Brooklyn.

title: Merger News
description: The International Utilities Corporation announced yester day it had agreed in principle to acquire the Airborne Freight Corporation, the nation's sec ond largest air freight forward er, for stock valued at about $42million.

title: WITNESS SAYS FIRES OFTEN HIT CARRIER
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 28 (UPI) A prosecution witness testi fied today that fires were a common occurrence aboard the aircraft carrier Forrestal prior to the $7.5million blaze on July 10 that delayed the ship's de parture for the Mediterranean by nearly two months.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City officials raised the popular theme of decentrali zation before the city Charter Revision Commission today. But they treated it variously as the best hope for the city, a Balkanizing threat, a ve hicle for beneficial patronage, and a bad substitute for guts by elected leaders.

title: Mother and Two Children Shot to Death at Rochester
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Nov. 28 (AP)  A mother and her two grown children were found shot to death today in their home in suburban Greece.

title: 22 Coffee Nations Meet To Formulate Positions
description: LONDON, Nov. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)  Representa tives of 22 coffeeproducing countries met here today to draw up the document they will sub mit to the International Coffee Organization tomorrow on steps to take for the next nine months of the present coffee season.

title: National Tree in Place
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The national Christmas tree, a 70foot Engelmann spruce from Wyoming, was put up to day on the Ellipse, south of the White House. The tree was cut in Medicine Bow National For est near Laramie and was shipped to the capital from Cheyenne by rail it is to be lighted Dec. 15.

title: Argentine Authorities Term Some of the Statements on Bormann Unfounded
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 28 Some of the statements that have been made to substantiate recent reports that Martin Bor mann is alive and recently en tered Argentina have been de scribed by Argentine authori ties as unfounded.

title: Aetna Cuts Florida Rates
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 28 (AP) The Aetna Life and Casualty Company said today that in January it would reduce its rates on Florida auto insurance policies as a result of that state's nofault auto insurance law.

title: It's Time to Get Started on That Plum Pudding
description: It was more like an in formal party than a class in cooking, but when it was over the students had one Christmas holiday problem solved. They had dessert ready for a holiday repast.

title: N.B.C. President Scores F.C.C. Pressures on TV
description: Julian Goodman, president of the National Broadcasting Com pany, said yesterday that an antinetwork climate in the Federal Government is making it increasingly difficult for the television networks to fulfill their obligations to the public creatively and responsibly.

title: FIRE RULES VOTED ON OFFICE TOWERS
description: A bill requiring new strin gent firesafety features in high rise office buildings was voted out yesterday by the City Council Buildings Committee after a twoyear study.

title: G.M. Weighs Air Bag Use
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28  The General Motors Corporation might put airbags in some 1974 cars as an option, Edward N. Cole, G.M.'s president, said in a speech today.

title: Assemblyman Kelly Set To Head Cable TV Panel
description: Governor Rockefeller will appoint Assemblyman Robert F. Kelly, a Brooklyn Republican, to head a new bipartisan state commission to regulate cable television, Republican sources reported yesterday.

title: James Carmichael, Who Sought Governorship of Georgia, Dead
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Nov. 28 (AP) James V. Carmichael, an At lanta businessman who in 1946 won the Democratic primary popular vote for Governor but was defeated by the county unit system, died in a hospital here today. His age was 62.

title: Economic Analysis
description: So the hard bargaining over the reformation of the world monetary system has been launched. Or has it? The question is how do 124 nationsgreat and small, capitalist and not so capitalist, over developed and underdevel oped, creditor and debtor, dollar creators and dollar haters, friends of exchange rate flexibility and champions of rigidity  go about reforming a world monetary system? The an swer is they meet in a big room be hind closed doors on the 12th floor of the International Monetary Fund building in Washington and hope to find a way of simulating the Bret ton Woods negotiation of 1944 at the Mount Washing ton Hotel in New Hampshire, which established the postwar monetary system that has now come apart at the seams.

title: Decentralization Argued At City Charter Hearing
description: City officials raised the popular theme of decentraliza tion before the City Charter Re vision Commission yesterday.
